Good wardrobe space, tv and kitchenette.Negatives..breakfast poor..except the fresh orange.. Don't rely on it, we got pastries from shop close by. All day teas and coffees great though.Lighting in room poor, pillows not great and no view from room, but other than that would definitely return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our stay at Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan was relaxing. The hotel met our every need. Chef Lloyd prepared a tasty breakfast. Erica was very efficient and friendly. The staff was helpful giving us directions using the subway and finding different places we wanted to go. This hotel is definitely more than worth the money and a place we would choose to repeat.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great place to stay when in NY. Good service and not too highly priced.Wonderful location close to Macys, Time Squere and Penn Plaza. Many nice restaurantsat walking distance from hotel. Easy to arrange taxi to airports.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed two nights at the Homewood Suites in midtown for a recent business trip. I would highly recommend it. For me the location was great, in the middle of everything but not noisy. My room was extremely quiet, there was no road noise and even though I was right next to the lift there was no noise at all from there. The room was a very good size and well equipped even though it was one of the smaller ones they offer. The bed as really, really comfortable. Breakfast is fine, generous and varied and offered for a decent spell of time (as in you don't need to be there by 7am to benefit). The staff were charming and helpful and the overall vibe was that you are welcome. I would be very happy to stay again. It's not funky or hip but it works and I would rather have a big bed and good wifi than trendy wall art.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed on 10/7/18. Great location & excellent service. Jr was friendly, helpful, and provided some of the best service we've ever experienced at a hotel. The rooms are excellent, modern, and very clean. Short walk to NYC Penn Station & Time Square. Tim & Kim from Orlando, FL

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent location if you are attending events at the javits center. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Parking garage is located across the street just a few yards up the road so it is easy and convenient. Easy walk to numerous attractions and places to eat. This is my go to hotel for a stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We recently stayed at the Times Square Homewood Suites for Comic-Con and the BTS concert and we were very happy with our stay. The staff was very courteous, friendly and always eager to help. They greeted us by name and pleasant smiles whenever we walked by in the lobby. Speaking of the lobby, it was very clean and attractive, as were all areas of the hotel, even the elevators and stairwells. We originally booked a king suite with sofa bed. We were waiting for an upgrade to two queen beds but decided to stick with our original room because it was ready on arrival whereas the double queen wasn't available yet and we had to get over to Comic-Con. Our room was nice and clean and spacious enough to accommodate our party of two parents and two teens. The room was equipped with a full kitchen which included a sink, dishwasher, stove/oven, refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. Although the stove and refrigerator aren't full size, they're not mini and are sufficiently large enough for the majority of guests. There were also cooking utensils, dishes and cutlery. As far as amenities it felt more like staying in a timeshare room than a hotel suite. The king bed was comfortable but the twin sofa sleeper was very uncomfortable. The mattress was very thin and hard as a rock. Thankfully, I was the only one who had to suffer sleeping on it as my wife and two daughters slept in the king bed. The room also had a desk, very nice 55-inch LED television and a balcony overlooking 37th Street. Our room was generally quiet but we did clearly hear housekeeping and a few guests in the hallway on a few occasions. The hotel serves hot breakfast each morning but it's pretty bland and generic. If you just want some food for energy to get started, it's fine but if you go expecting a nice steaming hot delicious breakfast, you may want to catch one of the nearby restaurants instead. The hotel is within walking distance of the Javits Center and Times Square which are both are several blocks away. Penn Station is also nearby and was very convenient for traveling to Citi-Field in Brooklyn for the concert. Thanks to the close proximity to Times Square, the Javits Center and Penn Station, the Times Square Homewood Suites is about as centrally located as it gets. It's also a short ride to and from the Lincoln Tunnel. We really enjoyed our stay at the Times Square Homewood Suites and send thanks to the front desk staff for being so polite, helpful and courteous during our stay. Sometimes, the attitude of the staff can make or break a trip and they made our trip very pleasant.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Unhappy with the level of service from checking in to checking out. The checking in agent was as bad as I have ever experienced and I was surprised to see this at a Hilton hotel. The checking out agent did not ask me how I wanted to pay and just took the money from the card given at checking in. Outraged as I get foreign transaction fees and I wanted to avoid this and pay by cash. Now I have to pay the bank extra money that Hilton should be paying for. Not too much choice in the breakfast but it was one of the few around here that included it in the price so it is better value for money. The room I had was higher up on the 21st floor but it was really noisy all day and night due to a unit somewhere close by I suspect. It was for 3 people but the room is not arranged properly for 3 and I wouldn't come back here again.
user_name:
Tajesh P
Greater London, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If you only plan to sit on the pull-out sofa - you are good to go. The hotel is clean, nice. It was quiet - did not hear much city noise or other guests. Close enough to walk to Times Square, but not on it. I was glad for that. The gym equipment is adequate, though I don't know how often they look it over. The universal could use some attention. Breakfast was fine. The usual for this chain. Stay away from the "fresh" fruit, it is a bit slimy. And they have a few egg dishes that resemble . . . well, rubber. But there is plenty else to eat that will get you up and on your way. They have a nice rooftop area where you can take food or a beverage. We used it a few times to eat our take-away. Staff was wonderful - always helpful and pleasant.HOWEVER, if you plan to sleep on the pull-out sofa - good luck. Very uncomfortable. Very noisy with all kinds of squeaks and rustling whenever you roll over. I suspect that whoever picked out this particular pull-out sofa never spent the night on one.
user_name:
Joni B
West Fargo, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The concierge, Luc, does a fabulous job remembering guests names and helping them with tickets, rides, and general questions. The room was clean, quiet and very comfortable. The breakfast was plentiful and the selection of food not your standard watery eggs a day undone bacon. The meat was seasoned steak bites...really excellent.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Prime location- Times Square south. Hotel rooms and Loby are big and comfortable, new modern designed. . Bed is very comfortable and rooms are super clean and big (compare to other hotel rooms in the area). The hotel rooftop is a must place for relaxing and taking photos ( vice view). Hotel stuff and front desk manager are super professional and helpful. Breakfast is fresh and tasty and free coffee and tea served 24/7 at the lobby. I stayed in this hotel 3 times and I can’t wait to Come back again soon!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed in the Homewood suites in September, the hotel is in a great location for Times Square and exploring the big apple. Rooms are clean and have all that you need just a little small although expected for a city hotel. Roof top area to sit out on. There is also a buffet breakfast which is ok to start the day. Avoid top floors as noise from Air Con is a no no, we were on the 12th floor which was fine. The front staff are friendly and helpful. Overall a nice stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homeward Suites is a nice place to stay near the Times Square. It is located conveniently and the rooms are big, spacious and clean. The housekeeping staff is also great. Their hot breakfast is very good. However, beware of the cabs service they offer at their gates. The hotel security told me airport drop would cost me $65 and got me a cab, but the cab driver charged by $80, the extra as toll charge although there were none on the way.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was perfect for what we needed. There were three adults and we had a king room with a single sofa lounge. It is very tight when you pull the sofa out but if you turn it sideways you can get around a lot easier. A lot roomier than many other hotel rooms in New York. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was busy but that's what you expect during the summer break. Good location. Trolleys at the front to help you take luggage upstairs. Breakfast had a good variety. Lifts were fairly fast. It had laundry facilities downstairs and a gym. Our room had a fridge and microwave. Very handy.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, great accommodation and fair price. Our room consisted of two queen beds and the en suite had a good sized walk in shower. In addition the room had a fridge together with a microwave and cooking facilities and a coffee maker. We arrived in NYC via Penn Station and were able to walk from there to our hotel (with our luggage!). This hotel is perfectly positioned to reach the many tourist attractions that New York has to offer. Large departmental stores like Macy’s and JC Penny etc are also close by. Metro stations are within easy walking distance. At the end if our stay we caught an Uber from here to JFK in the early morning and it took about 30 minutes. Our room was on the 18th floor and there was no road noise. The 24 hour complimentary tea/coffee/hot chocolate station in the foyer is a nice touch. The hotel is modern and clean and we would most certainly stay here again when visiting the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Lovely rooms, enormous bed really clean & comfortable. Everything we needed in the room. Great breakfast, which is included, in a morning & a drinks station always open.Good location,Had a great stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It was difficult to select a hotel for our stay in NYC and after reading lots of reviews we opted for Homewood Suites. The staff was very nice and welcoming. The breakfast is average but it's free so we didn't have to go out anywhere. Our only complaint was with housekeeping. My husband put on black socks one morning and after walking around the room as we got ready for the day, his socks were full of lint and hair. I don't think they cleaned the floors for a very long time. Everything else seemed clean and we had no other issues. The shower water was hot and didn't run out. Very quiet location and rather central to all the events we walked to. Would definitely recommend. The staff was great in getting us taxis or cars when we needed them.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We are currently in New York and we are staying here. Rooms are clean and certainly comfortable. Having a rooftop space to relax is great. There is no amazing view but it’s a lovely place to just hang out after a really busy time exploring New York. Breakfast is adequate and great that it is included in the room rate. Great location, close to Subway, restaurants and all you could want on your New York adventure. Staff are friendly and welcoming. Good job, Homewood Suites!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff and the hotel are fantastic. Excelent location, near Times Square, Port Authority, Empire State Building.....The room is very good.The breakfast is very good.The atmosphere is very good.Sure we will come back

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel lobby and rooms were beautiful and appeared new. The entire staff was excellent, cheerful and always ready to help. The front desk was especially helpful with directions, advice and assistance. Good buffet breakfast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent location,we stay for four days September 2018. the room was clean big,and quite , the staff were Super nice and attentive the kitchen in the room was super, Fantastic Hotel I would definitely stay here again,and definitely recommend it!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Pros to this hotel: Rooms are good sizeShower is powerfulCoffee machine in room is greatStaff are friendly CleanRooftop chill out areaCoffee machine in foyerFree fruit in foyerCons to this hotel:Lifts take FOREVER! The system that they use means it can take up to 10mins to get downstairsBreakfast. So bland and hardly any hot food.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My Partner and myself had a fab holiday in New York, last week,and we stayed at the homewood suites, the hotel is very good and is in a fab location. Staff very friendly and helpful, rooms good size,lovely and clean....just like home from home. The only one thing I would say about the hotel is the breakfast hot choices could be changed more regularly, on the upside the hotel did have tea/coffee/hot chocolate etc in the Reception for you to help yourself 24/7. If and when I was ever to go back to New York I would def stay at this hotel and would recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights in September and had an all round brilliant stay in this hotel.The rooms are quite spacious for NY standards and the kitchenette in the rooms is quite handy, although as some others have mentioned before the refrigerator can be quite loud but not a major issue as we were that tired from exploring it didn’t really affect our sleep!Bathrooms are nice and clean and the shower decent. The breakfast is convenient although quite cramped they do the best with what space they have. Sets you up perfectly for a day of exploring the city. Finally the staff here are fantastic, they cannot do enough for you and any request you make they ensure is done quickly and efficiently. They are a credit to the Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just checking out from a wonderful 6 days in NewYork, made all the better by the Homewood suites. Stayed here with my husband and daughter, the room was well equipt with everything you need, comfy beds and very clean. Staff always have a cheery welcome and very helpful. Breakfast was okay, sometimes not too great, but generally enjoyed, sometimes hard to find seating so you will need to time it right, but don’t let that put you off, it certainly didn’t spoil our time here. I would highly recommend and if I ever come to NY again this would definately be where I book

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I like this hotel, very nice rooms, the staff are very friendly, close to Macy and empire state building. there are many restaurants in this area. Also, the hotel serves free breakfast and very nice gym

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My friends and I went to the city for my birthday.. I used my Hilton Honors points and chose Homewood suites. The staff were super nice and attentive. We needed extra towels which they brought us pretty quickly. We also forgot a toothbrush which they provided with a little tube of Colgate. The room was small as they usually are in the city but fine. One friend slept on the pull out which she said she slept well. It has a full refrigerator, microwave and stove top. You don't have to bring your cork screw or knife for your cheese and crackers. We went up to the roof before heading out to the city. It was a about 5 -10 blocks to Times Square and Broadway shows. Breakfast was decent, my friends were pleasantly surprised. Although, it is a little tricky finding a place to sit. My only complaint was the shower didn't have a lot of pressure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This location is amazing - super close to Penn Station so easy to get to with a short walk from the train. Close to all things NYC: Times square, Macy's at Herald Square, Broadway, the subway, lots of amazing restaurants. And as far as the hotel goes: the rooms are very comfortable - perfect for a quick weekend get away. Next time I'm in the city - I'll be choosing this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is perfect for a long stay. Free hot breakfast, with a lot of variety, and pretty much all options anyone can want for breakfast. The reception staff were usually great, and the hotel itself is really nice. The cookers in the rooms could be improved as they tended to not be hot enough. However, that is minor. The rooms were adequately spacious, and housekeeping was great. There are also laundry facilities for keeping clothes fresh. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. Keep up the good work.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Five of us stayed in the room (3 kids) and we found the room modern and spacious for NYC. The warehouse district, where the hotel is located, felt a little seedy, but its close proximity to Times Square and Subway helped mitigate that point.The crowd at the hotel was full of international tourists from Europe - which gave it a fun atmosphere. The complimentary breakfast was OKAY. It had all the basic, but the food felt like it came out of the freezer. It was also very crowded and we had to wait to find a table!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 2nd - 6th September 2018. Couple, late 30's. Little to say other than this being a fantastic hotel! After spending hours going round and round in circles on the internet, we are so please to have chosen Homewood Suites. It was very comfortable, clean and fresh decor throughout, good facilities, welcoming and peaceful. From the moment we arrived all staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. We arrived a few hours before check in. Luggage was kept safely locked away behind reception and cloakroom ticket system used. Check in was very quick and simple. We stayed in room 1214 which was perfect for our needs (see photos). Our room was cleaned daily and fresh towels supplied. The buffet breakfast was quite basic but ideal for preparing for a full on day of sightseeing! Breakfast included is what really sold this hotel above others of similar price. If you are big on breakfast and are staying for just a short break, it is so much easier on time to have breakfast at the hotel before heading out for the day. There was also tea/coffee/hot chocolate available in the lobby area 24/7. Location of the hotel was good. All the major sights are within walking distance. No more than 5 minutes walk to 34th St Penn Station. We would definitely recommend and return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just back from NY stayed in Homewood suites. Great choice of location. It was a pleasure to walk back into the lobby, staff very friendly, greeted with a friendly “Welcome Back” most times when we returned back to the hotel after a busy day out. Our room was well equipped with fridge, cooker, microwave, dishwasher, tv, hairdryer. Also plenty of storage. Rooms made up every day with fresh towels if needed. Breakfast was fantastic. Only one thing eating areas a little cramped but it was fine if you went down early. This Hotel is close to most things but as your in NY walking is a must don’t forget your comfy shoes. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay a pleasant one.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Not the least expensive hotel in mid-town, but the amenities were worth it. Nice rooms with full cooking facilities. Nice if you feel like staying in. Full reefer, dishwasher, stovetop, microwave. Nice breakfast with subtle entry changes each day. We had interior room. Very quiet. Only problems were busy elevators during peek times. Never got coffee maker to work, but 24 coffee in lobby. Pleasant, helpful staff. Enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: August 2016. Nice and peaceful. Breakfast was good, Really busy seemed to be overbooked. Location was great to Times Square and Shows.No late night food places all closed. Times Square short distances to 911 Twin Towers and Uber’s every where.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is located in a great location, just minutes from the Times Square action. There are lots of restaurants to choose from within walking distance, and lots of places to shop. The rooms are large and well appointed, very comfortable. We had a king bed room with couch, desk, place to hang our clothes, and a kitchen. Bathroom was ample size as well. Breakfast had both hot and cold choices and was very filling. We will definitely stay at this location again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Simply OUTSTANDING service, quality, amenities, food service, and location. Exceeded EVERY expectation for our family of four. Room: bathroom, shower, kitchen and linens were clean, operational, quiet, and comfortable. Staff: delightful, professional from the front desk to housekeeping to maintenance to food service. Everyone was willing to help with a gracious smile. Breakfast: plentiful selections and variety with an abundance of seating. Location: 1.5 blocks from the subway and 3-4 blocks from Penn Station. Rooftop patio offers a delightful getaway.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is close to everything. The front desk personnel were welcoming and ready to help out. Clean rooms and comfortable bed. The room was a bit small but had everything for a short stay. The breakfast was good too. I enjoyed my stay there.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is located close to Times Square. It had a decent breakfast and the rooms and bed were comfortable. If you need queen beds, Homewood is the place to book. Staff were all super-friendly. Kitchen has everything you need. Full-size fridge and dishes, microwave, plates, cups, cutlery and pots and pans. Room is a bit small to actually eat in but you can at least buy milk and fruit and leave in the fridge. Worth the price because it includes breakfast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We’ve stayed at this property before, and although it has never been a great neighborhood, the staff has always been friendly & astute. This trip there was one exception. We were moving our daughter into college, so we chose this location due to its proximity to Macy’s, Kmart, Duane Reed & Target & we also appreciated the courteous front desk associates receiving packages for us.The evening of 8/21/18 we returned to our hotel at 11pm. I was waiting for a package & my husband & daughter headed up to our room. Once I had the box, I proceeded to the elevator. A man who appeared to be homeless was waiting for the elevator. He waited for a car to close & when I pushed the button up, he wanted to follow me into the next empty elevator. I declined & said I forgot I had some laundry in the basement. Then he pressed the down button and when I tried to get in, he attempted to follow me, so I actually pushed passed him & approached the front desk. He stayed by the elevators. Several landed & he wasn’t getting in. When the front desk woman (I didn’t get her name but it appeared that next to her a shift change was happening where another clerk was leaving and a man was coming in)...anyway, she asked how she could help me and I said that I was just waiting for that man to get in his own elevator. She laughed and said “oh he’s harmless. I mean, he’s homeless but he’s harmless. His family pays for him to stay here. He’s been here for three months.” She said it loud enough for him to hear...I didn’t want to lodge a complaint, I just wanted to feel safe. She walked away, making me feel even more uncomfortable.I tried to call my husband, but he had his phone on silent. I lingered in the lobby until he eventually got on his own car.This behavior is not acceptable. We live in Orlando. I actually founded a charity in 2012 for homeless school children. I’m not afraid of the homeless. However, his behavior was erratic & if I was made to feel uncomfortable and just wanted to engage in conversation with the front desk clerk, why did she behave this way? She mentioned that there had been other complaints.There are hotels in Orlando that house the homeless, and people are aware they are staying at the hotel with homeless people. Not all are down on their luck; some have addiction problems. Under the influence even “harmless” people can cause harm.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The start of our family road trip. Stayed here for three nights. Great staff and rooms. Central for the whole of NYC. Rooms clean and tidy, well maintained.If we ever come back we would certainly stay here again. Two queen size beds and a large sofa bed, microwave, coffee machine, fridge and hob. All you ever need with local stores nearby.The breakfast was fine, scrambled eggs and sausages most days and bacon a Saturday. Free tea, coffee and hot chocolate 24/7.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is modern and clean.Four of us (2adults & 2 teenagers) stayed on the 19th floor for 7 days. Not a great view but very limited road noise despite the busy area.The hotel is perfectly situated to get to Times Square, Penn Station, the bus station and the abundance of eateries in Hell’s Kitchen.All of The hotel staff were lovely and very helpful.Towels were changed daily and beds made.We ordered additional towels and pillows , nothing was too much trouble.The room had 2 double beds with kitchenette (microwave, full fridge, hob, dishwasher and sink- no kettle), bathroom with large shower, w.c and sink , hairdryer, TV, wardrobe and desk & night light.Note: there is no T Towel or scourer (we took our own) but there is a small bottle of washing up liquid and kitchen roll.(Tip - not enough coat hangers for 4 people, but no issue to us as we took additional with us)Breakfast was a welcome addition Lots of choice, both hot & cold options Usual queue in the morning to put bread/bagels in a toaster that you have to put in at least twice to get any colour.Orange juice, apple juice, fresh fruit, yoghurts and a selection of muffins /pastries to suit all palates. The hotel provides coffee/hot chocolate/ hot water and a selection of teas for free all day.The breakfast staff work very hard !It seemed the norm for people to clear there own plates and cutlery away to allow people to sit down but some people did not seem to get the same message, maybe a note in the dining area might help all clients conform to the same policy?The 22nd floor roof top was lovely to get away from it all after a busy day of pounding the streets. If you go to the left of the building you can see the Empire State Building between the high rises.The hotel also sells a small selection of groceries, at the back of reception (something we didn’t spot straight away)Check out was very easy, there is a luggage room for storage and use of a bathroom in the hotel lobby. We ordered a SUV to transport us to JFK as we had 4 large cases for $85A taxi would cost roughly $65-$70 If you have small cases there is an express bus/train to the airport for less but wouldn’t recommend if you have heavy luggage (lots of stairs)Would recommend to anyone but if you want 5 star luxury this is not for you.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a well-maintained updated property in mid-town Manhattan. Rooms are actually a decent size and come with a refrigerator, microwave, and burners. The price is decent for the excellent location (expensive, of course, for anywhere else). Complimentary breakfast (though waffles would be a nice addition!). We had a room on the back side which was very quiet. Staff was very helpful. The location is convenient to Times Square and the theater district as well as to restaurants and subway stops. While there is the bustle on the street to get to the hotel, inside all is quiet.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: While I'm not sure I would stay near Times Square again, if only for the crowds, I would stay at a Homewood Suites another time. Plenty of space for my 4 little kids, the complimentary breakfast was a huge perk, plus the hotel was clean and the staff was helpful. We walked a lot of places thanks to this location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 3 nights recently at the Homewood Suites with our 3 teenage kids and having arrived from stewart International with the coach - we found the location excellent. No need for taxis we just walked where the coach dropped us off.Breakfasts were good and I did have reservations having read some of the reviews but have to admit they was more choice and more food at the weekend. Monday was quiet with not a lot of choice.I would like to make a special mention to NICOLE who checked us in and dealt so professionally and nicely with a minor issue we had. Also Yvette in Housekeeping was lovely and very attentive.I would definitely return here again - so central and so easy for the coaches and trains.THANK YOU

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If you are looking for a reasonably priced, clean hotel in midtown near Times Square, Broadway and Penn Station then this could well be for you.We stayed for 4 days in two rooms in mid August.The hotel is clean and centrally located. The rooms are of a reasonable size, but the bathrooms are small and if you request a second bed in the room, as we did, you get a sofa bed for the second bed which is great if you have a 7 year old, but not if you have a 6'5" 17 year old!Breakfast is free and is reasonable, but nothing more than that. You may prefer to eat out, we did.One of our rooms had a balcony (809). Given our chance again we wouldn't have wasted the money on it. Whilst large it is at a level that means you see nothing but the block (and semi naked residents) opposite.The staff were civil, but not overly friendly.There is a small shop that stocks drinks and basic snacks. There is a huge fridge, but no mini bar in the room.Probably not one we would visit again, but it serves its purpose at a reasonable price.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel. Great location. Breakfast provided was convenient. Plenty of room for 5 people. Helpful staff. Easy to catch cabs and subway. We loved the roof top deck, it was our end of the day place to relax and talk about our day in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hospitality... Comfort... Central location... These were priorities for a 4-day visit to the Big Apple with my 9-year-old granddaughter. Fortunately, this hotel met expectations at every turn. It was convenient to come and go from our room, allowing us to refresh, recharge, and drop off treasures acquired on our jaunts across the city. The room was well-appointed with a sitting area, functional desk, mini kitchen, and cloud-like bed. We highly recommend this facility.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: About 3/4 mile walk to most Broadway venues and a bajillion restaurants, coffee shops, and pizza parlors. Oh, 3 blocks from Penn Station, don't even need a taxi. Staff bends over backwards for your satisfaction.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at the Hilton NY Midtown in July with my nieces and best friend visiting my daughter. We had a great time and all went well. Our last day there, I forgot to pack my outfit that I had left in the wardrobe. Once home in AZ I realized it, immediately called the hotel and talked to Jeremy Lopez who told me he would leave a message for Wedin Santos to call me the next day and Mr Santos called me and was so wonderful and helpful in finding my outfit! He told me he would sent it the next day! And he did! I can't tell you how impressed I am with the Customer service that your Hotel provides! I usually go once a year to NYC and Always stay at the New York Hilton! Thank you again to Mr. Wedin Santos for being so Wonderful! Looking forward to my next visit to your hotel! Sincerely Olivia M. padilla

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The only issue encountered was the original room booked was not available but accommodations were made by giving us an additional room for the 5 family members. The rooms were very clean and bed was extremely comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for one night at this hotel using a free reward night. Hotel is all that Homewood has to offer. Room was a little tight, but that was to be expected as it is Manhattan. We were on the 16th floor. not much of a few, just the building across the street. Check out the upstairs rooftop terrace, it was pretty cool, from he back side you can see the top of the empire state building. Breakfast was everything that the Homewood normal offers, and it was great. When we check in the lady at the front desk was great. I can't remember her name, but she was short and had curly hair. She mentioned how cute our baby was and was talking with him a bit. She explained the best way to get to our tour in the morning. It was a quick walk to times square, and also the Wicked theater. Overall a great stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were stranded in NYC after flight cancellations out of Kennedy Airport. We were fortunate to find that this hotel had one room available. The hotel was clean and very well maintained. The staff when we arrived shortly before midnight was amazing. The following morning Audreen Corbin was working at the front desk, and was cheerful, courteous and helpful as we tried to figure out our next steps. Thanks for being a very positive experience in the midst of a frustrating travel experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 12 nights and felt like part of the family when we were leaving! We loved the facilities, the location, the staff, and our beds were so comfortable! We walked to restaurants and shows and will definitely return to this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I spent 2 nights on a 3 day stay there during my last vacation in New York city. The staff at the front desk can be more nicer but my check-in experience was nonetheless smooth & the rooms are big, I had no gorgeous view of the city though :-(... They've got a cute lil' coffee bar by reception and a small sitting area to catch up on those emails.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice hotel. We walked so many places during this trip and the subway is just a short walk. Staff is very friendly, appreciated the smiling faces. It is NYC, so as can be expected the hotel is busy. Lots of people coming and going, only 3 elevators so that often is a little wait and elevators were crowded but definitely not bad. Breakfast was very crowded and we only got food there one day. Breakfast was fine, nothing real special there and not as good as other Homewood Suites I’ve stayed in, however, with the amount of people being served it was a great way to start the day and appreciated the multiple pots of coffee in the lobby. Utilized that daily. I hope to get back to NYC and would definitely stay at this Homewood again if there was availability and the rates stay competitive.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is well maintained. Beds were comfortable, rooms were clean, with well kept furnishings.The hotel front desk staff were friendly.The breakfast buffet that was complimentary, was just okay. Items empty when we got there, and the staff at the buffet were not very friendly/helpful.We did not partake in the evening meals on the two days we were there, but it is nice that evening meals are offered.Nice indoor pool and exercise room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location of the hotel is a little far from the subway and the street at night has some not so great people lingering around. But all in all, this hotel has decent staff and the rooms are clean. I got a great price for the room which made it worthwhile to stay here. I thought I would use the kitchen more as I was traveling with kids. The pull out sofa bed worked great for my 12 year old. Next time I would choose a hotel with a mini fridge closer to a subway stop.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location of the hotel was great, especially close to Ripley-grier studios, Hotel staff was great very friendly and courteous. Hotel was clean. My only disappointments were there is no evening reception at this property and they serve turkey sausage and bacon only for meat selections at breakfast. Overall though we enjoyed our stay there

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel for awesome service and location. The staff are wonderful. Great Breakfast. Clean comfortable rooms. We had an extended stay in the city and this place made it great. I will stay at this place again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great place to stay just outside of the hustle and bustle of Times Square. It's convenient to Penn Station, several subway lines, and is within walking distance to the theatre district. The room was spacious, had a full kitchen, laundry room, and was comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was in a great location for the NYC Theater experience. Accommodations were perfect for a short (or even long) stay. Bryant Park and the NYC Library are within walking distance. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Not worth the price they are charging. The only advantage is that the hotel is located close to most New York attractions. Not clean, breakfast selection poor and not enough room to sit for breakfast, slow elevators and very small bathrooms with no counter space. Had to brush teeth in kitchen sink.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed ourselves. Great Value for a family of four. It is very convenient to Penn station and all tourist attractions. We felt very safe. The room was spacious and modern. We didn’t get to enjoy the social hours and wish the cookies stayed out longer:)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have stayed at the hotel for 4 nights , very clean , modern rooms , walkable distance to most places , easy accessibility to everything They provided breakfast everyday which was good, but we had the same menu continuously for 3 days out of 4 days we stayed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood suites is an excellent stay, service beyond compare and you dont need to worry about anything. The staff is always courteous and kind, they just make you feel at home. Never let me down. If you haven't already, it's a must do.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice, clean and modern rooms in Midtown at great value with complimentary full breakfast at great quality. Homewood provide great value for the business and leisure traveller the like. Efficient check-in through the Hilton app with digital key. Bellman provides genuinely friendly and efficient service.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here with our family of four for 3 nights. Loved the hotel and the location! The staff at this hotel were amazing. Special thanks to Junior and Ivette for all their help when we lost one of our bags. We also wanted to recognize Junior for always being so friendly and helpful. It felt like he was working 24/7 as he always seemed to be in the lobby when we were passing through. He always greeted us with a smile and was able to help us with all our inquiries on our first trip to Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our family of four stayed here while visiting NYC. We loved the location, the friendliness of the front desk staff, the comfortable lobby and the great breakfasts and complimentary coffee bar. Our room was fabulous as we were on the 21st floor and on the 22nd floor there was a great open terrace where you could sit and enjoy drinks and snacks with the family (or a few moments with a good book). We will definitely be back for another stay! Hopefully soon!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Special mention on front desk personnel Audreen. Our room for 5 wasn't available and gave us 2 rooms. Very accommodating and welcoming to her guests. Clean place and spacious for a times square hotel. I was so concerned about bedbugs in NY hotels but you won't worry about those bugs here. This is a very wise hotel choice to enjoy times square anytime of the day and night. Strategically located and wonderful free breakfast selection.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our studio king bed room on the 11th floor had a large window with an uptown view and good block out blinds and also another blind that let in light but also provided privacy. The room had all the normal kitchen gear although with so many food outlets and choices nearby we had no need for any of these facilities. We finally had a good size bathroom with space on the vanity to store some of our toiletries. Breakfast is included although the hot food is limited in choice, but there is good coffee, cereals and pastries on offer. We also liked the rooftop space – there is no bar service but the privacy and views are great. There is also a self-service laundry which we were able to avail ourselves of.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was very nice and we had a neat view from the 21st floor. We were close to just about everything we wanted to see during our visit. The room was a little smaller than what we are used to in Texas, but it had everything we needed - a comfy bed, a warm shower, a full-size refrigerator, microwave, real dishes, and even a small dishwasher! Plus the usual desk, night stands, wardrobe, dresser, and tv. They have a convenient fitness center and business center. The breakfast was really yummy, but we were disappointed that there was only one morning (out of five) that they had bacon, and I think it was turkey bacon (we didn't care for it).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location and price of the hotel were great! Nice and central to everything we wanted to see and do. Front desk staff great, even gave us a last minute lift to the airport at check out!Breakfast buffet had a large selection of items, however the eggs were not very tasty.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location and friendly staff. The hotel is a short walk to Times Square, Empire State Building, and many more attractions and restaurants. Rooms were clean and comfortable with fridge, stove, and microwave.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We came for a concert at MSG and sightseeing. This location was walking distance (3 blocks or 5Min walk) to MSG and a major subway station that can take you uptown to Rockefeller or downtown to Staten Island ferry, Wall Street. The hotel itself had helpful staff, clean rooms, and full kitchen. There’s a great rooftop lounge area with good views of the city life and Hudson River. The only reason I didn’t rate the hotel 5 Stars was the glass shower door was missing the stripping at the bottom, so there was major leaks every time we showered and did not ever see maintenance come by to fix it even though we notified them. I love homewood suites and have stayed at several locations. Always good to know you get exactly what you expect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I choose this particular location for its proximity to Madison Square Garden and its great reviews on TripAdvisor. Both lived up to expectations. When I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by a friendly staff. I knew my room was not ready because I used the digital key option but I was given the opportunity to store my luggage and start my journey around the city. When I returned later in the afternoon my room was still not ready but was offered the same corner room one floor lower. It was perfect. I was given room 1601. It was a 1 KING BED PREMIUM EFF CLEAN AIR STUDIO. I was met with a variety of complimentary beverages and snacks in room and fridge. The room had a full-size fridge, a two burner electric stove, a dishwasher, a full complement of kitchen supplies. This room was ideal for the traveler who is staying an extended time in the city and wanted to prepare his/her meals. Due to an early flight home, I was only able to advantage of their breakfast selection. It is the standard breakfast selection you find at most if not all Hiltons that offer a free breakfast, which I find is more than adequate to start your day. This one had a nice selection of food and a good size dining room. Location-This hotel is easy to find on W. 37th Street and 8th Avenue. You can easily see the sign from the corner and is extremely helpful if you forget which street it is on. It is only 3-4 blocks from Madison Square Garden. I was lucky enough to purchase tickets to two nights of the Radiohead concert in NYC and this hotel was ideal for it. It was so nice to be able to leave for the concert and be there. I didn't have to take the subway or a taxi. When it comes to the subway, this hotel is ideally located within walking distance of the majority of NYC's subway lines. Rooftop terrace- After the first concert I decided to utilize the terrace offered. It was ideal after a long day and night in the city. Located on the 22nd floor, I was given the opportunity to relax high above all the noise of the city. The cool breeze of the evening made for a perfect night with a really nice view of the city's skyline. Overall- Many hotel rooms in NYC can be quite small, but this one was ideal. It was perfect for my needs and well worth every Hilton Honors Point.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I highly recommend this place to stay if you're visiting New York. This place makes you feel at home and the staff will treat you like you are their family! Our room was super neat and clean and their complimentary breakfast had lots of variety to select from and the fruits were excellent. We'll definitely stay here again in the future!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 4nights at this property divided into 2nights at 2Qn Studio Suite & 2nights at 1 King 1BR Suite. We arrived around 12PM plus and as usual we can't get the room so we hang around in lobby area and surrounding area. The FO guy was ok, not too friendly but not rude either, just ok.Around 1.30PM the kids start become cranky so I approach FO staff again to asked whether the room is ready. This time I served by Tiara; FO staff and she is very very helpful and friendly. After checking in the system she apologized and said that the room still in cleaning progress and she will informed me once it's ready and it's should not be long.So I wait again then after 5-10min I saw that she was looking for us then she walked to us and said this is your room key as i promised 15min ago. I was very happy and thanked her for her quick actionMy reservation was divided into 2 reservation as I can't book 1 room straight for 4nights. For this issue she also very helpful and check every morning to see whether I can stay in the same room for the whole 4nightsThe third day in the morning I met her again and she sorry that apparently room is fully booked so I had to change room but she asked me to pack everything and leave our 5big luggages and 3cabin luggages in the room. She'll asked porter to move all of them to the new roomSo when we back to the room around 4PM I collect the new key; served by Junior; FO staff. He was also very helpful during our stay. We went to the new room and all my 8 luggages already in the new room without any drama.The 2 rooms category that I stay is excellent. Quite spacious and clean. It's not luxury but more that adequate for family to stay for more that 1-2 weeks. Homewood suites is not a luxury hotel but also not a basic apartment hotel. It's a normal hotel but its room is more like a small apartment; spacious and equipped with kitchen, full size fridge, microwave etc. They also have big laundromat room in the basementLocation is perfect. It's not in the middle of Times Square but only 10-15min walk to TS. It's surrounded by many restaurants and pizza counter. So food is not an issue.  Overall I very recommend this hotel for family. Also I want to say thank you especially for Tiara. She is truly a very valuable asset for the hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Ten of our family members went to NYC for a couple of days and I booked three rooms for us at this hotel. The price was right and the hotel was convenient to the Penn Station subway station. We were not disappointed. The hotel was clean, the staff was terrific, the beds were comfortable and the free breakfast was outstanding. This trip was my third to NYC in the past several years, the other two were on business at so-called luxury hotels. I'll take Homewood Suites any day-- a real gem.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: As a NY native, I've stayed in quite a few hotels in the city and this hotel was by far the best one I've ever stayed at! The room was larger than some apartments I've had when I lived in NYC (no joke). It fit me and my 2 kids easily (king sized bed and a fold-out couch) and had a small kitchenette, TV and plenty of room. The kids LOVED it. This hotel also has a beautiful lobby and a rooftop deck which had nice views. It is centrally located to Time Square and Penn Station, if you're doing the touristy thing, and only a few blocks from the TS subway station. Price was really reasonable for NYC and parking was also extremely reasonable for an overnight in the city. The breakfast was better than most hotel breakfasts, although not stellar, but it was free! When the room we had picked out on the Hilton Honors app wasn't ready on our arrival, they upgraded us to a bigger room for free! I have zero complaints and highly recommend this property!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This little gem is by far the best of ANY Hilton brand I've stayed in not to mention it's in NYC where you sometimes have to lower expectations. Other Hilton brand franchises could learn a lot from everything they do. Beautiful room, spotlessly clean, quality mattress, friendly staff, great AC system and the list goes on. Thank you!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I would recommend this hotel for a stay in the city!! The only thing I wish were a little different were the cleanliness of the linens when we arrived, but it was handled with the staff and they were more than accommodating!! I can't remember everyone's names but thank you to Audreen, Nick, Bryan and Tiara!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I liked the location being a little away from times square but close enough to walk. It was quieter. The bed was not comfortable to me or my husband. The extra pillows I requested were better quality than the original ones. Staff was friendly.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a 2.5 star hotel at best. Hard to tell when you are stupid like me to book on Expedia with combined airfare so I really don’t know what it cost. $3400 for the three of us from LAX to NYC for 6 days. Don’t let the Hilton brand name fool you. First day was fine, room appeared clean & supplied with extra goodies as we had a “premium “ room with coffee & water, sodas etc. After that it was hit or miss for the next 5 days of our six day stay, water wasn’t replaced, snacks & soap were nonexistent. By day 3 no more water or coffee and dam If the staff felt like leaving towels and cleaning the room, they did. If they didn’t the room was left dirty. The front desk was nice but they 1000% know what’s going on and it’s all bull crap and it’s clearly done to cut costs and they don’t care about repeat customers. The free breakfast was absolutely marginal at best, the oatmeal was ok, that we attempted to have 1 out of 6 days, I would have preferred just coffee in the room. Happy to Have the WiFi to post this off my iPad! Nice desk staff, bad housekeeping. See pics of the shower. I fear the past guests DNA was still in the shower due to the yellow mold . I was afraid to touch the shower walls. Rethinking where we stay next time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This Hilton property is not worth the money. Across the street there is a Marriott which is probably a better option. Rooms are not ready when you check in and are offered rooms that you did not book. The hotel lobby is always crowded and the elevators are super slow.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for our honeymoon and received a complimentary bottle of champagne along with a plate of cheeses and crackers. It was a nice surprise! Hotel is very clean. Only drawbacks; long waits for the elevators, no bar, no pool, inconsistent quality in breakfasts served,& the height/type of wall on the balcony is too tall and blocks the views.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had not been to NYC in 18 years and this was a great location to enjoy everything there is in the city. Just far enough away from the noise of times square by being just on the edge. Staff was welcoming and very helpful. Thanks especially to Junior for all his help.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: good staff quite courteous both at the front desk and the restaurant. The room was tight but fairly decent --The price was a little high for the quality. But I paid it. Overall it was decent and I would stay with kids again.
user_name:
Dhiraj S
San Jose, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Love the central location and newer building. This is the first time tho I am a big disappointed. Not many people here now, as a Hilton honors diamond I am usually awarded an upgrade of some kind. Feel like I was degraded with the Tiny room I was provided. The pillows were flat and worn and I tried to ring the front desk and bell desk multiple times. Ph always busy. Just didn’t feel the high level of service and comfort as I have so many times in the past. Next visit I may look for a new place to call home during my visit.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for three nights during a recent stopover in NYC. The Hotel was excellent and as a family of 5 with 3 almost adult children accommodated our needs very well. Location was perfect, breakfast kept us going until afternoon and the endless coffee in lounge was great. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here to explore NYC. We had been to NYC a few times but this time done the highline which was lovely. took the free Statten Island ferry which was great and the 9/11 museum which is very moving but gives a great insiight into the tragedy of 9/11. The fountains are also a lovely tribute

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My room was on the back side of the hotel, was so quiet with a really comfortable bed. Very nice free breakfast daily, modern furnishings and the kitchenette was a welcome amenity. Breakfast was pretty yummy and included.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Pros: spacious rooms, nice gym, and great views from 22nd floor. Also had really good staff.Cons: Lackluster breakfast that did not change very much and never offered bacon or pancakes. Bathrooms are not functional as they have small counter space for such a large room and the sliding bathroom door does not lock. Sometimes the door would open after you enter. Bad design!Overall good stay but for the price could have been a bit better.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: So glad we chose this hotel for our first trip to New York - we stayed for 4 nights and cannot wait to go back! From the moment we arrived staff were friendly and so helpful. Due to delays we were unable to return the huge SUV rental car and had no idea where to park it - lady on reception came out into the street to direct us to a local car park. The hotel location was amazing on a quiet street between Time Square and Maddison Square Garden, close to a subway station and within walking distance of so many attractions, shops, bars and restaurants. The room was fabulous, so well equipped, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The reception has a 24 hour coffee station which meant we did not use the facilities in the room which included a fridge freezer, hob and microwave! Breakfast was amazing! Before traveling, we had read reviews saying it was crowded and busy - we easily found a table every morning and found breakfast a relaxed experience. Delicious food, which was different each morning with an amazing choice to suit even the fussiest traveller. On our last morning we took coffee and cake up to the 22nd floor roof terrace, which was a really tranquil spot above all the hustle and bustle below. We spent a relaxing hour up there and loved it. As I said the staff are amazing - as 1st timers we had lots of questions for the concierge - who from start to finish was so helpful. The reception staff wishes you a good day as you left and a warm welcome back every time - usually a friendly wave as we came and went.We cannot recommend this hotel enough and are hoping to return in September.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Pleasant and uneventful hotel. Great location. Rooms clean and well appointed. Late check out not very accommodating and hotel lobby simple. Overall price for service I would rate as very good. Rooms are quiet.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my first visit in the summer months. The hotel has been great in every regard for both of my stays. The only negative for meis the constant traffic jam on 37th Street, limiting access to Uber or other ride services. Distance to subway stations is decent.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fairly close to subway and tour bus stops. Nice room layout - we had 2 queens with a twin-size sofa sleeper. Beds were extremely hard. Air conditioning was very sensitive - we alternated between warm and really cold with just 1 or 2 degrees. Breakfast had plenty of seating. Offerings included cereal, oatmeal, toast, cut fruit (cantaloupe, melon, grapes, oranges), bananas, eggs (some days okay, some days gross), turkey sausage, muffins.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, clean, modern and friendly. I brought in 16 people for a convention at Javits. It's easy walking so between free breakfast and no cab we saved $50+ a day per person. Great place. I will bring groups here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I don't get to try the luxurious hotels so I am a mid range hotel guest, Hampton, Holiday Inn, etc so that is the realm of my review. The rooms are large for NYC. The kitchen was a great surprise of how much they got into the space. The bathroom had plenty of space, shower was full size and had a nice shower head. Main room had a work desk and a loveseat with ottoman. Comfortable bed. No noise. Breakfast area was large and was standard Hilton breakfast, it worked well. This was a major upgrade to the Hampton Inn nearby and I liked Homewood better than the Yotel. Staff was accommodating and friendly. Car parking is across the street at an independent garage. That garage was "ok" , seemed understaffed. This is an up and coming area of Manhattan, much different then when I lived in the region 35 years ago!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked the Studio King room for 3 people. I knew it might be smaller than normal but was really surprised on how small it was. We managed though but bathroom could have more counter space. Hard to do make-up or hair when you don't have much room to put your things. The location is great, close to theater district and Penn Station subway location. The kitchen is really useless except for the refrigerator and microwave. The staff was very nice and helpful for all requests. Did not have any issue finding a spot to eat breakfast in the mornings. I will say the breakfast got tiresome after 4 days. I would recommend the hotel for 2 people. If more than 2, opt for the larger room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was conveniently located near Penn Station. The staff was very pleasant. For Manhattan, the room was a decent size and price. The flooring made the room seem extra clean - no carpet! Nice view on the 22nd floor.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel staff was delightful and efficient. The suite was modern and beautiful.The kitchenette was perfect. I plan on staying again to uses the rooftop terrace and enjoy the view.Thank you Homewood Suites
user_name:
kaneelya
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We recently enjoyed a four night stay at the Homewood Stuites by Hilton on Times Square. With a pullout couch bed, three of our children were able to visit over time and celebrate with us, The room although not especially large served adequately. The hotel, room, restaurant, and gym were well maintained and clean. The hot breakfast was tasty and gave us a good start to our busy day. The staff was uniformly friendly, polite, efficient, and industrious. I will single out Tiara, Cleopatra, Idrus, and Ladonna at the front desk as especially helpful and considerate

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a great place to stay! After a long day of working it was nice to come “home”. The room was spacious and the staff is very friendly. They serve a nice hot breakfast and have the coffee going all day. There is a view of the Empire State Building from the 22nd floor public balcony. It was nice to have a place to go sit outdoors.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We just came home after staying at Homewood Suites in Times Square. My husband is disabled and needs a handicap room. The staff was very accommodating in making sure he had everything to make his stay comfortable. Everyone always greeted us each afternoon when we returned to the hotel, and we always had cookies and coffee or cold water to snack on when we returned each afternoon. The breakfast staff always did their best to help each guest with whatever they needed. The hotel was very clean and inviting. Highly recommend this Homewood Suites!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at the hotel to see a Broadway production. I found the hotel in a great location, with the ability to walk to TimesSquare but just far enough away to be away from the noise. Hotel was very clean and breakfast was decent.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed a week in this very well located hotel, the staff very friendly, the room very well equipped and the cleaning very good, complimentary breakfast varied and well stocked there was always room although the hotel was full

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is definitely the best place to stay in NYC. We visit 1-4 times a year and we almost always stay here. I just recommended this hotel to a friend for her upcoming trip to the city. Best location. Walking distance to Times Square and subways. Staff is always helpful and pleasant, even when they are busy. They serve a complimentary breakfast every morning. Plenty of different options to choose from. Also 24 hour complimentary coffee in the lobby. Rooms are very clean. They know how to run a hotel. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We (2 adults, 1 teenager) stayed here for 3 nights after a cruise to explore NYC a bit. It's a short couple of blocks from Times Square or Port Authority. Staff was excellent, always happy to help. They can arrange tickets, transportation to airports, etc. In the afternoon, there was water and tea, as well as some yummy cookies. Morning breakfast had hot items (varied from turkey bacon, sausage, cheese omelets, scrambled eggs), bagels, toast, yogurt, fruit, juices, cereals. Coffee, Tea and Hot chocolate is available 24 hours. Our room was a King Premiere, which had a King Bed and a twin sofa bed. The window looked out on the office building behind us, which was fine. We were on the back of the hotel, so no street noise!! There was a little kitchenette, with utensils and plates, as well as a dishwasher. Refrigerator was a good size. There is a beautiful terrace on 22 floor that allows a glimpse of the River. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is situated in a great location, easy walking distance to everything, great places to eat, Penn station only minutes away. Fantastic rooms. Great buffet breaky, 24 hour coffee in the lobby, biscuits always served in the lobby for an afternoon snack, small grocery section, laundry to do your own, wifi was great, and they have computers to print out any tickets or info needed. Be aware tho dont pre authorize your room or they take full amount pending on arrival, plus the full ammount of hotel bill 2nd last day to leaving an you dont get your pre autho back for at least 10 days which meant we were out of pocket around $8000 for 10 days, ask to pay the ammount first up not pre autho, lesson learnt for future hotels. When I questioned it they said I should have been asked if I wanted to pay it or autho, but I wasnt.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff was friendly, helpful and approachable. The location of the hotel was good. Breakfast had several food choices - I enjoyed the fresh fruit! We enjoyed the 22nd floor Terrace. We will recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is an excellent hotel that is away from all the crowds, yet close enough to everything to walk. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are great with very comfortable beds. The breakfast is nice and there is coffee, tea and hot chocolate always available - even cookies! The room is a very nice size - especially for New York, and it comes with a kitchenette with all dishes, pots/pans provided. This hotel is in a very quiet area of the city yet it is close enough to be able to walk to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, great restaurants and even up to central park if you feel like it. The other nice thing - the rooftop area is really nice with a pretty nice view. Will be back to this hotel next time we are in New York!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, very nice rooms, nice service. The rooms connected has an issue when the light in one room turn in on, its turning on as well on the other room; besides the acoustic it´s not really good. I heard the voices on next room.Good breakfast!! The terrace on the last floor is amazing!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, great staff, great room and view and excellent location. Breakfast was a super start to the day, good selection and the 24hr tea/coffee/hot chocolate in the lobby was an excellent bonus after a long day exploring this fab city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed one day in this wonderful hotel. The front desk assistant, Ms. Cleopatra, is very helpful and cheerful. She did not hesitate to help us check-in and provide directions...at no time did she refuse to answer any of our questions; in fact, she is very knowledgeable of the city surroundings and very cheerful. When visiting this property make sure to see her as she will gladly answer your questions. I am very happy that I chose this hotel to stay at for the day. The enclosed photo is the view from my room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is the first time I stayed at a homewood suites and first time I been in New York. I have to admit, I loved every minute of it! The hotel had a good size room, comfortable bed, big fridge and a microwave that came in handy! The breakfast was great and a variety to choose from. They had coffee and tea there always if you ever needed something to drink or a quick pick me up. We loved the fresh cookies they had in the afternoons! Everything is walkable if you fell up to it. Time square, Central Park and Rockefeller center was a short walk away. We even walked back from battery park and took a hour to get back to the hotel. The hotel for us was great and will be back if we head back to New York!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Midtown was solid. Upon initial check in, the lady who helped was amazing. Our room wasn't ready so we had to come back. When we returned however, the guy who helped was rude, acted as if we were bothering him, very short, etc etc etc. He put a bad taste in our mouths. Our room was very clean, it didn't have everything it was supposed to have, as far as, the extra snacks I'd paid for but they were sent right up. Coffee was only decaf, never refilled with regular. This is minor. Poor cell phone and internet reception required us to move to another room. Service was better but not great. Seemed to be consistent no matter what part of the hotel we were in. Housekeeping was great! Each day the room was cleaned, snacks refilled, smelled good, clean towels and bed was made.The remainder of the stay went well. Other than the sour puss at check in the rest of the staff was excellent. They really turned our stay around. We had some minor issues but they were quickly addressed and resolved. Location is AWESOME! Walking distance to Times Square, Empire State, Penn Station and 34th Street just to name a few. The only thing that concerned me was there was a homeless man who obviously frequents this hotel. He came in multiple times, helped himself to the coffee and tea and would ride the elevator upstairs and disappear for a while. The staff seemed to ignore him, as he didn't seem to bother anyone, but it made me uncomfortable. Other than that I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Love the hardwood floors in this hotel. It makes it easy to get around with the suitcase and see how clean or not the floors are.The included breakfast was nice for full business days but get there before 8:30 on the weekends or it's very crowded. A nice touch was premade breakfast to-go bags.Ice machine only on a few floors but included an ice tray in the fridge freezer for convenience that worked well.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Loved our 2 night stay here! The staff was friendly and helpful and the room itself was larger than other hotel rooms we’ve stayed in in NYC. We arrived an hour prior to check in & expected to wait for our room to be ready. No wait required!Location is PRIME! About a 10 minute walk to the theatre district and Times Square. Had some issue with being able to hear our neighbors, but couldn’t hear traffic outside so that was a nice compromise.Only snafu was the website said parking was self-park and it was actually valet. Not a huge issue, just unprepared for that.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Conveniently located to everything, good free breakfast, clean room, thick towels, mini kitchen in your room, quiet and they allowed us to have a late checkout. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very average. Beds are highly uncomfortable. Lobby very crowded and food wasn’t great. Couldn’t eat breakfast downstairs as far too crowded even at 7am. Had items taken from the room. And shopping bags were moved around the room. Won’t be back.
user_name:
conniehartnell
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: They lobby was very crowded with people just hanging out with their luggage in front of the elevators. It seemed way to small for the number of people staying there. The breakfast service was always crowded in the 10 days we stayed. It was loud and not a great place to have a simple cup of coffee.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This place was a good balance between economy and comfort for a week long trip.
