Room rates below $500/night keep the CFO happy, and a nice clean hotel in a central location keeps me happy. The hotel and staff met my expectations of a Hilton property. Rooms were decent size for NYC, and having a kitchenette is beyond convenient when traveling for a week or more. They have breakfast but it’s nothing to write home about. And I did find that I missed having an on-site full service restaurant, but I just ordered lots of delivery.I’ll continue my crusade about the utility of hotels’ bathrooms: once again I was frustrated by low lighting and absence of a wall-mounted make-up (and shaving for the guys?) mirror. Come on folks, this is an easy one to remedy! Anyway, I was very satisfied overall and would stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here 24th May - 28th May having chosen the hotel for its great reviews and proximity to TS and Penn (next leg of the trip being NJ) and was not disappointed. The manager behind the desk was very polite and helpful - as we're all staff we encountered, the place was spotless and the on tap hot drinks in the foyer a great touch. The room was a standard king. It was spacious, loved the little kitchenette suite - lovely to have a fridge and freezer as the weather was scorching, shower was hot and powerful. Linens and towels clean and fresh, housekeeping daily and air con was a treat. Did not hear other guests in their rooms. Breakfast was included and whilst it was certainly no Michelin star it was a nice selection of fodder and plenty of it. Wifi was stable and strong and worked even on the roof terrace - logged out a couple of times after leaving the hotel for the day but quick and easy to log back in once back at the hotel. Honestly can't find anything to gripe about whatsoever and already my partner and I have agreed that when we take the kids next time we will definitely be rebooking the Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: When we arrived at 3.50pm , they said none of room is ready and it won't be ready anytime soon and they can't commit on a time frame! While checking out they were behind to checkout asap.Bit on costly side not that much worth the stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is in a great location and the furnishings and room were very comfortable. I loved that there was plenty of light in the room. We had an eighth floor king with a patio. The patio was a nice feature that created an airiness to the room. There were four chairs and a table. Unfortunately the WiFi didn’t extend to the patio. Even though it was only 8 floors up, it was quiet. Breakfast was typical. Hideous hot foods and low grade starches. But there is an outdoor area which was pleasant, but a bit noisy.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked to stay here for our ten day trip to NYC as we like the flexibility of a suite. Homewood Suites are super easy to find and the location is excellent - only a few blocks to Times Square and Penn Station, and not far from Port Authority bus terminal were the Newark Airport express bus dropped us off. We arrived early but our room was ready for us. Staff were friendly and check-in was very efficient. Our room was spotless, and very quiet considering we were in the centre of the city. Having a full size fridge in the room was great, even just being able to have bottles of water in there to come back to made our stay much more comfortable. The room wasn't the biggest but was perfectly comfortable for the two of us staying for nine nights. The shower was easy to use and nicely powerful, hairdryer provided actually dried my hair (very unusual for a hotel drier). I was a bit unsure when I found there was no kettle in the room, but the complementary tea and coffee in the lobby was an excellent touch. And I think every hotel should provide delicious cookies for their guests in the afternoon, that was a real treat!The breakfast did what is was designed to do, obviously its complementary so I wasn't expecting five-star dining. The hot food was always hot, everything was kept fresh (we actively watched them replace bread and bagels that had been sitting for a while with fresh ones). Since we were staying for such a long time we did notice a lack of variety in the food on offer, but what was there was very good and a great start to the day. I genuinely cannot find a single fault with the hotel - staff were friendly, room was clean and comfortable, food was good, location excellent. I just wish every hotel I stay in can match this high standard, if we come back to NYC I will definitely book again.
user_name:
Charlotte S
Dumfries and Galloway, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was looking for free breakfast and we had that and a kitchen in our room. Breakfast was excellent and the staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and clean and it has three working elevators. We never had to climb stairs to get to our room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The last 7 years I have stayed at the same Manhattan hotel by Herald square. This time I wanted a suite and was so pleased that I chose here. Had 2 x 1 bedroom premium suites which came with snacks and sodas every day. Larger than ave rooms, good size bathroom. Sofa and table useful for takeouts. Microwave and full size fridge is great. Great location and could not hear any sound from the street which is rare in NYC. Staff were amazing. 7 Eleven at the end of the block where you get snacks, beverages, beer, pizza slices etc. Omy on front desk made our stay perfect. From ordering dinner for us from our fav local restaurant to making sure we had water for the journey to JFK and the anniversary card and bottle form the hotel. The hot breakfast every day was great and real good choice-and rare in Manhattan.The grab and go breakfast every day was great for early starts. Short Walking distance to Time square, Penn st, Macy’s etc and 2 4 min walk to 34th street subway. Highly recommend and will be staying here all the time going forward. Im now truly Converted from my old hotel to the Homewood! Thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First and foremost, we were very pleased with this hotel while on a quick trip to NYC. Convenient, quiet, safe location. Just a short walk to so many choices of things to see, do or eat. I was especially interested in it's location in the garment district. As a Project Runway fan, the fact that we were only about 2 blocks from Mood Fabrics, it was like a visit to Disney for some! Our room was adequate for 3. (Unfortunately there were 4 of us. More on that in a minute.) It was very nice to have a small kitchenette with fridge, microwave, stovetop, sink and accompanying utensils. Everything was well done including a pretty extensive included morning breakfast. There is also an area with tables in the lobby with 24 hr coffee, hot chocolate and a fireplace. Now to the Nightmare. My friend booked this hotel via Expedia. At first, there were 3 of us going. Then we needed to add a fourth person. She called Expedia and was able to re-book to a larger room that was to sleep 4. She paid the resulting increase and thought all was well. Until we arrived at the hotel. Expedia had supposedly re-booked us 4 into this hotel in a room configuration that we now found does not even exist in the hotel. Our room had beds for 3, NOT 4. The staff was very gracious in trying to help us through this nightmare while we spent THREE HOURS on the phone with Expedia trying to work this out. It was Spring Break week and besides the room for 3 that we were booked into, there was only 1 other unsold room in the hotel, a King. Expedia refused to help us in the only reasonable way, by paying for the King for us as well. They promised and charged us for a room that slept 4. They even called and spoke to the hotel staff about their booking error and confirmed that the configuration that we were sold did not exist in this hotel. They ultimately refused to pay for the second room and grudingly refunded the upcharge from our 3 person to 4 person reservation. This seriously took the first 3 hours of our short 2 day trip to NYC. All throughout our phone ordeal with Expedia, the hotel staff was gracious, helpful and empathetic to our situation. They could not change or comp our room situation since the error was on Expedia's part. They ultimately provided an air mattress to accommodate the necessity to sleep 4 in the original room. It was a very tight squeeze. But luckily, the 4 of us are the best of friends. Shame on Expedia, but Kudos to Homewood Suites Midtown. They helped us make the best of what was a rotten start to our trip. We had a wonderful trip and we'd definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The rooms and service of the staff were good. There was no evening social like at all other Homewood suites, and this was not disclosed at time of booking that was not disclosed. The breakfast was not as good as other Homewood Suites that I have stayed at. The eggs had green peppers in them two days in a row, how many people like green peppers?

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect location just minutes from Times Square. Easy ride to lower Manhattan or Central Park. Just quiet enough to get a break from the crowd. Breakfast was more than expected with rotating hot entrees. Great hotel for a disabled person.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is about 1/2 mile to Javits and an easy, safe walk. Having breakfast served each morning as well sack breakfast to go was very convenience. Friendly staff and very nice hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean, safe and convenient hotel while visiting for a convention or group event. great location!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had a last minute trip to plan to nyc. I’ve been there many times, and I’ve stayed in many hotels. Everything from The Marriott Marquis to the Club Quarter brands. I’ve loved each and every hotel, but this was a shocker. I walked in to check in, and was greeted by wonderful people. They were chatty and helpful. They got me into a room, which was supposed to be a Queen and Sofa bed. I went up the elevator and to the room. I opened the door to see two double beds and a sofa bed, more than I asked for. The room was huge, even by outside of NYC standards. It was clean and smelled wonderful. The kitchenette would be great for a longer stay. The bathroom had so much more room than any other hotel. The ceiling fan was a wonderful addition as well. Never would I think New York had a gem like this. We also got to get a later check out, without charge. Didn’t see the breakfast, as we slept a bit late and we just ordered from my favorite diner. Checkout was quick and they made sure we wanted to charge we had, for drinks, to go to the account. My only complaint is I can’t find a room with this many beds for October. I have a larger group coming to NYC in October and this room would’ve been idea for us. I appreciate all this Hotel was, the super comfy beds and pillows and the wonderful customer service. This hotel will be one of my go to locations from now on.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The rooms are small as expected in NYC. The room was clean but felt cold and I don’t mean temperature wise. Almost sterile feel. Had a corner room which was nice for the view. The breakfast was not as good as some of the ones I have had at other locations. There was no alcohol available on site which was somewhat disappointing. Would have loved one glass of wine before bed. I would recommend this hotel especially if you are attending something at the javits center it was a very quick walk.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fireplace and in-glass waterfall in lobby are nice touches. Snack pantry and good seating. Rooms are clean, modern style. Full kitchen. Modern shower. Rooftop access was greatly appreciated. Morning breakfast buffet was the best I have seen in a while. Manager Mark Thompson was very helpful with our group. Will be a return visitor.
user_name:
GBNJ
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is the place to stay. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff,large modern rooms with refrigerators.It was like having your own apartment in midtown Manhattan.The beds are very comfortable, the rooftop is a great space to relax in,And everything is a short walk away, The High Line, Penn station, the Garden, Macy's to name a few.
user_name:
Thomas M
Rockville Centre, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I arrived early and the welcome from the reception desk was complete, thorough and accommodating.The lobby is friendly and international. The patio is large and relaxing. The rooftop is perfect and not crowded. The location is very convenient to Times Square and Penn Station.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Located near Penn Station which is how we usually travel into New York City from New Jersey, we love the convenience and comfort of this hotel. Staff is very friendly, attentive, and courteous. Breakfast is provided but we do miss the evening social held at all the other Homewood Suites in which we have stayed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I spent hours researching the best hotel for our 6 night stay and we were very happy with our choice. We walked to everything - Central Park, the High Line, Empire State, the Rock and even to Battery Point and the Brooklyn Bridge. We took a cab from JFK and then used their car service for the return trip ($85 plus tip). The breakfast was good with plenty of choices. Loved the coffee available all day in the Lobby. It can get busy down there at breakfast but the longest we had to wait for a table was five minutes. Would have loved to see a waffle station! Staff are very very friendly and helpful. Beds were comfortable, great pillows, handy kitchen. Short walk to Target for groceries but there are other grocery/food options available closer. Good wifi, great rooftop deck too. All in all this was a great location for our family NY stay, we will stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights and chose the Premium room with snacks. The only thing I could have complained about was the lack of snacks being available. There was an issue with their delivery but the manager was fair and adjusted our rate accordingly.The hotel is located in a great location for getting around Manhattan with grocery stores nearby as well. The room was clean and provided a small kitchen area to help with reheating some of those great restaurant leftovers. The coffee was always fresh and ready to serve in the lobby. The desk staff were very capable and friendly.Breakfast was great and always refilled. I just wish they had a bit more space for seating as it was sometimes hard to find a table. You could take breakfast back to the room though if you cared to.We loved our visit and plan to go back again one day soon!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I chose this hotel because I got lucky with a decent price after considerable work on many websites. I regularly stay with Homewood, but at full price, I would not have stayed here because it did not offer the value of a Homewood and there were a number of comparable hotels that were cheaper. There is no evening reception, and the rooms are small (New York size though) but I found several major chain hotels that had larger rooms for the same price. Also be aware that they have a car service available at a flat rate from the airport.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here after lots of research. We had 2 rooms and both were very nice. Although it is in a great central location the rooms were quiet and comfy beds made for a good nights sleep. Breakfast was handy but at times struggled to get a table. The hotel should manage the tables better as we saw many people sitting having a coffee and a chat in the morning when people were obviously looking for a table, this was not a big issue though. Great having 24 hr tea coffee etc. It would have been handy to have a kettle in the room. Would definitely stay again. Staff were also great and always ready to help and very polite.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Economically fair and safe facility. Staff was friendly, polite, and helpful. Rooms were clean and it was helpful having a little kitchenette to use. Free breakfast was nice to have every day. I would like a heavier blanket for the bed but otherwise, it was a pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed again at the Homewood Suites on West 37th Street. It is a very convenient and utilitarian. Our room had a kitchen unit along one wall. The sink vanity and shelves in the bathroom are just a bit too small for all our stuff, There is a complimentary breakfast the is very good. The staff is very friendly and efficient. We enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has a wonderful staff. The facility is very clean and organized. The room was comfortable although the refrigerator had a loud whine to it and the shower floor was slippery. The breakfast served varied and was tasty, but sometimes the items were cold. Also, seating is limited so get there early.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall, this was a great hotel experience. Centrally located hotel with many amenities. Breakfast was ample and varied; very pleasant staff. Check in was quick and staff were very friendly and courteous.Room was very clean and well-maintained. Only complaint - last night of stay, cleaning staff did not leave sufficient # of towels, wash clothes, and bath mat. Otherwise, this was an excellent experience; would highly recommend. Great value for NYC hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was not impressed by the hotel. Staying at other homewood suites, this place did not have the same quality. Our initial room was not made. The staff was not friendly. The room quality was okay. Not at all what i would consider good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed eight nights and had a great experience. We got our requested room. The breakfast staff are motivated and courteous and always kept the buffet stocked. We enjoyed the comp drinks in the lobby. The staff we came across were courteous. You can tell they are well trained. Junior on reception was particularly jolly and hospitable. The laundry room was useful for us and the hotel always looked clean. I'm pretty fussy and I was very happy. Thank you.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is new inside and is close to major subway stops, yet away from the bustle of Times Square. The breakfast provided many options and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Will definitely consider this property for future NYC trips. The front desk was very helpful.
user_name:
Lynne M
Dallas, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The three star review is not a knock on the hotel. It’s functional, and is a good base if you’re looking to be close to the heart of Manhattan without being right in the thick of it. Let’s talk pros and cons.Cons: 1) Water pressure is awful. While I applaud being eco friendly and am all for water conservation, of t did make for a difficult shower.2) Breakfast. This actually surprised me a bit because usually the Hilton family nails it on breakfast. I got sick my first afternoon there after eating the breakfast so I didn’t go back. The sausage tasted weird, and the egg “omelette” with a kraft single in the middle wasn’t appetizing. If I was F&B, I’d shoot for a little better ingredients. My suggestion: skip breakfast and go to Brooklyn Bagel and Coffee down the street.The pros: 1) Check in process. Service is friendly and efficient. I think the entire check in process took three minutes, if that. Nick helped us at check in, and Michael V. totally saved me when I needed a late night florist at midnight.2) Location. HWS is tucked down a side street and is easily accessible to Times Square and all subway lines. Overall, I would return again. There are some areas of opportunity that I hope they improve on, but this is a decent, no frills hotel in midtown.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have just got back from a 4 night stay at this hotel and found it to be fantastic. Great location. Check in was easy and short after our long journey. the room was very well presented and perfect for our needs. I loved the fact that they had barrels of complimentary coffee in reception that were always kept fully stocked! (24/7). Unlike many hotels, a buffet breakfast was provided, which was very good - cereals, yoghurts, fruit. scrambled egg, sausage etc. Toast / bagels. This set you up for the day, and obviously saved money too!The staff were all excellent, and the room was cleaned to a very high standard. I will be recommending this hotel to my friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed here over the weekend, its a lovely hotel, very clean and has all the facilities you could need. Breakfast is very good (if a little busy at times) but staff were very helpful and friendly. Couldn't recommend enough for the location and the overall experience. Will stay again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Have the option to stay at the Fantastic Homewood Suites there in Seattle downtown have the managers dinner happy hour fantastic hot breakfast and got out to do the Starbucks tour and the Olympic National Park all in two days great point of attack right near the Space Needle and Starbucks on Queen Anne Queen Anne and second

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was wonderful! Location was perfect! Walking distance from Penn Station so easy to get anywhere; but many attractions were close enough to walk. Great location for Broadway plays, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and so much more. We stayed in a well priced room with 2 queen beds and single sofa bed and the room even had a small complete kitchen. Room was immaculate, beds were very comfortable, breakfast was included and staff was extremely helpful and nice. As an added bonus there was a rooftop terrace with ample seating and great views of the city to unwind in the evening . Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very spacious rooms with kitchen a plus. Housekeeping are on top of cleaning daily which I love! All around staff here by far one of the best I have encountered! Will not disappoint. Book book book here..lol

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed with my teenagers and it was perfect for us so I’d definitely stay here again. The room rate was expensive but, considering the location and amenities, it was actually very good value for money. The kitchenette with a proper sized fridge freezer was handy - there’s a 7 Eleven round the corner and other shops like Kmart and Target nearby for buying food to prepare in the room. There’s no restaurant in the hotel but it’s not needed with the vast array of restaurants and take away food places nearby. You can even eat your take away in the lobby area or take your food up to the roof terrace. It was unusually cold for NY in April when we visited but we did go up to the roof terrace. It was a lovely place to sit outdoors in a very busy area of the city. The self service hot drinks in the lobby were fantastic. The inclusive buffet breakfast was good but crowded (as other reviewers mentioned). It was useful that they didn’t mind you taking it up to your room. I loved the delicious little bagels. We did happen to be in the lobby one afternoon and had a couple of the complimentary cookies which were tasty. There were greedy guests sitting in the lobby with their takeaway food who grabbed all the cookies every time they were brought out, but that’s not the hotel’s fault. The room and bathroom were very clean and the shower was good. My only gripe is that they provide soap bars instead of shower gel, which I prefer. The hotel is walking distance to many sights including Times Square. The subway is easily reached at Penn Station (which is only a few blocks away). We didn’t get a chance to use the gym as hoped but it had a good selection of equipment and was very clean.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The one thing that the Hilton chain does well is to hire great staff, from the front of house to the janitorial team. This was no exception, all the staff had a smile and made you feel welcomed. This is sadly where my praise ends, I have an expectation from the Hilton chain from their breakfast and I was sorely disappointed, we paid extra for the breakfast for the 10 days and could only stomach it twice. The eggs were tasteless and I don't think were real eggs in my opinion. So shocked at what was served, Anything that has the Hilton brand should not serve that breakfast and clearly it is not the fault of the staff. The bed was slightly too soft but the room was comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our check in was amazing and Cleopatra was one of the best customer service personnel that I have ever encountered. The room was very nice and the hotel was close to Times Square! Tiara gave my wife a special treat after learning of her special occasion. This hotel has won me over and I will make sure to stay here again. Please give Cleopatra and Tiara my humble thanks for an outstanding experience along with the young man who’s name escapes me but he gave my daughter a Kit Kar bar; which brought a smile to her face! Thanks,Rashad

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staff were fantastic and friendly, breakfast was mediocre (didn't have the traditional Belgium waffles many have that my kids like) Rooms are roomy for NYC, common room cleaning was amazing, our actual room cleaning was cursory. Well located for walking to most anything particularly broadway, time square, shopping, etc. Area of town felt safe to walk around.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We are sitting in the foyer of the hotel waiting for the taxi pick up and I thought I would write a review of the hotel. One word .... fantastic.My family consists of my wife and 3 kids and the 2 bedroom suite was an ideal size for us all. Only criticism was a noisy refrigerator but disconnecting it at night solved the problem.The hotel is situated in an ideal position close to all major attractions either by walking or the close by Penn st subway. The breakfast was ideal, providing a filling of our stomachs at the start of the day. The lemon sponge cakes were so tasty.I would encourage anyone coming to NYC to book this hotel as a base for their visit and if I visited again I would certainly return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Only stayed one night but would be great for several days. Good firm mattress. Easily sleeps 4 w/ foldout bed - although it would have blocked access to kitchen and hallway door, but we didn’t use its. Nice modern kitchen appliances, stocked w/ dishes etc. Better than usual motel breakfast - served many guests very efficiently. Nice reception desk service.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is conveniently close to Penn Station and within walking distance to TImes Square and even Central Park. We were there over Easter weekend and as mentioned in other reviews-the seating in the breakfast area is not adequate. It can be a somewhat stressful experience trying to figure out where to sit-much less get in line for the food. That said, the staff did a good job quickly refilling food stations and cleaning tables. THe food was fine, especially impressed by the fresh fruit. We had issues with the sofa bed also-fairly small and right in between the bathroom and the King size bed. The room was billed as comfortable for 3 adults-the space was fine except for the bed. We stayed on a lower floor, fortunately as the elevators always seemed busy. Otherwise, the staff was helpful and courteous-except the cab we ordered for the flight home from JFK overbilled us by $20-cash only. I keep being promised a refund by two different front desk staff and I've also emailed the manager. Still waiting for a refund to show up on my card.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is your typical Homewood Suites, so there were few surprises. But, this particular property let us down on two fronts. The pull out couch on which our daughter slept was TINY. It's a good thing my adult daughter is only 5'1". If she had been one inch taller, her feet would have hung off the bed. Also, the location of the open sofa made it difficult to reach the bathroom.I realized that we stayed over the busy Easter/Passover/Spring break period. Nevertheless, the crowding in the breakfast area was ridiculous. We got downstairs relatively early and at no point during our stay was seating available anywhere in the lobby or breakfast area. Nor could staff keep up with the mess.Long waits for the elevator were also typical and we mostly used the stairs. If you must use the elevators during a busy period, leave lots of extra time.
user_name:
DadaCabaret
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Lovely place, great location. Very clean and tidy and the staff are so helpful, nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast can get busy so get down early! Because of its central location it’s really easy to explore the city. Buy a metro card for the subway as it’s great value at $33 for 7 days.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Terrific NY hotel. Speedy, efficient check in, perfect location with easy access to many key sights, and a short walk to the subway. Breakfast was awesome and a great to start to the day without fussing over where to eat. Plenty of breakfast choices. Room was a good size by NY standards and the 5 of us (3 teens) found it roomy enough. Would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 6 nights in mid October. Rooms are good size by NYC standards, spotlessly clean & offer a comfortable and quiet stay.Tea/coffee/hot chocolate are available 24/7 in the lobby, perfect to grab and go, or to warm you up after a night out in the cool weather.Breakfast is included and has many hot/cold options and plenty of seating...unusual for a hotel!Very close to Penn Station and MSG. Highly convenient location about 5 min walk from Times Square, allows you to be close to the action without the noise & pricetag of TS hotels. To get to TS you walk right past the Port Auth & its truly only a few minutes. A 7/11 just around the corner means you can always grab anything you need.Rooms have a mini -kitchen so you can cook if you like. Coffee maker & fridge in room is a convenience not every NYC hotels offer, along with a coin laundry on site. They have free wifi and multiple charging points in the lobby.Staff are very friendly and helpful.We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend to anybody wanting a quality NYC hotel with a decent price. We will stay again :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had a great experience. The location was great, the front desk staff were happy, fast and friendly. The breakfast bar was very convenient especially having three children to feed. The suite I stayed it was a perfect size for 5 people. The only issue was having to reconnect to the internet each day and my fridge buzzed all night long. However, overall it was GREAT!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is our 5th trip to NYC in the span of 5 years and 1st time we stayed here. Usually stayed at other boutique hotels which were sufficient however, decided to stay at Homewood Suites/NYC this time. We had a King studio with kitchenette, twin sofabed, table/desk. Room was very spacious w/ very modern decor for reasonable price - which is surprising in NYC! Felt as if we were going home to our own NYC studio apartment! Free breakfast was great - no evening social here but don't need it w/ so much awesome food choices around you. We didn't have much view (another tall building right next door) but I guess you could ask for a nice view if you want. Walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, MSG, Grand Central Terminal, etc! Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: WE only stayed one night but the found the hotel to be very clean. Our room was smartly designed, from the bathroom to the work space. The kitchenette was much more than I expected. The service staff was well trained and professional.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I loved everything about this hotel. First off the location was great, easy walk to Times Square and so many other nearby sites and towns. The hotel itself was clean and modern and well staffed with employees constantly working to keep it great. At check-in (Junior) and the rest of the trip every staff member was super friendly, welcoming, polite and professional. It was a true joy staying here. Especially loved he 24 coffee, hot tea or hot chocolate. The free breakfast included was great along with be hours they ran it. Coming back during the day they had fresh baked cookies!!! Highly recommend this location for NYC with or without family. Rooms were clean and quiet too!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent a week in New York City for a Spring Break vacation and I decided to change an existing reservation to Homewood Suites since our party size reduced from three people to two. The room is NOT a "traditional" suite (with a bedroom separate from a living room) however was perfect for my daughter and me. I read extensive reviews about the hotel and set my expectations but was pleasantly surprised with the hotel and would definitely stay here again!GREAT SERVICE - We arrived in the city on Monday morning and were extremely lucky as we were allowed to check in early to our room. We found the front desk clerks to be very friendly and professional throughout our stay - always greeting us when we walked into the lobby and very helpful with directions, etc.HOT BREAKFAST - I read reviews about the breakfast area getting crowded, however since I filled a few plates and took the food back to eat in our room this was not an issue for me. Suggest getting an early start to beat the crowds - we also slept in most of the trip so only made it to the hot breakfast twice during our stay.ADEQUATE ELEVATORS - I read reviews about the long elevator wait times however again, we lucked out and got a room on the third floor. I was prepared to take the stairs in the event the elevator wait was too long however since we never had an issue with waiting we never took the stairs during our stay. NO SOUND ISSUES - Our room was located right behind the elevators (room 306). I had concerns about possible noise from the elevator mechanism and foot traffic but did not experience any problems. Our room was towards the back of the hotel (facing office buildings) so we did not experience significant street noise (however we are very heavy sleepers so snooze through anything!).HOTEL AMENITIES - We used the printer in the business center a few times and did a load of laundry as well. We used the gym once during our stay and found the equipment perfectly acceptable (but we admittedly are NOT "gym rats" so unqualified to opine on this subject). I am a coffee fanatic, so absolutely LOVED the coffee/tea/hot cocoa station set up in the lobby 24/7! The room also had a coffee maker so I was well caffeinated! We are Hilton Honors members so had free wi-fi in the room, which was also a great perk.ROOFTOP LOUNGE - The rooftop area is really nice to get some fresh air and probably lovely during the warmer months. It snowed during our stay so my daughter and I had a snowball fight and she made snow angels on the rooftop lounge!OK NEIGHBORHOOD - For the most part we felt safe but it is New York City so there will be "characters" on the streets late at night. It didn't bother us however if you are very sensitive to homeless people, then I'd suggest taking an Uber or taxi back to the hotel if returning after 9pm. Before that, there is enough "legitimate" foot traffic from the neighboring businesses, restaurants and stores.CONVENIENT LOCATION - We were able to walk to so many locations: Highline/Chelsea, Bryant Park, Times Square, Broadway, Midtown/5th Avenue. The hotel is very close to major subway stations (Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens) so we found it to be a very central location. There's a Dunkin Donuts, 7-Eleven and 2 Bros Pizza located closeby if you are hit with a late night snack attack.SMALL GRIPES - The dishwasher is pretty noisy; don't plan to run it right before bedtime. There is a small setup near the front desk selling toiletries, detergent, snacks, etc. however the prices are high (you're paying for convenience!).In summary, a fantastic trip and GREAT hotel! Don't expect the Taj Mahal or fancy-schmancy services since IS a limited service hotel. However I found it to be a great value so we could splurge on other fun things while in New York. We had an amazing vacation and this hotel was a wonderful "home base" for us.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our King Studio room was clean, a decent size and well equipped except the bathroom sink counter area was not large enough for two people’s toiletries. The shower door had a slight gap and water leaked all over floor, so we used the bath towel toabsorb the excess water. The fridge was a tad noisy but with earplugs, it wasn’t an issue. We loved having a ceiling fan! Our room was away from street and very quiet except for the next door guests’ constant door slamming, which I did directly and politely address - this isn’t the hotel’s fault, but I’ve seen other hotels with signs asking guests to softly close their doors. Perhaps this would be a good solution for people who need a gentle reminder :). Fortunately these folks did quiet down after I asked them. Unlike other reviews complaining about the slow elevators, the lifts were not a problem on the 12th floor. I’m not sure why, but Housekeeping consistently stored their cart outside our room overnight.Breakfast was meh. The “Hot” food was usually cold (3 days in a row, even at 7:30) and the cut up fruit didn’t taste very fresh. If patrons expect a hot breakfast, my recommendation would be to stick with the hotel’s yogurt, cereal and other similar provided fare, or find a nearby diner with cooked to order food. The staff at breakfast were very genial. Guests may want to dine on the early side as the breakfast area gets crowded and tables are a premium. The Homewood Suites is in a great location and has good rates for Manhattan. We were able to walk to many sites including Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and the High Line at Hudson Yards. It’s definitely a family friendly hotel. All of the Staff was very nice and helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed at this location several times for business. It's walking distance to the Javits Center and Times Square. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean rooms. Bathrooms are small, but nothing unusual for New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for a long weekend. Staff was extremely helpful, held our bags until checkin and after checkout. Convenient to subway (about 3 blocks away). The only negative was that the bathroom was not convenient. There was not a surface to place toiletries on and there was not a plug near the mirror in the room for hair appliances.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very central 3 stars hotel in walking distance from the metro Penn Station. Plenty of little restaurants and supermarkets nearby.The rooms are nice but need to be renewed. The bathroom wasn’t big enough and not practical at all. Moreover a suite with a King double bed and a bedsofa is definitely not enough for three adults as the bedsofa was too short and very uncomfortable. The hotel and room cleaning could have been better. The little kitchen in the suite was on the other hand very useful.Not so much food variety at breakfast but plenty of food and beverages as coffee or tea available round-the-clock in the hall. Unfortunately milk and yoghurt lactose-free were not available.The staff was friendly and reacted promptly and positively to our requests. There is also a taxi service available at the hotel desk but you need definitely to agree on the price with hotel and driver beforehand.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location: Only a 10 minute walk from Penn Station (we arrived by train). Close to the subway (35th/8th), Gregory's Coffee (good soy milk latte and banana nut bread) and 42nd street (if you want to go there). Its about a 30 minute walk to Lincoln Centre along 8th avenue.Room: excellent room overall. small kitchenette (hob, dishwasher, microwave, full fridge, toaster). You won't cook anything fancy, but great for a simple meal in (pasta and salad). Drip coffee is better in room than in lobby/breakfast. Small table for food, but only one chair; we had to use the luggage rag as chair number 2. Room kept clean (though they kept forgetting to restock the coffee and the dishwasher cleaning tablet). Great view and quiet.Lots of chocies for breakfast, though quality (visually) seemed so-so. We stuck to the fruit salad (good and fresh), oatmeal (a lttle mushy) and potatoes on some days (when not deep fried. With toast. Breakfast was crowded, though not at 7 am on Saturday :) If you're lucky and not out visiting, they put out cookies every afternoon which aren't bad.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'm normally a huge Homewood Suites fan, but this NYC version was a failure in so many small ways I thought I would write to warn other family travelers. Typically I love Homewood Suites because they have a separate room I where I can close the door and let my child go to sleep around 7pm. Then I can stay up later and watch a movie. Even though I booked the "king bed studio suite" there was no door separation to the living area. I was told 'studio' implies a single room. I'm not a linguist but the whole reason I booked a room in an all suite hotel was to I could have a separation between the bedroom and the living space. Combined with the following many small issues, the experience was the WORST for any Homewood Suite I've ever stayed in.- The refrigerator made a crazy high pitched noise so no one could sleep. The hotel's solution the following day? Unplug it. Great, thanks now my child's milk is spoiled. (Not kidding.)- The restroom next to the gym is absolutely foul with no working fans.- Soap, but no sponges to wash dishes. - Cleaning staff did not replace towels repeatedly. - Overall the breakfast was far lacking compared to other Homewood Suites I've stayed in. Breakfast egg omelette was filled with what seemed to be nacho cheese. All in all this particular Homewood Suites experience was what I would expect from a two star hotel, and not a Hilton branded property. On the positive side, the staff was very nice and very professional. Location is excellent.
user_name:
Bruce S
New Haven, Connecticut, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great price, good location, spacious rooms, friendly staff! Walking distance to subway, shopping, dining and entertainment. Definitly recommending to family and friends!! Hot breakfast was a big plus... breakfast meats could have been better, but it was free so no complaints.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed four nights for a family vacation. The location is fantastic - plenty of restaurants nearby and an easy walk to Madison Square Garden. Out of the way enough that it is an easy spot to catch an Uber. The room was small for three of us, but the space is well designed and efficient. Good size closet, nice full fridge, plates, utensils, large microwave, etc. I very much appreciated the ceiling fan that has three speeds. The free breakfast was definitely a factor in choosing this hotel. Good variety offered and plenty of seating for everyone - it was hopping every morning we were there! Friendly staff.We would stay here again but would probably upgrade to a larger room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hi the staff at this hotel junior, tiara, Idris, and audreen are very helpful and friendly the rooms are clean and spacious I would definitely stay here again The hotel is in a great destination it’s right next to time square really local the hotel also has free hot drinks in the reception 24 hours would recommend this hotel to anyone Thanks

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is very large and the breakfast room is the most disorganized I have ever seen. There are very few tables in relation to the number of guests and rooms. Result: you struggle to get a table. Although it has armchairs and a counter in the room is uncomfortable to eat with the plate in hand while the person on your side is simply making time to go out or reading emails on the computer. Several times I found dirty knives in the holder of cutlery cleaned for use. The coffee could be better.At no time did we get support from the hotel reception, nor when I asked for information to make a call because my phone gave a problem. They claimed that contacting the operator and the hotel fee were expensive and did not want to make the call. Although you are paying they behave as if they are doing you a favor.The person who presented as a concierge was only there to sell tickets to Broadway shows. I asked about tours to the ski resort and she said she had not had snow in the mountains for weeks. I asked how to get to a particular station that was next and she and had it enter the station's website. I asked for access to the metro and she handed me a map

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect location, at first I thought we where far from sites , Turned out —best location! Madison square garden , Times Square , all of it within walking distance ! Hotel staff - awesome! And having breakfast each morning included - was a definite plus !!!! If I ever come to NYC again , this is definitley where I would stay !!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was a great jumping off point with ease of access to Subway lines, Times Square, Theater District. Our room was comfy, front desk & concierge super helpful. Abundance of coffee shops a few steps away.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is an excellent location. Room is generously sized for NYC. The two negatives are the size of the bathroom and the slowness of the elevators during the morning. The stairwell works well if you are located on lower floors. Bathroom counter and storage space is non-existent but the kitchen is fully functional and equipped. Thermostat is very responsive and there is a ceiling fan to help keep temps cooler.The breakfast bar is organized well with many sections to keep people from bunching up.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here just before Christmas and had a very enjoyable stay! Our room was very clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Everyone at the desk was super friendly and helpful. It was great to have breakfast included, but their dining area could be better organized and maybe one more person working to keep things clean and replenished particularly on the very busy weekend mornings.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We love going to NYC, and even at higher price points, hotel rooms are often small, with not even a mini-fridge, and staff usually not very friendly. It is always a challenge to find a hotel that is friendly, clean, convenient, and reasonable. Yet Homewood managed to be all this and more. We booked two rooms for a long weekend stay and we couldn't be happier. First of all, the location is fantastic, just two blocks from the 35th st. subway stop and easy walk to the heart of Times Square yet tucked far enough that it is not chaotic. We arrived at 2 pm intending to just drop off our bags and were pleasantly surprised to be told that one of our rooms was already available. Our rooms were immaculate, compact but very complete. Everything is so modern, love the frameless shower doors! So nice to have a full-size fridge and mini-kitchen, which meant we had a place to store the goodies we were buying from all over the city! The breakfast is delicious, and served in their spacious lobby dining area using real plates and silverware! :-) Lots of nearby restaurants and shopping. Best part of this hotel is the staff, no matter what time of day there are at least 3-4 staff members behind the desk who are nice and cheerful and willing to help in every way. There is rarely a long line to check-in or out because someone else jumps in whenever it gets busy. Our search for the perfect NYC hotel is over. Thank you so much Homewood Suites!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'm from Texas so I was not quite prepared for how small the room was. However, it was very comfortable & I had a very nice stay. Only reason I'm giving it 4 not 5 stars is because I could hear noise from the hallway (talking) & other rooms (like TV noise). My room was a king efficiency that had a large mini fridge with freezer, stove top, microwave & mini-dishwasher. The bathroom was a little too small for my preference as there was hardly any counter space & the shower stall was small as well. I slept extremely well both nights. I loved the ceiling fan! That was probably the highlight of the room. There were also lots of accessible outlets for laptop & other electronics. The breakfast was also very good. This hotel was in walking distance to Tme Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I stayed in this hotel from 5 to 7 January 2018.We spent 2 nights in this hotel after our cruise at the beginning of January. The hotel is very convenient; you can get to most places of interest on foot.The hotel provides a great customer service. We’d like to say special thanks to Krystle. Who works at the PRdesk. She is very efficient and understanding! She helped us a lot.Breakfast is included in the price of the room. It is quite simple, but good enough to start a day in NY. In includes: omelet, potatoes, coffee, fresh croissants, fruit and juices. During the day you can have a cup of coffee or soft drinks in the lobby-bar. The lobby itself is the very attractive with a fire place in the middle. The room is very nice and the bed is very comfortable. The room has a small kitchenette where you can find a fridge, a microwave and a coffee pot). But there were some disadvantages:- Wi-fi was available, but not excellent. It didn’t work properly. Watching films was impossible.- Our room was of a smaller size than we had booked.But all in all, we really enjoyed customer service and our stay in the hotel in general.We would recommend in to my friends as it is really good value for money.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family of four recently stayed here for four nights. We found the staff polite and friendly .The room was very clean and catered for all our needs. There were no issues with noise.The breakfast was excellent and provided a variety of hot and cold food served between 6.30am and 10.30am. Coffee/tea and hot chocolate are available 24/7 in the foyer area.The location of the hotel is very good with only a a short walk to Times square and Penn station.Check out is at 12.00 with the hotel providing a luggage storage service and also arranging a taxi for our departure which allowed us a few hassle free hours to enjoy the City before our flight. I would highly recommend this hotel and will certainly return on our next visit to New York. Thanks to all the staff for their efforts.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very good experience at this restaurant. The common areas are very clean with good amenities. The breakfast has eggs, sausage, potatoes, fruit, pastries, cereal, and fruit juices. The rooms are very clean and well furnished.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked here through British Airways for a 5 day city break with my partner. Very glad we chose to do so as we can't fault it. Firstly, the location is brilliant, very short walk from Penn Station and within close proximity to Times Square (10 minute walk). The room was spotlessly clean and housekeeping was in every day so we always came back to a lovely clean room. Having the kitchenette was helpful as we could keep our drinks cool in the fridge and warm any food up we brought back in the microwave. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was fantastic. Also a wide choice of TV to watch.Having breakfast included was a massive plus point. Every morning we filled up on the wide variety of food options which included a hot choice (sausage, scrambled egg etc) and plenty of fruit, yoghurts and even little muffins/cupcakes. It was available from 6:00am - 10:30am.Overall, a brilliant, modern, clean hotel which was the perfect base for our wonderful New York stay. Thoroughly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel is very nice, well located and has several options for breakfast. Big room and bathroom, as well. Ideal for family and also for business. Close to Penn Station and some meters to Broadway. You can go by walking to several POI.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at Hilton Homewood Suites in the first week of Feb/18 and were very happy with our stay.Location is perfect, within walking distance to many attractions, public transport, shopping, restaurantsOur room was very clean, spacious and quiet. Kitchen was clean, well equipped with a full-sized fridge and provided everything that we needed for our stay.Free breakfast with a good variety of food was provided everyday from 6:00 - 10:30amWe made use of the spacious & well-maintained gym almost everyday.The coin laundry facilities on the C-floor were a big plus for families on long stayOverall, it's a great hotel in central location with excellent service and friendly/helpful staff. We would definitely return to this hotel when in the area

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was our 5th visit to New York and this time we decided on the Homewood Suites Times Square for 7 nights. This was based on the kitchen in the room (our son is a fussy eater), the included breakfast, the location and good reviews.Check-in was straightforward. We had asked for a room on a high floor away from the elevators and were given a room on the 17th floor (of 22) but surprised to find it was close to the elevators. However, this wasn’t a problem and we didn’t experience any noise whatsoever with the exception of a noisy neighbour on the first night. In fact being at the rear of the hotel meant it was a very quiet room.The room was very clean with a wood floor, comfortable king size bed and foldaway bed. It had a high ceiling with ceiling fan (3 settings) which we found useful for circulating the air. A good sized Samsung TV and plenty of electrical sockets with one being next to a full length mirror, very handy. A hairdryer is supplied as a well as an ironing board and iron. Also a bedside clock radio. The kitchen consisted of a very large clean microwave oven, a good sized fridge freezer, 2 burner halogen hob, sink and dishwasher. A coffee maker and coffee and tea bags (no kettle). All of the pans, plates, bowls, cutlery etc. was very clean and looked almost new. There was a small bottle of washing up liquid supplied and a detergent sachet for the dishwasher. The only downside with the fridge freezer was that it was quite noisy and being just a few feet from the bed meant we regularly heard it during the night.The bathroom had a tiled floor and was very clean with large shower but no bath which wasn’t a problem for us. Towels supplied were incredibly soft and very welcome and the toiletries were neutrogena.We were early risers for the breakfast buffet and found the choices available suited our needs and set us up for the days sightseeing. It included a choice of hot turkey patty, scrambled eggs and potato. Toast, bagels, fresh fruit salad, yoghurts, fruit and muffins/cookies as well as juice drinks and tea & coffee. In fact you could help yourself to tea and coffee all day and was a real plus. For those who like to keep on eye on the news/sport, there is a wall of 4 large tv screens where you can sit for breakfast or anytime during the day. Don’t miss the cookies available in the afternoons, they are delicious.Times Square is a short distance away but it was great to be just out of the hustle and bustle and sometimes a relief to get back to the hotel and out of the busy hoards! There is a handy 7-11 store a few doors away on the corner of 37th and 8th, Dunkin Donuts as well as “2 Bros Pizza” where you could buy a basic margherita pizza slice for $1 (or better choice of flavours for more $) and a wok to walk are nearby. We had planned to use the gym but simply didn’t find the time. It did however look well equipped. We found the small business room was useful for checking in online for our flight home and printing boarding passes.Check out is 12 midday but the hotel will store your luggage for you if you have a later flight.Overall, a good hotel. Generally, the staff were friendly particularly the tall lady in the breakfast room (we didn’t catch her name) and the maintenance guy in the light grey jacket. The only sour point being the rather cold and unfriendly lady on reception during checkout who made us feel like we were an inconvenience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent location. The hotel is ok, functional not luxury at all. There are a few issues others have mentioned like no cleaning on certain days (we didn’t really mind that as we weren’t in the room that much), terrible chaos at breakfast some days. The biggest issue at breakfast is everything is disposable, the most un eco breakfast area I’ve ever seen! Terrible waste. The room was ok, bit shabby with a terrible shower pressure but clean and functional. The reception is great, nice free coffee all day, cookies in the afternoon and nice staff.Just don’t expect too much and go here for the location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights during our New York City visit with our in-laws. Hotel is very well located - close to Holland Tunnel for easy access to New Jersey and also to tourist areas of NYC. We booked 2 Queen room with street view. As its NYC, streets are narrow and noisy. However, we slept quite well during night. You can walk to Times Square, and near by locationsBreakfast was quick and very well managed, unlike other Homewood Suites I have stayed in. This hotel is managed by another company and they are doing a great work !! Check-in was smooth and front desk was well managed. You will get coffee near the reception and have sitting areas as well. Corridors were narrow - if you have 2 people standing, you have ask them to move to get your luggage through. No issues with Digital Key at this location. Kitchen was clean and so were the utensils, pots and cook top. They even have different kinds of knives - break, steak, vegetable, etc. Beds were comfy and we all slept like babies.You get some discount when you park in garage near the hotel. You need to get the ticket stamped from the front desk to get the discount. There is hardly any space outside the hotel to drop-off or pick-up luggage/family, so you take any space you get near the hotel. Its a busy street.
user_name:
JaynanA
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I received a complementary certificate for a one-night stay at Homewood Suites in NY. The hotel was extremely clean; friendly staff; rooms were cozy! Location was perfect! The room amenities were great and beyond our expectations.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed 4 nights from the 9th Feb , party of 8 persons in 3 rooms . The hotel is in a great location close to the hustle but not too close . Everything is within walking distance 7 Eleven , various restaurants , dunkin donuts , time square , shopping so that should not be a worry for anyone reading this review .I like a clean hotel and a comfortable bed after a long day sightseeing and shopping after all who doesn't and this was the same sentiment expressed by my entire party which was more than met by this hotel . It is amazing how many things they were able to fit comfortably in the room fridge , micro wave , stove etc without feeling too clustered .The staff was always nice from check in to check out so we did not have any issues . The daily hot beverage station in the lobby was also a nice added touch for all guests as well as the cookies on afternoon .Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fantastic 5 days in NYC. Myself and my wife had been a couple of times before but first time for our 15 yr old daughter. This hotel was brilliant for us. A request for a high floor saw us on floor 16 with a good street view and absolutely no noise despite us being opposite the elevator bank. The room was plenty big for the 3 of us and the fridge and kitchenette was handy for leftovers , snacks and drinks. Hotel included breakfast was very good each morning as was the complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby. After we returned from a Broadway show on our last evening we enjoyed a bottle of bubbly on the roof terrace just sitting and listening to the sounds of NYC. Each time we left the hotel we were told " have a nice day " and on return it was " welcome back " - really nice touches. I've a big birthday next year so planning a return next Easter to see the Big Apple in warmer weather and will be booking the Homewood Suites by Hilton as soon as the flights from Ireland go on sale. Outstanding hotel !

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Quite modern, looks like it's been recently refurbished. Rooms are quite small, but I guess space is at a premium in Manhattan. Very handy location - easy walk to Times Square or Hudson River water transport. Quite a good complimentary breakfast, only let down by the extreme lack of suitable seating. It gets that busy it's like a feeding frenzy, with crowds of people forced to stand to eat. The biggest let down was the cleaning staff who repeatedly failed to clean our rooms and when we returned from a day of activities to clean up for dinner, we found our rooms still not cleaned. Then the cleaner would knock on the door to tell us she was finishing her shift and if we wanted our rooms cleaned we need to pay her to work overtime. We reported this to management but nothing changed. And we also had a bad experience with the security deposit the hotel holds on checking in. This was not released by the hotel until over 1 month following our stay, and not after multiple international phone calls chasing it. They explained that it can take some time for money to be released with overseas credit cards, but funnily every other hotel we stayed in on the trip managed to release the funds within about 48 hours of check out. We loved NYC and will be returning in the near future. But we will try a different hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I originally booked another hotel, which Agoda cancelled unilaterally without my agreement. I booked 2 more times, but was cancelled by Agoda again. The reason they gave was system issue. This shows how weak Agoda is in US, one can easily get a better and more reliable deal from other sites.Well, a contract is a contract, they have no right to cancel unilaterally. They claimed to have offered me compensation, but that was actually credit card discount extended by the bank. I was supposed to be in a twin room, but they didn’t bother to put me back on a similar room type, claiming that there’s a sofa bed. Yes, there was a sofa bed that was squeaking with the slightest movement and mattress so thin, sleeping on it for 8 nights just ain’t comfortable. If I were to upgrade to a twin room, I had to top up $50 per night, which Agoda didn’t compensate. There are only very few hotels with kitchenette near Times Square, so I was left with limited choice.Think twice before you book on Agoda, they’re slow, inefficient, insincere. My booking was cancelled days before the check-in date when I was already in US, which left me in distress. We exchanged more than 30 emails, which eventually ended with indifference and inaction by Agoda.DO NOT, I SAY DO NOT, AGAIN I SAY DO NOT USE AGODA. You’ll be left in distress and distraught, disillusioned and in disaster. Totally spoiled my holiday!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is gorgeous. Fireplace in the lobby; spacious and wonderful rooms; very quiet; gym; when the weather is nice, you can sit outside either on the first floor or go up to the rooftop; they offer a great breakfast in the am, with wonderful breakfast servers. Our favorite is Adreen. She is always smiling; so helpful; very professional; a breath of fresh air. The front desk people are wonderful. Thomas was so helpful with us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is our home away from home.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very nice and clean suites room. Very friendly and helpful staffs. I love their coffee counter in the lobby, which offers various hot drinks. It warmed me after walking in a very cold winter weather. They have a very tasty breakfast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Located in a very good position, 10 minutes walking from Penn. The suites are nice and clean, the rooftop are is also extremely nice. Breakfast is served every day with several options and coffee is available in the hall any time of the day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: They did not accommodate my family and they were overall awful in their service. I am a diamond member and got zero benefits or acknowledgement about it. I would stay at another Hilton in a heartbeat or consider a different chain. Additionally one of the receptionists hit on my by unbuttoning her blouse and moving closer to me so that I could see her xxxs.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A perfect efficiency apartment with easy access to everything. Very clean and helpful staff. Loved making this my home while in NYC. The breakfast was very good and the common areas were very comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Attentive staff. The pull out linens were wrong and the head of housekeeping came within minutes to right the situation. She even added extra cushion to the pull out for comfort. The room was ideal for what my friends and I needed! Close to shopping , concierge helpful with phanagling Uber for the first time. Hilton Family is the only way to go! Full breakfast included!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very comfortable stay in the garment district, easy access via subway to all of Manhattan. Walking distance to Rockefeller, Empire State, Times Square, Macy’s.We had a room with a balcony which was compact but comfortable and large enough for two. Would have liked a kettle, facilities cater more for the coffee drinker, but being British it’s tea for me.Room serviced everyday by efficient, polite and friendly staff as were the reception staff , we only came across one rude member of staff, however I imagine it is frustrating trying to vacuum and clean with so many guests milling about the place, it is a busy hotel. Fantastic facilities, whether you want to work out or there to work . For us breakfast was a disappointment, then again that could be down to our British pallets, it was more than adequate with the option of being able to cook in your room, as they are basically but satisfactorily equipped with the essentials, on the whole a good hotel with friendly front of house staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at the Homewood Suites recently for business. They were less than accommodating in relation to business credit cards, purchase orders and tax exemption. They were rude and demeaning. All things were figured out but not before charging my personal credit card AND the business credit card for the same charges/night stays. All things were figured out within the week but it was a stressful time in NYC and I had $1200 less in my account the entire time. AND... the free breakfast was cold and the eggs tasted like cardboard. The staff at the dining area were so kind and appear to care about their work. The room was clean and the maid-service was very good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for the first time and got a room on a Saturday night for $127 and breakfast on Sunday. Tiara ( almost positive that was her name) greeted me with a smile and check in was a breeze. Saw Lion King and the theater was within walking distance. Went up to the rooftop deck, very NICE! I will be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After reading review after review on hotels while planning our trip to NYC, I became hesitant on ALL options that were in a reasonable price range. We checked in early this afternoon and we are already beyond impressed with our stay! The room size is amazing. We are in a king premium suite. The price was more than reasonable. We arrived at 1pm and our room was ready so we were able to check in. The staff is more than friendly. Every time we return from an outing we are greeted with a “welcome back”. The rooms are clean and bed is VERY comfortable! Far exceeded our expectations!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our room was large, well equipped, clean and comfortable. The breakfast (included!) was very good - although (depending on the time in the morning) the place may be somewhat crowded. Overall a very good performance-price-ratio. Add the free 24/7 coffee and tea station, other amenities and the friendly staff: To be recommended!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I actually live in NYC but I was hired for a production at a studio that had early call times and we chose to stay in a hotel near the studio for convenience. The hotel was clean, service was friendly and we all had a great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood suites are always comfortable and clean. Decent breakfast. Coffee, tea, hot beverage items 24/7. Good service. Nice location in the garment district. Easy walking distance to everything. We walked to theaters, museums, Rockefeller Center from here. Staff is very friendly.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very clean & friendly with en suite kitchens made this stay a success. I highly recommend this hotel especially for extended stays. The grocery store Brooklyn Fair was 1 block away and had everything we needed for the week.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We’ve stayed in most of the similar value hotels in this area, and this Homewood Suites hotel is by far our favorite! We stayed three nights, January 18-20, 2018 for Unified college auditions, which were just around the corner. You can’t beat the value, location, and overall excellence of this hotel. Hop, skip, and a jump to Broadway shows, Penn station, and MSG. The rooms are so clean, and we saved so much money using the kitchenette in the room (picked up soup and frozen dinners for when we were too tired to leave the room). You feel welcomed as soon as you walk in the lobby with the fireplace and always friendly staff. The breakfast is just fine to fill your belly and also kept so clean. We had not one issue. Even the elevators were so speedy and clean. We were on the 16th floor and never heard/saw another soul! You have 24/7 access to coffee/tea/hot cocoa. Little things mean a lot! On our last day, while waiting in the lobby to go catch our train, three different staff members asked us if we needed a cab or anything. They also happily watched our luggage on the last day while we traveled downtown for the day. What peace of mind we had! So happy and thank you!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a gem in NYC. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are good for NYC, they have everything you need. My first stay, I had a corner room, htis time I am right by the elevators and I can't hear the dinging or the people waiting for the elevators.The breakfast area is good size, the food is good and you can get what you want and stay as long as you want.The hotel is located between 8th & 9th Avenue's. Good location, if you are going to Times Square, the Theater district or going to down towards Greenwich Village.Great hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I visit NYC at least 4 times a year and this hotel was by far, one of the best I have ever stayed in. The location was perfect; the rooms are large by NYC standards and came equipped with a large screen tv, a full size refrigerator, microwave and should I have needed it - a two burner stovetop. The coffee bar was well stocked with coffee and tea. I liked the wood flooring as opposed to carpet because it is cleaner; the bathroom had class doors which is so much nicer than curtains. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the heating/cooling worked perfectly unlike some hotels where I'm either always cold or hot. There was a very nice desk, which I chose to use as a vanity so as not to take up the bathroom while my husband showered. My only complaint is that there is no where to put your personal toiletries in the bathroom ... there is literally no counter space and the cupboards under the sink held towels and the hairdryer. I cleaned them out - stuffed the towels into one cubby and used the rest for my things. I wall towel rack would eliminate this and allow the shelving to be used for personal items. The lobby is large and comfortable with plenty of seating, a fireplace which was great as we were there during the 'great freeze' and they provide complimentary hot chocolate, coffee and tea.
