hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A small, friendly, knowledgeable front staff made this hotel feel boutique and special. A welcome surprise. Room was clean and decent size for NYC. Advertised junior suite with view had no view but otherwise very pleased with stay. Nice breakfast selection and comfortable lobby.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a surprisingly lovely stay. Room was spacious for NYC, ceiling fan a nice touch, bed and pillows comfy too. Very quiet hotel with friendly, welcoming staff. Nice breakfast in the morning in a quiet, relaxed atmosphere. Will definitely stay here again soon!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our couples stay in New York was excellent. This hotel has applied the 'keep it simple so it works' principle in managing their hotel at this location. We chose a king bed room with kitchenette and lounge! The hotel is well managed, the staff pleasant and very accomodating. We had complimentary wifi and breakfast both very good quality. The location was near west 34th Street Station subway (three blocks) and for a city like New York good value for money! This hotel for my wife and I thinking is probably better than it's bigger brothers. It is a no fuss but you have everything for ones stay! We had a high floor at 20 and traffic noise was non existent! The hotel is slightly sited off the main traffic area. More than highly recommended!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Close to Times Square, Macy's and Empire State Building. Very comfortable and well equipped room. Self-service complimentary breakfast provided. Free 24 hour tea/coffee facility in reception area. Business suite access to computers & printers, fitness suite & laundry facility all available to use.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a very clean and affordable property. Includes free internet and breakfast. Located central to Time Square, Broadway and Hell's Kitchen. Shopping close by. Very safe feeling. Staff welcoming to us.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A friend and I went to NYC for a week and stayed in this hotel and had the best week ever! The hotel had everything you could want, included breakfast and complimentary hot drinks all day as well as the kitchen appliances in the room if you wished to cook. The staff were amazing, very attentive even when it came to us stumbling in at 5am begging them to find us a heel repair shop as we had both broken our heels on a night out. The location is brilliant, walking distance to Times Square and the nightlife was never too far away. Will definitely be back to this hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Second time staying Homewood Suites by Hilton in NYC. This time we had a smaller room but it accommodated the three of us fine. I think we stayed here again because the rooms are a little larger than other hotels. We had a King bed and sofa bed (the sofa bed was not comfortable at all, but I not really sure if ANY sofa bed is).The hotel is in a great location, the room was clean, the breakfast was ok and the front desk staff were great.I will definitely return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked and stayed here for 5 nights from the uk for a family Birthday celebration. We arrived late morning and our room wasn't ready as it shouldn't of been, the hotel took our luggage and sent us for breakfast, we then went out to get our bearings and when we checked back the room was ready early..... fantastic! Birthday cake, goodies and balloons in our room were such a thoughtful touch, reception and concierge couldn't help enough they were amazing, the room was ultra clean and modern and spacious for 5 of us with a kitchenette and modern bathroom. Roof terrace was a lovely escape with good views and seating, breakfast was lovely with so much choice and location was great and Central near time square but also quiet at night. Can't recommend this hotel and all its staff enough.... we definitely dropped lucky with this hotel!! Thank you

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughter and I were in town to see Lion King on Broadway. We chose Homewood based on their high reviews, proximity to Time Square, and free breakfast. We chose the room with the "snacks" option. My daughter (11) LOVED having the snacks (as did I), and the breakfast was great! There was plenty of food and places to sit in the breakfast area. The room was VERY clean and modern. The front desk was happy to hold our luggage in storage on day 2 while we visited the city as we were staying at a hotel closer to the airport at the end of day 2. The concierge rep was OUTSTANDING! She was super kind and led us to the attraction Gulliver's Gate. It was great, and we would not have known of it without the help of the concierge representative. They even texted me while we stayed with them to see if we were happy with the stay and if we needed anything. I have never had a hotel do that before, and must say it was a neat touch! We will definitely come back to stay at Homewood again in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Superb from check to checkout, staff amazingly friendly and nothing to much trouble, complimentary breakfast superb something for everyone. Rooms superb superbly equipped luxury products, internet fab, snacks drinks filled up daily Will only use homewood by Hilton in future ideal location nothing more than couple blocks away near subway perfect

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is located near Times Square, Macy's, and lots more. It's like a little oasis in the midst of all the hubbub. Our room was always a calm, quiet place to relax after a busy day. We had no issues of any kind, which means the staff is doing a great job. It is on the expensive side, but everything in this area is.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have been staying at the Homewood Suites for a couple of years now for business. I am continuously impressed by the quality of service. Led by Melissa and Tiara at the front desk, the great attitude and happy demeanor of the staff makes for a nice oasis in the hustle of the City. Rooms are large and outfitted with things I hardly ever use, like a dishwasher. The bathrooms are impeccably kept, and the beds are comfortable and clean as well. 24 hour coffee/tea/etc. is a great convenience. Breakfast is expansive and contains a large variety. And the location is perfect for Penn Station and the 1/2/3 and A/C/E subway lines. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has everything and more. Clean, stylish, friendly staff, great breakfast, great location. They have thought of a travelers every need and the beds are so comfortable. Just what's needed after a full day exploring NY. I can't recommend this hotel enough. My friend and I stayed for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Would have no hesitation in staying again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed in this excellently placed hotel for a week and I really could not find fault, from the generous sized room(inc kitchenette) to the varied and ample breakfast. The roof top garden was an oasis of peace set against the hustle and bustle of New York streets. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will visit again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Seemed to me they have manpower shortages.Not that great but not bad ,it's an average stay.But I will not recommend it to anyone.But I have to say their breakfast was very good.overall it's an okay type wouldn't recommend to family.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: From the moment I arrived until way after check out above and beyond. Spotless Rooms , great Staff. Great location , great price. Daughter Sweet Sixteen to See New York City brought a party of 5 and plenty of room. Room bigger than most NYC Apartments.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My stay at Homewood Suites was lovely! I will definitely stay there again when I return to New York. The rooms were clean, there was a complimentary breakfast and the ambiance was pleasing. I will definitely return to this hotel when I come back to New York!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stopped in new York for 4 nights following our cruise so husband pre-booked the Homewood Suites mainly for their proximity to Times Square but quieter location. The suites are located smack in the middle of the Garment district. From the moment we arrived at 11.00am, we found the staff to be really helpful and welcoming. Our luggage was stored until a room was available, at which time we were texted. Hot and cold drinks were available in the small but pleasant lobby, as were cookies mid afternoon. We could also have taken advantage of the patio area at lobby level or the roof top patio.We booked a queen suite and asked for a quiet room. I wasn't disappointed. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the street but the noise insulation was so good that I never had a disturbed night for our whole stay. The room itself was absolutely adequate for our needs. Two very comfortable beds, plus a bed settee, a well equipped kitchenette (which we didn't use), and a comfortable bathroom with Neutrogena toiletries. The only disadvantage was the small wardrobe which was located in the bathroom but as we were only there for 4 nights it wasn't an issue for us.The breakfast room was situated adjacent to the lobby and again we found the fare met our needs. Cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt, muffins, a minimal hot selection, toast, bagels and various toppings for the latter. Again, very friendly support staff, and the area was kept clean.With regards to location, I loved browsing the material shops in the Garment district. It felt safe to walk around during day or evening. We were close to some great mid range restaurants and any number of takeaway outlets, and we were comfortably within walking distance of the lights and noise of times Square and Broadway.All in all, would we stay again? Definitely, and a big thank you to all of the staff-you do a great job and it was a pleasure to meet such friendly folk.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a wonderful time in New York. Homewood Suites was positioned far enough away from the chaos of Time Square but still close enough to walk to most attractions or the subway. The staff were always very friendly and willing to offer suggestions for dinner and we loved the homemade cookies on offer each afternoon after a big day exploring the city!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very Clean, Staff friendly & helpful. Will definitely stay again! Lobby is small, but nice - love the Fireplace. Enjoyed the Roof Top Patio area! Breakfast Very Good! Dining are nice and very clean. Great selection of breakfast items! Business Center small, but very efficient.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect for Family. The only Homewood Suites in Manhattan. Liked the clean and cozy room, Full-size refrigerator, mini kitchen, Guest laundry, Rooftop lounge with Hudson River view, Patio and friendly service.Close to Penn station and Hell's Kitchen. We liked the pizza and pasta from "Tavola" on the corner of 9th Ave.Bring some food and booze to enjoy the sunset at the rooftop!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was initially a hit and miss choice of hotel, but so pleased with my choice. We were three ladies travelling from Australia and found the perfect location. The Check-in staff were amazing and help full, they provided extra mattress on the sofa bed. The room was huge with full kitchen. The bathroom a bit on the small size but clean. The breakfast was basic but enough to get you started. Tamara in the dining room was excellent in her job and very helpful . The location is within walking distance to most things. I would highly recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a great weekend at NYC, hotel was excellent! Very comfortable room for 4 friends. Service was very good. We made check-in earlier and they treat us outstanding allowing us to have the room earlier. 100% recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I went with a colleague.1. Staff was polite and courteous2. Room was clean but small for 2 people. It has facility for kitchen and microwave for cooking food.3. Breakfast was complimentary and delicious.4. Location is very near (walkable) to Times Square and is very close to Penn Station.5. The area has good accessibility in terms of railway station nearby.The best part was that I came quite early than the actual check in time. They had already prepared the room and allowed early checkin without any hassles.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great hotel and location near Times Square (more Midtown actually). It's only three blocks from the subway so you have a lot of flexibility to go anywhere. I stayed on the 8th floor which surprisingly has an enormous balcony. The balcony is larger than the room it seems. It's a nice place to drink coffee and begin your day. The hotel isn't enormous but the rooms are very spacious for NYC. I never imagined I'd have a kitchenette and outside area so close to Midtown. This will be my go-to location in Manhattan for the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A real amazing place to stay with your family, the best position you can dream, a very professional staff and rooms always clean and comfortable. Breakfast was really great , me and my family we left a piece of your heart in this hotel. We hope to visit you soon again!
user_name:
cekkino11
Wangen an der Aare, Switzerland

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We are a large family (8). Our crew included 2 children with special needs.The hotel can get busy but that is to be expected especially since we visited at Christmas time. We had some issues with the fridge noise, rowdy neighbors and a leaky shower but the office staff took great care to ensure things got fixed and that we were taken care of. The breakfast was great and everything was clean. Its not a swanky place but we were glad to come "home" each night. The price and location can't be beat.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I would give a 4.5 if I could.Second trip to New York and a completely different location and style of hotel so I am not going to compare. Excellent location for the Garden (main purpose of the trip was for a Depeche Mode concert) but also ideally placed for 34th for Macy's and Empire State as well as Times Square and theatre district. Its also only about 10 minutes to the start of the High Line and 34st Penn subway is a couple of minutes away.Hotel is modern with an attractive lobby and the bonus of a free breakfast, as well as coffee and tea available 24/7 - it was nice to grab a coffee on our way back in from a day in the hustle and bustle of NYC. Breakfast is ok - its not going to win any awards but there is certainly enough to set you up for the day and its free so we certainly have no complaints.Room was not large but was more than adequate, with a very comfortable bed and kept very clean by housekeeping. AC works well (we had a high of 28c despite being mid September). Great shower too!We were on the 17th floor and found it both quiet from street noise and from other guests. We did not find the lifts to be slow to arrive as some others have commented - quite perplexed by that to be honest and we were there for five nights.The front desk was friendly, courteous and efficient, as were all staff members we encountered.I do not hesitate to recommend this hotel as a good base for exploring NYC. It does not have an extensive list of facilities but what it has it does well and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent accommodations in the core of the Big Apple. Friendly polite and knowledgeable staff without being overbearing. Comfortable and clean room. Nice extras including terrace overlooking the city. Cant get any closer to the action on the square and theater district. I will be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I chose this hotel for our one night stay based upon such strong TripAdvisor reviews (and the fact that it was only 10 minutes from Madison Square Garden and Clapton concert), and it didn't disappoint! Room was immaculate, amply spacious (particularly for NYC standards), and well-thought out; staff was friendly and attentive; bedding was very comfortable; and room was quiet (we were on 17th floor, but adjacent an elevator)... we didn't hear a peep. Breakfast was typical Homewood Suites fare, but certainly adequate. And rooftop seating area is nice option to enjoy the outdoors, check out the skyscrapers, and/or enjoy a glass of self-provided wine. Only improvement I could suggest is more shelf/counter area around bathroom sink for dop kits, etc. when room is occupied by more than one person.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had a lovely room with ceiling fan. The room is HUGE compared to other New York City Hotels, nearby. The hotel is in a convenient location near Penn Station. Steps away from 9th Avenue Hell's Kitchen Restaurants.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 9 nights in August - September 2017 for our wedding. Pros:* Room was larger than most NYC hotel rooms & has small kitchenette* Full size fridge, but as others have said is noisy when kicks in* Sofa bed was okay for our daughter to sleep on, however was not made up (even with basic sheets - found these in cupboard)* Location in garment district is relatively close to everything, otherwise take metro 34-Penn uptown or downtown* Room was clean, and no issues with housekeeping. Towels replenished often (we left small tip on bed each day)* Laundry was convenient to use* Free printing in business centre for boarding passes* Roof top was nice, had music playing from speakers and nice chairs / lounges (could do with more)* Room was quite / no street noise Cons:* Staff could be hit and miss with service. Some were friendlier than others. Checkin was rushed* On booking we mentioned this was for our wedding / honeymoon trip. No mention at check in or even questioned about reason for our stay* Breakfast was free but food quality was terrible. Some items like fresh fruit / cereal was good but hot food was just edible* Pillow quality was horrid. All 5 pillows in room were terrible, we had to call down for more* Shower door leaked and water would go over bathroom floor (used towels)* Lifts were always busy & we had to wait lengths of time to go up or down, including times it would bypass our floor all together* Small shop at hotel is expensive, suggest getting items elsewhere is you canIf visiting NYC again, I think we would look elsewhere for accommodation. Price point was good, but felt we experienced why it was cheaper than other hotels.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is perfectly situated. Close to most of the main sites. Staff were helpful and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. Nice to have a little kitchenette although we didn't use it much. Breakfast was tasty. Good value for money.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We normally stay further uptown ...so found 37th to be a bit far from some things .....we used the subway everywhere we went ! The staff was lovely ....everyone we encountered !!! The room was very nice and clean and that is HUGE in our books !

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here from August 31st-Sep 5th. Overall things were good. The room is a decent size compared to most in New York with a comfortable bed and room layout. The continental breakfast is what you would expect, nothing great but it works.  Our checkin-in process was really smooth, we arrived way before checkin and they were able to accommodate early check in, but in a room other than the one we had reserved-from what we hear it was actually better because it was close to ground floor and the higher up you get (originally we were going to be staying on the 18th floor) the longer is takes to get up and down, because their elevator is incredibly slow. Negative about check in*Didn't receive welcome bag thats generally given to Hilton Honors members.*Didn't receive and area map*Wasn't informed of breakfast timesHousecleaning-Our room was relatively clean, you can tell they intentionally skimp. For example our dish soap was mixed with water-HATE THAT. The house cleaners also have very unpredictable hours and we had awkward encounters multiple times where you could tell they were incredibly irritated (and hostile,expressed verbally being mad) that we were delaying their work day. BTW we did not have a DO NOT DISTURB sign to put outside of our door.Our View was of a brick wall with offices able to look directly into our room-we didn't mind, just put the drapes down. With the size of the room it can feel rather claustrophobic. A huge downfall of the room was the air quality, I would compare it to that of a hotel casino. It was awful and extremely hard to breathe, the bathroom reeked of stale cigarette, like it was in the wall. (we were in a NO smoking room btw)The hotel is is a perfect location, with time square only being within blocks, Penn station being maybe two blocks away that can connect to all major subway lines, tons of restaurant and fast grab food places in a close proximity. PERF. location for a tourist that wants to be central to everythingalmost forgot, theres a beautiful roof top terrace that offers awesome views of the city! Enjoy.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our family of five stayed here in a 2 queen bed suite. The room was very comfortable and easily accommodated my husband, myself and our three boys. Our teenager was quite happy to sleep on the pull out sofa bed. The kitchenette was a nice feature to have in the room. We didn't do any cooking, but there was a full size fridge that we utilized a lot. The only thing that the room was lacking was a dining table. Even just a small table with a couple of chairs would have been helpful. The hotel is in a great location. It is within walking distance to Times Square, Madison Square Gardens and other attractions. Penn Station was only a five minute walk from the hotel so it was easy to access the subway. There are also plenty of restaurants and bars close by. There is also a 7-11 just around the corner, which was convenient for buying drinks and snacks to keep in the room.The rooftop terrace was a nice feature. There is a great view with ample seating and people are allowed to take drinks up there. The complimentary breakfast was also great. The quality of the food wasn't the greatest, but it was decent. We got a great deal for the room and for the price we were paying we more than happy with the food offerings. There was always a choice of a type of egg, sausage and potato in addition to cereals, bagels, oatmeal, pastries and fruit. It was a great way to fuel up in the mornings before going to explore NYC. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again. It was great value for the price that we paid, which was much lower than other hotels in the area.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just back on Friday from a 4 night stay. We found it easy to get subway (Penn Station 34th Street) to most places or we just walked. Rooms are lovely and clean, the kitchen area within your room is really handy. Breakfast did set us up for the day, cereals, porridge, bagels/toast, muffins, the cooked food was a little boring, scrambled eggs or plain omelette style eggs and turkey sausages or turkey burgers. It would have been nice to have pork or meat sausages as a change, BUT, this would not stop me staying here again and recommending the hotel to my friends. There is always coffee, tea, hot chocolate and biscuits etc available in the lobby. The rooftop seating area is lovely and peaceful - great to take a coffee up and chill. The Staff are AMAZING, really helpful, nothing was too much bother. I will be staying here again, hopefully next year.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our suite was clean, comfortable and nicely designed and decorated. We loved the location and proximity to Penn Station. The staff were very friendly. The complementary breakfast was very good with plenty of choices. We had a great time!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect central location, hotel staff were fabulous, extremely helpful and courteous. Room was spacious with lovely spotless bathroom and kitchen. Complimentary breakfast was fabulous, so expensive in NYC so as s family this saved us money over the 5 nights we were there! Staff went over and above to celebrate 2 special birthdays, organise taxis and give directions/helpful tips..Would totally recommend to anyone, thrilled with choice we made and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel worked very well for our stay during Thanksgiving last year. We have two kids and the kitchenette and the extra sofa bed was a plus. Rooms are very clean and well maintained. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. We could walk to some of the major attractions like the Empire State and Macys. My favorite part was the complimentary breakfast. This is, most definitely, a great value for your money choice. Would come back anytime and recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First class hotel. Friendly staff. Immaculate rooms. Comfy bed & pillows. Special touches by staff. Delicious coffee in lobby anytime needed. Made my husband feel special on his 50th birthday. Thanks for everything.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We celebrated my daughter's 16th bday in NYC. The staff at the Homewood Suites were extremely friendly and eager to provide excellent service. I brought a few decorations for the room and they not only decorated the room for me, they also provided a piece of chocolate cake with strawberries, drinks and a handwritten bday card. My daughter was very happy when she walked into the room. As far as the room, it was everything you need for a 1 night or 7 night stay. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. The hot breakfast and 24/7 coffee bar were wonderful. And there were fresh cookies put out in the afternoon (which were amazing!). The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Penn Station and about 12-15 to Time Square. I highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Where else can you get 24 hours internet facilities, fitness Centre and complimentary tea and Coffee. Free cooked breakfast each morning and fresh cookies in the afternoon. Hotel is central to all the sites. Best by far.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We've stayed at this hotel in the past and have enjoyed the experience both times. The hotel staff is friendly and professional. The rooms are clean and comfortable and there's enough space especially for reasonable Manhattan accommodations. They have a nice fitness facility and a warm breakfast is complimentary. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Sybil B
Albany, NY, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is an excellent place to stay. Staff was wonderful and location was perfect. Close enough to everything but not too close. Breakfast was great, but you'll want to go earlier for everything to be hot. Doors do not latch, so make sure to check them when you leave for the day. Had two teenagers and they thought it was a great place also.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is in a great location in NY..only a few streets everything that midtown has to offer. The hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful when asking where to go or help with something. Room was very well equipped with hob, sink and fridge/freezer. Room was also spotless and kept that way. There is a breakfast included and while the hot offering was not to my liking there is plenty of cereals, fruit, bagels and bread for toasting, Hotel has tea and coffee available all day in lobby and in the afternoon some cookies..Fabulous rooftop are where you can bring in your own drinks and admire the views including empire state building from part of it. Prices were reasonable for such a great location and 4 of us in a room. Perfect stay in NY

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We reserved two rooms; one for my wife and me, one for my 3 children. Both rooms were roomy and clean. Breakfast was good. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Short walk to Times Square and theaters and Penn Station. We would definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel in a great location. The room is a comfortable size and I really liked that there is a full size fridge in the room. There was also a nice size stovetop, cooking pans, silverware and dishes. In addition to a comfortable bed there was a small sofa, desk and nice LED TV in the room. The lighting was plentiful. The bathroom which is located adjacent to the entry door could have used a bigger counter but other than that it was nice too. Our room was across from the elevator so we often heard people talking in the hallway. We were facing 37th street which I'm told is the preferred view. There was a residential building directly across the street but I guess in NY you don't care about them and they don't care about you :) In the morning Homewood Suites provides a continental and hot breakfast in the lobby. Considering the location and hotel rate this is an added bonus. The choices are standard like scrambled eggs, waffles, sausage, toast, fruit, pastries and cereal. Nothing fancy but its FREE. Throughout the day there is self serve coffee, tea and hot chocolate available at no cost too. Also in the lobby is a concierge who is available to assist with tours & tickets.Once outside of the hotel it's an easy walk to the Fashion District, 42nd Street train station, Port Authority, Times Square, Broadway Theatre's, Madison Square Garden, Macy's & Whole Foods Bryant Park. I actually ventured all the way to Union Square and NYU. I ubered back though lol. Excellent service. Excellent location. Excellent value.Highly recommended

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very nice location. Starbucks, Penn Station, and a ton of bars, restaurants and other stores close by! First trip to NYC and loved the location of this quiet hotel. Clean rooms, friendly knowledgable staff (Thomas at the Front desk batted 1000 with all his recommendations!) Free breakfast and dinner were nothing special. Nice gym & convenient "office" and "laundry".

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Beautiful room, helpful staff, great lobby area and roof top deck. Loved our visit. Breakfast however was difficult to choke down 4 days in a row. Cold eggs, terrible sausage, dry dull potatoes and cold oatmeal. Standard fare but very poorly done. Would definitely give five stars if not for breakfast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel, nice rooms and very clean. Perfect location near everything, just steps from times square and subway stations. Staff is very friendly, they help us a lot. We were having troubles with our previous reservation in another place and the staff were able to find 2 rooms for us, they are very kind; I left my cel charger in the lobby and they keep it for me. Very good breakfast. I definitely recommend this hotel and I will stay again there my next time in New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent 4 nights at Homewood in a king city view suite. The room was on level 20. Room size was a little smaller than anticipated, but adequate. Room was quiet except for rattling in the aircon...which staff said was normal. Breakfast included, was usually quite busy and simple. Location is close to garment district, times sq and shopping.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: very good location. Very easy to access all the attractions. The staff were very friendly. The breakfast was limited for vegetarians. Would recommend a few more options. Coffee 24 hours was very useful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fabulous hotel in the centre of New York City. I had to stay there, for four days, with my family of five and I understood that I couldn't make a better choice. It was five minutes, on foot, far from Times Square. Close enough to get there in a quick time but also enough far away to don't be disturbed by the crowd and the traffic. The room (and the bathroom) was clean, big and with a big window. There were also a big television and a lot of socket to charge the mobile device. The breakfast (international) was good tasted and you had a lot of choice.The personal was nice and wiling.At the last floor there is a big rooftop where you can seat in some armchair, listening to some good music and watching the skyscraper in front of you.I'm so proud for the choice that I made because all my family was so happy!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was an excellent choice for me with my 15 year old grandson. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel was clean, bright and user friendly. Having snacks provided free of charge and a full kitchen was extremely helpful. Everything was in working order and the kitchen was well equipped for our needs. The morning breakfast was good and had a nice variety of offerings to suit every taste.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed in a room with 2 doubles, and a single sofa bed, 1 bathroom. Microwave, hot plates and some dishes. Clean and modern hotel, breakfast average, biscuits supplied for afternoon tea were great. Walking distance to Times Square and to subway. Running distance to Central Park.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice hotel, close to Penn Station. Staff was great, rooms are very nice and up to date. Breakfast was fine. Rooftop with a nice view that you can visit. Comfortable beds, etc.  Will stay again next visit.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is the 4th time we've stayed at this hotel. The rooms are large (many suites set up in different ways, but they can accommodate large families). They have mini kitchens and pull out sofas in every room. The staff is friendly (Tiara has always been quite helpful!) but the downfall of this hotel is it's location. I know that when you're in the city, not a lot of time is spent in the room, but getting back and forth to the hotel on a street that is usually lined with drug addicts can be a challenge, especially if you are traveling with children. The price of this hotel is great, and when we stayed in the winter, there were less people on the street, but on our most recent stay there were many people in various states of incapacitation. If you are an adult couple, or if you are not bothered by such things, the price point of this hotel, the friendly staff do lend to it's popularity. We have had some cleanliness issues in the past that have been immediately attended to and resolved. The snacks provided and complimentary breakfast are also nice perks. And the rooftop is usually a great place to enjoy a cup of coffee and the view.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband, daughter and I took a quick trip to New York last Christmas and we couldn't have been happier with this gem of a hotel! It had everything: proximity to everything, friendly staff, great room and amenities. A little cramped with an extra cot in the room but this was one of the best stays I've had in New York and I've been many times.Steps to Penn Station and great restaurants, shopping and Central Park.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location. Friendly staff. Good service. This is my second stay and it was great. I missed the evening cocktails they used to have before. It is close to subways and buses. Many locations nearby like broadway, Times Square etc. This is my location in NYC!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean, spacious, light room. Great location. Amazing front desk staff (Thomas). Was able to find parking right in front of hotel on the street. Would recommend to others, and stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a nice, modern and clean suite that offers a lot of amenities. The suite offered free wifi and had a nice breakfast buffet offering. Its close to Times Square and several subway lines. I really felt special staying there, staff was friendly and professional.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel stopped during this year offering the evening social. Now it is just similar to other hotels in the area. It is no longer special.Cutting service is not the way to keep people coming back. You must offer more than nearby hotels.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for work, and caught a show at MSG, which is only a short few blocks away. I would definitely stay here again. Rooms are spacious, there are many places to eat and drink nearby. Subway stations are all relatively close as well.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Extremely helpful, friendly staff in a centrally located hotel. Complimentary breakfast was the same every morning, but passable. Clean, spacious rooms and extremely convenient to have a fridge, stove top, microwave, dishwasher and sink. Elevators were always slow and crowded.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Immaculate hotel. Nice roof top patio. Staff were very helpful and nice. About a 20 min walk to Times Square. We had no problems walking or getting a cab to where we wanted to go. Plenty of things to do in Manhattan. Beautiful city and state!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights. The front desk staff are hit or miss. There were some that were engaging and some that just didn't bother. The 2nd concierge we met was very helpful. I believe it's Andrea. She helped us with directions, etc. she's an asset to the hotel. The rooftop terrace is an added amenity. Laundry facility was a plus. This hotel is located very close to subway stations. Mind you, we're not used to subways, but we took it to most of the places we visited. So convenient and inexpensive. Broadway is also 5-6 short blocks walk. Breakfast however was ok because it's free. Nothing to mention except the staff were attentive. If we ever go back to NY, I would stay at this hotel again because of the location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Although you will pay NYC prices, this is an excellent hotel! The included breakfast has eggs, meats, pastries, fruits, yogurts, cereals, etc. Free coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby all day. Very quiet room with high ceiling. Excellent kitchenette stocked with cookware and eatingware.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have stayed two years in a row and two adults and a child lived comfortably in the room for over a week. We brought a crockpot and used the stove and microwave and made meals in which saved a good deal of money. Too bad there is SO much to do in NYC because the bed is CRAZY COMFY and room is comfortable and quiet with all the comforts of home. Great place to stay, makes street navigation easier to handle when you are coming "home" to this hotel!
user_name:
Charles B. D
york, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Welcomed with smiles and kindness. Nothing was ever too much for front desk and they always made sure our stay was great. The suite was extremely neat and clean. The cleaning and maintenance staff always greeted with smiles and were super efficient from what we could see of what was attended too. Breakfast staff were as friendly and promptly tidied surfaces once guests left area. The bed was comfortable and linen divine and crisp. All amenities were supplied as sold. The laundry access was my highlight as I love to make sure our clothing is fresh during stay. I cannot fault anything of our stay. Should we return, Homewood Suites would be our 1st choice. It felt like home away from home. Great stay! Thank you :D
user_name:
paigesmith1982
Cape Town Central, South Africa

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent 7-nights at the Hilton Homewood Suites Midtown as a part of a group reservation. We enjoyed the complimentary buffet breakfast,which always included eggs, a sausage, potato, multiple bread options, fresh fruit, cereals, juice, coffee, bagels/cream cheese and pastry options. Every day! The rooms are a modern style with hardwood floors, clean white sheets and relaxing colors. Kitchenette includes a small refrigerator/freezer, stove, microwave, dishwasher and dishware. The staff at this hotel are top-notch, friendly and helpful. The lobby and back patio offer lots of comfortable space to relax and converse, including TVs, water feature, and fireplace. The hotel is walking distance to the Theater District, Hells Kitchen, Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. I would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After a lot of research, we chose this hotel for its location. It is so close to Times Square and the subway. The hotel is clean, comfortable and good place to relax after a day of sightseeing. The breakfast is good although a little cramped where its situated. Friendly staff and always happy to help in guiding you in and around NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My teen kids and I recently stayed at this Homewood Suites for a week. The entire week we received genuine, attentive service. The whole hotel is very clean, staff is friendly and responsive. We had a king room with a pullout couch bed, which our 18yo son said was surprisingly comfortable. We are returning to NYC next week and are disappointed that this location is completely booked! We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at the Homewood Suites Midtown NYC for a week ... our daughter was in Broadway Artists Alliance Program. Staff was EXCELLENT ... Hotel felt like an oasis hidden away from a very busy city. Roof top lounge was also a great get-a-way and offered excellent views of the city. Overall Great Experience and we will stay there again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I chose this hotel because it was close to my New York office and had pretty good reviews (even better than some four star hotels). My room was surprisingly bigger than other NYC hotel rooms I've stayed in. It was clean, comfortable and even had a free hot breakfast! No complaints here! I liked this Homewood Suites better than hotels I used to consider a step up from this brand like the Hilton New York Fashion District or Sheraton Tribeca.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Came in on an early morning flight and they were able to get us into our room to drop off our bags before hitting the city. Very centrally located to major attractions and Penn Station to use the subway. They offer a nice breakfast and the beds and pillows are comfortable. Higher rooms have less noise. We were on the 11th and didn't hear a thing at night. A good place to stay if you are coming to NYC for a long weekend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Close to everything (Broadway AND a short walk to Hi-Line), this hotel is comfortable, clean, and full of great amenities. Our room was advertised as quiet and that it was - it is so easy to catch the noises of the city at all hours, but this lived up to its billing. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nothing special. I have used to stay on a lot of Hilton properties and this one was disappointed for me. Maybe I created high expectations. Front desk staff too dry. It seems that they are providing you a favor and not being paid to provide a good service. I noticed that the kids were receiving a complimentary kit. Since o was with my daughter, I had to ask for (why was not this noted by the front desk?). 1st day: room was not ready and we had to leave our luggage on a locker. 2nd day: around 4 pm (after we came back for a shower, before leaving for supper) the room still hadn't been cleaned. I had to call and they did the service while we were in the room, since they mentioned that that was the last time to clean it (we requested if it was possible to have it cleaned while we we would be out, around 5 pm). Room: clean, as must be. Issues with the noisy fridge that it is provided. Unbelievable that you have such a noisy fridge at 3 feet from your bed. And please, do not come with a standard email like "we really appreciate your feedback and we will take this into consideration, bla, bla, bla...As a gold member I was expecting a different treatment. I had to tell to the staff that I had "purchased" the premium package.... otherwise I would not get the service. Last time we stayed at Hilton Times Square. I regret to have not chosen the same hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great stay at Homewood Suites for our summer holiday with the family. Perfect location and facilities and excellent service from staff, especially Junior on Reception. Loved the 24/7 hot beverages and cookies during the day. Only critisim is the breakfast, which was great for the first few days but would have welcomed a variety for those like us staying a week or more. Thank you Homewood Suites!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The functional and esthetic design of the rooms complete with a kitchenette even beats IKEA. While actually small the rooms have space for everything including a sofa bed (we were three) and we felt very comfortable. Good breakfast buffet and tea/coffee facilities add to comfort and value for money. Reception was friendly and efficient and so was housekeeping. Big thank you. Location in midtown close to Penn Station and Times Square was convenient for visiting different parts of the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 10 nights in this hotel on a visit to NYC. We chose to stay in a Hilton chain hotel that is centrally located in NYC. Check in at the hotel was very smooth. We were assigned a room on the 21st floor. The bed was comfortable,the bathroom was rather of modest size, with or enough space to place our toilet articles. Storage space was Insufficient for a 10 day stay. One tiny cupboard and one drawer cabinet. The kitchen corner (in fact, not even a corner but an integral part of the room, with no separation at all from the sleep area) was over-equipped, with everything needed to operate a household kitchen - except for one problem - there was no room to place items next to the sink, and there was no kitchen or dinner table. So we could not really make use of the kitchen and resorted to having lunch and dinning daily in restaurants. This is a faulty design of the kitchen which did not allocate work space at all. The morning breakfast was OK but nothing more. Luckily, we are not big eaters or gourmets. The 22nd floor consisted of a terrace with comfortable seats/couches, but nothing more. The hotel was crowded with families with a number of children each and was therefore quite noisy. We had not expected that many children and so much noise in this level of hotel. The staff were very nice and courteous. The elevators were always a problem, always busy with a fairly long waiting time. Too few active elevators for this size hotel. Business room was very functional and helpful.Overall, when we booked a room at this hotel, we expected a fairly high level hotel. What we found was a loud, noisy and crowded family hotel - which is not what we had been looking for. The daily price which we paid for our room should have gotten us much better than what we did. The very nice staff, the cleanliness of the hotel and the excellent location compensated somewhat for our disappointment.so if you are a family with children, yes- this is a hotel to go to. But if you are a couple who is willing to pay the steep prices for a mid-manhattan Hilton hotel, consider going elsewhere.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 5 days as a family of 5 over the Christmas 2016 holiday period.Hotel was very busy at this time of year which we did expect but it was part of a bucket list for my wife and teenage children to spend a Christmas in NYC.I chose the hotel as it was one of very few hotels in Manhattan that you could get a balcony (I like to be able to walk outside even if it was cold).The rooms were nice and well equipped, small but that was to be expected here.The staff were great , all of them but especially at the front desk. anything we asked was taken care of and they looked after our teenage children when they needed assistance. Location was good, close enough to all the things most people want to walk to in Manhattan and the rest we took a cab or subway as traffic can be chaotic.The biggest let down with the hotel was breakfast, very basic with not a great deal of choice but the biggest issue was space, it was always full. with so many people it was like the running of the bulls most mornings. the other negative point was the lifts, they would have to be the slowest and smallest lifts I have ever witnessed, at some points we walked down from the 8th floor rather wait for the lift.I would stay again but not during a busy time of the year.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Arrived in NYC from an evening international flight into Newark. Trained into Penn Station then walked to the hotel (10 min). Location is spot-on in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. Booked directly with Homewood Suites in February for an early July accommodation. Room was a somewhat tight fit for our family of 5 (kids ages 14, 15, 17). Configuration consisted of 2 queen beds and a pullout couch. With the couch converted into a bed, it was difficult to scoot past it to reach the bathroom—that was the only inconvenience really. Complementary breakfast satisfied our needs featuring varied hot & cold selections. Staff accommodated us with a late check out until 1300 hours (final flight home was at 6pm). Offered luggage storage if we went out touring. Organized taxi-van to take us to LaGuardia the next day. Smooth/easy.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent the night in NYC by using a Hilton free night certificate and decided this location after reviewing the other Hilton hotels in the area. We were not disappointed, clean and convenient. For parking, an independent garage is down the street, the hotel web site does say self parking but the garage is valet! The hotel staff told us the self park meaning is you have to park your own vehicle, the hotel does not offer valet service, just remember that if you are looking for a self park garage. The roof top patio might be nice for a night time view.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We ended up at this hotel due to Hilton Honors not placing our original reservation at other location correctly. We were pleasantly surprised. Our room slept 5 and had a full kitchen - crowded with 5 but it worked for what we needed. Breakfast was just ok, liked using the back courtyard for breakfast as inside filled up quickly. Staff very helpful and friendly. Hotel was clean, pretty updated. The rooftop deck was cool. We took the stairs a lot from our 3rd floor room as the elevators were often busy. Wasn't too far from Times Square, we were able to get here easily from JFK via AirTrain and Subway.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great room, service and breakfast. Tamara, (worked in the breakfast area) worked hard to get available tables cleaned quickly. She made you feel at home. She was great!! Thank you!! Would recommend a stay there!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was the 2nd year that we stayed at the Homewood Suites. We had a great experience both times! The size of our double queen room was amazing! Loved the kitchenette area which came in handy since we were there for a week! The staff was very friendly and there for any needs. I requested a feather free room and was happy that they were able to supply it for us! Can't wait to stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was clean and "sizeable" enough to accommodate family of 5. The hotel is new and very conveniently located -- it is literally 10-15 minutes walk to many NYC attractions.The breakfast was hearty and delicious. As always in hotels, breakfast area was getting little crowded after 9 am. We used to get up early, so we were able to find table on every morning.The only thing that may bother other people -- for some reason, the waiting time for elevators could be very long. As soon as we figured out this, we just started to use the stairs -- it didn't bother us at all to go up and down to 6th floor.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites was a great place for a long business stay in midtown Manhattan. A nice walk to the Javitts Center and lots of choices for eating out and local social places. Close to the Empire State Bldg, MSG, and Times Square. They run a wonderful hotel here and the Staff are golden. At all times I felt the Staff's help and assistance, with consistent positive attitudes and smiles. Top floor 22 was a great oasis in the eve for me and my wife. A very nice view and vibe up there.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Loved this hotel. Great service, great staff. Location cannot be beat. Prices cannot be beat. Fitness center was a joy. Business center was helpful. Complimentary breakfast was adequate. Don't count on the concierge for help, though. They were rude and unhelpful. Rooms were clean, spacious for two people and wifi was great.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I recently stayed at The Homewood Suites Midtown for 3 days in July 2017 and our overall stay was excellent. The decor is modern, the hotel is clean, and the service is excellent. It's also very conveniently located to Penn Station, the theater district, and Times Square. The staff were very friendly, welcoming us every time we returned. My only disappointment was with the hot breakfast items. While it's nice that the breakfast is free, if you're going to offer hot items, they should be of at least average quality. That aside, I would highly recommend this hotel. I used Hilton Honors points to book the stay, so I can't comment on the value

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall, we were very impressed with the quality/cleanliness of the hotel. We would definitely consider staying again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Breakfast needs improvements. I give breakfast a 3 star and rooms 5 star. It is within walking distance to time square and also has a GREAT pizza restaurant about 100 feet down the sidewalk Non Solo Piada NYC (nonsolopiadanyc.com)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New property. Sizeable room for NY. Beautiful hardwood floors in living area. Modern. Convenient location. I would stay here again in a heart beat. Parking garage nearby. Complimentary breakfast. Walking distance to many locations in midtown.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My room wasn't ready at check in and had to wait nearly 2 hours in the lobby. Refrigerator was faulty (made loud high pitched noise). I was told "they all sound like this" but convinced them to replace it with a different refrigerator which was fine. My room was across from the very squeaky elevator. I used my iPhone to create white noise to drown out the elevator. Otherwise the stay was nice, room was clean, people were nice, breakfast was good, and I would probably stay again but would definitely ask for a room far from the elevator, although then again in NY there are so many other options and check in was so awful....

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Tiara at the front desk is excellent! She's so professional, friendly, and helpful. Argy in the sales office helped me book my extended stays while in town on business.This hotel is basically new or recently renovated. Each room has a kitchenette with full-size fridge, 2 burners, pots, pans, cutlery, etc..There is no pool but, the gym is great!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Warm welcomed, Nice and Big bedroom. Breakfast offers large variety of food.Very Nice rooftop where we had the opportunity To drink champagne with our friends. Professional desk team Ony was very helpful and gave us many advice. I will Come Back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great breakfast but discovered at checkin that dinner has stopped being served on Monday to Wednesday. Overall service and location was great. I would stay again. I would recommend that some house keeping services start before 9 am when a lot of people check out early so people who arrive before 10 from far distances have a chance to check in and freshen up before their day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel in walking distance to some of the attractions. Super friendly staff. Subway station at the next corner. Loads of food places and bars around the hotel. Breakfast was ok not as good as our last 2 stays. Roof terrace is a great bonus to sit and relax at the end of a long day walking about. The only negative thing i would say i wasnt happy about was our bed linen wasnt changed once during our 10 night stay even although i did request this be done with the room maid.
user_name:
Karen And Paul F
Fife, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This place is awesome! The location is prime. Walking distance to Times Square, subway is close and anything else you could want to do. Our room was beautiful. It was a suite with a balcony. The balcony was like a patio. It was very large. Perfect to check email while having a glass of wine or a cup of coffee. It made me feel at home because it actually has a grassy area that could have used some weeding. There is also a rooftop balcony that is furnished with style. Rockefeller Center is visible from there. RC was all lit up for the Fourth of July. People smoke up there and that is a problem for me, so we just used our balcony when smoking got annoying. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Breakfast was perfect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my family's first visit to NYC. The hotel staff was helpful and efficient. The rooms were spotless and quiet. We were in walking distance of a lot of major tourist attractions. We couldn't have had a better stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent 2 night in NYC to see the 911 museum and monument along with the Intrepid Museum. Was a great location and we could walk to a lot of restaurants and Time Square. We had a great time. The staff was friendly and gave excellent suggestions for restaurants and even ordering Chinese delivery! Oh so good!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good sized rooms, and amenities. Very helpful staff. We stayed for 3 nights during the July 4th weekend. Breakfast was a little crowded, but with lots of seating space, was able to quickly get places to sit. Overall, we recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed at a ton of Hilton properties, and this may have been the greatest experience I've ever had! The hotel is on a very easily accessible street and is fairly quiet for the area. One of their employees name Sairy went above and beyond for us. I told the hotel it was our 10 year anniversary and they put us in a suite on the 21st floor. When we got to the room, there was a hand written note, gift bag and a fruit and cheese tray in the fridge! Talk about making a great impression! I couldn't tell you one negative thing about this hotel. Amazing staff, beautiful rooms and fantastic location! Thank you again, Sairy! You are doing a great job!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was a great choice for our 4 night stay in NYC. The hotel was well located and within easy walking distance or a quick car ride to any major tourist attraction. The rooms were clean and the included breakfast was great (so was the all day available coffee). The staff was super helpful and happy to offer assistance and recommendations for the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I really liked this hotel, really comfortable, with a buffet for breakfast, during nights they also offer some free snacks, rooms were spacious, confortable... definitely a Hilton quality hotel in the heart of New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here with family for a week, the location was near Times Square and metro. I was little concerned about the sofa bed but it turned out to be comfortable enough for a good night sleep. Breakfast was good and had plenty of options. They also have coffee/tea in the lobby available 24 hours. There is 24hr parking garage about 100 feet from the hotel, though its close but at $45 a day, its little expansive, if you look around, you might be able to find a cheaper one at a distance.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everyone looking for hotel stay in Manhattan New York, especially families should definitely consider this hotel! Got good price c/w breakfast & location were the most powerful factors. Being in NYC, at first we were sceptical. However, we were pleasantly surprised with room size c/w small kitchenette & cleanliness. Hotel roof top place great for quiet evenings with a view, small gatherings. Mornings are greeted with good breakfast selections (for $ we paid) & nice cozy gym for workouts! Stayed total of 5 nights. Easy accessibility by foot & safe - nearest subway 4 mins, downtown 6 mins. Near restaurants/convenient stores/bakeries/shopping. Downside - coordination between Front Desk & Housekeeping. Requested from Front Desk 2 softer down pillows & they conveyed message to Housekeeping. After almost an hour of waiting, Housekeeping brought wrong type of pillows! What made things worse was Housekeeping staff spoke to us in a pretty harsh tone, laid blame on Front Desk, when what we wanted was just to get our pillows! Finally after another 20 mins later, we got the pillows we wanted.Other than this minor issue, we thoroughly enjoyed our fuss-free, value for $ stay at this hotel. We will definitely recommend or come back to stay at this hotel when in Manhattan NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My experience with this hotel was greatly enhanced because of the amazing customer service from Tiara. She has exceptional customer service skills and made our check in process absolutely amazing! The rest of the team at the front desk did an incredible job too. We truly loved staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staying on 19th floor, room with a nice view - not bad for NY. Room was modern and well kept, nice size (not the cheapest room in the house mind you). The area is fair enough, just bordering on the worn down harbor area thats being redeveloped. Free breakfast but very limited selection, basic cheap chow. Very cramped eating area. All in all a pretty decent deal - for NY.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Amazing place with spacious rooms and clean cozy and homely atmosphere .....got good variety of continental breakfast and coffee and tea is available around the day .....in coffee shop where you can have meetings also ......so it's a place for everyone .....

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed for two nights recently. The rooms are large, clean and well lit. The bathroom is very modern and good sized. The rooms were quiet and there was no noise from the hallway. The employees were all helpful and courteous. The location is great as it is within blocks of Times Square and the convention center. I'd be happy to stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a very nice hotel, close to Times Square and the Javits Center. The outdoor patios are a great escape from the busy city. The staff was very friendly, helpful and seemed genuinely happy. They greeted us with a smile every time we came in the door.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My Husband and I went on a family vacation to NYC with our 3 kids. The room was big enough to accomodate us. In addition to the two beds, there was a couch as well, and the kitchenette came in handy. The room overall was quiet and comfortable. I had to check in early and the lady at the front desk, Suiry, (sp?) was more than helpful. She made the entire process easy. This hotel has your standard free breakfast, which was fine in our opinion. We had no issue with it. I do wish they provided water throughout the entire day as opposed to mornings and late afternoons. Overall it's easy to get to and close to penn station. Definitely a good place to stay for people traveling with kids.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: So after weeks of searching for the perfect hotel for me my partner and 11 year old daughter on our first visit to New York we decided homewood suites fitted the bill, and we were not disappointed. The room was great huge comfy bed and a kitchenette with everything needed free tea and coffee in the lobby 24hrs and free breakfast which was sufficient enough to see us through till lunch, staff were lovely and housekeeping were fab. All in all would totally recommend staying here and will do so on our next visit :)
user_name:
Tpm2005
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The only thing going for this hotel is the location. Breakfast was repetitive. Towels were not clean all the time. Soap and other toiletries were not always refilled. You do not get much for your money.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites, NYC. Don't do it. Breakfast is cold. TV doesn't work. HVAC system is noisy. Par for the Hilton course. A repeated attempt by the hotel staff to fix the TV and a change of rooms didn't solve the problem. I would stay across the street at the Marriott.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Jonathan and front desk staff went above and beyond to help us. Made us feel important. Maid was helpful. Great stay! Thank you hotel personnel. Could provide food delivery menus. Will be back. Quiet.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We visited the Homewood Suites for my partners 30th birthday in January. We informed the hotel about this a few months prior and requested a balcony room.We arrived at the hotel around 3pm, I thoroughly recommend as a low cost option transfer from JFK to Manhattan that you take the Air Train to Jamaica, then the LIRR to Manhattan. At $14 each return it really is a superb option. The hotel is a few blocks from 34th/Penn Station which makes it an easy walk to the subway and its super close to times square. The room was ready and was exactly the same as what was requested. It was immaculately clean and had all the amenities that you would ever need. We we're extremely impressed with room. We loved the free breakfast in the morning, good selection of yogurts, fruit juices, savories and a hot selection it saved us from having to hunt down breakfast in NYC before a days sightseeing. I did have an issue is that when we booked the hotel we we're promised a managers reception, and this has been the case with other homewood suites we had stayed at previously was suddenly withdrawn which was a major disappointment. This was replaced with cookies and warm milk, which was welcome after the freezing temperatures of NYC but no where near as good as the full managers receptions we had experienced previously. This stopped me giving the property a 5 star.Property is in a quiet sidestreet, never felt unsafe during our stay at the hotel. There is a great pub at the end of the street called the Houndstooth, good happy hour and great food! Apart from that we enjoyed our stay and would return in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff was outstanding. We were always greeted when we walked in and was asked how our day was and if we needed anything. This hotel is a block and half from the start of Time Square. We felt safe and was close to subway access and for the money, it was great. The hotel includes hot breakfast which was very good. Our room also had a full kitchen in it. The room was a bit small, only because we had to use the pull bed and we left it up instead of folding it up every day. The bed was really comfy. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My son (24), daughter (20) and myself have just come back from a 5 night stay at this hotel and found it absolutely perfect for us! The double is a king size, enough space for my daughter and I, my son had a good size sofa bed, both comfortable. It was nice having use of a kitchen with a full size fridge/freezer and microwave. The snacks which were included were replenished everyday, with two young people this was great, crisps, chocolate, sweets, cans of drink, popcorn and bottles of water which we took out with us for the day. The complimentary breakfast was a great addition, you don't have to have it, but we found it a great way to start the day it saved a bit on eating out which is pretty expensive. There was also complimentary coffee, hot drinks in the lobby area, perfect for my son who grabbed a take out coffee to start his day! Everyone we met who worked there we found to be friendly and helpful, check in and out was very quick. This hotel is about a 15min walk into Times Square which we didn't mind, Times Square itself is extremely busy! It was lovely to come back to the hotel at the end of a very busy day, we were on the 10th floor and was very quiet we felt like the only people on the whole floor! Air Con was very efficient in the room the only noise was the fridge but we were too tired to take much notice. The television was easy to use and good to watch with a cup of tea in the morning! We didn't find the lifts a problem which some people have mentioned. I would recommend a stay at this hotel especially with a family as all the little extras help to keep cost down! We found out on our last day that the High Line wasn't too far from the hotel which is well worth a visit, turn left out of the hotel along to 9th avenue about 20mins from there, just check for directions, it takes you to Greenwich Village which we had taken the metro to! Loved our stay and this hotel thank you!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. We booked 2 rooms with king size bed and pull out couch. The room was a little smaller than anticipated but it was very clean and AC worked great. The complementary snacks and drinks were a great surprise and perfect after a long day of sight-seeing. There was no water pressure in the shower. The complementary breakfast was pretty good (if you like turkey bacon and turkey sausage) cant complain since I did not find any other hotels offering free breakfast, there are cereals, breads, bagels and fruit. The location of the hotel was a little further away from times square than expected (4-6 blocks). I bring this up only because I was traveling with my mother who could not walk very far. Also, hotel is located on a one-way street that gets very very busy, I mention this because we used a hired car a lot and some drivers asked us to walk to the next street over to get picked up because the street was so busy. Overall, this is a nice clean hotel and I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I needed a quick decent place to stay for one night while attending an event at the Javits Center that was close to the Port Authority. I never stayed in a Homewood Suites before and I was really impressed.The location is great. Service was great. The front desk manager was welcoming and charming and explained where everything was located. He perfectly encapsulated everything you want from someone greeting you when you enter a hotel. My studio suite was amazing. I don't know if the rooms are new or recently re-done but they are stylish and sparkling. The bathroom is roomy but there is not much counter space to put your stuff. Comfy king bed, wall with big fridge, microwave, stove. They cram a lot into the room but yet it still feels roomy for a city hotel room. There is a free breakfast.
