It is mid-range so there are the standard little nits - blow dryer didn't work right, towels were flimsy and pillows were too small. But really those are small blemishes on what is a great hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for a week on a business trip. I liked it. Clean modern rooms. No carpeting, parquet floors. Great having a microwave and full fridge in the room. Everything was easy - check in and out was quick. Room was available as requested. Good location. A couple of blocks from Times Square. A couple of blocks (in the other direction) from Penn station and shopping on 34th street. I would definitely stay here on my next trip.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel, very conveniently located. Close to Port Authority terminal and close to major attractions. Hotel staff is very courteous and were extremely helpful and supportive. Rooms are nice, decent size and clean. Highly recommend to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Highly recommend this hotel. Close to everything's, price Point is fair and overall cleanliness was way above expected. Plan on staying again for New Years Eve. Staff was great and helpful. A+ experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I highly recommend anyone wishing to experience the Midtown NYC environment, stay at the Homewood Suites, Midtown-Times Square South. The staff, location, and décor is excellent and modernized to provide the feel of an apartment. Can't say enough good things about this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Would definitely return to this hotel again. The staff at the front desk were always friendly. Room included a kitchenette that was stocked with utensils, dinnerware, coffee maker. I really liked our updated room and greatly appreciate the wood laminate floors. I do agree with previous reviews about the limited breakfast but this wood not deter us from returning again. Also enjoyed the 24 hour coffee and tea. Good location. Rooms were very quiet and comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Close to penn station but not that close to Times SquareNew and well appointed No bar Buffet breakfast bur no other foodIf you want a full service hotel This is not a good choiceStayed 2 nights 17 th floor

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall the hotel stay was fine. The staff was very kind, and helpful throughout our three days. However, the breakfast experience was less than pleasant. There were always way now people than the space provided, and ropes were used to help 'funnel' people through in an orderly fashion. The foods was ok, but often there were few places to sit and the amount of children was unpleasant. If you have a large family - then great...this seems to be where everyone is staying. Also, easy walking distance to most all of the tourist areas and/or access to those tours.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel and great location. Easy to walk most places or subway not far away. Rooms a very good size and facilities very good. Staff very helpful. Free tea and coffee all day. Second stay and would stay again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent 5 nights visiting our son. It was 'rearranged' due to the BA computer failure.Although the room was not the one 'with a balcony' originally selected it was very well presented, amenities include a small kitchen, although not really used by us we ate out, it would be ideal for a small family and snacks / drinks were provided. The staff could have been more friendly or helpful. Cooked breakfast poor standard would probably be better if they only offered 'continental' as cold selection fine.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Loved the wood floors of the hotel room. The kitchen appliances were handy to have for a long term stay. Breakfast was included, which was very crowded after 8am, but plentiful. Before 8am, the area was peaceful and comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have been to New York City many times over the last 20 years or so and I have never really been impressed with any of the hotels I have stayed in. Normally now I tend to rent an apartment as you get far more space and you can really relax but for my last trip I was travelling alone and renting an apartment alone can be VERY expensive.So, for all my searching online and comparing sites for the best deal for a solo traveller I found Homewood Suites by Hilton. It was good price considering what would be included - king-size bed, plus sofa bed, a kitchenette, full bathroom with shower unit, work desk, air-conditioning, free Wi-Fi in the room for up to 2 devices, free local phone calls and breakfast. I was staying in NYC for 10 days so I wanted a hotel room that I could be comfortable in, and this sounded like it did the job.I arrived on a Saturday evening and it was very busy in the lobby but I was soon being checked in and went straight to my room - on the 12th Floor at the back of the hotel. The window had no views of the city to speak of, only a block of offices opposite - so keep your blinds down during the weekdays as you never know who might be looking in! However being at the back of the hotel means that you get none of the noise of the traffic coming from 8th Avenue!The room was indeed spacious for my requirements; the king-size bed really was king-size (I've been caught out before with that one). There was a reasonably comfortable sofa bed although it was never used as a bed, just a sofa. The kitchenette was very well designed with a two-ring electric hob, a microwave, full-sized fridge/freezer, dishwasher, small sink and all utensils including cutlery, plates, bowls, glasses, mugs etc. The bathroom was a good size with sink, toilet and large shower cubicle with sliding doors and came with plenty of assorted towels.A large flat-screen TV with remote control was also in the room and standard free WIFI was also available. I was able to make free local calls from the hotel room phone - although I would check with Reception first to see if the number is local before making the call!So far, so good - I was impressed with the overall standard the hotel offered however I do have a few small complaints. Firstly, the fridge/freezer was quite noisy. I'm a light sleeper so that was a problem for me. In the end I had to unplug it for most of my stay, rendering it useless if I wanted to buy food and keep it fresh. Secondly, the water pressure for the shower was rubbish, making it difficult to get clean after applying shampoo etc. The TV reception was also very bad at times and the signal kept getting lost - quite infuriating.Now, did I complain about these issues? No, to be honest I didn't. I didn't believe there was much that could be done with the fridge/freezer or the TV signal and if the shower had become worse I think the only thing they could have done would have been to move me. I think my 'list' of complaints is quite small and fairly irrelevant considering the bed was comfortable, the air-conditioning worked, the WIFI worked and was FREE (although you did have to re-log in every 24 hours but that only takes a minute) and the room was spacious - something that is SO rare in an NYC hotel these days.There is a laundry room and small gym located in the basement - although I did not use these facilities during my stay. As for the FREE breakfast, I did not end up using this as I had to leave the hotel very early every morning - although after reading other peoples reviews about how bad it was, perhaps that was for the best. However, I cannot judge something that I did not try, so I cannot comment further on that.I found the Reception staff very helpful to me and when I requested a late check-out on my day of departure. They gave me one and a half hours extra without charging me; I was therefore able to stay in the room until 1.30pm.The location of the hotel is quite superb. Located on West 37th Street, just off 8th Avenue, it is ideally located for Broadway, Times Square, Penn Station/Madison Square Garden and Macys Department Store. The nearest subways are at Penn Station or 42nd Street - 4 blocks in either direction. There is a good bus service right on the corner of West 37th Street (the M20 which goes up to Lincoln Centre at West 66th Street), but check the timetable first before using it.Overall, I really liked this hotel. I feel it offers more than most hotels in NYC, unless you are prepared to spend large sums of money, which most people aren't. For me whether its a hotel, restaurant, attraction or flight, the question I always ask myself is, would I stay or do that again? If its yes, then it must be good... and this hotel is good!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staying 8 nights at end of May 2017: we re given a premium studio room with a sofa bed at level 10. Overall we re satisfied with our stay at this hotel: great location, great staffs, great facilities! Special thanks to Natalia Ortiz who was always patient to reply my emails and clarify my online booking(s) very quickly prior our arrival. Also to all front desks who were all great, also to Michale, who helped me with my parcels that were sent to the hotel! Some improvements are perhaps for breakfast to have more varieties (hoping to get a regular bacon instead of that turkey bacon, though:) Then cleaning can be improved, some dust over the lamps etc, had been there the whole our 9 days stay:) Big fridge is great but it was really noisy at night. At last, sofa bed was bit too thin for big kids. My son said that his back was a little bit painful after sleeping on that sofa bedWill like to come back again in the future especially if the rate is also competitive!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Have just spent 4 nights in The Homewood Suites on 37th Street must say this hotel was everything we expected so close to all the attractions very clean and all staff very helpful loved to go to the roof terrace in the evening with a bottle of wine and nibbles to relax after a very long but enjoyable day out beds so comfy breakfast very good overall a very good time was had by us and our family Sandra and Phil

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed 6/2/17 to 6/6/17. Staff very friendly and very clean accommodations. The only prob with the room was the TV kept loosing signal. Breakfast I would give 1 and a half star's, out of 5. Food not very good actually ran out of bagels and butter the last day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very good hotel; close to my office. Rooms are spacious, with full kitchenettes. The staff is very friendly. They have one of the nicest hotel gyms I have ever seen. Breakfast is good and the little "store" area has some basic essentials.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My sister and I stayed for one night and enjoyed our room. Our room was very clean, spacious, and modern. I loved our room. With the full kitchen, I felt at home. We had breakfast the next morning and I can't complain. The food was great and I loved the variety. Everyone could find something to eat. The dining area was also very nice. Had plenty of space to find a table. Everyone that we met were very nice and helpful. The hotel was close to everything in Times Square. We were there for BookCon and was close to the Javits Center. Everything was in walking distance which we loved. I will definitely stay here again. Thank you for the great experience! Until next time!
user_name:
JourneyTraveler101
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: As far as rooms go, this Homewood is fine. Rooms are somewhat smaller and most do not have a separate bedroom like most in the chain but they are slightly bigger than a typical Manhattan hotel. Both times I've been here, rooms are quiet, but I stay on upper floors - have heard from other guests that lower floors on the 37th St. side are noisy. Staff is nice and helpful.The problem? 1) Breakfast is just disgusting. I've seen better food from military ration cans. Now I can't say this is JUST this Homewood - the entire chain has gone to inedible garbage, but this one was particularly foul. 2) (and this is what put me over the line) this location has discontinued the evening reception. This is one of the main reasons I choose Homewood or Embassy Suites properties. This is just ridiculous. I don't know if this was a local management decision or a corporate one, but it's unacceptable.So...next time I will stay at another Manhattan hotel. This one is off my list.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have stayed in the Homewood Suites by Hilton in NYC 5 nights with my wife in the begining of May 2017. But 3 days of our stay there was water delivery interruptedto the hotel from 8am to 3pm. It is crazy - it's not like by Hilton but more like service in North Korean Hotel. You can't clean your face, take a shower, clean the teeth or use the toilet in the morning. Terrible. In the reception it was possible to ask for 2 small bottles of water - comfort = 0. And the rest 2 days when watter was not interrupted, it was announced by in-hotel radio at 8am - they waked us up by the announcement from radio in the room in the 8am - horrible. If they have been informed us a few days before our arrival that there is problem with water in the area where hotel is located we could rebook to any other hotel in NYC - maybe to any other Hilton. But when we were there we couldn't do anything.We have chosen that hotel because its location near to Times Square. Location of the hotel is really great - on the 37st street just a few steps from 8th Avenue where you can taste during the day-time the real rush of NYC with shopping, all various fast-foods and then enjoy night. During the night 8th Avenue is really fantastic. You can walk to the real heart of NYC - Times Square - within 5 minutes. Subway station on 8th Ave and 34the street is just around the corner, you can walk to Macy's, Madison Square Garden or take a bus in Penn Station and travel for instance to New Jersey - everything is 5-10 minutes by walk from the hotel. Really great location.I have to appreciate very kind staff of hotel - all staff - receptionist, breakfast staff, room service, upkeepers - everybody were very professional and kind.Our room in the 16th floor was relatively spacious, very nice and modern, perfectly clean and well equiped - TV, table, safe, fitted kitchen with fridge and nice bathroom with shower. I really like the large window and view to the street was also not bad. Good is that you can fully dark the window. I missed any USB charger in teh room so I had to go buy adapter immediately. Air-condition was blowing the cold air directly on our heads in the bed so we had to stop it and open the window with all the noise of NYC. The hotel has 3 elevators but sometimes in rush-hours you need to wait a few minutes for any if you are accomodated in higher floors. But this I don't find out as fundamental problem.We had problem with the TV in our room. The broadcast was not fluent and all channels was every a few seconds interrupted. What bad surprise in such modern hotel.Breakfasts are included what is great. But the choice is very limited and the taste boring. 1st day it was good, but 2nd day the same and 3rd it was better to go for breakfast out. No vegetable. Scrambled eggs - but from dried eggs. Everything is served on paper plates and in plastic cups so it produces unbelievably lot of rubbish every breakfast - the ecology = zero. You can take a coffee in lobby all the day for free but the quality is poor - as well as at breakfast. I recommend to go to Starbucks or Donut Dumpkin which are a few steps from hotel.Overall good location and kind staff. The price seemed to be fair regarding location. But with not running water and some other problems it is not adequate. It was crazy.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a very nice hotel with a very good hot breakfast and a room big enough for a family of five. It was a good value compared to other hotels in the area. It was in the garment district and a five to six block walk to Times Square. We went up five blocks to a play and did not feel unsafe walking back to the hotel after 11:00 at night. If you want a hotel that is close to the action but not right in the middle of it then this is a good choice. We would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We booked a room for five (two double beds and a bed settee) for our family and it was great. The central location in the garment district was great and the staff were lovely. The 22nd floor roof top terrace was a perfect hideaway to enjoy the sun after a day's exploring. The eat-all-you-can breakfast filled up our three girls for a day pounding the streets, the rooms were spotless and well equipped and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. For families travelling on a budget this is just perfect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This 3 year- old hotel is great. Wonderful staff, excellent location, breakfast included. Very comfortable room. We had never stayed in one of this brand before, but if they are all like this one we'll look for them in all our travels. Only suggestion: ask for a room above the second floor as the lobby noise can carry into the room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have stayed at many hotels across the country and several different ones in NYC. This one is one of the best. Clean, accommodating, great location, and the staff is professional and very helpful! The amenities are perfect! A beautiful roof top sitting area is so relaxing as well.
user_name:
Michelle D
South Glens Falls, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: While on a vacation in New York City, the Homewood Suites by Hilton in Manhattan provided our family with 8 days and 7 nights of top of the line quite comfortable and attractive accomodations with reasonable cost. The staff always greeted us with kindness and offers to help us in any way they could including advice on transportation and directions to area attractions . The hotel is conveniently located withing walking distance to Penn Station where we arrived and departed on Amtrack. The hotel is also within walking distance to Times Square and other popular destinations for tourists. The complimentary breakfast is extensive in variety and top quality in taste as well as in service from the staff. I highly recommend this hotel in every way.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very busy hotel, was to be expected. Central, close proximity to theaters.We booked the rate with breakfast which was rather disappointing for us Europeans.Although our room was specious it had a disabled bathroom consisting of seat, railings, etc. taking up all the space making it impossible to take a shower. Why we were allocated a room which was clearly designed to cater for someone with disabilities is beyond us.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I love the rooms, access to a full kitchen, location of the hotel, fitness center, and complimentary breakfast which can be hard to find in the city. We will be staying here in the future. A great experience!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughter and I stayed at this property for 3 nights in May 2017. The location was great, rooms clean and modern and free breakfast every morning. And it was a good breakfast. Staff was helpful and friendly. Great thai place right around the corner. The subway was super easy to get to. Within walking distance to times square, Gershwin Theater where we saw Wicked and it was fabulous! Would def. recommend!!! Def. try Famiglia Pizza. Its within walking distance and sooo good. They even deliver to the hotel!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed here with my sister for two nights. Although we did not spend much time in the hotel, we enjoyed staying here. Location was great. Walking Distance to Times Square and Herald's Square. The rooms (including bathroom) were great and "big" for what you will find in New York. The room comes with a full compact kitchen which would be useful for a longer stay.In addition, we really enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel. Breakfast was included and was satisfactory. I loved the concept of free coffee and tea available at all times downstairs. The flavored water also available added a nice touch. The only negative from this stay was the fact that the water was off from 8am to 3pm for the entire stay we were day. It was an inconvenience as we had to get up earlier and start the day earlier. Coming from a trip to LA, we were exhausted so this was disappointing. However, the staff were VERY accommodating to our needs.Thank you for that.We had to checkout around midday but our flight wasn't until after 9pm. However, we were able to leave our luggage with no trouble and no extra fees. I want to give credit to Michael who arranged a taxi for us to the airport. He was able to combine the trip with a few other guests so we paid less than half the fee to the airport. Since taxis are so expensive, we really saved a lot! The taxi was late and it was a bit stressful at the time, but he did a great job. Thank you!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very expensive but very good location. Overall ok hotel to stay. Get everything what you can get from other hotel. Front road is narrow and very noisy. Had difficulty during sleeping. Kitchenette is just basic. Hard to use it has insufficient utensils.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We thought the location was terrific, being halfway between Penn Station and the Theater District. It meant we could leave our bags and pick them up on the way back from a show and heading to the train. The room was clean and relatively spacious for a Manhattan Hotel, the staff were friendly, and the 24 hour coffe/tea and full breakfast were another plus. We'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We couldn't have asked for a better hotel for our 6 nights. I travelled with my sisters-in-law and we had booked the suite with 2 beds and a pullout sofa bed so that everyone could have their own bed. The challenge in NYC is a hotel with 3 beds for this type of situation....so the hotel room worked perfectly. I volunteered for the sofa bed and it was surprisingly comfortable. We had a kitchen complete with microwave, dishwasher, cook top and a full size fridge. The staff were fantastic and very accommodating. Nothing but positive feedback for the staff. The included breakfast is a great way to start the day. Yes the area for sitting and eating was generally full, however we decided to plan our morning a bit ahead of the peak breakfast time, which seemed to be around 830a-930a and we had no problems getting a spot. Close proximity to all the sights, we loved the location. Short walk to the subway which is never really that far away from any point. A 7-11 is about a half block away on 8th avenue if you are looking to grab some things. We were about a 10min walk to MSG if you are attending an event. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Thank you to the Homewood Suites for a perfect getaway !

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a 6 night stay over here to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were warmly welcomed by Cleopatra who is friendly and polite. She arranged a nice room and thanked me for being a loyal HH member. The rooms are huge and kitchen is also included. It's very convenient and hot can cook in the room as well. Toiletries were of good quality and the hotel uses Neutrogena products. Miss Tiara surprised me with a cup of strawberries and chocolates for my anniversary, a very sweet and thoughtful gesture. The hotel also offers to help you buy groceries and you just need to fill in the list and they will deliver to your room. Nice! They are also very service oriented, offering to correct any issues that your have with the hotel to make it right or offer you a complimentary night stay. Sweet! Breakfast is very crowded but everyone was fast to leave after having their meals. This is one of the hotels that offers 24hours complimentary coffee (including decaf) , tea and hot chocolate. These hot drinks are free flow throughout. Another very great benefit for hotel guests. Awesome! Complimentary copies of USA Today are also placed on the lobby every morning. Cool! Elevators night take a while too especially during peak hours. This property has quite a good location. It's near to times square, 24hr convenience stores, laundry, pizza, mcdonald's and a lot more other places. It's situated on a street that is not rowdy and noisy. I enjoyed my stay tremendously and won't hesitate to come back to Homewood Suites again the next time I'm here. Keep up the great effort and service!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean, easy, comfortable and great staff. Would stay again for the trade show next year. We used the workout room and business center - both great. Loved being able to get coffee/tea in lobby at all times.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very nice rooms. Clean. Staff was very friendly, telling us to have a great day in the morning and welcoming us back in the evening. Management was accessible and always present in the lobby area. Have never been in a hotel in NYC that was this way. Best experience ever. Breakfast was not "continental", it was breakfast. Coffee available 24 hours a day. Free WiFi. Not your typical NYC hotel. Rating by our party is a 10+.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was presently surprised with the size of the suite and the superb quality that this property has to offer. I will be staying here again. I normal drive in , took the train this time. It less than 1 mile walking distance to Grand Central Station.
user_location: New York Time Square SO, United States
user_name:
608ericaf
New York Time Square SO, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Greetings, I just returned from a 6 night stay at this property. This is my second time staying here. This was not a coincidence that I came back again. Lets start off from the beginning. I received a text message the day prior to check in stating that the water to the building would be off during the day because of construction. My first thought was find another hotel. But I was wrong. The staff made every effort to get us through the day. Not a hitch nor inconvenience whatsoever. The staff here is very professional and always friendly. The property is clean and kudos to my housekeeper(room 301) for making our stay perfect. The breakfast is typical but filling. Yes it can get crowded but that was only minor. The property is walking distance to Times Square, and Penn Station. My room was very quiet and never was I interrupted by any outside noise. All and all a top notch stay. I am already looking forward to staying here during my next visit. Thank you hotel staff!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean newly renovated. Nice staff. Breakfast is cheesy I would rather be able to pay then to eat scrambled eggs and frozen waffles and it was closed down by 1030 am. On a Sunday I felt that was early. Coffee and tea always avaiable but I hate the fake creamer so I went to Dunkin down the street. Room was nice. Pillows a little uncomfortable. Overall experience was good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel would have gotten 5 stars from me if their customer service was better. I just checked out today May 23rd, and I accidentally left my wallet in the room. It's the hotel staffs/front desk job to call the housekeeping immediately from walkie talkie and inform them so they can get the item and keep it at the front desk so I can come back to get it in a few, yet I called them several times and they kept transferring me to housekeeping but nobody answered the phone. I called again and one of the guys told me I need to leave them a voicemail. I was like you must be joking, its my freaking wallet with credit card, ID and cash in there. I need someone go up there ASAP, I don't care if that person is a front desk or housekeeping before they check a new guest into that room, that'd create even more complications. I travel frequently and all over the US. And usually if I just checked out and no guest has checked into that room yet and I forgot an item by accident (my shoes for example), all I had to do was told the front desk to make a temporary key for me to go up to my room so I can get it. All the hotels I've stayed at in the past would never had a problem with that, doesn't matter if it's Marriott or Hilton properties because it was still my room and the housekeeping hasn't even cleaned the room yet. But the front desk girl, I don't know her name, she's African American, told me she was not allowed to do that. She did use her walkie talkie to call the housekeeping and they found my wallet. Thank you for that.That was around 4 pm, I hung out in the lobby for little bit then I asked the same front desk lady if she could store the luggage for me because I haven't eaten anything all day and I'm starving, I needed to go to a restaurant nearby because there's no restaurant on site. And she has the audacity to ask me if I'm staying at the hotel another night. I said no, and then she said then we won't be able to store your luggage. I was like are you out of your mind, do you really expect me to drag these two heavy luggages out onto the street and to a restaurant when I'm a guest here and was just staying at the hotel and just checked out barely 2-3 hours ago. That was extremely rude and unprofessional of her on so many levels. I've stayed at plenty of hotels and I swear to Jesus none of the front desk people would said such a nonsense like that to me. This is NYC, my flight won't be til later in the evening, does she really expect me to go shopping around Time Square with a big 28" luggage with me? Haha I swear I was so close to make a scene at the hotel but since I haven't eaten anything I didn't have energy, or else I'd personally ask to speak to the manager already. That was ridiculous. Who does that? The manager at this property seriously needs to train these front desk more, not just this young African American lady and tell them to smile and have more energetic/friendly/helpful attitude. And last but not least, the Internet service here is awful like it's not even funny. My 4G barely works on 12th floor. I love Hilton properties, I've stayed at plenty of Hilton Garden Inn, Homewood Suites, Hampton Inn, etc. But I'll not be returning to this one for sure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Foyer and checkin was quick and easy. Room was comfortable and quite. Breakfast included was ok. Staff were efficient and helpful and very friendly. The roof top was ok, we didn't use it much as all it was was a sitting area, a bar or cafe would have been inviting.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The service at the hotel is excellent, including the front desk staff and housekeeping. The breakfast is okay. There is no evening reception. The refrigerator can get a little noisy at night if you're in a studio suite.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: PROS- Lobby is beautiful- Breakfast is excellent- Room was nice, with fridge and stove- room service did a great job- location in midtown was excellentCONS- Wifi was not too strong in the room and we were on the SECOND floor! Not just my observation but by other family members as well- bathroom was quite small- there was no ledge, shelf, etc in the bathroom to put any clothes, items, etc. thats insane. very poor design-the hook for clothes that SHOULD be outside the shower stall was place WAY OVER by the sink. Seriously? who designed that and thought THAT was a good location for the towel or clothes hook. dumb

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here with a friend, Nice staff and great amenities. Location couldn't be better, just a few blocks from Penn Station, so close to subway lines, and trains. Staff was very nice and helpful. Room contains a refrigerator, small dishwasher, counter, microwave and stove. Room had king sized bed and single sized sofa bed, so good for 2 people. Quiet side of the building overlooked an alley.Definitely recommend

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 8 nights,the hotel is modern and in a great location.The rooms are of a very high quality,clean and really quiet.If you planning a New York trip with hundreds of hotels it's difficult to choose which one,price,location,standard,breakfast etc,this one ticks all the boxes.The rooms have a fridge,cooker,microwave and utensils.If I do NY again I will definitely go to the Homewood suites again.Just down from the hotel is lovely little Italian takeaway (non solo piada) sandwich/wraps shop freshly made and great coffee.
user_name:
Michael K
El Prat de Llobregat, Spain

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spacious, comfortable & bright NYC hotel. Location is central to all attractions and transportation. The hot breakfast has something for everyone to start the day before exploring the city. The fitness center allows you to maintain your regular workout routine. The staff is very helpful and pleasant.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Extremely pleased. The staff were gracious and cared about the guests experience. Cleopatia Brown and Idris at the front desk were phenomenal. The breakfast staff were great, specifically, JC Suazo, Juan, and Miguel. GREAT JOB!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Friendly, professional staff. Excellent location near Penn Station and subways. Clean room with coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave and stove top. Large room for Manhattan. Good restaurants nearby. Overall a very nice hotel.
user_name:
John W
Albany, NY, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had stayed in this hotel around 2 years back and loved it. This time I stayed from around 15-20th of the month and was not impressed at all. To start with, there was no water in the hotel after 8 am till the evening. I get it, this wasn't due to some civil work being done but at least they could have informed me about it prior to my booking. The person at the reception said that they had sent texts out but we never received a text and apparently neither did many of the other guests. This was by far the most annoying thing since we had to get up really early and couldn't sleep properly. Also, which hotel does not have water tankers to keep a stock of basic running water in the sink and toilets for these kind of issues?Coming to the service, it was just about average. The housekeeping did not clean the room well. On one occasion they forgot to empty the trash bin in the room. Also, they never put garbage bags in the trash cans and then didn't wash the bin well resulting in a mildly foul smell. Furthermore, they forgot to replace the soap in the bathroom a few times and we had to tell them again.The room did not have a laundry bag which they had last time. I went to the lobby to ask for one and they said they were out of those and instead gave me flimsy plastic bags which couldnt hold the clothes and kept tearing so we had to carry laundry around in our backpack.The hot water in the lobby for tea/cocoa was often lukewarm and thus not fit for purpose. Several times I just had to take the tea bag and then heat the water in the room. The spread of the breakfast also has been drastically reduced and is quite repetitive. Sorry if this seemed like a rant, aside from these issues the rooms are still good and decent in size and the staff is polite. On the bright side, they used to keep orange and cucumber water by the lobby which made for a good refreshment after those crowded walks in Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We booked this hotel for a birthday weekend to NYC. It was easy to walk from Penn Station, just about three blocks. Check-in was smooth and we were informed of city waterworks that were going to happen Saturday morning. The water would be shut off from 8am and could be for most of the day. We were given bottles of water and more water when we asked for some later the next day. It didn't bother us too much because we were out by the shut off time. Even with this unforeseen hiccup, our stay was great. We had a room on the 19th floor and had a great view of Garment District buildings. Lobby was busy at all times, but clean and modern with coffee available 24/7. Three elevators up to the rooms, which can be slowish at peak times (like when breakfast is served). There is a small rooftop patio on floor 22 (just seating, no bar or food served up there) and a gym in the basement. No pool. The room was a great size for two adults and a 6yr old. King sized bed, a full sized sofa/sofa bed, good sized fridge and full freezer, microwave, two ring stove, dishes for four, a toaster, small coffee pot, desk with a slide out table to eat on, roomy shower stall and bathroom. Really surprised by the generous size of the room, even when the sofa bed was out for the night there was still room to get around to the fridge. The room was also quite by NYC standards, helped by the hotel being off a main street and surrounded by offices/businesses that operate M-F. We cooked for ourselves, taking a Lyft to Whole Foods to buy groceries. I can't vouch for the places nearby to the hotel to eat, but for quick snacks and drinks there is a 7-11 on the corner. Restaurants and fast food galore are near the hotel if you are inclined to eat out. Breakfast is served, included with your stay, with the usual hotel breakfast foods (toast, breakfast meat, eggs, oatmeal, cold cereal, yogurt, fruit, coffee/tea, and juice). The breakfast area was swarming with people, but there was plenty of food. If your are interested in tourist trips or shows, there is a concierge at the hotel who can help with bookings, as well as all the open top bus tour people hawking tickets on 8th Avenue. Subway stops are also nearby, but we mainly walked or used Lyft. We will definitely be back at this hotel in the future. Family-friendly, clean, quiet, modern. :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a nice Homewood Suites. Rooms are nice new and clean. Free full breakfast is great and the sitting area outside is a special touch. Close to Time Square. Rates are a little less than TS hotels. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood in Manhattan informed me prior to arrival that the City was shutting off water daily from 8 to 3pm and that residents needed to prepare. Although I spent most of this time outside the hotel anyway, it was great to be pre-informed. The staff was excellent. The property is in great shape as well

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was large and modern. Having a couch and kitchen was awesome. This is the most quiet room I have ever had in Manhattan. I had a room on the back of the hotel. Not a great view but no horns, sirens, or garbage trucks beeping at 4AM. You can walk to the action at Times Square and then walk back to the quiet of the hotel. An included breakfast and afternoon cookies in the lobby were icing on the cake.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Central, clean, good free breakfast, friendly and helpful staff, would visit again and recommend to others. Tea coffee 24/7 cookies in the afternoon. Lovely rooftop terrace. Unfortunately we were subjected to water restrictions due to external maintenance which really affected us as it meant getting up by 7am to have a shower which you don't want to do when you are on holiday. I understand that the hotel were not to blame, however we should have been notified of this prior to arrival.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I recently spent a weekend in NYC with my husband and 5-year-old daughter who came into town to hang with me while I was working. While I was unfortunately alerted by the hotel a few days before our stay that there wouldn't be water from 8-3 for a few days during our stay (due to the city doing water maintenance), they did everything to make it right. Check-in online was a breeze and when we arrived the first thing the front desk staff did was acknowledge the inconvenience and supply us with several bottles of water. The water issues caused housekeeping to delay their room-cleaning efforts so when we got back to our room around 5 p.m. one day and saw them still cleaning, they were very apologetic. No issue for us as we understood what they were dealing with earlier when having no water. A couple hours later, we received a knock at the door with an apology and a bag of goodies, including additional Hilton Honors points. So unexpected yet so very appreciated! One last thing: I mistakenly left a coat and shirt in my room. Upon reaching out to the hotel to see if they found it, they said they did and shipped it right to my home. The entire staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a comfortable stay, despite things that were out of their control. They were kind and generous. Our room was clean and very spacious considering we were in NYC. We definitely will stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a great hotel! The room was very clean and the staff very kind and accommodating. We arrived rather tired after taking a red eye flight to New York City. We arrived around 7:30 or 8:00 in the morning, asked if it would be too early to check in (we weren't officially supposed to check in until 4pm), and they were able to find a room for us. The day we left, they took care of our bags until we had to head out to catch our flight. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: very good location near Times Square. good free breakfast but not enough place to seat....big and confortable bed, good sice room, very good refrigerator.. very good and clean. shower...Nice and informative staff

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great hotel! Centrally located. Very clean, appeared to be new or newly renovated. Wonderful hot breakfast. Free wi-fi Walking distance to Time Square. Great restaraunts near by. There's a subway stop very close by.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Although it had some problems the location was excellent and I really liked the room. I have never been to a hotel in NYC and they did not park your car. Lastly, how can you turn off water to the hotel first thing Monday morning......

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were in NYC for 4 days and stayed at the Homewood Suites in Midtown Manhatten near Times Square. Would highly recommend Homewood Suites as a place to stay in NYC. Did a lot of walking and this location was well within walking distance to many local attractions. The lodging more than met expectations. The room was clean, neat and quiet. The bed was comfortable and the amenities were solid. My only disappointment was the bathtub which did not have a functioning drain stopper for taking a bath (or soaking tired feet from miles of walking). Homewood suites provided hot, cooked breakfast every morning and the food was good. Hot coffee was available 24/7. The desk staff were very helpful in providing information and transportation as requested. The only thing missing at Homewood Suites was a bar. There was a rooftop patio that was very inviting and would have been a good place to relax at the end of the day. I guess we could have had the hotel 'shop' for us if we really wanted a bottle of wine. All told, i would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel staff was great, and very informative, esp like to call out Omy. Free breakfast was good, was surprised that they did not offer the 'evening social' option as other Homewood Suites. This hotel was in a good location - 15 mins walking to Times Square and the Empire State Building. 30 mins walking to Central Park. When we arrived was notified that there was service on the street and water was turned off from 8am to 3pm for 6 days - the 1st day they provided extra water bottles, but none of the rest of the days.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We chose this hotel for its central location. We flew into Newark, took the train to Penn Central, walked around the corner, and we were there. It's close to subways, Time Square and other spots. We had three generations on a sightseeing trip. The hotel was clean, and the staff was excellent.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Customer service was horrible. They didn't resolve our issues. Water was not workin. They gave us bottles of water and told us there was nothing they could do. We waited 2hrs for towels. People on our floor were extremely loud.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights in April. Very close to NY Penn Station and Times Square venues. Looks like recent renovation, surrounded by businesses. Check in fast and efficient. Room not ready, so we left our bags and the hotel texted us when ready. About 30 min ahead of normal check in time. Hotel down a side street off 8th Ave, so was quiet at night. First floor was lobby, and dining area, which after breakfast is mostly closed to access. Except for a high top table by the door, some seating/table around a fire place and a few small tables, not much of a lobby. We had a two full-size bed studio. Advertised as queen beds, but definitely full size - even called the front desk and was told this was a Hilton standard, either two full-size "queen" beds or one king bed. By Manhattan standards, room was huge. Had a fold out twin sofa bed, plus full kitchen (electric stovetop, microwave, fridge/freezer and sink - plenty of dishes/glasses and kitchenware to reheat leftovers/etc. Bathroom was small, no countertop to speak off, to place cosmetics, glasses, toothbrush or even the supplied hair dryer. Only closet in bathroom, with a safe. No cabinets. Just three drawers on a desk unit. But spacious to put luggage along wall. Bathroom, except for being small, was fine. Very hot shower. Ceiling fan in bedroom was nice touch. Kept air circulating. AC/heater was a bit noisy at night, and thermostat not very accurate or sensitive, as I got up during the night to adjust the temperature - too cold or too hot.Three elevators, but were extremely slow. Avoid a high floor in case you want to walk down stairs. We ended up walking often, as the elevator is used by staff as well.Breakfast was typical, okay if you are in a hurry, and need some food to get started, but all precooked packaged items, scrambled eggs, sausage, french toast, waffles, juices, bagels, oatmeal, fruit. Coffee was bad, but plentiful. Seating gets taken fast, so if you come late, expect to be split up as a group, or take food back to your room. Plenty of restaurants, coffee shops nearby, so save the calories for something worth it.Location, location, location. Across the street was a Courtyard by Marriott property. Expensive though, $300+ a night. Will stay here again, due to the location to Penn Station and Times Square venues.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The front desk staff, Tiara and her coworkers, were welcoming and helpful when we arrived early, several hours before check in time. Then the city shut off the water to our block, and the staff went the extra mile to accommodate the guests, providing bottled water, as much warning as possible of the shut down, and written instructions on what to do to minimize our inconvenience during the shut down.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I live in Manhattan and opted to stay here for 2 nights while my apartment was being renovated. I chose this hotel for its high rating and location close to my office--and, frankly, because it had a room with a kitchenette available on short notice. I was floored when I walked in to see a FULL kitchen and enormous private patio (that I was not aware of nor paid extra for on booking)!!! Everything about the space was modern and obviously newly updated. Downstairs, there was a 24-hour coffee bar that even stocked my favorite creamers, plus various lounges and a dining room with complimentary full breakfast. The gym was roomy, clean and well-appointed. I passed a 24-hour laundry room on my way to the gym, as well as a quiet "business center" -- basically a room with several nice desktop computers for guest use. There was also a beautiful rooftop terrace that I definitely would have taken advantage of in warmer weather. Overall, the thing I kept coming back to was the private, grassy patio with a table and chairs--really unheard of in NYC. I didn't want to come home!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Was happy with this hotel, nice big bed and comfortable. Gym facilities also good. Breakfast nice although I was alone and I left my plate on the table and when I came back someone had taken my seat so I had nowhere to finish my breakfast and had to take it upstairs! Good overall, well located, clean and nice.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at this location before and will again. Everyone is helpful and friendly (always greeted with a hello and smile)! Breakfast very good and cleaning services were exceptional! Parking discount available and right across the street!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This property was excellent from beginning to end. It provides complimentary breakfast, a nice sized gym with plenty of space, evening sweet snacks, and the rooms are modern and updated. The rooms have a small kitchen with a full size refrigerator. Indeed it was a wonderful property away from home but felt like you were at home. First property I've stayed in NYC that allowed you the convenience to stay in and cook. Just everything seems wonderful. No complaints and they provided complimentary internet which worked best in the lobby but was available in the room too but experienced it was slower. Highly recommend this property. The staff were all friendly and very helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at the home wood suites for 5 nights in February 2 adults and 3 teenagers. Couldn't fault it. Friendly staff, lovely breakfast, clean hotel, really central location.We were in walking distance to Times Square and about a 15 minute walk to Central Park. Would definitely recommend it

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for a week over Easter. Our room was spacious, clean and well equipped. Breakfast was a bonus and everything was superb including all the friendly staff. Thanks to Juan, Juan Carlos and Miguel who were outstanding in their service and politeness as were everybody else. Also we'd like to thank the cleaning and maintenance staff plus the reception guys for being so welcoming and always with a smile.Highly recommended and with a great location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We've stayed in Homewood Suites in FL so were familiar with the chain but were pleasantly surprised by the high-end look and feel of this NYC location. Very contemporary and comfortable. Great vibe in the lobby; awesome fitness area; lovely rooftop terrace; fantastic location. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a newish, clean, pleasant hotel in the Garment District wit a pleasant staff and decent amenities. Manhattan hotel rates are crazy high, but I'd stay there again relative to the alternatives. Ask, if you care, for a room with a view; mine was very pleasant.
user_name:
Kim T
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel within easy walk to Times square and train station, very convenient right in the middle of the city. Great, clean, modern room with a good breakfast. Check in and check out was very efficient and friendly.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful place to stay in New York City - close enough to walk to many places and the hotel room was a quiet oasis to come 'home' to. Kitchen facilities are very good for someone with food allergies.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We are pleased we chose Homewood Suites for our New York visit. Our family stayed in a room with 2 Queens and a Sofabed for 5 nights - it provided the space we needed for travelling with 2 teenagers. The room was very clean as was the overall property. Also we were surprised how quiet it was considering we were in NYC and on the 6th floor - we all slept well. In terms of location, it was an easy walk to places like Times Square, Empire State Building, Macy's, etc and the Subway for everything else. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent property very close to Penn Station. Tiara and Jonathan at tge front desk were very efficient and friendly. Comfortable bed and very clean property. The room was quiet and roomy for NYC...Close to Times Square and all the shopping, restaurants and bars you could imagine. An excellent find if you are seeking a nice Midtown Manhattan property. Free breakfast was an added bonus and tasty with plenty of options.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel lives up to all the fantastic reviews and is a 5 star! However, due to NYC construction, there is NO WATER May 3-6 during daily business hours. Not the hotel's fault-they are providing bottled water. We have to work showers and bathrooming around the outage hours. If you are sight seeing during the day, it shouldn't be too much of a hassle. Also, they have Dish TV, which frequently loses the signal.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were celebrating Two of our daughters birthdays. Hotel staff was outstanding. Since we had theatre tickets, we needed to check in early and the front desk staff accommodated us. They were excellent.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Based on my previous experience in Dec 2016 at this Hotel I enjoyed this Hotel during my last stay in April 2017. Well equipped and functional hotel facilities close to the theatre district. Spacious room with Kitchen, king size bed, modern bath room and good view. Needed to get upgraded from 7th to 14th floor with a bit of effort but gentle reaction to my request. Will book this hotel for my next biz trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a lucky find! Suite has a complete kitchen with an almost real sized fridge, two burner stove, micro, etc. Room is on the small side, but typical for NY and very efficiently laid out. Gorgeous bathroom, looks new. Everything you need is here - laundry, gym, business center. Felt like an incredible bargain - very reasonable price for NY. I've found a new home base in midtown!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This place was fantastic! Unbeatable price, great location and most importantly for this light sleeper, my room was quiet. Having stayed in several hotels throughout the city, I know where I'll be staying during my next visit.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel which extends to its suites. The staff are very well presented & professional. I've stayed here for seven days & have had great experiences with all the staff. From the front desk right through to the kitchen & cleaning staff. They are all so friendly & work hard to provide above average service to the guests. This is my first time in New York & the front desk staff have helped me so much with advice & directions. A special shout out to Junior, Thomas & Mike. Thank you all so much for giving me such a memorable stay. Highly recommend staying here for families & singles.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This facility is incredibly well maintained and boasts a plethora of amenities for its guests. Located near Times Square, but on a quieter block, this property is in close proximity to several train lines and transit centers - including walking distance to Port Authority Bus Terminal. You also find yourself within walking distance of an incredible number of restaurants, bars, and entertainment venues. I would highly recommend Southern Comfort for dinner and drinks.The staff at this location are great - professional, courteous, and always smiling. Upon arrival, I was informed my room wasn't quite ready yet (I arrived right at 4:00PM, which is check in time). Front desk staff contacted housekeeping who went right to the room for inspection and had the room ready within ten minutes. This was not an inconvenience at all; I waited in the lobby, enjoyed a complimentary cookie and glass of milk and read the complimentary USA Today with a cup of complimentary coffee from the 24/7 coffee bar. They also have a grab n go snack bar near the front desk if you prefer iced coffee or would like a late night snack.When I did finish my check in process, I found the elevator button in the lobby to stick a bit but was immediately assisted by a staff member. I was upgraded to a balcony room and it was excellent! The bathrooms were incredibly clean and modern. The room was spotless and I enjoyed the option of in room movie ordering. Unfortunately, I slept through the all you can eat breakfast, but it is nice to know it is available. Overall, the property, amenities, and staff were all great at this location and I would definitely consider staying again!
user_name:
Benjamin S
Penn Yan, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a nice family friendly hotel in a good location and was great value for money.Breakfast was very busy and sometimes hard to get a table but otherwise ok with reasonable choices. Tea, coffee and hot chocolate was always available which was great in the cold weather and they even put out freshly baked cookies every afternoon which the kids loved. The location was a short stroll to everything (Broadway, Times Square, subway stations etc) and we felt safe walking at night. There was a 711 around the corner, larger Walgreens 5 min walk away and plenty of restaurants and shops nearby.The room was a little tight with 5 of us in it but it's one of the few hotels in the area that fits 5 people with 2 queens and a single sofa bed. The sofa bed was soft and not very comfortable and the bathroom was a little small with no bench top space for toiletries. The small kitchenette with a dishwasher, stove, sink and full size fridge was very handy.Fast, free Wifi and the staff were very friendly so I would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel close to all sights in New York. Check in wasn't till 4pm and that's the only negative thing there is about this hotel. After unable to book our 1st choice hotel we decided to stay here , I'm so pleased we did!! Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. 24 hour complimentary hot drinks and cookies in reception area. Room we paid for had a kitchenette and a living space which made it so airy and spacious. Free wifi in rooms. Complimentary shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. Fridge and hob with complimentary tea and coffee etc. Very modern rooms. Beds so comfy. Breakfast was included and had a large range of hot and cold breakfast options. Close enough to all attractions of the city.would definately rebook this little gem of a hotel!!! Can't understand why it was only stated as a 3 star when we booked with Expedia.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel accommodated us in every way. Perfect location, perfect property and wonderful staff. Will be our new "go to" property when visiting Manhattan. Right in the middle of everything without the crowds.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'd highly recommend this hotel when visiting NYC. It's a great location, the staff is very friendly, and the hotel is clean and modern. We had all the amenities we needed: internet, kitchen, free breakfast, workout room, small on-site convenience store. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We received texts daily asking us if there was anything we needed, etc. Extremely quiet considering we were in the heart of NYC. We could hear no traffic and slept like logs. Great experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Really liked everything about this hotel! Our room was good sized especially compared to other NYC hotel rooms The hotel is very clean and in great shape. The quality of the breakfast food was average but there were plenty of options. Breakfast was included so we certainly can't complain! We will stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a convenient location being only a 15 minute walk to either the Empire State Building area and Times Square. It's a hike to get to Central Park or for sure a bus or train ride to lower Manhattan. As for being up to Homewood Suites standards, the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. They are not big rooms by any stretch of the imagination. TV had a large scratch on the front (Rm 1401). Breakfast was very repetitive though and rather lacking for a Homewood Suites. Had no variety at all over 4 days...just alternated the eggs back and forth, and the other item was the same except one day. Lacking in muffins and bagel options with only mini apple strudels 4 days in a row and plain mini-bagels daily. French toast and waffles in steamer tray were not fresh tasting. No waffle maker. No Robust version of coffee and only sweetened creamer options. No plain half and half. Also...no manager's reception whatsoever on the weekdays like EVERY OTHER HOMEWOOD SUITES EVERYWHERE. This caps it off as to not returning. For what they charge, it should be included. Lastly, elevators took forever and even on 2 of 4 days were one elevator down at times. Programming seems off...wait forever while an elevator sits motionless several floors above or below and others dart around and often skip the floor while the other one doesn't move. Was not during housekeeping hours either. Parking...well, it's independent and $45/day....and just 1/2 block past the hotel entry...where there is no drop-off space. Expect to walk with your luggage in-hand. Just beware that on 2 evenings, if you go to pay to get out, there was a chicken-scrawled note that the credit card machine was "down" mysteriously so you'll have to pony up cash or find an ATM. Seems to me that's just too odd this happens only during evenings...is the parking staff skimming? Hmmm....not sure...but just something to note. I did try to contact the hotel several times to get parking info ahead and it was inconsistent on the info I got. Given the above, I will stay elsewhere next time. This is not up to Homewood Suites standards.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location of this hotel is unbeatable. You can easily walk to Times Square, Broadway shows, Penn Station, Grand Central Station and catch the subway to other parts of town close by. This hotel is located on a side street so the traffic noise is minimal- in our room it was actually nonexistent as we faced another building on the side and didn't face the street. The breakfast that is included is a big plus for a hotel in the city. Also, complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate, cookies, and fruit are available around the clock. The fitness center was large by NYC standards. The rooms are comfortable and have a refrigerator, stove and microwave for your use. The staff was friendly and Tiara was a bright face and friendly at check-in and check-out. She was very helpful with questions we had. I would highly recommend the Homewood Suites Manhattan Times Square and will use it as my base the next time I travel to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed one night here with my daughter and a good friend. Our visit was terrific from checkin to checkout! The front desk was friendly, helpful and accommodating. Our room was spacious, clean and had everything we needed for an even lengthier stay. The complimentary coffee service in the lobby was a lifesaver both mornings and evenings for me! In addition, the complimentary breakfast was a great start to the day with everything from waffles to oatmeal to fresh fruit and pastries. They even accommodated my friends allergy needs. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Three of us spent the Easter weekend in NYC. In the past we have stayed closer to Herald Square, but needed room for three and this was a good compromise. Having now stayed here, I would definitely book it again. Location is close to everything midtown, the breakfast was always generous and being restocked constantly. Lots of seating. Cookies and coffee after a day of walking was a treat. Staff at this location were incredibly friendly and helpful (not the case other places we have stayed). They made guests feel welcome, kept things at the desk moving, and were helpful with taxi booking and luggage storage. The rooftop patio was a great bonus to enjoy the spring weather. The room was spacious enough with all the amenities (fridge, dishwasher, microwave, safe, hair dryer) and even a window that opened although we did not have a view. Wifi was fast and reliable. Can see the Empire State Building from the patio. Elevators seemed fast and efficient. Really no complaints at all!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: outstanding hotel. great location. employees who care. professional attitudes. a rare find in NYC. felt safe for our entire visit. room was superb. especially liked the flooring with no carpets. comfortable mattress. great climate control.
user_name:
John E
Jasper, GA, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Really surprised to find such large rooms and if in the deluxe rooms, daily snacks and drinks provided. A super hotel for families, own kitchen area and better that expected breakfasts. Tea and coffee always available in the foyer, but milk needed for the English tea drinkers not the coffee mate liquid! Friendly helpful and efficient front of house team. Nice roof terrace, central but not too noisy location.
user_name:
Paula C
London, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staff was friendly and the complementary breakfast is a nice addition. It is a great location: not too far from TIME SQUARE and not too close that the big tourist crowds will make it an inconvenience. It is very close to Penn Station if one is to take Amtrak.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Room was very clean. I enjoyed the wood floors vs carpet, never feel carpet is clean. The kitchenette appliances were more than I expected although we wound up not using them, it was nice to have them in the room-range top, microwave, dishwasher and especially refrigerator. I thought the room was smaller than internet pictures indicated but location was perfect. Always very quiet, didn't hear noises outside the room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good location and facilities. Very clean and spacious suites (by NY standards) for our family of four. Breakfast times were was a little chaotic but it was worth it for the complimentary meal which was a real saving for us.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is an excellent choice for visiting New York. It is close to Time Square! You can enjoy walking around street without stress and enjoy free breakfast. Really wonderful experiences for our family!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here during a trip in December and really enjoyed this hotel. We stayed in a standard King Suite and it had great space (for a NYC hotel room)! We enjoyed the refrigerator and microwave to hold bottled water and leftover food. The room stayed surprisingly quiet and we were very pleased. The breakfast selection was fair, but always well stocked and plenty of options. We enjoyed the coffee, tea, and hot cocoa in the lobby, especially after coming in from spending the day in the cold. The front desk staff was friendly and helped ensure our room was ready for early check-in, which was appreciated.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a great place to stay. It was 5 blocks from Times Square with a great tiny Italian place next door. Warm cookies in the afternoon and free internet access were both great perks. Breakfast is included, while it was not as good as some others, it still offered a decent variety. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We got this hotel as a place to spend the night after a broadway show. Considering the price this hotel was great. It was very clean and nice room, the full breakfast was a plus. Our receptionist, Tiara, was very helpful especially since we came to the hotel before we could check in but she let us check in earlier with no extra charge.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good location between stations on 34/8 and 42/8. Easy to walk to Empire State and Rockerfeller and subway/trains for further afield Room 2112, no real view, but good daylight in morning, Sofa bed lumpy and not suitable for adults.Noisy AC, but no external noises, so generally a good nights sleep.Breakfast variable in range and can be very busy, although we managed to find space for 3 without waiting too long. Expensive, liked the idea of having a kitchen area though grocery shopping limited in this area, so would try something different next time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I first reviewed this hotel about a year ago and I gave it a higher rating then. This time the rating is lower and I'll tell you why I came to that conclusion. Like many people, I show up early to a hotel hoping that they give us a room where we can freshen up and then go and enjoy our day. They were accommodating last time, but I got a room that faced the interior alley and office building; however, I was just thankful then. This time I arrived early, but since no room available we did not come back until 9 pm. Instead of having a room for me based on my original arrival time it appears that I received the last room - another interior facing room. The Sunday EVENING staff (lady) was abrupt telling me there were no other rooms when I called down. I texted the hotel the next morning. They apologized and asked what they could do, but what could they do at that point? It was too late. They said that I should have asked for a particular kind of room when I arrived in the morning, but I just thought that would be common sense. I know better now for this hotel. I will keep it in mind when I come back to NYC later this year. This particular stay has impressed on me how important it is to get a room with a view. Thanks for that lesson, Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We are Hilton Loyalists, so staying at one of their brand on our regular visits to NYC is an easy choice. On this occasion, the Homewood Suites had the price and location that suited us best. The location is excellent, especially for those of us arriving by bus at Penn Station. Rooms are very nicely furnished and a decent size for NYC. Staff were (with one exception) friendly and helpful, and we availed ourselves of the free coffee and cookies that are a Hilton trademark. Only disappointment? - we stay a lot at Hampton Inns and really appreciate their free breakfast bar. This hotel tried it's best to match their sister properties, but the available eating area was desperately overcrowded, and they ran out of several staple items quickly. Still a minor inconvenience in anotherwise good stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed here with my family for 3 nights and we had a wonderful stay! Room was spacious and clean, breakfast was amazing in both food options and staff, and the later afternoon cookies and milk were a treat that my children loved. Will definitely stay again the next time we visit NY.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everything was beyond our expections at this gem of a hotel: clean, modern room in hotel that is only 2 years old; exceptional staff who really cared that we were happy staying there and a huge, fresh and absolutely delicious breakfast buffet every day. Even had warm cookies in the lobby in the afternoons & free coffee & tea. Plus great prices. Beyond a 10! This hotel is one of the best-managed we have ever seen.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We chose this hotel so we could walk home from the theater after a show, and this was a great choice! It's a recently updated hotel, so the room was clean and spacious (for a New York City hotel), and the furnishings all seemed new. The employees at the front desk and in the breakfast room were all very nice and professional. Most interesting was how quiet this hotel was. In our room we never heard any street noise, nor did we hear any noise from the hallway. I'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I never knew how much I would love such a random hotel find, especially in NYC. I had to unexpectedly book accommodations at the last minute, and Homewood Suites came in with the best value in the right location. I had some groceries and bottled water delivered ahead of my arrival, and the front desk had them ready for me when I checked in. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Since I was traveling solo, I felt safe at the property. I loved the rooms were carpetless; it felt clean and modern!
