The beds were very comfortable, and I loved having a kitchenette to help me stay on budget. I definitely will be staying here again when I'm in NYC again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'll rather stay at the upper west side In Nyc but we got a great value with great breakfast in the garment district. The hotel is in great condition with a very good staff. The elevators were fast and even cookies near reception was a nice treat.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There are a lot of over-priced and mediocre hotels in New York City, and this is NOT one of the,., It was clean and fresh, with a very pleasant staff. It was a good value for NYC. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were lucky enough to spend two nights in this hotel for Spring Break. From the moment we walked in we were welcomed with friendly and efficient service. We were very early so they held our bags for us(free of charge) while we went exploring in the city. Our room was clean and well appointed as well as being huge by NYC standards. The bed was comfortable and the room itself was very quiet both from inside and outside noise. No view but we didn't pay for a view, nor do I sit in my room and look out the window when I am in NYC! The free breakfast was really good, other than the kids digging in things with their bare hands. That isn't the hotel's fault, that is a major parenting fail. GROSS! Had a nice conversation one morning with the gentleman who was working the breakfast area. Everyone was so friendly here. I have to say you get what you give though. I smile and speak politely to service people and consequently I generally get the same in return. I see so many people who are very rude or inconsiderate to service people for no reason. They are just people trying to do their jobs too. We will 100% return to this hotel if we are lucky enough to return to NYC. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Possibly the most comfortable sleeper sofa in the world! Amazing. Rooms are tight but well designed. Location is perfect. Shower has excellent water pressure and the shower head actually works as designed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: As a family of 5 we enjoyed staying at this hotel.The room size was very good and the staff were very friendly and professional.Breakfast was great and the free tea, coffee, hot chocolate and cookies were an added bonus!The hotel is close to Penn station and is also close to all the attractions (Times Square, empties State building etc)Would I come back? Yes!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: EXCELLENT value for money. Much larger rooms than similar NYC hotels. Spacious gym - not a closet! Equipment includes ellipticals, bikes, treadmills, medicine balls, fitness balls, mats, stretching machine, free weights and an apparatus with pulleys where you can perform multiple exercises (don't know what it's called). Decent variety of breakfast foods. Friendly service. Convenient to everything and a 15 minute walk to the High Line.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Loved this hotel. Found it as an online deal at LateRooms.com following a disaster at another hotel and so we checked in well after midnight. We were given a large suite which worked out at £158 (including breakfast and taxes) which was just perfect after all the earlier stress. Whole hotel had a contemporary feel to it and very much reminded me of staying in a posh Barcelona hotel. Room was exceptionally clean and fresh. Nice big bathroom and room was very quiet. There were bars and restaurants all around as we were at that point gagging for a drink! Breakfast was buffet style and really nice. It's a 5/10 min walk to Penn station. Would 100% recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Lovely clean stylish hotel for great value in the heart of the garment district. Near 34 street subway and local restaurants. Quiet and stylish. Enjoy the feeling of a boutique style hotel for less. I enjoyed my stay here very much.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Conveniently located in Mid-Town- this swanky hotel is close to everything! The service was great, the parking is VERY convenient (Garage- 200ft away). The rooms were neat, clean and quiet. The breakfast was not what we expected, however. The eggs were (powdered) sausage patties were cold and the other "warm" items were cold as well...Awesome rooms, Awesome service, Awesome location, not so much on the breakfast, however. This won't keep us from coming back- we love it there!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel is on 37th street junction with 8th Avenue. This is in New York;s fashion district and is within a few minutes walk of Time Square or Empire State building. Like most well located city centre hotels staying here is quite expensive, but I would say by New York standards reasonable value.Check-in was efficient. Our 10th floor room, although not as spacious as other Homewood Suites we have stayed in, was perfectly adequate with the available space cleverly used. Everything was clean and comfortable and the room was freshly made up on each day of our three day stay.The room had a large TV, good wi-fi, bathroom with shower. There was a kitchen area built into the room with a two burner stove, combination microwave oven, dishwasher, fridge with small freezer and a few pans. Although we had originally planned to cook our own evening meals we ended up buying food from a nearby deli and warming it in the microwave.In the basement of the hotel there is a fitness suite and a guest laundry with washers $2.50 and dryers again $2.50. There is a small store in the lobby which sells washing powder.In the lobby coffee is available (I guess 24/7) and mid afternoon cookies appear. Unlike some Homewood Suites there is no evening reception. Breakfast served from 600 to 10 30 was OK with a choice of hot or cold food.A bonus on a fine day is the rooftop terrace on 22nd floor.There are three elevators serving the needs of both guests and staff so at busy times there can be a sort wit until a lift arrives at your floor.In summary a very convenient place to stay when visiting New York City. It offers a good compromise between the budget and luxury ends of the market. I'll probably choose to stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location to Times Sq. And subway...very courteous helpful staff...fast internet service...outlets everywhere...even provided takeout containers for breakfast even when my kids were sleeping...have a small snack corner n has a grocery delivery service as long as you submit before 12 noon (didn't use)... very clean n modern remodel...but because you are in NYC...expect your view to be to someone else's apt or the Main Street...overall, great stay

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location is amazing, room is great- especially for manhattan, breakfast is decent...The only thing that is a bit disturbing is the bad mobile phone reception in the room, and as free internet they provide is so so... its a trouble.Besides that- all was great

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here on the recommendation of a colleague. It was great value for money and well located. Suites were very functional and service in general was above average. Would stay here again especially if I were in NYC for 2 weeks or more.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is adjacent to a shopping precinct. The weather was poor so we didn't really explore it. Our room was a small suite, it was pleasant and had most things you will need. Relatively economical with a free breakfast offered and 24 hour coffee available. They also provide an early evening snack and drink (four days per week) which is very nice.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was pleasantly suprised with the room size and amenities for this NYC hotel. It wasn't huge, but compared to my two other visiting family members it rated far above their rooms in their hotels in size amenities and well thought out spaces. Breakfast was great. I find Homewood Suites pretty consistent in quality. The kitchenette is convenient for those staying a few days as well.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This facility was our home away from home for an all girls trip for spring break. Can't say enough about the quality of the property. It is new and just blocks from Times Square. The suites are modern and kitchen is sufficient for a week. The staff is helpful and attentive. The breakfast met the picky dietary needs of women from 8 to 65! There was something for everyone. I will absolutely use this facility again. We loved it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I spent one night here when I was in between apartments (I live in New York), and can attest that you get a lot of bang for your buck at the Homewood Suites. It's brand new construction, so everything is immaculate. Room size compares well to a typical studio apartment in Manhattan. There is a mini kitchenette, which is perfect for saving a few dollars on meals. The hotel also has a roof deck with views of the Hudson, which would be amazing on a warm summer night. The free breakfast is decent, although the coffee was on the weaker side (but hey, it's free). Neighborhood may seem slightly gritty if you're visiting New York for the first time, but the area is completely safe, even late at night. All in all, I would highly recommend for anyone coming from out of town!
user_name:
sfmwh
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have travelled to Homewood Suites for over a decade as our family grew. Traveling to NYC with our last teen this was the smallest HS we have been in - very compact and a bit too small for 5 nights and luggage but we made it work. No managers reception but cookies around 4pm. Breakfast was standard and if early enough space not a problem but it is during the rush. Easy walk to subway and times square but tough to find a cab. Quiet if not on the street side and great views from the 22 floor. Friendly front desk staff. We'd stay again for the location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is very good, clean and spacious room in a great location. Staff was really helpful and friendly. Walk distance to Time Square, Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, North High Line and 3 min walk to Penn Station on Blue Subway Line.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Flying into Newark was not bad. Train from Newark to Penn Station New York was easier than anticipated. Penn Station is located under Madison Square Garden which is 3 blocks over and 2 blocks down. Street to hotel is a little scary, somewhat low lit. However nobody bothers you. Front desk was a bit chaotic. One young lady was helping customers while another employee was gossiping and telling customers someone else would help them. Lobby area is very clean as well as room. Location is not bad but room is tight but cozy. Refrigerator, washer and microwave are useful. Price is a little steep for this property.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I visited this hotel in March 2017, beautiful hotel, nice location & JUNIOR (Front Desk) has excellent customer service. ONLY PROBLEM WAS HOTEL MANAGER DIO CASTILLO, he KNOCKED ON MY DOOR ACCUSING ME OF SMOKING/smoke coming into the hallway, warned me of a $350 smoking fee, then RED FLAGGED MY ROOM FOR CHECKOUT. Upon checkout, I'm waiting 20 mins for my room to be checked for smoking & ended up being NOT GUILTY. Never did I receive an apology or anything.. I would recommend this hotel but I don't think I'll pay my money to stay here again.
user_name:
Jay_lauren
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I Spent the better part of this past week at the Homewood Suites on West 37th Street while attending a trade show at the Javits Center a couple blocks away. Easy, quick, early check-in. Room was a great size for NYC and I enjoyed having a small kitchen for early coffee before breakfast. Room was exceptional clean and had a wood-grained tile floor and not questionable carpeting. Asked for a quiet room and was assigned one at the back of the building and although the room backed up to an elevator, I DID NOT hear it until we had a very windy day, and the wind could be heard in the elevator shaft a bit at night. Their breakfast buffet comes with the room ( and didn't cost an additional $25-35 as in some bigger name hotels in town) and was greatly appreciated. Nothing out of the ordinary, but decent, fresh, nourishing food with enough selection for anyone's taste. Also offered walk-away fruit to enjoy later in the morning along with cookies in the lobby in the afternoon. Staff was friendly and accommodating. I would definitely recommend this Homewood Suites for anyone that needs a home away from home while in New York City. Thanks Homewood Suites for a great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If you are looking for the quietest hotel in NYC, this is the place!! No hallway noise, no noise outside, no noise from the room next door. Peaceful!! The shades work more than well....no light to wake you up in the morning! Continuous hot coffee in the lobby. Awesome breakfast. So close to MSG. Grab this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Consistency is important. Time and time again during my stay at the Homewood suites they have perform at a high standard in customer service for business, as well as family travels with hotel stay.The rooms are spacious and comfortable.Best of all after a good night rest is breakfast. This hotel exceed expectation time and time again with high-quality breakfast. The staff is very accommodating, when my time is limited and can not stay for breakfast ,I am provided a to go container for take out.When checking out you're always asking when will you join us again and thank you for staying with us.They have earned my business again and again.
user_name:
Roderick G
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good place to stay very central in Times Square. Good breakfast but seating area limited sometimes had to wait to sit down. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would recommend it . Heartland brewery is just around the corner too!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We chose that hotel for a pre and post-cruise stay in NYC. On both stays, we were very pleased by this hotel. The staff was very friendly and proactive. They kept a small piece of luggage for us in between the 2 stays. On the 2nd stay, we were accomodated (with delays) with an early check-in. A couple of downsides: the breakfast... OMG that was awful on both stays. The food doesn't taste anything, the hot buffet was somewhat cold and NO healthy choice AT ALL. There is not even milk or cream for your coffee, only flavored creamers. To be honest, even if the breakfast is included, you should look at other options in the area. One other thing: during our 2nd stay, the room we got had a very noisy fridge and a ceiling fan that ran all night long... we didn't sleep at all... When I told the staff the next morning, they said that this fan is linked to the kitchen exhaust fan... No excuse, No compensation, no nothing... At least, they should put a notice somewhere in the rooms...

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed here to attend a trade show at the nearby Javits Center. The suite was great for someone not wanting to spend $$$ on eating out, as it provided a kitchen (with full size fridge, stove top, microwave & dishwasher, plus utensils/crockery/cutlery). Although not large, the suite nevertheless managed to fit a comfortable king bed, a sofa, and the kitchen. My only gripe was with the bathroom: it had one of those no-lip showers so I had to wipe the floor dry every day. (Although I had been assigned an ADA bathroom so understood why my bathroom was like this, when I asked if I could be moved to a room with a SENSIBLE shower I was told all the bathrooms had this must-have-been-designed-by-a-man-who-has-a-wifey-do-all-the-cleaning type of showers. Hence I didn't bother moving.) The other problem with the bathroom was that there was absolutely NO counter space, so toiletry/makeup bags had to sit on the floor. The hotel provides complimentary breakfasts, and there was a great choice: pastries/breads, hot and cold cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit and a selection of at least 3 hot items. The hotel is situated in the garment district, so it's easy walking to Penn Station, Times Square, Broadway, etc (and the Javits. Not that I walked there, as it was FREEZING!). The hotel itself seems relatively new. The lobby area is appealing, and the reception staff were attentive and friendly. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for both its comforts and the bonus of that kitchen!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice surprise! Perfect location and wonderful staff:) Everyone was extremely helpful and pleasant. The rooms come with free breakfast which is a great advantage. It is a walking distance from the Empire State Building and Broadway. Perfect!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Half the price of other hotels yet the rooms are equal in size if not larger. Modern as well. I have stayed at a lot of NYC hotels and this is now my favorite. Only 3 blocks from Penn Station to the south and 5 blocks from Times Square to the Northeast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First rate facility. Staff was outstanding and the location close to Tmes Square and the theater district. Room was very satisfactory although a bit on the small side. Bed and pillows excellent. Breakfast very good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel, wonderful staff, excellent location. The parking garage across the street was easy in and out...they were also very friendly and we waited less than five minutes for the car. The hotel room was quite large for NYC, and spotless. 11th floor was very quiet even though we faced 37th St. We will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Room was clean and spacious, although the hardwood floors took some getting used to.....I'm just glad I brought my slippers. Kitchenette was nice (though we didn't really use it), and free breakfast as well as consistent availability of coffee/tea in the lobby were added bonuses. Unbeatable location if you need to be in the heart of the city. Did have a minor issue with the shower leaking water (even with the shower door closed), and the TV was difficult to turn on/off (remote battery, maybe?). But overall, a great value for what we paid.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Comfortable, clean, convenient location and great value. Friendly and helpful staff. Bathroom a bit odd - not much counter space and the shower was not set apart or self contained, just separated from the rest of the room by a curtain. Resulted in water all over the floor and overuse of towels to sop up the water. Minor inconvenience though. Really liked the tile floor throughout the room - major improvement over carpet. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Comfortable, clean and great location! You can walk everywhere from this location.Really enjoyed our experience. Friendly service and great breakfast included. Located in the garment district. Safe & cozy feel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for six nights and it was nice to have a more spacious room in New York by their standards. Also the fact that there was a small kitchen with dishwasher fridge and microwave and stove top helped as we prepared a couple of meals and were able to use those facilities for the children. I am not a huge fan of the breakfast but I guess it is convenient for children and families and anyone really because it gets a jumpstart on your day which is important in a city like New York. Alas for me quality trumps quantity all the time. Should my family and I be in New York again we would definitely consider staying here.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This review is way overdue! The first time I came here was November 2014 and was pleasantly surprised to find out that some of the rooms have patios!! There's nothing like being in the middle of Manhattan in a decent hotel room, not overly expensive, that has outdoor patio! There's even grass! This is a great secret in Manhattan and I just gave it away! My girlfriend will beat me if the next time she tries to get one of the rooms and can't because of a review by me! A big plus! By the way, the breakfast is also pretty decent along with the staff makes this Manhattan hotel an enjoyable stay!
user_name:
Robert B
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel, we had 5 adults and they accommodated us. Nice lobby with places to gather at night or during the day. Breakfast was included and they had a lot to choose from. Close to the subway and being in mid-town, close to everything else too!
user_name:
Susan C
Hartland, Michigan, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at the homewood suites on 37th st. We were checked I. And received water on arrival. The suite was equipped with full kitchen and very comfortable king bed. The rio also had a sleeper couch but we did not use it. The hotel is near subway and time square. I would highly recommend this hotel. There is also a complementary breakfast which had something for everyone. The coffee, hot chocolate and tea was available all day with fresh baked cookies midday. I don't think anyone would be disappointed with the hotel or location I will certainly stay at the hotel again.there is also reasonable parking almost across the street which was very convenient.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Friendly Staff, clean rooms, decent breakfast always had fresh fruit and pastries, rooms are a bit smaller for a suite than we expected, but nicely done and clean. Good walking distance to everything including times square and penn station.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nicely done - very functional and great location. Room quiet. Great breakfast, which is extremely convenient. I will go back. Parking garage not owned by hotel, and garage is not accommodating when I have parked there in the past. Friends had a similar surprise. Hotel advertises valet parking, but it is self-parking down the street. Anytime over initial day is a full $45 additional charge.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good location for Hilton honors members just off the main Manhattan 8th Avenue area but quiet for a good stay. Good selection of neighborhood restaurants nearby within walking distance. Easy access to a range of oretail outlets for travel needs while staying in the NYC area.
user_name:
Edward P M
Marblehead, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Notwithstanding the value, we encountered (and are still dealing with) a problem. We paid cash upon checkout. We had been told that the credit card we gave at check in would not be charged. The credit card was charged. A week later, when the charge had not been removed, the hotel was called and we were told it could take up to two weeks. We waited another ten days. Still no change. Called a second time and were told it had now been take care of and to wait a day or two for the charge to come off the card. Several days later and the charge is still there. BEWARE!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We lucked out and had wonderful weather for NYC in February during our three-night stay (better than our visit two years ago when it was sub-zero!). I booked the hotel before we knew which theatre shows we would attend, and it was fate that one theatre was several blocks south and the other several blocks north of the hotel, with it in the middle. (There are a good number of Off-Broadway theatres in this area.) While the subway line isn't all that close compared to other hotels in NYC, we did use it, as well as walking a lot, including over to MOMA and up Broadway and the distances were tolerable. The staff were nice and the room was clean and a good size for NYC. Having a kitchenette with refrigerator was great. However, as other guests have mentioned, though, the #1 problem with this hotel is the elevators. In the morning it was difficult to get an elevator because they serve not only guests, but a staff member told me they don't have a freight/staff elevator so it's both guests and staff jockeying for elevators. This is especially difficult because if staff are on the elevators, they tend to stop at many more intermediate floors than they would if it were simply guests going to the lobby. Also, they turned the far right elevator off at night so there were only two working. We went up to the roof deck which must be nice in summer, but even on a warm-ish for February day, it wasn't much of a view. We were on the 17th floor and were not bothered by light or sound so we slept well (which can be hard to do in the city). There isn't much on the short block the hotel is on (food or otherwise), but there is a cheap pizza place on the corner and a really good burger place just a block or so away. The best thing about the hotel is it is near Times Square, but not actually in it, so it's not that crowded or blindingly bright. Breakfast was a bit of craziness as it was crowded and hard to find a table each morning. The parking garage the hotel partners with is a bit down the street and was being renovated when we checked out, so retrieving my car was a bit of a challenge. There was also very limited parking in front of the hotel for loading/unloading, so be aware of that as well. Overall we'd stay here again, but be aware of the elevator issues - apparently it's an ongoing concern from reading other comments.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is standard fare, with small but comfortable rooms. Quiet, which is always good. Wonderful view from the 22nd floor patio (no furniture out there in winter but a great view of the Empire State Building). Right near the High Line and a short walk to Times Square, Bryant Park and many good tourist spot. My only gripe was that there was no cell service in my room--a quirk but very annoying. I had to go to the lobby to make or receive calls. The desk couldn't help other than offer for me to move to another room, at my inconvenience and no offer of any compensation.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: being so close to times sq we opted to stay here and paid a few dollars extra. the line at check in was nothing, but to get to the room was a nightmare. there was a line 20+ people deep because of a broken elevator. 20+ people ... AND their luggage. We took the stairs and it was not fun with luggage. breakfast was worse. the entire lobby was wall to wall people, it was crazy. there wasn't enough seating and you couldn't take it back to the room because the elevators were busy mostly with ppl checking out. at one point a second elevator went out. the ppl at the front desk don't care.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is an excellent choice when staying in Manhattan. I stayed there for 6 night and my experience was amazing. It has a perfect location, near Times Square, 5th Avenue and all the main attractions. The breakfast that was included was really good.I would like to specially thank Tiara who was of a great help while dealing with some shipping issues. She was always willing to help with a great smile. What a great customer service!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We came here for anniversary. The manager gave us the recognition that made our trip unforgettable. The location is very close to Times square, very convenience. People there recognized us and greeted us with personal care. Love this place.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nafeesa Brent made our stay wonderful! When we first checked in & went to our room, corner room, 301, had a small window & was very dark due to location. Light & bright is a priority for me. I asked at front desk if another room had a larger window & explained how room very dark, even w/ all the lights on. I was told no, all rooms the same. After walking away, Nafeesa, who overheard this exchange, came over to me & said she could show us another room. It was great! Nice, big floor to ceiling window, so much better! Nafeesa went above & beyond! She didn't have to do anything, but went out of her way for great customer service. Throughout our stay, she always had a big smile & was so friendly.The rooms are big for NYC standards. Breakfast great, lots of options & seating. All areas of hotel neat & clean. Room was by elevator, but very quiet, couldn't even hear it. Convenient location to Penn Station.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We will stay at this Homewood Suites again! It was one of the best experiences I've had with a hotel. The complimentary breakfast had a nice assortment of hot items as well as pastries and cereal. The fitness center was clean with well-maintained equipment. The room was nice and utilized the space well, which included a fold-out couch and a kitchenette. The staff was friendly. I just can't say enough about how delighted we were with the experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Really enjoyed staying at this hotel and would definitely stay here again. We had booked this hotel because of the ratings across several sites and it didn't disappoint. Our favorite amenity in this hotel was that no matter what time of day you walk in you are greeted with a smile and a hot coffee bar. Our room was kept immaculate everyday and we loved that they have would floors instead of nasty carpeting in the rooms. These days you can't be clean and friendly.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights and it was fantastic. The location is excellent for mid town only 10 mins from Times Square. Breakfast was a real positive as were the facilities. The room was plenty big enough for 2 adults and 2 children. Thank you for making this trip so memorable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Arrived last Saturday afternoon. We were a party of 5 split between 2 rooms.One of the receptionists was very professional and seemed to know what she was doing, whilst the other one had to ask a manager for assistance as she wanted to put the 5 of us in one room, then wanted to give us 3 rooms, at an extra expense?? Luckily i had my hotel voucher which proved we had paid for 2 rooms. The room for the 2 friends was ready, so we piled the cases into that room, had a natter whilst they unpacked. The room was large with a double wardrobe, a full kitchen area and a nice bathroom.We hit NYC and didn't get back to the hotel until after 8pm. We got the key to our room. It was smaller than our friends room, a single wardrobe and less floor space? The bed settee wasn't made up and the light under the microwave wouldn't turn off. To start swapping rooms just seemed too much hard work as we were very tired. One of my friends went down to ask for the bed settee to be made up and also asked why the light under the microwave wouldn't turn off. We were told an engineer would sort the light out the following morning. Was that tired just agreed.Have to say the mattress was very comfy and had a good nights sleep even with the jet lag. Breakfast was good. On our way out asked about the engineers visit, to be informed that it was a switch on the microwave that turned the light out, by the professional receptionist. Breakfast on the Monday morning was erratic and took more than 40 minutes before we finally managed to get a seat. It would make sense if someone, kept an eye on people eating. Several tables had finished eating but were obviously discussing their plans for the day, which could have been conducted in the soft seating area.Also, more notices about clearing your own table, would help as you weren't always sure whether a table was empty or whether they'd gone back to replenish their breakfast!On the whole the hotel was good, the view of the ESB on the roof terrace was great. Its a little out of the main stretch, but does give you a quieter nights sleep. The maid service was great and the majority of staff were polite and helpful. Would i stay again- definitely.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It is very wise for us to chose the hotel. No matter for the convinient site but also for its free hot drink and breakfast. It was very cold and snowy when we arrived NY. The hotel make us feel at home, always warm and leasure. The charge is quite resonable. We already recommend the choice to our friend. We will chose the place definitely next time. Thanks a lot.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This Manhattan mid-town Hilton brand is worth trying. We had the king size bed room with the mini kitchen. The location is very good as it is in a nice neighborhood (just on edge of the Garment District) with lots of restaurants and shops. Getting a cab is easy by just walking about 200 feet to 8th Avenue which is a major north-south route. It is a $10 cab ride to Madison Square Garden. The staff was excellent and professional. Try it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great stay, the best place I can find, the manager Beatriz Liza was awesome, the breakfast is the best and the after office snacks and beers are a great idea. Ready to back ASAP. The rest of the crew friendly and always with a smile, asking if there are something more they can do for us.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Relatively new hotel. Utility rooms are of a reasonable size for NYC, nicely furnished with all the facilities you need for a self-catering stay (though breakfast is provided).Helpful front desk staff. Public areas, though small, are well designed and presented. Small roof terrace.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at the Homewood suites last weekend and had a great time. The hotel is new and very clean the staff was very nice. We enjoyed the room we had 3 in it and it was large enough for our needs. We have stayed in other hotels in the area and the space available was minimal and we felt crowded in. There was a massive crowd for the complementary breakfast, and table space was at a premium as in the winter the patio was not open. People were eating in the dining room and in the lobby. The lobby was very nice with multiple TV's, coffee, tea and cookies throughout the day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed early February 2017 and was really pleased with the hotel. First impressions were really good; I arrived from JFK through Port Authority and arrived at the hotel after a short 5min walk.The hotel is a few strides off 8th Avenue and the reception staff were very efficient in checking me in and up to my room.As the name of the hotel says, the room was more like a suite! There was a large king-size bed, a really comfy couch and an almost full kitchen, with a number of hotplates, microwave, fridge/freezer, toaster, dishwasher and all utensils! The bathroom was clean, modern and tidy (apart from the leaky shower unit you seem to get in almost all hotels these days!)The hotel has a complimentary breakfast, which although is very busy, you can easily take a couple of plates to the room if space is limited.Times Square is just a 10min walk and the subways, through Port Authority is just 5mins away.Overall a great stay and very importantly, value for money!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Whn I checked into my room it was very small. Since I was going to be staying for six nights I called down to see if I could get an upgrade due to my gold status. The front desk staff was very nice but said nothing was available. I asked to speak to the manager. Mr. Costillio (sp) was very helpful and said he would look into it for me. He called my room within ten minutes and had found me a larger room. Thank you so much!! The only issue I have here is that on two occasions the breakfast sausage I selected was very cold. Not lukewarm but outright cold. And the hash browns are very bland. However, I will say Tht if I'm fortunate enough to return to NYC I would not hesitate to stay her again. All the staff are super friendly.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel! 410 sq. ft. suites are awesome & very spacious. Great floors without carpets - nice! (Bring slippers in the winter) location is perfect - no complaints at all- recommend staying here and can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Awesome stay at Homewood Suites in NYC! Very comfortable CLEAN room for 5; and the room still felt "roomy." Hard to find rooms for 5 in NYC. Plus, FREE breakfast helped save money. Very satisfied with stay and will return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Rooms were clean and nice plus staff was friendly and flexible. Breakfast buffet had so much variety. Hotel is close to all the main attraction and convinent to find buses and trains. Near to all good restaurants and shopping centers.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location near Times Square. Great price for the location and suite style room. One issue I have is that I upgraded to the City View room...my view was looking into offices across from me. Ripoff

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I really enjoyed my five night stay here and would definitely return. I shared a room with my sister and it was small, but quaint and comfortable. We both had plenty of room for our luggage and ice cream in the big freezer. It was nice having a kitchenette even though we did most of our eating in the city. The complimentary breakfast every morning was the highlight of staying here during a fashion sales show with long days and commutes. I would recommend this hotel for its rates and great comfort to anyone traveling to the garment district of NYC

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for a few days and it was our first time in New York City. The hotel was clean and had a great hot breakfast in the morning. Staff was friendly and helpful and arranged transfers to and from the airport and our cruise which left from Newark New Jersey. It was within walking distance of Times Square and we always felt safe.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Small studio suite with full size fridge and electric cook top and microwave oven. Updated room with modern metropolitan decor. Overall stay is pleasant. Quite convenient if you don't enjoy eating out too much. Close to a local grocer. Within walking distance to Time Square, and Bryant Park. 15 min to Convention Center

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I really liked this hotel! We had a very quiet room, although we needed to unplug the fridge as I cannot sleep with that sound :) The room was clean and nice, the receptionists very friendly. We got 1 hour extension at no charge. The location is perfect, couple of blocks from Times Square, with a 7 eleven just round the corner. The breakfast was good, scrambled eggs and assorted cereals. They offer nice coffee all day in the lobby, which is perfect for colder days.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What's best about the hotel are their staff, hardworking and helpful! Concierge is very helpful and always wear a beautiful smile to greet you! Location is good, there's quite some hotel on the same area, so staff there is really making the difference! Although breakfast area is crowded and food was so so, but the hardworking people there keep on refilling and making tidy the area for you is very important! I started get hook with Homewood nowadays because it really make you feel like home with the kitchenette in the room and most of them giving you a nice breakfast! Keep it up Homewood! Keep it up Hilton!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Can't express how perfect this hotel was for our stay. The location, the staff, our room, everything! The all-day coffee/tea station is a nice touch, as is the free wifi. The breakfasts were perfect too, hot food, pastries, fruit, cereal etc. Would definitely book again on our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel, great location. Fab room with two large beds, plenty of room with a kitchen area and sitting area. Nice and clean.Staff - very helpful and accommodating. Sent chocolate cake, strawberries and a card to our room on our daughters birthday. This was our second stay at home wood suites and I have no hesitation in recommending it and would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites in New York is an excellent place to stay for Business or Personal. Breakfast is open for longer hours than most, lots of options. Rooms are spacious and service and employees are great, very nice. Other than my shower being a little narrow for me and occasional tv signal loss, it was a great experience. I'll be returning to this place again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family and I enjoyed the hotel and its location. The staff was friendly! The all day coffee was great! Kids loves the afternoon treats! The room was spacious for a family of four. The only thing we did not like is the bedding was not very warm and had to ask for extra blankets.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Arriving early with car, New York style Parked half wedged to unload...LOLI frantically unload with my curious Wow opened eyed twin 7yr Old Daughters.... Safe to say a wonderful smile is greeting us "MELISSA".... Seeing that I was flying solo "Single Father" quickly with no issues, checked us in! Room is ready! Melissa even helped with watching as I parked the car and entertained the girls as she knew exactly where Daddy was taking them American Girl Store... with the Dolls in hand...LOLThis is a Wonderful place for a Single Parent or Parents! Breakfast was remarkable! Location perfection! People you need to walk in New York to know New York.! ;) Thank you to the entire staff!Upon departure emotions started rolling through this Dad's eyes how wonderful and gentle Melissa was to myself and the girls! KUDOS!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There was a bad smell in my room on my second night because someone was cooking fish and the hotel moved me into another room within 20 minutes! I only had to call the front desk and inform them and they moved me. Amazing service!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I (50-ish) made this hotel our home base for a weekend trip to NYC to see a couple Broadway shows and visit MoMA. The location was ideal: a short walk from both Port Authority bus terminal (which is how we arrived) and Penn Station. Our standard King room was quite large and nicely decorated with clean, contemporary furnishings, a full-size fridge, microwave, and 2-burner stove. There were also pots, pans, dishes and silverware, though we didn't use any of those. The bathroom was a nice size, with a large shower. Plenty of room to hang garments and modular furniture, which would be great if you're going to be there a while or need to do business/work while in the room. The breakfast was adequate, nothing fancy, but plenty to start the morning. The breakfast room was mobbed on Saturday morning, but not so much on Sunday. We never had a problem waiting for the elevator. And we really enjoyed the complimentary coffee, tea and hot cocoa in the lobby. We got a great rate because we traveled in January and used a AAA discount. I would most definitely stay here again on a future trip to NYC and would recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel. Only issue was slow elevator. We stayed for at a gymnastics meet at peer 94. It was a quick inexpensive cab ride away. A cab came right up to hotel just after we walked out. Walked to time square and there were several close places to eat.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The only things I can complain about was an elevator wasn't working through my stay making high volume times and check-out lengthy. I am not a picky eater and was impressed with the complimentary breakfast. The kitchenette also helped off-set the cost of food in NYC. I think they use a dish for TV service and it froze frequently for a few seconds at a time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had reservation issues that could only be fixed with us purchasing a second room. I guess we were lucky to get another as the place was full. Out of 3 elevators for 22 floors. One was down the whole weekend and at one point we only had one. Lines to get on a elevator. Had to walk the stairs a few times to many.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent a long weekend getaway with friends and was disappointed in 1) broken elevators to the point that we had to use the stairs including dragging the luggage cart up to the 3rd floor 2) cold breakfast (at 6:30am) on day 1 and on the second day, no room to eat our breakfast because the area was too small for all of the people - had to walk our breakfasts up to the 3rd floor via the stairwell.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First time staying at this property but it won't be the last. Centrally located on the west side near Times Square, Bryant Park and Macy's. The room was the size of an apartment. Modern and clean accomodations. Completely equipped kitchen. Room included a small sofa that opened into a fold out twin bed that was comfortable. Staff was very helpful everyday and even arranged for transportation to JFK when there was a snow and ice storm. Compliementary breakfast had a large selection of hot and cold items. It I didn't see something out, wait staff would go in the back and try to locate the item. Coffee bar located in the lobby with coffee, tea or hot chocolate available 24/7. Used the business center with quick and efficient computer equipment. Our room was on the opposite side of West 37th Street and was very quiet. Elevator system was fast. The hotel is close to many restaurants, shopping and Broadway shows.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: In full disclosure I was in NY this weekend and stayed at a different brand hotel (Marriott) and wished I would have booked here. I stayed here last year and just could not get a room here this time around so I thought I would go back and write my review. This hotel was fabulous. The rooms were very clean, modern and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and the lobby was very inviting. If you were to magically appear in the room and just stay ion the hotel, you would not know you are smack in the middle of the chaos of mid town Manhattan. The breakfast was very good and again the staff was very helpful and friendly while keeping things clean and well stocked. For the location you cant beat it. This staff and and management team have done a great job in reflecting quality of the Homewood Brand. I would definitely recommend staying here. Try to book in advance if possible.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a very nice hotel. The location is perfect. Very clean and tidy, friendly and helpful staff, nice, modern décor. Complimentary breakfast was good and 24/7 tea and coffee available.This hotel is just minutes from Times Square and the Empire State Building. Within a few minutes of the subway too. Rooms have fridge and cooking facilities.We have just returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel and really enjoyed our stay here.We would definitely return to this hotel. We had a great time in New York and this was a great base for our stay. Would happily return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Rooms were clean and comfortable. Amenities were good. Elevators worked efficiently. Were within short walking distance to restaurants and transit. Complimentary breakfast was a nice bonus as was afternoon cookies and coffee. Would definately stay again in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My sister in law and I caught a bus to DC for the Women's March at Penn Station and this hotel was the perfect place to stay, conveniently located within walking distance. The staff were friendly and kind. The bed was VERY comfortable, especially after being on our feet/on a bus for nearly 20 hours the day of the March. The only drawback for me was that the coffee station did not offer half and half, only three flavors of Coffeemate.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stay here several times a year for work. I always pay a little more for a room on the 8th floor to secure a balcony which is great all year round but especially during the summer to take in the city and have a beverage right outside your room. As most Manhattan rooms, this is a bit smaller than a normal Homewood, but still very well appointed and VERY CLEAN which is what matters most. The people at the check in desk are always very friendly. The location is great and surrounded by some great places to eat and grab an evening drink. I highly recommend this hotel and will continue to use it as my first choice when I am in Manhattan for meetings.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everything was really good except for the food. Breakfast was not great. the rooms were a bit small but staff was friendly. We like how they had coffee and cookies towards the afternoon. Super friendly staff

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel 2 times in the past 2 months. We choose it because of the location and value. It is very close to Penn Station, so great if you're taking the LIRR in from Long Island. The price was the best in the area and a great value, considering it was very nice and clean. There's a nice sitting area in the lobby with a fireplace. As well as free coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby. There is also a complimentary breakfast buffet. Typical hotel buffet offerings.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean rooms, friendly, helpful staff. Got what was promised. Breakfast hot items were hot. Plenty of items from which to choose. Breakfast area was clean. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was able to answer questions and assist in directions to all destinations.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had the pleasure of staying here when I had to make last minute reservations to attend a trade show. The Homewood Suites was by far, the best user experience I've had in many years. I wasn't looking forward to this stay as I've never stayed at a Homewood suites, but my other normal places to stay were completely booked and don't let the inexpensive price fool you. These guys nailed it from the first moment I walked in the door until I left. You will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, walking distance to Empire State Bldg, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, parking garage is across the street and tunnels are 5 minutes away. Breakfast is included and all day coffee. Rooms are very modern, clean and comfortable. I stay at this location for business often.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I invite you to come to the Homewood Suites By Hilton located on the south of times Square in New York, NY. It is in a great location and you all you may have in your house. all you have to think is a home away from home. you have kitchen with al you need to do and beside that you also have continental breakfast, hot chocolate and tea 24hrs. I don't want you to think that I am laying I want you to come and see all you could do in this beautiful City of New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Homewood Suites, but there were some negatives as well as positives.The positives - the location is excellent and an easy walk to subway stations, Times Square, Broadway theatres and other mid-town attractions. Our suite was spacious, comfortable and quiet. Despite it being very cold during our stay, we remained warm and cosy at all times. Given NYC prices, we felt the suites were good value for money.The negatives - the property was extremely busy, hosting several tour parties as well as independent guests. This meant long delays in hailing the lifts, repeated difficulties finding a table at breakfast and queues at the reception desk and the breakfast offerings. We also suspect it was why we didn't secure a suite on a higher floor with a view, despite having requested this in advance, being a member of the Honors club, and staying 10 nights (we noted the tour party guests were mostly on the high floors). Some staff were also rude and curt, maybe due to the pressure of dealing with so many guests. While the continental breakfast choices were fine, the hot buffet was also variable in quality.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at Homewood Suits over the New Year period for 7 days. Overall a nice stay.We arrived around 3.30pm, we were travelling from the UK so after a long haul flight we was very excited to get to our room. On arrival we were told our room was not ready. Our paper worked stated a 3pm check in time. We was told this was a mistake and our check in was 4pm. We choose not to argue this as we just headed out to catch a bite to eat. When we returned around 4.30pm the room was still not ready, obviously slightly annoyed at this, but was then quickly given the key to our room.The rooms overall were really nice, clean and modern a fully functional kitchen and nice bathroom an ok size for 3 girls sharing. The wifi worked well in the room as well as in reception. The room took two days to get house keeping in, again we did not argue this as we just phoned reception for clean towels.Breakfast for us for really nice, hot stations with egg and sausages and the usual continental breakfast. Nice touch with 24 hour hot drinks, went down a treat after a long day site seeing.Our room was on the 17th floor, never had a problem waiting for the lifts. One day on new year we waited a while. We put this down to a very busy time everyone getting ready for the celebrations. Location for us was fine, a short walk to the main attractions. Overall a nice stay, were not fussy to give a bad review over minor issues that really did not spoil our trip. We would stay here again no questions asked.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our family stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and we were extremely happy with our accommodation. The linen and towels were excellent, bathroom clean and modern and the kitchenette was great. Breakfast was pretty good too - hot and cold choices available and tea/coffee/cookies available all day. The location is superb - a couple of blocks from Times Square, Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. The only criticism I have is that the rooms were serviced far too late in the day - often after 4 pm which was when we preferred to be resting in our room. Almost on every occasion we had to leave the room and go down to the lobby whilst it was being done. Other than that, this hotel is a gem, and all staff were courteous, helpful and professional. I heartily recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a great time at the Homewood Suites. They were EXTREMELY accommodating and while they were extremely busy, they still were able to get us in a room earlier than check in time and hold our bags for us while we explored the city the next day. The room was clean and spacious. The staff went above and beyond. We will definitely be booking there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: we stayed here for 5 night over the xmas and new year period. On arrival in our room there was a cake, a bottle of fizz a birthday card and some other goodies waiting as a surprise for my 50th birthday which was a lovely touch we thought. The room was well laid out and had everything we needed except a seating area would have been nice as we were expecting that going by the hotel pictures but not the end of the world. The breakfast was really nice and set us up for the day, at certain times it was busy but they worked hard to keep things topped up. There is free tea, coffee and hot chocolate in hotel lobby all day which was also great. Only niggle we had was the heating was very noisy as was the fridge but we were so tired after walking around all day it made no impact on our stay. It is in a good location within walking distance of most things and I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my first and "bucket list" trip to NYC. Heart failure requires me to use a 3-wheeled scooter to travel more than 50 feet. The first morning, the breakfast area was extremely crowded, and the tables were so close together, that I could not easily turn around, even if I found space at a table. None of the kitchen/serving staff helped me to get food and drinks. The second day I asked Lloyd to get me a bag to carry some cereal to my room. He then realized my predicament, asked me what I needed, and offered to carry a tray to my room. I tipped him very well. He said that I could call him and order my breakfast delivered in the future. This prevented me from impeding the flow of able-bodied guests. // Our housekeeper and her supervisor made sure that we had everything that we needed even after we arrived with an ice-covered scooter.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I enjoyed my stay at Homewood suites for many reasons! It was in the best location for a first time new Yorker like me so I couldn't get lost while exploring. And the breakfast was delicious! Only suggestion I would make is to add bacon when I'm in town. Lol. I'll call ahead to request. The place was very clean and accommodating. We called the Front desk and mentioned our let out bed was uncomfortable and without hesitation they brought up an extra mattress for it. The front desk staff was really the highlight of my stay. The night shift especially. They made me feel like we were old friends! The day staff was very pleasant as well. They had our car ready when we needed to head to the airport and even though it was a rush of people at the front desk no one rushed me or pushed me aside but politley answered my questions with a smile and took time to assist me. I felt like a VIP guest! The hot chocolate was always available and I drank many cups of it! I will definitely be back even if it's just to visit the staff! Thanks for all you do and keep up the good work! Oh and even the maid was friendly and very pretty! Loved the whole hotel experience!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location ,friendly and helpful staff .spacious room.Breakfast & all day coffee was greatWifi was working wellWe had a great time & I highly recommend this hotel, in a quiet area ,but still nearby everything

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel about 3 or 4 times and always had a good experience. Clean, spacious rooms (for NYC, anyway), and kitchen amenities that make traveling so much easier. The staff is friendly and helpful and both check-in and check-out were quick and simple. I'll continue to return to this hotel when I'm in town for business, and might rebook for a personal stay as well!
user_name:
katherinej602
St. Louis, MO, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel seemed a bit overwhelmed. There was a group of about 100 people camped out in the lobby all afternoon awaiting transportation. Our rooms did not get made up until after 6 pm... they ran the dishwasher for one cup, while leaving a used glass in the bathroom, and did not replenish coffee for the next day.On the plus side, the hotel staff was friendly and accommodating, and the breakfast was fine (though the eggs may have been a bit too "creative"),Location is convenient to Time Square and theaters, and close to Penn Station.Rooms were a bit small, with little on no view, but this is NYC. Thankfully we were there on the weekend. There was an office just across the street, right outside our window. On Friday afternoon we had a view of the workers at their desks. I imagine they get quite a "view" themselves.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I loved everything about Homewood Suites. The room was relatively spacious, and had everything I wanted or needed. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were exceptionally nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good. And the endless supply of hot chocolate in the lobby was most welcome! The internet worked well. The location was perfect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel we chose for our three night trip to the Big Apple made our stay very easy and comfortable. We booked several months in advance and got a very good rate through Agoda. Our main concerns were walkability to the theatres and Times Square, safety and security issues and of course a clean comfortable room with the usual ammenities.We were not disappointed in the least with the Hilton Homewood Suites, but rather very impressed. The staff was lovely, very helpful and accommodating. The breakfast arrangements were quite unique. A lovely buffet spread was provided and patrons had a comfy lounge area to sit in eating their breakfast, reading the paper and planning their exciting New York day. Bonus for shoppers.....Macy's is just down the street.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for Christmas and New Year. The hotel is modern and clean. The location is brilliant and the staff are friendly and helpful. We liked the complimentary tea, coffee and hot chocolate. Thank you for making our stay so good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We took a short trip to New York City by train, and we picked this hotel because of its close proximity to Penn Station and our past experience with other Homewood Suites and the Hilton brand. It was only about a 6 minute walk from the train station, and we were extremely pleased with the quality of the accommodations. The included breakfast was great, the rooms were very clean and well maintained, and the internet connection was fast and reliable. It was close to Times Square and Macy's, which was another plus. I highly recommend this hotel if you need a comfortable, affordable place to stay in this part of Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location and amenities for a longer stay, very easy to find and nice to have a little walk back to the hotel after eating. Great having a separate couch rather than always having to sit on a bed as I usually do. Not that far to walk to Times Square etc.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location for a quick weekend trip in the city to see a show. Walking distance to both penn station and Times Square. Hotel seems very new and everything is in great condition. They switched rooms on us but we still got the room we wanted facing the back on a high floor. Quiet as can be. We had the studio which was small but adequate for two. The room design is very efficient and sensible. Bed and linens very comfortable. Blanket was a little thin for a cold winter night. Heating system worked well but took some time to figure out how to operate. Shower was good but the water seemed to leak all over the floor. Nice lobby but quite crowded. We did not have breakfast as we heard how crowded it gets so we picked up some food for the room and stored it in the fridge. They have a nice rooftop deck which is worth checking out. They stored our bags after we checked out which was incredibly convenient. Got a good rate. Overall a great place to stay-would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: it has a great location, not too far from various attractions in the city. free breakfast in the morning is also a plus, even though it can get pretty crowded during high season. one of my complain is that some of the rooms, the entrance door is right next to the other room's so that when the neighbor opens and closes the door you can hear them. this is very bothersome when you have a loud neighbor with kids that go back in and out and bang the door in the middle of the night.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It was a great location. Near Port Authority and Times Square and Javitz convention. Comes with free breakfast and coffee/tea and cookies in the lobby. Visit rooftop balcony. Room and bed were amazing.
user_name:
georginam336
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Beautiful, clean, friendly helpful staff. Quiet rooms with frig, sink, Keurig coffee maker, dishes, utensils, dishwasher, & range top. Great base for your busy visit to NYC. Finally made it to NYC after 15 years of planning. Good friend & I spent 5 days packing as much NYC as possible in! Homewood suites was great. Lots of choices for breakfast. Cookies in the afternoon. Recommend to all.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, within 5 mins walking distance of the hustle and bustle of Times Square and some major attractions such as the Empire State Building. The rooms are big and plenty of room for our family of 5. Cleaned everyday. Our room was directly across from an Elevator, not at all noisy. Complimentary hot drinks in reception area, the hot chocolate is delicious. Staff are friendly and approachable.The only downside is could find is the size of the dining room. It isn't big enough for the amount of guests. We got down at 7am and had no problem finding a table. Any later the 7.30/8am and you would struggle. Breakfast was pretty much the same everyday but again not really a massive issue. On one occasion they had run out of scrambled eggs and put out omelette style eggs, which I wasn't keen on. I asked if there was anymore scrambled eggs and they made some especially for me & my sister, which was fabulous.Travelling all the way from the UK you start to worry about where you are staying, we needn't have worried at all. Fabulous hotel (and I am extremely fussy about where I stay) I would absolutely book this hotel again.NYC is fantastic

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We chose this hotel because of the kitchenette (we cook most of our meals due to food allergies), as well as the convenient location. It is a ten minute walk from Times Square, which was actually a bonus as Times Square was filled with hordes of people and the summer temps, humidity and smells were unpleasant, so we avoided the area like the plague. The Homewood Suites is a short walk to the subway, which we used to get around Manhattan. There is a Subway sandwich shop and a Chipotles nearby. Outside the hotel was not the nicest area, but I felt safe and walked all over with my 13 y.o. son, even at night. The lobby was modern, clean, welcoming and safe. We stayed in a 295 sq. ft. efficiency studio with a king size bed. The kitchenette included a tiny sink, 2 burners, microwave, toaster, little dishwasher and a small but full size refrigerator/freezer. Under the desk was a pull out table we used with the desk chair and little love seat for our dining area. There was plenty of storage for our clothes and luggage, and the bed and shower were both comfortable. The AC/heat worked well. The room was quite clean, except for the wood floors. They looked clean, but dark wood hides dirt. We took our shoes off upon entering the room and when my son sat on the bed, the dust bunnies and dirt from the wood floor transferred from his socks to the bed spread. I mopped the floor with a wet towel, which was filthy when I finished. The staff at the front desk apologized and offered us a small discount on one of our nights. We stayed on the 10th and 12th floors away from the elevator and never heard other guests. We never had trouble getting an elevator. The free breakfast was just ok, but included a lot of choices - some combination of hot foods (turkey bacon or sausage, eggs, potatoes), oatmeal, cereal, bread, pastries and bagels, fresh fruit (apples, oranges, bananas and sometimes melon), yogurt, juice and milk. There were cookies and appetizers some evenings in the lobby and a gym in the basement which we did not use. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely chose the Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan South again. We booked just a month in advance. Had we booked earlier we may have gotten a lower rate, but our average price for 4 nights was $250 a night, which is still a deal for a place with a kitchen and free breakfast in the heart of NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great reception staff very attentetive and friendly. Rooms are of great size and fully equipped. Generally hotel was clean and well maintained. Breakfast was satisfactory and plentyful. Afternoon cookies are a nice touch and all day complementary drinks too.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location near Time Square but not so crowded!Upon arrival (9am) the staff assisted me immediately for check-in and invited me for breakfast. Surprised that i can already take breakfast upon check-in, as its not common in any other hotels.The room is clean and tidy. But one glitch, next day, we had breakfast and came back to the room around 10am to leave for the day. Came back around 11pm and room was not cleaned up, so called the front desk - told us, the housekeeping is at 9am daily. So they skipped our room! But they willingly cleaned up after that call. Next day onwards, we must ensure to tell front desk and remind for housekeeping.I must mention also, this hotel offers tea time snacks(yummy cookies!) and all day coffee. Must say, coffee is not too bad! Not sure of this perk is only during winter...to keep guests warm. If going back to NY, will definitely stay in this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: More like 3 star. Some very nice staff and some very grumpy! Rooms very clean, a little small. Breakfast ok. Basically the same everyday. But it's complimentary so it works. Parking $50usd per night. Had high end headphones go missing from our bag in the room. Front desk took it very lightly. Will definitely be taking it further.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The service and staff was excellent. Very helpful and courteous. I just wasn't pleased that the hotel had no bathtub or pool. Which are things I like on a getaway. Besides that the hotel was very nice. My only other issue was that it was not convenient for subway travel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed at many different hotel franchises in NYC, including some boutique hotels. The Homewood Suites was booked this time because as a Hilton member I wanted the additional points and it is pet friendly. The hotel is in a great location, clean, 24hr beverage bar in lobby with fireplace and sofa, complimentary breakfast and very clean rooms with comfortable bedding. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a great experience at this Homewood Suites. The only thing we would have liked to see was a bar at the location. But we understand that space is a premium in NYC! Maybe a rooftop bar in the future???

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our stay there was about 5 nights.It is conveniently located from Times square, 5th Avenue etc. touristy locations and is at walk able distance.Family friendly and has good food.I would refer this to anyone looking for enjoying the nearby tourist attractions, someone who does not want to spend a lot of money on taxis (it is also not far from Train stations) and for someone who wants to stay near the Manhattan hustle and bustle.When we visited, a portion of the hotel was being renovated and that might be a disturbance to some of the travelers.Make sure you book your tourist attractions in advance if you are visiting during peak holiday season, as you would not be able to get the tickets at the last minute.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is several blocks from Times Square. Food was mediocre at best. For a suite hotel, the rooms are tiny though they a clean, well laid out, and equipped as advertised. There a three elevator bays which makes every room close to an elevator. Thankfully, all the people on our floor were quiet.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites if a great value for NYC.It is within walking distance of all Times Square has to offer without all the congestion. The rooms are large for NYC clean comfortable with a fully supplied kitchen. Breakfast included is way above usual Hotel fare.
