New items everyday fresh and great VARIETY.Staff is exceptional always smiling and asking if they can help. This will be our go to hotel anytime we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: When I started looking for hotels in NYC, I wanted the hotel to be in a walking distance to Times Square and the price not sky high. I do believe that Homewood checked those boxes. This was my first time in New York so I didn't really know what to expect or what to ask for. Great value and only 10 min max walking to Times Square (and you're only about 5 minutes walking to a CVS/Kmart) The hotel has such an amazing staff, honestly, the kindest and most helpful people I met in New York. They were always so kind to us and I do believe that if there would have been any problems, they would have sorted them out immediately. The room we had was very nice except the sofa bed is a bit worn out (that's why sleep quality only gets 4*) The room itself wasn't really large but hey, you're in NYC. There was a large fridge there and a microwave, which was very nice and convenient. The breakfast was lovely and super busy! I can't really say anything bad about this hotel except the sofa bed oh and the elevators were a bit slow sometimes. I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My stay was during the New Year's Eve weekend in New York City. As you can imagine it was an extremely busy weekend for hotel staff. In spite of that the staff never appeared stressed or rushed while servicing a line of check-ins and check-outs. I wish I knew the names of the staff who I interacted with directly so that I may thank them. That includes the housekeeper who I met at the elevator. We had a fun conversation while waiting and then as we were going down to the first floor. I can imagine that it was a very busy day for her, but yet you'd never know it. The accommodations were excellent for both comfort and cleanliness. Even though my stay was for only one night, it was still great having a kitchen which I used for night time snacks while checking emails and watching some TV before going to bed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A home away from home. The nicest staff you'll ever encounter in all areas of the hotel, we loved Paulina who took care of our room all week, the front desk staff always corteous and helpful and the breakfast staff very efficient and responsive to all our needs.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great hotel in a great location. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Complimentary Breakfast is amazing and has lots of choices for all ages. The lobby is really nice, and it's great that the hotel offers 24 hour coffee/hot water/tea service.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is ok, rooms of a good standard, what lets this place down is the very bad quality of the food served for breakfast, it's really bad, artificial scrambled eggs, plastic taste and look like bacon, always the same every day, gluey porridge, ice cold butter single portions, tinned fruits, toaster that doesn't toast, a I can go on and on, absolutely dreadful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect location! Excellent customer service! And the rooms, for the typical tiny NYC rooms, this is considered bigger! So nice to have a big full size fridge, freezer, kitchen, sink and kitchen ammentidies. It's a pleasant surprise! Clean, modern. I would like a bigger bathroom but it's NYC! Good enough. Would definitely recommend this hotel!
user_name:
cindy1818_13
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean and comfortable, great location. Access to subway and attractions, restaurants and shops excellent. Breakfast could be better, not much selection, and kitchen staff not so friendly. and Internet service not so great.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great clean hotel off the beaten path. Close to subway. Lobby is way too small for all the people staying in the hotel. Breakfast was way too crowded and afternoon cookies were gone in minutes. Friendly staff and very clean hotel. Our room was perfect for us. Roof top is nothing to brag about.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 11 night stay over Christmas and New Year. Quite basic, but clean and modern. It has everything you need, and great price too. It has the facilities to do self-catering too.The staff are all exceptionally friendly and helpful. Cleaning up to a very high standard.Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 1st time in nyc & this hotel made my experience wonderful!!!Excellent staff,great breakfast,clean rooms, complimentary snacks in room(My favorite part),comfortable beds, full kitchenette,I mean honestly u cnt ask 4 much more..I had a king size bed with pull out sofa, I slept well no noise that kept me up.Walking distance of Port authority bus terminal, Macy's shopping district, 8 minute walk from times square & Rockefeller center..my only con is that their was no body mirrors in the rm & the shower was small but I'm a petite person so it didn't bother me..thank u so much homewood suites 4 the great time!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is ideally suited for Times Square and Broadway being 15 minutes from either and the rooms are big and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and breakfast is plentiful with a lot of choice. Not much seating after 0900 but you have to expect that. We had no issues and we stayed for Christmas so it was very busy. We would have no hesitation in going back in the future and the kids loved it as well.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for three nights over Christmas. I had originally booked a Hilton in the FiDi for four nights but when our plans changed, I could not get the same rate but found a slightly better rate at the Homewood Suites Times Square South. Frankly, I was a bit less enthusiastic because of the location, which has historically not been a top one for tourists (though safe). It has not been known for good dining, for example.I need not have worried. The hotel, itself, is newer and the rooms exhibit an ingenious use of space and give the impression of being larger than they are. We had a king room with a twin sofabed that sat two, as well as a desk and chair, a small sofa table which could be used for snacks and another ingenious feature--a rolling table, stored under the desk, at which three people could sit and eat. There is a real closet and set of drawers and a nice bath with shower. There is also a kitchenette in each room with a two burner stovetop, full refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher and enough utensils, tableware and cookware to satisfy anyone! While the hotel does include breakfast in the rate (some hot and cold options such as cereals, prepared eggs and meats, toast, bagels and several healthy options such as fruit, yogurt and oatmeal), the kitchenette is handy if you would rather prepare breakfast and eat in the room, buy and prepare lunch and dinner provisions or leftovers or just have snacks! Our room was on the 17th floor facing West 37th Street and we were not bothered by noise. The double shades ensured that lighting was blocked so we slept well.Location-wise, the hotel is convenient to Penn Station and Port Authority Bus terminal, both of which we used during our stay. But it is also far enough from each that one is not bothered by their congestion. It is in walking distance to Grand Central Station, from which we took a train up the Hudson Valley for a day trip AND it is within walking distance to great dining options on 9th Avenue and the upper West 30s. FINALLY, the staff is fantastic: friendly and service-oriented. Despite the crowds over the holidays, checkin was fast and courteous, the breakfast dining area was constantly cleaned and food replenished, the housekeeping very good. Kudos especially to the front-desk staff who noticed I had left my IPad behind and retrieved it for me. I would not hesitate to return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This Homewood Suites deserves its high TripAdvisor rating. It is a bit of a hike from Rockefeller Center or Times Square in the cold but close enough to walk. The room was modern, sleek, and the beds comfortable. I was pleased with the size for a hotel room in the city. Breakfast was quite busy but good. My scone was even warm! I would recommend this hotel in the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel close to Times Square and far away enough to have a nice and restful sleep. The rooms are modern and you have everything you need. The bed and pillows were very comfy. The breakfast was fantastic and the staff super friendly and accommodating. Special mention to the staff taking care of the breakfast area, they were so fast replenishing food and cleaning everything up. Overall, a great stay and would go back again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A beautiful hotel right in midtown that won't disappoint you. Great hotel if your are headed to Times Square or need a kitchen for ease in the city. The clean, quiet large rooms makes you enjoy your stay. The extremely friendly service makes you want to return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights over Christmas. The best NYC hotel I have stayed in, and I have stayed in quite a few. Newly remodeled and extremely clean. Very large room, especially for NYC. Full size fridge and microwave came in very handy for heating up leftovers from dinners out. 24 hr coffee, tea, and hot chocolate was a great perk. Breakfast was great with different choices each day and many different options. Would definitely recommend and would stay again for sure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed this hotel. Location was perfect location for all the tourist spots without being right in the middle of Times Square. Loved the breakfast, all day hot drinks available and seating area. Used the business center a few times to print out game tickets. Clean, updated cozy hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location close to Times Square, close to subway, better amenities than most hotels in the area. Very well maintained Rooms with Complimentary Breakfast. The Staff is very accomodating. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: promised both breakfast and dinner at hotel breakfast was included daily dinner... when we booked...they promised daily dinner included instead...gave us $20 voucher for food for two persons in New York City...what a joke small pizzia..was $20 with our voucher

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Went for a quick overnight stay The day before Christmas Eve at this Midtown hotel. Staff was very friendly and accommodating lobby was comfortable and clean room with spotless. Loved the efficiency with the dishwasher even though we're not staying long enough to use it. Beautiful rooftop terrace with nice views of the city. The Christmas music playing on the rooftop terrace made us feel very festive before heading to see the sights for Christmas. Quick walk from Penn station and to Rockefeller Center .complementary breakfast was delicious and seating was a bit tight for the amount of people staying. Would definitely stay again.
user_name:
mrswegman
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was very busy due to Christmas. The hotel staff handled everything professionally. The free coffee Bar was available all day and always fully stocked. The Breakfast buffet had a variety of hot & cold foods which was plentiful. The property was well maintained. The WiFi is free and worked as it should.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean and comfortable. Close to everything. Continental breakfast was busy but kept up nicely. Staff was friendly and accommodating, held our bags so we could continue enjoying the city on our last day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed in hotel during christmas time. The location is great. The hotel is situated close to Lincoln Tunnel, Penn Station and Port Authority bus terminal. The rooms are newly renovated and very clean.The front desk staff was very friendly and we even got a call if our room was OK shortly after arriving at our room.Breakfast is included with the room price. Unlike many hotels, hot breakfast options are there along with the usual continental choices. The Kitchenette has a fridge and stove and all the necessities that is good if one wants to cook or warm their food.Parking is next door and cost 45 dollars with hotel validation. Time Square is a short walk away and closest metro station is 34th/Penn.I would definitely recommend this hotel for a family vacation or for a longer stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Truly near all major attractions! Three blocks down via 8th Ave walk and there is the Madison Sq, POst Office. Duane Reade, Tick tock Diner and Penn Station. Being near Penn and the nearby subway stations 9 for 2.75USD min) along 8th made going about easy especially to Long Island via LIRR.Homewood is truly near Broadway at 42 -49th St Three blocks to the east is 5th Ave and walking uptown you get to see a lot of great spots like Rockefeller, St Patricks - all the shops - all the way to Central Park - all very nice pleasant walks.. The I train at 8th Ave will take you to the Business District and Brooklyn Br. The breakfast is always delicious and filling and the staff are all friendly and efficient! Frontliners esp Bryan, Tiara , Yvette are very helpful with maps and directions, Danny helped us with tickets and even with our airport transfer. Cesar was quick to come for a minor repair in the bath and Victorina is always bright and cheerful at the 7th floor. The mini kitchen was very efficient and we used the microwave a lot! The secure pay laundry at the basement was a lifesaver for our two week stay! The business room also at the basement was a great for web search at times when my T mobile is slow. A parking garage nearby can get your van settled for 45usd overnight. Affordable diners like Tick Tock. Walk to Wok, Mc Donald's, DD , 1 usd Pizza are nearby at 8th, Schnippers and Shake Shack are also near, together with the New Jersey Buses just in front of the NY Times Building. Definitely I recommend Homewood Midtown NYC! Especially for Asians who are coming for the first time to NYC! .

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There are several types of rooms at Homewood Suites, but I stayed in the King Suite - not the Efficiency. The room was clean and spacious and I wasn't forever bumping into the bed/furniture moving about the room. There was a small 2-seater sofa and a TV dinner table which was convenient since I had take-out food and ate on the couch watching TV. The bed was comfortable and even though I was on the 5th floor, I didn't hear any traffic noise which is indicative of NYC. The blackout curtains were great as well! They have coffee 24/7 and a hot/cold buffet downstairs every morning. I didn't eat any of the food, but it was your standard fare with eggs, breakfast meat, cereal, etc. I had a great stay and would definitely stay again.
user_name:
DCharlieNYC
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel for a family vacation during Christmas. I knew that hotels in NY tend to have smaller rooms. We had a suite with a king bed and a pull out sofa. This is not like most of the Homewood Suites that I've stayed at. The king bed and the sofa bed were side by side. This was not a suite. It was a room with a king bed and a sofa bed (twin size). The room was quite small and difficult for 3 of us to move around in. There was very little storage, so we all pretty much lived out of our suitcases. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The complimentary breakfast was good. I would caution everyone to choose a room higher up because the lobby noise was definitely audible from the 2nd floor. One night, there was a large and noisy group still going at 12:45 AM and keeping us awake. I am a Hilton Honors diamond member, so I have pretty high expectations of the higher tier hotels. In this case, I believe that location alone drives the price. The hotel is nice, but it is not as nice as other Hilton hotels of the same equivalent that I've stayed at in the past.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the hotel was fantastic ,good location ,rooms were spotless,staff was friendly and very helpful ,loby are was great with fireplace ,the full break fast was really good .would highly recommend this hotel and will be back again ,

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: As one would expect in New York the room was pretty small. However, it was pristine! On the modern side, beautiful floors, white linens, comfy bed, nice view. The common area downstairs was so nice. Very inviting. Couches, tables and chairs, 24 hour coffee, tea, hot chocolate.... perfect after winter sightseeing. And a wonderful breakfast was included. We'll definitely stay again if I can get my husband to go back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I came back this time with my husband and baby. We did not have to ask for a crib. The staff saw the baby and said we will send up a crib. It was set up when they delivered, which we had not experienced at other hotels. Breakfast was tasty as usual. When the snow hit my scheduled ride could not make it on time. The hotel staff made alternative arrangements for me so I was not late for my appointment. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed for three nights in an efficiency with a pull-out sofa bed. Room was very clean, modern and updated. During 17 degree weather the lobby was toasty warm as was the staff. Very efficient check-in with plenty of people at the front desk. I called downstairs once and within minutes someone was at my room to assist me with something I couldn't figure out. Everyone was very helpful and courteous. I never eat the free hotel breakfast, but I saw many families eating during my stay, and they seemed to be enjoying it. There's a very good grocery store Brooklyn Fare a couple of blocks away. They have everything you need to stock your refrigerator, plus toiletries, etc. The room size was easily double what I had when I stayed one week at a Hampton Inn at Times Square. I would never stay there again after staying at the Homewood Suites. The walk to Penn Station is more like 3/10 of a mile than 6/10 like another reviewer wrote. You need to exit on the 8th avenue side of the station. I took the train from the airport both ways pulling a suitcase, my large tote bag and a yoga mat easily. The walk was less than 10 minutes even on the crowded streets, and waiting for lights to change.The only recommendation I have is there are thousands of people coming through this hotel daily and I never saw a hand sanitizing station. I kept looking for them. People all around me were coughing and sneezing in fairly close quarters and bathroom access is limited. Plus, a lot of people don't wash their hands even with access to a sink. I would love to see more places do what my Whole Foods in Coral Gables did. They have sinks inside and outside the bathroom specifically for people to wash their hands prior to eating along with hand sanitizers. Other than that, this hotel is a winner.
user_name:
Kellyexcursions
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel, very convenient if you are driving in from NJ. Beautiful lobby, ample hot breakfast, modern rooms. Lots of hooks in bathroom (so many hotels get this wrong). Great friendly staff. Excellent shower. Tons of outlets.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My wife and I just got back from New York after 5 nights at the Homewood Suites Midtown- Times Square. We took a cab over and it cost about $50 from LaGuardia and about 30 minutes (traffic was good). We got there super early (around 9am) and they let us check in and held our bags until the room was ready. The customer service was exceptional and they called us by 11am with a room ready.We were on the second floor which I was worried about at first because of street noise. Truthfully it wasn't a problem except the trash and laundry pickup a couple nights around 11pm and mornings early. Other than rush hour, traffic on 37th wasn't bad so it was actually pretty quiet. The advantage to the low floor like that is that the wait for elevators seemed long most days at busy times so we actually used it only 3 times in 6 days.Breakfast was okay. Don't expect any pork but there was always some eggs and turkey sausage/bacon, and other things like hash browns or waffles. We stocked up on coffee each morning and also on the way back through the lobby every day. Overall we didn't pay for breakfast a single day which allowed us to fit some better options in for lunch and dinner each day. To us, that was a great deal.The location is 2 blocks north of the 34th street station entrance to pick up the A,C, E trains. Or you can walk another block and get to 1,2,3 train or 2 more (in the other direction or continuing down the island) to get to a bunch of other lines.One of the absolute best things about this hotel is the location. You are a few blocks from Times Square, Bryant Park, Macy's, and the Empire State Building. However you are tucked away off of 8th instead of stuck right in the middle of all the noise and confusion. We were in the subway within 2 minutes of the hotel or Times Square/Macy's/MSG within 5. The bed was SUPER comfortable, pillow was superb, and there were plenty of channels on the TV. We didn't have any issues and the room was way cleaner than many I have stayed in larger cities. Service was outstanding!!! However... Let me say this... We were super nice to the front desk and they were beyond kind in return. We witnessed a couple being rude to the front desk and they got less than desirable service in return. But that has been my experience everywhere in NYC other than the poshest joints. If you are nice to New Yorkers, they will be nice right back. If you are a jerk... Well...Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling for pleasure. You can get downtown, Central Park, Brook, Times Square, the Village, etc. very conveniently! Nice rooms, nice people, and a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: One of my favorite hotels in the midtown area in New York.Not the most luxurious but very well kept and clean.Easy to get to and out of the city!If your coming from Newark take the train to Penn station and the walk is ~0.6miles.Leaving to Newark is very simple and efficient simply take the bus from the port Authority called Newark airport express located in the center road which passes through the port authority.The price is 16$ x personI spent between my family just 40$ and no stops straight to the airport. A taxi would have cost 75-100$The front desk is very quick and efficient with check in and check out!The rooms a small but clean! I had a king size with a bathroom and living room, mini kitchen and fridge!Breakfast is served between 6-11 and is fair!The have coffee and hot cocoa all day in the lobby.The gym is ok for a non enthusiast few free weights!You can go to the rooftop 22nd floor and enjoy the view!If it is snowing it is the best since your kids can play with CLEAN snow.Hungry no problem you got dunkin doughnuts in the corner, McD close, pizza place and lots of small restaurants!I got some Asian cuisine close called kung fu restaurant which was very good and fresh!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel extremely nice and welcoming, very close to Times Square and actually nearly everything. Good breakfast, luxury rooms, is nice and very helpful staff. They were very helpful in providing hotel rides, taxis, luggage service. Very unusual New York experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location. Close to Herald square and Time square. Excellent value for location. Staff are friendly and helpful. Suites are larger than expected in a NYC hotel. Would definitely stay here again and recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Would definitely stay here again, I went with my two daughters for a short break and it was great location. Nice complimentary breakfast but it could have a bit more of a variation on the hot food option.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A fantastic location - only about a ten minute walk from Times Square and five minute walk from Macy's - you're really centralized without all of the noise. Rooms were clean, spacious and breakfast was filling with a good variety each day. The service was some of the best I've ever encountered. We were really, really early having come in on a red eye flight and the Director of Front Office (I can't recall her name) was amazing and offered us breakfast while we waited for a room to be checked. We then were able to receive a late check-out for a reasonable fee which really made our stay very convenient. The hotel was clean, spacious (for NYC) and the rooms offered a full fridge, microwave and range which is typical for a Homewood but very convenient for all of the amazing leftovers you get from dining in the city. Fantastic stay overall!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is ideally located off of 8th Avenue between Penn Station and the Port Authority bus terminal. It is close to Times Square, the Broadway theater district and many restaurants in the Hell's Kitchen district. The hotel's staff was very friendly and the facilities were clean and well appointed. The lobby had a fireplace with coffee and hot cocoa available 24 hours. Despite the name, the 'suites' are small but comfortable. The complimentary breakfast offered a good variety but the hot choices were not to my liking. Unlike many of the hotels in midtown where I have stayed before, the room was very quiet devoid of sirens and car horn sounds which is typical of New York.
user_name:
Arnold P
San Diego, California, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Had a very enjoyable mini vacation/get away for my husband and I. The hotel was excellent. The staff exceptional. The property is located close to everything we wanted to do and see. Very well kept up property and and suites are very spacious compared to many NYC hotels.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We took a nice in NYC away from the kiddos! The breakfast was great and cookies in the afternoon were a nice surprise when we popped in for a few minutes. The hotel is located on a busier side of Manhattan with access to a lot of tourist areas. This wasn't our ideal (we usually stay in Gramercy Park) area, but we loved the hotel and the staff was super nice and accommodating and more than willing to help. The hotel was clean, hip, and provided nice options in the rooms (stove, fridge, etc, if you need that kind of thing, but we didn't use as it was only one night).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is one of the best places to stay in the city as far as getting what you pay for. It's clean, comfortable & the staff is very polite. They have more amenities than hotels much more expensive than this. Would definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: we had a pleasant 4 night stay at this Homewood Suites. It is located a short walk from Pen Station and Times Square. The breakfast is excellent and food selection varies each day. All employees were courteous and helpful. Room was very neat, clean and well-equipped.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed 3 nights and the rooms are excellent. Staff is the best and always ready to help and greet you with a smile. No problems and would recommend in a second. The lobby is small but really beautiful with the fireplace and waterfall. The 24 hours coffee, tea and cocoa is always a plus, especially in the winter. My only suggestion would be to add pancakes or french toast to the breakfast bar. Everything else is there!!!! Keep up the great work!!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If you are looking for a clean, convenient hotel near Penn Station, Homewood Suites will work. It is not fancy, but it is clean and the rooms have all the kitchen amenities: refrigerator, stove, microwave. The breakfast area gets very crowded, but the selections are above average for a budget hotel. the layout of our suite was not ideal: the noisy refrigerator was about two feet from the edge of the bed. But the hotel is not far from subways that take you where you need to go.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Actually a pretty small hotel room and we had a premium suite. Certainly nothing remotely comparable to a suite. The sofa barely sat two and the bed was a single. Once pulled out you pretty much had no floor space.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A group of old high school friends spent 4 days in New York City sightseeing and shopping in early December. We stayed at the Homewood Suites and it was great. We reserved 2 rooms with 2 in each room and had plenty of space. Beds were so comfy. Staff was excellent. Great location to Times Square and Garment District. Would not hesitate to stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We go into Manhattan each year around Thanksgiving and this was the first time we've stayed at the Homewood Suites. The room was very nice - full size refrigerator for example - and the location was excellent. A short walk to Times Square / Penn Station, not far from Bryant Square etc. Breakfast was reasonably good. An outstanding value for what we paid (we expected to pay much more for this type of stay).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Rooms have small kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, and stove. Rooms are well insulated and quite which is great for NYC. Location is 3 blocks from bus terminal and Penn Station. Newark airport is easy to get to via sky train from Newark. Only 5-6 blocks from Times Square. I would recommend it to any one.Breakfast buffet is great in the morning and the king bed rooms have a pull out couch which is great for family of 3.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for month of Dec. First appearance of lobby that it was very clean and updated. This also goes for the rooms. All updated and very nice. I would highly recomendAll staff members very nice.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The management and staff couldn't have been more professional and gracious. The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch. I was sad that the evening wine, beer and heavy Horderves were not offered at t his location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is just a little off the beaten path, but the staff was very pleasant, courteous and professional. The room was very spacious and clean, there is also a complimentary breakfast included in the stay. Overall, it was a good experience and I would stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I fell in love with Homewood Suites because of this trip! The location, facilities, and room are all top notch (full size fridge, or mini dishwasher anyone?). I actually thought the hotel had an even more glamorous high end feel than I even expected. And the Christmas decorations were so beautiful and so delightful! But the star here with question is the staff.The staff here are the friendliest, and went of their way on several occasions to get me early check in (I arrived at 5:30am), make copies for me for my presentation, right down to the housekeeping lady who was so kind and would always say hello when she saw me and ask me if I needed anything. They seemed like they genuinely liked each other and always had a convivial, caring spirit for guests and each other whenever they interacted. I have managed more than one team and all I can say is, that is by no means an accident, and I commend the management for a job well done. Your team is a wonderful reflection of you- congratulations! I look forward to returning for a stay soon! Thanks again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here this week and was as i expected , room was comfortable and was at the perfect temperature all the time , buffet breakfast also was very nice and had a selection every morning . not far from times square . would definateley stay again .

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall good experience, had no problems. Breakfast was blahh but in a great central location and close to the Javits center. Would recommend for a business stay but could be tight with multiple people in the room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Modern & clean hotel with all expected amenities. Have read other reviews which complained about the busy lifts and breakfast. We were on the go early so did not experience any delays in getting the lifts or getting a table at breakfast. Had to call housekeeping on 2 occasions (not any fault with hotel - once for more pillow and once for a bedding change due to a spillage and found Jeffery more than helpful and pleasant on both occasions. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location near Penn Station. Helpful and friendly front staff. Very nice rooms that were recently remodeled. Very small, but it is NYC. Free wifi and breakfast was a plus. Lobby had a nice feel with lots of seating and a lovely fireplace. Would stay there again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel will keep you and your family comfortable. There is a small kitchen for families and comfortable beds and a small couch. Breakfast is very nice and the location is good too. We took train from Newark Airport and got off at Penn Station and walked 5 blocks to hotel. There are cookies from 3:00 pm until 6:00 pm. Coffee and hot chocolate are always available along with fruit. The hotel room wasn't ready because we arrived early but the hotel changed our room for us at as we had tickets to the Rockettes at 3:00 pm and needed to freshen up. This hotel is a good choice. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Better than average experience with Great Staff. The checkin experience was somewhat off, but it is New York so that is to be expected. The staff at this location is second to none. They knew their area and what to see & do, and where to eat.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If you need a place near Times Square and Javits then this is the place for you. Mini kitchen and a ceiling fan..enough said but I will say more. The staff was friendly and room was tidy. I would recommend this to anyone coming to NYC. Also TV was great.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent 10 days at this hotel ,nice rooms big bed ,pleasant and polite staff nice having a hotel with breakfast great location for times square and shopping etc only 5 minute walk away Penn station 5,,minute walk

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'll start with the good: the hotel does not feel dated, and the rooms and the common area are clean. The rooms have a fridge, a microwave and a stove, which could be useful for some. Also, if you have a big family and are budget minded, they do offer very basic complimentary breakfast in the morning.I had a pretty awful experience with housekeeping. My girlfriend and I left the room at 9am (made sure the "shhhh" sign was off), and when we got back at 2:15pm the room still was not made! I figured "ok, this happens", called housekeeping and asked to bring new towels. After the towels came, my girlfriend and I took a little nap, only to be woken up 20 minutes into-it by another housekeeping person who disregarded the "do not disturb" sign and brought more towels. When I asked her why would she disturb us despite the sign, she simply said "I have your towels" - not even an apology. Also, the immediate neighborhood is pretty sketchy, and the rooms are definitely on a small side. So, we stayed there two nights, our room was never made, and the housekeeping was outright rude or inconsiderate - you pick. Not ever coming back for sure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel itself was very nice. Small rooms, but it did have a large refrigerator / freezer and coin laundry. The rooms were modern and comfortable. Our housekeeper was great and the folks at the front desk were generally helpful. One in our group ended up sleeping on the floor and got some bites (they allow pets), but the staff gave us a new room right away. The only bad thing I have to say is that over the last four or so years, the quality of the food has really dropped to being inedible. They used to serve thick bacon and strawberry waffles with whipped cream in the morning, but you won't find any of that at Homewood Suites anymore! In addition, dinner is no longer served. They stopped that in August. It's on a side street in the garment district near to Penn station and Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent position with excellent customer service. Never utilised kitchen as space is too small. Overall room very clean and suitable for couples rather than family. One tip to aussie holidaying in NY the term 'excuse me means 'get the hell out of my way'.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is super nice and relaxing-not stuffy at all. The neighboring businesses are a bit sketchy. Breakfast was a great and the staff was on top of keeping everything clean after each table was finished. You are a 20/30 min walk to Times Square. Maybe 30/45 min to 30 Rock.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is my second stay at this property, and this time we had two rooms and I stayed with my children. Well the hotel seems to have gotten more popular and the breakfast was more crowded this year, I would still recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York, but especially if they plan on visiting the theater district. It's an easy walk, but the hotel is on a nice quiet street that isn't loud at night. The hotel staff was incredibly accommodating and the rooms are clean and well appointed. The pillows and mattresses are wonderful and having a full kitchen is crucial, if you plan on bringing home leftovers or you have little picky kids to cook for.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Cookies and milk or a coffee bar in the lobby. A warm fireplace near the elevators. A warm breakfast included. Can't beat this hotel for a stay in Manhattan. Comfy beds, a kitchenette, wifi, complimentary waters in the room. Would come again.
user_location: North Babylon, New York, United States
user_name:
Linda C
North Babylon, New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: great location, excellent service, friendly staff, clean , great breakfast. Able to walk to times square, Macey's Empire State building,close to great restaurants .All in all very convenient location. We would certainly stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wow, what a superb stay! My family of four had an outstanding experience at this property! Many thanks to Sairy, Tiara and Cleo for their outstanding customer service! Check-in was super smooth and their can-do attitudes we amazing. We had to move rooms because of an housekeeping issue, but the staff, especially Stefan, was super professional and helpful! The breakfast is great and the all day tea and coffee a great touch. But, those cookies--all I can say is WOW! Thanks again Homewood Suites for making my families vacation to NYC over Thanksgiving such a wonderful experience. As a native Southerner, we pride ourselves on hospitality--its clear to me that we don't have a monopoly on it! Your entire Homewood Suites staff clearly demonstrated that! Thanks!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel. Beatiful room, excellent breakfast and coffee any time of the day. Apple cider in the afternoon. Good location. You wont regret a thing,they even gave us our room just after noon. Perfect!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Rooms huge, and spotless with all the amenities. Breakfast buffet was well done. Place was busy with many guests, but all attended to us with smiles. Free newspaper. We have absolutely no complaints. Will get the word out on this one!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for three nights on 11/23 to 11/26 rm. 911 with wife and two son 3 and 18months. The hotel is close to Penn Station which is a plus. The room are spacious for NY and clean. The lobby is warm and comfy with 24 hour coffee, tea, hot coco a plus. Close to many tourist attractions and a quick walk or subway ride to others.The hotel has a modern touchRooms have a modern touch, roomy and comfy and maintained with kitchenette.The lobby is comfortable and welcoming.Breakfast is ok with choices and is included with stayFront desk staff for the most part were professional some are very good at multitasking Their is no evening social or substitute for it at this HWS.Overall the place is nice

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: GREAT location EXCELLENT staff and accomadations and services Purchased Romance package got a great room with an outside deck. Roses and a bottle of wine and a handwritten note and was very pleased as this was our 25th Anniversary

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Awesome stay loved the location, the room ,staff was great plus a free breakfast, great workout facility , most activities were within walking distance, loved having kitchen facilities and the bed was comfortable

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Good breakfast, clean big room, friendly staff. Excellent location. Staff was very helpful. Allowed us to check in early on the day of our arrival. Hotel was clean.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here to attend the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade. Price was reasonable, room was great and it was very close to parade route. Easy parking at a good rate. Close to stores, restaurants and souvenir shops

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There are too many good things to write about. This is an excellent hotel for the dance community. Its a short walk to Broadway dance center and Times Square. I loved the big breakfast and complimentary coffee and hot cocoa all day! This is the biggest room we have ever had in New York. Rooms looked brand new and modern and so clean. The staff was so helpful and offered to help in all ways. I highly recommend this to any family traveling to New York. - Dance family from SC

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were in Manhattan for a couples week. This hotel was central, clean, reasonably priced yet compact. The roommate small. The elevators come in a priority we had never experienced elsewhere. We never used the evening social activities and unlike most other Homewood Suite properties there is no evening meal Monday's to Thursday's, nor complementary done and beer.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: An overnight trip to see a play. Very nice property - modern rooms, well equipped. Nice rooftop terrace with a glimpse of the Hudson and the Empire State Building. Easy walk from Penn Station to hotel and then hotel to theatres and Time Square, Macy's, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and Library. Couple blocks from subway to the rest of NYC! Helpful staff. And after years of complaining about cheap OJ at Hilton breakfasts, I can praise their new Sunkist OJ! Yeah! :) Will recommend this hotel to others

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has done away with the evening reception. Now it is similar to many other hotel in the same area. Therefore, no good reason to stay here next time. Nothing makes this hotel special. Guest appreciated the special treatment, now they will no longer receive it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First of all, I am a HHonors customer and have stayed several nights at other Hilton properties in the past year. For each of these stays, I have taken advantage of the check in option promoted and provided by Hilton via their app. NEVER once did I encounter the issue I encountered at this property.This property DECIDES to put a hold on your card when you use the check in option PRIOR TO CHECK IN, SO, if you decide to use a different card, other than the one which is attached to your Hilton account, you cannot without having two holds on two different accounts. At no other Hilton properties has this occurred BEFORE I arrive to check in.I am not naive or uneducated about the use of holds, however, I was NOT told that my card attached to my Hilton account had had a hold placed upon it when I checked in and requested a different card be used.When I contacted the front desk prior to departure and then again afterward via the online survey and comments, I was sent an email by the Assistant Manager of the Front Desk that said, "we apologize the old if the hold of funds trumped your experience in NYC . . . " Word choice aside, I then contacted Hilton Corporate offices and was told that this property's staff lied and said they told me about the hold upon check in. Common sense strongly opposes this claim of theirs because what customers would agree to two holds on two separate cards at the same time tying up hundreds of dollars?? And my cousin, who was with me at check in, can verify that this information was not given to me as "claimed" by the staff.The Asst. Manager ended the email with "We hope this instance does not deter you from returning to our property once more in the future." This is a joke, right? The entire episode reeked of a property philosophy toward customers which is outside of the quality service and treatment I have received at other Hilton named properties. And when I go to NYC in the future I will be staying away from Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this great new hotel located near Times Square and Hudson Yards. The rooms are fantastic with full kitchens and more amenities than most hotels. The lobby is warm and roomy. It was a pleasure having friends meet me there. I highly recommend this hotel for either business or pleasure!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family and I are just back from NYC we stayed here for 7 nights the hotel staff were fantastic room was good size even though there was five of us .breakfast was ok but because we are Scottish a beef or pork sausage would have been good. I read other reviews about the lifts not being great but we had no issues with them. The only thing I would criticize was the fire alarm when it went off we thought it was the dishwasher or microwave not very loud and doesn't sound like firealarms in the UK ,but all in all we had an amazing time in newyork .I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting nyc close to centre of Manhattan.Thank you again Homewood for my card and bottle for my birthday ,Tiara it was a nice surprise and great start to or holiday.from the Mastertons in room 613

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here! I've worked at 3 different Homewood's in the past, and this was such a great property in the city. All of the staff were friendly, it was close enough to walk to pretty much everything as well! We needed a room with two beds once we got there and we were able to get an accessible room that had two beds- the room was HUGE. I have never seen such a large room for a NYC hotel. Breakfast was good in the morning, and the ice tea and cookies were a treat in evening as we were leaving to walk around. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is a wonderful addition for those families traveling to Manhattan. There are not many hotels that can accommodate a family of 5. The hotel is easy to get to and only 5 short blocks to the subway and time square. The parking garage for your car is expensive $50 for vans/SUVs but they all are. It is only 1 block from hotel. The hotel rooms have 2 queen beds, pullout sofa bed, and kitchenette. Plenty of room for people and luggage. The rooms were nice and clean. The breakfast in the morning is nice and an included feature. There is hot drinks including hot cocoa for the kids all day long in the lobby. The front staff is very helpful and friendly. I would stay here over and over again when visiting Manhattan. We walked to times square many times, we walked to the Empire State Building, Rockefeller center, trump tower, and the intrepid. We rode the subway to farther locations. This is a great hotel and I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I will start with the good because there is more good things about it then bad.Hotel has a nice lobby that offers tea/coffee I believe all the time. Check in was pretty good - not sure why and I find this in most of the hotels we stay in that no matter how early I make the reservation and request to be put on a higher floor in a quiet room away from the elevators it never happens. And again with this hotel, we were put on the 5th floor although it was a room away from the elevators. If there is a secret to getting on one of the higher floors would love to know what it is. Doesn't matter if your a rewards member or not, we just cannot seem to get that request honored. The rooms there are really nice, the small kitchen area with the stainless steel and granite and wood or laminate flooring instead of dirty rugs are really nice. Everything is very modern in the rooms. The rooms are pretty quiet to outside noise of the streets also. Now onto the bad - we always completely check the beds when we first check in and one of the beds in our room definitely needed to be replaced as did the sheet on it. While it was apparently washed and clean everywhere else, there was a stain looked like coffee or tea on it at the end of the bed and the bed itself was in pretty rough shape. I wanted to change rooms because of it but we were heading out to eat and a basketball game and did not have the time. Also, the breakfast was bad. I know it's free but the waffles were cold and just tasted weird. The eggs were bad and we have never come across this at a hotel, but they had no regular half and half just a bunch of flavored/sweetened creamers which neither my husband or I like. So we didn't have any coffee and seeing as we drink that first thing in the morning especially after our late night, it was disappointing. At $360 a night. they definitely need to have someone check the beds and the sheets better when cleaning the rooms.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We fit 6 in a room, haha. I love that the rooms have wood floors and not gross carpet. Rooms had a lot of outlets. We had a full kitchen, 2 beds & a pullout. This hotel was very close to where we had to be for the weekend. Easy to get to. Not a far walk from times square or other attractions. Lots of food near by, and super close to penn station & the subway. Our room was clean. The rooftop access was a bonus. Complementary breakfast was very convenient for us. When we come back next year for the event we attend I will probably book this hotel again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 9 nights in October 2016. Price included hot/cold breakfast (really good and plentiful) and free wifi. Hotel is in a great location, only 5 minute walk to 42nd St bus station and subway as well as 5 minute walk to 34th St Penn Station. Hotel is very clean and rooms are big enough (enough room to have 3 large suitcases by the door). Room was serviced daily with toiletries & plenty of towels. There is a coin operated laundry with 4 washers & 4 dryers as well as a business centre with 2 computers/printers etc. There were power points by the bed and on the desk as well as in the kitchenette to recharge batteries etc and a safe & microwave. Several places to eat around the corner on 8th Ave and Times Square is about 10-15 minutes walk. 7/11 around the corner as well. We travelled with our 7yr old so being close to everything was great. In the lobby, they offered free tea/coffee/hot chocolate 24hrs. Staff helpful and pleasant. This hotel is in such a great location, would definitely stay here again in lucky enough to be back in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have been to New York yearly for the last 30 years. This was by far the cleanest hotel and roomiest. I loved the location and it was so quiet compared to staying in time square. The staff was friendly and always available. Loved the variety at breakfast with plenty of food options. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My two friends and I stayed last week for five nights at the Homewood Suites. Very nice room (2 queen size beds); a large room by anyone's standards, complete with microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator, etc. Plus a "real" breakfast thrown in - breakfast room was across from the lobby. Very reasonable pricing, very helpful front desk staff made this a very comfortable stay. The location was best - midtown Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were a family of 4 and felt comfortable in a studio with 2 big beds and 1 double sofa bed. The places we wanted to see and the restaurants we desired to dine in were within walking distance or a short subway ride. Yes, the subway station is only a few minute walk from the hotel. All through our 14-day stay, we were made to feel like we were back home where breakfast was ready each day we woke up, though it was the same stuff everyday :) Coffee, tea and hot chocolate were waiting for us when we came back each evening from our day's activities. We especially loved the guys at Reception who never failed to say hello each day. The Concierge, Danny was most patient when we asked him to change our pick-up schedule and some tickets to some shows. It was a lovely trip we had in Fall and we made the right choice of accommodation. As an owner of a travel company, I will recommend Homewood Suites to my clients and friends because I know I will not fail them.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family and I got a great deal for this hotel via TripAdvisor. Can't recommend this place enough! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and allowed us to leave our bags with them free of charge while we went to walk around Times Square. The hotel is extremely close to everything, close enough that you could pretty much walk to wherever without having to call fur a taxi/Uber. The atmosphere was amazing, our room was nice, beds are extremely comfy. Breakfast is free, but I suggest getting there as soon as it opens as it can get packed pretty fast. Coffee/tea/hot chocolate is served all day for free as well which was a plus for us as it was a little cold when we visited. I do want to add that some comments have said the elevators are slow, but my guess is because the hotel has 22 floors. :) They did seem fast to us whenever we needed it, and if we did have to wait it was only for about a minute or two, but nothing more than that.I can't recommend Homewood Suites enough, and will definitely make this my go to hotel for future trips to New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Did a last minute booking. I was afraid cause it said it was good for 2 pax only and we were 6. Was shocked when we checked in that it had a king bed, sofa bed, kitchen (with stove and ref) and had nice lobby.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Walking distance to theater district, Times Square, Penn Station. Two blocks to subway. Complimentary full breakfast. Suite kitchenette adequate for some cooking. Rooftop terrace. Exercise room, business center, laundry. Good for business or tourist.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was surprised by this hotel. Breakfast really good and the people that worked at this hotel were amazing. Rooms were bigger than I expected for NY hotel. I would recommend the Homewood suites. Location is perfect where you can work every where. Since it's not on the avenue and it's located on the street, it's gets quiet at night.
user_name:
omg20162016
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Centra location near broadway, nice reception area, rooms look bigger in photos than the truth but r not small. Took a room on the 10th floor u were exposed to the apartments in front of u I think starting the 12 floor u would have an unobstructed view the hotel has more than 20 floors. The 8th floor has balconies they are a good idea in summer or for smokers for a quick smoke with out having to leave the hotel. Staff are nice but have little patience maybe they r over worked

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I picked this hotel because it was central to Penn Station, the Convention center and the NYC library which made it perfect for the marathon. We took the subway after the marathon and it wasn't crowded and made it back to the hotel within 30-45 min. Super easy hotel for the crazy NYC marathon weekend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at Homewood Suites during a business trip to New York. We were happy with the hotel, which offered a comfortable bed and a nice breakfast with a good selection. I would definately consider staying at Homewood Suites, if I should come back to New York City.
user_name:
Nikolaj M
Skærbæk ved Fredericia, Denmark

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I experienced a very bad ankle sprain on day 1 of my visit in NYC after falling into a hole in the sidewalk on 59th street. I returned to the hotel at 8 p.m. in the evening by cab and upon arrival at the hotel was completely unable to walk at all. Omy, the bellman, went above the call of duty by walking 13 blocks at 8:30 p.m. to purchase crutches for me, help escort me to my room and get ice for my injured ankle. I could not have made it to my room without his assistance and am grateful for his amazing kindness.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was in a great location good for time square and shopping subway station and Penn station was close by, room was furnished well and functional, breakfast was adequate and the free coffee and tea all day was a good treat would defiantly stay here again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Midtown is a good location to have as starting point whether it´s shopping or other escapades. This apartment hotel is probably in the "Mid-range"/"more economical than luxury" in this town...well...that statement comes after staying at another one close to Ground zero. One legacy they still have from the British rule is lousy windows...double or triple glazing is a unusual... or they come with those sound leaking sash window...if you are a reacting badly to police or other rescue sirens ask for a room not facing the street...otherwise you WILL sleep poorly. This hotel was good... good beds, good (well.. american) breakfast, small kitchenette och refrigerator. We (2 adults and 3 kids) shared 2 queen sized bed and a sofa/bedThey have a gym downstairs and the possibility for laundry (self serviced).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a nice, quite new hotel in a very good location. It has a nicve kitchenette, Quite small bathroom, we missed some hygenical amenities.The hotel is modern and top-notch, it has fitness facilities, business room. The rooms are spacious and comfortable It is centrally located and in walking distance to Hell's Kitchen, Times Square, all the the mid-town shopping, Garment District, Empire state building etc. We took advantage of the free breakfast, we grabbed coffee and tea during the day and in the evening. The staff is very polite. The only reason that I did not give 5 stars is that, like most NYC hotels, it's price/performance is not for superb.But when I return to NY, it's one of my possible destinations.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights and had a very pleasant experience. The location is superb being walking distance from Times Square. The room was large clean and modern with a really comfortable bed. The staff were welcoming and friendly which always contributes to a positive experience. A couple of minor gripes. The elevators were always busy and you could wait what seemed to be an age before one stopped at our floor. There seemed to be something strange about the control logic as the elevator would go past our floor even if both the up and down buttons had been pressed. Lack of seats at breakfast was another issue, whatever time you tried. Overall though we enjoyed our stay and would come again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Close to everything! The staff was super friendly. Our room was super spacious and clean. The elevators are a little slow and get pretty packed. The best part was being able to get a great breakfast before hitting the streets of Manhattan. Would stay here again for sure!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Traveled as family (12yo, 6month old). Great location...short walk to Times Square and subway station. Staff friedly and helpful. Would stay here again. Breakfast was a nice perk and offered a variety of food.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: From the time we arrived, the Staff were friendly, welcoming, polite and utterly professional. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable (our must have item!). Breakfast was basic but perfectly adequate and was a bonus enabling us to get out and about early each day as we had so much we wanted to see and do. The air handling unit was practically facing our room (2105), so we were concerned that it amy disturb our sleep but we were fine. Street noise was negligible from that height so, all in all, we wouldn't have any problem staying in the same room again. We would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 3 night stay, hotel has a fresh feel to it. The rooms are well appointed, wooden floors, great beds, choice of pillows. Really modern bathroom and nice to have a proper shower rather than one over a bath. Good breakfast Buffett, does get crowded, cereals fresh fruit, and each day different cooked items and baked items. Welcoming reception, comfy lounges and fire. Great location, away from the chaos of Times Sqaure, but only a 5 minute walk away. We slept with the window open, it was that quiet. Easy walk to Penn Station

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Only a short walk from Times Square and Empire State Building, great location for all sight seeing. Hotel was clean , comfortable rooms and good to have 24 hours coffee downstairs. Reception staff generally miserable especially when we checked in, deposit of 50 dollars per night taken at check in and still a week later not paid back! They no longer do evening snacks and drinks so a 20 dollar voucher is given to spend in local pizzeria. Despite being email by British Airways who we booked with to tell us to pick up voucher at reception for this we found staff extremely reluctant to let us have a voucher. The one evening we did get it we had to go through 4 different staff to be given permission to let us have it , couldn't be bothered to waste time waiting and asking after that!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Convenient hotel relatively close to Times Square. The room was good, but the floor was dusty and looked dirty. They offered coffee and tea all day and free breakfast which was a plus. There's also a rooftop balcony, which was nice. Elevators were probably the most inconvenient thing about the whole stay, luckily we were only on the third floor and tried to avoid it as much as possible during our stay by taking the stairs after waiting for a long time. Overall I recommend the hotel and would most likely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great midtown location, especially for Broadway shows, shopping, Times Square and Herald Square. Very polite and helpful staff. Some drawbacks: Fitness center has very limited exercise equipment. Seating for buffet breakfasts in the a.m. can be limited at times (people swarm at the "trough" as if they haven't eaten for days). Very few gluten-free options offered at the buffets.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights recently on a recommendation from a friend who had also stayed there recently. We weren't disappointed. Lovely suite, on the small side but for Manhattan probably spacious, everything we needed. Bed comfortable, shower water pressure good. No issues with room. Rooftop terrace lovely. Breakfast is VERY crowded. Every afternoon cold iced tea and cookies provided free in reception (very much appreciated on very hot days having that lovely cool tea to drink!). They also do free dinner a few nights a week too but we didn't partake as we were always out and about. Business centre good - used it for internet and printing. Laundry facilities good - used it too. Wifi very good and free! The only negative would be the elevators a little slow especially at busy periods (breakfast time) due to so many using it. Good location! Overall would stay here again and recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is the perfect location for extended stay with great freebies including massive buffet brekkie every morning and Monday to Thursday between 5-7pm dinner free and drinks on the rooftop nightly free during happy hour with a kitchen in your room with sink, fridge, toaster and jug, cutlery, drinks are and crockery and microwave so you don't have to eat out all the time and can have a frozen dinner in your room to save money if on a tight budget or just want to stay home.Conveniently located within minutes to Broadway Times Square and Central Park the area is safe and so much to see and about 7 minutes walk to Hells Kitchen Restaurant and other amazing eat outs, complimentary high speed wifi, laundry facilities and fully equipped state of art gym.The room is big and clean and stylish. Highly recommended from a fussy traveller on a budget.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I love the Hilton and any Hilton brand hotel. The breakfast was delicious. They provided a great variety with different types of eggs everyday and never ran out of food. The elevator was the trouble. The waits were long ranging from 5-15 minutes, and super packed we were touching other people. The location was perfect and easy to navigate.
user_name:
janiefunbeach
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here in august 3016 for a girls getaway. It was a very clean hotel and centrally located to everything. Elevators we slow and breakfasts in the morning were crowded but other than that it is perfect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've been here before but not in a couple of years. I plan to stay here more often in future. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Location is very convenient to west side and penn station transportation. The street is quieter than many others nearby where competing hotels are located. Rooms and facility still feel fresh as the hotel isn't very old. Breakfast is nice. Thanks Homewood for a great stay and thanks Tiara for accommodating my special requirements on this trip! I'll be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Well situated for getting easily to all the sights. Clean, comfortable, well equipped accommodation, extremely approachable, friendly and helpful staff. Lovely complimentary breakfast. A home from home.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I feel really guilty not giving 5 stars for this hotel as the staff and general presentation and cleanliness were really excellent and having a breakfast thrown in really was a great bonus but I have to be honest that we found the place just kind of forgettable possibly because it didn't take our breath away, everything was fine but it just felt a little claustrophobic particularly on level 20 where we were, maybe a change of decor in the corridors to something lighter would express more of a feeling of space.The hotel itself was well placed at 37th which is really only a 5-10min walk from Times Square and it is away from all of the bustle in more of a nondescript block and the nights appeared very quiet on our high floor.Incidentally location-wise there is a Seven11 around the corner, (turn right as you exit the reception entrance door and turn right on the corner of the block and it is but yards away) which has a lovely selection of beer if you like beer... I like beer!Our room was a studio with view, (well we saw the road and street from the window) and in reality if it were an inward facing i would have been totally uncomfortable as it was too dark however the room was a good size with fridge, sink and the microwave that we didn't use, in fact I think it would have been a nicer space if these were removed for us as we would never use them and the fridge whistled when it turned on automatically at night which was annoying and it wasn't a friendly whistle, more of a high pitched weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee if the description is of use....?The bed was a good UK King Size and the sofa bed was a UK Double Bed size itself however my 8 yr old son did highlight it was a little 'springy' in his back so not a great nights sleep if you are staying on it long-term. Little tip for the aircon, override the auto button and select the temp with fan on low as the vent blows in your face like a gale if your bed, (like ours) had the head-end directly opposite. My other half moaned that it was a regular 'ice blast' when the temp got too warm which was fine for me as I was on the other side and used her as a windbreak!Bathroom was shower only and perfectly clean, can't really think of more to say than that... Oh it was a little cold...The team on reception were very friendly and we booked a car back to JFK for $65 (plus tip) which is way below what was quoted on here before and comparable with a yellow cab and we got a Lincoln Town Car (but the driver drove like we were on fire which woke me up nicely for check-in...)Breakfast was the real bonus, the waffles were great and I over-ate these making me feel like an overweight mule wandering around Manhattan, there was also fruit salad, bagels, french toast, small selection of cereals and toast which for me was fine however you may want more from a breakfast but then in NYC breakfast is usually an additional charge so 'lap it up it' was great. Free coffee in reception was really nice and useful with my usual slow awakening although I think it was a little weak which is saying something for a Londoner! Try the hot chocolate sachets though they were really nice.... This should so be a 5 Star place and I WOULD come back no problem but I have dropped a star because I just found the place very claustrophobic due mainly to decor but I would recommend staying here without a shadow of a doubt!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: One of the best hotels I've stayed in in the US. Lovely large room, more than large enough for five people with all the facilities you would want. Breakfast is really good. Staff very helpful, couldn't do enough for you. Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our room in this hotel was really great. There was a lot of room and it was laid out very well. We had a couch and a kitchenette (that included a dishwasher). The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. For example, I came in just as they were cleaning up after breakfast and someone saw I was looking for milk for my coffee. Even though breakfast had been all put away, he went to the kitchen and brought me a cup of milk for my coffee. I really appreciated it because they had plenty of creamer available (I don't like creamer) and they could have left me to that. The breakfast was much better than expected. There was waffles, potatoes, turkey sausage or bacon, and something else hot every day. There was also pastries, cereals, yogurt, fruit, fruit salad, bagels, and toast. The only problem was that it was a zoo during breakfast. We made it down to the lobby when it was relatively quiet one morning, but the other five mornings the lobby was filled with noisy kids. We brought our food back upstairs to our room and microwaved it.The location was good. The hotel is in the middle of the garment district and I enjoyed poking around the various specialist stores.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
