review_body: Stayed here last week whilst in New York with my friend for her 40th and our mums. The hotel was in a good location very close to Times Square. The rooms were clean and a good size with a safe, ironing board, iron, hairdryer, small kitchen area with fridge, microwave etc. There was no kettle which was disappointing however tea / coffee station was situated in the reception area. Breakfast was perfect, exactly what we needed before heading out! I think we may have stayed in the hotel in evenings more if there was a bar, it would have been nice to relax a bit later on at night. All the staff were fantastic, very helpful and friendly! All in all a great stay and would definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: In search of a nice value for money hotel we came cross this little gem in Garment district.This is a new hotel only 2 years old with nice layout, spacious rooms for NY standards based on our research.Our room at the 21st floor city view was the best we could get for this rate. Prior to our booking we became members of Hilton honors and we received the best offer.Reception, housekeeping and generally the staff exceeded our expectations and were friendly and accommodating. It’s nice to hear welcome back after you are out the whole day. Also their restaurant list and specially the tip for the best burger was an extra bonus.Although we did not care about evening reception which is not common in Europe still others complained but for us was not an issue. What was a nice touch though is that 24/7 you could enjoy a hot coffee tea and fresh fruits.Room was pretty spacious around 29 m2 with a nice bathroom (only drawback that as most NY hotels have a shower screwed on the wall. Second day we went to close pharmacy which is open 24/7 and bought a sponge.) The closet was big enough for couple of people that travel with light luggage. Of course they had a 3 drawer furniture were most of our cloths were fitted.Housekeeping and cleanliness was excellent and they never bothered us.You cannot get wrong by choosing to stay here and value for money it’s a fact!The neighborhood was ok and although we walked a lot and most of the times returned by foot even late at night (i.e. after a night show at Maddison square garden which is very close) we never felt any threat whatsoever. We will definitely stay again at this hotel when we return in New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood in New York was a great choice with large, clean rooms and personnel polite, smiley and helpful; they definitely made our stay a good experience.The breakfast was standard, if you don’t have great expectations is fine otherwise try a diner. It has 24h coffee and tea at the lobby, which is refreshing after the long walks.The hotel is in a good location, close to Times Square, Madison Square Garden and the Theaters. Also the metro is close just 2 minutes’ walk to get to Penn station, but I would recommend walking in this big, bright city!I highly recommend Homewood Suites and definitely I would stay again. Thank you all for your hospitality!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: You'll be pleasantly surprised by the complimentary breakfasts and dinners and also the unlimited hot beverages to help endure the cold season of New York.Not the best hotel room views at the back facing a commercial office though :(

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Convenient place to stay. Close enough to Times Square, far enough away to reduce the noise, hustle and bustle. Close to the restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. Close to Penn station and other stations (we came via Amtrak - was a short walk). We had a reasonable sized room with a king bed, city view and kitchenette. Bed is comfy, air conditioning effective, plenty of storage in bedroom. Bathroom is a good size but lacks shelf space for toiletries. Water pressure in shower is excellent. Good onsite gym and laundry. Constant tea & coffee available in foyer, with afternoon, fresh cooked biscuits.Breakfast is included, but is typical for a Homebody Suites (mass produced, some hits and some misses).There is a long wait for an elevator in peak period (mornings). They even go past you. Being in the 21at floor we didn't use the stairs but it would be a better option on lower floor, especially when going down for breakfast.Was surprised that they charge US$300 on credit card on check in. There is no onsite restaurant, so no real way to run up this sort of 'tab'.In all though a comfortable place to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved the space we got in a studio suite. Everything felt new, no long waits for the lifts, no noise as we were on a high floor. Service was great and the breakfast was a great plus! It was about a 10-15 walk to Times Square. I would probably stay closer to 34th street next time though as over time it was alot of walking..

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our stay was clean, quiet and convenient. The hotel is close to the train stations, we walked to both Grand Central Station to get a train to the NY Botanical Gardens and we walked with our suitcases to Penn Station for a train to Baltimore. The weather was good so no problem walking to either station.The Staff was courteous and helpful, they stowed our suitcases on arrival until our room was ready and on departure after we checked out until we were ready to leave the city.The elevator in the morning was slow, slower and very slow...we were on the 15th floor so it took a long time to get an elevator and get down. The rest of the day the elevators were ok.Breakfast was included in our 2 day stay. It was convenient to be able to eat at the hotel...we've had better and worse meals.On the whole I recommend this hotel and my wife and I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The one reason I picked this hotel was because they offered a complimentary 2 hour cocktail and appetizer for guests on week evenings. All sites, even the Hilton website stated this; yet the evening we arrived I was told that they had stopped this practice 4 months ago. When looking for a hotel for our 7 days stay in NYC, I had narrowed the search to 4 hotels, all in Manhattan, all closet to Penn Station, all offering hot breadfast and yet several were quite a bit less expensive per night. I was very disappointed to learn that the main reason I choose Homewood Suites was not going to happen.I will say the breakfast was good, the bed was comfortable, room was clean, hotel was quiet and most of the employees were very friendly and helpful. One employee, Josh (I think) (possibly with housekeeping) went out of his way to help us. Thank you and Kudos to him. Neither my daughter or I felt comfortable talking to the concierge who seemed to be bothered by us the first and only time we asked him some questions.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: NY Hotels are really pricey and we needed a hotel with suite rooms so we could have separate beds. We went with Homewood because of the suites and free breakfasts. We requested rooms next to each other with our family friend 2 days before check in. We were told to call back a day before. We did and were told which rooms we would have and that it was confirmed. Unfortunately when we arrived, we were told they were unable to accommodate our request (after we asked why our rooms were on different floors) and when we asked why after confirmation were they not able to? They had no response other than the hotel was really full and they only do things like that if they are able to and it's not guaranteed. Well, we were told by the hotel that it was confirmed. The rooms were ok. The bathroom sink has zero space. The bathroom and room could have been cleaned better. The rooms are a little outdated. The free breakfast was very basic. And the turkey patties are not good. It would be nice if they could mimic Embassy Suites and have a much better breakfast experience. Some of the staff was helpful and some were not.We probably will never stay at another Homewood Suites again, sorry.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location:. Close to everything but quite street, kind and helpful staff, nice hot buffet breakfast, clean, working complementary iinternet, check in and out efficient. Complete kitchennet. Coffee and tea station 24/7.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Pleasantly surprised by its cleanliness and comfort, right in midtown NYC. I would plan to stay there again, because of its proximity to NYPenn Station and midtown. Nearby we found a very nice restaurant for dinner and were close to the Hammerstein Ballroom, our concert destination that evening.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: In October 2016, three friends and I stayed for 7 nights, and were impressed with the cleanliness of this newer facility. It was within easy walking distance to Times Square and subway/bus access. Though it fronts on a very busy street that is not particularly attractive, once inside the place feels like "home". Complimentary breakfast is good and has extended hours. What made our stay so pleasurable was the staff. Everyone was friendly, accommodating, and went out of their way to make our stay "the best". The concierge, front desk folks, and particularly the ladies in housekeeping were totally on top of our needs and requests. Particularly impressive were Mey, head of housekeeping, and Lenny, housekeeping and kitchen. These two women are definite assets to Homewood Suites, going above and beyond to make sure guests are well taken care of in very personable ways.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a reasonably priced (by NYC standards) newer property. Location is substandard, but the property is relatively fresh and was clean and comfortable during my stay. Complimentary hot breakfast buffet is included with the room - the buffet is not fancy, but the food is fresh and of decent quality. Monday through Thursday the hotel hosts a complimentary evening reception with beer, wine, and appetizers.The hotel is located just off 8th avenue in a not-so-great part of town. If location is a priority, I would look elsewhere in Midtown, as this property is not particularly close to anything other than Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Because of the poor location relative to other midtown Hilton family properties I am rating this property as "average".

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I went for a weekend 2 nights / 3 days and stayed at the Homewood Suites and had an amazing stay. The service was great all the way through. From the time we got to the hotel (about 5 hours before their scheduled check in time), the staff was helpful and allowed us to stow our bags safely while we went out to explore the city. I've been to some hotels that leave your bag in the entrance/lobby, and I've never had an issue, but am always worried about the possibility that someone could potentially steal something has always been in the back of my mind. The Homewood Suites moved our luggage to their storage space for this, and gave me luggage tickets for when we returned so I felt much better.After check in, the staff said they would bring our luggage up right away. It did take about 15-20 minutes for them to do this, for some reason. We weren't in a rush, but we were surprised at the amount of time. The man came to our room with the luggage and apologized so many times for the wait. It wasn't an issue it all, he kept saying "so sorry for the wait" and we assured him that it was fine.We could change the temperature very easily, and it worked very quickly to heat or cool our room down (probably because it's a small area - but not in a bad way, I've definitely seen smaller hotel rooms in NYC, this was very roomy). The fridge, dishwasher and sink worked perfectly (we didn't use the microwave or anything else, but I'm sure they were more than fine). The view was just of the street and the building across from us, not sure what people are really expecting from a New York hotel room, but this was more than fine.The location is close to Times Square, yes of course it is a bit of a walk (maybe 10 minutes?) but 5 blocks away is very close when you're talking about New York. There is so much within walking distance, and it's close to the Port Authority Bus Terminal (we took a shuttle bus from Newark Airport to the Port Authority) so it was a quick walk.The room was always clean and has a very modern look to it. We booked this hotel also because of the free breakfast included. We loved it! No, it's not a gourmet meal, if that's what you're looking for, then go somewhere else and pay a lot of money for it. I've stayed at other hotels and the "free breakfast" was a sad excuse, but I still didn't complain because it was free. In this case, there was so much variety and the food was hot, there's not much else you can ask for. Coffee and other hot drinks were always available in the lobby (I believe 24 hours) and the breakfast room was never too crowded. It was busy and sometimes you had to wait for a seat for maybe a minute or so, but mostly because someone chose to leave a mess when they left the table. The staff did come and clean up for those people rather quickly, but there are bins to put your plates and cutlery, and garbages for anything else, it's not hard to clean up your own mess when all you have to do is put the items in a bin!Also, the TV in the room was great, I think it was a SmartTV, although I didn't really use it for that function. It did lose signal quite a bit, maybe every 5-10 minutes or so there would be a few seconds of delay, so that was kind of annoying. But, we weren't in the room/ watching TV long enough to be bothered by that.I will definitely stay at this hotel again. The service was wonderful and everything about it made my stay so great. I really enjoyed it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a fine hotel just couple of years old, furniture paints new nicely located at garment district with easy reach of city center and Penn street 34th & Madison square garden Pros Clean A+ Service A Location A+ Cons Breakfast C+ mainly as it was very basic standard for Europeans (i.e. No bacon American breakfast without bacon?) Rest just ok.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just loved it here very helpful friendly staff, rooms are great, breakfast is superb and all the little added extras I.e free coffee biscuits etc. And to top it all right in the middle of all the time square action.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Comfortable bed and great shower. Breakfast was basic but ok. Nice to have cookies and tea/coffee available 24/7. Staff at reception were friendly and helpful and it had the vibe of a laid-back kind of place. The hotel was within walking distance to Times Square/theatres. When I made the booking a light weekday dinner including wine was on offer but when I checked in that was off the table so that was disappointing. There is a 7 Eleven store around the corner however, which came in handy. All in all it was a nice basic hotel but probably overpriced. Not sure I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights. The room is a bit small but the location is great. It's near to everything you need to see in New York for short vacation. They have everything you need as a small apartment: microwave, stove, cooking tools.... So homey!!! The buffet breakfast and dinner is quite unhealthy in my opinion. I would refer more veggies and fruits rather than meat. The unlimited welcome drinks are so nice. Very cozy hotel lobby. Feel like home.
user_location: Ho Chi Minh City, null, Vietnam
user_name:
NicyTang
Ho Chi Minh City, null, Vietnam

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We definitely did not expect a hotel in the heart of the busy garment district to be so quiet. No sounds from the hotel itself or the staff disturbed hour sleep in any way. The hot breakfast was pretty good, and added a great deal of value for us. We appreciated that they stayed open until 10:30 AM, since we are night people

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Loved our stay here! Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very modern, from the lobby to the rooms. The complimentary breakfast was delicious, and there is a complimentary coffee / hot chocolate bar 24-7. The rooms are small, but that is standard in NYC. Also, if the description online says a single pull-out couch, don’t think that it couldn’t possibly be a single, because it is (picture a bed pulling out from a large chair).This hotel is in a great location…close to Herald Square, Empire State, Bryant Park, Times Square, etc. Given that it is a few blocks from Times Square, you have a bit of breathing room vs. some other hotels nearer to Times Square where it’s throngs of people the minute you walk outside of your room. Would definitely stay here again on a subsequent trip to NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel with excellent staff and service.Welcoming and inviting from the first moment!Location just off main drag means you are within easy reach of subway and therefore cheaper travel to/from the airports; not so noisy as locations around Time Square,8th/9th Avenues but walking distance to many sites.Rooms are not huge but what you would expect in middle of any city and this place makes up for that with great facilities within the room, perhaps making it just right for families with children who may be difficult to feed whilst on holiday!Everything was immaculately clean and staff very helpful - particularly in the hectic breakfast times in main lobby.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good location for Mid Manhattan. Clean rooms with OK bed(s), but pillows need updating or replacing. No views from the rooms we were in. Central air conditioning in rooms noisy to very noisy with no guest control. So called complementary breakfast monotonous with poor quality breads, breakfast cereals and cakes were all loaded with sugar. Coffee had no taste and was often cold. A reasonable amount of fresh fruit. Rooms were clean and once we realized we had to demand some service which should have been automatic we were OK. Room size was good and kitchenette with full sized frig work well. Lots of construction and noise in this part of Manhattan.
user_name:
Ludwig H
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My last stay at a Hilton Affiliate hotel was at HOMEWOOD SUITES Between October 14 and October 18th, 2016. Firstly I booked on line and then called front desk who was very helpful. They sent me two emails to welcome me before I arrived and a couple days before sent online information for me to check in. I was showed the room assigned but told I could change if I wanted to. Kept it because I was satisfied. Overall a fantastic Experience, wish I had more time to stay but had to go back to work. Thanks guys.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Returning after 1 year, found the place a little different. Although the staff of the front desk remains almost the same, the service is not as good as it use to be. Before my arrival, I've asked for an early check in, explaining that my husband after a 12 hour flight would be pleased in having a room a little earlier. Arriving at the hotel, I told the girl at the front desk that, besides my previous request, my husband was not felling well, and, as a Hilton Honor member, kindly ask for a room. To make long story short. We had to wait four hours. Yes, 4 hours! During my stay, I had to ask twice for the housekeeping service. Another thing that me and many others guests complained is that the hotel is not offering the social evening any more. It is a pitty. It was good to meet new people, to hear different experiences. The salad bar that they tried to serve one evening do not deserve any comments. Inside the room, not even a dish towel! Unfortunately, the price has not been changed!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Awesome staff. This hotel is located very close to Times Square and the subways. The rooms are very nice and clean. The breakfast was good. I gave them 5 stars for location, friendliness of staff and cleanliness. The rooftop is really nice.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family and I stayed here this year on our annual Comic-Con trip. This is the only hotel we'll stay in when we visit NYC from now on. The entire staff went out of their way to be helpful. Our room was amazing, modern and really clean. The Breakfast was great. My kids loved the hot chocolate in the lobby. Overall the trip was amazing. The only negative we felt was the elevators. The hotel was booked full and there was usually a long wait for the elevator. It didn't help that one of the three lifts was broken. It was a inconvenience, but it compared to the types of hotels we've stayed in before, it is a minor one!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were 2 adults and a teen, with the sofabed out, it was a squeeze but ok as we were only in there to sleep. Didn't use the kitchen at all. Room was 408, behind the lifts but completely quiet. We chose a room on a low floor at the back of the hotel in order to avoid traffic noise and be able to use the stairs vs. the lift. Staff were attentive, polite and friendly. We had two parcels delivered whilst there and both were handled very efficiently by Reception. The hotel is busy, the lobby is often crowded and the overspill from breakfast very visible. Breakfast is fine (but nothing to linger over and relax but that could be deliberate as the dining space could be bigger), it's cafeteria style with a reasonable selection of hot and cold choices. The street is just off 8th Avenue and commercial/industrial vs. residential. A bit grubby, building work going on close by but is a couple of minutes from the underground and there are shops, deli's etc. within 100m. Have marked sleep quality down as the pillows were very lumpy and the sofabed noisy. Overall, we were happy with our hotel choice and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Two moms and three daughters travelled to NYC for a girls' trip over a long weekend. With 2 queen beds and a small sofa bed, we all slept comfortably. We had a good amount of room for suitcases as well. Our room was across the hall from the elevator, but it was very quiet. We didn't really use the kitchen. The complimentary breakfast was quite good. The location is convenient to Macy's/Herald Square area, but a little far from Times Square. Overall, I'd recommend it!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Expensive and breakfast was poor. Ok for a short stay roof was nice to hang out on... no pool Was an ok area .... small room didn't clean while we were out didn't warn us about holding extra money until we were checking out

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel is fantastic. Great location, great staff, and a great General Manager. This hotel goes above and beyond to make you fell welcome especially when you are traveling and away from home for an extended time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great service new rooms coming comfy beds we really enjoyed staying here. We had a girls weekend in the city and you want to go to the theater and this is just a short walk toward the theaters. The breakfast was surprisingly good they had coffee all the time

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The experience at this hotel is always pleasant to us as we always enjoy our stay at this particular hotel. Breakfast is great. Staff and Manager are all friendly and accommodating. Looking forward to staying there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 3 night stay, family of 4. 5 min walk to subway stop, plenty of places to grab a bite, 7 eleven on the corner. Only problem we had was the middle elevator was out of service for our entire stay, making travel to and from the room very annoying. Other than that, we rayher enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was designed to support the 21st century expectations of its clients: free breakfast, outlets for recharging throughout the room, well designed room and furnishings, including a kitchenette. More importantly, the staff was outstanding throughout the hotel and restaurant.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here to attend a conference at Jacob Javitz Convention Center. . Homewood Suites is new-ish (opened 2014?) and I appreciate the rooms (true to website), amenities like free wi-fi for Hilton Members and 24/7 coffee/tea/hot chocolate in the lobby. I have stayed in Marriott's Residence Inns and this is Hilton answer to the "suite" hotel with a hot breakfast. Did not use the gym but it looked like the website photos. There are also laundry facilities on site so it would be great for families. All staff encountered was pleasant, and housekeeping did not disappoint. Breakfast was bountiful but be sure to go before 9am or you will have a hard time finding a table. If weather is good a nice outdoor patio is available, and worst case, you can spill into the lobby seating. One plea to hotel management, I appreciated the hot breakfast but any way to improve the scrambled eggs? It had a custard like consistency so wondering if they started out as powdered? Great Points - This is a great hotel for conferences at Javitz. Walking straight down West 37th brings you to the front door of Javitz which is the big plus for this hotel, a 10 minute walk for me. Another big plus is the proximity to 2 major transport hubs, Port Authority bus terminal and Penn Station for Amtrak. If coming in to NYC it would be great, I flew in to NYC so not helpful for me. Notable Issues - I used to live in Manhattan for about 7 years for grad school and first job post graduation so I feel I know Manhattan well enough. This location is basically the garment district and nestled between Penn Station and Port Authority it is not quite Chelsea, Time Square or Hells Kitchen. If pushed, it is lower Time Square but not quite the Theater District. Yes, it is an odd neighborhood and my main issue is the lack of restaurants that are not fast food in the "immediate" surroundings. Don't get me wrong there are some (Tavola Italian) and some pubs but I counted THREE Dunkin Donuts, a 7-11, and a pizza slice place within a block of the hotel for context. For a classic NYC Diner I went to the Skylight Dinner on 34th and even the hotel's in-room compendium lists Ellen's Stardust Diner and that is on 51st and 7th. Bottom line, Homewood is fabulous for conferences at Javitz. However, make plans for evening entertainment/meals elsewhere if you don't just want a slice of pizza or a take away.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I picked this hotel based on access to smoking area yet there was none. The hotels more midtown on 37th had outdoor seating where you could smoke. Not here. And there were a lot of us out there squished up against the building under the overhang in the rain. Perfect location to Penn Station ergo getting to other parts of the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a beautiful new hotel. Think it was built about 3 years ago. It has one of the best kitchenettes of any NYC hotel (at least that we have stayed at). The hotel is centrally located and in walking distance to Hell's Kitchen, Times Square, all the the mid-town shopping, Garment District, etc. While we did not take advantage of the free breakfast, we did grab coffee and tea in the evening. The staff is wonderful. The hotel is modern and top-notch. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The only reason that I did not give 5 stars is that, like most NYC hotels, the prices have just been steadily increasing. The price of this one is actually a little more reasonable than most so I actually give it 4 1/2 stars!! Thank you Hilton. This is now our go-to NYC hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 4 nights in a self contained suite which was smallish but well laid out and had everything we needed. Good sound proof windows and block out blinds, bed ok. Location is back from bustle of Times Square but close enough to most tourist pick up/meeting places. Breakfast was ok, not great. All day coffee is fantastic. We also liked being able to use the diy, on site, laundry. Staff were good until check out when we asked them to call us a cab to go to the airport and I was told their chauffeured car could take us for $110US, I said no thanks we just want a cab and I was told off you go then, walk up the street and hale one. I said but we have 4 suitcases and this is NYC, no offer to make a phone call to get that cab for us....very, very annoyed as we lugged suitcases along a construction site in the street to get to the main roads to stand in the sun and try, TRY, to get a cab. Not good enough Hilton Homewood Suitesl!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our 2 queen bed suite was surprisingly roomy and very quiet. Staff was helpful. We used the subways a lot. Not far from Penn Station. Breakfast was decent. Room bigger than expected. Beds comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Busy with tourists and families. Fairly new hotel with a full studio apartment in each room. Refrigerator stove microwave pots and pans and dishes. Sofa bed in most rooms so comfortable for a family of 3 or 4 if you have small children and they'd share a small sofa bed. Parking is down the street and hotel has rates in garage from 45-50 per day. Clean room beds ok but heat and AC either make TRE room too hot or too cold. Staff is friendly and attentive but get overwhelmed at times. Easy walk from hotel to most Broadway theatres and Times Square but the hotel is 5 blocks away from Times Square

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is perfect (although there are lots of weird people going around in the neighborhood). We got an upgrade and had a really big room on a high floor. Very modern. The only negative point is that we could not turn off the fridge which can be noisy at night. We did not use the kitchen but it has lots of kitchenware.The bed was huge and really comfortable.The breakfast was not good for the price of the room. I also understand the need to accommodate all cultures but some real bacon would be nice instead of flavorless turkey bacon. More than 3 sorts of jams should also not be much more expensive...We would come back but would also appreciate cheaper prices ;-)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I love this hotel and would recommend it to everyone! Junior on front desk is definitely a gem to this establishment. Both times we have stayed he was very helpful and pleasant!! Also the location is ideal and close to everything. I would definitely stay again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood suites is a very good place to stay however there are quite a few homeless people in the area. Checking in is a breeze and I stayed on the 16th floor. The view from the window was of the opposite hotel. The room consists of a living/bedroom/kitchenette and bathroom. The bathroom isn't very big. It has a sink, lavatory and shower. It has a sliding door to give privacy. The kitchen is basic enough to cook in with a microwave,job, sink and fridge freezer. There is not a lot of work top to prepare food. The bed is was comfortable but pillows had seen better days. There is a decent size table that pulls out from under the counter. There are plenty of power sockets.The wardrobe is small and a safe is in the top section. The hotel has a complimentary breakfast which is adequate but be warned if you get up the table gets cleared very quickly, you need to leave something on the table to stop this happening. Checkout was simple too. Staff are friendly and i would probably stay here again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had four women sharing a room. Staff was helpful and rooms were large with a full kitchen. Having a complimentary hot breakfast was a bonus! Great value for the money! Always fresh coffee in lobby.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have nothing, but positive things to say about the staff in their friendliness and helpfulness, the room was clean and well maintance great job to the mateinance department they are doing a great job in the hotel
user_name:
chrisortega814
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This newer hotel is located convenient to Penn Station, Times Square and major subway lines.Rooms are bright, spacious and well appointed and thoughtfully laid out. Front desk staff is friendly, courteous and helpful.Nice garden area, roof top and gym. Complimentary hot breakfast was tasty, plentiful choices and lots of seating.This is a very nice hotel for families and extended stays. Very large floor to ceiling windows let on lots of light but lower floors may be visible from street.I will stay again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I will definitely stay at this hotel again. I had a room with a king bed and sofa. The rooms are small but a typical size for New York. I arrived at the hotel at 9:30am on a rainy day. Check-in was not until 4pm, however I was given a room within 5 minutes of arriving at the hotel. The staff were great. The location was great. Overall a great experience

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We've not stayed in a Homewood Suites before and booked a King Suite with Balcony which was situated on the 8th Floor. We were pleasantly surprised on how good this hotel was. Our room had a kitchenette with a fridge/freezer, microwave, coffee machine, two ring electric hob and fully equipped cupboards with cutlery, plates, cups, saucepans etc. We had a kingsize bed as well as a sofa bed and footstool, desk and chair which if you were here on business would be great. The bathroom was large with a big walk in shower, good toiletries and plenty of towels. There are three lifts so you never had to wait long to get up and down.There was ample choice at breakfast which was included in our package - it is self service and people tend to clear their own tables although there are also staff on hand to do this. It is a busy hotel with people coming and going on a regular basis but this is dealt with very efficiently by the staff and luggage storage is available when you have checked out or are waiting to check in.There is a guest laundry on the lower floor which was a big asset after travelling around for a week and a half and there is also a business centre where you can print your boarding passes and a gym to use as well. There is also a roof terraced on the 22nd Floor. The hotel doesn't do evening dinner but there is a small shop next to reception where you can buy food to microwave etc and there are plenty of 7/11 stores close by if you want a bigger selection of food or drink to purchase.From Monday to Thursday there is also a free salad bar from 17:00 - 19:00 and free tea, coffee and hot water is available throught the day in the reception area and I discovered biscuits on arriving back one day at 13:00.The location is great for getting to the main sights. Penn Street Station is only 3 blocks away and the Empire State Building and Times Square are within easy walking distance.We thought the hotel was good value for money and would definitely recommend this hotel to others it would be our first choice if we return to New York, nothing was too much trouble and it was very clean.Thank you for making us feel so welcome, we've stayed in a few hotels on our trip and this was definitely one of the best.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I really recommend this hotel they have amazing staff! the front desk guys were very polite and welcoming with great attitudes making us feel welcomed, safe and comfortable, thank you guys! ps. to their boss you hired the best candidates you have a great team working their!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Opted for Homewood Suites because we were a party of 3 and had a good experience with our first stay in a Suites last month. Loved it again. Very roomy for NYC. Clean. Nice amenities. Great location. Very friendly staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel was clean, staff was very friendly, location was convenient to subway and Time Square. The price was pretty fair for a hotel in New York City. The room was average size for a room in NYC. The room however was very small compared to the Homewood Suites that I have stayed in for past trips to other cities, mostly in Florida. For a family of 4 it will work, but it's tight. I would definitely stay here again because of the cleanliness of the hotel and because of the friendly, helpful staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Homewood Suites in Manhatten, NY. It was so convenient to have a refrigerator and full mini kitchen . The property is beautifully maintained. Breakfast is included with a nice assortment of choices to start the day . Nafessa was extremely helpful when I voiced a concern . We would definitely stay here again !

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We arrived at the hotel pretty late to be greeted with a lovely warm welcome. The hotel staff are very friendly and always tried to help. We were staying here during my boyfriends birthday. We received a high floor room and in the room there was a birthday surprise which included cake (found in the fridge), a bag of sweets and crisps, birthday card and a bottle to celebrate. This I thought, was a lovely touch. The room itself was very modern. We had a small kitchen area which had a fridge, dishwasher, microwave and all utensils. The bathroom was spacious and clean. We had a great view looking over the city ahead. We had free breakfast each morning which I thought was enough. I didn't want a big pancake or breakfast anywhere. So here you could work away at hot food such as eggs, bacon etc. Or you could have cereals, porridge, toast, yogurts, fruit. What more do people want for breakfast? I had seen to many reviews about people complaining about this. They also offered free tea/coffee/hot chocolate all day. The location was good as we were close to times square (10 mins) Madison Gardens (10 mins) and Penn station (5 mins) All essential places to visit for when you are staying in New York. If we were to come back to New York again, I would probably stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We chose Homewood for its location, wifi and breakfast. It gave us a good base to launch from to start a three day NY fast paced holiday. It all worked for us. Would recommend. Only downside is the area it is in is not classy. I would also recommend a 5 minute walk to the espresso bar next to dunkin donuts on the corner. Still coming to terms with Americans love of percolated coffee over lattes and cappuccinos.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a great hotel for a long weekend getaway. The room was a good size for NYC, there was a hot breakfast every morning, and the hotel is new so everything was in nice condition and looked good. A perk, there is a nice rooftop patio and nobody uses it because every time we were up there, we were alone. So a bit of outdoor space, plus a mini kitchen in the room, made me think this hotel would be good for long stays too. Being in midtown made it easy to get to everywhere we were visiting in Manhattan. This is plenty close to Times Square, you only have to walk up a few short blocks. I would choose staying here vs a Times Square hotel to avoid the crowds of Times Square. Was very happy it was easy and free to check bags at the front desk as we had to check out at noon but didn't have to go to the airport til 7pm on our last day. The hotel staff was pretty helpful but we did ask for a switch to a room with a tub and they were not able to or didn't try very hard to do that. And we asked for a late checkout as my husband wasn't feeling very good and we only got an extra half hour. So nothing bad at all, but don't expect them to be super accommodating. All in all, I would defiantly stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall our stay was good, the room was comfortable, a decent size and we had three good nights sleep without any noise issues. The breakfast was OK, nothing amazing in terms of quality, but it provided a good selection to set you up for the day. The daytime offerings of coffee and cookies were a nice touch and whilst we didn't try the salad bar offerings between 5pm and 7pm it looked alright if that's what you want. Facilities such as a gym and guest laundry are also available and I would recommend the rooftop seating area if you just want to 'chill' !Where it fell down for us ?.....we booked in the knowledge that there was a 'Happy Hour' serving beer and wine between 5pm and 7pm. Since making our booking this had been stopped and the hotel no longer even offers alcohol to purchase. What kind of hotel in NYC doesn't offer alcohol ??.......We purchased bottles of water from the lobby shop on our first day and got charged $7 !! The feeling of being ripped off is not a nice one and whilst I acknowledge businesses having to make a margin this was excessive. If you want water there is a 7 Eleven around the corner that has water at reasonable prices. The street the hotel is on appears to attract some 'odd' characters and I couldn't get to the bottom of why this was. It didn't affect our stay and we never had an issue however I would have been quite nervy about walking down there late at night !

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was perfect in every way. Clean accommodations, super location to Time Square, friendly staff, and excellent complimentary breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We visit Hilton properties regularly and always request an upper floor away from elevators and vending. When we checked in they had upgraded us to a one bedroom suite but it was located on the 2nd floor in the front of the hotel. We asked to be relocated due to the traffic noise from 37th St. They then put us in the back on the 15th floor with a small room where the bathroom shared a wall with an elevator. The room was quiet but one of the smallest in the hotel with an exceptionally small bathroom (4" on one side of the wash bowl 3" on the other). We asked to have a private car for 9am the next morning. It didn't arrive so the hailed a taxi "to save us money"? House keeping seems to forget a few things each day and does not vacuum the floors. Much to our surprise this Homewood Suites hotel has a salad bar for its 5 to 7 evening get together but no snacks, beer or wine on Mondays through Thursday PM. I believe this is a test market for urban areas so before you book a Homeroom Suites hotel you might want to inquire if they are also taking away this special perk from your hotel which makes Homewood more like a Hampton inn or their competition. The strongest part of this hotel is the front desk that go out of their way to make you feel special. Assistant Mgr. Nafeesa Brent, Tiarra and Michael V were the highlight of our visit. We won't return to this Homewood Suites hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This property has huge rooms. My coworkers also had the same handicap rooms that I got. Pros1. Comes with full kitchen which includes:---Standard stainless steel fridge---Fully equipped with pots and pans, plates and utensils---stainless steel pull out drawer dishwasher2. Rooms are huge and some comes with a nice skyscraper views like mine did including:---Huge bathroom for New York standards---A sofa with a small cushioned table---Long desk table with leather rolling computer chair---Lobby area has adequate areas for group gatherings including several sports TV---22nd floor is their rooftop view which at night has partial view of NYC.Shortcomings:---Handicap bathroom lacks counter space---No place to put clean towels and instead, they use the Handicap shower chair.---Very small closet. This can be a deal breaker if you are staying for a longer duration.Closet also cannot accommodate long dress or even hanging pants straight down from the hanger.--Table top ironing board instead of stand alone---Breakfast was just okay. And for the size of the property, I experience no place to sit due to the lack of tables and chairs during peak breakfast hours.---Elevators can be slow especially during peak time.Personal experience:1. I think one of my biggest disappointment was when I first checked in. I informed the guest service gentleman that I am a Hilton HHonors member and that if he wouldn't mind adding my membership for this property. I also requested nicely if I could please have a bottle water as I was extremely thirsty after a long flight from San Francisco. I was requested to purchase the water instead. 2. I called Hilton HHonors once I got in my room and they were able to add my membership over the phone with no problem. Laura from Hilton HHonors customer service also said I should have no problem now getting my complimentary bottled water. Not a big deal, but I travel almost every week for work and my company is exclusive with Hilton properties, and this is the first time I've experienced this type of inconvenience.While the gentlemen who checked me in said I wasn't able to use my Hilton HHonors membership, but interestingly enough, my coworker who checked in an hour after me, had no problem. Here's another interesting fact, we work for the same company who made the same booking. Maybe, the gentlemen who checked me in was having an off day. Either way, it left a very bad experience. I wrote down his name but I am leaving it out from this review and hope he will consider spending a few more seconds to provide a better customer experience. My advise to management is to please have a ONE communication with your staff so that extra few seconds with their customer interaction can be resolved quickly, without having to call Hilton HHonors. I do share my experience with my company, and they take note not just my experience, but my whole team's experience for future bookings which by the way, our whole team stayed at this property, and we were a large group.Cheers!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was impressed with the overall size and feel of my room. I felt like I was staying in a contemporary studio apartment instead of a tiny NYC hotel room. Nice bathroom and kitchen and the ceiling fan was a nice addition!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Enjoyed a great trip to Manhattan/Times Square with my family. Homewood Suites is nice hotel walking distance from Empire State, Times Square, Madison Square Gardens and much, much more. Convenient to subway. Nice hotel, good amenities, good value (not cheap), friendly staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Modern, smart and within easy reach of the subway, Times Square and the Empire State Building. Breakfast was included and this was fine but we ended up seeking hot fluffy pancakes, bacon and eggs at the local diner. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the kitchenette fridge was useful for storing beers and snacks bought at the local shop. Loved the free drinks in the lobby and the roof garden.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Consider staying someone else. Over the last couple of months the cleniness of the room has decreased. They don't offer beer and wine anymore. There is no more hot food which is the main reason why to stay out the Homewood Suites.
user_name:
nike143
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stay here. You will not regret it!Great for families too. Very professional staff and complimentary snacks at 7pm. Greatly priced and located in an easy-access part of town. Beautiful bathrooms and comfortable bed. Also, they have BRAVO!!!!!!
user_name:
Felnwer
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for a night while in the city to see a show. Parking is conveniently located across the street and the woman who answered the phone when I called to ask about the parking situation was so nice and helpful. After our show, we went back to the hotel and Junior was working at the front desk. He was friendly and helpful and let us know that we could take our own drinks out on the rooftop terrace. We highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: They only served salad. When I think Homewood Suit I think happy Hour with a little dinner so you feel at home. But this hotel only served salad snd you spent a lot of money staying at the hotel and still had to spend money for dinnet

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our beautiful room was on the 3rd floor (we liked that as we could use the stairs but the elevators are fast and quiet). It was super clean, modern and a good size. The kitchenette was awesome ! A two burner cooktop, microwave and tiny dishwasher. There was dinner and silverware for 4, glasses, pans, serving and cooking utensils. We didn't use them but when we return we will! The rooftop deck/patio is AWESOME! There is a good view of the Empire State building. It was lit up red white and blue during our stay.Concierge and front desk personnel were all helpful, kind and knowledgeable.The breakfast was good and beautifully set up, they had a different egg dish every day, bacon, bagels/bakery, fresh fruit and loads of fresh hot coffee/teaThe location is in the garment district. Right down the street from Mood Fabric (only important if you love sewing or Project Runway). The subway was near enough for us, about 4 blocks (we used Penn Station most times). Oh the business center was small but efficient, two large screen computers. And the work out rock was excellent.A great stay !

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Convenient, if not particularly glamorous location; excellent front-desk service. The rooftop terrace on the 22nd floor is not to be missed. Room is clean, smallish, but exceptionally well-organized - our efficiency fit in a fully-stocked kitchenette with a dishwasher, a desk, a closet, a king size bed, a foldable couch and an expandable table. Tea/coffee/hot chocolate station near the checkout seems to be open at all hours. The convenience store has a limited, reasonably priced selection of foods and toiletries. The Green Emerald Garage is across the street (you can enter and exit on both 37th and 38th street, regardless of what Google Maps tells you), and if you get your ticket validated at the hotel, the price is $45 for 24 hours ($50 for SUV). Valet parking only.The less-than-stellar experiences were all minor, but they did add up. E.g. the dishwashing liquid was supplied, but diluted to the point of being barely colored water. The lack of garbage bags in a hotel with a kitchenette is startling - not a single garbage bag, not in the bathroom, not in the kitchen. The breakfast was hot but barely palatable, and there is very limited room to sit unless you come early, as we did. By the time we finished our breakfast, people were clamoring for every available space in the front lounge area, by the elevators, etc. The building is also underserved by three elevators - the wait was always long, and elevators invariably crowded. But that's a Manhattan thing, so it's understandable. The room is well-isolated from the street, but super-noisy inside - the air conditioning unit and the fridge kept us up most of the night. Given all that, would gladly stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location and very nice rooms that are kept up well and very clean. This hotel delivers everything with promptness and professionalism. Everyone answered every question and request first with a smile. All of our requests were met with no questions asked. The reception staff, breakfast room staff and all housekeeping staff were wonderful . We would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York. The breakfast especially was a nice addition- My only complaint would be to add in more fruits and plain yougurt!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice hotel in a great location, Room was a good size , kitchenette included appliances, dishes pots and pans which is very efficient specially when traveling with kids. once in your room, it was nice, quiet and comfortable. The hotel is non-smoking which is a plus. Room and hotel overall was clean, staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was generous. more likely i will consider staying in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent a week in Homewood Suites, having experienced the same chain in San Diego. We weren't disappointed: the room was comfortable, the staff very friendly, and it was great experience.It must be said that the food provided for breakfast wasn't great, but since it's at no extra cost it would be unnecessarily harsh to mark them down for it.The only problem we had was that the wifi (fairly good) vanished for about 24 hours without explanation. There are plenty of places that advertise wifi and don't provide it and this was NOT one of those, but it could have been better.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It was a last minute decision arriving in very late from Penn Station. The reservationist was great they honored the price of booking.com. When we arrived we were astonished of the beauty & cleanliness of the room. We will most definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Upon booking the hotel promised a suite with couch. They are redefining the word "suite." It turned out to be a regular, smallish hotel room with kitchen facilities along one wall. The couch is barely big enough for two people to sit; it does not even have two arm rests. The bathroom is about 6 by 6 feet (excluding the shower, which is spacious) and lacks decent shelf space.The hotel is advertised by Hilton as Times Square South, That's also a stretch. It is off 8th Avenue in a particularly dingy stretch of 37th Street. But the bottom line: this is not a Suite hotel. Don't be fooled by the title.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It's walking distance from both Penn Station-Macy's and Times Square. Had a cute little efficiency. The hotel is only two years old. LOVED the laminate floors instead of a worn out carpet. Daniel the Concierge could use some work, though. He's too crabby. Other employees were super nice. Will be returning to this Boutique Hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staff was great! Free breakfast was great! Room was clean and confortable. Location was close to the midtown hot spots with no traffic noise. Besides the party goers being loud every morning at 5am, our stay was perfect! I will definitely stay again and maybe bring the kids next time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was small but adequate for us. It was very contemporary in design which was very important to me. Location was ideal to combine the shopping n commuting we had to do. Service was not exceptional honestly but the breakfast buffet was good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This newly renovated Hilton property had everthing we need for a vacation stay in NYC. The location was convenient to the subway and there were several local eateries close by on the nights we just wanted to grab a quick bite. Our room was a balcony room; we used the outdoor space to read the paper in the mornings and to read outside after a long day of touring. The hotel had a nice workout facility and breakfast every morning. The front desk staff were super and very helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fantastic trip. Fantastic location super clean so friendly and went above the service I expected. Super safe as very quiet hotel. The breakfast was very good. Lots of selection and hot! Evening social was great as well the roof top patio is great to enjoy a glass of wine on

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great for visiting with a family due to the larger suites, wifi for 3 devices, and some free meals(not that we had any). Unfortunately the suites lacked room to put 'family amounts' of clothing away and space in the bathroom was minimal. A great family base, but not great if you wanted anything more.
user_name:
Gooobie
Weston super Mare, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a really great hotel in a great location. The suites are great especially when staying for a few days. Lovely breakfast and nice to have tea and coffee available anytime of the day. The staff are lovely and friendly too. I would definite stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is convenient to reach from Penn Station and Times Square subway stations yet on a quiet street so close to action. Entering the lobby is like an oasis compared to the bustle of the vibrant city. Checking service was friendly and efficient and the room spacious with fully equipped kitchen and work desk with chairs and couch. Very creative space making considering the challenges of being in Manhattan. Elevators are quick with very little wait. Breakfast is from 6:30 to 10:30 plenty of time and very satisfactory. With the efficiency and friendly service experienced I would definitely stay here again should work or leisure bring me to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: ONLY CHANGES WOULD BE TO GIVE ALL GUESTS WATER AND POD COFFEE POTS. loved the room and how large it was. staff was wonderful. breakfast could vary instead of the same thing each day. the salad bar was ok but nothing great

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great QUIET and large hotel with kitchen, fridge, etc - super comfy bed & pillows and easy walk to anywhere. Only complaint - zero cell reception in my room. Free wifi however...will def stay again for price & amenities.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've been a guest, off and on, over the course of a year...it feels like home and when my family flew out, they treated them with a great deal of attention. Really nice, with gifts and a welcome card for my wide and 3yr old.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There's no other spot for the money that delivers the quality of the staff at the Homewood Suites Midtown. It is my home away from home and all of the amenities are in house or in proximity. Hilton has done a smart thing to bring the suites concept to the business traveler. Nafessa, Diogenes and the entire front desk and support staff deserve all the credit for the positive outcomes. Thank you for being so great!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a quiet room in the back corner of the hotel, really enjoyed our stay here, extremely helpful staff, comfy bed, roof top terrace was very relaxing, excellent value for the price, very convenient to have microwave and full size refrigerator in room

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This Homewood suites is an excellent location from Penn Station and the hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and the Theatre District. The hotel is very contemporary in it's décor and is clean and pleasant and the rooms are very quiet. Breakfast is included which consists of eggs, bacon, toast, fruit, cereal, etc. The breakfast is very good and the service is excellent. I paid a rate of $198 per night, which is very reasonable for NYC on a Holiday weekend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel was really nice and clean, no funky smell! Staff was wonderful and very helpful. I would definitely come back to this particular hotel and recommend to my friends and family. I enjoyed the roof top
user_name:
Angela O
Jersey City, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was amazing. I wasn't even aware that our room would come with a full fridge, stove and dishwasher! the sofa bed was comfortable and the king was more than enough for 3 people. The room was small but we didnt care as we only used it for sleeping. Alot of options for breakfast.The only complaint is the elevators take time when people are checking out

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I really cant say enough about this place, my girlfriend and I were astounded by how nice the room was (and it was cheap, AND AND AND... it was their cheapest room!!!) kitchenette was awesome, large refrigerator microwave, AND a small stove!! WHAT?!?! free breakfast, (yes, eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, cereal, bagles etc... unbelievable! the staff was really nice, kind, sweet, I don't think i have ever stayed at a place that offered this much bang for the buck!! Book it now, you wont regret it for a minute!
user_name:
Marlo R
Los Angelos, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed 2 nights in August 16 and enjoyed the Downtown New Yokr hotel, on 8th Ave and near Times Sq/42nd St and Port Authority station.Lots of shops and restaurants within a few minutes walking distance.Hotel was very busy and with only 3 elevators, you could wait a long time at rush hours (breakfast, check-out...)My room was only on 4th floor (hotel has 22 floor) so kind of disappointment with no view. It was still quiet as it was facing 37th St. And the room was large. No bath, only shower. Big king bed, larger Kitchen and fridge, sofa and desk. It was very cold in the room upon arrival as housekeeping turn it into 65F. I didn't like it.Free breakfast (crazy and busy place around 9am, better go at 9.30-9.45), free wifi and good staff.Price was right and I might be back but wil definitely choose a higher room category next time.Booked a cab (Towncar) to JFK Airport at 65USD from Concierge desk.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family and I traveled to NYC for the first time and loved it. Homewood Suites was a big part of our positive experience. Great location, beautiful hotel and the amenities were amazing! The breakfast and evening reception were full meals that were part of our reasonably priced rooms. For NYC and to be able to include 2 meals into the hotel price really helped us save money in an expensive city. Front desk staff and concierge staff very friendly. Really enjoyed our stay and if we head back to the Big City, Homewood Suites will definitely be the place for our stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location near Penn Station was very convenient. The room was spacious for NYC standards. The rooftop terrace was a nice option to get away from the busy lobby and visit with family who were also staying at the hotel. The breakfast, while plentiful, offered very under-whelming food. We heard the door to the room adjacent to ours opening and closing.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is very well maintained and has great staff. My family felt very welcome and enjoyed the breakfast, snack, and hot beverages at any hour. I would stay here again. The location is walking distance from Times Square, Madison Square Garden, and the subway station.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very comfortable and spacious. Lots of room for our family of 5 plus dog in one room. It had a kitchenette included and 2 queen size beds plus a sofa. The bathroom had one of those sliding doors which was a bit odd as it doesn't give the same kind of privacy but it saved space. We would definitely stay here again if we need to stay in the city. Great location near Macy's and the Empire State Building , Friendly staff, very clean and well maintained, delicious drinks and treats in the lobby 24/7 and great breakfast. It was expensive in the middle of summer for our big family but everywhere in the city is pricey. We are glad we booked this place. Thank you for making our stay enjoyable and comfortable!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We found this hotel to be decent enough -- but it had some downsides...wasn't quite up to the Homewood Suites standards we are used to due to some cleanliness issues (see attached photos). First of all, our room was kind of small -- and YES, I know we're talking NYC -- been staying in hotels there for years -- but was still surprised at the lack of space for a Homewood Suites. We were in town for 4 nights this time so had a small carry on with us. But there wasn't even enough room to be able to set up the luggage rack without it being in the middle of the "walkway" area of the room!However, after seeing some of the other traveler photos of similar rooms, I think we might have just had a "bad luck of the draw" based on our room's location possibly. Our room was located around the corner from the elevator kind of in a "corner" -- so maybe it was "gypped" a bit on space...??? I THOUGHT when I made the reservation I picked one with more square footage (vs. others that were listed)...so maybe we even ended up with the wrong room?? There was a nice desk area -- but then a large TV took up alot of space on it!! Would be nice if they'd consider mounting the TV on the wall! We did however love a little table that was in front of the couch that folded out into a larger table space -- which we used quite a bit.We had a wonderful, large window -- however it looked directly at a factory. We could see into the factory, so figured the workers could probably see into our room -- thus our blinds ended up being down ALL the time!! There was a wonderful rooftop deck area which we utilized and enjoyed! The lobby is beautiful -- but tended to be extremely crowded any time we came through. The breakfast area was nice as well but is long and narrow -- thus is not conducive to the large crowds that were present usually. The location of this hotel wasn't bad -- although we've stayed in better locations in NYC as far as subway access goes (but I knew this when we booked this hotel). The biggest issue though with this particular Homewood Suites was the lack of cleanliness!! There was dirt on the bathroom floor when we checked in, the frig door was filthy on the outside, and there was noticeable dust on the arms of the couch as well as on the light/fan (see pics). While I'd rate this hotel as "very good", and I'd consider staying here again, I'd definitely check into staying at the Hampton Inn Times Square North again FIRST -- the rooms were MUCH larger and multiple train lines were literally across the street!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Really cool hotel! Nicely done with. Cool fireplace ! Access to coffee drinks a nice free breakfast and an evening reception The room was a nice size (in NY terms) comfy and had a fridge kitchen even a dishwasher !Convenient location to everything whether you're going to Times Square Chelsea or the high line It's not the prettiest location in NYC however the hotel location and amenities make it a great place to seeI will definitely return Ps parking is located bit too far from the hotel and it's not so bad (again in NYC terms)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff here was absolutely amazing. Nafeesah, the front office supervisor, was just absolutely amazing and welcoming. The rooms were really clean and very spacious. The bed was just so comfortable that I literally forgot where I was because I was in such a deep sleep. Th location was also a major plus. I thought I would be using Uber but I walked everywhere.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful stay last week. Great location for walking everywhere in and around Times Sqr. 2 min walk to Penn Station. Large modern and clean rooms, very helpful, friendly staff. We are a family of four (16 & 14 yr olds) and all appreciated the hot breakfast options and large clean eating area. Really appreciated returning to hotel after long tour day to find fresh ice tea, homemade cookies in the lobby followed by hot appie items pre dinner. Amazing touches for a hotel. We travel a lot with and without kids and I have become pretty picky when it comes to hotels. No negatives with this stay and would definitely recommend and stay again if back in the big apple!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Highly recommend staying here. Great location quiet rooms and also very clean. Rooms were big. The check in staff was very friendly and willing to help with anything. The social hour had good food but no alcohol.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My Homewood Suites stay was my first experience using it in New York. The location was convenient and close to many venues and had great access to various modes of transportation. The rooms were very modern and clean with great features such as complementary internet, appliances and smart TV. Some staff were a little on the New Yorkish side but most were friendly and willing to help. It was definitely a worth while stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was huge by NY hotel standards. Breakfast was great each morning, plenty of choice so that everyone found something they liked. The evening social could easily be a substitute for going out to dinner on evenings when you are just too tired to make the effort. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is very good. We walked from Penn Station when we arrived and we were able to walk to many attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY.
user_name:
Beverly R
Fredericksburg, VA, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was clean and a fair size for New York. Breakfast included in the price was an added bonus and offered a good choice. Access to coffee and tea in the lobby was most welcome! Staff friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, clean, comfortable beds and linens, quiet.Spent three nights in this location and would highly recommend. Property includes decent breakfast and hospitality hour.Front desk folks were courteous, prompt and helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We booked this hotel for a four day business trip. We were delighted to find that the room, while smallish, had absolutely everything we needed. It was clean, lots of natural sunlight, walk-in shower and full kitchen, including freezer and dishwasher, plus all dinner and cookware. Plenty of closet space plus an in-room safe. There was a new thermostat which worked perfectly and a ceiling fan. Sleep quality was not great because mattress and pillows were ultra mushy. It also comes with a free breakfast and afternoon "reception." The food was the only real disappointment: Everything was institutional and flavorless. And the hot food, even the full trays, were barely tepid. The only good food were, oddly enough, the fresh vegetables and fruits - they were of much better quality than the average buffet.The location is excellent, convenient to Penn Station, the Javits Center, the theater district and Madison Square Garden. The rooms were quiet. Most of the guests were foreign tourists. Dollarwise, an unbeatable value for mid-town Manhattan. We will definitely book here again on our next business trip to NY.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful Hotel Clean and Friendly Elevators are super FAST!!!!! Breakfast crowded BUT WONDERFUL hot and cold items Maybe in the future waffles? Rooms clean and roomy Like new Hotel Afternoon cookies freshly baked and yummy

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We travelled as a family of four and we took a 2 queen size beds room.The room itself was very spacious (unusually even for NY) and had all the amenities you might need of with small children or teenagers (fridge, oven, microwave, etc.).We liked the included breakfast (although you should avoid peak hours) and we liked the permanent access in the Lobby to hot drinks.The staff was very friendly and helpful.The hotel is very conveniently located for walking in midtown and Penn St metro - which has an access two blocs aways (on 35th St.) - takes you anywhere else.Wifi was OK in terms of speed but the fact that you had to insert pwd everytime you connected was a bit annoying.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spend one week in NYC with a group of 6 adults. Location of Homewood Suites was perfect. Close to the subway and 10 min walk to Times Square. The size of the rooms are spacious for NYC. The breakfast was included and was rather good (however, rather basic stuff and not the reason why we will go back) The happy meal evening from Monday to Thursday was a nice surprise for us. The staff was very helpful. If we go back to NYC, we may go back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is great, clean, welcoming staff. Rooms were cleaned everyday. Very modern, great wifi in room and lobby. Check out the views on the roof top, floor 22. We were on the 6th floor, 3 lifts, gym. Restaurant was clean and modern. Breakfast was good, buffet style. Hotel located between Madison square gardens and time square. 10 min walk and your on 5th avenue.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Superb Hotel with big rooms.,likely to see this kind of room size in Manhattan... Good location,Good health club.. Ideal for familys and short stay biz . Check in staff very friendly.,GREAT value for Money

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
