review_body: My husband stays at hotels every week in NYC but I came for a visit for 4 days. We stayed at the Homewood Suites so we could have extra room. We got to the hotel very early so we could not check in right away but they had drinks and snacks so I waited for our room and watched TV. My husband is a Diamond member so he requested early check-in and sometimes they can accommodate the request. They told him to have me check back in an hour and when I did Thomas told me they didn't have our room ready. It was still hours before regular check-in so no big deal.about 15minutes later Thomas came over to me to tell me he could put us in another room just one floor above the room my husband picked and of course, I said yes!The room was fantastic and the full refrigerator, stove and microwave with a fully stocked kitchen is a nice plus! the breakfast food was great and all service was friendly and superior! I used the fitness facilities and they are well maintained.The location is central and everything is within walking distance.I definitely recommend this hotel if you are visiting the city!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a good hotel. It is clean, recently remodeled and service was fine. Breakfast was o.k., but I like to eat breakfast out when in the City. We came very early 11:30ish in the morning. They had a room available for me (great), but it was only on the 7th floor and facing the back (not so great). In any case, I would rather have the room where we could drop our stuff off and head out rather than sitting around for a couple of hours. Moreover, if you want a view, you can go to the rooftop terrace and behold. Our room was just fine. We didn't spend much time there anyway. Breakfast is ok, but very busy after 9:30 a.m. - maybe go down sooner? I enjoyed it and would come back again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This Homewood Suites property is different than all other cookie cutter Homewood Suites. It is located in a busy Manhattan high rise. The building is old, but the interior seems to be brand new. Our room was clean and all the furnishing and appliances were better than other Homewood Suites (slightly upgraded in my opinion). It has a roof top terrace and an indoor pool. Our room was smaller than other Homewood Suites, but it is still pretty large compared with other Manhattan hotels that we've stayed in the past. The breakfast area is quite hectic as there were a lot of guests when we stayed there, the food was refilled quickly (but not the cut fruits, which ran out both mornings that we had breakfasts there), but hard to find a place to sit. It is really not a big deal since this is Manhattan, space is always at a premium. The location is convenient if you are a tourist visiting NYC, but at the same time, it can be difficult to get around by a car due to the high volume of traffic. Again, this is not the hotel's fault, just something as a guest, you will need to decide if you want to be close to the action. The gym was small but functional and the roof top terrace was nice, but it was too hot for us to stay more than 5 minutes (there was a heat wave in NYC when we visited). All in all, we had a real good stay as the staff was very friendly (a nice change of pace from some of the other hotels in NYC). I would definitely recommend this place for a family (probably not that good for business travelers unless you are doing business in the NY Garment District, which is where this property is located at).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Last minute trip with Family of 5. Large accessible suite. Great amenities. 3 blocks from Times Square. Near Madison Square Garden and Bus Terminal. Complimentary Breakfast was very good with lots of choices. Roof deck, large gym.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I travel quite a bit and I must say this hotel is among the best. I have not experienced better customer service anywhere. The rooms are exceptional for a New York hotel. I travel with a large group every year and this is the only hotel we use. The breakfast and evening light meals are perfect. The staff makes sure to take care of minor details that do not go unnoticed. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The ntire staff was very nice the entirw stay. The complimentary breakfast and evening social had lots of good food options. The internet service was fast. Easy access to the subways. Good coffee choices "Gregory's" and "by Suzette" outside of the hotel just around the corner. A great great stay. We'll definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our room was close to Penn Station & near many of our planned activities - walking The Highline, Hop on Hop Off Boat, theater, great restaurants... - We were three women & we had 2 Queens, a pull out couch & a kitchen. The room was clean & comfortable - breakfast in the lobby from 6 to 10:30 every morning. There were also some amenities we didn't use such as a gym, laundry facility, a rooftop terrace... Staff was wonderful
user_name:
Lynn4four
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel, great service and very friendly staff, great free breakfast, spotless rooms, great location. Loved everything! Would highly recommend to everyone! Needed something for the room and got it right away.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New Homewood property did not disappoint. We thought these rooms were among the biggest we have stayed in.Hotel in well situated for Broadway if that is,your purpise. Although the aeea is still in transituin. Very nice for the extended stay business guest.Some odd room choices for four three or more guests. No bathroom counter top and the mirror outside is not convenient for getting ready. TV is infront of small pull out couch and one bed but not the other. All of this can be overlooked with the size and configuration of the room. It is simply heaven to find this kind of space in NYC especially for 3 or more room guests. The size of the beds is good which is nice if more than one will be occupying them.Cannot overlook the large breakfast and night receptions. Lots to chose from and FREE. That is a big bonus in NYC.It will go on my list of properties to check on future visits to Manhattan. It should go on your list too.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights at the hotel in the beginning of August. Our room on the 16th floor was comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The best aspect of the hotel is its central location. One can walk to many of the attractions in New York City. The breakfast was decent but the dinner offered on the weekdays was pretty basic. Overall, a very good stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean, modern accommodation. More than a little disappointed with travelling to New York on vacation all the way from the UK, to find the recent withdrawal of American and European breakfast staples such bacon, sausages etc and the exclusion of alcohol, allegedly at the request of the new Qatari owners, means next time, it's a no from me......

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Upon check in we were informed that this hotel was recently accuired by Qatar Industries (Muslim Corp) BH Hospitality runs this particular location. When asking about amenities were informed they were no longer hosting the evening reception with beer/wine service, and pork was no longer being served. Spending 9 days with the same breakfast, overcooked, and cheese and crackers for the evening dinner meal! Hiltons need to really consider what they sold out to. Families all over come to Homewood because they know what is available to them. Make sure you really know who owns what when booking your stay-

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Found this great hotel in Garment district of Manhattan for a short stay with family. Very modern decor. Breakfast was good with lots of options. Close to Bryant Park and Times Square in Midtown. Walking distance to Penn station. Would recommend it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very clean and pleasant hotel with comfortable beds. The location is ideal and within walking distance of many tourist sites and great shopping. The front staff was cordial and attentive. The only downside was the elevators were slow and the breakfast was mediocre.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Property looks and feels nice. Decent room size and nice decor. My big complain is about someone named Veritta at the front service who was very rude and non helpful to me. I made a mistake when making my reservation and book one kid as opposed to two, called her to request an additional sofa bed or mattress. Her response was very poor saying that they have provided me with what i had requested and that there was nothing else to be done. Not the type of response you would expect for a Marriot Rewards member travelling with children, very insensitive. I asked the person setting up my sofa bed and he got me an air mattress (BTW mentioned the night before everyone in that floor was using air mattresses!) and my problem was solved in 10 minutes. It is sad how a bad response from someone can ruin a whole weekend/experience and review for a hotel. Everyone else at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I liked this little hotel, and liked the location. Off the beaten path but close enough to walk to everything. The staff here was phenomenal especially Omy who went the extra mile for us upon check out. No wonder I always stay with Hilton. They truly take care of you. Rooftop has a great view. Parking is across the street and quite expensive but what do you expect in New York?Not sure I will be returning but I did like this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is very conveniently located next to major attractions. The rooms and lobby are very clean and the hotel staff are really nice. The coffee at the lobby is also very good. Like many New York hotels, the room is small especially when accomodating three adults. Also the breakfast would have been great, had it offered non-pork options for non-pork eaters, but it was still definitely very good. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely like to be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for almost 2 weeks during her broadway intensive program. The rooms with 2 queen beds are very large, comfortable and quiet. The staff was always friendly. We were both happy to come back to our room at the end of long days - clean and cool on hot summer days!
user_name:
Susan M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is one of the nicest Homewood Suites Hotels we have ever been in. It's pretty new and the contemporary décor is very nice. They have an outstanding breakfast area, well-maintained by their staff and a beautiful patio area that you can sit outside when the weather is nice. Although the rooms are a bit smaller than usual (it's NYC), they are well-designed for comfort and convenience. Bathrooms are very nice and upscale. They have a concierge in the lobby who can book tickets for you and a nice front staff who are very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. It is also convenient to the Javits Convention Center. We really enjoyed our stay here.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved everything about our stay. The staff was wonderful, the rooms were spacious, well appointed and exceptionally clean. Great location, delicious breakfast was included. We highly recommend this hotel and we commend the manager and staff for making our stay so pleasant. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very nice residence ; Room space is very nice, fully equipped with nice amenities. On the evening , diner/ evening social event , in the morning , hot american breakfast: all included Staff is very friendly Close to Times square but still in a quiet aera

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There are better loations for tourists, but we stayed here for five nights because we had a discounted group rate. The hotel shows very well and appears to have been through a major renovation not long ago. The staff is really great! During our stay our youngest daughter turned 11, and the staff even gave her a small birthday gift, so thoughtful. This is a good location if you are attending an event at MSG, a few blocks away. While we enjoyed the overall experience, what made our stay a 3 and not 4-5 rating has more to do with some of the little details. First, while they offer a free breakfast and dinner during the week, its always the same exact food. Ironically, the eleveator has a picture of their breakfast with a waffle, but never had waffles or pancacks, all that was offered was instant eggs, undercooked turkey bacon, and stale grease tasting tatertots...every day! Fortunately there was a decent enough continental bfast option which was ok. Dinner was similar story. The rooms were OK, a little noisy, could have been better insulated for noise when doing the renovations. They are suites, so they offer kitchens and the studios are a bit larger than a traditional hotel room. I heard the 1BR suites were a really nice size. If you are on a budget and want to eat in your room its a good option in Midtown.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Decent hotel for a short visit to New York. Biggest frustration was the elevators. Three small elevators and one was either down or being used by room attendants. For a busy location such as this there really aren't enough. At times we would spend 15 minutes or more waiting and then if one came it was too full.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very pleased with location, near "everything" but Not in time square (I do not like to be in the middle of time square). Hotel was very clean. Things were new. Staff was always present and available to help with anything needed.I travel alot & I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a comfortable hotel that can accommodate a family of five. The breakfast and evening reception helped reduce the costs of eating out. And the location is walking distance to the theater district, Times Square, and public transportation. Our family enjoyed our stay!
user_name:
Emily K
Plymouth, MI, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here in late July and used points to get 2 King studio rooms because my husband is an Honors member and stays with Hilton on a regular basis. The rooms are small, but nicely arranged so they use space wisely. I think the bed and pillows were some of the most comfortable I've slept on in a hotel. The little compact kitchen area is a bonus and add to that their free breakfast as well as an evening meal during week nights and it really is a wonderful deal. The staff is nice, the hotel very clean and modern. It's not in the best area, but it's close to Penn Station which I found the easiest to navigate to and from different locations. Also, around the corner there's Sergimmo Salumeria for yummy sandwiches, Madman Espresso and Gregory's Coffee, also Capizzi's Pizza which we liked. I never heard any street noise during the night which is a bonus in a busy area. It's a short walk to Times Square, but luckily not right in it, which is a good thing. Highly recommend if looking for a Midtown hotel that's comfortable and affordable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a great stay for the weekend in New York. The staff was excellent. The front desk Tiara greeted us with a smile, and was very accommodating throughout our stay. Thumbs up to her. Danny, the concierge was awesome as well. He was there for us, arranged for our great theater tickets, and told us great things to do on our 1st visit to New York. Other staff members were great also all had smiles, every time we encountered. The room was very nice, clean and good view on 16th floor. Location was very convenient for walking to Times Square, and subway access. we would stay again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location: Just a few steps away from the corner of West 37th and 8th Avenue - location is unbeatable. Room: We had a king studio. On the 12th floor. View was good. Small room, but very well designed and was perfect for the two of us. Micro kitchen unit, with a refrigerator, sink, stove and dishwasher. The only gripe - no USB charge ports in the room. Decent soundproofing. The only time we heard anything was when a child was screaming in the corridor. No amount of soundproofing can work in cases like that. Had no issues with the elevators.Breakfast: Standard. Wish they had regular half and half for their coffee - but a very basic gripe. Overall good value for the money since it was included with the room.Service - Front desk staff was very good. Attentive. We were able to check in at 11. Concierge - could work on the service level. Was busy checking personal emails and we had to wait for a couple of minutes while he finished doing that - until we had to get his attention for him to talk to us. Overall - cannot go wrong. Clean, functional, great location. Price very decent for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Would stay there again. Rooms are very nice, staff were great. We were going to a show and walked to times square which was a nice walk if you enjoy walking. The hotel is in the garment district, wish we had more time to shop, but we were only staying one night. We definitely recommend this hotel as a good value in the city.
user_name:
Deborah L
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We only stayed one night and checked out. We were in New York for 2 special occasions so were hopeful it would be a good stay. We had a great size room but it was an adjoining room. The family next door were soooo noisy and all that separated us was a thin flimsy door. We telephoned down and the front desk did phone and ask them to quieten down but they were back at it again at 5am. Screaming and yelling. But, tbh honest my biggest problem was the the area. I just didn't feel comfortable in the garment district. There were a number of drunks hanging around and it wasn't the kind of area I wanted to be with a child. It is a little seedy. The hotel were very obliging about our check out.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Breakfast daily - warm food such as eggs, bacon, sausage are served at room temp or cooler. Either the warmer doesn't work or it is kept at room temp until it is placed in the warmer. Evening (Monday-Thursday) - BIG disclaimer missing on website, hotel check in and in hotel room info. There is NO wine or beer at this location. This was the only asset to the evening events at this location since the food doesn't make sense and doesn't match what is listed on the calendar in the hotel rooms. We can say this because this is the second year we have stayed at this location. The first Monday no staff member could explain why there was no beer or wine for adults. All adults around our table stated that was the sole reason they booked this location as they enjoy it at other Homewood locations and were repeat customers at this location. On to the food selections and presentation. It would appear that either the person purchasing and/or deciding what food is purchased and served is either on a very strict budget and/or has no idea what foods grouped together would work well together. One example, HUGE bins of pulled pork not kept warm with nothing to flavor the dry shredded mass of meat, mostly left sitting full. You could either use the mayo packets or the blue cheese dressing single serve containers next to the veggies. Hint here, barbque sauce for the pulled pork AND Ranch dressing would be the most normal choice for the one solitary choice for veggies. And if budget is the reason for the mismatch, consider buying ranch dressing in bulk instead of single servings of Blue Cheese dressing. Minestrone soup and tortillnd a soup on Asian night? Hamburger sliders, but no buns or condiments? Nothing else to go with the sliders? Fries? A salad? The only drinks available all four nights were water, lemonade and apple juice. If you removed the adult beverages could you not spring for a small can of coke, coke zero.or sprite? Not in the budget? By Tuesday evening there was less than 15 people there. People looked and left with nothing, the hotel was nearly sold out. Why bother advertising and opening the room if you can't do it well. The Element owned by Westin two blocks over on 39th does it well and we'll be there again next year apologizing for not staying the last two years.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really like the location and service we get at this hotel. Rooms are spacious compared to most NYC rooms and the staff are some of the nicest people you'll meet in the city. My only warnings are that the elevators are small and there are 22 floors so leave extra time, and the food service is just ok. Don't stay here and expect the waffle makers and fresh baked goods at breakfast and full meals at weeknight dinner that you'll find at other Homewood Suites. We make good use of our efficiency kitchen every time we stay there! We will come back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: stayed two weeks on a business trip here and was positively surprised about the quality I got compared to other midtwon Manhattan hotels.Large room (390 sqft), well equipped kitchenette, spacious bathroom, quiet A/C, ample space in wardrobe and drawers. Also cleaning and housekeeping doing a very good job.A few improvement points relate to the restaurant ... breakfast had a tendency to be always the same, after four days you definitely knew what was coming - too basic to my opinion. The hotel also offers "free dinner" from Monday through Thursday. However, I found the food quality rather inferior and thus preferred to get something from the outside - with Fairway and Wholefoods being not too far away for a walk and plenty of joints around in the Times Square quarter.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: From the moment you step through the doors, you are greeted by the friendly and helpful staff at the front desk. The rooms are large, the kitchens are a boon, and housekeeping takes care of business in a timely manner with great efficiency. They serve two meals daily. This hotel manages to be cozy and accomplished. The decor is fashionable, and the hotel is secure. Great location close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the amenities of this hotel was fabulous. you get free breakfast and dinner and a kitchenette in all the rooms..Perfect when you travel on a train and you bring things to keep cool. the hotel is close to Penn Station and metro line. i have spread the word to many that like traveling to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: GREAT STAFF GREAT LOCATION - We have people of different levels of ability and this was a prime location - GREAT ROOFTOP patio - could not ask for more - we where able to go to CENTRAL PARK on foot and find some really neat places to eat and shop - we also were able to walk to BATTERY PARK - we have been 6 or 7 times to this AMAZING CITY and by far this hotel exceeded our expectations - I would stay here again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good access to subway. Easy walk to Broadway shows. Shake shack 4 blocks away! Street a bit scary at night due to street people, but inside hotel very comfortable. Roof had nice views - including the river. Closest shopping Herald Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a smart value in an expensive city. The rooms had a great size with nice ammenities like a full sized fridge and micro wave. The location was convenient to Times Square, 5th Avenue and other tourist spots.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel. It is new, modern and the rooms are great. The hotel staff is very disconnected and not hospitable. We stayed for 7 nights and had a couple of service quality experiences that would have been easily remedied, but the hotel did not rise up to correct them. I loved the building and my room, but I was disappointed with the staff. We have to stay in that area twice a year for at 7 to 14 nights at a time, but we will not be returning to the hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites is in a good location. The hotel is clean. We checked in at noon. The room was not ready, so we were told that we could leave our luggage and tour the city. Normal service by most hotels. The luggage was tagged and we were told it would be put in a secure, locked location. We arrived back at hotel around 10pm and the luggage was unattended, unsecured in the dining area of the hotel. The Homewood suite employee made three attempts to locate luggage. When she finally realized where it was, we followed her to the dining area. Our luggage was all alone near the garbage cans and a dining table. I made mention of how it was unsecured and the employee said the "room was locked". NOT TRUE. WE followed her into the dining room. No door to lock, but if there was some type of slide door, it was NOT shut, NOR locked. LIED to my face. I am highly disappointed. Our luggage could have been taken without anyone knowing what happened to it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel delivers the best of home away from home: comfort, cleanliness, great workout facilities, good food, professional staff. Additionally, it is very nice to have kitchen facilities so that you don't have to eat out for every meal. Highly recommend this Homewood Suites!
user_name:
Cynthia M
Charlotte, North Carolina, USA

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location! Friendly staff and complimentary breakfast and weekday dinner. Rooms are modern and clean with kitchen facilities. Easy walk to Time Square, Maceys, Empire State and Penn subway. Excellent value! Turn left and left out of hotel for good local eating - Uncle Jacks and Skyline Diner.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: So, I literally saw my friend get checked in to the same room type, while at the desk next to him I was told there were no rooms to check into early. Waited about 45 minutes to finally get a room. I downgraded from a city room but was charged for a city view room and was not offered a credit or some sort of compensation. I've stayed at other homewood suites properties in Anaheim and San Jose, Ca, which steered me to go with this property. But in reality rooms were not that much bigger than your standard NYC rooms.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here because my daughter attended a Broadway intensive program a block away. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Got there at 1pm and got right into my room. We couldn't get a Hilton Honors room upgrade because the hotel was booked solid for the week. I could see why. The room was spotless. It was huge. We had a king size bed and a twin size pull-out couch. A full fridge, a desk, a table, an ottoman, tons of lights, a decent closet and bureau, and a fantastic kitchenette with a stove, sink, microwave, fridge, and dishwasher. Oh, and there were like 16 outlets in the room - enough for all of our electronics - ha ha. The hotel served an awesome free hot breakfast (and a happy hour each day M-Th where I was able to get a side salad.). While there were a lot of guests, the staff made sure the food was flowing and it was hot and delicious too. The cleaning staff made the room sparkle and were extremely polite. There wasn't a long wait for the elevators (there were 3) and they were fast, too. Although you didn't need a key card to get between floors, I wish it did - it's a security thing with me as far as safety. Dio the manager took care of us - he found a second room for us - we needed another room for just 2 nights due an unexpected friend who had to come into town due to a family emergency. The business center was busy but it was fabulous. You could send your documents over the internet to print (nothing sensitive of course). The workout center was full of clean machines and the laundry machines were quick and reasonable. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. The only complaint I had about the hotel was out of their control. At the corner of 8th and 37th street is a free WIFI station and the homeless/druggies hung out there to catch some free WIFI. It got difficult at times when they blocked the sidewalk or got a little boisterous. I found that crossing the street to avoid them did the trick. It's not something anyone could control, and these little WIFI spots are now stationed all over the city so the problem is not an isolated one. Highly recommend this place, and if my child does this program again next summer, we would definitely stay here.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was so convenient to Times Square. The room was immaculate, the lobby and hallways clean as well. The staff was fantastic and helpful navigating me around the city. We were able to walk around city, and the hotel was centrally located. We were welcomed with smiles and questions regarding our needs while in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood suites is located right close to the attractions in Manhattan and very close to Time square. We just walked to 8th avenue to join the HopOn HopOff tour bus, Madam Tussauds and many other attractions. Excellent service and family friendly. Very clean and modern decor! Breakfast selection was excellent as well but could be crowded.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I found Homewood Suites clean and affordable. The staff were willing to help with direction so we could see the Big Apple. Thanks to Rodney for his knowledge of his city. This was a great trip. I will keep this hotel on my good list!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed at this location before. I like this location because it's not a far walk to the subway or you can walk to uptown and the theater district. Quieter than staying closer to Times Square. The property is well maintained and very clean. This staff were friendly and seemed to really enjoy their jobs. I like seeing that.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Yes, we stayed in Manhattan to later take a subway to uptown for a Yankee game.A very wise choice, this is by far a 5 star hotel in the heart of Manhattan with awesome amenities. With both a complimentary breakfast and dinner.Just blocks from walking to time-square and the hard rock.We will be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for a family 4 day vacation in the city. The hotel is walking distance to the metro station as well as Times Square and restaurants. It was very clean with a great gym and upstairs patio area. Our suite was supper clean and updated. We did not take advantage of the night manager drinks and dinner but did use the breakfast buffet. It was convenient and had all of the standard Hilton breakfast items. We would stay again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was a really good hotel at a nice price to stay at when visiting NYC. Great location - at Times Square but not in Times Square, so no noise from the streets. And within walking distance to all midtown tourist attractions. Our party of four women and one teenager shared a one bedroom suite in which there was a complete pentry - although we didn't use it much since breakfast was complimentary. And the breakfast was ok - basic but something for everyone. A pleasant surprise was that dinner was also complimentary Monday thru Thursday so when we arrived at dinner time on Thursday evening we didn't have to rush out to find someplace to eat. Free WiFi in the rooms and public areas saved the day for our teenager and it was also easier for the adults to keep in touch with the folks back home. The staff was very friendly and helpful - especially when our transfer to the airport didn't show up on time. On their own initiative they contacted the transfer service to find out the cause of the delay. The room was kept clean during our stay - though they supplied towels only for 3-4 people although we were 5 people checked into the room so we had to request extra towels every day. But as a whole we were very satisfied with our stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A hotel with family rooms (up to 6 beds) and breakfast buffé. Fresh fruit and Youplait youghurt and toast.Unfortunately only jam to put on the toast. We from Sweden likes cheese, ham or similar.Nice to have cold/hot food between monday and thursday, 5-7 o´clock.The hotel is situated in the middle of Manhattan nad you are near to everything.You could ask for gluten free bread for breakfast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After coming back to the states and running around NYC with the fam, I wanted to relax in the lobby and sip my tea. Something I did in the UK. Jeffery demeanor and singing was a pleasant surprise to end my night. Very relaxing. The staff is awesome. Paul and I taking a selfie. Keeping it real and clean. Thank you.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I made a quick trip to NYC to see a show. Typically when we visit we stay in 4-star hotels right around Times Square, though we have also tried hotels in midtown. This time, though, given the very short stay, I wanted to find a less expensive hotel that was still good quality and walkable to the theater. I am pleased to report that Homewood Suites met and exceeded those objectives.This was my husband and my first time staying in a Homewood Suites property, and the New York location represents the brand very well. I tried it out because we have Hilton HHonors gold status, so I wanted to stay at a Hilton-family property if I could find a sufficiently good deal. This property's very high TripAdvisor ranking, really positive reviews, great location, sleek design, and surprisingly affordable rate caught my eye. The room was clean and attractive, and the bed was more comfortable than those I've experienced in a number of 4-star hotels in NYC and elsewhere. The sheets were luxuriously smooth -- they seemed to be a high thread count cotton sateen -- and the pillows were good quality. The self-serve breakfast was good, with nice touches like eggs scrambled with veggies (fresh broccoli and tomatoes or red peppers), red-skinned potatoes, beef sausage, and Sunkist raspberry lemonade, in addition to the more typical bagels, toast, cereal, fruit salad, etc. The hotel might consider adding protein-rich Greek yogurt (non-Greek light yogurt was available) and a self-serve waffle maker (though admittedly those can get a bit messy).The hotel personnel were so service-oriented that at checkout, with no prompting, they apologized and sought to make amends for a fire alarm that required displacement of guests the prior evening. I'm glad to have discovered this wonderful property and will stay there again. Thanks, TripAdvisor community, for the detailed and accurate positive reviews that prompted me to try it out. Thanks also to the Homewood Suites staff and management for making this hotel such a great value.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I don't often do reviews, but the staff at the Homewood Suites Times Square deserves recognition. I'm here with my daughter's Broadway Artists Alliance group, so the hotel was chosen for it's location. But where this place really shines is in it's hospitality. From the moment Talia checked us in to Paul surprising me by hailing a cab quickly when we were running late--this staff is all about service. Every staff member I've encountered from maintenance to housekeeping to food service wears a smile on their face and has a spring in their step. Thank you for making our home base in Manhattan such a comfortable place to be!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Pleased with our experience. Room was large especially large for NYC. Staff was very accommodating. We were able to get into our room hours early. We were able to walk to most locations we needed to and staff directed us as to how to get to other locations.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This place has a great location to explore the city. Easy to get just about anywhere. Rooms are rather spacious with everything one might need. We were traveling with a toddler so having a small kitchen with all the necessary equipment was really great. My wife fell in love with their bed. The mattress was just fantastic to sleep at!Another nice bonus is complimentary dinner on weekdays, which was rather good throughout all of our stay.And the service, it's very good. The only negative thing that I could come up with was the fridge, it's way too loud, especially during the night!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is really an excellent option for those looking to stay somewhere near midtown. You have proximity to the theater scene, Times Square, the Hudson River, and lots more depending on how much you like to walk. Alternatives are taxis and, of course, the subway, which you'll have to walk to a few blocks away (not too bad, but the streets are crowded). The rooms are modern, very nice, and a good size by NYC standards. Considering you get a nice kitchen with a full fridge and microwave, it's really pretty rare in my NYC visiting experience. We had, I believe, a king bed and a pullout couch. Once the couch is expanded, it really takes up a lot of space, but still you could maneuver around pretty well and use the desk/chair with space and ease. Wifi was free. The TV was large. The detached closet was kind of small/cramped, with a rather unwieldy luggage rack stuffed in there. Our view was of a neighboring office building/alley, so while it wasn't exactly thrilling, it kept things very quiet. There were some "next door neighbor" type noises, but during our 8-night stay it wasn't too noticeable. The bathroom was a good size with room for our stuff and good water pressure in the shower. The perks include a full breakfast buffet (great for kids) with lots of options and a manager's reception that could double as dinner if you're lazy. That's pretty good for NYC. The exercise facility was top notch, though there's no pool. As far as customer service, I read a couple of complaints on here, but in eight days we had several very minor requests and all were handled expeditiously and very well, with one exception. One family member has a gluten allergy. This seemed to throw the food staff for a bit of a loop (odd considering it's fairly common these days). In the end they did try to accommodate, heading out to get some GF bagels and then providing info on GF options among the prepared food. So in the end everything was fine, though clearly the level of compliance varied depending on which staff member you talked to. No real surprise there. So all in all I would say the pros outweigh any minor cons in such a way that I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for a longer than normal stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was not like any homewood I've ever stayed at. The whole room was decorated very modern. The bathroom door was a pocketdoor. NYC rules meant that my family of 5 had to get two rooms. There were no connecting rooms. The room was clean. The roof had a very nice sitting area but there were few seats. The morning breakfast area was ok but a little chaotic - lots of people and not enough seating to accommodate. We regularly found ourselves sitting on a couch in the lobby. The hotel's is located in the garment district and we found it to be a great location if you are willing to walk. Time Square and a number of good theatres are close by. We also found a great bagel place a couple blocks away. Finally, this location is very easy to get in and out of - especially to get out of. It was super simple to quickly exit out of the nearby parking garage the hotel uses and get right into the Lincoln tunnel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just back from a trip to New York. Had a fantastic time, walked the Highline, Central Park, Time Square and Intrepid. All easy locations from our hotel. Hotel was excellent, staff were friendly, rooms were clean and breakfast was a bonus. A good time had by all.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The front desk staff seems very nice and greet you every time. The issue is that when you ask them to act on something, they say they will but they won't follow up. This took place 4 times during our stay. We asked for better cushion on the sofa bed 3 times and they promised to take care of it but it only got done when we asked the maid directly and paid her to take care of the problem. The other time we asked them to follow up and see if they had non-dairy milk. They never came back to us to respond after a face-to-face request.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great room tons of space and quiet! Breaky buffet makes it one less meal you have to worry about. All the staff are great very friendly! Close to subways and attractions. They have a car severe they use for a fee which is nice for airport shuttles.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed in this hotel 3 nights over July 4th. Excellent location - very walkable to Times Square, theater district, subway. Lots of choices for eating and shopping. Felt very safe walking to and from hotel. Stayed on upper floor - very quiet. Room looked out over back of hotel - there's not road there, so very quiet. Breakfast each morning was very good - lot's of choices - crowded, but not that big a problem. Full kitchen - stove, full size fridge, microwave. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great place, super clean room, great complimentary breakfast, super clean, great staff, very nice and comfortable beds, and they have a ceiling fan above the bed which to me is a massive plus. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan on staying there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is my 2nd visit and my 2nd review of this hotel. The upsides are that it is new, consistent with most Homewood Suites service offering, friendly staff and conveniently located for NY Penn Station. But I really noticed some downsides during this stay:1) The breakfast quality and variety were significantly less than my previous experience at any Homewood Suites. The only bakery items were bread and bagels. The bananas were all bruised. No waffles and no oatmeal to be found anywhere. The bacon looked unnatural and disgusting.2) The elevators appeared dysfunctional. We stayed on the 21st floor and lifts would come up to about floor 15 and then go down again.3) The noise in the room made sleep prohibitive. It wasn't the noise of New York, but their air system that constantly blows air through the vents, whether you have air conditioning on or not.4) The sofa bed was not even made up for our arrival, despite the fact we had a reservation for 3.As a HHonnors member, this was a clear 'fail' for this place. I won't be returning.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is an amazingly well designed, amenity stocked, eco/green hotel suited for families and business travelers. Breakfast and dinner (3 nights a week) on the house; coffee, tea all day in the lobby. An amazing fitness center, not to mention a full kitchen in every room/suite. Most of these budget hotels feel cramped and serviceable; Homewood Suites on West 37th Street has a wide high beautiful lobby- the entire hotel is sparkling clean and all are there to help and assist. Do stay there.
user_name:
adimarzio
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was great, it's pretty well located, the complimentary breakfast was amazing. They offer a complimentary evening dinner ( which we didn't found about, because we weren't told white staff) which looked amazing. It's clean. It's very quiet.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location – 5-10 mins walk from Times Square, 5 minutes from Macy’s department store and close to plenty of bars & restaurants. Close to the main bus station and also bus stops for the main bus tours (highly recommended as an easy way to get about as you can hop on and off at different points of interest)Benefits of the hotel – Rooms cleaned daily, supplies like toiletries etc. replenished daily – free breakfast with a good selection of fruit/ cereals/ cold meats/ warm food etc. and then also 4 nights a week 2 hours free snacks at evening, which also includes alcoholic drinks….. A nice little extra touch from the hotel for free! Free tea/ coffee & hot chocolate in Reception 24/7.Rooms – Good sized rooms, plenty of space, all came with ironing boards & iron, free safes for use, small kitchen area which was adequate if needed to make small meals with hob, microwave, kettle and all utensils. Good size TVs with plenty of channels and free air con & fans in the rooms. FREE safes to store your money/ valuables.Hotel Staff – Always willing to help, always approachable and plenty of staff on reception/ food area at all times. With a hotel shop for drinks & snacks availableThe hotel can arrange taxi’s to and from the airport for a set fee and also can help secure you tickets for certain attractions etc. Would definitely stay here again, good hotel, helpful staff, great location!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is a real hidden gem of New York!! The location is fab, only 5 minutes from Times Square and within walking distance to a lot of the sights plus it really is great value for money. We stayed for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The complimentary breakfast every morning and dinner most nights was great and saved us some money. The rooms were big and quite luxurious with your own wee kitchen which was a good asset also. I was with people who had been to New York before and they said they would definitely recommend here and were annoyed they had not found it sooner for their previous trips. The free use of the computer and printer was also really helpful when organising paperwork for our flights. The staff were lovely and keen to help you plan your day if you were not sure of where to go or what to do and were more than happy to accommodate any queries or requests you may have had. Overall our experience in Homewood Suites was great and I will definitely be back here in the future!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 7 nights with 2 teenage boys. Good sized room for the 4 of us (2 queen size beds & a sofa bed). Breakfast & dinner (4 nights/wk) was a bonus - busy but fine. Loved the location. Windows were well glazed to cut out the 'New York' noise. Location is great - walking distance to Time Square & all other major sights.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel nice room . The welcome happy hour is perfect. Close to times square. The breakfast is complete, man choices. The rooftop is very nice to share with family and friends. The roomsecond are clean and have complete kitchen.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I booked a room and several hours later I was told the room couldn't be confirmed so I had to cancel, yet the money was drawn out of my account and it would take a week or two too be refunded. The results was lost vacation plans and my time. I'm throughly disappointed in trip advisor and the hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We just spent 4 nights here! This hotel was awesome. It has breakfast, an afternoon cocktail hour, roof top view that is very relaxing, car service, friendly hotel staff and concierge service that was very helpful. The beds were also comfortable and we loved the kitchenette.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My sisters and I stayed at this hotel over the Fourth of July weekend/holiday. We got there super late and were greeted by Junior who was absolutely pleasant during our entire stay! He was always a joy to see and always happy, which made us even more happy to be in New York enjoying this girl's trip. There were other helpful staff at front desk and in housekeeping, some not so much. But Junior stood out to us the most! Me, being someone who worked in the hotel industry for six years I was extremely impressed at his mannerism and professionalism while still being personable and approachable! Making you feel like you've known him for much longer than a few days or even hours. We will absolutely be back! The hotel is awesome. Conveniently located, the beds are comfy and clean, the room has a kitchenette, decent sized fridge, cute stove if you wanted to cook, bathroom was great too; a few questionable stains on the tile but nothing major. We loved it and were so impressed when we walked into the lobby and relieved when we got into the room. Thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel provides a convenient point-of-departure for mid-town NYC attractions and the theatre district. The room was clean and comfortable, although the hallways were noisy late at night. Complimentary breakfast selections and overall breakfast experience can be improved.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location of this hotel is great and so easy to walk to all the main attractions as well as the Penn Station subway if you wanted to go further a field. The breakfast was fine, I have had better but it was still okay and fruit was available to take away after breakfast. The coffee, hot chocolate and tea facility is a really good idea a bit of a moan because no milk for the tea drinkers outside breakfast/dinner opening hours only sweet/flavoured coffee mate. Staff really helpful on our last day looking after our luggage and able to have beverages while we were waiting for our airport taxi. All in all we had a great time

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 2 nights, and though this was a business trip I decided to bring my wife along as she had some time off she needed to take from work too. I made the booking through bookings.com and this was the only part that was the negative. The information on the web site was out of date. The hotel room suite was clean, well maintained, bathroom was spacious enough though the room was understandably smaller as this is Manhattan mid town after all. We took the King bed suite. The wi fi worked reasonably well for all our devices and I was able to get substantial work done in the room. There is discounted parking just next door to the hotel, we had driven in from Boston. Breakfast and dinner is INCLUDED in this deal, and I was told this is the case for all the different room offerings. Breakfast includes meat and eggs and was very good. Dinner includes wine and beer and was somewhat on the basic side, but in terms of variety it was more than adequate. Without exception, the service staff were friendly, happy and helpful. A great way to mix business with family touring. The location was very convenient, with the subway station just a short walk away. Our stay was too short and we will be back, soon I hope.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were flying all night were tired got to the hotel at 10:30 by 11:30 got the room staff let us eat breakfast. liked breakfast hours 6:00-10:30 and they even made special orders for you. Evening meals were good. We loved our hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Well I should just say I am extremely happy with my experience here. Nafissa checked us in and she was the best receptionist I met in New York. At check out , Dio made sure we had everything we needed for the bill. Omy also respectful And Helped us keeping our luggage safe .Breakfast was great and the staff made sure the refill are on its way all the time.Clean rooms and little kitchen was great. The sofa bed wasn't the best but still manageable.I will def recommend this hotel Again thanks to Nafissa and Dio ! You guys are the best!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is in a great location. The rooms while smaller are fully equipped. We were on the 22nd floor and my only complaint would be the noise from the doors slamming to the terrace at night. The staff make this hotel, check in was fast. Any staff member we had contact with was personable and helpful. Who's definitely stay again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Accommodations and service were excellent. Breakfast was great. Room was clean. Roof top deck provides a beautiful view of the city. Front desk staff came outside to help me park and unload my car. This location is close to everything...metro station, happening section of time square, etc.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We booked a double bed suite for 3 Adults & 1 child. It was a good size for a New York Hotel. Location is quite close to 34th street (Macys) and walking distance to the Empire State Building. Not a very desirable location. Expect lots of homeless near the hotel. They did not disturb us but a disturbing sight compared to those hotels nearby Times Square.Homewood Suites had a late check in at 4pm and difficult to get an early check in if you are arriving early. They will acomodate to store your luggage while you can go out shopping. Being a Hilton honors member does not make much difference to the treatment you will get if you are to request a late checkout. Late check out are available to 4pm with a fee of US$150.00. The staff are friendly but I found the Supervisors very strict about their late check out conditions despite we stayed for 4 nights and arrived late on the day of check-in. They were not prepared to extend our late checkout despite we booked the Airport transfers through the Hotel and we had a late long flight back home. I felt the Supervisors were trained to refuse late check out despite whatever circumstances. I did not find this same problem if I had stayed at Accor hotel or IHG group where complimentary late checkout were ready offered. Even offering to pay US$150 I was only given the option for late checkout maximum till 4pm. The Supervisors were not ready to budge with the timing even though the front desk at earlier offered till 6pm. Benefits of staying at this Hotel was a complimentary breakfast till 10.30am and free coffee, tea and hot chocolate offered all day at the Lobby. Room comes a full equipped kitchen but did not use it. The Hotel did not offer much view eventhough they had up to 20+ storey. The Double bed rooms were only offered till 6 storey. Our room faced the main street and it was not a great sight. Opposite were residential and office building. Laundry room available at basement level. It was not occupied and you could do Laundry for US$5.00 for both washer and drying separately. The use of the Computer and printer was useful for printing boarding pass. Overall good experience staying at the Homewood Suites if only the Supervisors can communicate the rules on the late check out in a better manner than giving an excuse that they do not have any cleaners after 4pm so we need to pay for a full rate if we decide to extend anytime after 4pm. I guess this is my 1st time hearing this reason to deter customers from late checkout. I would not stay in a Hotel next time when I have a late flight which does not accomodate late check out even with the option of storing luggage. I definitely need a shower before leaving to the Airport after last minute shopping. I made a mistake and should have booked for 5 nights instead of 4 nights and the additional night rate would have been US$200.00 or lower depending on the period. I thought I would be given the late check out option but it was frustrating negotiating with staff who refuse to give guest the flexibility for a late checkout.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everything was very good, we traveled with 2 adults/ 2 children- our daughter attended a week of Joffrey Ballet School and this location was close to its satellite location. Our complaints were minor such as wifi, difficulty in securing a cab from this location, but overall a nice place to stay with kids.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We brought a grandchild with us and observed many other families with children. It seems pleasant and safe for children. Really like having food available twice a day as it does get overwhelming to find child friendly food after a big tiring day out and about with kids.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a hard time finding a hotel that was economical for our family for our trip. We needed 2 rooms. I used the Hilton honors app and found this. Wanted to stay in midtown, near time square and the hustle. Also wanted to save time and money with a breakfast. This hotel was perfect. Clean and very modern. Coffe and tea all day, fruit baskets in lobby all day. Breakfast changed up the two days we were there. Literally walking distance to everything we did. Parking was easy too. Very techy... Charging stations all over lobby and room. We also had a fridge which worked out for our road trip items.I suggest this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location and mini apt suite.Well recommended for any travelers and especially if you want to prepare your own meals or anything else.The pull our sofa bed was another added addition that we didn't know about. It fits 6 comfortable!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We got this room from hotwire for a decent amount considering it was 8pm when we booked. The rooms are a good size with a mini kitchen but there really isn't much of a need for one in that area since there are no grocery stores within a short walking distance and the hotel offers surprisingly good breakfast. We walked to Times Sq and back but it is a shady neighborhood at night...not a soul on the street except some strange looking characters drifting around which is not what you want to be in the middle of in NYC at night. Otherwise the King bed was on the small size even though the rooms aren't that small. Overall good stay close to Times Sq.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I travel a lot and this hotels staff was among the best I've experienced. Conveniently located within walking distance of many attractions including Times Square. Convenient access to convention center and subways.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood was near Times Square not far from the Empire State Building and all of the sights of NY. I enjoyed it for my business trip because most of my needs were met in my room and kitchenette, but the lobby and amenities were also lovely. Great hotel to stay in when you are in NY.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here with 2 teenagers for 8 nights. Room was comfortable and clean. Was lucky enough to stay on the 22nd floor which had a rooftop patio with great views of the city. Certainly a memorable first trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It's hard to find a roomy, nice hotel in Manhattan that doesn't cost a fortune. This is your place. Large room with a big, comfortable King and mini suite, free wifi, free happy hour (B&W) and complimentary breakfast. Only downside to that is in the summer there's a bunch of families with kids running all over. Also don't book a room near the "service closets." The doors slam constantly.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Room 2115Pros:Room was clean, friendly staff, near Times Square, near public transit. It's nice to have the option to have a light breakfast or evening snack. Cons:The seal on the shower door was damaged and water spilled all over bathroom floor and into bedroom every time we showered. We had to use extra towels to soak up the leaking water from the shower. The sink pipe under the counter in the small kitchen was Leaking and we had to constantly clean that. Last thing we wanted to do after a long day out in the city was to have to clean up leaks after every shower.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is in a perfect location. The rooms are modern, clean and laid out well. The breakfasts each day were very good, with a different set of options each day. The staff are exceptional!! They are very pleasant and go out of their way to make sure your stay is the best!!! When I return to NYC I will definitely stay at Homewood.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A great last minute deal on a king efficiency room. Close enough to everything yet far enough away to be quiet. Great staff with complimentary early bag check. Our room was clean and well appointed. The common areas were beautiful. As a Hilton Honors member I appreciate the level of service that Hilton properties provide. We will be back for sure!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very convenient place to stay for family of five - spacious room for New York City - quiet, off the main streets, would recommend staying on higher floors. Free breakfast was great option, with plenty of areas to eat, watch TV. Very nice dining area. Close to all the main attractions in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I needed to select a hotel for a quick one-night staycation for my family and myself. We have a baby, so we also needed to find a spot that would accommodate us properly. I found Homewood Suites to be just exactly that. The room, while spacious enough (1 King bed efficiency), it provided the kitchenette that we so badly needed with a clean area. Also, they provided us with a nice crib/pack-n-play for our baby so we didn't need to bring our own. Next, they gave a nice gift for my son who had a recent graduation. All in all, they were VERY hospitable, the room was good enough, and the food for breakfast was good as well. Only drawback is the front area, a bit hard to load and unload due to the traffic and space allotted, AND the sketchy folks that hang outside here and there. Just don't be a dummy and flash your wallet or hang outside directly of the hotel and you will be fine. No one will bother you.
user_name:
Saji M
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great value for location. Friendly staff. Shout out to Junior at the front desk for being exceptionally friendly/helpful. Spacious rooms. Hot breakfast. Easy walk to Penn Station. Very manageable walk to Grand Central. Great access to shows and Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I enjoyed a great stay at the Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan recently. My stay was perfect, from the efficient check-in process, to the awesome rooms with kitchen and full size refrigerator, to the delicious breakfast each morning. The staff are welcoming and helpful, the accommodations and public areas are very attractive and clean, and the hotel is in a great location to everything in midtown! I hope to stay there again soon!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: From the respectful, helpful, and friendly attitudes of its entire staff to the clean, modern designs and comfortable beds of the rooms to the delicious breakfast in a remarkably spacious dining room to that refreshing, relaxing 22nd floor terrace, this is a superb hotel--a relaxing oasis in midtown Manhattan. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a great haven in the middle of this very busy city. The place is classy in feel (compared to other Homewood Suites locations - which aren't bad at all either) and staffed with very helpful front desk staff (ask for Junior!). There is a place to plug in and just get connected if you need to wait for your room and the front desk folks will keep you informed of anything. Plenty of coffee and a great dining area - which also serves as the breakfast area - although, there are plenty of good and inexpensive places in Manhattan to eat anything you like. The rooms are of course suites - which means there is a kitchen and a fridge. The bed is very comfortable (we got a King size), massive window, modern bathroom - and generally a large comfortable and modern room.I marked it as a luxury hotel - because it felt somewhat like it. It isn't a Ritz Carlton - but then you aren't paying the Ritz price either.Finally, great location! Steps to Broadway or Times Square. I would gladly stay here again while in Manhattan!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good price, free breakfast and within walking distance of Times Square NYC and other key locations within the city. A good place to stay during any trip within NYC! Easy access to subway. Plenty of good places to eat close by to hotel. Great view from Hotel up on 22 floor. Good internet access.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I choose this hotel for its location to Time Square (15-20 minutes) and the Penn Street subway station (3 blocks). There are luxury condos surrounding the hotel. We noticed every day outside on the sidewalk, the regular neighborhood residents converge here. They do no pay attention to the tourists, they just go about their business.Be careful of where you walk. The sidewalks have all types – brick, cobble stone, concrete, etc. Very unusual for a major metropolitan city.The Lobby is clean, ample charging stations, has 24/7 coffee, hot chocolate and hot water for tea.There is complimentary buffet breakfast served each day. Powdered eggs, some hot plate items and cold plate selections. Guests even come down in their pajamas. Seating inside and in the lobby area for the overflow. Only pet peeve – the tables were NOT wiped down in between guests.The elevators fit approx. 5 people not including luggage. So be careful of your time, if you are departing the hotel with more than one piece of luggage.Suite had a modern design with parquet flooring. Our room faced the street and the lux condos. The kitchen is a plus. It contains an apartment size frig, microwave, dishwasher, electric stove and pot & pans.Both beds sagged. Possibly need to be turned regularly. On the 2nd day, the room was not cleaned. I called Housekeeping and she did not seemed phased that it was not cleaned. This struck me as odd.The saving grace for this property was the excellent Front Office staff. Some of them even fill in at the complimentary breakfast area. Kudos to them for their hard work and dedication!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Despite the small size of the room, the king-size bed and bathroom were well equipped and comfortable. The kitchenette was a good amenity. We enjoyed the breakfast, selection was good early in the morning. The staff was very kind and willing to make our stay enjoyable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Awesome hotel and staff. Breakfast and Social Hour very pleasant and relaxing after hitting NY streets. The staff was friendly and efficient. Windows kept out street noise. Loved rooftop patio and outdoor veranda

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great rooms, great location! The value was fantastic. Most of the staff was very helpful. Tiara (hotel clerk) and Gary (Concierge) were especially great! Be careful of room charges though. Somehow our bank overcharged us based on a pre-approval or something, and the one bad experience was lack of help and empathy from one clerk. Luckily the bank reversed the charge. Everything else rocked!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just back from NYC and stayed two nights at the Homewood suites, I'm a diamond member and was fortunate to get upgraded to the one bedroom suite. Only problem is all the suites are on the second floor. I usually prefer a high floor but the extra room was nice. There is a rooftop terrace that will eventually have a great view but there is currently construction going on next door. Overall a nice modern property, close to the madness of Times Square but in alittle more subdued area.
user_name:
Mark F
flowery branch, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice room, good price, acceptable breakfast, decent location! We walked to Broadway, Macy's, the Empire State Building, and the Javits Convention Center from this location. We appreciated the comfortable beds and the convenience of a small kitchen. We were most pleased with how quiet our room was. Great price for the location. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Without a doubt this is the best Hilton chain hotel in the Times Square area, possibly Manhattan. I'm pretty sure that I've stayed in most, if not all, in this area. If I could change one thing it would be the shower head. The room was spacious, nice work station, and a great kitchenette.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I would specially like to call out Nafessa for understanding our needs and reserving our room. All the staff's we dealt with were courteous and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located to several attractions near by.
user_name:
Saurabh B
Hartford, CT, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I couldn't have had a better experience at a hotel than I did at the Homewood Suites - Midtown. Location was great - a short walk to Bryant Park, Penn Station, Times Square and the theaters. But the staff and the service was even greater!From the moment I walked through the doors I was greeted by the friendly front desk agent. He checked me in quickly so that I could get to my room and make it to my dinner that I was running late for. Breakfast was busy with guests but it was always fully stocked with food and the fruit was fresh (not brusied or overripe) on both days I was there. My room was quiet, nicely decorated and clean. I love the floor to ceiling windows! How they fit a kitchenette, a pull out couch, foot rest, desk, armoire and bed into a NYC hotel room and still make it feel like you have so much space is amazing. Front desk was attentive and helpful with directions. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning my room and stocking me with amenities and the public areas always looked clean. Lunch prepared for our meeting was tasty... the yummy fresh baked cookies were a huge hit amongst everyone at the meeting.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everything about this hotel exceeded my expectations from beginning to end! The staff consistently delivered customer service during my stay. Nafessa went over and beyond...she is super awesome! My room was perfect! And talk about great location....walking distance to everything shopping and great food! Would highly recommend the hotel!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: From the moment of arrival up to check out time, the staff here are so helpful and friendly. The hotel is as clean as a whistle, linen and towels changed on a daily basis. Free hot drinks in the lobby 24 /7 complimentary breakfast every morning with something to suit everyone, Monday to Thursday complimentary evening meal, nothing fancy but again something to suit all tastes they even serve free beer and wine with the free buffet. I am by nature very hard to please, but I could not fault this hotel. Located 5 mins walk from Times Square, 5 mins the other way gets you to Penn station so near enough to count but not too near so you can get some peace. I would not hesitate to book here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is CLOSE to everything that you will want to do while in NY. The suites allow you option of having an at-home experience. The outdoor deck on the 22nd floor is amazing and the breakfast is EXCELLENT. Staff friendly and very helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everything at this hotel exceeded our expectations the staff, the facilities..the room was perfect...everything was just wonderful. We were helped to get to the specific point in the NY city that we wanted to go, with maps, print outs...etc.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Group of 5 women celebrating a milestone birthday and we got a room with 2 double beds and a pull out couch.Hotel was new or newly renovated - free Wifi, lots of outlets in the lobby, very friendly and helpful staff.Would highly recommend the hotel and its location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Convenient to Times Square, Cruise Terminal, shopping, shows, and dining. The breakfast was just average for the hotel type, but the room was above average. Contemporary decor, plenty of room, and a great bed! We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 3 of us were traveling to NYC for a girls weekend. We were looking for a larger hotel close to Times Square, but not in the hustle and bustle of madness that is Times Square.This hotel was exactly what we were looking for.
