It was a short walk to Times Square and the theater, but the area was more laid back and quiet.The rooms were spacious, clean and modern. 3 of us fit in there without feeling crowded. The staff was very friendly and willing to help us out.Would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites offer excellent value for group's traveling to feel at home. Their amenities make it much easier to get settled into a new city. The staff is very friendly and provides expeditious service.
user_name:
Valerie A
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This had to have been one of the worse hotels I've ever stayed at. I booked my room over a month ago and I specifically asked for a room with extra towels because there was 3 of us and a room with a nice view and we got NEITHER OF THOSE!! When I called down to the desk and the guy at the desk said they had no rooms that viewed the city available for the night but we could switch the next day and when I said I booked the room over a month ago he changed his story and said they had no rooms that viewed the city..you're employees need to get there story straight. We received a 1pm c/o and we were stuck in traffic and she said that she would charge me $50 half day charge..I work in a hotel and this was poorly serviced and not accommodating by any means. The only nice thing was that it was close to Times Square. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE! The manager that was on when we checked out did absolutely nothing about the room..just said sorry. And housekeeping moved our luggage when it clearly was not in the way. I know it's New York but have some manners!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Visitng New York for the first time with family I was very nervous with the accomodation . However all these apprehensions were set to rest once we entered the hotel. The hotel has a small reception/lobby which is usually quite busy. We were promptly provided an ugraded room on the topmost floor on 22nd floor. The room was quite spacious, very clean and even had a small kitchenette. The floor had a rooftop terrace and therefore during evenings we could sit in the open area and enjoy conversations over beer/wines etc. The hotel provided complimetary breakfast and dinners (Mon-Thur). The breakfast is standard continental version which is quite palatable. They have a gym downstairs and even offer self service laundry facility. The hotel itself is in a great location in the garment district and thereby away from the chaos. Yet. It is close to the famed Times Square and Empire State Building. It has a lot of restaurants nearby as well. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this property for staying and exploring NY

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great midtown hotel. We were on 20th floor which was extremely quite. Huge room with good seating area and kitchen with all you need for a break away. We could even see towards the river from our room. Staff very friendly and cleaning staff work very hard and keep the hotel looking very good. No faults on cleanliness here! Breakfast has everything you need and for some nights there is also a managers reception with food, wine and beer in plentiful supply. Short walk to all the things you need, Macys, Time Square, subways, bus tours, restaurants, etc. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Check out sunset on the rooftop garden! Perfect location near Times Square but away from the chaos. Subway at Madison square Garden a few blocks away so easy to get around the city. Parking called self park but the workers park it and leave the windows open, keys inside and doors unlocked. Had to wait 20 minutes to bring the car up when we needed something out of it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites on 37th Street in NYC is within a few blocks of Times Square. Nice, modern, clean hotel with great rooms and amenities. Large fitness center, very friendly staff, efficiency kitchen in the room, and a nice sized room for NYC! I definitely recommend trying it out!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Had stayed at Homewood Suites before and was not disappointed at this location. Staff was very responsive from front desk, to concierge, and housekeeping when I had left an item in the room and they were very helpful in processing its return. We purposely chose this location to close proximity to Penn Station as we were taking the train to Hyde Park and could walk (no need for taxi). Breakfast offerings good (both hot and cold items) though space is very limited in lobby area. Dinner items were fair but for a quick light meal and included in the room price it was a nice offering (along with the wine). Rooms have kitchen with stove and full refrigerator which made it easy to stock keep food and drinks.Coffee available all day in the lobby.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is my hotel of choice when I come to New York, the room are no bigger than any other hotel but the services are awesome! Breakfast, light dinner in the evenings (Monday to Thursday only), business center, exercise room, and every room comes with a small kitchenette - I personally have never used it but it's comforting to know it's there. The food is very good here! The breakfast has a nice selection egg, some type of meat, potatoes, oats, cereals, fruits, juices, coffee all the regulars. And for an added treat there is a light dinner served on weekdays it's not the best but in a pinch it will do. The rooms are very confortable, clean, the higher floors have a great view, for the best view check out the roof top patio. Plus this hotel was built about 2 years ago so it was a lot of modern amenities. I could go on about how much I like this hotel, but why don't you visit for your self :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Poor service. Employees did not know what they were doing. Breakfast at 6am was supposed to be warm, but everything was cold??? Clearly refrigerated overnight... Not close to subway to get around and really not that close to Times Square or Theater district. Rooms were nice and clean which is important in the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: During my trip, I stayed here and at a much "nicer" (i.e. much more expensive) hotel nearby. This hotel won hands down. The rooms themselves are new, well-appointed and ours had a mini-kitchen which allowed us to keep cold water handy. The area is right nearby boasts the Port Authority Bus Terminal, which is super-sketchy and there were several homeless people sleeping on the sidewalks nearby. So, you may want to avoid heading toward that area if you're walking alone at night. Otherwise, safe as houses and I will definitely stay here if called to New York Midtown for business again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is so nice! The location is close to everything... Times Square Rockefeller Center, Penn Station and MSG. Guest rooms were beautiful and clean. This hotel is perfect for anyone who is staying 1 day or 20 days. The complimentary breakfast was very nice. I will definitely be coming back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We wanted a hotel close to Times Square, and found the Homewood Suites to be right were we wanted to be. The price was moderate and you usually can't go wrong with a Hilton property. The breakfast was pretty good, and the evening reception was very nice.The room was like a small apartment, the King bed was very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great stay! As a tri-state resident I do not stay in the city often, however had to stay locally for a business trip. From start to finish, this hotel never failed to please. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. We had the smallest room- king efficiency studio- to be split between two people. The size was not bad at all, and the layout seemed to use the square footage effectively. The was ample storage throughout the entire room, and it had a full kitchen (even a dishwasher!). If that wasn't enough, the kitchen came equipped with basic cooking essentials, and a hotel events calendar. As if the rooms weren't welcoming enough, the hotel offered complimentary breakfast AND dinner. The food quality was good, with basic options that would appeal to most people. The rooftop lounge area was welcoming, and offered great city views including the Empire State Building. Finally, the lobby had great socializing areas, with business and fitness centers on the lower levels. Extra info- about a 15 minute walk from Grand Central, and 5 minute walk from Penn Station/Madison Square Garden.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Where to begin... I used this hotel as my normal hang out in Manhattan was full. The place is ok - the room is ok, and that's about it. I paid $300+ a night for it, and felt somewhat ripped of for that. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and that is almost all I need - but the hotel is overlooked by another building about 30 yards away that means you basically can't have your curtains open if you have a light on or it's day time and you want privacy.There is complimentary dinner and breakfast - I tried the breakfast.... think hotel buffet breakfast crossed with fast food - I got my food, my coffee from the dispenser and so on and then had to put the plate in a big box and put waste in the bin - kind of like McDonalds. Except I don't pay $300 to go to McD's.Needless to say - won't be staying there again, but if you want somewhere that is ok, close to Times Square (about

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Easy to get to Penn Station as well as the Broadway district. Very Accessible parking garage across the street as well. The staff was very helpful and nice. My daughters loved the room. No view at all but the 22nd floor offers a spectacular view of the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Considering that NY is an expensive city where to stay, the price is quite good considering the facilities of this Hotel.The staff is incredibly gentle, the rooms are pretty new and comfortable. It has many ammenities, plus included breakfast and from Monday to Thursday, there's an optional dinner which you can also enjoy. The negative points would be that breakfast is not that good, the bathroom sliding door doesn't closed properly, abt 1 cm kept open, the optional dinner is being given from 17-19 so besides is free, is not very common that you are at this time at the hotel, for the rest, nothing to complain,

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very nice, the hotel and also the people working there is super helpful.I went with a friend and everything was wonderful. You have all day free tea&coffee in the lounge, very nice when you arrive to the hotel after all day freezing.The cleaners leave the room and the toilet super clean everyday, they care abut every bit.The room is quite big, big bed, big TV, kitchen (you also have a little dishwasher), toilet (equipped with shower)...Downstairs they have a room with facilities to print stuff from a couple of computers with Internet access, a little gym, a small "grocery store" and a laundry.The location is very good, 10' walking to Times Square, 7' to Broadway and around 8' walking to Penn Station.I will definitely come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was EXCELLENT! Our group of 22 girls and their parents really enjoyed staying at the Homewood! The staff was amazing and very helpful from the moment we arrived. The complimentary breakfast and evening social foods were delicious. The location was very convenient for reaching our tour bus and Broadway shows, plus it was convenient for souvenir shopping. Also, we loved the atmosphere of the patio outside of our room!Our girls and parents enjoyed the stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and will likely stay here again!
user_name:
Fenika M
Warner Robins, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Conveniently located three blocks from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, this west side midtown hotel is a VERY busy hub of tourist, family, and business activity. The hotel is a short walk from the 34th street subway stations, Macy's, and Times Square. The food quality was good but the variety of the fare offered was comparably less than other Homewood Suites I have encountered (i.e. Virginia Beach, VA). Available seating in the restaurant area and lounge is limited. Fitness center was spacious and clean. Guest rooms were clean and relatively quiet considering the location of the hotel and the traffic noise. Bathrooms have minimal counter space. Depending on the time of day, expect to wait for one of the three available elevators as they may be busy carrying hotel staff and guests. Need something more? In the evening, check out The Skylark located at 200 39th West Street for chic restaurant, bar, and rooftop lounge with spectacular views of midtown.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Considering we were in NYC, this room was a find. Our stay was quiet and our room met all of our needs, comfy beds, small kitchenette, nice bathroom, reliable wifi. The morning breakfast was standard hotel fair. The location allowed us to walk (2 adults in their 50's and a 16 year old) to Times Square, the Empire State Building, Macy's, Broadway, and many fine restaurants. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had stopped in a Homewood Suites previously and this was of a similar good standard. Check in was a little slow as we had to wait half an hour for our keys but the room was clean, tidy and, for a city centre location, I felt it was spacious.Breakfast and the evening social (as they call it) were great - although it does get busy at times. That said, we always managed to find somewhere to sit.My only complaint was the nighttime noise from idiots in nearby rooms. Normally I don't notice but the problem is that the soundproofing if you are in a room with an adjoining door is non existent; if they stand near that you could be in the same room. Even worse, we had a set of morons who decided to let their child play with it when they arrived late at night - unbelievable.Other than that I was very impressed though.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Lovely stay in the home wood suites everything you expect from Hilton groups plenty of space a/c lovely shower nice little touch with the shower gel /shampoo etc comfy bed pull out bed was a bit bumpy but not too uncomfortable for a 12yr old close enough to all the sites and the Monday / Thursday food great idea saving money and even had a glass of wine or beer nice touch would defo go back nice staff and really nice roof top gardens great great great hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After spending months searching for somewhere to stay on our trip to NYC we chose here. The location for public transport is great, not far from penn st station and the port authority. That has its downside as there are a lot of homeless people and people with mental health issues nearby. We never had a problem with them but it could be off putting for some. Check in was very efficient and we had a very clean room on the 21st floor complete with mini kitchen which was great forange supplies for the room. Elevators were fast and breakfast good, they even end put snacks on Monday to Thursday with free beer and wine. I paticulary liked the 24/7 tea and coffee in the lobby. All public spaces were spotless and staff friendly and efficient. I've heard a lot how people in NYC can be rude but that wasn't the case here or anywhere else in the city. If you treat people with respect then they will treattach you that way. We had a great time here and if we ever come back to the city we will return, oh free WiFi too all over, not just the lobby

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Based on the reviews & pictures here on Trip Advisor and on Homewood Suites by Hilton's website, we had high expectations for this hotel. We were disappointed when we walked in the room and saw how small it was. We stay in Manhattan about 1x a year and this was the smallest room we've stayed in. The was no bath & no sofa that you see in many of the pictures. There really wasn't a space to put your bags. There is a luggage rack provided but using it would block entrance to/from the room & bathroom. There was a desk, 3 large drawers & an armoire, however this was where the iron/board is stored. There is a little space to put coats in. There's a small shower. The seal on the shower was bad & each morning there was a puddle on the bathroom floor. There was no fan to turn on in the bathroom. There was a white powder on the bed that got on our clothes. The people that worked in housekeeping were very nice, always friendly. Continental breakfast of small bagels, fruit, cereal, potatoes & quiche with spinach and meat were provided each morning & Monday through Thursday from 5-7 P.M. a small dinner buffet was available for no additional cost. This includes 2 wine & 2 beer options. I thought the kitchenette would be nice to have but we didn't end up using it at all. I had brought a few food items but there wasn't much room in the cabinets to place them. They are filled with plates & cutlery. The fridge is empty with a lot of room. There is a nice roof deck & you can take food & drinks (including alcohol) up to. I did use the laundry. You need $5 in quarters ($2.50 washer/$2.50 dryer) and your own detergent which could be purchased at the front desk for $3.75/load. You need your room key to access the laundry area.Overall the room/accommodations were sufficient/fine but I would not have spent $300./night + $185. in fees + $40./day for parking had I not thought it would be an excellent stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our family of 3 stayed at this establishment in June 2016. The staff was friendly and helpful. Due to our travel plans, they graciously stored out luggage pre-check-in and post-check-out. The complimentary breakfast and evening social were welcome additions. The room was clean and decently appointed. It is a pity that once you walk out the front door, the local environs are run-down with street/homeless folks just a few steps away, but that's NYC for you.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fab location, walking distance to lots of landmarks. Clean, comfy room. Really nice complimentary breakfast and light evening buffet Monday - Thursday with wine/beer.Hotel staff very friendly and helpful (especially on reception)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was very impressed by the size of the King room which had a couch and big area with a wooden floor in the entry way to the room.It was so big that I was able to do a cardio video workout in the room without knocking into the bed or TV.The complimentary breakfast is great and staff so nice.I recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 1. we were told that the hotel is 2 block away from the time square which is wrong the hotel is approx. 4 block aways as we were travelling with childer and aged personel walking to the time square was task for us 2. time of booking we were told that the room have separate sitting and the children room which was not available.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staff were very accommodating and provided excell entry customer service. Breakfast was great! Bed and bedding was very comfortable. Modular furniture made the room very accessible and convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel.
user_location: West Valley City, Utah, United States
user_name:
roaddrivers
West Valley City, Utah, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: When driving up to the hotel I was impressed and could tell the hotel was kept very clean and was very new. The hotel was very modern and fancy and made me feel like I was traveling business class because of how fancy it looked. The hotel had extremely nice and helpful staff and was fancy in the lobby too just like the out side. The rooms were fancy too and were very spacious, clean, and really did look like a suite. The fitness center was nice and clean. The roof top lounge was fancy and comfortable. The only thing that they did not have was a pool or hot tub. The hotel was in a very quiet and good location. The hotel was only a 3 block walk to the nearest subway station and 5 blocks from Times Square. The only problem was room service. The hotel did not clean our room during the day for the 7 hours we were gone and we had to ask to get them to clean it. We asked for them to take the garbage out and replace towels but we soon found out after being gone for only 2 hours that they only took out the trash and came back really late around 11:00 when we were already in the room to replace the towels. Over all it was a great stay though and I would definitely recommend it for any type of stay especially with family or friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel is in a great location for shopping, shows and many of the attractions. Lack of tables anschairs for breakfast if the weather is bad. Lifts seem to take forever to arrive and I am being really picky now. Rooms were great, really spacious.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Enjoyed a 2 bedroom suite in this hotel for 3 nights to attend a family wedding. The hotel is immaculate, the rooms are very spacious, quiet and well-appointed, and the beds are very comfortable. There are block-out curtains and a decent, casual breakfast. The staff is very relaxed and make you feel at home and welcome. If for some reason you have a need for accommodation in this area then this is a good choice. There is not much to do in the area and it is not suitable for a holiday commute into the city as it is quite a distance - more than an hour to NYC and to Southampton.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Ottimo hotel a 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square. Personale gentilissimo e sempre disponibile. Consiglio la 2 Queen Bed Studio. Letti king size, camera molto spaziosa, cucina completamente attrezzata e completa di lavastoviglie e frigo grande. Manca solo lo scolapasta. Evitate di portarvi la pasta dall'Italia perchè a 5 minuti a piedi c'è un grosso market pieno di prodotti italiani, dalla Barilla alla Levissima, trovate tutto a prezzi modici. Posizione fantastica a 2 passi dalla metro e da Time Square, si raggiunge tutto a piedi. Se desiderate il taxi per JFK vi consiglio di prenotarlo il gg prima per evitare inutili attese (costo fisso 65$). In un letto possono dormire tranquillamente 2 persone. Bagno ampio. Ottima pulizia. C'è tutto dal phon alla sveglia. Consigliatissimo specie per noi italiani. 3 ascensori veloci. Colazione inclusa. le camere vengono fatte verso le 14, tenetelo presente. Ampia fornitura di asciugamani puliti tutti i giorni. Wifi gratuito veloce e sempre disponibile. Ottimo soggiorno, ci torneremo. Great hotel at 5 minutes walk from Times Square . Friendly and helpful staff . I recommend the 2 Queen Bed Studio . King size beds, very spacious room , fully equipped kitchen complete with dishwasher and large fridge . Missing only the colander . Do not bring the pasta from Italy because at 5-minute walk there is a big market full of Italian products, from Barilla to Levissima , you find everything at reasonable prices . Fantastic location, just 2 steps from the metro and from Time Square , you can reach everything on foot . If you want the taxi to JFK I recommend you book it the day before to avoid unnecessary waiting time (fixed cost $ 65) . In a bed 2 people can sleep peacefully . Large bathroom . Good cleaning. There is everything from hairdryer to the alarm . Highly recommended especially for us Italians . 3 fast lifts . Breakfast included. The rooms are cleaned at 2 p.m., keep this in mind . Ample supply of towels cleaned daily. Free wifi fast and always available Great stay, we will be back .

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great staff. Leslie is very kind and welcoming. Need easier Inet access. I'd prefer the rooms on the 8th floor with balconies, but many times those are taken by higher Hilton Honor members. I've don't get credit on my membership for all the other employees that I have stay at this hotel and such I got a referral of some sort.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for two nights. Very convenient location in Manhattan. Very good breakfast and light dinner- all complimentary. Reasonable price. Very clean facility. Friendly staff. Would recommend without hesitation especially for families

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a friendly hotel that prides itself on excellent service. The rooms are a good size and very clean. The additional kitchen facilities within the rooms are excellent and well equipped. The breakfast and evening food was a good bonus.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Gorgeous modern Rooms and great, efficient staff made this trip a wonderful stay for me.at this property. The crowds at breakfast can be big, But staff keeps everything moving well. Times Square and Broadway are an easy and safe walk away. I am a 20 plus year traveler to this city and I whole heartedly recommend this place for a good place in the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Awesome service, the room was a little small, but I think that is New York for you. The room was cozy We stayed here over thanks giving and were really impressed by the thanks giving dinner the hotel provided, it was really good and the atmosphere was great as well.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Located in the Garment District this hotel is close to the subway and only a few minutes walk from Times Square. It's easy to get to all the main sites from here. The hotel is quiet, clean, staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are a good size, well equipped and well maintained. Overall a good value for money option to stay in Central Manhattan

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is within walking distance of Times Square & the theater district. Also not too far from Penn station.We found the situation excellent & the hotel is modern, very clean & our room was surprisingly spacious & bright & although it was facing the street front it was quiet & extremely comfortable. The staff were all very friendly & helpful.The only disappointment was the lack of selection for breakfast, & especially when busy some products were not replenished in a timely manner. The evening light meal was obviously very popular but I was only able to avail myself of this on one night, but this is an excellent extra!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed in a king studio with couch. The room felt very spacious and light, especially because of the floor to ceiling windows and hardwood floor. As we had tickets to a 7 PM show it was very nice to have a quick bite during the happy hour at 6. I can see how people could make it their main meal but that would mean missing out on all the great dining NYC has to offer. Location, location, location. Walking distance to Penn station where you can take a subway anywhere. It was also walking distance to the theatres. We were delighted when we arrived ~noon and were allowed to check-in early.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is a great location just a few blocks from Penn station. All the staff were professional, friendly, courteous and helpful. Rooms are well equipped with pots, cooking utensils, dishes, stove, microwave, kitchen sink, refrigerator and dishwasher.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the hotel in very good place for all subway, theaters, running on the river. rooms clean and nice, staff very helpful. breakfast good but too many people around 8-9. Gym very nice and new. roof terrace not good w/ no water or shadow

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel and staff. The property is very clean with good sized rooms; we had the studio and our room was off the inside courtyard. This made for noiseless and comfortable sleep. The staff was friendly and quite helpful. The breakfast and evening social help your bottom line especially if you have children to feed. The hotel is located in the center of Manhattan just minutes from all the hot spots whether walking or hopping on the subway and thank goodness you're just far enough from Times Square, which is extremely commercial and full of pushy pitchmen trying to hawk tours, tickets, or some type of scam.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I loved our stay here! Everyone was polite and professional. We stayed in a king bed efficiency with a sofabed. It was 3 of us; myself with my 17 and 19 year old daughters and we had just enough room. I had read complaints about the elevator before we arrived. We were on the 20th floor next to the elevator and we did not notice any noise in the room. The elevator was a little slow at busier times but we were not negatively affected by this. The location was great! An easy walk to Penn Station. It is where we arrived using Airtrain/NJ transit from Newark airport. We also used the metro at Penn Station. There may have been a closer station but we met a friend who was coming in from Long Island there. An easy walk to Times Square. (Although, you WILL do a lot of walking). Breakfast was good. The evening reception was good. I would not recommend arriving close to the end as the offering will be limited. I loved the terrace on the 22nd floor and the waterfall in the lobby. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel.
user_name:
Kathleen H
Detroit area, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If the weather is nice, this is a great place to stay because of the outdoor seating areas. The rooms are very nice but small. The breakfast that is included was pretty bad - the "eggs" mixed with peppers looked more like yellow styrofoam packing peanuts than food, the bagels were of the tiny, pre- packaged variety, and there was only 1 kind of yogurt - vanilla. The oatmeal was the only thing that looked appetizing. And there was a 15 minute wait for an elevator to get to this breakfast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites gets an "A" from me because of its class and style. I really had no major problems. The hotel is located approx. 3 blocks from shopping. The garage for parking was no greater than a few steps away and the staff for the parking and the hotel were super nice. I felt like I was experiencing southern hospitality in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed a week at this hotel to attend the world stamp show at Javitts. This hotel was within walking distance of the convention center and also close to times square. There were restaurants and deli stores right close. It was nice to have a fridge and microwave and coffee pot in our room. It was very quiet, which can be hard to find in NYC.They had a nice free breakfast and a cocktail hour with different foods every evening. The staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive. Our tv wasn't working so a repairman showed up in 5 minutes and replaced it....you don't get that kind of service very often and we appreciated it. The beds were comfortable and maid service exemplary. We would definately stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Selected this hotel because breakfast was included ,and the fact that there is a kitchen in every room. Breakfast choices could have been better (For 300$ a night) but ok.Internet could have been faster, but again ok. location ok. Close to Times sq and trains,buses. Not the Waldorf but I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I went to NYC to see the sought after Hamilton musical. I was going to make a day trip out of it but realized that would be cutting time really short. So I decided to make it an overnight trip. I searched for a Homewoods, mostly because that's the only hotel myself and family usually stay in. It's a go to because they accommodate you and really make you feel like you're at home. At this particular location, the staff was on top of everything. They were very helpful, courteous, and greeted you with a smile on their face. They even asked did me and my brother need a taxi or an uber called for our night out. We booked an efficiency and even though it was a small space, they worked their magic and made it look so spacious. The decor was amazing, very modern looking; and the room was very clean...top to bottom. And the location! It wasn't that far from Times Square, Penn Station, Hell's Kitchen and the theater district. So if you're wanting to hit all those places and don't want to travel far? This is a great location for you!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Steps from Penn Station and Port Authority. Close to Times Square and all the busyness of Midtown. The neighborhood around the hotel lacks ambiance and character. Now on to the hotel itself-- it's awesome!! We got a great price. Hhonors members, download the app and you can check in and choose your room. The rooms facing 37th street have a decent view. There is a great rooftop deck on the 22nd floor. BYOB and relax! The fridge, freezer, small kitchen are a great asset to the room. The rooms are modern updated and clean. The hotel staff were very kind and helpful. The breakfast is great and there is coffee and tea in the lobby all the time. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is the first hotel I have enjoyed staying at in Manhattan. Clean, beautiful, modern, and with enough of a kitchen that I can do a few things with food if needed. The breakfast is fantastic. Not just lip service and some poorly made food, breakfast here is fantastic. The afternoon/evening mingle has some pretty great food too. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean and enjoyable. While this is a small room for a traditional Homewood Suites room, it is more than big enough for a manhattan space. The location in the Fashion District is in the most mid of midtown and might not be the most comfortable for everyone to walk around late in the evening, but those used to the city, it won't be a problem.
user_name:
Brett T
Salt Lake City, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It is definitely a great hotel to stay at. They give free breakfast everyday and dinner four days a week. Location is awesome. Rooms spacious and beds are relaaaaxing. Tip your housekeeping person because it is the best of the best.
user_name:
Jordan M
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 2 nights 5/25-5/27 2016. Made the choice based on location, overall reviews and value. This was a great place to stay- all around. The staff was very friendly and efficient, the held our bags all day while we explored NYC on the day of check-in as well as after checkout while we had time before our train.Very short walk to Penn Station and reasonable 10 min walk to the theaters. The room was clean and modern with a nice efficiency kitchen that was fairly well appointed with stove, microwave, and fridge. The noise of the fridge wasn't distracting and the AC worked well during a heat wave. The bathroom was clean and modern. There is no tub, only a classy tiled shower with frosted frameless glass. My only complaint in the bathroom is the lack of counter space.The tv worked well with a good selection of channels. You could not hear any street noise at all but we were looking at an office building so it wasn't private or scenic (welcome to the city). The 22nd floor has a nice outdoor patio that had views.The included breakfast was great with a selection of hot and cold cereal, eggs, sausage, fruit breads and bagels. There is a weekday hospitality event with a dinner and beer and wine. I did that one night and the food was pretty good. I didn't come to NYC to eat in the hotel otherwise I would recommend taking advantage of it every night!This hotel was a class act all the way around on this visit!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved our stay at this hotel. Very central and the free breakfast and evening snack/ drinks a great bonus.The room was beautiful and clean very modern and with a small kitchen area. The bed provided a great sleep including the sofa bed.Couldn't imagine staying anywhere else!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Manhattan, from super deluxe to basic. This one is a newer hotel in the "Garment District"--this is an area of Manhatten that itself isn't anything special, but is located close to transportation (Penn Station and the Port Authority) and Times Square/Theater District. Its 3-4 blocks to two subway stations. The hotel is quite nice for the price, friendly staff, and it offers an evening reception and free hot breakfast. Business center and Fitness Center are in the lower level; Fitness Center was big and bright, but several treadmills were in need of repair. My room was fairly big for NYC (which means small anywhere else), but it had a full refrigerator, stove, etc. Free wifi. Overall its a great value for NYC-I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for the peakest of the peak season which was Dec 31 until Jan4. We thought of glancing the New Year ball drop or atleast the fireworks from our window but were not successful bec Timesquare is still few blocks away from this hotel. Our booking was more or less triple the regular price bec again it was the peakest of the season in nyc. The room was small for a suite, but cozy enough. 5-7 walk to the nearest train station (34th st) and close enough to some stores and eateries. The best part of our stay was the complimentary overflowing Starbucks coffee in the lobby.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were impressed with the price and proximity to sites. Finding it was easy. Staff was very friendly and helpful as this was our first time to NY. The rooms were spacious enough for 3 adults. The complimentary breakfast was great each day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel at least five nights over two trips. The hotel is nice...new, clean lobby with decent breakfast and dinner offerings. The suites are spacious, especially for NYC hotels, and modern. There are hardwood floors and nice appliances, if you care to cook?? The weaknesses...the customer service leaves more to be desired, the elevators are slow, and in-room wifi is limited if your room is on the back side of the hotel (i.e., window away from the street). The location is convenient to many NYC attractions and right between Penn and Times Square stations.I would stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I would stay here again. Friendly staff, clean, great location. The evening social was a big hit and The complementary breakfast made our day easier to make time for shopping, shows, tours, and other fun activities in the city,

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I upgraded to a suite as a diamond member. The breakfast was just so-so, but who needs hotel buffet when you have NYC restaurants?The hardwood floors give a neat appearance and will make me shudder at all the other hotels with those grungy carpets with who-knows-what-has-spilled. The staff was very friendly. A better choice for someone already comfortable w Manhattan, or if you think Times Square is the place to be. For me, it was convenient to take the short walk to the subway -- especially Penn station which also gets you to trains for other travel options (ex. to/from JFK/Newark airports). Either new, or it just feels new.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'm in the city for work for three days and selected Homewood Suites. The location is great! The room very nice, great shower and really comfy bed. The internet is free and good strength. The only issue I've had is cell reception in my room, but that could be my carrier :( Full Breakfast is included and every evening from 5 - 7 pm there are complimentary snacks (more like a mini meal) and drinks! The location is a short walk to Times Square. Columbus Circle and Central Park are at 60th street. There are lots of restaurants to choose from, and of course all the energy of the city has made my stay fantastic!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Had great stay at convenient Times SQ Homewood. Excellent customer service from all. Great IT. Delicious free breakfast all days & dinner & wine Mon-Thur. Quiet luxurious immaculate suites. Plan ahead.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice hotel. The shower needs to be re-touched with bathroom Sealer. Otherwise the hotel is a great place to stay. The breakfast was great and I love the hardwood floors in the room. In addition, it was plus to have a small kitchen. I would like to see the hotel provide bottle water upon arrival - 4 water bottles per room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very modern hotel, great breakfast, very clean, very convenient location close to the subway entrance and walking distance to Times Square. This hotel is great and I booked like a month in advance, what made me get a great price. So worth it! I would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There are two hotels steps away from my office. This was the first time I stayed at the Homewood Suites. It was convenient to everything. I thought the rooms were very comfortable. The daily breakfast was great. I particularly enjoyed the warm scones. I was kind of disappointed when they were not on the menu the next day. I thought it was nice that they had a happy hour dining in the evening. Unfortunately my schedule did not permit be to take advantage of it. They also were very gracious to allow late check out. Since I am pregnant, they gave me and additional 1/2 hour.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location for walking, subway or amtrakClean, modern room, with small kitchen and pull out extra bed, great staff, Nice free breakfast with plenty of choices. Do not miss the roof top, really nice bonus and a place to just sit and relax

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel met and far exceeded every one of our expectations! Within walking distance to Times Square, and the subway, 24 hour free coffee in the lobby, free breakfast, free dinner, superior rooms (very spacious and clean), excellent customer service from all staff, I would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is located in a perfect location for someone traveling by train (Penn Station) or the bus. My friend and I never used a cab during our trip. The rooms didn't have carpeting and were really clean. The breakfast buffet was 1st rate and the staff was very attentive. If the price is right this hotel will always be my 1st choice when visiting NYC.
user_name:
Kim L
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A great find in the heart of Manhattan. Comfy beds, very spacious room, good breakfast every morning. We loved that it was an apartment type hotel so we were able to bring in food on the evenings where we felt like staying in. We also tried the evening reception which was a nice touch after a long day of sight seeing. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to many places, including Central Park, Macy's and Fifth Avenue. The staff was really friendly and made our anniversary extra special. It's really a gem and I can't wait to stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This property is very modern with hardwood (maybe laminate) floors in the suites, stainless steel appliances, glass-doored shower stall. The suite is really just one big room, but it's a decent size for New York. The roof features a seating area. Like all Homewoods, it has free breakfast every day and free dinner Monday-Thursday. The staff was great. I was most impressed by the low sound levels. We were on the 17th floor and heard no street noise at all, and very little sound from the hallway. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed every minute. The hotel is in a great location, near to Times Square, Empire State and shops!! The room was very spacious and clean. Breakfast was delicious and I loved the social evenings! All the staff were friendly and helpful and always smiling.I would definitely return to this hotel, I had a great time thanks to all the staff!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: On paper this hotel ticks most of the boxes, but we have stayed at better for significantly less. I suppose our trip (pre cruise for 3 days) was blighted by bad weather from the off, but I have tried to be objective in my views.One of our reasons for preferring the Homewood (and in general - Hilton brands) is the comfort of the beds, which in this case didn't live up to expectations, so a slight de-merit there.Other than the beds, not much to complain about as long as you don't want to do anything but cardio or dumbells in the "fitness centre". The free breakfast is pretty standard fare but as a heavily booked hotel, finding seating and getting at the food on offer is chaotic, although the staff do work hard at clearing tables and replenishing the food, so other guest and not the staff are the cause of the chaos.The evening manager's reception is worth a swerve unless you like salty nibbles and free beer or wine - don't expect it to be your evening meal.Housekeeping are on the ball, with no cause for complaint. The room (a twin bed studio was not well blessed with storage, so we lived pretty much out of a suitcase - and wardrobe (as such) in the bathroom? Where did that idea come from?Location is a little hard to categorise - calling it "Times Square" is being a bit free with geography, and because of the weather, getting about on foot wasn't very pleasant. Is it a good base to do New York - I think not - it sits just in the middle of nothing and an essential (as is always the case with NYC) is a good pair of walking shoes.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I will definitely visit this hotel again if I return to New York City! Clean, modern decor, hardwood floors, free breakfast and dinner Mon-Thurs including drinks. Who could ask for more? I couldn't believe how quiet my room was. Slept like a baby each of the three nights I was there. Full refrigerator, microwave and small stove. This is a great find in NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Times Square. What I like about it is that it's relatively new (at least the rooms seemed new), near everything, but not right in the heart of Times Square, so a bit calmer environment, though busy, area. The rooms are clean and well decorated, though small. I stayed in a king room, with a pull out sofa bed on the 21 floor. I liked the fact that the hotel elevators were prompt, even though it's a 22 story hotel. No long waits like in some hotels, even during the height of the business morning and evening "rush hour". They serve a full hot and cold breakfast every day. I enjoyed the cheese omelets, turkey sausage, oatmeal, bananas. The coffee left something to be desired, however. Mon-Thurs, they also serve free food from 5-7pm, but I was out and didn't partake in that. The hotel offered complimentary WiFi for my stay (not sure if that was due to being a Hilton Honors member, or not). The paid parking garage is directly across the street and there was in-out privileges, with the ability to go out without having to pay again. Daily cost for parking is $45. One issue: the shower leaked onto the bathroom floor the first day, but seemed to resolve the 2nd and 3rd day of our stay. Maybe we hadn't secured the shower door much. All and all, a clean, conveniently located, mid-priced hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We experienced a warm friendly welcome with a quick check-in, we were pleasantly surprised to find out that Along with their hot breakfast each morning they offered a complimentary appys Mon. to Thur. which includes beer and wine. how awesome is that?! they are close to Penn Station so getting around the city is easy. getting to time square is less than a ten minute walk. the hotel is very quiet so we had excellent sleeps. we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staying this week and had to change rooms. Hotel is in need of urgent renovation. There was an excursion of noisy middle schoolers. Cudtomer service took 5 hours to change me to a new floor still with the same group. We've sll been there and know how it is. It's poor hotel management to not let them party and enjoy themselves apart from the other (older and desperate for a sleep) guests!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I typically enjoy Homewood Suites and this property exceeded my expectations. The hotel is only two years old. I was allowed to check-in early and check-out late which was a bonus. I had a studio which was a little larger than many New York City hotel rooms and very comfortable. I liked having a kitchenette which was nice to heat up leftovers and store things in the full sized refrigerator. The bed was very comfortable.There's a complimentary hot breakfast served daily and Monday-Thursday dinner with beer and wine. With all the great eating options in the city, I was surprised the amount of people eating dinner. For those on a budget or tired after a long day of meetings or sightseeing, the free dinner is a nice touch.I enjoyed heading up to the rooftop deck on the 22nd floor. It was nice to sit outside, read, soak up some sun and enjoy the views of the city.Service was friendly, professional and helpful. Whenever I ran into staff in the hallways or elevator, they made it a point to say hello and smile. This is something that I appreciate, especially in such a large city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel. Room lot bigger than expected and very modern. In great location. Quiet street, no noise at night. Breakfast an added bonus, basic but always something you can eat. Complimentary tea/coffee etc all day. Staff were great - very helpful. Maid service daily. Iron & board, hairdryer included, tv and kitchen facilities all in room. Would def recommend to stay here and would not hesitate staying here again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Was great experience meet a lot good ppl and the hotel just awesome, staff the food the stay and complimentary think the give, and they always asking you if needed any think and how as the stay . Good service and excellent ppl

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good service Exceptionally clean room with clean, good working appliances great location especially if working at Javits Quite street with close proximity to all kinds of shopping We will definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. This hotel is amazing and I would stay again anytime. It was my first Homewood experience but it was phenomenal. The staff were great, building was exceptionally well kept.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect location. Great staff. Clean. Loved the breakfast and cocktail hour. This was first trip to NYC and everyone was helpful and friendly. Also felt safe. Offer car service to airport which was perfect because did not have a good cab experience to.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Even nicer than expected! Very convenient to either Penn Station or Times Square. This worked well for us since we took the train in from Newark Airport. The area had plenty of places to eat. Room was clean and modern. They kept breakfast available until 10:30 am which we liked. The staff were all very pleasant and efficient. We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel was outstanding and service was above expectations. I enjoy staying at this Hilton brand because it truly lives up to its name. Have stayed at Homewood Suites many times and the quality is always great.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a last minute trip the city and booked last minute. We got a great price for a really nice room. Very spacious, clean with lovely amenities. The bed was awesome. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly, found us great late night pizza! We had the complimentary breakfast in the morning which was super. It's really centrally located, a short walk to Grand Central (maybe 10 minutes). We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was located near Times Square. The breakfast was great with a good selection. The staff was extremely helpful. The ambiance was clean and modern. The desk staff was very glad to hold our luggage until we left town -- so that we could see one more site.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hardwood/laminate floors are a nice touch. Rooms are small but well appointed. Large fridge is nice. Hilton beds are great. Lobby was nice and staff were friendly. Overall it was a nice hotel for the price in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very convenient location: near Penn Station which has easy access to the most important metro lines.We had a room on the 16th Floor, no noises from the street, sometimes some noise from other people in the hallway (loud tourists, not a problem linked to the hotel)Breakfast was ok: some hot dishes/cold dishes. Fresh fruit, yoghurt, bagels,...Coffee and tea available 24/7Between 5 and 7 pm some snacks are offered. Don't expect too much from it but it might be a cheap alternative for dinner. There is a small kitchen in the room so you can heat up some food as well.Room and bathroom were clean. Bed was great, enough space and soft pillows.Staff was very friendly. They offer a (paying) shuttle service from and to the airport.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My friend and I recently stayed for two weeks in this hotel, the rooms were very spacious modern and clean, with fridge freezer and microwave, the hotel was situated a few blocks from Penn Station, Port Authority bus terminal and Times Square.Breakfast included in the deal, free tea, coffee and hot chocolate 24hrs a day.The staff were Curteous and friendlyCan't recommend this hotel enough! Great find!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is very convenient. The hotel is close to Penn Station, several subway stops, Time's Square, Bryant Park, Hell's Kitchen (good eats!) and the Theater District. The property is new, clean, and spacious. There is a large lobby with lots of seating and charging stations everywhere. Wi-fi is free everywhere in the hotel. All of the staff we encountered were quite friendly.The lounge where they serve breakfast is located off the lobby. Behind the entire property is a spacious outdoor lounge area. You look down from the lobby area into the gym which has a decent amount of equipment. Our room was quite large, especially by NYC standards. We had a King sized bed and a sofa/chair bed that converted to a single sleeper. Just right for us and our son. The room had lots of neat built ins and additional seating. There was a roll away table that slipped under the desk. There was a fridge, microwave, stove top,and dishwasher. Bathroom had a shower only but was spacious. You could certainly spend a few nights at this location and not feel cramped.On the roof top there is a beautiful outdoor lounge with views over the city and the river. There is plenty of seating and if the weather is nice you could bring up some food and drinks to enjoy. The breakfast was adequate. About the same as what you would find in a Hampton Inn - a few hot items, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, bagels, bread, muffins, coffee, tea, and juice. They had a good amount of seating and people also spread out to sit around the lobby. If the weather had been nice, we would have enjoyed sitting in the outdoor lounge. I would stay here again and would recommend it if you are looking for a good value and space in the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent one night for business. This hotel was in a good location close walk to Times Square. The room was very spacious, clean and modern. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Lobby area was modern, clean and welcoming. Breakfast was excellent and while I missed it, they offer free snacks in the evening. All this for a great value! I will be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel! Clean, quiet, central location. Delicious breakfast. Spacious room. Affordable price. Great choice for the city. Close to Penn station, subway, Empire State Building. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel, good location, easy to feel at home. Still looks new. Lobby is nice. Room is small but quite comfortable. QUIET! TV didn't work for last day of stay. Breakfast and dinner are okay, though limited, but with so many restaurants nearby and a kitchen with microwave and refrigerator, it does not matter.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my wife's first visit to New York and my second from many years ago. We were pretty within walking distance of Madison Square Gardens one way and Times Square the other way. We had a great time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good hotel a few blocks away from the hustle and bustle but within easy walking distance of many attractions.Check in was easy and given room on eighth floor. Room not big but big enough, unfortunately no view other than an office block a few feet away which necessitated having the blinds pulled down permanently. Had microwave, dishwasher, cooker but no kettle!Small wardrobe with iron and ironing board reducing the space inside.Very large and comfortable bed.Flat screen television.The bonus of this hotel is the provision of breakfast every morning. This was certainly a bonus, plenty of choice, but beware at times it was a bit of a scrum to get the food and find somewhere to sit down to eat it. There was an evening buffet also provided Monday to Thursday again very well received, especially as they also give free beer and wine!The three lifts were in constant action and at times could take sometime to get into.The concereige service was good and provided welcome advice.Checking out no problem and they arranged a car to the airport at a very similar price to a yellow cab, turned out ours was a 'stretch limo' so rounded off our stay in style!Would certainly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at the Garden Inn the previous year, but the price rose so much that I looked around at other Hilton properties. So glad I found this one. Fab location within walking distance to Times Square/bus/train/Hudson etc, massive room, free food, drinks and wifi, and all for a great price. We stayed here for a week and literally couldn't have asked for any more. Would 100% stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here one night before heading to DC. Picked the hotel as near Penn Station, (7 mins walk) and near 5th Ave, Empire State Building and Time Square. Was immaculate, great size room with kitchen food etc. Complementary Tea & Coffee 24 hour and breakfast buffet was very good.We were in bed for 9pm NY time as been travelling since early UK time and slept soundly!Would definitely recommend. If staying here I would also recommend Houndstooth bar / pub just along the road at the corner for food and drink!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was amazing - the staff -- the rooms - -the service - the breakfast - the employees. The check in clerk was absolutely amazing and acted like he owned the hotel - so concerned - as was the concierge and bellman.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at the Homewood Suites for a week for a combination business/pleasure trip. The location was perfect for getting around the entire city. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable and the complimentary breakfast and evening reception were a nice perk. I would definitely stay here again if I return to New York.
user_name:
Jo Ann S
Mesa, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had such a great experience at this hotel. I was treated with excellent customer service from arrival by Johnathan at the front desk to departure by Nafessa at the front desk. The staff at this hotel was amazing and very accommodating! The hotel was very beautiful and modern- very clean. The rooms were very large for New York and newly updated. I had an amazing time and felt like I was at home as the efficiency/suite had all the basic amenties of a small apartment. I would stay here each and every time I visit New York. I made a great choice by visiting this Homewood suites

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Every aspect of my stay was on point. However, I have to highlight how helpful front desk staff, Cindy, was. Five star hotel concierge level service. The hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and Madison Square Garden. Access to any part of the island by bus, train or cab can be had within five blocks.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful!!! First time I've used this hotel but so not the last. Will use it for business and vacations. Great location, awesome staff, great rooms. Loved having mini kitchen in my room. Just an absolutely wonderful hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is everything we'd hope for. The price was incredible. Our rooms were clean, modern, and bedding comfortable. Our room was a king studio suite equipped with a kitchenette and microwave. Breakfasts were organized and sufficient. Round the clock coffee and tea in the lobby available. Housekeeping was efficient daily. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. We were in room 616 which was very quiet corner room. I would have given it five stars but our room had no view at all. Faced a brick building of windowed offices. We didn't stay in the room much so it really didn't matter! Would definitely return!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is very nice and updated. The staff is more than pleasant. The breakfast is included and is very good with lots of choices and space to sit. The room is a little small but is updated and has all the comforts of a NYC apartment. The gym is fantastic, plenty of treadmills, ellipticals and bicycles plus weights, universal, and other equipment for floor exercises. The location was great for my purpose which was walking distance from penn station and the javits center. I didn't know but there is an extra charge for the location near the javits center. It is a bit on the expensive side but wanted to give it a try. It is between 8 and 9th ave so one can take the 8th avenue public transportation if needed. Great location for walking anywhere.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for my bachelorette weekend and had an amazing experience. We had five people in a double queen room and it was enough space for us. The kitchenette is my favorite part of these rooms. You are able to prepare a meal and save on food costs. I would highly reccomend staying here!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is the only place to stay in NYC with a family! The beds are queen size w extra sofa sleeper, FULL kitchen w stove and refrigerator, not that you need it since the complimentary breakfast and dinners are amazing. But the best part by far is the attentive warm staff that make you feel like you really are at home and they care for you and your family. We will not stay anywhere else other than here in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I booked this hotel last minute to see if I could get a better deal than I previously booked w/ another chain. We have a family of 5 so finding one room that can fit 5 is always a struggle. The two queens and pull out couch accommodated our family size w/ ease! The light dinner was more than enough for all of us & the breakfast offered by the hotel was great. Super experience. Close to Times Square. About 3 minute walk.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Tiara (front desk manager) was amazing - the hotel staff was superb, accommodating and our stay was terrific! The location was perfect walking distance to many great locations and we had a blast staying here.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and left thoroughly impressed. We arrived early and were given early access to our room (a little pressure was required!) which was great and allowed us to make the most of the day. The location of the hotel is very convenient (5 min walk from NY Penn Station, 10 mins from Times Square, 20 mins from Central Park), and very central for exploring Manhattan. The room (suite - King NS) was a perfect size with a small kitchenette, big fridge, decent size bathroom and good internet. It was also immaculate and very quiet - minimal internal noise and reasonably protected from external noise too. The bed was very comfortable!!! Breakfast was very busy but of a good standard with plenty of variety. We didn't take advantage of the complimentary food and drink available Mon-Thu evenings, but a great option for those trying to offset the cost of visiting NYC. A late check-out was refused point-blank which was a shame but bag storage was available. Overall, a perfect stay with friendly staff and a very competitive room rate!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I HAD THE MISFORTUNE OF SELECTING THIS hotel based on location and misleading good reviews basedmostly on free breakfast and good location! I tried checking at 1pm with 8yr child and wife after long 21 hour flight. we were flatly announced" i have no rooms to give you now- keep checking time to time" by the receptionist who kept both her hands in her pockets with body turned away ! This was the most impolite rude way of greeting a client and i pointed this out to the attending manger who simply said she was only doing her job but what attitude! it went till 9pm for us to be checked in finally ruining our days plan and my wife caught bronchitis having to walk around in rain at 9c ! the room given too faced a dirty dingy backyard , the breakfast had queues with people eating standing due lack of seating. the word sorry was muttered only on checkout by the manger ! these people have enough clients and are overbooked due to location in times square where anything would sell, and have learned to treat clients with contempt !The marriot next lane we stayed next, was cheaper, polite and served a better meal too! AVOID UNLESS YOU WISH A 8 HOUR WAIT IN STREETS---a definite no if you need an early check in or atleast at 4 pm as advertised!I am not targetting any hotel chain as The hilton proper at times square next to ripleys was reviewed by me as excellent same time last year!This is no HILTON !

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff and facilities of the Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan are wonderful and ready to provide you with a positive travel experience. Located between 8th Ave and 9th Ave on 37th St, the all-suites hotel is well situated for travel downtown or uptown. The rooms are very well maintained and great for a good night's rest from the workaday bustle. IMHO the best value in Midtown.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here one night for a midweek getaway to NYC. This is a very nice, new, clean property. As with any NYC hotel, the rooms are much smaller than other properties in the chain. Our room had a king bed, love seat, large ottoman, desk with chair, and a kitchenette that ran about 4 feet along one wall. The bathroom had a large shower (no tub) and a sink with very limited counter space to spread out toiletries. Most Homewood Suites have a table near the kitchenette big enough for two people to eat at. Here the "table" was between the love seat and ottoman and folded out to perhaps 18"x24". So this is bigger than a typical NYC hotel room and okay for one person, but it's not really designed for a couple to stay in and eat in longer term. The small size compared to other Homewood properties is the only reason I'm bumping my rating down to 4 stars.The lobby area is large and comfortable by NYC hotel standards, with comfy seating and a gas-burning fireplace. You can be comfortable here if your room isn't ready when you arrive. The complementary breakfast has a nice selection of hot and cold items. We did not participate in the manager's reception, but it was popular and offered a light meal.The staff was very friendly and helpful. There's a "pantry" next to the reception desk selling a variety of snacks and beverages. There's also a 7-11 around the corner.The location is great--about a 6-minute walk to Madison Square Garden/Penn Station (and the closest subway stop is there) and about a 10-15-minute walk to the Theater District, depending on exactly where you're headed there. It's in the middle of the Fashion District, and it's always fun to window shop while you're walking by. There are plenty of restaurants within a couple of blocks. This will definitely be one of our top picks for a hotel the next time we visit midtown Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a great stay at Homewood Suites 312 W. 37th New York City. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and quiet. The kitchenette was great. Bathroom looked newly remodeled, great hot water. Loved the breakfast, incredible start to our day of touring along with the non-stop coffee bar when we returned from a long day of site seeing. I want to recognize Tiara, a sweet, friendly, funny yet skillful , organized young lady who greeted us on arrival and set the tone for a very positive stay, Would highly recommend staying here, esp if you are traveling with a family

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at Homewood Suites...excellent central location!Close to Times Square, Theater District & bus station.Complimentary breakfast was very convenient. Room 806 was bigger than I thought it would be.Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family spent a week in NY after a ten day cruise. This is an excellent location. We could easily walk or take the subway anywhere we wanted to go on Manhattan. The room was great and the staff very helpful. We made extensive use of the WiFi and the laundry.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is perfect if you take the train. Just a short walk and you are there. Staff is fabulous no matter what your needs are. Social hour is fun. Breakfast is good. Location is great for midtown Manhatten. So close to everything.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: One night stay for Javits center. Used the self check and pick room on Hilton website, room was ready 2 hours before check in and also received two bottles of water and cookies in a bag. 12 floor room overlooking 37th street spotless and comfortable with great use of space, no traffic noise. Breakfast the next morning was crowded but plentiful. I picked this hotel because all positive TA reviews and wasn’t disappointed, everyone has it correct it’s a great place to stay. Will stay here again on next visit to Javits center, would recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel had some good qualities. However because of the high pitched noise my fridge made I was too tired to enjoy them. I was there on business and my stay was for 27 days. They could not fix the noise and refused to swap the fridge for one that didn't make that noise. The room layout was nice. Breakfast in the morning was good. Lenny and Francisco were extremely friendly and welcoming. They always had a smile. The gym was clean and new. The room was clean. However the cleaning lady got a spot of bleach on my shoes and my tin of popcorn got a dent. So make sure you secure your personal belongings before she cleans so that nothing get damaged. Over all it was just ok. The front desk staff is not very friendly, however they weren't rude either. cell service is spotty and so is the internet connection.
user_name:
Megan W
Washington DC, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
