review_body: The hotel told me where to park directly across the street and they told me it would be $40 for the night. two bad things, first of all, I had left something in the car and had to go back to the garage and they had moved my car to the basement and I had to walk down there where I learned ALL the cars are kept with the driver side window down and the cars in the vehicle!! the employee with me kept saying in broken English, its safe its safe down here. stupidly I let the car there but when I tried to get the car back the next day, my car was held hostage until I paid $72 for parking. I asked to speak to manager but was told the supervisors are not on site so they gave me phone and the person was so very rude kept calling me lady and told me to pay or the amount wil just go up. NEVER AGAIN WILL I PARK AT A GREENWOOD MANAGEMENT CORP GARAGE. THIS ONE IS LOCATED AT 320 WEST 38TH ST NEW YORK, ny directly across from Homewood suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've been coming to the Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY for the past 6mos and will be there through the end of July. I could not be in better hands or have picked a better place to stay.Everyone is very accommodating and it's a home away from home for me- as a Diamond member, they really make me feel special, thanks.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: stayed here for three nights. Like most Manhattan Hotels , the room was not large buhad everything you need for a pleasant stay. TV, Fridge microwave etc. comfy bed.Nice complementary breakfast real knives and forks and very pleasant friendly staff.great location . Handy for bus terminal Penn station and a short stroll to Time Square.A great choice for us

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Super location, wonderful friendly helpful staff, nice room and a good modern gym. Actually little not to like until you go to breakfast. The restaurant is way too small for the hotel and the food not great, actually it was chaotic with very limited choice, not enough cutlery and heaven forbid if like me one is vegetarian; there were I guess basic cereals, yogurt and the odd Apple. Come on sort this out please, None the less it is a really good central hotel but with a better restaurant it could be great!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My first time staying at Homewood Suites....pleasantly surprised! Well appointed room decor...great amenities. Beds were great. Complimentary breakfast was nice. Would stay here again for business or leisure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here this past week and the staff were very helpful and friendly! We loved the fact that a light dinner is included with stay Mon-Thurs and breakfast served every morning. This was a great breakfast compared to other places we stayed that just offer the make your own waffle machine. There was a good variety of food offered. There was always hot coffee and hot water for tea and they were accomodating to bring out honey if asked. We did a lot of sight seeing and the desk staff provided maps and directions for all mass transit. Our room was very clean and had a small kitchen suited for a studio apartment! There was even a dishwasher! The bathroom was very clean as well. The noise levels were very very low. Their roof top terrace offered nice views of the night skyline as well. This is a very new hotel that's only 1 1/2 years old. The lobby is very accomodating and there are plenty of outlets for charging electronics including USB outlets as well. This is a long review because I can't say enough about this amazing hotel. I even joined their H Honors club because this will be the hotel we stay at next time we come to NYC and I will be telling my family and friends to stay here. The price was reasonable by NYC hotel standards and we used our AAA membership for it, but their own rates were also reasonable for all you get staying here!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What an amazing birthday gift, and what an amazing city New York is! We stayed at Homewood Suites By Hilton and 'wow' we really were blown away by the top quality of this unassuming hotel. The staff, whatever their specific duties were, were, without exception, friendly,polite and very well presented. We had meals in the hotel, and again, without exception they were of top quality and plenty for everyone. We would highly recommended this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staff are great, helpful & friendly. The rooms are good size, the beds are comfortable, bathrooms modern and good size. Breakfast was included in the room rate. Breakfast had good variety, plenty of places to sit. Coffee and Tea available all day. The location is in the Garment District, easy access to subway, easy walk to Central Park, Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: That is a wonderful experience for my family. clean room ,convenience location and variety breakfast. we were so enjoyed. this is the first time to New York. the hotel located in times square and you can go to the center by walk and very near to Rockefeller. good scenery there!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Short walk to Times Square. Staff was super friendly. Rooms were good sized. Nice area for breakfast/afternoon snacks. Roof top terrace was relaxing. First visit to this hotel but will definitely return again. Beds comfortable and could not hear any sounds from outside.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The breakfast was basic but fine, the weekday dinner was a bonus. The coffee and hot chocolate are good and free. We didn't get our room cleaned twice and it's hard to get a smile from the staff. Location is great. Try the $1 pizza down the road.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Super close to everything. Great prices. 3 of us in one king room. Sofa bed was perfect. Would easily recommend. Gym was nice. Id recommend this hotel easily! Didn't get to do breakfast due to late nights :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were greeted at the front desk by friendly and professional staff. Our room was exactly as represented - clean, modern and spacious with all the comforts of home. The location was ideal for our needs and within a short 5 block walk to the Port Authority Terminal and 8 blocks to the Theatre district. The breakfast and dinner meals were delicious and bountiful. Multiple choices of our favorite foods. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was fantastic! The staff were all great and very accommodating! The room was spacious for my family of 5 and the hotel was very clean. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. We never ate at the happy hour, but it looked very nice. The location of the hotel was perfect. My family and I can't wait to come back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Arrived at 1am to be greeted by a cheerful check in agent - fully explained features of hotel and breakfast details as well as (surprise) Monday through Thursday evening meal. Given a small welcome pack water and nibbles.Room was a King Studio with mini kitchen consisting full size fridge, 2 burner stove top, microwave and dishwasher. Good quality pots and pans plus crockery and cutlery. Bathroom was shower only although a reasonable size - possibly could do with a little more counter space but we survived. Room had a single sleeper sofa good size TV, in room safe, iron and board. Negative comment is the size of the cupboard which loses a fair amount of space due to the iron. Breakfast hot dish changed each day as an example cheese omelette, egg soufflé, egg cheese sausage muffins. Additionally potatoes and a meat. This together with continental breakfast made for a substantial start to the day. During day Tea and Coffee continually available in lobby. Only had one evening meal and again quite reasonable with Soup and Salad spaghetti and fajita meat plus cheese and crackers. Also included Red and White Wine plus Beer. Hotel has a guest laundry $2.50 per wash or dry open 24 hours a day. A definite plus when travelling for over 30 days. we were on 10th floor zero traffic noise. Check out 12 although extended to 1 for us at no charge then stored luggage to our 4pm pick up. All in all a great experience and a hotel we will definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: About 10 minutes walk to Times Square so just far enough to be away from all the hussle and bustle. Check in was easy and quick and we were in a room on 20th floor. Had read previous reviews of long waiting times for lift but we never waited more than a minute and lifts were quick. Reception area has good sitting area and 24hr access to machines for coffee, tea and hot chocolate which was great. The room was very nice with small kitchen area of fridge, microwave, coffee machine and small hob so sufficient if you wanted to make a snack or small meal. Nice large and comfy bed plus a desk area and chair. Bathroom quite roomy and modern. A good hot breakfast buffet is included and an added bonus was a meal on offer from Monday to Thursday from 5-7pm I think, again free of charge and included unlimited wine or beer which was served by a member of staff from a small bar table. There was just one main choice which was quite basic like sausage or pasta but there was crisps, cheese, salad and various other bits to fill the plate. The quality of the food was good and we had not known this was going to be available so was a very nice surprise!! The only downside which was not the fault of the hotel but the concierge which is not run by the Hilton - we went to buy theatre tickets through them and paid $40 each ticket over the original ticket price but I had specifically said I would not want side seats as have a problem with my neck and those seats affect me. The girl on concierge phoned the agency, explained the situation and was assured that would be fine. I must have repeated 6 times I would not be prepared to pay an extra 50% over and above the ticket price for side seats and she assured me this would not be a problem but when we went to collect the tickets at 7pm needless to say they were side seats and I was gutted!! The concierge girl said the following day this has happened a few times where requested tickets were not fulfilled so just beware if you book as they only confirm as best available and they won't do anything about it afterwards. I really wouldn't recommend this facility unless you are happy to pay over the odds and sit absolutely anywhere in the theatre.
user_name:
Brenda A
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location is great. It is a short walk to Time Square area but far enough away it is quiet. They have a happy hour that has light snacks and dinner as well as beer and wine. Elevators can be slow. Rooms always are clean. I think I have stayed here 5 times now. Typically the can't get you checked in early but will hold your bags for you if needed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everything ( almost) about this hotel was SUPER. Fast check-in, fast elevators, big fresh clean rooms with nice design, amazing bed, windows that was soundproof so you didnt hera anything from outside traffic, a nice private terass ( 8th floor) so you could enjoy some sun in the morning. Hotel VERY clean. Breakfast was pretty good with yoghurt, freshly sliced fruit, bagels/toast, oatmeal, eggs/ bacon. Afternoon complimentary dinner was not the most culinary experience but it was food, and always nice with a free glass of wine/ beer. Convinience store right around the corner ( also a small shop in reception area). Free coffe/ tea 24h freshly made. The hotel was also close to Penn station (7min) Subway ( 5 min) So all by all best hotel in NYC so far, been here aprox 15 times. Definitely a re-book next time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful stay! The staff was so kind and helpful. The hotels was very clean and comfy. Morning breakfast was delicious, evening was yummy too. Our favorite thing was enjoying a hot cup of coffee, tea, or hot cocoa anytime of the night or day from the lobby! Also the location was great! We walked everywhere from here and enjoyed how easy it was to get around from this location. We only used a couple taxis our entire trip.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room, location and quality of the hotel was great, front desk fast and efficient, everyone was very nice and helpful, the only downside was that the breakfast was very crowded and the actual food left a lot to be desired but I would definitely stay here again when coming to New York was in central location to a lot of the sites.
user_name:
Terri S
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was tempted to write a bad review so no one else would discover this great hotel, but I can't do it! price was right, room was clean and new and roof top deck was so cool! only gripe I had was that room wasn't ready until 4:30, which was a little frustrating after a 5 hour ride. Front desk staff awesome & friendly

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 3 nights at the hotel.Very expensive due to location.In front of the hotel is noisy and complicated.Room condition was good but uncomfortable because the sink problem.I was very disappointed by unfriendly staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have my top 3 NYC hotels this is def one of the 3. One thing I really like about the room is the ceiling fan it adds the extra breeze I like. The kitchenette is a nice touch and the fact the hotel has an ice machine available. The bed was great no complaints front desk was quick and let me check in a bit earlier then I expected. 37th St is a great location in general few blocks from 34st shopping and a few blocks from time sq attractions.
user_name:
J E
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my first time visiting New York and I don't think I could have picked a better hotel. This place serves free dinner and drinks(beer & wine) Mon-Thurs and free breakfast every morning. Hot chocolate and coffee is available 24/7. The location to Times Square was perfect the staff was friendly. I'm from Atlanta so I'm used to suites being bigger than what our room was but I've heard this is typical for New York so that's nothing to complain about. Do yourself a favor and stay at this hotel and if you are a AAA member they have great discounts.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had excellent stay with Homewood Suites in New York City. Hotel is located in convenient location where have access to many transportation i.e. subway, bus, airport transfer, NJ Transit. Staff were very helpful with our late-check in. Complimentary breakfast and dinner added value to our pleasant stay. Room was spacious, compared to other hotel in Times Square that we had stayed in the past. We will definitely return to this hotel for our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent 10 days at the Homewood Suites and had a great time. The rooms are really clean and roomy and the free breakfast and evening social (Mon-Thurs) are a bonus The staff were friendly especially the lady who served the free beer and wine ,sorry I forgot her name. Times Square and the Empire State Building and Penn Street subway are only a 5-10 walk.I would definitely recommend

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location of the Hotel was excellent. Time Square, Empire State building all in walking distance. The staff was very courteous and friendly. Always helpful with a car or touring tips. Complimentary breakfast was excellent. Housekeeping services the best. I highly recommend staying at the Homewood Suites for any occasion.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Loved this hotel. Complementary breakfast and all day hot chocolate. It was perfect for the cold New York evenings. Great location too. Right down the street from Times Square and the Theater District.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a great home base for your trip to NYC! The location is so close to Times Square and the Theater District and three blocks from the High Line. The rooms are modern and efficiently designed, including a kitchen with dishwasher! Daily breakfast and four nights of dinners (with wine or beer) are included. The staff was very helpful and accommodating! Cabs were very easy to get on 8th or 9th Avenue. There are many stores and dining venues on the blocks around. The room was so quiet at night that we felt that we were home and not in NYC. We will definitely be back!
user_name:
Gretchen K
Midland, MI, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a wonderful 5 night stay. Per other reviews on Tripadvisor, we found the Homewood Suites in Manhattan spacious for a NY hotel for 2 adults plus 2 teens. The hotel is modern, clean and has a kitchenette. We used the pull out sofa bed so the kids could each have their own place to sleep. The breakfasts exceeded our expectations with ample hot and cold choices. While it was busy, we never had trouble finding places to sit. Free hot drinks were available in the lobby 24 hours a day. The complimentary evening receptions (Monday through Thursday) provided a variety of hearty food choices in addition to an assortment of beverages including beer and wine. The location is convenient to Times Square (10 minute walk), Broadway shows, Empire State building and Penn Station to catch the subway. We would stay here again and highly recommend the Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family of 4 went to NYC during our spring Break and to celebrate my youngest turning 6 years old. We met Leslie at check in and she set the tone for a wonderful vacation. She was so helpful and full of great information. She recommended several places that we ate at including a spectacular ice cream place! On my daughter's birthday, the staff even gave her a present with candies, a book and a toy! She was thrilled. We were able to walk to most of the places we wanted to go and it was easy to catch a taxi one block over. Hotel is on a one way street so it is quieter than some places we have stayed in NYC. There is a free breakfast in the morning which changes it menu daily. Breakfast flavor is ok on the hot items but it is extremely packed and not enough seating for everyone. Plan to get your food and eat in the room if you have several people with you. The only other con was the walls seemed to be a bit thin or either we had really loud neighbors beside us because we could hear most of their conversation until they went to bed. Our room was HUGE compared to NYC standards and also the full size fridge, dishwasher (yes!) and microwave and range were helpful for a family. We had plenty of room for everyone to spread out. We will be back and hope to see Leslie again! She was wonderful and really added a personal touch to our stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It was a very wonderful stay. The people at the Front Desk were very helpful. The hotel was a great size especially for Manhattan. The staff made sure to make me feel appreciated for being a Hilton Honors member and they all were kind, friendly, warm and professional. The only complaint I have is the cost of parking- but I know that it is Manhattan and I wouldn't expect anything else... Thanks for a great visit and hopefully, next time I'm in the city I can get a good deal to stay at this property again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: When I think of Homewood Suites I think about waffles as an option for breakfast. I also think of real meals as options Monday through Thursday. Breakfasts were adequate but I also bought from a nearby grocery store. The evening food was not what I've experienced at other Homewood Suites. It was fuel and complimentary however. The staff was wonderful. The location perfect. The room was as expected in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for 14 nights during March/April 2016. We had a King EFF STUDIO-CTY VW and we were on the 20th floor I was travelling with a 12 year old. Our room was extremely comfortable and roomy enough that we were able to unpack our cases and live out of the cupboard and drawer space provided. We stored our suitcases under the workstation which meant we didn't lose floor space due to luggage. Being on the 20th floor meant we had no issue getting an elevator however during the breakfast peak we often stopped at 10 floors even though we were full and no one else could fit. The hotel has 3 elevators which are used by staff and guests. There was some street noise but certainly none that caused us any problems. Our room was right next to the lifts and once again this didn't cause us any problems. Breakfast is provided complimentary each day. With a choice of 4 cereals and oatmeal, toast, bagels, yoghurt, fruit, apple and orange juice and a selection of something hot. They had different selection each day sometimes scrambled eggs, omelets, bacon, French toast, turkey sausages or egg and cheese muffins. The rooms are serviced each day and they use Neutrogena products. There is no turn down service, not that we would have used it anyway but some people do like that. We found the staff very pleasant and helpful and we would definitely stay again if we were to return to New York. We did have one problem and it did put a fairly major negative on our final day. Because of the hotels policy of putting multiple holds on your cards during your stay I was left with no money on my prepaid card and unable to access cash. The hotel had been informed that I was using a prepaid card and given the details of a credit card they could use for holding funds. An option they chose not to use so left me in a predicament on the last day. I was extremely vigilant and queried the practice a number of times, each time being advised by staff that it really would not be a problem. Until it was and it became my problem.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Arrived too early for check in but after a short wait in the spacious and comfortable lobby we were given our room. The room exceeded all our expectations, was large, modern, very clean and had all the amenities we needed as a family of four (2 adults and 2 teens). Breakfast was excellent with good hot and cold choices and plenty of tables. Free hot drinks were available in the lobby 24 hours. The complimentary food, wine, beer and soft drinks on evenings Monday through Thursday was an excellent bonus and money saver that we were not expecting. To top it all every member of staff that we came into contact with were excellent, we would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely visit again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was able to choose a slightly larger room from their map, which is a great feature. Layout is good, amenities are good. I'd call the room 'sterile' but my friend said it was ultramodern. It has a kitchen, which is great.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for three nights and found it an incredibly convenient location. We walked to see three Broadway shows and it was just a short walk to Penn Station where we caught the subway and the train to go to Newark Airport. Our room was lovely, clean and quiet. It was a bit cozy when we pulled out the couch for our daughter but hey, it is New York City, space is at a premium! I liked having the kitchenette in the room, the overhead fan and that the room was not carpeted. The evening reception was nice especially on the evening we arrived and were tired and hungry - nice to get a quick free snack! The breakfasts were better than most and I liked that they went until 10:30 - later than most hotels. The only day we had much trouble getting an elevator was Saturday - on the weekdays, we had no problem. The staff was friendly although we did not interact with them much aside from check-in and check-out since we had no problems! I felt I got a good price on the room. The only criticisms were the pull out couch slumped in the middle and the free wifi was not great. Otherwise we really enjoyed our stay and would stay again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed a night in NYC. The Homewood suites was an excellent hotel with many amenities, including breakfast, evening reception and fitness center. The staff was helpful. The location is convenient, but the Times Square area is a bit sketchy also.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I go to NYC monthly for work, so I've been trying out all the hotels in Midtown. This was my first stay at the Homewood Suites. It's in a great location half-way between Penn Station and Times Square. The rooms are quite spacious for Manhattan. I loved that they aren't carpeted (they have those vinyl planks that look like hardwood). I also appreciated the walk-in shower and the desk with a separate table that rolled out and was the perfect height for using a laptop. I paid extra for a city view room; I don't think it was worth the extra money because all you see are the buildings across the street - not much of a view.I would have given the hotel an excellent rating, but a couple of things stopped me. One was the free meals. Breakfast was OK, but every morning, the hot items were empty. Fortunately, the oatmeal is very good. One evening, they served pork bratwurst with no other options. That's OK if you eat pork and meat, but it not, your only option was soup (which had meat) or a basic salad bar. The other thing I didn't like about the hotel was the scratchy towels. I mean really rough. I've been to lower end hotels that had better towels. Maybe they need to find a new laundry or use some fabric softener?I'm on the fence as to whether or not I'll be back. I did like the room and location, so a good deal (like the 25% off flash sale for Hilton Honors members) would put it at the top of the list.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location of this hotel was perfect for going to Broadway shows. Also pretty close to Penn Station which was handy for the subway and also for getting to Newark Airport. The breakfast was better than average and we enjoyed the evening social. Rooms were very clean and I appreciated having a little kitchenette. I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Okay here goes - positives .. Great position, decor very modern, coffee on tap in reception 24/7, very clean, rooms have everything you need and a full size fridge/freezer. Negatives ... It really bothered me that apart from one lovely lady who helped us out by checking us in early the staff don't use please or thank you, never ! For example when asking me for $ for a purchase from the shop the guy on reception said $6 .. No please . I then gave him the $6 which he took .. No thank you. When he handed me my change to which I said "thank you" he nodded in recognition! Manners cost nothing and it's a real bug bear of mine and this was not the only time. Forget finding a table at breakfast unless you're lucky. The hotel had a very small area and people spill into reception it was a pain! Breakfast was okay. Lastly trying to get a lift in the morning proved .. Well .. We took the stairs most days.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Lovely hotel. Free food until 7pm (mainly snacks) this was a bonus. The suite was very large, very quiet and very clean. We didn't spend a great deal of time in the hotel as we did a lot of sightseeing.
user_name:
Carol-Olivia W
Hazel Grove, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'm a fan of Homewood Suites. Wherever possible, I choose them over other Hilton choices. I stay in NYC a couple times a year, this is the best (outside of the Millennium) in the city within the Hilton brand. It's spacious, has the manager's receptions HS's are known for, an excellent fitness room and great staff. It's conveniently located for the subways and walking, great walking distance to the Theater district and Times SquareI'll always look for availability here first.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I were pleasantly surprised by the Homewood suites ! The staff was wonderful, the hotel was clean, the rooms were spacious, and the balcony was great to sit out and enjoy coffee or a drink on!! The only thing for us was that it is a little far from a subway line but nothing more than a 5-8 minute walk depending on what line you had to get on. I highly recommend this hotel and will return !!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall we enjoyed the entire stay. From the room layout and floor to ceiling window, to the helpful and friendly staff. The complementary happy hour and breakfast in the morning was also great perks. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: An excellent place to stay to tour New York. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are very clean and modern. Breakfast starts from 6am which allows you to fuel up before sightseeing. We found that by going early to places such as the Empire State Building (a short walk away) that there were hardly any queues. I would definitely take my family back to Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: As previous reviews have stated the hotel is brilliantly located, being under a 10 minute stroll to the centre of Times Square. We arrived using the AirTrain/LIRR from JFK to Penn station, I would highly recommend this way of arriving. It was both quicker and cheaper than taking a taxi, we had 4 cases between two of us and it was easy and no hassle! Then just a 3 block walk.The hotel lobby is stylish and spacious, the welcome was gracious, I wish I had noted the ladies name as she was by far the best member of staff we encountered over the week. It made a great start to the holiday.People have complained about the size of the rooms, however being New York, rooms are smaller. That being said, our room on the 15th floor was spacious and well equipped. The bed was comfy, the duvet was lacking somewhat and extremely small not even covering the whole bed which was pretty poor. There was enough storage space for two people to unpack their luggage and store it without getting in the way which was great. Both the kitchenette and bathroom were clean and well appointed. The only 'dirty' thing in the room was the sofa which was extremely dusty as I found out after sitting on it! The room, at the front of the hotel, had a fantastic view of the street which made the room feel light with the full size window. Air con and heating both worked well. A real bonus of the hotel was the food, breakfast I can not understand how people can say it is limited as for an included breakfast there was both a great selection as well as variety in what was offered each day. It was busy each morning but there was always a table available. Additionally the evening food on Monday to Thursday evenings was good for a bite to eat to keep you going until supper or for as a light dinner. We took this up to our room to eat whilst getting ready to go out for the evening.The staff, although we didn't really have much to do with them, were hit and miss, two were absolutely brilliant I wish I remembered their names whereas one lady was pretty abrupt/rude even going by what is standard for New York. However that being said I wouldn't hesitate staying at the hotel again it was a fantastic base for New York and I would throughly recommend asking for a high room, it often seemed that the lower floor people (below floor 10) struggled for the lifts as they were full by the time they reached their floors on the way down.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were looking for a cost-reasonable hotel to stay at near Times Square during the horribly expensive week of Spring Break. We found it! It is just a bit off of the beaten path (which probably was nice - cabs were easier to get and it was likely quieter), and the price was reasonable (comparatively, anyway!) and I think the free breakfast over the week we were there likely saved us a fortune as well. I'd stay there again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Located just blocks off Times Square, this Homewood Suites worked perfectly for our family of three. Free, hot breakfast was a "must" for us and this hotel provided variety. Located never the heart of Manhattan, evenings were quiet in our room, helping us get a good sleep each night.
user_name:
Daniel R
South Milwaukee, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Love this hotel! It's close to everything and the subway. The free breakfast is very hardy. It's nice to have a full kitchen in your suite just in case you need it. Hotel staff is very helpful. Rooms are updated and very clean. It was our second stay here and we loved it again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. The location was ideal. Very close walking distance to Penn Station and the subway, as well as Times Square. The staff was friendly and helpful and pointed us in the right direction (right around the corner!) when our daughter had a mad craving for Asian noodles one night at 11 pm :). They never failed to greet us whenever we came in. The room itself was very clean and large for NYC. There was a fully stocked coffee/tea area in the lobby available 24/7. The free breakfast was extensive and very good. The entire experience was positive and we would definitely stay here again on future trips to Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I read hundreds of reviews, trawled tripadvisor and various other sites for a hotel in NY. It was for my partners 40th birthday so wanted to make sure we had a nice hotel, central, easy access to public transport and that won't break the bank. Well folks this hotel is it! We booked an efficiency suite, got the 17th floor. Complimentary breakfast is sufficient and enough variety - a great benefit especially if you on a budget. I believe there is a free dinner during the week as well but didn't see/use it as we were there over a weekend. Easy access to Penn Street station and just off 8th ave and about 10 minutes walk to time square. You can't go wrong with this hotel! Don't spend all the hours searching...book it!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent location. Only a couple blocks from Broadway plays and Times Square. Hotel staff is extremely helpful and courtesy. Stayed in the King studio suite. Had a twin sofa sleeper, which wasn't the most comfortable of sleepers. That's would be my only knock on the room. I've been to Manhattan 5 times in the last 3 months and would highly recommend this hotel. The location, knowledgeable, well trained and friendly staff along will with a nice breakfast and evening cocktail/light dinner, served Monday-Friday, make this a tough hotel to pass up. I'd highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Lovely clean hotel, excellent, helpful and polite staff. Ten minutes from Time Square in one direction and 5 minutes from Penn Station in the other direction. Room were clean, bright and well equipped. Great location to explore from.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location. Place 5 star. Breakfast. Rooms. But. Staff so super friendly. Kool. I go back again again love places. Love veiw. From room. All hilton. Great i said. Location. So great walk shows dinner restaurants.  hotel. All 5 to 6 star. Hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It was nice to have meals in the morning and on some nights. In the morning the staff was super friendly, in particular Lenny Terrero. She found out that I was studying Spanish and she patiently instructed me about Spanish vocabulary in the dining hall. My oldest son bonded with the staff at the front desk, and they made my youngest son feel special too.My mother worked for Homewood Suites when I was a child, and they made me feel like I was back at home in the hotel I grew up in and loved as a child. I stayed in New York before, but this staff has truly made feel welcoming for a Midwest guy. Thanks.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice place! Very clean! Gives Military discount or could end afford to stay, Staff was awesome, Breakfest was awesome at least for ARMY but WAY WAY better than what you get at holiday inn's!!!This is just a place to sleep, although it's nice! But the best part is the closeness to everything in the area! I won't look no further imitating hear every year on vacation

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I needed to be close to the Javits Center for a trade show I was attending and my wife was joining me. She likes it when breakfast is handy, better if it's in the hotel and it's included. We all know how expensive hotel breakfasts can be. The room also comes equipped with a fridge and mini-kitchen set up - perfect if you're staying several days.We got a great price booking directly with Hilton (I'm a gold member) and using AAA discount. We paid around $217. However, this week when the car show was in, it was showing $280/nt. So watch for that.I have to give the hotel kudos for it's breakfast. For someone like me who travels and generally stays in the chains, especially for their quickie easy to access breakfasts, they get tiring fast. By day 2 I'm usually onto cereal only. However, they changed the menu each day, enough so that there was a variety.On the whole it was very good.To add to this, Mon-Thursday, they offer free wine and beer along with a light meal. We used it twice and it is a really nice touch and very popular.The hotel is easy to get to via subway, Penn Station is your best route and more importantly it is near Time Square but not next to it. The glaring lights and activity is fun to experience but not so much when you want a bit of R&R and some shut eye. Also a short walk to the theatre district.The rooms are a bit small (who cares when you're in NYC) and nicely designed. Plugs for all those nice electronic gizmos we carry are plentiful and easy to reach (desk level, not hands and knee level). There is a walk in shower, not tub which I much prefer. It was a hit with my wife, so I guess it's a hit with me (to be honest, I liked it too).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I found this hotel after trawling through trip advisor reviews of hotels in Manhattan and this came out as one of the best. We were not disappointed! The staff on arrival were friendly and helpful which was a positive start. Our room 513 was very spacious with 2 queen beds and small kitchen and seating area. It was nicely furnished and more importantly immaculately clean. The housekeeping staff were excellent. It was also quiet and we slept soundly each night. There were 3 elevators to service all floors but we never waited more than a few minutes. The breakfast in the morning set us off nicely for the day. Some reviews I read said it wasn't a great choice of breakfast but it's free and we found it to be ample choice. There was cereal, fruit, yogurt, croissants and cooked breakfast options changed daily but always included eggs, sausage, potatoes or hash browns etc. Something for everyone and coffee/tea/hot chocolate was available 24 hours in the lobby. It was difficult to get a table to eat breakfast one morning but I think as it was Easter Sunday everyone decided to go to breakfast at the same time. The terrace on the 22nd floor provided some great views so worth trying out. The location was fantastic with Times Square, Empire State, Rockefeller Centre, Bryant Park, Madison Square Garden, Grand Central Station all within 10 minutes walking distance. 34th street also provides great shopping with the world largest Maceys store as well as others. We took the AirTrain from JFK to Jamaica Station then the Long Island Railroad train to Penn Station which is a couple of blocks from the hotel and 5-10 minutes to walk to the hotel from the station. There's also a couple of nice supermarkets to stock up on essentials just found the corner although the hotel had a little shop for anything you might need. We would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to friends and family visiting NYC and will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is very comfortable and in a great location. the price is supper good and remember they currently offer free breakfast (which is weird since all units come with a full kitchen) The rooms are very comfortable with nice beding.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent location...excellent value for money....great spacious rooms!Just a 10 min walk to times squareBreakfast was different every morning.. nothing too flash but just what you need to get on the go!Could not fault this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice hotel central for everything restaurants nearby plus convenience stores, subway station can walk to some attractions. Complementary hot breakfast and free WiFi. Welcoming staff home from home .Airport transfers arranged if required.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The value was wonderful, location was great for a sightseeing family of teens and pre-teens. Walk to Times Square and Penn Station subway very easy. A great price and clean with very nice accomondations.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was a surprise. It was in a great location with helpful staff, and excellent accommodations. This property was beautifully laid out and would certainly be a place that I would stay at again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, mostly great staff and facilities, dinner too early and not all week. So if family cannt take advantage of dinner hotel is expensive. Take extra care if booking cab from homewood as they book a company they get commision from so could be more expensive and not good service.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great clean hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Free breakfast and evening social saved money. We arrived and was able to do early check in. Staff was helpful storing bags while we toured NYC. Free coffee 24 hours a day in lobby. Rooms was clean and was cleaned daily. Free breakfast in the morning was good. The evening social with free drinks was great. Food was ok but was free. Check out was easy. Would for sure stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was very comfortable and clean. The staff was always very friendly and courteous. We would love to stay again! Only issues was that there wasn't enough seating at breakfast and they ran out of dishes. Completely understandable since the hotel was full the night before and we were a little late getting downstairs. Not a big deal though! Everything else at this hotel was great!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean comfortable spacious with first class staff. Going back to them soon. My " go to guys" in Midtown. Family keeps asking me ". When are we going back there???" Unconditional endorsement. Keep up the great work

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was in a great location. 2 blocks from Madison Square Garden and subway stations. Short walk to Times square. Tons of great food options. Hotel lobby breakfast every morning served it's purpose. Complimentary social in lobby Monday - Thursday evening was nice. My wife and I visited NYC for 10 days. We had an awesome trip for our first time in NYC. I recommend doing the Hop on Hop off bus when you first get there to get a lay of the land. We did the 2 day pass so we could break the bus time up over 2 days. This worked great and gave us a good game plan for doing the things we wanted to take in. Make sure you take some plays. A lot of the theaters are smaller, which is great because this makes a more intimate feel and there's no bad seats. Get discount tickets at TKTS

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Home wood suites was clean, cozy, with a very kind professional and accommodating staff, I will definetly return as well as recommend to anyone mostly friends who work long hours in Manhattan, Maileen Nunez specifically was wonderful!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice clean hotel accessible to many events and landmarks. Rooms were very clean and electronic check in was a bug help. Close to Javitz and Times Square and all transportation. Nice to also have a kitchen in the room. Beds were a bit soft and pillows could be firmer but that is being picky.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean room, good price, good location. I booked this hotel based on tripadvisor ratings and I was very satisfied. I would book a room here again. It's nice having a full kitchenette in an affordable room in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We arrived at 10am and we were able to check into a room! Complimentary breakfast buffet was more than expected. Room was good size for NY and super convenient. Cudos to desk staff - pleasant the entire stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 5 star Hotel Very nice hotel, clean, nice big rooms, free wifi, in room mini fridge and microwave. excellent front desk clerks they always take care of the customers, the rate is good They have a nice restaurant with good prices,and food, everything you need is around, nice shopping stores around the hotel, and fast food restaurants.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Homewood Suites. It is located within walking distance to Penn Station and Times Square. The room was very clean and updated. The staff was helpful and allowed us to check in early because our room was available. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We traveled 9 days visited 10 states plus a night in Toronto Canada. We stayed the night in 8 Hotels and this hotel was by far the best. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this Hotel!!
user_name:
Edward K
Cave City, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There are complimentary meals (I would say snack time) offered during 5-7pm, which is the very first time I see this in NY! Convenient for reaching Times Square and Penn Station.Room is comfortable, and with a good size.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We just returned from our visit to NYC during spring break. The hotel provided a great base for exploring the city. Traveling with my husband and 12 year old son - the King room with a sleeper sofa worked great. The rooms were small however sufficient for our visit. The sleeper was just a twin, and not much additional room when the sofa was pulled out. The morning breakfast and evening cocktail hour/meal was a welcomed addition to beginning a busy day in New York. We walked nearly everywhere - Time Square, Rockafeller Center, and Central Park. A lot of walking, but glad to get back to our hotel at the end of the day. Clean rooms, and attentive front desk and housekeeping. Will stay again if in New York!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were so pleased with the location, the service, and the food. There were some bumps: the second night we had really noisy neighbors (a child woke up crying and the adults talked full voice for two hours) and our heating was only air conditioning for a while (brr)--but the front desk responded quickly to each problem. We would definitely return!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Had a really nice stay at the Homewood suites, the food was good and the beds where comfortable and the location was good for seeing all the sights, but unfortunately as soon as you walk out of the door and do a right all you see are drug addicts dealing right on the doorstep.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for a week while my daughter participated in a Broadway intensive summer program nearby. The room itself was relatively spacious and had a nice kitchenette; there were four of us in the room (2 adults, 2 teens) so after a week it felt a bit cramped with all of our luggage. We had some problems with the staff though; every time I called in the evening for extra towels because they hadn't replaced the number we'd used, I would get a recording and have to leave a message. Then I would call the front desk and they'd have someone come up, but they were never particularly friendly. More to the point, I was expecting a FedEx package with valuable contents, and had given the staff at the desk a heads up, but no one called to let us know when it arrived and it wasn't until I called the next day to inquire that they finally realized they had it, and that was only after a long search. As for the food, the free afternoon happy hour was ok but limited in terms of food, and the breakfasts, though included with the room rate, got boring after a while and the room was mobbed with people. I didn't think the layout of the space was conducive to handling crowds. Tip: We bought cases of drinks from a wholesaler we discovered by chance down the street and kept them in the fridge since we were out and about a lot during the day and didn't want to pay NYC prices for single bottles. If you exit the hotel to the left and go most of the way down the street, it was on the right side.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is very nice, the location is great near broadway,Madison Square Garden. The staff was very nice,friendly and helpful. We visit NY several times during the year. This was our first stay at at the Homewood Suites in NYC and everything was great.Breakfast is good, happy hour too. Would stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Outstanding! Staff was very nice and helpful. Hotel was clean and recently remodeled. Rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. Well thought out design. Complementary breakfast was decent, big selection. The reception was nice, added a nice touch after coming in from a long day of sightseeing. Location was nicely tucked away in Time Square. Close to Penn station easy to get around the city. Overall, I would absolutely consider staying here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the staff was great providing information on New York City, making reservations for us, providing a free can of shaving cream, finding a container to hold the flowers I bought for my girl friend's birthday. Bringing up dish towels and knife to the room. Putting dishes away from the dishwasher.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is in a great location near the broadway shows we wanted to attend and also easy access to the subway. The hotel is up-to-date and clean and our room was a good size, especially for New York. The breakfast was plentiful but hard to find a seat each morning to eat. Only other complaint is the shower--the shower head did little more than dribble--virtually no water pressure. Otherwise, a very nice stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean rooms and clean hotel, solid value, excellent staff, very friendly and helpful. Great location near Madison Square Garden and able to walk to everything we wanted to see in New York. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Certainly exceeded expectations

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room is always neat clean and the staff is helpful experienced the bed is very comfortable for an extended stay was absolutely perfect cannot hope your wish for better trip. It has to be one of the most comfortable but I've stayed in while visiting New York my room was always neat clean and a timely manner staff is always helpful have a wonderful breakfast in the morning and I social in the evening . The facilities has a fantastic gym very roomy lots of equipment laundry room and business center

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: *A nearly new property*Very clean*Nicely designed rooms, bit unique*Good location for midtown walking distance activities*Free breakfast (included in all rates) has a good selection of hot & cold & fruit & cereal, just avoid the "turkey sausages" they're just plain awful*Free evening wine & canapés, not bad, just so-so, but great value for free!*Great F&B staff, really good friendly service *I think the wi-fi is only free if you're a member of their loyalty scheme

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We enjoyed our 5 nights at this Homewood Suites. Monday-Thursday they have evening reception; which is nice touch. Every morning there is free breakfast. We were located in room 415 and I did not have an issue with STREET noise. I am a very light sleeper, too!! However, I will say our neighbors (connecting door) were loud and on different time zone!! Next time I will call ahead and try not to get a room with connecting door if possible. I complained to front desk around midnight when my husband and I notice cigarette smoke smell! Front desk responsive and followed up on issue right away. They offered to move our room if we wanted the next day. That night we placed a towel at the bottom of the the connecting door...since we could see lights were on and there is an inch gap from floor to bottom of door. Would be good if they put a rubber door sweep at the bottom of all the connecting doors. Elevators were not as slow as the previous reviews I had read which is why I choice a room on 4th floor (worried about elevator). My girls often wanted to go up to the 22nd floor roof top and we never had issue with long wait. Workout area is nice and clean. The laundry next door to work out and it looked very clean; you could work out and be close to your laundry if needed. Front desk staff always responsive and professional!! Loved how they had coffee and hot water (for tea) in lobby all day. After a long day of walking & sightseeing it was nice to drink some hot tea a night! Subway a couple blocks away. Enjoyed location! We would defiantly stay again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites provided everything I needed in NYC at a reasonable price. The Wi-Fi was good, you can get coffee the whole time, the rooms were reasonably sized and comfortable, breakfast is included and had a wide selection of offerings, and there's even a roof terrace with a great view. It's well located too, close to Macy's, Time Square and Restaurant Row - what's not to like. Just get down early for breakfast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Totally enjoyed recent stay. Staff extremely helpful, especially Ms. Brent, Supervisor, Front Desk. She arranged early check in so that I could enjoy more time with family for our reunion. Room clean and entire staff very helpful. Loved rooftop sitting area with city view!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The food for breakfast and dinner is not the best you can find in New York but it was on par with other Homewood Suites I've stayed at. When checking in one worker claimed she could not get me a room and offered to check my bags. However, all of the other people in my group were able to get a room from another worker. When I brought this up to her she said that there were no rooms available. The other worker over heard and said that there were in fact rooms and he would get me one. I was very happy that this gentleman stepped up and corrected the situation. I wish I had gotten his name because I would have thanked him by name in this review.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed in a room with a king size bed in March 2016, The room was a good size for NYC and it had a small kichen area in it. The rooms with the odd numbers face the street in the front and appeared to be brighter. The hotel is located between 8 and 9th Ave so it is a bit of a walk to Times Square subway station (5 minutes) which was no problem for us, but some hotels are closer to the subway if you need that. the staff was very nice. Would definately stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hy husband is a diamond member and we have not stayed yet but I put a call in today because we are going in April for a family baptism and have several rooms reserved. I Spoke to Benita who was very nice and said that she is the night manager there. She told me that she would attempt to help our family with our requests. Stay posted as I will be writing another review after we stay :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: When I was looking for a hotel in mid-town Manhattan I was thrilled to see a Homewood Suites. I have stayed in Homewood Suites in the past with other family members and we have always been very happy with our stay. The lobby used efficiently valuable Manhattan real estate. The room was smaller than other suite rooms I have stayed in but much larger than other New York hotel rooms. The bathroom counter space was very limited. There was no wall to wall and that made it feel very clean. The location was perfect for where we needed to be, and it was close to Times Square and other tourist sites, but on a quiet block. On Monday night they ran out of a lot of the food at the free dinners in the evenings so we could not take advantage of that and we had other plans for the other nights of our stay. I would gladly stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is ideally located a couple of blocks from Penn Station and Times Square. The desk staff is very welcoming and customer-focused. As we had 6 people in the room, I asked for extra towels and they were delivered in minutes. The breakfast in the morning was great and saved us a lot of time and money. The view outside our room was another building so we kept the shades shut. We checked our bags before and after check-in and were able to retrieve them immediately. Finally, the room was very quiet. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, near all the midtown attractions and a short walk to Penn station. The staff at the hotel were very nice, professional, and courteous! The room was clean and overall this was a nice stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This property was such a nice surprise. Feels brand new, rooms larger than normal for the city. Super clean and spotless. Great complimentary breakfast and Eve reception. Service was awesome. Thomas that works Front Desk was especially helpful. Close to everything. Only minutes to Penn Station and the Theater District and Hells Kitchen food scene. Walkable to everything The only glitch is my room was almost 2 hours late to being ready after mobile check in. But the staff made it up with their friendliness and concern. I will be back for sure

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My wife and I have just spent 1 week at the Homewood Suites and were pleased with our choice. We thought that, overall, it was good value for money. Located on 37th between 8th and 9th, it's a great venue for a number of the key sightseeing locations being only a short walk from Times Square, the Empire State Building. Madison Square Garden and Broadway and Penn subway station. The room we were assigned (1004) was modern and spacious and included a king size bed plus a kitchenette, dish washer and large fridge-freezer and a desk plus a small settee and foot stool. The bed was comfortable. The room had aircon plus an overhead fan,The view was over the street. Not sure if there were any better views from other rooms.The staff were always friendly and helpful.Breakfast is available from 6 to 1030am each day. We were able to get a table for breakfast with ease between 7 and 8am though it was very busy at weekends between 9am and 10am. The food and drink is on a buffet basis. As a result, and has been our experience in a number of countries, the "hot" food was often only lukewarm. The hot food was usually: 1 tray egg based - always with cheese; 1 tray - bacon or sausage or corn beef hash; 1 tray - potato based - often hash browns.On Monday to Thursdays between 5pm and 7pm, the hotel provided complimentary beer and wine with some complimentary snacks (pretzels, nuts etc) and 3 "hot" trays. Each evening had a theme for the hot food eg pasta 1 evening; sliders on another evening; oriental on another evening. The above comment re the temperature of the hot food was again our only criticism.Complimentary coffee and hot water (with a variety of tea bags) is available adjacent to the restaurant 24x7. Complimentary wifi was available in the room and in the public areas we visited in the hotel and was consistently a good strength.We were able to agree a complimentary check out time of 1pm. It would have been USD50 up to 230pm and USD150 after that. The hotel looked after our bags at the reception desk and arranged a taxi (flat rate of USD65) to JFK for our departure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at the Homewood Suites Manhattan for a business trip. I loved the entire stay. The staff was extremely helpful. The lobby is very beautifully designed. The fitness room was bigger and nicer than most hotels. My room was compact as to be expected in the city, but I was pleasantly surprised as to how comfortable I was in the small space. The room had everyting I needed. I would absolutely stay here again. In fact, I have already booked my next business stay here.
user_name:
Kendra R
Valley Stream, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very friendly reception when we arrived. Our room was spacious and clean. I don't normally sleep well in hotels, but this room was very comfortable. Even though it is located close to busy streets it is extremely quiet inside. This was my and my son's first trip to New York and I am so glad I chose this hotel. There are subway entrances close by and most of the big attractions are not too far by foot. We were able to come back to the hotel for a rest midday before heading back out at night. It has great amenities as well. Breakfast buffet in the morning, all day coffee, tea, and hot chocolate, and dinner buffet during the week. We will definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Pleasant reception staff, very attentive from arrival until departure. Breakfast was very good, no problem with getting a table every morning and we stayed for 7 nights. Managers social nights Monday to Thursday is good, plenty to eat and good wine both red and white available, waiting staff work very hard. The room is very specious and very clean. It was our 24th wedding anniversary and the hotel gave us a bottle of wine and chocolates, a very nice touch. All in all I highly recommend this hotel. I look forward to staying here again . To the point that we are staying at the homewood suites in Orlando in May.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is in a good location for exploring New York, its a short walk to Times Square, Madison square gardens or a bit further to Central Park. The staff are very friendly helpful and the rooms of a good size especially for New York. Breakfast in the mornings is a bonus, this hotel was great value for money.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Where do I start? Myself and two grown up children wanted a hotel that was in a good location and would fit 3 adults comfortably. This hotel met those requirements.Staff are really friendly, helpful and approachable.Domestic staff do a great job and all areas of the hotel are kept extremely clean.Rooms too were cleaned to a high standard and the kitchenette was useful and well stocked. Breakfast was plentiful with a very good variety available.The evening social was a bonus, as was having tea, coffee or hot chocolate available 24/7. Location is great, especially for first timers who are looking for a Times Square location. penn station and port authority are only a few blocks away.We have stayed at the ROW hotel on previous occasions but I would definitely stay at the Homewood in future and will definitely recommend to friends. Thank you for an amazing stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I find the Home wood Suites and all the Hilton Properties in the city a pleasure to call my home in NYC The staff and accommodations are always top notch. people who I have set up in the Hilton properties have also felt the same and usually make arrangements based on availability at one of the properties. Always a comfort to know that after a hard day of business and travel I will arrive to welcoming staff and clean and comfortable accommodations.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at the HS for 3nts for a conference at the javitz center. Hotel was very accommodating, had a great restaurant, and a good room for the price. This is a great hotel for business travelers. I will stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location to get to everything midtown has to offer, but is actually quiet at night. So many areas in NYC are loud the entire night, not so much here which was great. Beds were comfortable, complimentary hot breakfast is more than adequate and the hotel is kept very clean considering how much traffic it gets. Price very reasonable for NYC. Love the Hilton brand and would have no problem staying here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room is a good size with kitchenette (full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher & crockery etc) and is very clean. The safe is big enough for 2 laptops and lots of other stuff. The large window lets in a lot of light. Breakfast is included & there is coffee/tea in the lobby. There is also a light evening meal & drinks served Mon-Thurs and free wifi. The staff at reception, catering and cleaning were all very pleasant and helpful but on a couple of occasions our room still had not been serviced by 3.45pm when we returned to rest before heading out for the evening. Plenty of small restaurants nearby and well-situated for getting to other attractions. I had a good view of sunset from the roof terrace.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our room was adorable and very clean. For my first time in New York I was very pleased with our hotel choice. The staff were very friendly and they went the extra mile to make you feel comfortable. The only complaint I had was the hot food for breakfast was always cold. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family when visiting New York. Walking distance to everything we wanted to see.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Beautiful room with comfortable bed and the whole suite was in immaculate condition. Walk to Times Square(and many other places- Grand Central, Madison Square Garden etc). Loved staying here. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Rooms are new and clean and staff is friendly and obliging of all requests I've made. Love the floor to ceiling windows and modern desks for times when I have to work from my room, too. Location convenient to our office in midtown.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay in Midtown Manhatten! The location of the hotel is ideal when you want to explore te city: 10 minute walk to Broadway and Time Square, 5min. walk to 'the garden', close to the pier for a boattrip, in between the bus- and railwaystation... The Hotel Staff was very nice and our room was spacious, quiet and clean. The bed was really comfortable, I slept like a baby.A big plus - every morning there's a complimentary breakfast (not what I'm used to in Europe, but more than okay) and there is a coffee/thea stand in the lobby. The hotel had everything we needed (including free Wifi!) for a great vacation in the Big Apple. Keep in mind that you are in the 'garment district', there are a lot of (healthy) 'take away' options in the neighborhood. But if you are a 'foodie' and want to 'wine & dine' you will have to walk a bit or take a cab to find a good restaurant, but we didn't mind.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights at Homewood suites during a short trip to NYC with my husband. My husband usually stays at Homewood suites at other cities during his business trips, and is always satisfied. So we chose this hotel without any hesitation and it was great. Most of the important points to see were all within a walking distance. Complimentary breakfast was quite nice, too.30여 년만에 다시 찾은 뉴욕이어서 여러 장소를 구경하고 싶었는데 이 호텔은 대부분의 장소까지 걸어 갈 수 있는 위치에 있어서 좋았고, 다른 홈우드 스위트와 마찬가지로 (화려하거나 멋있지는 않지만) 간단하고 깔끔한 아침식사를 할 수 있어서 좋았습니다. 대체로 홈우드 스위트가 다 그렇듯이 객실요금도 상당히 괜찮은 편이면서도 시설이나 서비스가 만족스러운 곳입니다.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great professional staff. Safe area. Clean rooms. Great room service. Great amenities. All burrows easily accessible. Close to airport. will bring my family for vacation. Lots to do for kids and adults. Good restaurants around the hotel. Really like the on house eat & drink in the evening every day. Ask for a room on top floor for a great city view. They offer free WIFI which is very important for me while travelling. Had breakfast once and loved it. Good selection, fresh food and clean dining area. I do recommend them to have their own bar as well which will be great after day's work if you do not wish to go out. Over all i would give them 9.8 out of 10 as a great hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My only problem was the the treatment of the poor people whose travel agent made a mistake on booking. These fellow-Mainers were treated by the front desk and I felt bad for them. To me the experience was great and I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My wife and I enjoyed our stay here very much so. Every morning the breakfast was very good, a bit crowded, but very good. They did well to keep the food and coffee fresh. Rooms were cleaned well and just had a very new and fresh look to them. Showers were nice as well. Only a few blocks from time Square and would definitely book here again. Very happy.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have very mixed feelings about this hotel. I wouldn't say I didn't like it, but there are a couple things I'd want to point out to future guests. There are definitely some good things, mixed in with a few things I didn't particularly care for.The hotel and our room was very clean. That is a major plus! Even with heavy traffic through the lobby, they really kept it nice! The free coffee bar in the lobby was a great plus! The coffee was very good and they had a variety of creamers and such. A nice touch. Our bed was so comfy! It was terrific to lay down after 4 full days of walking, walking and more walking around the city. The hotel was located in great proximity to Times Square, Madison Sq Garden, Penn Station and the subway. There are a few NY Gift stores located on the corner of the street. We also really liked the floor to ceiling windows in our room! A few of the things I didn't particularly care for was that the food (both breakfast and dinner reception) wasn't very good. Unfortunately, I would have to say below average. It was great they offered these free dining options for their guests, but with the food being sub par, I didn't care to go get some. It was nice they did offer 2 beers on tap and wine with the evening reception. The food didn't have much taste, the vegetables were very old looking and my husband saw some mold on the cheese platter. In our room, I was disappointed we didn't get a small couch as shown in all the photos. I was very happy with the kitchenette, but having the couch would have been nice for a seating area and we could have used the unfolding table. One last thing that really bothered my husband, more than myself is that the vent in the wall for the heating/cooling blew right on top of us when we were sleeping all night. I usually like sleeping with a fan, but that can easily be turned on and off. This was constant blowing.Overall, it's a nice place, but personally I wouldn't count on having full meals here. It was a great price for NY and was very nice to have the kitchenette, coffee bar and friendly staff. I would say a 7 out of 10.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I am in NYC every other week and use Hotel Tonight for 90% of my stays. This is a fantastic hotel next to Times Square and close to Herald Square and Penn Station. the staff could not be nicer and could not believe how amazing the dinner and breakfast buffets were.I am not sure what hotels do this sort of thing anymore. There was free delicious beer and wine and the front desk personnel could not have been nicer. i will be back!!!
user_name:
Jeff W
Cabo San Lucas, Mexico

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 5 days, and could not be more pleased!
