After a very long, and delayed arrival, when we walked into our room at 3am, we were welcomed with a handwritten card, dessert and a bottle of wine on the table, as we had come to celebrate our 10th anniversary in NYC. It was just what we needed! The stay just got better from there. The room was a decent size, the bed was comfy and the room was clean. The breakfast and dinner were also good and we enjoyed the coffee and hot chocolate available all the time in the lobby. The staff was great and very welcoming every time we walked through the door. It's conveniently located close to Times Square and Broadway, but not too close. It's also close to Penn Station and Grand Central Station. We walked to 5th Ave, Empire State Building, and Bryant Park - and that's just some of the places. We walked all over - but used the subway to go downtown and to Central Park.. There are definitely fancier hotels, but for the price, location and staff - you cannot beat it. When we return, this will be our first choice and I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Super Hotel, great staff, close enough to the action of Broadway but far enough off the main drag to avoid noise and congestion. We walked from Grand Central to the hotel with luggage in tow, fairly easy. Bfast was great, complimentary beverages in the lobby. The room was terrific. Price couldnt be beat.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked a suite that could accommodate my family of 5, the check in process was simple and efficient, Mo was really sweet and friendly, room was fine for a stay in NYC, two large beds, roll out sofa bed. Bathroom a good size. Restaurant was what we needed on each day they varied the cooked selection basic 2 or 3 cooked items, however the juice, cereals, bagels, fresh fruit, yoghurt, pastries, made sure everyone was set up for the day. Location was ideal for us as only 4 blocks from Times square, 20 - 25 minute walk to Rockefeller building/5th Avenue. 5 minutes from Penn Station, 20 minutes from High Line entrance, 5 minutes to subway. Hotel always had hot fresh coffee and tea available, and a good little shop, but location made it for us. Excellent concierge service on checking out suitcase, look after for several hours before heading back to Penn Station.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very conveniently located to Penn Station, Broadway Shows, Korea Town and subways this gem stands out. Reasonably priced with lots of amenities - free hot breakfast, 24 hour coffee & tea, free internet, large rooms (for Manhattan) and fast modern decor and elevators. Best value for money I've found in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were in town for New York Toy Fair 2016 and wanted a hotel that was close to the Jacob Javits Center. This property was about a half mile away and had great ratings on tripadvisor so that made it an easy decision.I'm a Hilton guy and tend to be a fan of Homewood Suites. I find they typically provide excellent service with nice amenities in the rooms. This property delivered and met my expectations of the typical Homewood Suites experience.The only thing that was abnormal was that we booked a double queen room. About a week and a half out from our stay I checked our reservations on hilton.com and noticed that we were issued a wheelchair accessible room. Since my business partner and I are both over 6'3 we don't typically like these rooms because the showers usually have a bench (that takes up room) and the showerhead is usually very low. So I requested that we be put in a regular room and not an accessible one. I was instantly told "no" and that's basically it. Seems kind of odd that we were automatically assigned an accessibility room with no hope of a room adjustment when I'm calling a few weeks before the event. To be fair, it may have something to do with the New York Toy Fair room block that we purchased in. I wasn't told of anything specific, but since I didn't book on hilton.com like I usually do, maybe that's why I got the cold shoulder.The breakfasts were good and I would advise not waiting until the last 20-30 minutes before breakfast ends. Because it was a madhouse with people all over the place. It's NYC and something you deal with, but wow.. pretty chaotic. Food was pretty well stocked and staff provided good service.I would stay at this hotel again if I return for New York Toy Fair. It's nice having the kitchenette with the large fridge and etc... The rooms had relatively new furnishings and were pretty trendy for Homewood Suites.Give this a look if you're going to be around TImes Square or need to be close to the Javits Center.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The rooms in this hotel are modern and have a clean, sleek feel to them. This hotel is not luxury, but is clean and well managed. The area surrounding the hotel can be a bit intimidating at night, but I stayed close to other pedestrians and went to bed early. They serve a free breakfast every day plus during the week, you can get a free dinner. This came in handy when I was late for a broadway show and didn't have time to go to a restaurant. The fare is basic and minimal, but it was enough to tide me over. There is a small kitchen area in the room which was handy. I have stayed in this hotel twice and look forward to going there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We just returned from a trip to NYC and Homewood Suites made the trip exceptional. The breakfast and spacious rooms were unusual for this location. We were so happy to have a mini kitchen and so much space! We will definitely come back to this property!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: You could not do better in New York. Very comfortable, reasonable and we found convenient for our purposes. Excellent staff and housekeeping. Great Breakfast! Loved the coffee and tea 24/7. Just a great experience. Try it!
user_name:
Mary S
Dallasll, TX, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Profile: a little about me to understand my review. i travel ALOT, mostly on business. i get a fariry large travel budget, but I am a VALUE person. When I travel with my family, I look for places like this.Pros: Reasonably large room size (for NYC), free breakfast (better quality than most free breakfast hotels), free evening social (not as good as Embassy Suites, etc., but better than most), location (Penn Sta area; also a Con) for convenience; full kitchen; great housekeepingCons: Slow elevators, somewhat crowded common areas (breakfast, evening social, lobby), location (also a Pro) for ambience; some room issues: water in kitchen sink not working, light switches & odd lighting; small/tight bath; narrow hallwaysThe Verdict (based on my profile): book it! Pros outweigh all Cons--especially given NYC location.Other Comments: Heavily visited by families wanting to save money; breakfast early works best; not necessarily a business venue. Cheap beer (but ok: Bud, Shock Top), cheap wine (but ok: Sutter). Definite value--a place I would gladly book to save money travelling with my family.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel! The rooms are nice and clean. The breakfast is great and the staff was friendly and helpful. There was a hot drinks station offered all the time which was a nice thing to have. The location was good walking distance from some great things. It was also about a $5 cab ride from time square which was nice if you didn't want to walk it. Great hotel for people wanting to explore all day and need a nice hotel to stay in for the night.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here with my spouse and a couple of friends for a long weekend. Rooms were newly remodeled and very nice. I loved having a mini kitchen in the room. Tea and coffee were available in the room as well as anytime in the lobby. The beds and pillows were so comfortable. Nice selection of food at the complimentary breakfast buffet. The location is very good too. A 10 min walk to Penn Station. Special kudos to Kim who was working the concierge desk. She was so helpful and nice. She recommended a musical and helped us get tickets. We loved the performance. This was an outstanding value. We will definately stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Oh, they came so close...From the get-go, I was perturbed that I spent more than 10 minutes trying to figure out the "early check-in," which includes being able to pick your own room. As luck would have it (or maybe it happens a lot), I chose a room, only to receive an email the next day that I could not have that room and another was chosen for me. While they did assign a room with my special request to not be near the elevators, it was a waste of time to try to pick myself. Granted, there is a caveat that you may not get the room, but they tease you with the ability to do so.Likes - great value for NYC, clean and comfortable room, courteous and professional staffDislikes - the free breakfast is mediocre at best and tough to find seating at the peak hours (although this is no different than most chain hotels), the room doors are extremely loud when closing (even when being careful), and the ice machine is smack dab in the middle of the hallway. If you are like our family, and don't stay out too late/go to bed early, the last two may be problematic for you. You can't close the doors softly, even if you try. It's the way the locks are. As such, you may wake to your neighbors door. Also, apparently to save space for revenue generating rooms, the ice machine is in the middle of the hallway, built into a wall, near the elevators. In most hotels, it is placed within a room with perhaps vending machines to alleviate potential noise. Although we were at the end of the hallway, which is not very long, we could still hear people using the ice machine. We were on the third floor, and I assume that every floor is set-up the same.Recommendations for those liking quiet - to best stay away from the elevators, ice machine and most used stairwell, I recommend you staying at the end of the hall with the numbers ending in 14 or 16, or the odd numbers across the way. There is a stairwell there, but that leads to the outside, so won't be used as much as the other end, which leads to the lobby (rooms ending in 02 or 04, or the odd rooms across the way). If you have your choice, choose the rooms ending with 14 or 16. Just be advised that the early check-in with a room selection is probably a gimmick only. So make a request for those rooms ending with 14 or 16, or the odd numbers across the way. The second best is rooms ending in 02 or 04 or the odd rooms across the way.On another note - the garage is located conveniently across the street, but be aware that this is not an easy in or out of the garage - the vehicle is parked by a valet and buried in the abyss with other cars. If you want to retrieve something from your vehicle, expect to dole out some doe to tip they guy to bring you to the car, and when you want the car, you'll wait with others while the valet gets same, resulting in a wait and more doe. I also abhor handing my keys over to a valet, not knowing how the vehicle is being jammed in somewhere.All in all you can't go terribly wrong here, but it's not worthy of an excellent rating in my opinion.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New, clean,friendly, awesome roof deck, terrific breakfast assortment.Digital check-in was fast , checked bags on way out for a few hours. Room with small kitchen was perfect for a light snack or full meal.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Currently staying at the hotel and whilst most of the hotel, and the staff, are wonderful there are some points that need looking at. We've just woken up on our second morning and feel abnormally ill and blocked up. It's clearly down to the room as we have been fine when we're out but this room leaves you incredibly blocked up. I've had to take tablets to decongest myself, not what you want first thing every morning!We booked a family room, we were obviously able to choose our room; however, if there is a small child in the room it should be noted that when the pull out sofa bed is made, the room is very very small. It doesn't look this small online and I think the pictures are very deceptive. It was also not made up on our arrival and when it was made up we were made to wait until 11pm until we had any bedding sent to the room. There is also no bath tub so bear this in mind when travelling here with small children.The room is beautifully decorated whilst very compact and also very clean (our maid is fantastic), staff very helpful, free breakfast is useful.Without a shadow of a doubt this is worth 5 stars on tripAdvisor, but when you are ill when in your room and when you can barely get out of bed because of the sofabed it does knock off some points! Customers should be informed that if the sofabed is being used its not practical to be classified as a family room.Such a shame as really could be perfect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent the night. Room was small but so nice! Great service. Parking right across the street so that's convenient. Parking was $45 for the night. Hotel post as self parking but it's really valet. In walking distance to everything. Great spot! Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Despite the first impression where the staff took a long time to find my reservation even though I even did the e-Check in; everything else was fine. Rooms are comfortable and functional, I stayed in the 6th floor and didn't heard a sound from the street. enjoyed the free Wi-fi and breakfast and the location is just good, one block walking from subway station.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed on the 8th floor and had a large patio, nearly the size of the room. Unfortunately we also visited during the record breaking cold Valentine's Day so didn't get much use of the patio. We did get up to the roof deck on our last day and the views are fantastic. The hotel also offers free daily breakfast and evening meals on Monday-Thursday.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was happy and very satisfied with my whole experience with Homewood Suites NY. I had only 2 days to tour NY with some family members and somehow staying at HW suites helped make that happen. Starting with the quick and easy check in and out with their friendly and knowledgeable staff, to the comfort and cleanliness of the guest rooms. The location was great as well, close to most subway stations. Parking was not overpriced compared to other NY hotels. The complimentary breakfast saved us time as we didn't have to worry about our tummies before we hit the road with our itinerary.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We come to NY several times a year for up to 10 days at a time for professional theater training for my teenager. We have stayed in numerous hotels near 37th & 8th Avenue, and this one is far and away the best. In a city where decent-sized rooms are hard to come by at a reasonable price, this was a real find. The rooms are big enough for our family of three (four would work OK), and they are well equipped with a mini-kitchen, including full sized fridge, cooktop, and dishwasher. The wood floors were especially nice, since carpeted floors in high-traffic urban hotels usually get pretty gross pretty fast. There is a generous breakfast spread, as well as a light dinner (!!!) Mondays-Thursdays -- all included. They also have a nice workout room. The very best part is that the front desk staff is wonderful. I wish I'd gotten the name of the red-headed gal who helped us plan travel to the theater on a horribly blustery night. She was gracious and kind and very knowledgeable.
user_name:
Debra C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton this past weekend with my sister and a total of 5 kids. We wanted a large room so all of the cousins could be together. The hotel staff at check in were pleasant and helpful. The complimentary breakfast, warm beverages all day and evening Manager's Reception were a welcome treat. Our room was spacious with a kitchenette. The hotel is midtown so we were within walking distance of many sights but also close to main transit lines. Very happy with our choice and the price could not be beat--with no extra hotel fees and free WiFi.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The check in process was rough. Couldn't check in until abouut 3:30pm after a very early flight. Probably no big deal if you are not needing a nap. I was. The lobby was freezing the entire weekend. It was a super cold weekend with very windy conditions. The problem is the entryway just is not built for the city. It is cold during breakfast and every other time down there. Everything else was awesome. Surprisingly quiet room! We were on a high floor, but what a nice retreat from the busy streets! Food was normally average, but hot and plentiful. The location is awesome. Five minute walks to the subway, Madison Square Garden, Starbucks, great restaurants. A little longer to broadway shows. Churches nearby. A great quiet place to sleep!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I enjoyed my stay at Homewood Suites, even though NY was experiencing an Arctic Blast with record low temperatures while I was there. I stayed at Homewood Suites for four nights in February on a business trip, and found the location to be very convenient - it was walking distance to the Javitts Center (took about 10 - 15 minutes), as well as Times Square, Penn Station, the subway, etc. The room on the larger side for New York hotel room standards, and was clean and very comfortable. It had a large flat screen TV, comfy king bed, desk, sofa, and came with a kitchenette area with a good-sized fridge, stove top, microwave, dishwasher, sink, coffeemaker and was well stocked with plates, utensils, glassware, cookware, etc. As a Hilton Gold member, I was given free bottled water and cookies upon arrival. Breakfast is included 7 days a week, and dinner is included M - Th in the hotel's lobby restaurant area. The food was pretty basic, but I appreciated the convenience of not to having to venture out into the cold to get something to eat. There is also a coffee/tea/hot chocolate bar available in the lobby 24/7, and free wi-fi. All of the employees I came into contact with were extremely pleasant, helpful and polite. The lobby area has a modern feel with a fireplace and a giant waterfall feature on the wall. I heard that there is a rooftop terrace, but considering how cold it was in NY while I was there, I never checked it out. The only issue I had was that the heat/air system in the room was a little too loud, but at least it was a consistent, steady sound (like loud white noise). However, it was nothing that earplugs couldn't fix. Overall, I really liked this hotel, and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York City. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites is an excellent place to stay especially if you like fabric, right in the Garment District but also very central for most of the sights as you can walk to Grand Central, NY Public Library, Macy's, even Tiffany's, along with the Rockefeller Centre, Central Park etc, etc. There is a hot breakfast every morning, hot meal and drink Monday to Thursday in the evening, as much as you want, tea, coffee, hot chocolate on tap in the foyer, all included in the cost of the room. Reception staff are friendly, helpful and have a wealth of information.....there was only one member of staff who was not at all helpful, the concierge who completely ignored me as I stood in front of him. It was pretty obvious as the duty manager and other staff stepped in immediately while the concierge continued not to make eye contact. Not sure why, so will give him the benefit of the doubt. Apart from that we had a wonderful time, waiting staff were helpful too, definitely to be recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Had a wonderful trip and enjoyed the location of the hotel - only 2 or 3 blocks from subway lines, about 7 blocks from Times Square, 2 blocks from MSG. King studio was like the perfect apartment with full fridge, dishwasher, cooktop, dishes, pots and utensils. When we ordered too much food at Carmine's, we ate it for lunch the next day! The breakfast had an excellent variety and small to go containers which was great for getting on the road with a bagel for the car ride. The staff was helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Elevators were pretty fast also. Beautiful interior with modern and contemporary style-hardwood floors and sliding bathroom door were nice features-well thought-out space in the rooms. Enjoyed it and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights on business in Feb 2016 - including the coldest February weather on record! First the good stuff;The hotel is convenient for many of the sites, but like many streets in that area, W317th isn't glamorous at all. Good sized room with very comfortable bed and (not that I used them) a good range of cooking facilities - hob, microwave, dishwasher, fridge and freezer. Good bathroom with decent enough shower. Free wifi is good as well.Now for the not so good;The main problem for me - as a light sleeper - is that the ventilation, air con (when it cut in) and fridge were all pretty noisy. I didn't get a good night's sleep while I was there and I don't think it was just the jet lag. Also the TV channels don't seem to have anything from outside the USA.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved our stay at Homewood Suites! The room was spacious enough for two people, and large based on New York standards. It has a small kitchen which was great for leftovers and snacks! All of the employees we came into contact with were very helpful and polite. The workout too was huge and well maintained. The hotel offers free breakfast which we took advantage of every morning. The breakfast was fresh and had a nice variety to suit everyone. We always found a spot to sit even during the busy times. There is a rooftop terrace which would have been great had we visited during the summer. The hotels locations was very convenient and a quick walk to the Penn station subway station. Overall we felt the hotel was an excellent value and would July recommend this hotel to friends and family traveling to New York City. We had a great stay and hope to be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Got stuck in the city during a snowstorm. Was able to get early check in. Nice staff. Buffett breakfast. Clean room, has fridge, stove, utensils, microwave etc. wish they gave me a room with a view but staff said for early check in they could offer the room without a view of street. no complaints from me. Slept like a baby :)
user_name:
killer4783
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If not for the convenient location and HHonors I would avoid this hotel. It is very large, slow elevators, crowded lobby, small rooms. Executive Lounge was on upper level floor with nice view, now it is tiny and adjacent to lobby with poor menu

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel and its location. I could walk to Macy's. Subway entrances are nearby. The kitchen accommodations were way more than I expected--a large refrigerator, dishwasher, dishes etc. The room was larger than most New York hotel rooms and was clean and nicely decorated. The price was extremely affordable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We got this hotel at a good price in February, only about 110 $ for a 3 person little suite including breakfast.The room itself was not that big, and the fold out couch / futon actually blocked the way to the bed in the room, when folded out. This was quite annoying and stupidly arranged.Kitchen in our room was very small, but we didn't use it.Refrigerator was incredibly noisy at some times!!Besides the room flaws, the hotel itself was great. Not close to a metro/subway station, but still very central.We liked the breakfast with good options, including oatmeal. No pancakes or waffles though.The free reception hour at night was very good the one night we had it. Fresh vegetables, humus and a very tasty tomato soup was just perfect, instead of cheap nachos and chili like most places serve. We would love to have tried the other nights, the menu changes each night.The fitness room was quite big, with 4-5 treadmills and cycles, as well as free weights.Free coffe in lobby was great, BUT it was very watery, and didn't taste like coffee. Should have been much stronger.If the above flaws get fixed, we would be happy to return, and maybe give 5 stars next time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel was excellent and location ideal for proximity to midtown Manhattan with easy access to all portions of pubic transit. Made stay in NYCT pleasurable for both business and leisure at an affordable price.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Having stayed at the midtown Homewood Suites in the past and found it to be a great place, I re-booked for January 21-25 as a birthday celebration to see Bruce Springsteen at Madison Square Garden. Due to the impending snowstorm, I had to add an extra couple of days to my stay and had no luck communicating with a Hilton rep at the 1-800 phone number. I called the hotel directly and Brian, who was working at the front desk, was able to help me quickly and accurately. I told him he had saved my birthday/Bruce celebration and he was very pleasant. Imagine my surprise when I arrived at the hotel on my birthday and found that Nafeesa, the front office supervisor, had a beautiful bag of birthday goodies for me including wine, snacks, and a beautiful card. Brian and Nafeesa made my day and made the entire trip special. The concert was cancelled due to snow and I needed more days to stay there because of the bad weather and their team took care of things for me with ease. In addition, the huge snowstorm was no problem for the Homewood staff. The sidewalk was clear at all times and the lobby was mopped constantly to keep the floor slip-free and dry. They really worked hard during trying circumstances and with less staff than usual and did a great job. Thanks again to Brian, who listened to my questions and found a quick solution that helped me and for mentioning my birthday to the staff and thanks to Nafeesa, who made an out-of-town birthday a memorable experience. Great customer service in every way.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has a wonderful location. We walked easily to see a show on Broadway and visit Times Square. We were also within walking distance from the Port Authority (where our shuttle picked us up for the Newark airport), Macy's on 34th, and Chelsea. The hotel is near the blue line on the Subway which provides fast, easy access to Central Park, the Financial District, and Brooklyn. We enjoyed the free breakfast, which was decent quality for a buffet. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the hotel is not ritzy enough to be considered a 5 star, luxury property.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at this hotel during the weekend blizzard. We were warm and toasty and safe. The staff did a super job of keeping the sidewalks clear and lobby floor dry.The included breakfast is very good and changes daily. The rooms were large enough that we three ladies did not feel crowded.There are many terrific restaurants and delis in the neighborhood and the staff knew about them all!This was my second time to stay at Homewood Suites..there will be a third and fourth.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It was super affordable for NYC. It was also super clean and new looking. It is also in a great location near everything. Having a kitchenette in the room is very helpful as well if you plan on staying for an extended period of time.
user_name:
Cari K
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Quiet, clean hotel. I would stay here again. The staff at the front desk even remembered my name when I left to pick up dinner. Nice room. I did hear another guest in front of me at the desk saying that there was someone else sleeping in the bed of the room they were assigned. But there was not stranger in my bed, so that was a plus.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fabulous hotel conveniently located between Penn Station and the Theater District. I believe it's actually located in the Garment District and was a short walk from Penn Station. It was a welcome walk into the lobby and we felt transformed from the busyness of the NY City streets. The glass enclosed fireplace with seating all around and pleasantness of the front desk staff made us feel right at home.The room was small but most are in NY City. We had more than everything we needed in the room - a comfortable king size bed, a kitchen complete with large refrigerator, 2 burner electric cooktop, dishes, a sink and even a dishwasher! WOW! There was a cute fold-out table in the room and a balcony with a table and 4 chairs. The bathroom was spacious and the shower was lovely. The only trouble we had was that the shower door seemed to leak. Otherwise it was a perfect stay!Breakfast is offered each morning in the lobby which was greatly appreciated. When we left the front desk staff checked our bags so we could walk more of the city unencumbered with our luggage. Every person we met and walked with at the desk was incredibly helpful, pleasant and made us feel very welcome. We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There was noise all night and the hotel room had a sticky layer of something on the floor and desk. Also, skip the breakfast. It will basically be ash and oil by the time you get to it. This hotel costs what it does because of where it is.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom Hilton Honor Club on February 5, 2016. Upon our arrival we were checked in by John, who was very pleasant,friendly, and helped us immediately . (We needed to print out our theater tickets) Then in a friendly conversation with John we, happened to mention it was a Birthday celebration.We were then surprise with Champagne by Carlos M., who was so enthusiastic and made the birthday Girl feel so special with the gesture. The entire staff during the wine and cheese were amazing. Carmen took the time during breakfast to show us how to make a Latte. The entire staff was awesome!
user_name:
Mary S
Perth Amboy, New Jersey

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for one night at start of Feb 2016. From the moment we walked in (we were a couple), the lady at the front desk had an air of hostility about her - something as if she was angry she was being forced to work there. I spoke to the manager and he had the same attitude. Very cold hearted people. I have traveled often and know what hospitality is. Anyway, the staff at this location (37th and 8th) was VERY rude. Every single person, not just one, had a sentiment of hostility when you approached the person. From the manager to the common front desk worker. I was paying for the room. It wasn't a gift or for free. My company did not pay for it. I paid for it myself with my own money. If these people really hate their jobs, they should quit. I have no clue who is managing that branch but corporate needs to go there incognito and witness the anger they hold inside and how they talk to their guests with the attitude they carry. Too bad they represent a premier brand. This is not a corner joint hotel/shack. There were other problems with the hotel. It was clean which is a good thing but the blanket was way too thin and too narrow in its width for two people to share. The room also had heating problems as the hvac did not work properly. The heat kept turning off and we'd have to get up multiple times at night to turn it back on.
user_name:
Alex W
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is just great! The room was on the small side, but that didnt do anything. The room was clean and modern! The hotel served breakfast and dinner. This was included in the price :-) it also included a glas of wine/beer. The food was ok, not amazing, but good enough :) The location of the hotel was amazing! We walked to everything!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed in a room with a small kitchen (full size refrigerator, cooktop, washing machine, microwave, dishes, pans, silverware, etc). It was great because we could enjoy shopping at places like Eataly and cooking in our room. They had a free breakfast buffet, and from Monday to Friday, there was a free dinner buffet. It was not a lot of food, and to be honest I only got myself a glass of wine the one time. Still, you can save a lot on food at this hotel. Of course, that also means there was no room service. There is an ice machine every 3 floors, a computer room and a self-service laundry room in the lower level.It's close to Times Square, Penn Station and Macy's. I walked to the Highline from there. For the first few days, I barely felt the need to use public transportation.I used their gym every other day. It's not big, but it was enough. We had wi-fi for free in the room because of the Hilton Honors program. Overall, a great experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I loved this hotel so much I booked for my next trip before I even checked out. Staff is exceptional and are ready to do what ever is needed. If there is a bad review given i imagine that person is probably never happy. room is clean, modern, compact but well done and you dont feel it. i will look for a room whenever i visit the city. it was as comfy as being home.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I hardly could imagine a better location within NYC. A walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State, Madison Square Garden and many other great places. The room is very convenient with a full-equipped kitchen and everything inside is very well maintained. Breakfast is also excellent. Must come back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Room was super!!! Very clean and spacious... Came in for the weekend and did not want to leave the room lol... Bed is very comfortable... Free breakfast and WiFi... Will be staying at homewood for future travel....

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and plan to come back again. We loved the contemporary design of the lobby. The room was a very nice size, very clean and we loved the hardwood floors. The fitness room is huge and has lots to offer. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was hot with plenty of food available at all times. Great location near the Lincoln Tunnel. The beds with the Hilton hotel chain are always the most comfortable. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I travel to many places in US, but this is a one of the best so far. Clean , friendly and what!! Free beer , free snack, free food Wowwww!! Incredible deal. Absolutely recommended!! A best hotel in NYC 5stars ...............................

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I would highly recommend staying at this beautiful, modern, clean, comfortable hotel! Staff was extremely friendly and efficient and went out of their way to make my sister's 50th birthday weekend special. They sent up gifts to our room and even called us when she was on her way up so we could surprise her. Breakfast was great and modern lobby with fireplace is nice to relax in. Very convenient location to so many attractions.
user_name:
Jean K
New York City, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed there for 2 weeks during winter and a blizzard (:The rate was good. The room was very good.They served light dinner and good breakfast which were complimentary.I really enjoyed.Staff was very kind.I highly recommend.It was on Jan. 2015
user_name:
MLLL12
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Large, clean rooms and bathrooms, recently updated. Friendly and responsive staff. 24 hour coffee and tea plus a fireplace in the lobby is a welcoming touch. Breakfast adequate. Free wifi quick enough

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is over 12 months old and very modern. Our room was clean, bed was super comfortable and the kitchen was very convenient. The bathroom also had a great shower. Great buffet breakfast every morning and a complimentary dinner most evenings. Coffee and Tea is available 24/7 in the lobby. The concierge Kim was super helpful and knowledgeable and nothing was ever too much trouble with our requests but all the staff were exceptional. The hotel is close to Penn Station and pretty much everything else including Macy's, and Times Square. My only small annoyance was that the air conditioning throughout the building was really cold all the time and needed a jacket for breakfast and dinner. My husband and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My sister and I checked in on Thursday with our children for our first girls overnight in Manhattan!! From the time of checking in we were treated like royality! We started at the check in desk conversing and laughing because we got ripped off by a driver who took us from Grand Central to our hotel for $40!!! The wonderful girl took his business card from me and replied "we won't be using him again!!" PS it went into the garbage can!! Thanks for nothing Alex! With a laugh she then said "use the yellow cabs"!! Our suite was amazing and our girls loved the free hot chocolate all day and night! Free coffee for me and my niece was impressed that I didn't get Donkin Coffee -since I live there and 2 were right across the street!! From a great free dinner which we only got a tasting of- we arrived late- to the best free breakfast included! Visited the 22nd floor for an amazing view of the city! Checkout was sad-no one wanted to leave!! An amazing man who worked there named Devon-hope I spelled it right-even got us a yellow cab and loaded our 4 heavy duffel bags! Can't wait to go back to this amazing place that felt like home! I can't believe our trip to NYC is over but thanks to the staff of the Homewood Suites in Midtown, our first trip to NYC from Dutchess County will be a memorable one!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I just returned home yesterday after a two night stay at this hotel! It was a girls get away with my sister and our three children! This hotel impressed us from the moment we walked in at 6:30pm with a friendly welcome from the front desk! Dinner is served Mon-Thur and ends at 7 but they held it so we were able to grab a quick bite! The room was a perfect size forthe five of us and very clean and had a pull out couch for all to sleep perfectly! Breakfast each morning was bountiful and delicious! The kids loved the non stop hot chocolate in the lobby! We were able to walk to Times Square and other sites as this hotel is in a great location! We are already looking to when we can return for another visit and know this is the hotel we will without a doubt be booking! Thank you to the entire staff, especially Devon who helped us get a taxi when it was time to go home! If your looking to come to midtown you can't find better than this!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located--close to Penn Station, Macy's, Times Square. The hotel is modern, clean, and the Homewood Suites brand provides the little extras of a small kitchen area in your room plus a buffet breakfast and dinner bar. Stayed here for a quick overnight trip during midweek. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and went the extra mile to personally print out our theatre tickets for us when we had difficulty using the Business Center computer.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. This is one of the better hotels I have stayed in. It is a perfect location, close to Penn Station and just a few blocks from times square. The front desk staff were very knowledgeable for places to eat and directions to get there. The free breakfast every morning was a huge plus with a great selection. If our travels ever take us to NYC again we will for sure be staying here. Very clean, modern and extremely helpful staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Built-in kitchen helps a lot. Free drinking 24x7 at lobby. Parking is $45.00 per day, even it's not free but reasonable in Manhattan. Location is great, within 20 minutes walk to ESB, Time Square, Macy's, and a lot of places. Definitely would come back again and recommended to friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel staff is great, complimentary breakfast is a big hit especially when traveling with children. Location in mid-town Manhattan is convenient for shopping, dining and sight seeing. Within walking distance to Time Square and subways. Overall a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved this hotel. Largest room I've ever had in NYC. Staff was friendly. The breakfast was great. Coffee, tea, and hot chocolate were always available which was especially nice in January. Great location. Close to Herald Square, Madison Square Gardens, and the Port Authority. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My two daughters took me to New York for my 80th birthday. From this location, we were able to get the places I wanted to see and we did it by subway. Saw the World Center - Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island and many nice restaurants in the three days we were there. And, during the snow storm, we were able to walk to the subway and it was running and we kept all of our reservations! It was a great stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The rooms had a kitchen area with Fridge. The free breakfast was great. They had coffee/tea and hot choclate 24 hours a day. I left at 5am and there was fresh coffee! Wifi was good and since I was a HH member it was free. The staff is very helpful, our flight was cancelled and they rebooked another night at the same rate in the same room. Close to Penn station to take the metro to the museum's or quick taxi to restaurant alley.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed in this hotel with my son for two days during college auditions. Highly recommend. We requested a quiet room and were not disappointed. Bed very comfortable. Service and breakfast were excellent, lobby so nice with the fire and the complimentary tea and coffee all day long. We will definitely go back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My and my daughter stayed here for a week in Oct. It's a lovely new hotel. A warm feeling to it..hard working staff. Loved the free breakfasts and mon-thurs dinners. My only problem was the $50 per night security bond. I find this extremely high. Especially as we stayed a whole week. I would stay again if the price was right.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem in NY City. I was there for only two days while attending a convention, but I felt at home. From the warm greeting at the front desk to the beautiful, clean, ultra-quiet rooms, this hotel is a great place for business or pleasure. I will return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family stayed here for three nights last weekend. The hotel has a great location and was within walking distance to a lot of the sites that we wanted to visit. Our room was very clean and my husband loved that it had hardwood floors. We arrived around 2:00, which was significantly earlier than the 4:00 check-in. No rooms were available for early check-in at the time, but when I explained that my daughter was not feeling well (motion sickness from the train ride) the lady at the front desk was kind enough to give her a bottle of ginger ale. We were able to store our bags so that two of my kids and I could go get something to eat while my husband sat in the lobby with our daughter. After a brief wait they were notified that our room was ready and they could check-in. All of the staff that we encountered from the front desk to the maids were very nice and accommodating. My only (very minor) complaint was with the layout of the room itself. I wish hotels were designed with women in mind. The bathroom counter was tiny and the only other mirror was by the door with no outlet nearby and only a small ledge to put things on. It would have been nice if there could have been a mirror over the desk so make-up and hair appliances could be utilized while the bathroom is also in use. Overall, this is a great hotel and we would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The size of the room is great for a 5 night stay. It is in a great central location. I LOVE that they have a convenience store for forgotten item and great complimentary breakfast at reasonable hours. The rooms and lobby are very clean.
user_name:
Rachel D
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is only one of the things that make this hotel top of the list when I have to come to NYC for work. The other reasons are the cleanliness of the hotel and the rooms. I like the option of being able to eat in my room (kitchenette) or go out. The breakfast is alright...could have some healthier choices, but I think that they do a great job considering. Same with the evening reception. There is most always a salad...my go to. And fresh fruit (apples, bananas, oranges...) during the day. I don't like to stay anywhere else when I am in the Big Apple. (Just remember - ALL hotel rooms in NYC are small - these are actually larger than most....)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a well-run and well-managed hotel. Everyone we encountered, from housekeeping to front desk to the restaurant, was professional, efficient and courteous. The location is convenient to Broadway, restaurants and many other attractions. The cost, for NYC, is a great value. We would definitely stay here again and we recommend it without any caveats.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: You cannot beat the location, spacious rooms or the accommodations of this hotel for the amazing price you pay for this lovely hotel. We stay every time we travel for business but would also stay for a family trip as well. You are on the Lincoln Tunnel within a block and on your way in no time. The staff is amazing- super friendly, polite and helpful. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I traveled to NYC every week on business in 2015. Each week that I stayed at the Homewood Suites was a pleasurable experience. The staff was amazing and the accommodations were fabulous. It's the people that make a hotel a place that you want to revisit. I will always consider the Homewood at 317 West 37th St my first choice of hotels when I travel to NYC

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The service and amenities found at the Homewood Suites Midtown make it a best value for travel to NYC. I can recommend few properties that bring location and convenience together in one place. If they served PopSecret microwave HomeStyle popcorn instead of Act II, my rating would be off the chart!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in January and loved the hotel. The staff working the front desk are some of the nicest, most helpful people I have ever encountered at a Hilton Property. The location is great as 37th Street is not overly busy or loud. The property itself is newer and fairly modern. Rooms are adequate sized and comfortable. WiFi worked great. The refrigerator in our room made a terrible noise, but the staff immediately responded when notified and was willing to remove and replace it right away. We stayed on the 17th floor and only had issues with crowded elevator 1 time and that was Sunday during peak breakfast time. All other times it was not an issue at all. The morning breakfast and evening receptions are nothing fancy but a nice bonus. You can get a simple breakfast (at no added cost!) before heading out to explore the city. We will definitely stay here again when in New York. The staff really made it an enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We highly recommend this property. We were able to walk everywhere. I took my 12 year old nephew to his 1st Broadway Show and then we explored Times Square-- all on foot! Everything is very close. You should check it out!
user_name:
Cindi O
Fort Pierce, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Came with my wife for a week. We came early in the morning after a long flight, we were surprised that the room was ready. The rooms are big and facilitate. Nice and small kitchen king size bed. They have basic breakfast and from Monday until Thursday also lite dinner. The fitness room is big and facilitate. They also got business room which is very helpful. The location is the best!!I recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We did a last minute weekend trip to NYC while spending Christmas with our Son in DC. I went through Hotels.com, last minute deals. We had no luck finding a room anywhere in Manhattan with two double beds, us and our adult Son. We opted for a King Suite at Homewood which had a pull out couch. I realize that space is at a premium in NYC, but the pull out couch was about 4 inches away from our bed.This was in no way a suite, although there was a kitchenette, about 1 ft across from the bed. All in all, the worse thing was their elevator. We waited on average 15 minutes to catch one. They have hotel staff and guests all fighting for space on an elevator, I felt very sorry for the staff, their jobs must take 10 times longer just waiting to get to another floor. Breakfast was solid. If the price was lower I would go back, but not for close to $400 a night.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here last week for 5 nights. Hotel is in an excellent location, we got the train in from Newark airport to Penn Station and it's only a 10 min walk to hotel. It's very close to the time square area and within walking distance of the Empire State, Rockefeller, Central Park (probs 30 mins) and more. Arrived at hotel at 3pm and was able to check in straight away. Good size room, huge bed and massive TV. All amenities in room, apart from a kettle so was unable to make tea, although I'm sure they could have provided one if I'd asked. Made great use of the complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby which you help yourself to. I wasn't expecting much from breakfast after reading previous reviews and thought we'd maybe only have it a couple of times but ended up having it every day as it was great. Always meat, egg and potato options, bagels, muffins, cereal etc. Great choice. Only had difficulty getting a seat on one occasion so ended up taking it to our room. Was able to avoid high data roaming charges by using the free wifi which was very fast. Our flight back to the UK wasn't until 7.30pm and check out is at 12, I asked for a late check out and managed to get 2pm for free which was very helpful. All in all a great hotel which I'd definitely stay in again and would 100% recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Even though I travel to New York frequently, this was my first stay here. What a great experience. The hotel feels like brand-new. The rooms are impecable, modern, well-lit, quiet and extremely clean. The service equalled the rooms: friendly, professional and with the "what can I help you with?" attitude that is rare to find these days. It can get very busy at breakfast time but the food was good and replenished frequently.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Small suites in Midtown are convenient to most tourist destinations. There was a communication breakdown between Expedia and the hotel regarding booking which resulted in a reduced rate at checkout. Otherwise, very average hotel. The rooftop terrace was a nice touch which provided obstructed water views.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Typical modern hotel, nicely decorated hotel, but I probably won't come back. First, they were running an hour late for check in due to housekeeping. The guys at the desk were very nice and offered drinks to us and the kids while we waited. That said, there was A LOT of people waiting, many people standing. My room on the 5th floor wasn't ready so they moved me to the 4th floor. I prefer higher when in NY due to street traffic. Luckily, it's not on a main road so we only heard honking once or twice. We get to our room and the keys won't work. So I have to go back and get another set of keys made. Finally get in the room and it's nice. It has a ceiling fan, which earns big points with me. The AC is working great, another good sign. Actually it was freezing my friend and her daughter because it blows on the bed closest to the window. They are used to it being warmer so I didn't sleep well. I'm not a fan of the closet being inside the bathroom. Who thought that was a good use of space? I don't mind bringing my clothes into the bathroom if I want privacy. The thing I really didn't like was the bathroom door slides shut, but does not latch or lock! And is not close to being soundproof. :-P Seriously think of a hanging door just closing over the opening. The vent fan in the bathroom wasn't working that we could tell. I forgot to tell management about that now that I think of it. There is very little space in the bathroom for your toiletries. There are buttons on the top of the toilet tank to use to flush so forget sitting anything there. The sink area is very narrow and the only other shelving is the area where the medicine cabinet would be has narrow shelves. They could have done a little better I think with that. The room is meant for up to 4 people, but they only had towels for 3. Had to request more towels. Next day they took the used towels even thought they were not on the floor. Breakfast was crazy, no seating available at 9am (breakfast ends at 10am). We stood to eat, which I have never had to do in a hotel. For 45 minutes there were no seats available. Granted it was a holiday weekend, but so not worth a free meal. I thought they had a waffle maker and they did not so the kids were disappointed. Next day we were leaving and stopped for breakfast on the way home. Again, the hotel was nice, but we've stayed at nicer in the city. It was close to the train, which is why I booked there, but then we ended up driving and I was unable to change my reservation by then. There is a parking lot just up the street since the hotel does not have valet parking. You might get lucky and find street parking. What was nice is how centrally located the hotel was. Usually we stay closer to Times Square and it takes longer to get places. This was a little closer to the areas we wanted to go. Also, I'm a Hilton Honors member so I had free Wi-Fi.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were able to check in as soon as we arrived from the airport. I mentioned it was my mom's birthday when we were checking in. Later that night we came back to the room to find a birthday banner, personal birthday card, wine, snacks, a gift, and a tray of sweets! This was so unexpected and just set our whole trip to be a wonderful experience! Breakfasts were delicious and plentiful. Such a bonus in NYC!
user_name:
Dorothy V J
West Chester, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel room was a great value. I had seen complaints that the rooms are small but having stayed in NYC many times this was definitely one of the more spacious hotel rooms we have stayed in. Also one of the least expensive and includes a good breakfast buffet and a managers reception during the week. Very clean and new with a decent kitchen. Not being right on Times Square it was actually very quiet. Still great proximity to Times Square, Central Park, tons of restaurants/shopping near by. Staff also very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful Grandmother, daughter, granddaughter Christmas trip to NYC! Leslie and all the staff were welcoming and very helpful. The breakfast, and evening happy hour were terrific! Our room was very comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great Hotel! Modern, clean and great complimentary breakfast.I was very surprised at the spaciousness of the room and little kitchennette is perfect for NYC. The breakfast was very good and a wonderful way to stet the day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stay at this hotel every few months for business. Great staff, great rooms, wonderful hotel but check out is a nightmare if you require help with your bags. One luggage cart and bellman is all I have ever seen and this last stay the hour and a half wait caused me to be late for a meeting.
user_name:
tammyd912
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughter, 3 granddaughters, and I visited for our January birthdays and found our stay there extraordinary! The staff could not have been more helpful and I was surprised by a lovely birthday treat our first night. They happily accommodated our early check in and baggage storage after checking out. The breakfast buffet was lovely with variety each morning. The room was well appointed and we had more space than anywhere I've stayed in NYC. I could not have had a more comfortable place to celebrate my birthday! Loved every minute!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We came for a holiday vacation .The hotel is located in a perfect location for vacation in Manhattan. The rooms are comfortable and the facilities are good. Breakfast is basic , and they also give lite dinner .Fitness place is nice and there is also business room that is very helpful if you need to print something or connect to your office for few minutes .

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My business trip for New York Times Travel Show was great and this hotel was a great location to Jacobs Jarvits Center. The breakfast was superb French toast, sausage, eggs, cereal, 24 hours coffee/tea

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is honestly the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Usually, I don't stay in mid tier hotels but I'm so glad that I decided to stay here. I can't really think of any cons to this hotel so I'm going to list all the pros instead.-The service is absolutely amazing. All of the staff members were friendly and helpful but I'd like to mention a few who really surpassed my expectations. Junior is one of them. I was ill for the first few days of my trip and he actually took the effort to get me some stomach relief medication so I would feel better. Additionally, he was really friendly and recommended really awesome restaurants :D. Thomas and Leslie were also really efficient and helped us organise certain aspects of our trip (i.e. transportation). -The rooms were big, especially for Manhattan standards. Plus, the beds were really comfortable and housekeeping did a great job at keeping the room tidy.-The location of the hotel was really good as well as most of Manhattan's attractions were only a few minutes away by foot. -This is probably what a typical teenager would say but I loved the free wifi. Unlike most complimentary wifis, this one wasn't slow at all.I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone, as it is well worth the money you pay for it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We wanted somewhere not directly in the middle of Times Square and of good value, so glad we came across Homewood literally 2 days before flying out. From JFK it was 45 mins by train costing all of $13 each to Penn Station (Madison Square Garden), far better than an expensive taxi. Less than a 5 minute walk we were at the hotel. We were greeted with a smile which always helps by Nafeesa who after a few mins conversation realised it was my 40th Birthday the next day. She didn't have to but kindly gave us an upgrade to a room with a balcony. She explained where everything was in the hotel so we felt at ease. Getting to the room (805 8th floor) we were presented with an immaculately cleaned room with kitchenette. Then we noticed the balcony, how nice was this to have our own patio. Was like sitting in our own garden back at home. We then decided to leave and venture around Times Square which was between 5-10mins away. The highlight of the stay was when we got back from our day out on my birthday to find a bottle of wine, 2 cakes, decoration on the window, a card and some other treats on the table. Nafeesa had made the effort to put this into our room and I have to honestly say, the service we receive on our Vegas trips in 5 star hotels hadn't matched up to this so was appreciative of the gesture. So a massive thank you to all staff especially Nafeesa for making my 40th birthday something we will not forget, secondly the staff in the breakfast area, constantly tidying up which we felt mean leaving our plates so we put these away ourselves each time. Just a bit annoyed we never got to say bye to Nafeesa. Our opinion:Pros:Worth the cost of staying thereStaff put other hotel staff to shame with the customer service levels no matter what time of day it was you walked past or asked a questionHot Breakfast each morningBed is one of the most comfortableKitchenette in roomFree meal on Weds evening between 5-7pm with wine and beer (missed Mon, Tues & Thurs)24 hour tea and coffee in the lobby areaRooftop terrace which would be stunning to use in the summerLovely lobby areaDistance to Times Square, Penn station and Port Authority station is a plusConsNo hotel bar which would've been nice on some evenings before going outAir con vent in room and sometimes the one in the corridor made noises which can be annoying for someOther negative reviews I don't believeOverall we would definitely stay here again as it has everything you require for your stay.Thank you and we hope to see you again soon

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewoods are always good. We were there on a weekend, so no managers reception. But room are a reasonable size, staff is friendly, and location of this property is really good. Decent value in the city. We were there for a Broadway show, and could walk to just about anything.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel looks brand new, everything in the room feels new and clean.room is pretty specious, especially for NY.It has a full kitchenette.free breakfast every morning and a good one, with many options.free dinner! Mon to Thur. free wifi with a strong signal.staff and front desk and kind and helpful.This is the first hotel that i stayed in which has a laundry room with washing machines, laundry is 2.5$ and dryer is 2.5$ which is pretty cheap.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: By far this is the best hotel i have ever stayed at. The staff very friendly and helpful always a smile on their face which made you feel at home. My room was always clean especially coming back after a long day sightseeing and on your feet all day. Hot cooked breakfast every morning is a good start to your day and dinner monday to thursday was lovely with free wine. I was on the 8th floor had no problem with noise or the elevators. Close to most attractions and train stations which was easy to get to. Overall 10/10. I' ll come back here anyday. Thankyou for making my stay feel at home.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was very excited to stay at this hotel because of all the glowing reviews. I exclusively choose this type of hotels now anytime I'm in NYC and if the prices are not exaggerated (as it can be in NYC sometimes). So I have visited to Homes2 by Hilton (Long Island City), Residence Inn by Marriott (Central Park and Eastside), Staybridges Suites Times Square and Dumont hotel.This Homewood Suites Times Square is my least favorite of them all.Cons: The kitchenette is not separated from the sleeping area so it is very odd.The room is smaller than all the hotels previously mentioned. The cleanliness is just ok (hair from previous customers on towels and around sink, bathroom,shower, kinda gross!) ...I even had to request another room from the previously allocated one because the floor was dirty,dusty and full of hair.The towels were worn out, "beige"-ish and some torn...really at a Hilton?Pros: Nice and understanding staff. Modern room. Fully equipped kitchen. Safe and busy location. Request a higher floor though (above floor 15) or you'll get zero view or a view inside the apartment right across the window!Free Breakfast AND dinner (yessss!). Great for families or long stays.In this style of hotel, I would choose the Residence Inn Central Park (brand new) or Staybridges Suites TSquare over this one. Period. Now if you need a clean huge room and the most comfortable bed (but a more "ancient" kitchen) go for Dumont.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a really nice place, close to Time Square and Penn Station. Clean, nice staff, beautiful roof top deck. Breakfast is included but dinner and drinks are also included Monday through Thursday. The dinner is really good fresh food. The value for this place is awesome.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staff is super friendly and professional. Between Times Square and Penn Station. Easy to get to from airport by train. Daily breakfasts get your day going in the right direction, easy and stress-free. Fitness center has the essentials to get your workout in.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites by Hilton turned out to be the best decision we made as a family for our one week vacation. The check in process at 2.00am in the morning was quick and welcoming. The highlight of the stay was the play area. It helped our two year old son to acclimatize to the new environment. He met and played with many new friends his age from all over the world. This simple feature made parenting during the trip so much easier and more enjoyable. We strongly recommend that the hotel keeps a play area as a part of its year round offerings. The other features we deeply appreciated included the 24 hour laundry, the extremely quick internet service, the built in kitchen (even though we didn't cook) the windows that could open and the evening dinners provided by the Hotel. The Hotel is centrally located major all the conveniences and within walking distance of the major transportation options. It was so easy to walk or even travel by taxi, bus or train. The rooms are sound proof so you don’t hear the external sounds and heating and the a/c works well. Homewood Suites has earned the right to include the word "Home" in its name. The staff were instrumental to the fantastic experience we had and we deeply appreciate it. Well done Homewood Suites...
user_location: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago
user_name:
Terrence W
Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family spent a week here for a Christmas vacation. The location is great because it is close to Times Square, close to Madison Square Garden, and two blocks from two different subway stations. We traversed much of Manhattan during our visit and this hotel/location was excellent. I wish I could say more about the staff but without a doubt it was the best hotel staff I've ever encountered. They must have been under enormous stress given the hotel was fully occupied during Christmas. Tons of people but the staff repeatedly attended to our every need in a timely manner with a gracious smile. This speaks volumes for the their training program. The staff was highly motivated and trained to make their guests have a wonderful experience. Our room was great, all of these are suites with a kitchenette, again, great for traveling. I will repeat this visit at my earliest opportunity. My only suggestion is choose a room on a lower floor. When they are crowded there is a signficant wait for elevators (they have 3). Had we been on the 3rd or 4th floor we would have used the stairs exclusively. I have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this hotel. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was our third visit to New York and this was by far the best hotel we have stayed in. We stayed the first week in December for the start of the Christmas celebrations. The room was plenty big enough and quiet, kitchenette ideal even with a dishwasher, large fridge, everything that was needed to enjoy your stay was there. In fact due to the mattress being so comfortable , I had the best sleep the whole week than I've had in a long time due to a bad back, hence now, we have just changed our mattress. Free breakfasts every morning set you up for the day and during the week the light evening meals were ideal, not to mention the free wine! Complimentary hot drinks 24/7. All staff we encountered were very friendly throughout our stay. Hotel ideal location to Times Square and other attractions. Wouldn't use another hotel again and would recommend this hotel to anyone that we know are thinking of visiting New York. Had an amazing time and a good hotel makes it so much more enjoyable, this is now the hotel for us, look forward to going back.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Sharon W
New York, New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: i picked this hotel off Expedia and it turned out great! Pretty close to everything, restaurants, 7/11, subway. Wee knights they have light dinner & drinks free from 5-7. Breakfast is included also. Every member of staff we encountered was very helpful & friendly. We visited between Christmas and New Years so I expected busy. Meal times were crowded and elevators were slow in the morning, but that was expected. Also have coffee and hot tea/cocoa at all times. Rooms were modern and easily accommodated my husband and our 3 teenagers. Definitely would recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have visited a lot of cities all around and for that we have stayed in many different hotels, and this one has to be one of my favorites. Great location and kind staff. No doubt, I will stay here when I come back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is only a few blocks from Penn Station. The room is very nice for the price. The room had a frig, microwave, and cooktop with dishes, utensils, etc. The hotel offers free breakfast, cookies, etc. Great value!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our room was never properly cleaned. The hotel is very weel located. Food is great in the morning and in the evening. Only problem we had was that the room was not cleaned properly so we had to sleep very uncorfortably.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Since we have a young baby and were trying to celebrate our anniversary weekend, I booked this hotel because of the kitchenette and the location. This was a poor choice. I had called a week in advance to request a room on a high floor, but when we checked in, we were put in a room on the 8th floor facing another brick building. I found it hard to believe this was the only room available as the associate said when we checked in. Just a few minutes after us, there were crowds of people checking in, I'm sure they were well accommodated. It was horrible for the price we paid. I had also requested a crib in the room. The associate said she would be up in 15 minutes after we checked in, but never showed. It took 2 phone calls to get the crib and it was after our long night out that we had to come back and deal with this. The room is tiny and very crowded with the ottoman, table, rolling chair, crib etc. There was no space for the baby to crawl around even if he wanted to. I felt like we were sleeping on a set of blankets, the mattress was very uncomfortable. When we checked out, the associate was rude and would barely look at me when we asked if we could wheel our luggage to the car which is parked in the $50 garage. So my husband had to bring the car around as I waited in a crowded lobby with a baby and luggage for 20 minutes. We also waited almost 30 minutes for a tiny elevator to get downstairs. It was so heavily used in the morning.The only perk was the free breakfast, which was convenient to grab some bagels as we couldn't get out of the hotel fast enough the next morning. I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We booked this hotel using Hilton Honors points and got a good value. Other Hilton properties in Manhattan range from Waldorf Astoria (lux, but requires a super-premium in points) to Hilton New York (stiff, business feel) to Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square (great for families and first time tourists) to various Hampton Inns (which can be good values but tend to all seem the same). This one features oversized suite-like rooms with contemporary furnishings and a large bathroom. (See photos.)The location is a few blocks from Madison Square Garden/Penn Station and a fairly easy walk to Times Square and Broadway theaters. Quite convenient if you are flying into Newark and taking the train into Penn Station.
