Not the most happening neighborhood in the city but safe enough and easy to get most anywhere you need to go.The staff is friendly and helpful. The included breakfast is well stocked with the usual buffet faire, and the breakfast room was not jammed while we were there. On weekdays, there is also an included evening reception but we stayed over a weekend.Our room had an o.k. view but with no landmarks to see. There is also a rooftop deck with more expansive views.Free Wifi if you book on the Hilton site and/or if you are an Honors member. (As a general rule, you should always join a hotel's loyalty program. It's invariably free and they will frequently give you extras just for being a member.)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a wonderful pre-Christmas girls' trip to NYC thanks to Homewood Suites! The location was great for all the Midtown Christmas sights and close to Penn Station for catching the subway. The hotel staff was friendly and always cleaning! We loved the complimentary coffee, tea, and hot chocolate available in the lobby!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This one was booked last minute but ended up being a good choice. There isn't a lot to see in this part of town and you will pass a bunch of other hotels on the way here but it ended up being a quiet night's sleep. I had the room next to the elevator and it wasn't too noisy at all. I really wish they had more than two elevators to the rooms. It takes forever if your on the high floors. If you're in a rush in the morning, opt for a lower floor which is staircase accessible. Continental breakfast in the morning isn't shabby. Go earlier to get s seat otherwise you might have to wait or share tables. Rooms were clean and shower pressure was good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I wanted to say thanks to all staff they made our stay amazing. The room was always cool as outside was boiling! The room was clean and facilities were modern and housekeeping were very attentive and left out rooms just like the first day.The food was good and lots of choice for breakfast. The attendants were very friendly and clearing tables, rubbishy and replenishing food items as fast as they could. I would like to mention Miriam was very kind to my younger brother who has special needs and was always looking out for him at meal times. Thanks!All in all our stay was happy and we will be be visiting again when we return to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a comfortable and affordable hotel. Rooms were spacious, spotless bathroom, courteous service and walking distance to everything. I recommend this place and will use again. Monday-Thursday they give free breakfast and dinner if traveling with a family. Small kitchenette in the room with a full size mini refrigerator, dishwasher, and microwave and fully stocked with pots and dishes but who wants to cook when you are in NYC. They have a concession stand downstairs for those extra munchie nights. Parking across the street for $45.00 a day after the hotel stamps your voucher. Very convenient, right off the holland tunnel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent in every way .. I have not checked out yet but already fell in love with this hotel. We celebrate great anniversary here and the manager gave us a bottle of wine. Very thoughtful!! The lobby is very well designed, with intimate spaces, fireplace and a waterfall. And the staff is constantly cleaning. A terrific place that I highly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall this hotel was very good! The room (a king suite) was spacious considering it was in NYC. We were on the 9th floor, and other than one time when I heard police sirens, it was very quiet! Staff was very pleasant, Tiara helped us out a couple of times and provided great service! The only thing that I would say could have been better was the breakfast. It was crazy busy, which has more to do I imagine with our timing of hitting the breakfast. But the potatoes were really really dried out and not even warm; the sausage was lukewarm. I would stay here again !

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room is clean with enough space! The dinner with wine is really cool plus the staff is perfect! Big up to Ugo who are really nice to me. The size of the room is perfect and the shower is great! The only downside is the elevator even the employee are complaining

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a nice property to stay at right in Lower Midtown. We were here on business so the location was actually perfect. The staff was great as well. The hotel is relatively new so it is very clean!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our pre-Christmas family reununion in NYC was a HUGE success thanks to selecting this hotel. Our party of 15, ages 3-57 was spread over 6 rooms. The key concern in selecting the hotel had been our ability to all be able to meet on a daily basis and yet have the flexibility for people to do whatever they wanted. The breakfast and weekday buffets were ideal for this, as were the rooms with their kitchen faciltiies. The hotel is IDEALLY located on a quiet (by NYC standards) street, and we walked pretty much everywhere. I'm delighted to record that Tiara was a massive influence on the success of our reuinion: her calm and persistent effeiciency at (1) handling a room change request (thank you!!), (2) delaing with a present I had shipped to the hotel (3) arranging an extremely late check out for our room so that ALL our party could deposit their luggage use the faciltiies there until the time of our flight and (4) her unflappable and ever-smiling demeanour made our stay (and my responsibilities as the trip organisor) simply special. Yes, the lifts are a little slow at peak times, and yes the breakfast can be busy but these are small prices to pay for a great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Superb hotel in a great location for the major attractions of NY. Room was small (as expected) but spotless. Tiana and Kim on the front desk were superb with our daughter (6) and the book gift at the end of our stay was a lovely touch. Guy pouring the beer and wine most nights was great also. The coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby is 24 hours and free flow - didn't go to Starbucks once in 6 days! Breakfast was good but basic (sausage/bacon/s eggs/fruit/cereal/toast/pastries and bagels) and changed slightly gently each day. Evening food Mon-Thurs was again basic but enough if you don't want t eat out every night. Free flow wine and beer also Mon-Thurs 5-7pm. As others have mentioned, there isn't enough space for all of the guests at breakfast, but we were there just before Xmas. People were taking food up to rooms which didn't seem to be a problem. My only complaint is that the fridge in the room can't be switched off and is a little noisy if you're a light sleeper. You could pull it out and unplug if it was too much I suppose.Private car to JFK was booked though the concierge and as advertised was $65 all in.I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and have been telling lots of people the same. I read some of the poor reviews (very few with this hotel) and wonder if they stayed in the same place.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed here and I cannot praise the staff enough. Mo (Motanoy) and her co-worker (forgot her name) were so helpful in switching my reservation and making sure my stay there was pleasant. They entertained my prolonged conversation I insisted on having with them after a long night out in the city and were so polite and made me feel at home. I cannot thank you enough for making my stressful weekend there less hectic and bearable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I staying in room 1116. Was of put by the fact that my window faced an active office building 20 feet away. Would have liked to have been asked at the front desk if that type of room was OK. Took some getting used to but it worked out OK. Room was not super clean (found a woman's hair), and the shower door leaked into the bathroom. front desk staff failed to ask me about my stay so I forgot to tell them . Was there on business. Breakfast is good. I am a Hampton Inn person typically which I prefer over Homewood. Hotels is new and clean otherwise. Good gym facility. If you are bargain hunting in NYC this is a good spot.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was having a rather pleasant stay after having to manage a damp smelly room with not so white towels and not so white bedsheets and a thin duvet that smells so bad until Melissa Infante the director of front desk services appeared and made my stay even worse!!! I will not be coming back here and I do not recommend them. Melissa is so so rude, very uncaring and her customer service skills suck! This attitude is spilling over to her co workers and making them act like her often as they call her " my boss" SMH. Junior the Bellman is so so amazing, he is so caring, hardworking and very good with kids. Nefessat is wonderful and very caring and deserves a double promotion.The hotel is generally not children friendly and unnecessarily expensive with their items in the little shop in the hotel. The housekeepers don't speak English or hear English and communicating with them on when to come in to clean the room and what to do is so so hard!! Besides most of the staff in the hotel act like they are doing you a favour accommodating you!!! It's my money! It's not charity!! I pay for your services!! Customers pay and thats why you have a job!!! So stop with the attitude!! The housekeepers don't do a thorough job at cleaning and I had a hard time doing their job for them the much I could so I let it be and when the litter was too much because they wouldn't do a thorough job they charged the credit card almost $200 for cleaning because of their failure to do their job thoroughly!! And they wouldn't call my number to verify my late checkout status. I DO NOT RECOMMEND!
user_name:
anonymousany
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room that we stayed in was SO SMALL. One person cant even fit in the bathroom. We felt like we were in a small shoe box. The hosted managers meal was awesome and the employees were all helpful. The location was a bit far from Time Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Really enjoyed staying at the Homewood Suites. It was the perfect location for both shopping and sight-seeing. I'll definitely use this hotel again when visiting NYC. The staff was really accommodating and we left with a smile.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Tiara and Kelvin rock. The entire staff puts on a great experience in a very busy hotel but they all go the extra mile to put a warm smile and make one feel welcome. Will be back! They only negative are the elevators. Small and sloooooow... But the rooms are great and modern and the showers rock!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family was staying in New York City for only a night before taking a flight to Berlin. We arrived early in the morning (way before check in time) and was warmly welcomed by a great staff. The girl at the front desk (Michelle) was very thoughtful and told us that we could enjoy breakfast while she looked for a room for us. We ended up settling down in our room hours before official check in time, which was a gift after a 10 hour flight. The room itself was very spacious, clean and comfortable, specially considering NYC standards. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel and amazing staff. Shout out to Idris as well who helped us with our luggage and transportation to the airport.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just home from a brilliant week in New York! This hotel has large, spacious, clean rooms with great amenities including a fridge, microwave, dishwasher, cooker, sofa and TV. However, the fridge did make a noise at night so not good for a light sleeper! But the bed was huge and extremely comfortable and we had no trouble sleeping. It's in a fantastic location, a 15 minute walk from Times Square, a 5 minute walk to the closest subway station and a 10 minute walk to the Empire State Building. The only let down was the limited seating for breakfast, there are not enough tables for all the guests so we sometimes had to wait for one to become free. Staff were helpful and friendly.Overall, I would definitely recommend Homewood Suites and would stay again! It was the perfect hotel to stay in to explore this incredible city!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood suites are Hilton's attempt to offer "wee homes" (kitchen, bath, comfy beds) in NYC. This particular facility is newly renovated. Rooms are clean, well designed, and bright. Staff is particularly nice and accommodating. A shout out to Tiara, who cancelled a second reservation of mine after the 4pm cut off as a one time curtesy. Very appreciated. Join HHonors, use the app to find rooms, and they will take care of you!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My friends call me a hotel snob ! This is a hidden jewel, found because I could not get the hotel I really wanted...how lucky for me, Fabulous hotel. Not many hotels offer complementary breakfast. Will definitely stay there again. Great location and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our stay at this hotel truly was superb. The location was convenient to Penn Station, and since we flew into Newark Liberty, we simply hopped on the NJ Transit, rode into Penn Station, and walked about 3 or 4 blocks to the hotel. The property is close to Times Square, so we were able to walk over there; walk up to Central Park; and use the nearby Subway station to move around the city with ease. The hotel was incredibly clean. The rooms were just awesome (we had a King Efficiency). The 22nd floor terrace was right around the corner from our room (2202), and we loved going outside. The evening reception is quite nice, and the hotel offered milk and cookies, which was a very nice touch. Although we were not pleased with the taste of the breakfast foods, there was a good selection. We would stay at this hotel ANY time we were in NYC.
user_name:
Tracy G
Newburgh, IN, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just got home yesterday from a family trip to New York City. We stayed on the 22nd floor in room 2203. Everything in that room you could possibly need for your stay. Pots and pans, dishes, dishwasher, coffee machine, full size fridge and a comfortable bed. Our son slept on the pullout couch and he found it comfortable. Our room was quiet and clean and they made us feel so welcomed. It was my husband's birthday and when we went into the room, we found a card, a bottle of red wine (his favourite) and a little gift bag with York Peppermint patties in it. He was so happy. On our 3rd day, we came back to our room and found a Christmas card with a Cookie in a small Christmas tin can. Another wonderful touch. Can't forget the full hot breakfast every morning and during weekdays, small light meals, beer and wine for free between 5-7 pm. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Decided to stay at this hotel since it was perfectly located for the midtown sites we were visiting while in the city for our anniversary. The hotel was well staffed, kept clean, and offered a great morning breakfast. While returning to the hotel one afternoon and strking up a conversation with a desk employee, we happened to mention what we were here to celebrate. Upon coming back later that evening we were surprised by an oversized martini glass of treats, a bottle of red wine and a card from the employee wishing us a Happy Anniversary. Very nice personal service at this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My wife and I rolled the dice and bid on a room on Priceline. We were not expecting much for the money we paid, but we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was much nicer than expected with modern upgraded décor, mini kitchenette, and upscale bathroom. Very comfortable. There was a pretty decent free breakfast provided, not the cheap continental breakfast with a couple of pastries and bagels either. They provided a nice breakfast buffet spread with different types of egg dishes every morning, various meats, pastries, coffee, etc…, very good. Several nights there was also a Manager’s Reception type event with a smaller free buffet and complimentary wine & beer. We took out dinner and drinks and went up to the roof lounge to watch the sun set over the skyline, very pretty. Easy walk from Penn Station and to Times Square area. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We visited NYC recently with another couple and reserved two King Studio Suites with Balconies on the 8th floor. We couldn't have been happier with the rooms - clean, comfortable and well-appointed. Although we were only there for one night, the kitchenettes came in handy - especially because we took full advantage of the balconies. Each balcony was enclosed, affording a measure of privacy. Due the unseasonably warm weather, there's was still grass on the balcony, along with a table and four chairs. It was perfect for hanging out, snacking and drinking. We could hear the hum of the city and enjoy fresh air in the room (which had a ceiling fan - a really nice touch). We liked the wood floors and not having to worry about the cleanliness of the carpeting. The beds were comfortable, and the linens smelled and felt nice and fresh. The kitchenettes had all the supplies/equipment we needed (including a bottle opener). The bathrooms were spotless. The showers had good water pressure and we appreciated the Neutrogena body care products. The sink/vanity area was a little small, but we managed. Our only other (minor) complaint concerned the elevators. There were only three, so we wound up waiting up to five minutes to go up or down, but that was to be expected in mid-December when the hotel was completely sold-out. Last but not least, every single staff member we interacted with was genuinely friendly and helpful. They actually seemed to enjoy working as a team to make their guests happy. I can't remember the last time I formed that impression at a Manhattan hotel...Consensus among our group was that we will absolutely stay at the Homewood Suites Midtown for all of our future trips to New York. We loved it and the location is great, regardless of where in the city our plans may take us. We'll just be sure to book early enough to get one of the rooms with a balcony (ahhhh, so great).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for the weekend. I was very impressed with the service. I was able to check in early (as a Diamond Member) and check out late on a busy Holiday weekend which was great. The hotel itself is in a great location (3 blocks from Penn Station). The public areas and rooms are in great shape. The rooms are a good size for an NYC hotel. Everything works and the extras are nice that you get with an efficiency. This would have been a slam dunk 5 star, come back any time kind of place except the breakfast was terrible. The eggs were standard fake eggs, fine and the sausage was also standard microwave stuff...fine. For me you can always rely on decent oatmeal but this oatmeal was was just wet warm oats. It was inedible. I was sorely disappointed and that is why they get a very good for me.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Was in town for an event at MSG. The location to the venue was within walking distance. Great location with access to lots! Even had the chance to shop and take in a little of the City. Facilities clean and the breakfast was a great surprise! Looking forward to extending the venue to our entire event staff next year!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hip, new, clean, well-amenitized hotel. The rooms are incredibly well designed and, while small, seem spacious. Little kitchenettes in each room add a nice touch. Lobby is beautiful. Breakfast could be better, but it's free.
user_name:
JSGMomof3
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: So glad I found this location. Very convenient location near times square and subway. The bus I took from DC dropped me off 3 block away. The hotel has a full kitchenette that we didn't use but would be great for a family with kids. Free breakfast until 1030am was a plus. Stayed on 21st floor room 2101. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is perfect for many New York City activities: walk to Times Sq, Madison Sq Gardens. Rockefeller Center, good restaurants and it is easy to get taxis to many other attractions. I highly recommend this excellent facility. the only drawback is that the breakfast eating area is somewhat crowded during the peak hours. The rooms are very comfortable and has many amenities. The hotel is a perfect place to return to when a family is out on the town seeing NYC at Christmas time or any other time of the year!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a great time in New York and the hotel was super good. They provided breakfast every morning the breakfast was good it did safe us money which was great. The hotel was near Time square. We recommend it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If you want no surprises this is your place to stay. Everything is as described by hotel, location very convenient for seeingcentral part of Manhattan. If looking for a hotel with "personality" go somewhere else. Free breakfast and evening meal, but quite industrial.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Me and my Family stayed here due to a last minute booking and we were Delightfully Surprised and Pleasantly Pleased by the Cleanliness and Convenience of this Hotel !!!! We were happy to see the refrigerator, microwave, stove top, with dishes and all necessities and conveniences of being at home!!!!!! I would HIGHLY recommend this Hotel and look forward to visiting in the near FUTURE!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here last week and found the hotel and staff to be great! Rooms were not massive, but suited our needs. They were very well kitted out with coffee maker, dish washer, fridge-freezer. Beds big, and comfy. Breakfast was included, which was great too! It was busy at times, but we always got seated. It was Eat as much as you wanted, and tea and coffee was available 24/7. Also available were the milk and choc chip cookies that were brought out to the foyer, happy days!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just arrived home after staying 7 nights in this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and could not do enough for you. Our room was of a very good size and as well as being very well maintained there we had an excellent choice of facilities in it. As well as breakfast provided in the cost, there was always coffee/tea/hot chocolate available which when strolling in from cold New York nights was most welcome. On top of this there was a good size gym and a business centre which came in handy when checking in for flights home. I have stayed in a few New York hotels and the location of this one was excellent, if you want to walk to attractions you could but there was also a metro station close by for getting to downtown attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very friendly and helpfull staff ,nice room, good location ,good standard of food .Enjoyed the evening snacks after a full day out sight seeing and visiting many of the fantastic eating places at lunch time ,we would defnetly stay here again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I booked this hotel through Hotel Tonight. Based on the very good reviews on TripAdvisor and from a colleague, I was excited for the stay. When I arrived at the hotel around 9:30 pm I was told -- after a rather long delay -- by the manager than a room was not available for me. Instead, he offered me a room at a hotel in Brookyln. BROOKLYN.I don't know how familiar you are with NYC, but Manhattan and Brooklyn are incredibly different. It's Like telling someone booked in San Diego that they've found room for them in Orange County.So, besides being "walked" to a different hotel, which is lousy enough, I was told it would be in Brooklyn. Obviously, this was not OK, since my meetings for the next two days were in Midtown ManhattanAfter arguing with the absurdly useless manager on duty -- who kept encouraging me to go to Brooklyn and seemed to think it was a totally logical and acceptable solution -- I canceled the reservation and booked elsewhere. Here's the best part: the hotel manager was willing to pay for my cab ride to the hotel in Brooklyn, but when I told him that I instead booked a hotel 10 blocks away, he wasn't willing to cough up a dime. I've only had great experiences at Hilton hotels up to this point. My experience with the management of this hotel was infuriating.My advice -- skip this hotel and go somewhere that treats guests with respect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Ideal location. Not as big a room as usual Homewood Suites, but probably big by New York standards. Everything you need within short distance. Restaurants, subway, Times Square and so on. Would return with pleasure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our family has stayed in various hotels in NYC and this was an excellent hotel, has an exceptional friendly staff, beautifully kept clean rooms and perfectly situated right in the heart of Manhattan close to many great restaurants and cool bars. Although we are part of the Hilton Honors program, this was a pleasant surprise for our first Homewood Suites by Hilton stay. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My friend and I arrived at 4pm, but had a short wait to confirm room was ready, although could have had a lower floor straight away (stayed on 19th floor )Room was very clean, with kingsize bed and fairly comfortable sofa bed. Also had most of what we needed, with fully equipped kitchen, plenty of storage and wooden coat hangers, shampoo and conditioner although no shower gel only soap, which I hadn't been prepared for. One downside was the extractor fan in the kitchen wouldn't turn off and was quite noisy at night time - a pair of ear plugs quickly remedied the situation! Location of hotel is perfect, with most of the places we wanted to visit within 20-30 minute walk away. A mention has to go to Nafeessa who is a credit to the hotel, and nothing is too much trouble!Its best to get to breakfast before 8 am, after which the area becomes extremely busy. The free tea and hot chocolate in the lobby were always much appreciated after a day of walking! Hopefully will be back same time next year!
user_name:
A M B
Alloa, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family stayed for Thanksgiving Holiday. First of all reception staff was very kind and nice. We arrived pretty early than usual check in time, but i didn't remember his name, he gave a empty clean room immediately. -very thankful! After long flight(13 hours)we were pretty tired, but he makes us smile. The room was small but here is NYC. It's enough to stay comfortable. The hot breakfast, light dinner were good. And perfect location to reach Time Square, Macy's and lots of hot spot!! Definitely I would recommend Homewood Suits to anyone!!
user_name:
hee eun k
Incheon, South Korea

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, newer property, clean and well maintained. We arrived about midday , couldn't check-in early but found front staff to be pleasent and inviting, even with a crowded lobby fill with constant flow of arrivals. After a walkabout I was able to check-in hassle free. Traveling with children, larger suites are frequently sought-after, and although my request for more than a king & pullout was met with "nothing available", we made due with out space. Albeit a bit cramp. Since it was a weekend stay, I was lucky to find on street parking directly across from hotel entrance at no charge. My vehicle sat the entire stay. The complimentary breakfest will satisfy most, as long as you're seeking typical quick eats. My stay was short and frustration free, HS is on my radar for possible stays in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were in NYC for Thanksgiving week, for vacation and to watch my daughter's college band march in the Macy's parade. We flew into EWR and took the train to Penn Station - an easy walk to the hotel. The location is perfect - just a couple blocks to Times Square. Our room was a King efficiency - which was small of course but had everything we needed. A king bed and a twin size pull out were perfect for my husband, my son and I. The rooms have hardwood floors and were very clean - excellent use of small space with lots of ledges and shelves to put your things on. The hot breakfast, drinks and light dinner in the evening were great! It was a busy holiday week but there still seemed to be enough room for everyone to sit down. The thing that surprised me the most was the fact that they had a GREAT turkey dinner on Thanksgiving! We didn't know what they were serving and sat down to have a glass of wine while we were figuring out where we wanted to go. Then as people got in line for the food, we realized they were serving, turkey, mashed potatoes, vegetables, salad, rolls - the works! So instead of spending big bucks on Thanksgiving dinner in NYC we had a free dinner at the hotel and then went to a Broadway show! We were thrilled how it all worked out! We highly recommend this hotel and hope to be back again soon!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfectly situated hotel just 10 minutes walk from Time Square. Modern rooms include microwave and fridge/freezer. Nearest subway is also only 3 blocks away and Macy's is within walking distance. Although the hotel doesn't have a bar they offer an evening buffet and complimentary wine and beer (Mon to Thur). Breakfast varies every day and the hot buffet may not be to everyone's taste but plenty of toast, cereal etc available as well. There is also a superb deli on West 37th Street called Brooklyn Fare which sells a massive range and the most gorgeous wraps and cakes. When I'm next in New York will definitely be back to the Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites is the only place to stay if you want to have a brand new, clean and spacious place to stay in Midtown Manhattan. It is like no other place. The staff is amazing and treats you with personalized service Iike the worlds priciest hotels. Everyone is great. Would Iike to single out Kelvin who has always gone out of his way to assure our family has the best room for our needs, even going so far as to upgrade us to a 1 Br suite last week. Great service, clean and large suites with all new and beautiful rooms not to mention the free breakfast everyday and dinners weeknights makes for an unforgettable stay.Keep up the amazing service and smart people will keep choosing HomewoodAlly

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was very clean. Chosen for its location, 4 blocks from MSG. We were extremely happy with the room, people and hotel overall. Beautiful 22nd floor deck to watch the bustling city below. Had to go down a floor for ice, but that's fine, less chance for noise on our floor, 18. Full kitchen would have been nice if stayed longer. Refrigerator, microwave, sink and dish washer. They had dishes in cabinets for use. A small couch folded out to twin bed. The hotel was quiet, didn't hear other guests or any other noise from the street below. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be close to mid town and don't want to break the bank. Parking was just a few feet from front door. 50 for overnight parking. Great room for a decent price in the heart of the city

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staying here for 2 nights was the best decision ever, we did not want to leave, very central in the city, excellent rooms and amenities. Although very pricey, you defineatly get your money's worth with the standard of the rooms and the overall hotel. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent 2 weeks visiting and felt comfortable every minute. Hotel is located between penn station and Times Square subways and this is the most convenient way to get from one place to another. You will learn subways quickly and you will WALK. Breakfast in hotel was great. Had a late breakfast most days, did tourist stuff and then an early dinner before shows. Hotel is 5 minute walk to Macy's and or Madison square Garden and 10 minutes or so the other way to Times Square. The comp. dinner during the week nights we were not running around the city was a great bonus. Staff were friendly and hotel and rooms were spotless

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: On arrival we were welcomed by friendly and helpful staff.Our double suite was spacious and clean and close to the lifts.Breakfast had a good choice, enough to set you up for the day, once again cheerful staff, and we had a chat with Devon who was very informative,and a young employee, who welcomed me one morning, and even knew my name.nice touchThe evening lite meals with drinks was another bonus, we took advantage on three of our nights,.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After searching fpr several hotels from the Hilton Family, I decided to stay here for a couple of nights. Just getting to the lobby was a good experience. It is a clean, newer, modern place. The rooms display the same message with a modern touch and cleanliness. Also the place was surprisingly quiet for sleep considering it is in the Time Square neighborhood. Would stay again for sure. The only complaint that I have is that when I checked out I was going to take a yellow cab service and the fron desk person told methat I could use the Continental Radio Dispatch service taxi. I was told was a flat rate of $65 that included everything (Tax, Tolls and Tip). To my surprise the Cab driver requested me to pay $8.00 for Tolls because it was not included and that the hotel was wrong. This is an FYI just in case you want to use that service so you understand all of the charges. It turned out to be $73 to JFK.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My wife and I stayed for a week at this hotel in October 2015. We found the staff to be exceptional, especially on the morning of our departure. We had booked SuperShuttle to take us back to JFK airport, but the shuttle was running over an hour late and we were in jeopardy of missing our flight. One of the bellmen (I believe his name is Junior) noticed we had been in the lobby for a long time. He asked if we needed assistance and we explained our situation. He immediately picked up a phone, spoke to someone for a few minutes, and came back and asked us to step outside with our luggage. Within a minute or so of stepping outside, a car pulled up outside the hotel, we got in, and we were on our way to the airport. Junior knew exactly how to solve our problem and we were able to make out flight. We cannot praise him enough for saving our day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for three nights based on the good reviews and close proximity to Pennsylvania station.Nice spacious rooms, comfy beds and free WiFi.Free breakfast was ok although wasn't enough choice for me personally I could still have filled up on it daily with a variety of cereals fresh fruit and a few hot selections.Times square and empire state building well within walking distance as well as a variety of food establishments.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is my second stay here and haven't found anything to not like. The hotel lobby is very modern with a large area for dining as they serve a good breakfast every morning and dinners with free wine and beer Monday's-Thursday's. A really nice touch! There is a lovely outside courtyard too in nicer weather. The rooms are also modern style and are just like tiny house living. All the comforts of a studio apartment complete with full kitchen. Good views are somewhat hard to find here though as it's pretty landlocked by other buildings. The location is extremely convenient to many things and is a very easy walk from Penn Station. This is one of my favorites. Look forward to returning!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a quick business trip for me but the hotel was amazing. The location is very convenient and although the room sizes were not quite as large as I hoped, they were decent by NYC standards. It had all the facilities I needed and I left with a very positive feeling about the place. I will be looking to come back next year and hopefully stay a bit longer.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have a new go to place when I visit NYC. I decided to take a quick trip to NYC before starting a new job and wanted to find a centrally located hotel in order to cover a lot of ground in a few days and this hotel fit the bill. Its a couple of blocks away from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden in one direction and a few more blocks away from Times Square in the other direction. Restaurants, bars, liquor stores and places to shop are nearby and plentiful. The hotel and the room size in itself is a very nice surprise for NYC. I had a King studio with kitchenette on the 10th Floor that was very clean, the bed was comfortable and I was able to get a good night rest after running around the city all day. The free breakfast provided a nice start to the day and way to save a few dollars. A nice touch was the hotel has a roof top chill out area but no one was out there on my visit because it was a little windy and chilly but in nice weather would be a great place to unwind.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great staff very helpful with information. Large room for NYC, with great utilization of space. Exceptionally clean and well stocked. The hotel offers a great breakfast as well as kitchen and supplies for your room. The location is central and makes walking to places a breeze! Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location. Very modern rooms and lobby. Pleasant and helpful staff. Modest room size, nice refrigerator, sink, stove and microwave. Hidden gem is free dinner, wine, beer Monday thru Thursday and free breakfast every day. We had a high floor, no view, and away from the elevators which was very quiet. Would certainly go back

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very large, comfortable and clean room with good self catering facilities. Breakfast was included in the price and was surprisingly good and varied. An evening meal is also included Mon - Thurs. Hot drinks are freely available in the hotel lobby at all times. Staff were friendly, helpful and professional. The hotel is situated within 5-10 minute walk of Macys and Empire State Building and Time Square. Walking to Central Park takes a little longer but there is plenty to see on the way. All in all it was excellent value for money and we would certainly stay here again

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'm happy with this hotel. Front desk were professional and courteous. It's pretty expensive but their complimentary amenities makes it worthwhile. Hotel itself is very clean and is close to a subway station and Times Square. Room is small but is standard in most New York hotel rooms. I loved the free wi-fi ( join their free Hilton membership), the fridge, small stove ( didn't use since we were on a food trip), complimentary breakfast (everyday), evening reception and free dinner ( mon- Thurs). We even took advantage of the free coffee/tea and cocoa every night. I will definitely come back here next time we visit New York again. Ideal for families.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This nicely appointed hotel is in a great location in Manhattan and offers nice perks and amenities such as fresh coffee in the lobby - 24/7 seemingly, managers reception Mon. - Thurs., breakfast daily and a very friendly and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 7 nights. A very nice hotel, clean, modern and nice staff. The brakfast was good with different choices. Between 5-7 pm the hotel served drinks and food - very nice and generous! There were also a business center where you can use a computer, a possibility to wash clothes and also a gym. I did not try these but it looked very nice. On the roof a very nice terrace.I will recommend this hotel, nice and good situated.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Friendly, clean, great central location, well designed decent sized rooms, a good free breakfast, and reasonable (for NYC). It's not a fancy high end hotel but that's a waste of money from my standpoint. Highly recommend for anyone looking for for a comfortable and reasonable home base for a trip to the big city!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We choose the Homewood Suites in Midtown based on the newness of the property as well as the previous reviews here on TripAdvisor.Firstly, we were very pleased with the room experience itself, as the accommodations are generously sized for NYC standards and offer all of the comforts of a 4 star full service hotel. While we enjoyed the room and hotel in general, pay close attention to the location and make certain it suits your needs/purpose for the trip, more to come later in the review on location.Rooms:The entry level room type (Efficiency Studio) rooms are standard in size and include a kitchenette, pillowtop mattress, modern bathroom with stand up glass shower stall and hard wood (faux) surface flooring. We were upgraded to a city view Studio room types on a higher floor which afforded a bit more space than the Efficiency Studio along with high ceilings and a limited city view. This room types is particularly nice for couples as it's generously sized and much larger than most NYC hotel rooms. The beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed having a stand up glass shower. The room included a kitchenette, fully stocked with dishes. There aren't many room per floor, however the elevators were slow during peak times.The Experience:Service was pleasant throughout the property, and staff were always available to help. I personally like smaller hotels of this genre in NYC as they are easy to get in/out of, especially compared to the hotel giants you'll find in Times Square.The Location:This neighborhood adjacent to Penn. Station is transitional. Yes, it's convenient to Times Square, Hell's Kitchen and MSG/Penn. Station, however I felt like the neighborhood was a bit "sketchy" at times. I didn't necessarily feel unsafe, but for Manhattan standards this area was dirty and full of interesting characters to say the least. That said, it was centrally located and easy to get from Newark airport as it was close to the tunnel.All in all, Homewood Suites Midtown offered a solid hotel experience in the middle of Manhattan. The hotel itself was impressive for a limited service property and had all the comforts you would anticipate at a four star property. Inclusions such as popcorn in the room, morning breakfast service and mid week evening wine / appetizers make it a great value. I would choose this property at the right price.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I came to New York from Australia to run the marathon and booked this hotel more than six months in advance. When I booked I requested a quiet room with a crib. I was very unimpressed with the attitude of reception staff at check in. We arrived at 9am after travelling for 30+ hours from Australia with our one-year-old daughter and were told our room was not ready. This was understandable, however the clerk then told me the room would not be available until 4pm, despite my printed confirmation stating that check-in time was 3pm. When I pointed this out, she grudgingly agreed to honour this and ensure the room would be ready by 3pm. We were not offered the use of any hotel facilities to freshen up or change our daughter, and when I asked where we could do this we were directed to a basement restroom that did not even have a changing table, so I was forced to change her on the floor. The whole attitude was dismissive and unhelpful. We left the hotel for a few hours, returning around 1pm because we were simply too exhausted to do anything but sit and wait. Upon asking again whether our room was ready, a different clerk rudely informed me it wouldn't be available until 4pm - not 3pm as had been assured upon our arrival. When I asked whether there was anything we could do to expedite the process, even offering to pay an early check-in fee, I was coldly informed that the hotel uses an external housekeeping company and it was not possible to instruct them to prioritise the preparation of one room over another. I find this extremely hard to believe (after all, one staff member had already demonstrated that it was possible to have the room ready by 3pm instead of 4pm) and if it is indeed true I would advise them to use a different company! I told the clerk that we would remain in the lobby until check-in, and to please let me know as soon as the room was available. An hour later, my husband asked again whether the room was ready and was told, 'Oh yeah, it's been ready for a while, we thought you'd left.' This was despite remaining in full view of the reception desk the entire time.Why does the hotel bother to ask for an estimated time of arrival upon booking if not to prioritise the preparation of rooms for guests who will be arriving early? I understand that check-in times are set for a reason, however the dismissive and downright rude attitude of the staff towards a clearly exhausted family with a distressed young child was really appalling. When we finally got to our room, it was on the second floor at the front of the building, which was unbearably noisy. Having booked more than six months in advance and specifically requested a quiet suite, this was such a disappointment. There was also no crib, despite having requested one at the time of booking, so we had to call housekeeping and ask for one to be sent up.We were also forced to leave a day early after our airline rescheduled our departing flight. When my husband went to the reception desk the night before to make sure there would be someone on hand to check us out at 6am, the clerk snapped at him, 'What are you asking me?'While the accommodation itself was very nice, the attitude of staff and indifferent service were not acceptable and I would not stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Right off the highway. People in York are nice but they were exceptionally nice here. The night I stayed they had home-made chicken Alfredo for the evening happy hour. Plenty of good food and wine. I'll be staying here each time I have to be in York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Had a nearly perfect stay at this property 11/5-11/7. Check in was quick and courteous. The room was decent size for NYC and included a full efficiency kitchen with everything you would need to prepare and serve food they even include microwave popcorn. The bed and bedding were excellent. The HD TV had all HD tv signals. The wifi had good speed. The buffet breakfast was very well done. The buffet dinner including free wine and beer was a nice added benefit. 24 hot drinks in the lobby. The only negatives would be the shower is on the small size but still ok. I had called the hotel to tell them I was going to be arriving 1am and I would prefer a very high floor. ( I just prefer to be far from the street noise) The girl I spoke to said she would do that for me and never did. But the room I had was in the back and was very quiet so it was fine. I forgot that I could have reserved the room I wanted with on line check in with the Honors APP and I will do that next time. The hotel is 3 blocks from Penn Station and 3 blocks from the Port Authority bus terminal. Could not ask for a better location. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent location, spacious clean room. Helpful concierge and I could get around Manhattan with ease. Complimentary drinks each evening which I didn't have time for but was amazed there was also complimentary dinners five days a week. Did I mention Lenny?
user_name:
Jeff L
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is my 10th time in this hotel and I give it a 10/10 absolutely perfect. From smooth checkin and a lobby with fresh hot drinks to the dinners weeknights this hotel is home while you are away. I must give a shout out to Nafeesa at the front desk who makes us feel like we are regulars at the Ritz and to all the other wonderful staff!! Not to mention the rooms with kitchens are new clean and amazing space to work or live in while in NYC. Of course the great deck and delicious free breakfast only adds to the draw of the Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I contacted Hilton reservations to reserve a "Clean Air" room after having an allergic reaction to the fragrance used by a hotel that I was staying at for a conference in New York City. The only Hilton hotel in the City with a "Clean Air" room available was the Homewood Suites by Hilton on 37th between 8th and 9th. I guaranteed the reservation and arrived at 10 am to pre-check in and check my bags. At that time, the front desk confirmed the "Clean Air" room. I told them I'd be checking in around 10pm. When I arrived at 10pm, I checked in and went to my room only to discover that it was fragranced and not a clean air room. Figuring it was a mistake, I called the front desk to ask if they could move me. I was told that the hotel was 98% occupied and there was nothing they could do. I checked out and had to find another hotel with a hypo allergenic room in another area of town which I checked into around 11pm. Needless to say, I was exhausted and late for my conference the next morning. No thanks to the Hilton Homewood Suites!
user_name:
Margaret Mccue G
Atlanta, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I am a longtime Hilton customer but have never stayed in a Homewood Suites. I now seek them out with regularity. This property is fabulous. Modern, contemporary feel but warm touches like ceiling fans and flowers. Great location, wonderful rooftop sitting area (with music) and it's QUIET! Highly recommended!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed last Autumn after travelling across the US we splashed out on a somewhere with a little luxury for New York - but were disappointed with our stay.The hotel itself was clean, but pretty soulless, not the usually friendly, welcoming atmosphere of a Hilton.We were placed at the back of the hotel looking out onto the wall of another building, although this was not a major problem. The room was small, not tiny, but had a very boxy feel with the laminate flooring. The bed was comfy, but the kitchen not really realistic for use, we didn't use it at all during the stay.The big issue we had however was the sound of the fridge, which every 30mins would click on and make an almighty drone so loud that it woke us up all through the night. I told hotel staff about this as soon as I heard the first time on arrival, they said they would send a maintenance guy to have a look - this never happened, or certainly not while we were in (which we were that night). The next evening I flagged the problem again with staff who told me quite rudely that I was simply not used to the sound of a fridge (you'll see from my reviews I stay in apartment hotels quite regularly, so am quite used to the associated noise). In the end we pushed two towels above the freezer unit which seemed to help the rattling and drone. I was surprised we were not better looked after, taken seriously or offered a room change, having spent over $1000 on our stay.Wouldn't recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is walking distance to Convention Center, Broadway, Times Square, Central Park, and Etc. The Complementary Breakfast was always unique and good. Dinners at night were also great. Then having a kitchenette was the cherry on top.
user_name:
William L H
Fredericksburgt, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wow - what an amazing time we had here. Spacious room, very clean and great housekeeping every day, helpful staff, free tea and coffee in reception 24 hours, free breakfast every day, free supper Mon-Thurs, great rooftop terrace where you can just see the Empire State and the New Yorker building, a gym and even a guest laundry room. Easy walk to Empire State, Times Square and the subway at 34 Penn Street for a train anywhere else. Would definitely recommend for families or anyone travelling to NYC. We'll be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Title pretty much sums it up. This is a small budget hotel in a very busy bustling neighborhood. It is close to Times Square and Madison Square Garden. One of the noisiest locations in NYC. But it's very quiet. Rooms are large for this type of hotel and budget category. Very clean. No rugs = no bugs (I hope). Bathrooms were new and modern. Rooms included a sink and microwave and a fridge as a bonus. Check in and out was fast and efficient. Breakfast included. A great buy - not for a honeymoon but perfect for a night or two.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for two nights in October and I can't say enough how wonderful this hotel is. The staff is very cordial they answered all our questions about our daily schedule and made suggestions.The room was spacious and had everything necessary including a refrigerator the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very clean.The breakfast buffet had all the healthy and elegant items. The 5-7 pm dinner was the unexpected surprise. No other hotel in New York treated us better. We will definitely recommend this place to our friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just west of Eighth Ave., this property is relatively new, and the bedding/room amenities reflect the newness. Very well appointed mini-suite with a comfortable bed. Lobby area always seemed to be crowded, mostly due to the limited floor space. However, breakfast was good variety and a lot of seating. This is our second stay here and has become our hotel of choice when visiting NYC. Bring your exercise clothes because the workout area is immense and well-appointed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a great trip to NY and loved our stay at this hotel. Staff were all helpful and breakfast was great (although it got very crowded in the too-small dining area). Just 5 mins walk to Empire State and also Times Square, the hotel is well positioned but we did not find it to be noisy at all. We were there with our children aged 11 and 12 and would definitely use this hotel again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a very nice hotel, very clean room with everything you need. You are in the middle of it all yet back off enough so you don't hear all the noise. The coffee and tea in the lobby is great. Breakfast is good and we didn't find it was too busy. Very helpful and polite staff. We arrived early and were able to check in which was a plus.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was nestled in between businesses, stores and residental areas convenient to everything and a short walk to Time Square. Our room was on the 16th floor it was very quit ahhhh, the room was on the residential and business side, we could actually see inside the loft apartments . We could see the families living there we had to have our window shade closed majority of the time, it actually wasn't an issue cause we where out and about all the time until late night. Our room was a good size and not cramped very nice it had everything we needed. The hotel was very accommodating, the staff was excellent and they had buffet breakfast and dinner included in your stay, hot coffee, hot chocolate, tea and bottle was available 24/7. The patio decks on roof top and ground floor was enjoyable, the elevators were small but we never had any problems with them. Oh, if you have any kind of special request birthday, ect., they will be happy to accommodate, like for my birthday my room was decorated with balloons had two different flavored birthday cakes with a birthday card it was great I'm sure there was a charge for this I'm not sure cause it was there for my birthday. I had a wonderful, birthday celebration in New York and the hotel made it even nicer. This hotel is worth the stay if you head to New York. Have a wonderful stay. Robyn :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I took a 5 day trip to NYC and had Hilton Honor points to use. We chose this hotel as it was pretty new and we like suites for the extra room. We arrived at the hotel at 1 pm and our room wasn't ready yet. We decided to take a room right next to the elevator which was ready(I usually request to be as far away from the elevator as possible as I am a light sleeper). I never heard the elevator one time or any voices or street traffic. The large room had wood floors and a great kitchen for snack/drinks and it was so quiet. The bathroom was nice-big shower with glass tile, sink area was a little tight. We had breakfast every morning which was fine. We were pleased to find out they served dinner and beer/wine Mon-Thurs nights also. We had dinner there two nights instead of trying to blindly find a restaurant and make it to our play on time. There is a terrace on the 22nd floor so we took our wine up there and looked over the city at night. Front desk was friendly, polite and helpful. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Room was very modern and clean. It was smallish but that's to be expected in Manhattan. Breakfast was very good, but you would be wise to go early, it gets very busy. Hotel is within walking distance to Times Square but away from all of the noise of Times Square. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my fourth stay at the hotel, and I have been very satisfied each time. The front desk staff, particularly Leslie, were extremely friendly and helpful. The staff at the concierge desk were equally friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is great to transportation throughout the city, and to/from JFK. I definitely plan to stay during my next trip to NYC, and would recommend it to my friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel in the Empire State Building/Madison Square Garden area and they are doing a great job. Even the basic rooms are very spacious. I arrived close to check in time at 4pm. The lobby was a bit of a madhouse. I give the hotel credit for having 4 people checking in customers. I've been in similar situations with just 1 or 2 people staffed at that time and I appreciated the extra people working at this busy time. Homewood Suites - do not change this. You are one of the few hotels smart enough to have extra staff at check in and it is a big difference. The lobby is not very big, and there were a few groups waiting for their rooms and an enormous amount of luggage. Unfortunately, there are not enough elevators to service busy periods and I did wait in line in the lobby a few times for an elevator, and also had to skip a few elevator cars trying to leave my room. I have seen worse situations in other NYC hotels, but it was still a bit annoying. LI had a normal room with king bed. It is large by NYC standards. I liked the wood floors instead of hotel carpet. My impression is that it is easier to keep clean. My room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. There was a small couch and a desk area as well. The kitchen was clean and what you would expect in an efficiency hotel situation. In my room, the refrigerator was very close to the bed and the compressor was pretty loud and woke me up a few times.The breakfast was pretty standard and staffed by more than one person, which was nice. The space was kept clean and the food was restocked as needed. However, the space is not nearly big enough to handle the nearly 300 rooms at this hotel, but the staff has done a great job organizing the space to accommodate as many people as possible. It is actually quite impressive how many people they did fit, but do not plan on finding seats right away at busy times. This is a good example of something the hotel can't really change (amount of first floor space) but clear evidence of a lot of thought being put into how to make the best of the situation.Overall, this is a great hotel if you want to be in this area. It is convenient for tourism, although the area directly around the hotel is not the most exciting or my favorite in NYC. I have to stay in this neighborhood fairly frequently and this is my new favorite hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel better than I expected. Hotel was busy especially at free breakfast but environment seemed organized. Studio room with King size bed was larger than expected, very comfortable. Love the fridge freezer in the room. Staff were attentive, friendly, and helpful. Only negative would be the price, huge fluctuations In price, I paid $360 and (saw too late) same room for same days listed $189 on a discount website. That kind of stings! Would stay here again if the price was right, wouldn't pay $360 again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Had a wonderful stay at the Homewood Suites. Staff was very friendly. Melissa and her team treated us very well, and surprised us with a gift for our anniversary. The hotel is close to everything, the Highline, Madison Square Garden, Times Square & Macys! Rooms was new, clean and quiet. Parking convienent. Would stay here again! Loved it!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is very good, close to nearly all attractions. The staff was very helpful. Our suite was good and clean. There was no noise from streets. The service was so great. I can really recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel close to everything you need. Tried to check in at 3.10pm to be told that the room wasn't ready, which was fine.I asked if I could have the wifi code to which I was told "No"! This after I had provided passport and credit card I wasn't allowed internet until 4pm ... Get real .. This is 2015!!I asked for a code and I was told they had all been given out for the day and I didn't have a room numberI asked to see a manager who offered me to go to the business centre but I needed to access through my phone and now a computerWhen we did get in the room we had been given an apology card and a jar of cheddar popcorn ... Really ?Rooms were clean but bathroom needed more shelving for toiletries and the plumbing sounded like NY of the 1970'sThis review would have been better if my problem has been solved without the lying!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Best Budget Hotel in Times Squarethe value for the money is the best, the location of the hotel is great (3 blocks from times square) the rooms are clean and nice for this price.monday-friday there is a happy hour - buffet and free beer\winethe elvatoras are bad and the breakfast is not good also

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for a week and found the Suites perfect for our needs. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. The location is good for Times Square (10 min walk), 5th Ave (10 min walk) and Central Park (15 min walk). The subway is two blocks away. The Suites are clean and well maintained. The rooms are big, the shower is huge and the little kitchen perfect for quick snacks. The Suites offer complimentary breakfast and evening meals - the choice of food was good and the breakfast staff were always bright and cheerful. There is also outside space on the roof with views over the city. Great place for families with young children. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Cannot say enough about this hotel. A great location. Close to Times Square and Herald Square but close to 9th avenue as well and a more neighborhood feel. Bring good walking shoes and *don't* bring a car. Manhattan is for walking, not for driving.
user_name:
Phillip C
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at Homewood Suites in September 2015 and this past weekend 10/17/15 - 10/18/15. We have selected them to be home away from home. They have excellent front desk service and Junior whom help you with anything. He speaks three different languages and as humble as can be. In the room we select has a queen bed and sofa bed. The room and bath is clean. I found the bed very comfortable. This hotel is not far from the Bolt bus or Mega Bus departure because we can never catch a cab back to the bus area.
user_name:
Cynthia Z
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel staff was very friendly and took care of me immediately. Hotel is only a couples blocks from all the action NYC has to offer. The rooms are extreme small compared to what I am use to. Complimentary breakfast is just ok food could have been cooked a little longer. What I didn't like was that they have a pet fee that they then charged tax on. I have never had that happen before and I only noticed it when they charged my card no one even told me.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was within walking distance of Penn Station and was very convenient. We took the train in from Albany and had a family reunion at a restaurant near Times Square. Our stay was only two nights but the features within the suite would have made it comfortable if it were more. Everything about the hotel was top shelf!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The customer service at this property should be called "customer no service". They did the bare minimun to meet any of our needs. We got a room to sleep in that was clean, but that's all I can say. I realize the hotel rooms in New York are typically small, but when they have a kitchenette and a sleeper sofa, I expect a little more space. The sofa bed was the size of a love seat (twin bed) and we didn't have room to put 3 suitcases out for use. You pay extra for a king bed and the third person in the room, but there weren't towels or toiletries for three and no space for 3 people's luggage. They offer "full breakfast" included in the price, but it really was just a continental breakfast because none of the proteins offered were edible. I am not sure what the "eggs" or sausage were made of because it wasn't eggs or sausage. Those items were just gross!The location is closer to Macy's than Times Square but still not too far from the center of activities. I will never stay here again or would never recommend it to a friend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel for two nights while in New York City. The hotel was in a great location and there was a parking garage we were able to park our car at across the street. The breakfast was great, with a wide variety of a selection of good. The staff was very friendly and helpful and went above and beyond what we asked of them if any issue arise. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel again!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Returned from a overnight stay at this hotel . Very happy with my stay . Rooms clean, new and comfotable. I found. my room next to the elevator very quite. Luggage service great. Breakfast was good. Coffee station in lobby 24 hrs. comfortable bedding and pillows Hotel location was perfect for this trip. Would return for future stays.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked early due to great rates. The hotel exceeded expectations. Have stayed at Hilton Homewood Suites in other parts of the country & always had great experiences, but when in New York you expect hotel rooms to be on a smaller scale. Not this hotel. The room was spacious for three and clean. The breakfast and Managers evening supper were great and the location can't be beat!! Staff was very helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff here are phenomenal!! They make this place what it is! The rooms are small (but it is NYC), but pretty clean & newer appliances in kitchenette & decent shower & toilet in bathroom but sink needs to be bigger counter. I'm pretty sure most women would agree they prefer a sink with a decent sized counter to get ready & this one is quite tiny! I would've given it 5 stars except the food served for breakfast & dinner were just mediocre (granted its chain hotel free food but other Homewood Suites have much better).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: So... It's like a home from home apparently. Which I suppose it is; if you sleep within arms length from a full blown fridge-freezer. The rooms are, shall we say, compact...then again it is New York and I'm not a millionaire. Compared to other hotels within similar budgets Homewood does have tight room space. Breakfast was included - as long as you are not on a super tight budget I really wouldn't bother! Nowhere near enough seats for the hotel occupancy which led to people sitting in the breakfast room, reception, the lobby, the lifts and presumably their rooms as well. The food was not worth fighting through the stampede of flooding tourists - no proper queuing etiquette!! There is a "suite" (see what they did there?) shop located at the front desk. It's a bit like a high end designer boutique, there's no prices so assume you can't afford it. A stash of munchies (1 nights worth) cost us the best part of $50 in room charges. 7/11 located round the corner. The staff were lovely and the rooms were spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable and the shower had a good bit of force behind it as well. The walls between rooms are relatively thin but as long as your neighbours aren't in the middle of a domestic it's not drastic. Overall, the hotel just didn't do it for us. Also, there isn't a bar?! It seemed to be a massive hit for families with young children. I think it's more suited for the family market.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We all think of New York as being great on service and I have to say that was my view in previous years. Now, however, Homewood Suites was the only place I went to that delivered!It was wonderfully located for most things and having the free buffet get together from 5pm meant that we could easily and quickly get sufficient food and go to the opera or theatre without wasting time. As visiting the Met for the start of the 2015/16 season was the purpose of the trip, staying at Homewood Suits was perfect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel. Clean, nice rooms. I stayed here eith my 2 adult sons. Breakfast was good. The dining area was busy,but the hotel was very full. Centrally located. We walked or took the subway. Very helpful staff. Garage for our car was about 100 feet up on the right. Good stay, would stay there again. Booked using Trivago and got a good rate.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great Place to stay. Big Room. Impecable service. From the front desk to housekeeping. An attentive staff makes you really feel at home. No complaints at all.Breakfast very nice and the happy hour is a differential. I´ll certainly stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for two nights at this Homewood Suites; one night we used Hilton Honor points. We loved the studio room style though the bathroom was small though this is understandable. We were amazed at how thorough the housekeeping was. We will definitely stay here again if we are in NY. Loved the evening reception and breakfast as well.
user_name:
Marci A
Palatine, Illinois, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Taxi tries to pull up in front of the hotel entrance and there's literally nowhere to stop due to the construction crews. We couldn't get to the entrance without ducking under tape and over the ripped up street. No concierge or staff to help out, I was told they don't stand out front when it's raining (it was barely drizzle). Things got better once we got our room, it was cozy, quiet and clean, The breakfasts and just ok, as is the free coffee in the lobby, There's a Dunkin down the block if you need one. Best part is the evening social with free drinks. And the lobby is nice enough to make you want to hang out. The proximity to other places is also good, we walked to the MoMa and Grand Central station and it didn't take long. The staff insensitivity to the construction aside, it's still a very nice hotel, in a good location and the price is reasonable for what we got.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Lovely big room, huge bed, staff were helpful and polite and made our seven day stay very welcoming. Breakfast was nice if a bit hectic and the added bonus of free dinner, beer and wine on four days a week if you want it. Only downside was fridge/freezer was very noisy of a night and the wait for the lifts at breakfast time. But overall excellent.
