hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: So my wife and i decided to take a short 5 day trip to NYC with our 18 month old daughter. She is a bit of a picky eater so a kitchenette was a must. We did a lot a research on hotels and this Homewood Suites kept coming up. We were very pleased with the room and the breakfast options. (i would not recommend the 'Dinner' as anything more than a snack). There was coffee available all the time and the rooms were very clean. The hotel is just a few short blocks from Penn Station and Time Square. We took the Metro everywhere and i would recommend getting a Metro card because it is an affordable way to see NYC. This was our first time in NYC and we would definitely come back. This hotel is a great options and i would recommend to people who need a kitchen or just want to be just a few blocks from the action of New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood suites was a steal! I went to a weekend event at MSG (3 blocks away) and needed a hotel. Homewood suites was the cheapest by a good amount and yet was significantly better than the competition. The room was a very good size and having the kitchenette was a big added benefit. There was noise due to construction next door but I can fault the hotel for that. Overall I can't think of a single negative.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We booked a service apartment here thinking that it would be pretty standard, however the space is quite reasonable and the courtyard was a fantastic addition. The kitchen space was great, and just the right size. Rooms were always very clean. Location is fantastic, and in walking distance to most attractions.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed in a suite for a 5 night NYC trip. the room is wide enough (for a NY hotel), new and clean. The staff is friendly and available to help you with any issues you might have. The position is really good, 10 minutes walk from Times Square and 5 minutes from Penn Station Subway. There were only two notable issues during our stay. First of all the fridge was so noisy that one night I had to unplug it. Second issue: our room had a poor design of air conditioning fan, in short the air was blown straight to our faces and that was really annoying. Despite these two downsides our stay has been really pleasant and the position of the hotel was perfect for visiting Manhattan

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel offers good accommodation in a quiet but brilliant location. Only a few streets away from Times Square and Empire State Building, all within walking distance. Rooms a great size and super clean. Although breakfast is busy and there is a limited seated area you don't have to wait too long for a table. The staff are friendly and helpful especially Naseesa who was so pleasant and keen to make our holiday a special celebration
user_name:
Shirley B
Annalong, County Down, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel has a great location! Just few minutes away from time square and penn station. I was there on a work trip and had to move around very much but i find the location was ideal. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The service was good but not amazing. The concierge desk was helpful. If you want to have a relaxing breakfast make sure you go early as it gets very crowded and is very difficult to find a place to seat, I had to even ask someone if I could seat at the table. I didnt had dinner since most of the dished had glunten and I am allergic to wheat. I would definetely stay again at this hotel.
user_name:
Maria Jose M
Guanacaste, Costa Rica

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel offered everything we could ask for - comfortable, modern room with kitchen, coin operated laundry facility, fast wi-fi and an excellent breakfast. An added bonus was a light supper 4 nights a week with wine included. A range of coffee, tea and hot chocolate was available 24/7. Whilst the position of the hotel was fairly convenient to the subway I found the area lacked good quality restaurant options. I would certainly recommend this hotel for its amenities but I have one WARNING! Under no circumstances use the hotel's limousine service. I did and ended up stranded with my granddaughter on the free way to the airport as the driver was arrested for not having a drivers licence. Scary!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a wonderful 3 star hotel – great location close to Times Square, lots of sites, and subway. It had modern decorated rooms and a modern lobby – breakfast is included, and free wine and beer with some food options Monday to Thursday - great opportunity to meet others staying at the hotel.Rooms were clean, bed very comfortable, great size washroom. We had the suite and loved the space it provided. We were on the second floor, so if the elevator was busy, it was easy to use the stairs. On the downside, our room faced 37th and the noise from roadwork was crazy at times...The hotel has a quiet patio out back and also a rooftop terrace on the 22nd floor to sit out and take in the views of the city. Overall, this is a great hotel to stay in when visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel recently. The hotel is in a perfect location as it is easy to get around to all the well known tourist locations. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly , doing their very best to make you feel comfortable. The food was lovely and the free meal Monday-Thursday was a bonus.the room was very clean and modern with a great shower and a comfy bed. The roof top terrace was lovely especially after a busy day with a glass of wine. The only thing the hotel needed was a bar at the roof top terrace. We will definitely be back in the next few years!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel in the middle of it all. Suites are spacious, clean and feel very private. I was only there for one night, but would recommend this hotel for extended stays. Staff was friendly and I very much enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We chose this hotel after reading a lot of good reviews. We arrived around 10AM for check-in after driving from Washington DC. The staff was extremely friendly. We made the booking using third party website but there were no issues at check-in. However, the staff could not accommodate us for early check-in (we were kind of ready for it). Though, he offered us breakfast for that day even at 10:15AM. We were also offered to store our luggage till check-in time.Our room was ready when we came for check-in around 5PM. The room was nice, well-kept and clean. Bed was quite comfortable. However, the bed sheet was torn from a lot of places. We didn't housekeeping to change it as we didn't stay in the room during the day. The room offered a street view but there was nothing like a good view. Everything (coffee/sugar/MW pop corns/etc.) was well stocked up. There's a microwave, dishwasher and lot of utensils being an extended stay hotel. However, we never used any of these.Bathroom was small but nice. It had a standing shower area and Neutrogena brand toiletries. The only thing we didn't like was the door separating the shower area and the rest of the bathroom as the door didn't close properly which lead to water flowing outside. Housekeeping staff did a good job in cleaning the room.Breakfast was decent enough and offered good variety of food. Timings ranged from 6:30 in the morning to 10:30AM. Coffee/chocolate drinks were offered 24/7.We also had a chance to attend evening reception one day. It was far below our expectations. There were some items which ran out within 45mins of opening hours. They do offer wine and beer along with few snacks. But the quality and quantity was an issue. We reached out to the hotel about these small issues but the response was like they don’t care about it.Overall a nice hotel. The price is not worth it though considering we paid $650 for staying just 2 nights. But since it’s a 10min walk to Times Square and New York City, they know they can keep the prices high without matching the quality.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I love this hotel!! One of the best hotels in NYC! The staff were so lovely ! They were so attentive and friendly! They made sure that I had everything I needed!! I seriously cannot thank them enough, and I feel like I owe these lovely people so much! Over the course of my stay, I feel like I have become family with the staff. I would especially like to thank Devon, Lenny, Daniel, Wilma, J.C and Pedro. They truly made me feel like I was staying in a home away from home. GOD bless you guys!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just stayed here sat 10/3-10/4 for my mothers 69th birthday weekend in NYC. I chose this hotel based on the reviews and I was NOT disappointed.I wanted to give a 5 star rating, but the only thing we were disappointed in was the breakfast area. We went down around 9m Sunday morning and it was packed, the hot foods were cold and there were no tables. They only seemed to have about 2 staff members to not only replace the foods and clean up after the other guests who felt it was ok to walk away from their plates and breakfast items. I think that is personally disgusting and disrespectful to other people waiting for a table. They eat, leave a mess and walk away? So we had to clean someone elses mess up before we could even sit down. That was not cool....at all!The room was fabulous, we had a double queen suite with clean comfortable beds. Brand new hotel, only a year old so everything was modern and clean. Nice location.....zero decent views to anything but other buildings.will stay again...

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed over for a night here. All were impressive, good staff, nice facilities, great location. You could take a subway, or walk around to sightseeing NYC. Only concern, however, to me was hard to find some restaurants where suit single traveler. However, this place is strongly recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is centrally located in Midtown NYC. But it always seems like there are too many guest there. You couldn't find a table during breakfast, for example. Front desk personal were polite and attentive, but one day the maid didn't clean our room for no obvious reason. The room itself was somehow small. For almost $500 per day I expected a little more.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have stayed in New York 6 times & this hotel is by far the best. Superb location just a few blocks from Times Square. The hotel is super clean and clean towels available every day if u want. The rooms are spacious for a New York hotel and the beds are comfy. We were visiting New York for my aunts 50th birthday and the hotel delivered balloons & a bottle of wine to the room. The breakfast was lovely and plenty to go around. There was also free snacks & drinks from 5-7pm mon-thurs, of which we did make use of to wind down after long day of touring

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location with many amenities. Beautiful modern hotel with very friendly staff. Good size rooms with fridge, dishwasher, stove top. Very comfortable beds and sleeper sofa. We really appreciate the morning buffet and the night buffet. (Mon-Thurs and arrive early it goes fast)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel is so nice and modern. From the time you enter staff makes you feel at home. Very quick checkin and check out process. Staff very friendly. Rooms are modern and love the hardwood floors, modern bathroom, and kitchenette. In the kitchen there is not one thing missing they provide plates, pots, pans, eating utensils, dishwashing liquid, dishcloth and even a little dish washer. Breakfast to be free is beyond amazing. Always piping hot food and is a buffet style breakfast. Have been back 3 times in the past month. Any stay I have in NYC will be here going forward.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood suites is a comfy hotel in manhattan midtown, for New York city the rooms are really comfy with full Kitchen in room and all amenities. This is a perfect hotel for families with kids. Hotel is located at walkable distance to Madison square & Times square. Hotel looks modern with all fittings and decor. Also there was free breakfast every day and dinner on Monday to Thursday (not sure if this is some promotion that expires)Overall the place is great find and for families with small kids, easy eat out, food store and comfy room with attached bathroom.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Really good location for those arriving by car via the Lincoln tunnel. No need to fight Manhattan traffic. Hotel was clean, secure. I stayed on the 8th floor, in what is called the balcony room. That would be where I would like to stay again. I like the idea of having an outdoor area, even though the room was quite spacious especially considering other hotel offerings in Manhattan of all places.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: our family trip we were very pleased with the room it was extremely clean and modern and spacious. the location of the hotel was close to a lot of areas of mid town. the staff are friendly and courteous
user_name:
Denise T
lake worth, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is near the fashion/design area of NYC, about 20 blocks south of the Times Square area. It was perfectly located for me as i had business meeting very close by. The rooms are pricey but that can't be avoided in NYC. The room isn't really a suite but it does have a refrigerator and a microwave. The room, including the bathroom, was much smaller than i expected.The view was terrible, just an empty buidling being remodeled.The staff was quite friendly and helpful. I used their business center frequently and when i need some things not in that center, they made every effort to find them for me.There was a little vending area near the check-in desk but the prices were quite high. One BEWARE: they offered limousine services to the airports but the rates were much higher than are found in tourist magazines. The concierge was very friendly and really tried to get tickets for popular musical but it was just impossible.All in all, I felt it was good for a short stay but small rooms and too pricey.There is a buffet breakfast but it's a zoo with many people. More than once, I would leave something on a table, get my food, then come back to see someone had taken my table and moved my food.They did have a dinner as well but I usually got back too late to try it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My mother in law treated us to a weekend in NYC during the Papal visit. We were 3 adults and 2 kids and this was the perfect hotel for us. It is located just south of Times Square and quite near Madison Square Gardens, which was perfect for what we wanted to do.The staff is friendly, even joking with our kids and making them laugh. The rooms were large by NYC standards. They looked to be recently decorated. Ours had 2 queens and a single pull out sofa, which my 10 year old said was comfy. Like most Homewood Suites it had a small kitchen with stove, microwave, fridge w/freezer, basic pots/pans/plates/utensils, and a dishwasher. The floor was laminate, which I really liked and the color scheme was blue, which was relaxing. Plenty of plugs for all our devices, which is a must for this digital family.When our TV wouldn't work we called the front desk and someone came right away and fixed it. The elevators were quick and we never waited very long for one. The lobby was modern looking with a tv, fireplace, and comfy sofa to relax on. They also had a long table behind the sofa where you could plug in your devices, which we used while waiting for DH to return from the Papal Mass.They had a small convenience store with lots of snacks and necessities available for purchase. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, from price, to sevice,;to location this was a big win for us!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My friend and I stayed at this hotel and it was AMAZING. I can not praise the service enough. The room is clean and tidy the house keeping do a fabulous job.when you walk in you feel like a celeb the hotel is so fancy and posh. Room is a good size like a master bedroom. The food is delicious everyday you have a selection of different types of food. Each day we were greeted by Dejon Lloyd at breakfast who was amazing he always has a smile and helping us with anything we need.The service here is really good and the rooftop is breath taking. We stayed on the 18 floor and could see the tall high buildings and wonderful architecs. Staff are friendly and warm. A million out of a million loved it. I want to come back already and I have not even left:)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were very pleased that we chose this hotel. The location was great and in walking distance to so many places that we wanted the visit. Staff were helpful and very friendly. We found the size of the room great and was such a bonus to have a kitchenette. Breakfast and happy hour evenings were brilliant. Only negative was that, when I booked 9 months in advance I requested a higher room, as I had read that lower ones could be noisy. I was disappointed to be then put on level 2 as the noise from the lobby parties were so loud on a couple of occasions, that this made getting to sleep difficult.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: nice to find a free breakfast. we arrived early and they held our luggage and always had great recommendations for food. extremely clean. our delivery forgot plasticware and they promptly brought us forks and napkins.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, easy, simple, and pleasant. I recently had a business trip and booked Homewood Suites last minute for a few nights. The staff was very friendly and I was pleasantly surprised to find out they have complimentary breakfast and dinner at this location. The only hiccup was a delay with a service but I was impressed when management apologized and took care of my service bill. I would defiantly stay here again, thanks again Homewood Suites!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I tried this hotel for the first time and was impressed by all the extras they offer at no additional cost. The breakfast buffet varies each day and the quality is better than many other I have been to. The afternoon happy hour has a nice varying selection of food as well. The rooms are very modern, and I like having a kitchenette .. The rooftop terrace was a nice place to relax at the end of the day. The hotel seems very well staffed and the employees were friendly and efficient.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Enjoyed our stay at Homewood Suites. The breakfast, whilst always busy, is limited but good quality. The complimentary late afternoon snacks and drinks hit the spot, but no real substitute for dinner.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We enjoyed our room - everything worked just right: the refrigerator is huge, there's a microwave, toaster, and even a dishwasher. The bed was very comfortable and nicely made up every day; the bathroom is compact, but has everything you need. Glad to have a window that opened. Loved the rooftop terrace - especially during sunset, to just relax after a busy day. Breakfast was good: hot options and cold, nice variety. I just wish they had real cups - drinking out of paper cups gets a bit old after a week, and creates a lot of waste. We did not turn on the fan in the room - there was a years' worth of dust on it. Cleanliness in the room and bathroom is marginal.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful and friendly staff who offer good service and advice. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. We are already recommending this place to friends and we haven't even checked out yet. The location is great for seeing the sights of New York, with so much within walking distance. We really appreciate free access to the gym and free use of the business centre. The complimentary breakfasts and dinners are very tasty and well prepared, and it's great to come back and get free coffee /tea/hot chocolate 24 hours a day.We feel very much at home, which is excellent considering that we are spending 29 days here.We couldn't imagine finding a better place to stay in New York. There too many good staff to name individually....they all deserve the highest praise. We are so happy with everything that we have joined the Hilton Honors Program and will stay in Hilton Group accomodations in the future.
user_name:
Frank and Milic... P
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent a week here , has a great location . Nice room not too big but perfect for our week stay , compact & modern . House keeping everyday , breakfast included , mon- thurs free dinner . Roughly 5/10 min walk from Times Square & if you take a left outside hotel then 1st right you come into Hell's Kitchen ....loads of cafés bars restaurants with much wider price ranges . I don't realy want to say bad about this hotel , however the biggest let down is breakfast (hot food) it's not Hot , an in my opinion even though it's a 3* your still paying good money to stay here ,Come on guys this is basics your guests want there food Hot !! . I think you have enough choice for breakfast , can be a bit busy but only to be expected , an the free dinner has a small choice if your tired from long day or want grab a quick bite in between times . I've done many cities an normaly go for 4* however price was the issue for us in New York , but I would say this has been better than some 4* we have stayed in so don't be put off , definitely better than there rating of 3* .

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has everything you will need. The breakfast is good, but crowded. We enjoyed the roof top terrace on the 22nd floor. We walked to the theaters. It is about 1/2 mile from most Broadway shows. There were 3 in our party, and my son slept on the fold out couch. It wasn't as comfortable as the beds, but he said it was ok.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Expecting a typical city hotel in mid Manhattan we were impressed immediately by the homelike atmosphere, great support staff, ambiance, and amenities. The lobby is inviting with an excellent breakfast bar and evening meal with happy hour all gratis. We actually looked forward to coming home each day. The room was large with really good features including a kitchenette and large bathroom. We found the hotel on Hotels Tonight with a substantial discount. Highly recommend this home away from home.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: With daily breakfast and dinner included Monday to Thursdaythis hotel offeredPlenty of well appointed space and comfort friendly staff and central location all made this an excellent choice for a week in New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Tiara not only made our check-in process very smooth and easy, but she also provided us with solutions to make our stay worry-free and seamless. All this with smiles and a great attitude--thank you so much for the great experience!We travel to NYC often and it was truly refreshing to encounter someone who was friendly, efficient, and helpful in making our trip better!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I recommend you try to get a balcony room on the eighth floor but if you miss out, the huge balcony on the 22nd floor is a welcome retreat, it is fitted with lounges and tables for a quiet afternoon drink at the end of the day. The neighbourhood on 8th avenue is run down but take a left when you exit the hotel and head to 9th avenue, another right heading uptown and you will be very surprised with the wide variety of restaurants on offer. The hotel is very clean, the staff obliging, breakfast different each day seven days a week and the complimentary dinner Monday to Thursday is adequate at the end of a very busy day.The rooms have a mid sized fridge, two burn stove top and little dishwasher. Again adequate. We found a wine shop on ninth and further uptown, still on 9th, there are a couple of little super markets.We stayed for nine nights, went to two shows at Madison square Garden, less than a five minute walk on 8th avenue. It was absolutely fantastic to leave the hotel half an hour before the show start and be home ten minutes after the show finished!!! Just fantastic.Thirty fourth street Penn station is a hub station, we caught the train to Washington on Amtrak from there and trains to all points north and South from Penn.As I said the Hotel is in a great spot.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location of the hotel was only a few blocks from Penn station and walking distance to a number of the sightseeing attractions including the Empire State Building. I found the staff very helpful on the few occasions I needed to consult with them. All in all it was a trouble free stay at the hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is why I'm a Hilton Honors reward member. My 4 year old daughter lost one of her favorite toys during our trip. Nafeesa made her smile by giving her a gift bag with a lil stuffed duck inside, staff like this makes the world a beautiful place...She's carrying the gift bag over her shoulder like the lil lady she is...Nafeesa rocks...

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff was very friendly and helpful. They provided us with excellent service. This property exceeded my expectation. The hotel is conveniently located close to shopping, dining, and NY attractions. Just a short walk to get to time square, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, and Central Park.
user_name:
Amanda L
Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent 7 days at this hotel and they provided a clean room and fresh bedding and towels every day. The staff were always very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Would definitely recommend. The location was perfect for all attractions.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel & location in Midtown NYC. Staff was very friendly and accommodating from the time we first arrived until our departure. The property is well maintained, clean and easily accessible. I recommend this property and will return when visiting NYC again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel has a great location. Located very close to times square. Room was clean but the shower smelled like mildew. It was not a light smell. When you opened the shower door, you can tell there was an odor. Luckily, we ran very hot water and left the door opened and the smell was not as bad as before. We didn't want to change hotel rooms because we were already having a rough time getting to new york. Flying in from California with a cancelled flight in Dallas and arriving to the hotel 24 hours later. We were ready to just go to sleep did not want to deal with issue at the moment. It is always terrible when you expect certain standards from a name-brand hotel right when you arrive. Nobody wants to have to deal with room-issues immediately when you check-in. I would recommend this hotel still, but do a double take to your room as you arrive. You may need to plan extra time to change rooms.
user_name:
Noppol S
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good location very close to Times Square. Comfortable stay and very friendly and helpful staff - have to mention Junior (the bellboy) in particular who went above and beyond to ensure we were well looked after and were enjoying our stay. Food could be improved - but was content with our stay. Would most definitely book again if I return to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We recently stayed at the Homewood Suites for 7 nights, the hotel was excellent from the moment we arrived, staff were all friendly and helpful, hotel clean and modern, rooms well equipped, breakfast and evening reception were also excellent. Can't really fault the hotel would return and recommend to others.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a really great stay here. We were greeted with a friendly service immediately and our room had a birthday bottle of wine and note which was lovely. Perfect location, comfy beds and extremely nice and clean. Overall, would definitely stay here again! Thank you Homewood!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed six nights and really pleased we made the choice. Stayed on the higher floors away from the noise. Breakfast was excellent but avoid peak times as breakfast area too small to cater for peak demands. Evening snacks & happy hour was a bonus for a hotel in New York. Beds were ultra comfortable and the location was excellent with all major mid town sights within walkable distance such as Macy's, Broadway/ Times Square , Empire State Building, grand central station and pen station. 24 hr coffee available and the roof terrace was fine for relaxing in the sun. New York lived up to our expectations but Homwewood Suites exceeded them.Could not fault this place and would certainly book again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good value hotel in New York. Some real savings to be had with breakfast and some dinners (including alcoholic drinks) included. Only a short distance to the nearest subway and walking distance to Madison Square Garden. Air conditioning is a little on the loud side. A bit of a warning though, the area can get pretty dark and occasionally has some dodgy looking people lurking around. Never had a problem in 2 weeks, but as with everywhere, be extra mindful of the people around you. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed there for two weeks while working in Manhattan. I loved the location of the hotel. You can walk everywhere at midtown and around Times Square. Metro is just two blocks away at Penn Station! Next door is a carpark which also has a deal with the hotel! The standard rooms are nice and clean but a bit tight if you stay for a longer period! The real suites are much better with a living room and separate sleeping room. Sadly these rooms are on the 2nd floor and you nearly hear every car / truck driving by. Will come back, that's for sure! Hopefully next time at the 21st floor! Very friendly front desk and cleaning employees. See you next time!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at this hotel from 3rd September till 10th of September and I must say it has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in! This was our first time visiting New York and am so glad we chose to stay at the Homewood suites, we were always welcomes whenever we returned to the hotel by reception staff and all the staff said hello whenever we walked past them, had a really easy check in and out and was given our room straight away! Would recommend this hotel to anyone!! Loved it, well done!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was smaller and lacking in dresser space than the typical Homewood Suites setup, but that was to be expected with space limitations in NYC. Our group (13 ladies) were extremely impressed with the helpfulness and friendliness of the hotel staff (day or night). We were always greeted upon entering the hotel. Breakfast was changed each day (main dishes), no repeats for the week we stayed there, which we found refreshing. The evening meals were tasty and always had a salad to accompany the meal; along, with wine and beer. For the price of hotels in NYC we found this to be an excellent deal and the bonus was all the meals that were included. However, I can't compliment them enough on their friendliness!! Very impressive!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've been to NYC many times and have rarely stayed at the same place twice aside from the Waldorf Astoria for conferences. I would say that this may be the first hotel that I really try to book again. The location is good for tourists as it is close to time square, and also located near 8th Ave. and 9th Ave , which are good North-South streets to get you around town via cab. There are plenty of good places to eat within a few blocks of this location. I also found a bike rental place on 38th which was a great way to rent a bike for hours and explore the city. Riding in the streets is not as bad as it sounds, there are bike lanes on many streets. Anyway, the hotel was very clean, and very quiet. It has a very new a fresh feel to it. The included food in the morning was very good, and I had the dinner on Thursday, which was good for free... not gourmet.. but for a traveler looking to be frugal, it works. I'll stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect location for walking to restaurants, shops and tourist attractions in midtown. The subway and Penn Station are only 3 blocks away so it was super easy to get around. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. Loved our room and the bathroom was huge. The breakfast was a bit of a let down. I would have liked to have seen more options and perhaps having someone monitor the tables and direct people to a table to suit their group size. It was just a free for all and extremely difficult to get a table to sit down to eat.At check out I was given my invoice which showed I was charged an extra 200 dollars which would be reimbursed into my account within 2-3 weeks. I was really disappointed as I was not informed upon check in that this would happen. I can understand taking a deposit (if made aware) but I was more annoyed that I would not receive this back into my account for some time. After querying this at reception I was told that this was policy. I can understand that this may be a policy but I should have been made aware of this at check in and been asked to sign to authorise that this was ok to be taken from my card - I did not. Overall, a great stay but the surprise on my bill at check out did detract from our visit.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There was loud noise outside my room for several hours. It took 4 calls to the front desk for anyone to look into it. Finally someone came up and agreed with me, but the best they could do was offer me earplugs b/c there were no other rooms. The earplugs took over an hour to be delivered. Additionally, the soap holder was snapped off in the shower and there was blue tape covering it. This should have been disclosed at check in and the room should have been fixed before being offered.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I booked a 8 night surprise trip for my wife to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary, we stayed from 1st September 2015.The hotel had left a surprise bottle of wine and card to help celebrate the occasion. The room was bigger than I expected and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. The location of the hotel is ideal for all the sites,Empire State Building, Times Square and Central Park are all within walking distance.The breakfast was excellent and started the day off well and on Mondays to Thursdays there is a free diner and drinks, ideal after a long days walk. The hotel has a rooftop where you can relax in the evenings. We were very lucky as the weather was in the 90's all the time we were in New York. If you are thinking of visiting New York this is the hotel to stay , it is excellent, my wife loved every minute of our trip and we hope to be returning in 2016 and will certainly stay at this hotel!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'm not sure the star system means much anymore. I'm guessing hotels only need to check certain boxes of random amenities to get 4 stars. This hotel is a very nice corporate studio style hotel. The fixtures are all very new (cabinets, flooring, kitchenette) and stylish. This string or apartment hotels around the high 30s on the west side all cost a bit more because they've got a small kitchenette. Personally I'd say that's good for anything over 5 days. Under and you're not really going to use it. The gym is well equipped for a hotel gym. I appreciate the self laundry in the basement. The staff is great. They seem very busy but they're also very efficient. Check in was very fast and professional. They also had my room ready 3 hours early. My gripe would have been that a 4 pm check in time for a hotel room is far too late. I prefer 2pm and 3pm is the norm in NYC. I was thankful I was able to check in early and easily. Great front desk staff! Breakfast isn't spectacular but it's free and definitely more than the average free pastry.The bed linens do feel a bit cheap and corporate. My only issue isn't really the hotel's issue. The crowd of people staying here always seem to be congregating in the lobby. It's constantly packed with very... "non-city" travelers and families. It's a bit odd I'm not sure why. Perhaps it was only during my stay. Still compared to other hotels I've stayed in in Manhattan I do think I'd say this is a 4 star quality.If like me you can get a deal rate on hotels tonight id say it's worth it. If you can't I'd say the 300+ price tag it was before is overpriced. Overall a nice experience and great hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: In August, I stayed at Homewood Suites (Booked through Hotel Tonight) for just one evening with my partner from Australia. I can't say how pleasantly surprised and thrilled I was to stay at this hotel. First, the location was amazing as it was close to Times Square, Broadway, Penn St., Koreatown, and etc. Second, I only paid $119.00 (Inc. Taxes) and was treated like a VIP as soon as I walked in. I was assisted by a very wonderful, considerate, and professional staff. They even took the time to sign me up for the Hilton Honors Program, which took a few minutes. Our room was on the 15th floor, though it had a limited city view, it was chic, modern, and very spacious (King Size Bed). It had a limited kitchen, so my partner and I cooked some delicious Thai instant noodles! The next morning, we treated ourselves to a complimentary hot breakfast and I sneaked in a workout at the hotel gym before we checked out of the hotel. Even after we checked-out, the hotel was gracious enough to hold onto our bags for several hours as we toured the city. And each time we came and go, we always grabbed free cups of coffee and tea courtesy of the hotel. All in all, it was a great deal! I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 11 nights. Hotel was fabulous. The rooms were modern and clean with full kitchen. Bathroom was lovely but a little small although it did have good lighting. We were close to everything. Walking distance to theatre district, Times Square, subway and local attractions of Empire State Building and Top of the Rock.Hotel included a free hot breakfast daily and free supper and drinks were a pleasant inclusion as well. Tea and coffee was available 24 hours a day in the lobby. Wifi availability was reliable. The rooftop garden was an added bonus.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: we stayed at the Homewood suites for 6 nights, room is spacious and quiet (we were on the 6th floor). about 8 minutes walk to times square which was a nice distance to be away from the masses that converge at that place.Breakfasts were middle of the road, we didn't see any bacon on the buffet line, fruit was limited to none, there wasn't a huge selection to pick from as we had previously experienced on buffet lines but it was enough to fuel our bodies for the day ahead.There is coffee and tea available all day, and 5 - 7pm you can have drinks and snacks downstairs for free, there is also a laundry service which we found very helpful you can purchase washing powder etc from hotel.A stones throw away from Macy's and Penn Station. At one stage our swipe didn't work to enter our room but maintenance was able to assist with that quiet easily and effortlessly. If you like being just enough away from the traffic and noise and don't think twice this is a great place to keep as your location for sure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It was newly decorated, very stylishly. Excellent customer service. We got to check in early. There was happy hour and breakfast included. A very nice roof deck with seating. A comfortable lobby with seating, fireplace and water feature. Easily walk to subway and Times Square. I would definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Like many hotels within this class, the room was small but efficiently organized. It was nice to stay in a new property because everything is clean and well, new. The complimentary breakfast and manager's reception were perfect for a family on the go. We are early-risers so we didn't need to contend with a crowd for breakfast but there is outdoor seating which is a nice option. The staff seemed to handle the hectic pace of check-out efficiently.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved the proximity to everything here - we walked to Times Square and to our Broadway play. The hotel itself is really nicely appointed with large rooms (for NYC) and is very clean and well kept. Breakfast was great if a little crowded - nice selection for our whole family. Now the staff - Junior was there to greet us and get us into our room and he was there to keep our luggage on the last day so that we could take in a play before we left. He answered all of our questions and had great customer service skills. Aneta and Yvette from housekeeping helped us muddle through getting our forgotten items back - great communication, very quick to respond! I wish I could say the same for Leslie at the front desk. She was rude and condescending. We decided to take in an afternoon performance and start part of the way home on our check out day and called down to the desk to make sure it was okay given the short notice. The gentleman that I spoke to ensured us that there would be no charge imposed for the early departure - something we double checked when we got to the lobby on our way out in the morning. Flash forward to check out time where Leslie printed my receipt and when I questioned the fact that it did not have the name of the hotel on the letterhead she quite disdainfully remarked that if she reprinted it that would make no difference. Then she asked for the receipt back - I complied thinking that she was going to make an effort to reprint it as I required that the hotel information be on the receipt but no! She told me that she would have to redo the bill because we would have to pay for the evening's stay as we did not provide the required notice. When I told her that we had spoken to some one she was very condescending, her attitude was in stark contrast to what we had experienced so I would still recommend this hotel but this was not the best way to end our trip. Oh and I had to call when I got home to request a new copy of the bill on letterhead - really Leslie, it would have been so much easier if you had just done it when I asked you to. I like to think that I am a good Hilton customer, not an annoyance in your otherwise blissful day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect hotel to enjoy your NYC experience. Great location, very friendly service, breakfast and manager's nights are excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the perfect NYC hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Me and some friends stayed at this hotel for my 40th Birthday trip. The hotel is new and has a beautiful lobby. Our room was very spacious for a NYC hotel room and had two queen beds and a small couch that pulled out into a twin sized bed. There was a kitchen with a microwave, full size refrigerator, and a dish washer. Complimentary microwave popcorn was waiting for us when we arrived, and when I asked the desk if we could have an additional bag, they sent up several.The hotel is located in the Garment District, which is about a 10 minute walk to Times Square and a 20 minute train ride to Battery Park. Penn Station is located right around the corner, so it is easy to travel anywhere in the city.Besides how clean and nicely decorated this hotel is, my favorite aspect was the complimentary evening meals this hotel provides Monday - Thursday from 5:00 PM -7:00 PM and breakfast every morning. Every evening, the meal had a different theme and we ate well while we were there. Not having to look for somewhere to eat and spend our money on food, proved to be a huge bonus to us. Also, there were always healthy options available and the quality of food was much better than most hotels that I have stayed in (Including other Hiltons).We stayed on the third level (I think that the 2 Queen beds are limited to the first 6 floors or so) and we never heard a sound from the street. There is a small but beautiful garden located on the rooftop, where we would retire in the evenings to call our families. I originally preferred a higher room (I think the hotel is about 24 stories high), but I was grateful for the lower room because the elevators were slow and we were able to easily take the stairs. Overall, we enjoyed this hotel very much and would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel lobby was so nice & clean. The happy hour on weekdays was such a bonus (free drinks & food!). The location couldn't have been better for walking to Times Square and getting to the subway. We loved it & would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for a few nights with the girls, and had an amazing time, staff were so helpful, polite and friendly. The hotel itself is beautiful, very modern and great facilities, perfect location, right by Times Square. Breakfast was lovely! Traditional New York breakie, bagels, pancakes and bacon etc, freshly made each morning. Loved our stay and cannot wait to return! Couldn't recommend this hotel enough!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel from August 23-29! We were a family of 3 sightseeing in NYC for 6 full days. The location was perfect for us; close enough to Times Square without being IN Times Square. Our room had sufficient space for us - hubby and I in the king bed; 7-year-old son on the pull-out. I personally wouldn't have wanted to sleep on the pull-out, but for little people it's perfectly fine.Our sleeps were restful and never, ever heard noise coming from the hallway. i started to wonder if there was anyone other than us on our floor... Having a fully equipped kitchenette in the room was very much welcome. while we didn't cook meals there, it was nice to have a place to refridgerate and reheat leftovers. Access to breakfast in the mornings was a great start to our days! The evening reception in the evenings Monday thru Thursday was a nice touch, too. While we didn't actually eat, we did have a glass of wine each before heading off to dinners and evening activities.My only disappointment during our stay was housekeeping never once vacuumed or swept the floor in our room. My son somehow collected sand in his shoes during our Hop-On/Hop-Off bus tour and patrol around Times Square (7-year-old boys are dirt magnets!), which ended up on the floor when he returned to the room and took his shoes off. This was never swept up during the remaining 3 days of our trip.All-in-all, I myself would return to this property in addition to recommending to friends/family!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had booked this hotel for my family and I from 20th Aug to 3rd September and initially I was a bit anxious about how the hotel might be since my family was accompanying me but I absolutely loved the experience and my parents were thrilled with the courteousness of the staff.When I arrived I met Nafeesa who was an absolute delight and managed to give us our room slightly earlier than I had expected. Throughout the stay I found that everyone working in the hotel were really charming people with a sweet disposition. I remember having small chats with people in the lobby and they were all really friendly and very knowledgeable about good spots to visit in NYC. If you have a minute you should strike up a conversation with Junior, he is very friendly and can talk about a range of subjects. The room was clean and of a good size for NYC. The best part about this hotel is that they have free tea and coffee downstairs 24/7, so even when you arrive late you can energize yourself and if you have the time you can take tea to the rooftop deck for some good conversations along with fabulous views. Oh, they also have a decent spread for breakfast and dinner. Yes they were the first hotel I stayed in that had a free evening reception.To summarize if you are looking to stay in a homely place in NYC with all amenities and comfort you should look no further!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here from August 9 - 15. We've stayed any several Hilton properties in NYC. We chose this one for this trip because of the proximity to Ripley-Grier rehearsal studios. We are Diamond status and requested a high floor away from the elevator. We were given a lower floor right next to the elevator. (They did move us the next day after we complained.) Breakfast was terrible. The choices were not great and the hot food wasn't so much as warm. After the second day of that we went ate at the cafe in the lobby of Ripley-Grier ever morning (adding to the expense.) Calls to housekeeping were either not responded to at all, took more than one call, or were extremely slow. This was not a great experience. Both the Hilton Garden Inn on 8th and the Double Tree Times Square are much better. If/when we return and need to be at Ripley-Grier every day we will choose another hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family and I stayed at the Hilton, midtown from the 24th Aug - 28th Aug. The hotel is a good location for all site seeing. Our room was equipped with two double beds, TV, safe and iron and ironing board. The bathroom was small, but sufficient. Baths towels and bedding were changed regularly. The room itself was very spacious, which was handy for a family. Overall, the room was sufficient for what you need, which was basically sleeping as we were up and out every morning. There is a lot of building work being done at the time of our visit but this did not disturb us in the slightest.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stay in a lot of Hilton properties ( I am a diamond member) and I expect a certain kind of customer service from these properties. This one was different because of one person. Leslie was the most helpful and kind person I have ever run into in a Hilton property. She was instrumental in my family having a great time in NYC. Not only did she give us the layout of the property ( which has a great rooftop view) but gave us the names (and directions) of the best places to see and eat while we were there (not the touristy places nut where the locals eat). She also helped us navigate the subway system, which is a big deal for someone who has never been to NYC. The room was designed very well to get that much in such a small square footage. As always with Homewood the bed was very comfortable and my son really like the pullout couch.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Many pros to this hotel: good location to midtown attractions, the subway and theater district. The entire hotel staff (from front desk, concierge, to dining room staff) were very pleasant and helpful, going out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. They responded quickly to any calls for assistance. As stated in other reviews, breakfast and the evening reception M-Th was very helpful with the budget, allowing us to take in small meals during other hours of the day or after the theater. Rooms were clean, very well equipped with a small kitchen. Nice outdoor seating areas off dining room and on the 22nd floor allowed us to meet with friends and get some fresh air. Cons: very few, however, very limited closet space and some wear showing on bathroom mirrors. The sofa bed was concave and although staff brought in an additional pad, was basically not useable for sleep. Nonetheless, we had a wonderful stay at this very nice hotel! Would stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is perfect for a short stay in New York. It is central near to Times Square in the Garment Area of town.I stayed here with my sister and our Mum and we all were pleased with the standard of the accomodation.The room was very clean and well equipped with a sofa bed as well as a very large double bed.There was a good breakfast served every morning as well as a complimentary evening meal from Monday to Thursday. It was very busy and a little under resourced at the weekend in the morning not helped by the fact that lots of guests took the food in a box to eat at lunchtime.Overall the staff are very friendly and helpful without being overbearing. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels supplied.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent location for Times Square and shopping. Staff very friendly and helpful, complimentary tea, coffee available 24 hours. Complimentary breakfast serving a decent variety. Ideal for for when you're wanting to get out early and no need to start looking for somewhere to eat. Monday to Thursay complimentary meal with wine and beer available, though we didn't sample as usually out or planning to go out for our evening meal. Roof top terrace is a nice place to sit and relax with a drink on an evening, downstairs terrace nice for breakfast, though could be quite noisy at the time of our vist due to building work in the area. Our daughter celebrated her 21 St birthday and staff had decorated the room and left cakes/ snacks etc, which was a nice touch. We had a city view room on the 20th floor, good size and very quiet. Cooking facilities available, large fridge etc, so the option to cook and eat in is available. Room serviced daily with an abundance of toiletries and towels. Lovely comfy beds. Would defiantly opt to stay here if we returned. Great location with 1st class amenities.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This Homewood is another nice Hilton Property, where the folks who work here try hard to please their guest. I wanted to be close to TS, but got a better rate than the TS hotels and still have easy access to TS. There is also many nice restaurants around the hotel. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A small hotel located in Midtown. Very clean. The room we stayed in was not large but adequate for 2 people; included were a fridge and cooker. Included breakfast was fine - best to go early to avoid the crowds. During the week there is also free dinner with beer and wine - I was there only for a weekend so cannot comment on this. The roof-top patio was a great place to relax and take in the sounds of the city. I will stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, 10 min to time sq, 10 min to Empire State. Clean well equipt comfortable rooms. Tea and coffee 24hrs, free dinner mon to Thursday with wine or beer. Very busy breakfast , apart from Sun everything was always topped up.Great value for space, top class for mid budget .

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Two beds and a sofa bed comfortably accommodated our family of four. Very happy to have the buffet breakfast available, which is a significant time and money saver. Room and hotel were in great shape. Staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful.A couple of things to be aware of: • We were next to a "hearing accessible" room, which has a doorbell button outside. This button not only triggers a flashing light in the suite (which makes sense, to alert a hearing impaired guest) but also buzzes very loudly. One night, late night visitors to our neighbour woke us up with this loud buzzing periodically until 2:30 am. No problem on other nights. I would not want to be next to one of these buzzer rooms again.• Our room — all rooms with 2 queen beds, we were told — had the bathroom sink, vanity, mirror, closet AND safe, all together inside the bathroom with the toilet and the shower. i.e. if someone is on the toilet or in the shower, anyone else who wants to get something out of the closet or safe, or wants to shave, apply makeup, brush their teeth, etc, is inhibited from doing so. This is an inconvenient design for the very group that would be most interested in having the two bed suite.I would definitely stay in this hotel again, due to its value, quality and convenience, as long as I was not next to a buzzer room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We live 2 hours from NYC so we took a bus to port authority.We walked 5 blocks to 37th st and Homewood Suites was right there.We did early check in since it was 10:30 am.They held our bags and even told us to grab some breakfast before we left. Such a welcome!We returned and got our room key and bags. We went to our king suite...very clean.There was a bottle of wine and a card wishing us a 25th Anniversaryso so thoughtful!It was close to Times Square and Biricchino restuarnt where we had a fabulous dinner!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First time in New York was a great stay! The hotel staff welcomed us and was great to work with. The room was very new and felt very modern. The hotel couldn't have been in better shape. The thing that topped everything off was the hotel staff though. The staff was great to speak with as a first time traveler to New York. Highly recommended hotel!
user_name:
Greg M
Las Vegas, Nevada, Usa

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband, daughter, and I stayed at the Homewood Suites the weekend of Aug 21-23rd. Parking was conveniently close (across the street about 1/2 block), great location for walking to subway, Times Square, and other local attractions. The room was pleasantly larger than other NYC rooms I have stayed in. The customer service was impeccable. This without a doubt makes this property stand apart from others. Would stay here again and again! Thank you for a great weekend!
user_name:
Tiiu M
St. Paul, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a great experience here! Very clean and modern rooms. The staff was very helpful with giving directions to us. The food was all delicious! We also found the staff to be very honest in holding our luggage while we toured NYC. We will be back!!
user_name:
lovetotravelfam
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a great hotel stay we had, from day 1 to day 8 we felt looked after without being over familiar. Great location for sightseeing and cannot be beaten for value and comfort. Would definitely stay here again if returning to NYC. Great food and beer free during the week and 24hr coffee, who could want more!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here! Check in was so easy and fast! The staff was very friendly..this was awesome because I am a manager at a hotel in San Diego. When we got to the room, it was perfect! I kitchenette was the best! My partner made sushi! The bed was so comfortable! The room was nice and clean and right after we checked in, the housekeepers came by and asked if we needed anything extra (towels, soaps. etc.) They did have breakfast, but we slept in too late and missed that. Would stay here again!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a terrific stay at the Homewood Suites on 37th street NYC. The staff was caring and made sure we were taken care of. From Mr. Gonzalez and the ladies at the FD, Junior the amazing "catch-all" man, the concierge gentleman who made a point of giving correct information, the kitchen staff who actually smiled and worked extremely hard. We were impressed. The manager's special was a full meal! Not the usual cheez-balls and fruit juice we have had at other properties. The breakfast was also good and full of variety. You save a lot of money if you take advantage of both. Coffee was available always. The hotel is close to the A and E 8th Avenue line, and a short walk to Time Square. If we get to come back to NYC this hotel is our first pick.....and oh did I mention the rooms were spotless and we slept great!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: we stayed here for a month when we arrived at US. very friendly staff and great breakfast and dinner which is served with drinks.free shuttle service was a great benefit. room were clean and kitchen was sufficient for a family to stay for long. overall excellent experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Staff was very accommodating and courteous, from Manager to desk clerks to kitchen staff. Rooms were well appointed and very clean. Unbelievable how much they are able to fit in one room without it feeling cramped!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. New hotel with great staff and very quiet. Stayed for a girls weekend (Fri-Sun nights). Price was excellent and the location cannot be beat. Within 5 blocks of Times Square, Macys, Broadway, Empire State building, you name it. The room was designed well and very quiet. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My first phone call was with Tiarra a sweet young lady who was so helpful . It was a pleasure to start our trip with a kind person Leslie went above and beyond in every way to make our stay comfortable. Check in quick and easy Free breakfast was delicious and the staff again went above and beyond Room was spotless house keeping way to go Got a late check out and they kept our luggage till we were done playing in the city Thank you all for a true home stay ...

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here in Aug 2014 (a year to this day) , The hotel was only open a few months everything was perfect from the minute we entered the hotel to the minute we left.Staff were all very friendly and helpful even with our flight being cancelled and arriving a day later, Price was great for location. Location of the hotel is excellent in a few blocks you are right in the heart of time square other direction a few blocks down Madison square garden hotel is a perfect location to be away from all the city noise but you are not too far either. Breakfast was included every morning which was excellent only problem was the area where the food was laid out got very crowded at peak times(Be sure to get down before peak time) and there was no one way system or anything so was everyman for himself.The lifts also get very busy at the peak times so you could be waiting longer than normal for the lift. Not a big deal. On certain nights they have complimentary drinks laid out this was such a nice touch to have cause after a long day walking around the city it was nice to pick up a glass and relax in the room.There is a rooftop area where you can go and sit and enjoy This is really nice as you don’t find many NYC hotels with a rooftop area. However I think there is a lot more potential for this area to include more tables /chairs/lounge area and maybe have certain nights where food / drinks where located on the roof.Room:The rooms are a great size it had everything you could need including a full Kitchenette e.g Full sized fridge, coffee machine. There was also a sofa bed in the room with a table even with all this there was still plenty of room to walk about the room.Lobby:In some hotels the lobby is just a passing by area for people coming and going however they appear to have put a lot of thought into the lobby it has a Fireplace, Waterfall feature, cosy sitting area with plug outlets/USB ports.Nice area to relax and wind down If you are looking for a good Mexican close to get some food/drink ‘Lucy's Cantina Royale’ has a nice rooftop area and is right beside penn station about 10 minute walk from hotel. The hotel also arranged transport for us to the airport on day of leaving.Would recommend this to anyone looking for a relaxing no fuss stay in New York.Thank you for a great stay will look forward to another stay 

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel and can't say enough good things. From the minute we walked in until we left they were the most congenial, courteous and friendly staff, always smiling, helping with any questions we had. We were in room 601, a kingsize bed and nice kitchenette no bathroom, actually found the room very spacious and quiet tho the window faced the street. Really I can't say anything negative about the room. Oh wait....the pillows, it's time to invest in some quality pillows and ditch the ones in the room. That's the only minus and it's not like it was a make or break deal. Loved the included in room, complimentary wi-fi, speed was fine for us, didn't feel a need to upgrade the speed.Location is a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and many theaters. While we're not impressed with NYC, the hotel was convenient enough for the time we spent in the city and I'd definitely recommend it.Breakfast was OK, the usual cereals, yogurts, fruits, scrambled eggs and some type of breakfast meat, bagels, juice and pastries, plenty of choices. It was redundant but a nice inclusive meal so one doesn't have to head out early for breakfast unless they choose to.The weather was really hot so it was nice to return in time for a glass or two of wine during the evening reception, M-Th, 5-7 pm. We actually had a light bite a few nights at the buffet rather than heading back out, having eaten lunch out.I just can't share enough positive comments on Homewood Suites. Having read some of the comments on TA and several other websites I felt the negatives were unwarranted but that's only my opinion. Yes there are only 3 elevators for 22 floors but it was never a problem, you just wait a few minutes, no big deal. The wine at the reception was Sutter Home, but hey, there's no charge. Redundant breakfast and so-so food at the reception buffet, these are great perks and offered by few hotels in the city, again, if you don't like what's served its easy enough to dine elsewhere.Thanks for a great stay Homewood Suites. You've got a wonderful team and should we return to NYC we wouldn't hesitate to return for another stay with you.keep up the good work.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We visited NYC recently and wanted to stay a few days. I searched for a suite of rooms or a bedroom w/ a living room because of the privacy of one of our travelers. The value for the price at Homewood Suites was amazing. Price was excellent!More than that, they provided a full breakfast every morning and M-Thurs they provided a full dinner. We all enjoyed, even the teens!We were all very happy with the modern decor in the room and in the lobby. The water wall was a beautiful feature along with the fireplace.Above all, the customer service was beyond excellent! When I checked in, I met Nafeesa Brent. She assured me (as every hotel checkin person does) to let her know if anything was wrong and that she wanted me to have a great time. Well, my complimentary newspaper did not arrive Friday morning. I decided to let Nafeesa know. She was kindly apologetic. We went out sight seeing for the day. Upon our return mid afternoon, there was a newspaper along with a little gift and a beautifully written apology. This was over the top for me. I am big on customer service! In my eyes, and in my business, Nafeesa Brent is tops!!!Thanks for a great stay, and by the way, the beds were out of this world comfortable! We will stay again and in the future as I travel, I will be looking for more Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We came to the Homewood suites for a weekend away with the girls, we are three 21 year olds, our first time in New York. We arrived at about 2.30 and despite check in not being until 4, our room was ready and the staff happily let us go to our room. The room was nice with a lovely large bed and a sofa bed. Very clean and the maid visited daily. Once settled we went down stairs to explore, the concierge was more than helpful, giving up ideas about sights we should see. The other staff all put in their ideas of bars to visit and general information. One of the staff members even took some time to research some local bars with particular music genres and came back to us later with this info! Brilliant! The breakfast was eggs, sausages and bagels the first two days, so on one evening, after arriving home from a bar, (about 1.30am) we had a chat with the receptionist on duty and in the morning, as requested, there was PANCAKES! the staff are amazing here, if there is anything you need, they will be more than happy, and go well out of their way to provide it! They really made our city trip a wonderful experience! This hotel has great amenities with computers down stairs to print tickets, 24hr tea/coffee/hot chocolate and a lovely hot shower! Couldn't ask for more! Thank you all so so much! Will definitely visit next time we are in the city!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed in this property last weekend. This is a phenomenal hotel and fantastic stay. It is located right in the heart of all the action and is very convenient to all the major attractions and subway stations. The breakfast was very good and well stocked and the staff were excellent in their interactions. I will stay again here. My rating of 4/5 is only because of a minor glitch which I hope they will remedy soon. I booked a handicap access - mobility queen 2 bed room and I called ahead to let the front desk now that we will be checking in late. We arrived at 11pm. The property is easy to find and the front staff showed us the nearest parking which is within 25 feet of the entrance. Despite the phone call the handicap room was not available. The staff were very apologetic of this error. The fact that I could not take a shower the first night or next morning was made up by the manager and the front staff waiving the first night charges and helping us move to a handicap room the next day when we were exploring NY city. As a very nice gesture, I found an apology letter from the manager with some fruits, snacks and a free movie pass in the new room. I have to say that the staff handled the error very well and I found the rest of the hotel fantastic. If an error is made, this is the way to take care of the client - own it and make amends - kudos to the staff. Definitely will be back in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very very bad breakfast bad quality and fat! not very nice and service minded staff in reception, but 2 members of the staff were wonderful and made our days very nice whis there smiles and big kindness they was Jennifer FSD and IDRIS Nice rum and very clean

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. It is close to attractions and when exiting the city, it is only 1/2 block from the Lincoln Tunnel. The room I had was not as large as other Homewood Suites (it was a studio with a kitchen area), but you have to keep in perspective that this is New York City; so, it was probably still larger than a typical NYC room with the extra amenities expected at a Homewood Suites. There are select rooms with private balconies, but I did not stay in one of those rooms. The rooftop patio (an open area, not a bar) was OK, but I think it allows smoking. It is on the 37th Street side, and you can look up and down the street and slightly see the Hudson River to the west, but I wouldn't call it a view. This property is not as tall as other buildings around it; hence, it does not have views from any of the rooms as far as I could tell. I stayed on the "back side" of the hotel opposite of 37th Street, and it was quiet. The only thing I could hear was my neighbor's door opening and closing. If selecting your room online, you may want to consider a room where the next room's door is not immediately adjacent to yours.I enjoyed the patio off of the lobby to relax at the end of the night. Again, no views, but there is comfortable furniture, and you can bring your own refreshments.My largest issue at this property was check-in. They were busy; so, after checking in and not receiving my two bottles of complementary water with my Hilton Honors, I figured it was an honest, understandable oversight, and politely asked the staff member for them (they were on the floor less than 5 feet away from her). What I received was as best incorrect instructions on how my online profile/preferences were wrong, and I need to change them so that she can see that I want water and to choose receiving it instead of points. At worst, I could consider it a lecture. Who lectures their guest when checking in? I have stayed at over a dozen Hilton Honors properties, including three Homewood Suites in 2015, and never had this happen once. At the time I politely said I would look into it and went on my way, but since I have confirmed that the staff member was incorrect. The above interaction is probably minor and did not ruin my experience (it is after all only two bottles of water), but what is bothersome to me is that the morning of check out, I received a letter on my door from a manager thanking me for my stay, and if I could not rate them 9 or 10, I should contact her at the email address provided. Since I would not rate my check-in experience a 9 or 10, I emailed her, but I have not received a response one-week later (I will amend this review if I receive one in the future). I know it was a standard form letter, but don't go through the exercise if you do not want to be contacted.In summary, a quiet property in a good location.
