Rooms were the typical down-sized NYC versions for hotel chains compared to their properties outside the city, but it was very nice (but don't book if a view is important to you). I did not have any issues with breakfast or waiting for the elevators like other reviewers. You see I still give this property 4 out of 5 dots, as I do realize my issue may be individual in nature that most other guests will not have. Personally, however, I will need to think about if I will stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I LOVED this property!New, modern, clean, great location and great rooms... My new place to stay when in NYC for business. I was in town for a week at another hotel in the area and chose to leave it after five nights. The room was small and dark and the old and noisy air conditioner ran all day and night. The elevator wait was sometimes a full five minutes. I felt like a FOOL for not making the move to this hotel sooner, it was wonderful!!!Big, clean, comfortable room with a small fridge and kitchenette. Great bathroom with a big shower. Great desk to work at looking out the huge windows. Modern and clean decor. A nice workout room with new equipment. A great breakfast- Even snacks and drinks in the restaurant free around happy hour. The roof deck offered a peaceful retreat from the city with amazing views. Fast elevators. I couldn't find anything about this location that I didn't like.It's my new hotel of choice for business or pleasure trips to NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have both lived in Manhattan and stayed in dozens of hotels in NYC. This was by far the best hotel that I have ever stayed in! Even compared to the Grand Hyatt! Why? Rooms are immaculately clean and HUGE for NYC. Brand new hotel feel and smell. Had a look of a luxury modern apt. bldg., even the hallways. Central air worked perfectly, as did the Internet. I didn't know what to expect (didn't need a suite?), but in the end I was so impressed! The nice full size fridge came in handy. The free breakfast buffet was excellent and unexpected tho I didn't eat the free dinner.The location is great especially if you're a tourist and want to be by the theater district. Biggest pluses: new, large rooms, great deal, spotless room. I forgot to mention the SILENCE at night! I slept so well! Sadly, better than where I live. See my doubletree NYC review for comparison. Walls were thin there. Best NYC stay ever!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at this hotel several weeks this summer. It is spotless, quiet, and the staff is AMAZING! I do not have a single complaint. Everyone was kind and helpful. The breakfast was awesome and we also enjoyed the complimentary Happy Hour. I will stay here EVERY time I visit NYC. And, Leslie at the front desk is awesome, along with the rest of the staff!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Super clean, great location, friendly staff. Rooms were fantastic, with a kitchenette! Free Breakfast, and Free Dinner (what!!) Right next to MSG, would highly recommend if you're going to check out a show there.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked this online via a hotel booking site the photos on there certainly suggested a sizeable room and being that it was advertised as a suite I expected something a little better.Good points:The room was of a reasonable size, had a hotplate, fridge, sink, small bathroom with shower. On the 17th floor and didn't suffer any noise issues at all despite being near the lifts.WiFi is good but it seems you have to log back in every time you re-enter the building.You are very close to Times Square, Macy's etc etc only a short walk away.Bad points:The lobby offers free coffee 24hrs but I have to say that each time I tried to get a cup all of the four containers were empty with no effort made by staff to refill them even when they saw that was the case.The breakfast is a complete shambles, and probably best described as a 'free for all'. The serving area is far too small for the number of guests and we just gave up and went elsewhere during our four nights there.There is a roof terrace advertised but a bit of a let down its just a few chairs and a couple of tables with not a lot to see other than surrounding apartments. Seemed to me to be the place that people gathered to smoke.Could be better and I expected more for what I paid for, I think I would try somewhere else next time.
user_name:
cgt180
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel had everything we needed. Breakfast & wifi were included in the room rate. This property had a coin operated laundry which was very handy as we had a week NYC before going on a 2 week cruise. Good location for us.
user_name:
adara2
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked a last minute family trip to NYC and chose Homewood Suites for the location and relatively reasonable price. Since we were traveling with our eight year old, I wanted to be close to the train station. Turns out we were only 4 blocks away. When we arrived, the staff was great and let us know about the free breakfast and managers reception. I was not expecting free wine and beer in Manhattan. The room was very functional; all of the furniture was made to overlap each other so you could easily maneuver it to make more room if you needed it. My son sleep in the single pull out couch so it was the perfect size for the three of us. I loved the kitchenette, full size microwave and a midsize fridge. There was even free popcorn in the room which was a big hit with my son. We were directly adjacent to the elevator so I expected to hear noise as it moved between floors and when people exited. I didn't hear a thing! We all had a very peaceful nights sleep. I would definitely stay here again and will look for other Homewood suites when we travel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family loved this hotel! We stayed from August 2 to August 10, 2015. Rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. We had a kitchen. Our room faced the back so it was very quiet. The staff were very friendly always asking how our stay is going and if we were ok. A special mention goes to Jennifer. She was always friendly and welcoming. She made sure we had everything we needed. Everytime we came in we would have a little chat like we were old friends. The complimentary breakfast and dinner (Mon to Thurs) were amazing. The location was very good. Close to Penn station, Time Square and shopping. Although the housekeeping staff could have been a bit better (they would forget to replenish the toiletries, toilet paper and empty the garbage), they were also friendly. Despite this, because we had such a great experience, I still give it a 5 rating. Best hotel I have stayed at so far in New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my first visit to the Big Apple, conveniently located 2 blocks to where my sister and family had booked (I booked my holiday later so there were no more rooms available there) and to Penn Station (LIRR and Metro). I definitely had the better deal. The amenities, including breakfast, free hot drinks and staff helpfulness were excellent and welcoming. I was expecting a small room but since I wasn't sharing it, it was perfect: clean, comfortable, kitchenette, good shower. No room with a view on the 5th floor, but the roof top patio made up for that. Just wondering if there were rooms with baths, since we did a lot of walking it would be nice to have a soak in the evening. I would definitely consider coming back to Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Went June 2015 staff friendly and he helpful giving different places to visit.Rooms comfy and clean, with full fridge microwave and two ring hob.Monday to Thursday serve buffet food and drinks free, a real bonus in NYC In a very quiet street for New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites, as the reviews on the Hotel Tonight app have stated, is truly one of the best hotels out there.Also, it is fancy enough without being intimidating. And as what the reviews have said, its awesome, efficient and friendly staff are the real superstars.I honestly don't like it when clients/hotel visitors treat hotel staff as servants and act like divas and expect them to cater to their every whim. As such, I also don't expect hotel staff to act servile, subservient and overly people-pleasing.I just expect them to act normal, warm and simply be efficient in their jobs, which are expected of all of us anyway.What stood out to me about the staff was how constantly they checked in on the guests in the hotel, without being fake or irritating. They give you space but they do take the initiative to check in on you or at least say Hi.From the person who washes the windows, to Jennifer (Fire Safety Director) who we met at the rooftop lounge and said Hi and checked if we were doing ok and to the best first impression I've ever had of a front desk person, Nafeesa (hope I am spelling this correctly), who checked me in when I arrived. Jennifer and Nafeesa should be given a raise.Also worthy of a raise were the guy and the girl who were assigned at the front desk at night (that single night I stayed), sorry I forgot to take note of their names. They were so helpful to suggest a nearby place to eat that was still open that late. And, they even helped me with my photo project by advising the best place at Times Square that will fulfill the pic I needed to take.Overall, it's one of the best hotels I've stayed in in New York. I've been to hotels that are more expensive than Homewood Suites in the U.S. and overseas but this hotel managed to bring the heart along with the fancy. I was so impressed that I plan to stay here again (and again).PS.Free breakfast. Free drinks I think during the work week nights, too bad I checked in on Sunday. And definitely free tea and coffee at lobby any time of the day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for our sons first NYC trip. Good location between Penn Station and Times Square. Friendly staff and free breakfast. Nice small suite with a kitchenette, King bed and a small pull out couch. Overpriced but so is everything else. In Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was very clean and up-to-date. The staff was really what impressed me, Nafeesa was absolutely amazing from the moment we checked in until we checked out. She is attentive, generous, and sincere. Will stay at this hotel again because of her! Thank you Nafeesa!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Loved this hotel! Fabulous modern rooms. The best part...no carpeting! They have hard-wood (or faux wood?) flooring. Brilliant! Why don't all hotels have this?! It felt so much cleaner than the always dirty hotel carpeting. Some of the rooms (not ours) had a private outdoor patio. Floor to ceiling windows (so much light in the room when you want it and also window darkening shades for when you don't), full size refrigerator, kitchen and sitting area. There is also a roof top deck with seating and an outdoor patio area with seating. The patio area is adjacent to the breakfast/dinner room, so you can eat outside. Free breakfast that changes daily and free dinner Monday-Thursday that was surprisingly good and very convenient for a quick bite before heading off to a show. Staff does a great job keeping the dining room clean. 24/7 free tea, coffee and hot chocolate. Times Square was a few blocks away as was Riverside Park for a morning run. Very nice and helpful staff. Parking across the street for $45. Can't wait to stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel.The Studio room is spacious, design very well with a sofa , a little table and kitchenette (With a big refrigerator and a dishwasher)Very comfortable bed. The shower size and water pressure were good, just do not have enough space around the sink for private toiletries . Good location .

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great value for money. Plenty of room (biggest sq ft I could find for the price) and never heard a peep from our neighbours so must have good sound insulation. Good sized gym downstairs and business centre (excellent remote print facility). Nice rooftop terrace on 22nd floor to have drinks at sundown (no bar so bring your own). Also added benefit of free brekkie (if you're on a budget) and free drinks and nibbles in the eve from Mon to Thurs. Ordered airport pick up thru hotel and have a really comfortable chauffeured SUV for $65.Stay here and you won't be disappointed.Thanks to all the staff for a great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: From the moment I phoned the hotel to check on my reservation, the staff was extremely helpful and interested in assuring we had an excellent stay. We arrived before check in time but were able to keep our luggage there until later. The rooms were clean and very quiet and, for New York City, a good size. Both dinner and breakfast were very good, with choices that met and exceeded our expectations. The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect for traveling to the city and exploring. Penn Station is well within walking distance as is Time Square and the surrounding areas. Additionally, there is a public parking garage located across the street! The charge is $45/day which beats the cost of the train when there are 6 of you traveling together. After checkout, the staff willingly kept all of our luggage until we returned for it that evening. Everyone treated us like we were special.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I and my husband went to NYC and stayed at this hotel 4 night (21-25 July), It's terrible and nightmare to hear that our room was cancelled the first night without information or notice after we are so tired for long long trip. We try to shown them the paper that we got confirmation from booking.com but The reception man was informed that he just sold this room for one night to walk-in guest 1 hour before we arrived and all the room was fully booked. I have made a reservation for this hotel 2 rooms for us and my family that they will arrived one day later because they come from different country. The funny thing that our reservation another day (22-25 July) are ok accept the first day 21 July for me and my husband. The reception never ever try to help and do anything for us, we have to go to starwood hotel group that we are member to help and support us, the question that why I select this hotel not starwood because I was believe that the hotel by Hilton group also good service and very professional but the thing that we got are opposite, they let the guest that have booking to go aways and welcome walk-in guest. they are really unprofessional hotel that we ever stay. I warned you who are looking and decide to stay here to think again I know that the hotel is nice and comfortable but if you arrived and have the problem same as us your holiday will become terrible because you have to spent all the night to looking to another hotel for sleep.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spacious room, comfortable beds. Location is great for walking to Times Square and Penn station. Very professional, helpful and friendly staff. Complimentary breakfast with plenty of choices. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Looks as if this hotel has been renovated in the past couple of years-very nice. I like the floors are not carpeted - not a fan of carpeting in hotel rooms. The room was small - but that normal in NYC. The staff is very friendly, helpful and courteous. Across the street is a Dunkin Donuts and White Castle around the corner - great for late night snacking!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites on 37th between 8th and 9th avenues is a great location for the theater, dining, transportation. Breakfast was ok. Lot's of pork choices which I didn't care for and no oatmeal, but great yogurt. The happy hour was very nice and the lite supper also nice.
user_name:
Julie S
The Villages, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Checked it after seeing a concert at MSG. It was a Friday night and there was plenty of parking outside. The parking regulations are favorable Friday and Saturday night. Check in was a breeze. They gave us a care package consisting of a pack of Milano cookies and two bottles of water. Not sure if they gave that to is as Hilton honors members or not. The hotel looks very new. Probably built in the last couple of years. The room is on the smaller side but was very nice. Had a kitchenette that included a cooktop, full size refrigerator and a dishwasher. Everything looked brand new. Room was clean and well appointed with a large flatscreen TV. The a/c was quiet and worked well. The room was fairly quiet. Did hear a room door slam once or twice but nothing unreasonable. The location is great for MSG, but there is not a lot else around the hotel. Times Square and the theatre district is a short walk away. It is actually a fairly quiet street by Manhattans standards. The breakfast was decent (hey it's free). They had biscuits with egg and cheese, cereal, fruit, has browns, pastries etc. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Even though in the middle of the city, unusually smooth and easy unload. Very comfortable room and bed. Great coffee and very friendly staff. Kitchen was useful full refrigerator and burners. Would definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A great value for visit NYC The hotel is very well located... Near Times Square and other places are easy to join by subway.The staff is professional and nice.Nice room with view on the cityBreakfast is free and you have a free collation between 5/7 pmA great value to discover NYC

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just spent 3 days there and it was a great choice. For some reason, the rate on the 3rd night was almost double the first 2 but still a good choice. Location was great, we were able to get around to everywhere we wanted by foot. Very comfortable for the 6-party girls group (ages 3 to 54!). Very safe, very clean, great food.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent 5 days here in July while my teenage daughter attended some workshops. The property is not in my preferred location when staying in the city as it is a highly congested area but for this week it served us well. It is 3 blocks to port authority (we took the bus into the city) and to the subway. Our suite was small but efficient; a king bed (although it was more like a queen) and a sofa that converted to a sleeper; it faced the interior of the building and was very quiet. A kitchenette (2 burner stove / toaster / microwave w/ all of the pots/pans etc you need) with a full size fridge. The room was clean and modern. Lighting was good; I worked in the room for 3 days with solid wifi connectivity - there are also many outlets in the room - including bedside for your chargers. Breakfast was simple - hot items (eggs/omelets etc) were OK - but there was plenty of cereal / yogurt / bakery items. There is an evening reception Mon-Thurs that includes beer / wine which was great after a long day. Dinner is also offered - which again was OK. But it did allow us to get a snack after a long day (veggies / chips & dip) and take away some food (e.g. chinese / salad - the menu varied each day) for my daughter who had even longer days in the event she wanted a late night dinner. The servers were gracious to offer take away containers. Coffee and tea are always available in the lobby. There is a lovely roof top deck - on the 22nd floor, which we enjoyed each night. Overall, the staff was very accommodating for our needs and extremely pleasant and cheerful. There are many restaurants that are quite good along 9th and 10th avenue if you head north (Hell's Kitchen) so you don't need to go far for a good meal. Overall, a great property and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked in here for four nights and found it to be a great location for exploring NY on foot or getting around easily. Just 10 minutes walk from Times Square, it is convenient for the starting point of the hop-on/hop-off tours, shops and loads of places to eat. If you need to get groceries, hotel have a limited supply on site, but there is a fantastic store down the street across 9th Avenue (Brooklyn Fare) if you need a bit more. Having the breakfast included is a great bonus and quite adequate along with the nightly snack dinner between 5 - 7 on Monday to Thursday nights only, which is handy if you just want a light bite. Hotel is modern and rooms spacious, with the added benefit of a kitchenette with fridge-freezer and microwave. Beds are extremely comfortable and we slept well every night as air-con works great and was very welcome during an NY heatwave. 24 hour tea/coffee in reception is a super addition also plus the benefit of the gym and laundry in the basement ($2.50 for wash or dry in quarters) plus powder. After initial housekeeping hic-ups upon arrival which were sorted quickly, I would recommend this for location, comfort and convenience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I travelled to New York with our three daughters for a five night pre Christmas holiday, and found Homewood suites to be a lovely modern hotel.The room we stayed in had two very comfortable king beds and a sofa bed, and there was still space for a travel cot (crib) for our youngest, which the hotel provided. The kitchenette was a great addition and was equipped with the basics you could need for a short stay. Unfortunately, as beautifully appointed as the bathroom was, it was lacking in a bath, which for us was a small issue travelling with a then 20 moth old. But other than that I cannot fault the room at all.The staff were wonderful, especially the housekeeping team that helped with bedding in the middle of the night.Overall we had a great stay and I would highly recommend it, we would love to stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my first and last time at this hotel. Let me start with the positives. The hotel's location is excellent and the fact that it is located between 8th and 9th Aves means access to great restaurants, transportation, near Madison Square Garden etc. It is central enough without being subjected to crowds. The breakfast is decent and coffee throughout the day is always a plus.That being said, having stayed at other homewood suites, I expected a similar configuration. I was expecting too much. This hotel is good for two persons per room and no more. It was three of us and the room with the king bed and sofa bed was way too small for three persons with luggage!When I arrived there, the front desk rep was not very friendly and when I asked if a bigger room was possible as I was trying for months to access one online, I was told impossible. No visible attempts were made to see what was happening. I tried to call a Manager the following day and I was put on hold and I am still waiting. I made that call on Sunday and today is Wednesday!I was subsequently advised that they were booked to capacity and that their one bedroom suites were almost never available as they were permanently booked out. What was very telling about the service was that I cut a 28 day stay to 4/days and not one manager or supervisor called to find out why the drastic change. That said something to me. I think they need to review the reservations requirements such as number of persons per room etc. I realized for a few dollars more, there are aparthotels in NYC which are roomier and more comfortable to rival this one.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spend a week here in July with husband and 16 year old. Suite was larger than I expected. Bed very comfortable and sofa bed too. Room clean and modern, kitchenette great for snacks and for fridge freezer for drinks etc. being a tea lover I asked for a kettle and after a slight standoff over whether you can make tea using a coffeemaker one duly arrived in the room a couple of hours later. Breakfast was good with a choice of hot and cold. Slightly away from Times Square this hotel is quiet clean and comfortable - I would definitely return!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at Homewood Suites on July 24. I originally booked three nights but I had to change our stay to one night. Even though I booked the hotel months ahead of time, when I changed the number of nights we were staying, the rate was changed to a higher rate, so my original rate did not lock in. My one night stay costs me $415.00 which is outrageous. I made the mistake of not canceling my entire stay and moving to a different hotel. We stayed in a suite, which all suites are located on the 2nd floor. You can hear the noise on the street, so if you are a light sleeper, you cannot stay in a suite. Our suite was nice. The hotel is located a few blocks from Times Square and we were able to walk to most venues and did not have a problem catching the subway to the 911 Memorial. We were encourage to have the front desk call a car service for transportation to the airport, as you never know what a taxi cab will charge. We were told, and I asked one other time about the cost of the car to LaGuardia and were told $55. The driver charged us $60. Not sure if that is the fault of the hotel or the fault of the car company. For the cost of a one night stay in NYC, I would stay elsewhere, because there are hundreds of hotels out there which are just as nice, and cost a lot less.
user_name:
Tom M
St. Louis, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very Friendly staff. The hotel is clean. The rooms are well designed. There is a kitchenette to make our room a little oasis in the city. All hotels in New York are limited on space. So this is a treasure of a find in Midtown. Great location, great facilities, food available twice a day. And a friendly greeting every time you walk in the door. It feels like home!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very surprised to find a very good hotel in New York for not a bad price. Great Breakfast and a pretty good location. Clean and quick in and out. Would stay again. Very helpful staff both at check in and checkout. It was very nice you could leave luggage for the day at no charge after you checked out. Great service for site seeing!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for a week while daughter was in an acting camp. Breakfast and dinners with wine included were a nice touch in a city where nothing is free! Rooms comfortable. Staff on all shifts helpful and friendly. Had a room issue upon check-in at 1am and Tiffany and staff extremely efficient- solved problem and made us comfortable as quickly as they could after a long day. Easy walk to midtown/theaters. Area well lit to walk at night, easy to grab a cab.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for a week in NYC. Our room was huge by NY standards, with 2 queen beds, a sleeper sofa with sitting area and a full kitchen. The hotel is new so everything is clean & fresh. Loved having a kitchen for taking home leftovers & a large refrigerator for drinks. The evening reception was awesome, with free wine & beer. Overall this hotel provides an amazing value for NYC in a convenient location. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was lucky having a chance to stay in the Homewood suites with my family. The staff are very friendly and helpful , the breakfast was fresh and tasty.Location is perfect in the middle of Manhattan.I will definitely stay there again in my next trip.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites in midtown Manhattan is a perfect choice for both business and pleasure. The rooms are soothing shades of gray (maybe not 50!) and are modern and well appointed and are clean and well stocked with toiletries. The beds are very comfy and the duvets and pillows were crisp and clean. The kitchenette boasts a full-sized fridge, a two top ceramic burner, dishwasher, sink, and a nice range of cooking utensils including a toaster, coffeemaker with a wide array of coffees and teas, pots, pans, utensils,and plates, etc. If you have kids and need to fix some snacks or keep baby food/formula cool or have leftovers from dinner, the kitchen area is a godsend. The lounge area has a free light dinner Monday through Thursday (shrimp one night!) that is plentiful and includes free beer on tap or wine by the glass, which is surely welcome at the end of the day. As well, there is a free breakfast every morning that is substantial (eggs, sausage, yogurt, bagels, breads, fruit, juice, etc.) that is very generous and provides options for both vegetarians and meat eaters alike. The staff is courteous and friendly and check-in or out is a snap. The hotel is a short walk from Penn Station, Macy's. the Empire State Building, and several subway routes and buses and there are several drug stores, convenience stores, and restaurants nearby, but there is always hot coffee, tea, and fresh fruits available in the lobby. I've stayed in many different NYC hotels and this one was by far the best deal.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very happy with our choice. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was extremely well appointed. The elevators go fast. The rooms are soundproof. You may want to unplug the fridge becore sleeping because it is noisy We had takeout on the rooftop - highly recommended. (We bought the food from Wok to Walk.)However, if you need a third person to use the sofa bed, be aware that it's not comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After touring all over USA we stayed for a week here in NYC and you sure learn to enjoy the smaller things in life. This Hotel supplied you, as part of the stay, Breakfast every day dinner (Monday to Thursday) a 24 hour, help yourself coffee bar it really was like a Gold Mine. Our room had a massive fridge, dishwasher, cooktop and all kitchen accessories. The room was roomy and the very clean, loved staying here it made New York that much more special. A great stay Thanks Homewood suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at the Homewood suites for four nights and were very pleased. Manhattan/Midtown hotels can be quite disappointing but this one was NOT!Very good free breakfast and enough space in the breakfast area. The room was quite large and had a kitchenette. We were especially happy with the fact that everything was very clean, modern and comfortable. All the appliances worked as they should. the staff is super helpful and kind, especially Jennifer, who helped us with our bagage and helped us find a cab to the airport. We recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The people here were amazing. Every person on staff was nice and helpful The breakfasts were better than the dinners... but free wine is a plus. Also the beds and bathrooms were clean! Big shoutout to the night staff.
user_name:
Kathy E
Creve Couer, Mo., United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Another stay and was my last. The NYC hotel scene is dynamic and filled with choices. Unless you have a fetish for their points, just not worth it. The breakfast is not bad. The rest just doesn't stack up. Gym and other amenities don't meet the RE standard - especially in the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great hotel with very helpful staff. It is in a convenient location for seeing the NYC sites and easy walking distance to Broadway shows! It has been very recently redone, love the floors in the room instead of carpet, and also loved the rooftop deck.
user_name:
Debbie M
Surfside Beach, South Carolina

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall this is a nice hotel. We didn't know in advance they offer complementary breakfast and evening snacks, so this was a big plus for us. The breakfast includes orange juice, apple juice, lemonade, ice cold water, coffee, tea and hot chocolate for beverages. You can choose between sugar frosted cornflakes, granola with dried berries, honeyloops or you can taste them all ;-). Everyday they have yoghurt and berries (fresh and dried) with sliced almonds. They also offer a different plate with eggs (omelette with vegetables, with cheese, with pork, scrambled, ...) and some kind of meat (pork sausages, pork hash with white sauce, turkey burger, ...). Different kinds of bread and breakfast cakes/cookies are included, also sweet jelly, butter and cream cheese (diet and original).At evening (between 5 and 7 p.m.) you can go to the dining room for diner. The staff calls it that way, but I honestly think of it as 'snacks' because there isn't enough choice to really enjoy it like you should for diner. Most of the time the dishes were really salted and totally not healthy (hotdogs, burgers, ...). But I enjoyed the baby spinach salad on Wednesday.Now some advice for the staff and complaints about the hotel... Every area in the hotel is very cold. It's nice to enter a cold place when you've just had a long and exhausting walk in Manhattan, but when you're sitting in the lobby or dining room to enjoy a cup of tea, you definately need a cardigan or sweater. It is really that cold! The housekeeping also needs to check the drawers in the bedside cupboards, because there was a dirty handkerchief in there when we arrived. It was still there when we left the room before check-out. They also didn't clean the shower that well. I find hygiene very important and I don't want anything in my room from the previous visitor and definately no used handkerchiefs...Also one little thing. The refrigerator in our room made a really annoying noise at night. It often jumps on when we were asleep and then we couldn't sleep anymore without ear plugs. We enjoyed the location of the hotel. It is close to Penn Station, where you easily can take the train to anywhere in New York. With these little adjustments our stay in this hotel would be perfect. Special thanks to the guy who called my boyfriend "Scott" ;-). He's very friendly!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Things were perfect at our recent stay at the Homewood Suites in NYC until the end of our stay. My granddaughter turned on the kitchen faucet to get some water for her water bottle. She's 7 and weighs 58.5 lbs. She moved the faucet to accommodate the positioning of the bottle and the faucet broke. She was upset! I immediately contacted the front desk and maintenance came quickly. It could not be repaired. The problem? I received and email while at the hotel to say there was a 200$ repair cost. I was there at the time of email, back to pick up our luggage that they kindly held for us, and NO ONE said one work about the added charges. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE be mindful and human enough to tell this to my face not while I'm standing there checking out and having our bags stored while we waited for the train back to CT. VERY POOR CoMMUNICATION in this area. I am VERY disappointed of the lack of human contact regarding this issue. It was good but I will consider another place to stay when I return to NYC in the fall.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Decided last minute to go to NYC and booked on Hotel Tonight. This place was perfect. Great location, easy parking, spotless room that is brand new!! Breakfast included and a lovely rooftop deck. Travelling alone so I really appreciated the safe neighbourhood and friendly staff. Great lobby, nice hallways and perfect room. And......the wifi actually worked and was free!!! Can't recommend it highly enough.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: When I arrived at this hotel, my dad had the credit card we used on file but he hadn't authorized it, and we needed to contact him in Canada to fix it. After a busy day of travel we were stressed out about not getting into our room until it was authorized, and there was a big line up of people and we were starting to get anxious. One of the staff members (Tiara) was so calm and patient in helping us and told us exactly what we needed to do and was incredibly helpful and friendly despite us taking a while to sort everything out. She even spoke with my dad on the phone to make the communication easier and went above and beyond to relieve our stress and make sure we were happy with the service. Because of the positive and helpful staff I will happily choose Homewood Suites next time I am visiting New York for any reason.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've been at this hotel twice. It is a very nice hotel in the fashion district of New York. The staff are courteous and the rooms are comfortable. The rooms are a little expensive, but what do you expect it is New York City!There are numerous things to do in the area and plenty of restaurants for fine dining.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was well maintained and clean. rooms are small but laid out well with all of the necessary conveniences. Having a full size fridge and microwave was great. Close to subway, Herald Square shopping and Time square. Complimentary breakfast was average but I'm not a big breakfast eater. The nightly reception was a great feature allowing for a nice winddown from the day's sightseeing with a choice of a premium beer on tap and a light snack before going out to dinner. the staff were extremely friendly with everyone I encountered asking how I was doing and wishing me a good day even if a brief encounter on the elevator. You can tell it was a philosophy of hospitality that the entire staff had bought into. Stayed for 7 nights and will definitely choose this hotel for my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed with some friends for just one night. Great location close to Times Square and Penn Station. We had an efficiency room that was complete with kitchenette. If we'd stayed longer, it would have been nice a big plus. Very clean! Staff was very nice too. Before check in and after check out, they held our bags for use which maximized our time touring NYC. Breakfast was better than expected and free! Great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed between June 30th and July 7th, 2015; very comfortable rooms, really quiet rooms and in excellent condition (almost like new, the hotel itself should be around a year or two old), fully equipped kitchen, excellent layout and larger than average hotel rooms in Manhattan. Its all about the rooms, nonetheless breakfast and the manager´s dinner between Monday and Thursday(5pm to 7pm) are a definite plus.The area is not bad at all, very safe and quiet, its just not very fancy but you are 3 blocks away from Times Square and two blocks away to MSG and Penn Station going on the opposite direction. The staff was very friendly and they even have a small coin laundry and a couple of computers with printers on the concourse. Free and solid Wifi.I definitely recommend this Hotel either for business or with family, you can´t go wrong!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is fantastic. Clean, great friendly staff, wonderful breakfast AND dinner buffet! My room was across from the elevator and I never heard one sound come from the hallway. Room amenities were great. Location at 37th and 8th was perfect. Loved it and as a Travel Agency owner and Agent that is saying a lot!
user_name:
Lisa B
Lansdale, PA, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I love this hotel, its near Port Authority you can walk everywhere or hop on the train at 35th. The staff is very friendly and helpful here. They are all team players which is great. Last weekend I needed help with getting to Brooklyn and three people pitched in to help me with directions. Everyone here keeps a smile on there face and are very friendly. I recommend this hotel.Th4 hotel room reminds me of my luxury apartment in Downtown Silver Spring. I feel at home when I come here.
user_name:
Niyana B
Silver Spring, MD, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the hotel is located in a great area. I do not usually write reviews on this website but I was overwhelmed by the diligence and aid provided by Tiara at the front desk. Every time i need help she radiates positivity.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I only chose this hotel because my in law's were staying at the Double Tree, and we wanted to be close to them. The location of this hotel is not the best. The streets are not clean, they smell and there's a lot of construction. There's no parking either. We had to park in a public parking next door, and I did not feel safe there because it is a valet-style parking. You MUST give your car key to the attendants there to park it for you. It cost us $50 for 24H.As for the hotel itself, the lobby is quite small, but clean. The staff at the reception were nice and welcoming. The room was small (what do you expect from NY?), but it was clean. The only dirt that I found was on the bed sheets. It looked like someone had done some mechanic work on a car, and it did not wash off the sheets very well. The kitchenette was a nice addition, but we did not use it. There was free coffee and tea in the room. There was free coffee in the lobby available all the time as well.The biggest complaint I have was the free breakfast that came with the room. It was meh. Holiday Inn has better breakfasts. There weren't many options, and no eggs! They served mini bagels, too. Why not serve regular sized for adults and mini for kids or something? I know it was included with the room rate, but it's not like the room was cheap either. For $350 a night, we'd expect better breakfast, at least.Another complaint that I have were the elevators. You have to wait a long time to get into one which were very small and only fit a few people at a time. If you have big luggage and many family members, you'd probably have to go up in groups.Would I stay here again? No, unless I have no other option.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very comfortable and spacious. Great Hot breakfast with 24 hour coffee and tea station. Great location a couple of blocks walking to Time Square, great for a party 3 to 4 people. Will stay here again when comming back to Newyork with the family.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Traveling with support animals or pets can be daunting, especially in New York. I opted for a room with a balcony they could walk outside. What a great idea! Great to be able to stick to routines while traveling.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall the Homewood Suites was the best choice for a weekend getaway to New York. The hotel is located near Times Square, but slightly away from the hustle of everything. There is a subway stop about two blocks away which makes getting to other parts of the city. The lobby is very upscale. It actually looks better than some Hilton Hotel lobbies. The staff were very courteous and helpful with getting me settled in. The rooms are nice size for New York. Kitchenette was very beneficial when warming up leftovers and hosting friends on patio for lunch. The roof top terrace is great for lounging with friends before heading out. The rooftop views are limited but still nice. Breakfast was a little lack luster, but since its free I guess I can really complain. Would be nice to have some additional items like eggs and breakfast potatoes.This will most likely be my go to place when visiting New York in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Perfect location and slept great. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Room was clean and modern. Bathroom has to be seen to be believed. I love the sliding door and airy feel. Bed was very comfortable and the blackout shades made sleeping easy. Could not believe how quiet it was and how well I slept. Thanks for a great experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everything about this hotel is perfect. Rooms are very large for Midtown, price was good and it was very clean. I am staying here again. There were no issues at all and the staff was very friendly and helpful. It would be perfect if there was a restaurant in the hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent 11 nights here. Really central and near public transport. Comfortable, well equipped studio apartment. Everything worked. Very quiet considering its location. Breakfast good as was the meal offered four evenings each week. Outside eating area on ground floor and a roof terrace on 22nd floor.The staff were wonderful. Friendly, knowledgeable and really helpful. We felt valued. This is the third time we have stayed in USA with this chain and will certainly do so again. Thank you to Daniel, Tiffany, Lenny, Wilma, Hugo and all your colleagues.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is a beautiful Homewood Suites and is located conveniently to Time Square and Penn Station. The staff was extremely helpful and I was amazed at their outgoing friendliness and fantastic customer service.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: As a spur of the moment anniversary night, my wonderful husband booked us a last minute room through the Hotel Tonight app. When we got there the staff was sooo friendly and that already set our day off into the right direction. The app booked us for a double bed room but the staff quickly changed that for us and put us in a beautiful king bed suite for our stay for the night. It was a weekday so we enjoyed the free dinner buffet, that started an hour after check in (perfect timing after the subway trip). The wine and beer were also a delicious treat and great starter to a gorgeous night. The view from the rooftop, especially at night is great. Bring up a drink and enjoy the tranquility of being on a NYC rooftop while feeling like you have stepped out of the concrete jungle and into an oasis. Now for the room, perfect. Bathroom, clean and well stocked with designer soaps and lotions which I am thankful for. Having a kitchen in the room was great cuz I got to heat up the food we brought up from the dinner buffet, as well as cook food we picked up on our way. The king bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Hubby knocked out at the end of the night almost immediately and slept deeper than his has in a long long time; we both did. Having a 12pm check out time was perfect too. Overall our last minute anniversary getaway was perfect. Hubby is already looking forward to our next hotel stay. So thanks to the great staff for the hospitality! As a hospitality professional myself, this trip definitely made a lasting impression for all the right reasons.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent location. Easy to visit sights. Room was clean and modern but did find it a little small for three people especially the kitchen facilities. The breakfast selection I found a little unusual such as pork sausage sauce. That was down to me being fussy and not used to American tastes. Staff were excellent and the complimentary dinner laid on was a small selection but it was excellent in quality with free wine and beer. A definite plus. Also, there was complimentary hot drinks in the lobby which u could help yourself to 24/7. All in all a recommended hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites in mid-town NYC is right in the thick of all of the noise and excitement of New York City. On the inside, Homewood is calming, relaxing, and welcoming. Every staff member was friendly, welcoming, and helpful. We were on the 18th floor: beds were comfortable, the small kitchen was a great addition. We loved the extra table that slid out from under the desk. Free breakfast every day. On several weekdays, there is a "reception" which includes free juice, beer, wine and food. Tossed salad was included each night. Great stay, great hotel! Thanks Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff is very friendly. Free hot breakfast is great, but the evening social is even greater! There's food, wine and beer! The room is comfortable, perfect for a family of three. We had a king bed and a sofa bed. Penn station and Times Square are walking distance from the hotel (four blocks approximately). Of course I would book a room here again if I ever come back to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Service was excellent. Tons of hot water, and the beds were great. My personal highlight was a young lady at the front counter. Absolutely huge smile and made us feel like we the only ones there. Look for Tiara. Her smile will make your day.
user_name:
Bruce B
DeSoto, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: i got an king room in the 19th floor, the room was quiet and i select the temperature i want. there was free breakfeast every day, i stayed 7 days. the dinner was free too, but only on mondays to thursdays. the only problem i had is with the cleaning: the woman that cleaned my room always came at 4! at my last day she didn't cleaned my room. and at the check-in i was a little bit crowded in the main room. but it's a nice option if you don't want to spend soo much money on food. and the wi-fi is a bit slow.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked a last minute stay at Homewood Suites and didn't really expect anything out of the ordinary. 110 US dollars/night doesn't really get you that far in The Big Apple. Great location first of all. Walking distance to Penn Station and from there a short ride with NJ Transit to Newark Airport. Also close to Broadway and Times Square.Clean, spacious and well appointed rooms. Complimentary wifi. Minimal street noise (17th floor). Descent breakfast buffet American style - pancakes, hash browns, bagels, juice...All in all I'd definitely recommend it to anyone on a budget.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was very functional. It had a small kitchenette with stove top, dishwasher, microwave and fridge. The bed was very large and comfortable. The bathroom was large'ish for the. Room but very clean and functional. Overall the room was great and provided me with all I needed. But.. The wifi was very slow and at times difficult to connect to, the room looked onto a building that had one particular nocturnal resident playing loud music and the Aircon was rather noisy but needed as the weather was hot and humid.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: All staff were extremely friendly & helpful, we chose a large studio which was perfect. The breakfast gave a number of choices from fruit ,cereal ,cooked. The evening meals were spicey & as I prefer plain unspiced food it was not for me however when we booked we did so on the basis we would eat out. there was coffee tea etc free 24hrs a day, I would stay here again any time I come to New York , the dinning area is small so we came down early to avoid the peak time. I stayed 20/06/2015 to 28/06/2015

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was built less than a year ago, so everything is nice and new and updated. We were blown away when we learned that they offered free breakfast, cocktail hour, and DINNER! Unheard of in the hotel industry. The rooms were wonderful, with a kitchenette, and a little couch and desk. They made wonderful use of a narrow space, and it never felt cramped or crowded. The location was ideal! Just a few blocks to MSG, times square, the garment district, and not a bad walk to the west village. I will definitely be looking to stat here on my next trip to new york!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel seems to be fairly new and remodeled. The rooms are larger than typical Manhattan hotel rooms which is a nice touch. The location is fantastic, quick to get in an out of especially if you are using the tunnel. The con- The elevator directly across from our room was having an issue and making a horrific noise. I called down to the desk to find out what the issue was and they said they'd send their "engineer" up to check it out. He had no clue what he was doing and did nothing. Had to call down again when the noise continued and the person was very rude and not helpful. Best solution was they'd send us up earplugs.....earplugs?! It took me suggesting they shut that particular elevator down since they had a couple of other ones....I wouldn't think the guest should have to think of that. I was supposed to get extra Hilton Honors credits for my troubles but those were not issued either.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for our honeymoon in June, simply can,t fault the place, close to everything,very friendly staff spotlessly clean and the most comfortable bed ever. Food and drinks very welcome and complimentary. Our first time in New York and if we are every lucky enough to come back will definitely stay here. Only negative thing about our holiday was very rude British lady on plane.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed in the hotel with a friend last month and we liked a lot! They have a cocktail from Monday to Thursday, the location couldn't be better and the staff is great! Specially Lenny from the restaurant, who was very kind and helpfull, and the girls in the front desk.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for a week in June in a one bedroom suite, a true suite in that it has a separate living area, the other "suites" are one room. All good and clean , on the second floor. The breakfast was chaotic if you went down too late, and the hot choices were very manufactured , so it's just toast or bagels or cereal . The tea and coffee were dismal , weak tea , and horrid coffee. While other reviews have stated the convenient location , you must be aware that this comes at a compromise in that the area is very grotty, compared to other areas of Manhattan , scruffy surroundings and smelly rubbish strewn streets , that you have to navigate past the rear of the port authority bus station in order to get to any decent eateries . The staff here are as any where else , they do their job to check you in efficiently , but I don't understand the gushing reviews from previous posters , naming members of staff as stand outs , we found them quite terse , and in no way extraordinary . I say , stay elsewhere , there is much nicer accommodation in other parts of Manhattan , near to subways.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Picked this venue because it offered full facilities in every room and included breakfast. First impressions were very good. Nice size room, compact cooking facilities, a dishwasher, good size fridge, nice size swivelling TV, nice bathroom, nice bed, desk, couch and a writing/computer desk.Second impressions showed a few negative points. Tiny wardrobe with a good amount of space taken up by the ironing board and iron. The shower door even when closed leaked. There was a certain amount of construction noise from across the streetMy family and I visited at Easter so it was very busy. Sometimes morning breakfast was bouncing and so busy you could hardly move around. The staff were simply outstanding.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Well located near the Jarvitz Convention center, Times Square and Penn station. Modern nicely decorated rooms with a compact kitchenette, but a little small. For a "suite", I am expecting a separate living area from the bedroom area. Hallways are narrow. Staff I'd very nice. No bar, restaurant, parking or pool. Complimentary breakfast was weak and very busy. For $450 there must be better.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff was accommodating. We stayed in the efficiency on the 22nd floor. The view from the terrace was nice. In the morning, the complimentary breakfast was good for mass produced food. The coffee was better! We requested one of their cars to ride to the airport. They provided that timely. The fee was $55 to be taken to LaGuardia. Overall I enjoyed the stay and the room. The tv is a late model smart tv and there were enough channels for me. They allowed us to check out late which was great as our flight is at 5pm. The walk to Times Square was under 10 minutes. That was a plus. I would come again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here during January 2015 ( 2 Adults, 4 kids (9,11,1315)... Sorry for the late review.....I completely forgot....We were welcomed by Daniel and although it was freezing outside his warm and friendly 'welcome' made us feel right at home. He had us checked in, in no time and offered us hot chocolate and coffee before we were shown to our rooms.We were extremely happy with our stay here. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The reception staff were all extremely helpful and kind. They always greeted with genuine smiles and offered friendly advice. We enjoyed the simple breakfast in the mornings...bagels, eggs and coffee was sufficient for us until lunch. We didn't have dinner, although also complimentary during weekdays. I also made use of the washing machines and dryers which were very useful and can take huge loads. We found the location very convenient and walked to Time Square and Fifth Ave every day. The complimentary beverages are really great especially when you return from a walk and you are freezing. My kids were addicted to the hot chocolate. I wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else because Homewood Suites ticked all the right boxes for me and offers family friendly spacious accommodation.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Well appointed hotel in a fantastic location. Easy access to the entire city & public transportation. The hotel was very clean and had a wonderful staff. Our special thanks to Thomas, Daniel & Junior who were extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. They helped make this one of our best vacations. Kudos to Homewood!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites is an attractive, contemporary, well-maintained hotel with a great staff. From the front desk staff to the the attendants at breakfast to the very helpful concierge, who helped my group of six book airport transportation for our departure day. One slight disappointment was that beds had no blankets to be found. Don't hesitate to ask housekeeping to provide one, however. They were happy to assist. The hotel location is perfect if you want to be centrally located in Manhattan. Easy walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, shopping, restaurants, bus tours, etc. Homewood Suites helped make our three day trip to NYC a good one!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was there this month and the experience was great, the rooms are really good and clean. Is completely equipped with a kitchen and all. Also they have a nice terrace at the top with a view that is not the Rockefeller but you can feel how the city is. At the moment of the Breakfast my friend that can not eat gluten stuff there was a girl called Lenny (if I don't remember bad) that was really helpful looking the right food. Thanks to she the experience was better thought.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff is outstanding. Everyone (front desk, housekeeping, maintenance, food service, security, et al.) was smiling, helpful and went out of their way to be kind, all while doing a terrific job. My sense was that they enjoyed working here, which I can only guess reflects on management too.The lobby is attractive. My room was very nice and not as small as you'd expect in midtown. The free hot breakfast made the day a little less hectic. A great place stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location. Great hotel. Contemporary rooms with all the essentials needed for a comfortable extended stay. Complimentary breakfast and manager's reception are a great value added. Convenient to the subway for travel both uptown and downtown and within walking distance to many popular attractions.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed here for 4 days with my 2 children. It has a great location - We did not have to take a cab even once - we generally walked everywhere. Room was a very good size (by NYC standards). Rooms were modern and well equipped. Staff was very helpful. Breakfast was good though slightly limited in terms of choice. Evening snack with beer/wine was a great touch. I would def stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: one of the best hotel i've been to. staffe were so nice and helpful, rooms are very comfortable, clean, and spacious. location is realy close to averywhere and it realy do feels like a home away from home (guest laundry and businness center were a great help). coming back here for sure

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room is compact,but uses every inch to its best advantage. It is an efficiency wth refrigerator, stove,microwave and dishwasher. The staff was smiling and helpful. The rooms were clean and NEW! Very Comfortable at a great price.....oh yes, and you can check in online the night before. Hilton has really gotten its act together. A great place to stay. Oh yes, Free Breakfast and Dinner available...coffee 24 hrs. Wine and beer at dinner time.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I visited New York for a week and stayed at the Homewood suits by Hilton. Its location is fantastic and the environment is as being greeted by family. they make you feel really comfortable and they offer the best variety of food, services and hospitality!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everytime I go there it's always so nice to be there. I love everything about it, even though it's supposed to be cheap it's a very pleasant and clean atmosphere to live in. The buffet is amazing too.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The staff was very professional, and kind. A nice warm cookie warm cookie waiting for you when you check in. the room was very spacious for me. Close to everything. Bed was comfy, no noise. Left a very good imprsession on me. will be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The service far exceeded the room value. I was pleasantly surprised at the level of service that I received. Aside from the great service, I can't tell you how much the ambiance surpassed my expectations. This hotel is only about a year old and it is styled with clean lines and modern decor that give an overall sense of a higher level hotel. While the kitchenette is a great perk that some may use; it's not something that I would use in New York (maybe if I had kids and a lot more time), but, it's still a nice (and trendy) perk if needed. I do love the free breakfast (more than just pastries and cereal) and the weekly light dinner and drinks! The hotel is located in a great area, 3 blocks from Penn Station and about 6 blocks from TImes Square. Oh.... The bed was great and so was the A.C.!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Had a great stay here, not a single negative about it. The location is great, and while it was a wee bit away, was even able to run to Central park for my daily exercise! Handy to all things midtown and an easy walk from Penn Station. The lobby, eating areas and guestrooms are quite lovely and new. Breakfast was nice, and the two nights we were there they had complimentary wine and dinner buffet. Wow. We enjoyed the wine, and while the food looked and smelled delish we had other dinner plans. I loved our room, but next time I would request an upper floor as our view was quite nonexistent. The bedding was great, just an all over comfortable and modern suite area that I could see being quite comfortable in if I was a business traveler, especially. Full kitchen! The staff is indeed very friendly and accomodating to requests. Loved this hotel, and will be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My sister-in-law and myself stayed at Homewood Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan last week. It's a very nice hotel. Staff is very nice. Room was very nice. Love the roof top lounge area. The breakfast buffet was the nicest breakfast I've ever seen at a hotel! The food was delicious with a lovely area to eat! I'm sure the evening meal that they offer was wonderful but we had reservations out that night. I would definitely recommend this hotel for others to stay. It's very close to Penn Station, the subway, and Times square. Thank you for a great stay!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is at 8th Avenue and 37th. I con't consider it in Times Square, but it is close. The location is convenient to the subway, Hop On Hope Off bus stops and Macy's. The room was quiet. There were 3 of us in a King room with a pull out twin size sofa. We were a little crowded, but most rooms in NYC are not large. The room had a nice, modern decor and a mini kitchen. The breakfasts were good and we enjoyed the evening reception with wine and a meal on a couple of our nights there. The staff was friendly and helpful. We received excellent advice and assistant from the concierges. I would stay here again if we wanted to stay in this part of NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan was a really great surprise. I got a nice rate from HotelTonight ($152/night) and was expecting an average chain hotel room. The Homewood Suties rooms had hardwood floors, which was perfect - the room didn't smell like a hotel and I wasn't wondering what was lurking in the carpet when I took off my shoes. Everything was placed well; so often hotel rooms have outlets and light switches in awkward places, but these were in just the right place. I could turn off the lamp without getting out of bed; I could use my phone while charging it in bed, etc.The room was really quiet all night; I didn't hear any hallway noise. Breakfast was good, with egg dishes, yogurt and fruit, pastries and cereals. My only complaint was that the breakfast room was small for the number of guests the hotel can accommodate. The staff were all very friendly, and housekeeping met my requests.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Other than the electrical issue/inconvenience, my stay was very nice. The staff members are all very friendly and accomodating. I will definetly stay at the Homewood in the future and recommend the hotel to my business associates and friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stopped here on our way unexpectedly after a concert in NYC we booked a discounted rate through Hotel Tonight App. We were very pleased!! Room very clean. King size bed / kitchenette / shower. Breakfast was decent and included in the price. Easy check in and out. Great deal for NYC and very clean!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the room was clean and well equipped. very friendly staff, we found a bottle of wine in the room for our wedding anniversary; we drank the wine on the rooftop with view. The ventilation system was very loud, but we managed to shut it off and then the room was really quiet. very good cold and warm breakfast (terrace was still closed) and free hot drinks all day (very pleasant to enjoy a coffee/tea on the rooftop when coming back at night) . we did not take the evening buffet. excellent location, walking distance from times square and public transport. definitely a four star hotel. good price. free wifi but sometimes slow.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Until the morning we left, I would have said this was one of the best hotel stays ever! The Pros:1) it's beautiful 2) staff work hard to make it great3) Morning breakfast4) evening meal (Mon-Thurs)5) hot coffee all the time6) rooms are great & spacious7) comfortable beds8) great locationThe con: the day before we left (we were leaving early the next morning), we asked the lady at the desk where to park our car to load the luggage. She showed us the space directly in front of the hotel. When we parked there, only long enough to get loaded, we received a $115 ticket!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I am going to change its name to Homewood Sweet Suites. Homewood Suites does not disappoint. Have stayed at other Homewood Suites in Clearwater and Tampa Westshore and my experience has always been great.Miss Tiara at the front desk was lovely; Hector got real milk for me which was very much appreciated; smiles from the whole staff all the time. Who said New Yorkers do not smile. (The staff has been well trained.) Had a king with terrace (809). Laminated clean floor - better than carpets. There is no real milk in the sweet suite but you can get it in the lobby where the coffee is. Bed and pillows very comfortable; kitchen a plus and, best of all, a ceiling fan! Turned the air conditioner off and slept like a dog (all night). Homewood Suites is recommended very highly. Will definitely go back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We recently spent 4 nites here with our 15 and 9 year old grandsons. We usually don't spend this much on a hotel but the location and free breakfast and dinners were appealing to us. Usually we get a very early start and then crash early. It was really nice to return to our hotel and have a nice buffet waiting, not having to wait in a restaurant with tired kids. Our room was excellent - big, spacious, 2 queen beds,mini kitchen, couch sitting area. We stocked the fridge with treats and coke from a nearby convenience store. The lobby had hot coffee complimentary 24 hrs. And the location was great.- 5-10 minute walk to nearby metros at 42nd Street and Penn Station. The staff was exceptional...welcoming and always anxious to make our stay positive. I can't think of anything they could do to improve our experience.i should mention that the wifi is great and breakfasts featured a variety of hot dishes and the evening buffet is available to guests M-Th. We didn't use the fitness center.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have been to NYC five times and this hotel ranked first in location and amenities (free internet, free buffet breakfast and free tea/coffee during the day). The 8th floor room (809) we had was quiet, spacious with a sofa/bed and a small private patio (WOW!). I love having a fridge in the room. We didn't do any cooking since there are lots of restaurants/eateries close to the hotel. The location cannot be beat. Coming from EWR, we took the NJ Transit to Penn Station and walked a few blocks to the hotel. We booked this hotel through Priceline Express Deals and hope that we would get this hotel again the next time we visit NYC. We truly had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Many Good points, the rooms themselves, the cleanliness, the location, the staff, food and drinks, but 1 negative point and it did put a downer on our stay, The suites are the most expensive rooms in the hotel, but they are on the 2nd floor and get all of the street noise. These rooms need triple glazing at least as New York is not the quietest city. This led to disturbed sleep nearly every night

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family of 4 just left New York and stayed 4 nights at the Homewood Suites in a queen-queen studio suite on the 4th floor facing 37th street. Room was so spacious and beds super comfortable. We loved it! Fourth floor was perfect because we could easily walk down to lobby when elevators were busy--- especially during breakfast rush. Maybe we got lucky, but no street noise at all, so I would highly recommend lower floor for efficient access to lobby. Breakfast is a bit of a stampede, but that's usually the case at hotels with free breakfasts, so we are use to it, and the friendly staff does their best to keep up with the food and clearing tables quickly. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend Homewood! Only drawback is not the hotel itself but location. Walks to subway stations can be long and 8th avenue is not the best for walking back to the hotel at night. All in all, though, great hotel! Love the roof deck!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I visited NYC for the first time. We did a lot of research on hotels and decided on Homewood Suites by Hilton Midtown... Our expectations have been exceeded.. This hotel is in a great location close enough to Times Square but not too close.. Close enough to Subway (Penn Station).. Rooms are spacious and offer a mini kitchen with a full size fridge.. Onsite " clean" laundry which is a bonus so you do not have to incur hefty hotel laundry bills.. Also basic dinner is included Mon-Thurs with a choice of wine or beer.. Great option if you have been exploring the city all day and just want a quick bite. Definitely highly recommend this hotel... We will be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hello FB Friends. Back in April, I was in New York. I stayed at the Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan Times Square South. I would be remiss if I failed to thank the people that made my stay memorable. Thank you Daniel and Allan for attending to my needs when I first checked-in. Leslie, thank you for responding to my room requests and specifications. Special thanks to Michael, and Danny. Michael, I appreciated the great service at breakfast and dinner, specifically the complimentary wine. Danny, you were an outstanding concierge.
