Your suggestions for shows and attractions made my trip that much more special. I most definitely will be back to visit New York. And to make my stay that much more distinctive, exceptional, and unique I plan to stay at the Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan Times Square South

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for just 2 nights but the beds were so comfortable I didn't want to leave. The breakfast each morning was really good. Think some type of eggs, meat, fruit, cereal and toast/bagels. Also, they always had a fresh batch of oatmeal which was filling and delicious. Would return again without a doubt.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our King Suite was spacious and very comfortable. The rooftop seating was relaxing. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially Leslie. Victor was also most helpful arranging transportation when needed. The breakfast was good with friendly staff. I would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay, especially the evening reception. Telisha was a great server filling my wine glass a few times. The hotel was only a few blocks from most areas to catch a ride such as the subway, tour around the city and more. Not far from Times Square too.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We can't wait to return to Homewood Suites! We had a wonderful experience and everything about this hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff members were friendly and courteous. Our room was exactly what we needed when traveling with a toddler. The refrigerator in the room made it really convenient to store her milk and snacks. The complimentary breakfast was great. Last but not least, the hotel is located minutes away from Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites Hotel was fantastic. it was the quietest room I have ever stayed in. I was there with my wife celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and we didn't hear anyone else when we were in our room and the hotel was 100% booked. The staff was excellent and very helpful. Irecommend this hotel to everyone who needs to stay in New York.
user_name:
Gerry M D
Southbury, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the hotel is very conveniently located, it is just near times square. even the Penn station is few blocks away. the suites were well maintained and had all the stuff, which one needs if he is staying there long. breakfast is okay, very limited options for vegeterians

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had absolutely no expectations when I went to Homewood, since Manhattan hotels tend to have very small rooms, with little comfort. The price tag of less than 100 dollars a night made me expect for the smallest place a man can live in.For my surprise, the room was big, comfortable, with lots of amenities inside. Staff was attentive and cordial. Wifi had a minor issue that the hotel staff fixed in little time and with no effort from me. In the end, the bill was very inexpensive for a place like Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall great hotel for our trip . Very clean , nice setting perfect location for what we had planned very close to Times Square. The breakfast included in the price was phenomenal as well as all the waitstaff involved in serving and cleaning up the breakfast. Lenny (female) was sweet,hardworking and efficient.Rooftop sitting area a nice place to relax . Leslie working the front desk was extremely nice and helpful . There are two reasons I do not rate five out of five one being Daniel at the front desk , he was rude and unhelpful two different times as compared to everyone else who was extremely pleasant and helpful. The second reason is the lack of shelving in the bathrooms .

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My Father and I had a great stay during our business trip in NYC. The location was prime and the accommodations were great. We were welcomed and cared for by a very sweet employee named Tiffany who was nothing shy of excellence. She made our stay feel as though we were truly welcome at the Homewood despite having to deal with our complications checking in. If you are traveling into NYC I highly recommend you stay at the Homewood Suites if you are looking for tremendous service and hospitality.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my second time staying at the Homewood Suites in Manhattan (the first time had only been for a night and this time it was for 4 nights). I was planning to attend BookExpo America and selected the hotel because it is so centrally located to the Javits Center, Times Square and Penn Station (fantastic travel hub in the city). This hotel is no more than a 10 minute walk from any of those things, plus the hotel is less than a year old and gorgeous.I actually arranged for a block of rooms for myself and my friends as we were all attending the same event from all across the country and wanted to be near each other. Both Marina and Natalia worked with me to give us a wonderful discount to make the trip more affordable for everyone. Not only that, but they also let us invite a few friends over and have a get-together on their gorgeous rooftop lounge area. The rooftop has a spectacular view of the city and the Hudson River. My friends not staying in the same hotel as us were jealous (rightfully so).My entire stay the staff was more than amazing. If I needed more towels they were delivered promptly. If I wanted to order pizza and wasn't sure what place was best, the front desk guys told us their favorite place to order from (they were right - it was amazing). Marina and Natalia personally came out to greet me, and I heard from all my friends staying in the hotel that they loved the hotel and their rooms.I slept on the pullout sofa in our room and was surprised to find I actually slept better on it than my king size mattress at home. Like, really? Even a pullout sleeper sofa is amazing here, too?!The dining area is large and comfortable and includes and outdoor space that is enclosed and shaded giving you privacy and fresh air without blinding sunlight. I cannot say enough about this hotel and the staff. Every hotel should aspire to be this clean, courteous, and hospitable. I've already booked 2 more stays for this year (2015) with the Homewood Suites in Manhattan. I refuse to stay anywhere except this hotel from now on.
user_name:
Hannah M
Bel Air, Maryland, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was Great. We wanted a place close to Time Square and the Train station (Penn Station) this was the perfect fit. The Staff went out of their way to make our visit perfect. From an early check in/stow the luggage to storing our luggage so we could go out and about until our evening train departure. The breakfast was great and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We Couldn't have been more pleased!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 6 of us stayed 3 nights at the Homewood Suites and we had a wonderful experience. You can tell it's a great place since it is almost always sold out (according to desk receptionist). The breakfast is very extensive and the lobby area and outside tables are comfortable. The rooms are large and very clean for NYC. It is a new hotel (less than year old) so I hope they keep it up. Great location. Leslie was especially helpful.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I spent four nights here the first week of May. Three of the nights were paid for using my husbands Hilton points and the last night we paid for. I reserved the same type of room for the paid night so we were able to stay in the same room (King with sofa studio) the whole time. I contacted the hotel to find out which of this type of room did not have the fridge right next to the bed as I was afraid of the noise from previous reports I had read. I then checked us in on line and chose a room on the 19th floor at the back of the hotel. We heard no outside noise at all except the odd siren. The room was spotless, bed comfy and perfect amount of space for two people. The breakfast was ok it got us going in the morning. We flew to NJ and took the train to Penn and we walked the three blocks to the hotel with our luggage no problem. We make it a point to stay in Hilton properties whenever possible and this one did not disappoint.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First the bad things: (none of these are a deal breaker for me) :The lobby area was crowded most of the time as they were providing the luggage hold service. At one point, when we walked in, there was about 20 baggage kept on the floor at the lobby area.The elevators are small and sometimes the wait is long.Bathroom for the one king bed non smoking room was rather small. I am very short and thin and even for me , I could not shower well as the my hands were constantly hitting the walls.The good things :Location : This is right where you want to be if you stay in Manhattan. Walkable distance to Times square, Penn station etc and easy metro access to get to anywhere you want to go in the city.Rooms: I stay in a lot of Hilton brand hotels and this one is a little different from the ones I have seen and in a good way. It is modern and contemporary design which you don't find in other Hilton hotels I have seen. Part of that is also because, this place is relatively new. Liked the wooden floors which is better than stinky carpets at other places. Room had good flat led tv, full size fridge, full size microwave, locker, lot of crockery/utensils, full size dish washer etc. Beds and pillows were very comfortable.Housekeeping did a good job everyday we were there.Breakfast : Again modern and clean sitting area for the breakfast. Free cofee 24 hrs near the lobby area. Breakfast was nothing stellar, but decent enough.In general, for the price, we thought it was worth it and would stay there again if we go again. As mentioned, the cons were not much and was not a deal breaker for me.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Pre booked & pre paid thru a booking site several months ahead for a better rate. Twin (2 x queen) rooms hard to come by.....book early.This is not a hotel so don't expected a mini bar, restaurant, bar or room service. If you want these features go else where. If you want a wonderful central location, (we walked nearly everywhere), close to subway (& Penn station), room to move & kitchen facilities just in case u are in the mood to cook or at least heat something in your microwave (& keep icecream in a freezer!) then stay here! Breakfast is included - toast, bagels, cereal, juice, various hot options that change daily but include oatmeal (we ate a couple of times but only some looked palatable!) Tea, coffe, hot chocolate free 24hrs in lobby.Mon- Thurs 5-7pm there is a FREE evening meal with wine & beer!! No choice of food but it's free. A monthly planner of the meals is on your room fridge, so if it's something you don't like, then you won't bother coming back in time to eat, but the option is there. A really wonderful bonus to have even if u just have a drink on your way in or out! The free wifi states that it is for 3 devices only, but whether this is flexible I'm not sure.Level 22 has a roof top terrace if you want to sit & view the skyline.Never used the gym....walked enough about the city!Laundry was $2.50 per load for washer & same for dryer. (Change available at reception)Mini mart of food & sundries in lobby. A 7-11 is around the corner on 8th for more choice. There are other supermarkets with cheaper food but more of a distance. Sometimes you are happy to pay for convenience.9th ave has great restaurants & cheaper than than the very busy 8th ave.8th ave (near Port Authority bus terminal) is a bit seedy especially at night.Great cheap pizza one block up on 38th & 8th - $1 slices!!We had a king efficiency room. Large bed plus sofa. Bathroom small with inadequate bench space for toiletries bags. Room at back of hotel so view into another building but quiet.Requested (numerous times before & after our arrival) & were eventually moved to the preferred double room! Thank you!! This was on a lower level (6) at the front of the hotel, but there was no noise that bothered us. Perhaps a very light sleeper may have issues. This room had a shower over the bath with a shower curtain....not a nice as the previous rooms shower with glass sliding doors, but still fine. This bathroom had the much needed shelf space for toiletries. I mention this to make people aware that not all rooms/bathrooms are the same layout, so don't make a decision based upon one review alone (- or +)The double room was very spacious. 2 queen beds plus a sofa; desk with chair & roll under table that can be used for meals; free standing sofa side table that folds open to create a table to use on the sofa or with the 2 foot rest stools. There was also shelf space on the wall under the TV to store your bits & pieces.Our first room on level 14 had a half height window where as on level 6 we had a full length window with one small opening window (it only opens a few inches, but it's enough to help gauge the weather outside!)The bedside tables & desk have plenty of power points so all the phones, cameras etc can be recharged at the same time.The kitchenettes in both rooms were the same: microwave, full fridge/freezer, 2 burner cook top, crockery, glassware, toaster, and plenty of cookware.Rooms have a ceiling fan as well as own air conditioning. There are reading lamps & good lighting throughout.The decore is fresh and modern....floor boards and wallpaper with cute decorative touches, full length mirror & silk flowers. Our only negative was with the concierge. We enquired about Broadway tickets on our first night, but didn't realize how much of a mark up on the face value of the tickets there would be!!! ($149 each for tickets that had $88 printed on them!!!) Book your own shows! Try 'rush' tickets through the theatre or TKTS in Times Square if you have time. (Lower Manhattan location easier as not as busy) We got $30 rush tickets for Gigi & $37 rush lottery tickets for Kinky Boots. (Google Broadway rush tickets to learn more) We felt the concierge should have suggested options to us rather just just selling us expensive tickets where he was obviously getting a commission. The show we went to was on offer every day at 50% off at TKTS, so we paid $300 for a show we could have seen for $90 :-(I was under the impression a concierge is there to be helpful, not make a profit out of guests. If you are after clean, apartment style accommodation, close to transport, Broadway & Times Square then consider these suites, especially if booking early & getting a good rate.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was clean and staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was adequate and roof top deck was an added plus! Just steps away from the metro and Broadway as well local restaurants. The gym was very nice as well.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We always stay in a Hilton. I searched daily for 2 months for the right hotel for our first trip to NYC on our 26th wedding anniversary. I decided on this location and am soooo glad that I did. From the moment we arrived we felt so welcome and happy with our decision. Every single member of the staff is top notch. Service is extraordinary. Free breakfast daily and free dinner mon - thurs. They were knowledgable about their city and attractions and how to get around. We stayed in # 809 with a full kitchen and a private terrace. Room was clean and stocked with utensils, dishes , coffee, soap etc. The location is approx. 5 short blocks to Times Square, 3 blocks to subway and a 15 minute walk to the hop on hop off ferry which is also a must! Tons of restaurants, souvenier shops, pubs and convenience stores nearby. We LOVED our stay here and will definitely stay again!!! Way to go you guys did a superb job!!!! One thing I may change is the price of bottled water in your tuck shop $3.75 bit high :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We liked everything, the free breakfasts with healthy eating options and a helpful, hardworking and friendly breakfast room host named Lenny. The front desk staff was also friendly particularly Idrissa who tirelessly and smilingly helped me with my IPad problems in connecting to the Internet. We also enjoyed the evening Reception Lounge from 5 to 7 where we were offered free wine and supper. The Studio room was comfortable and attractive and the location suited us, close to Penn Station and a starting point for walking all over town.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great find in NYC. Sure the rooms are a bit small, breakfast was a little crowded but it was super clean, modern and a great price. My only complaint was the parking was a few buildings down the street and that wasn't real clear on the website where it listed parking.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved our stay at Homewood Suites. The hotel is clean, chic, and equipped with a kitchen (dishes, pans, utensils, and soap included) in the room. The square footage is larger than most hotel rooms in NYC and is wonderful. They offer free breakfast everyday and free dinner Monday-Thursday (beer/wine included). Coffee and tea are also offered 24/7. Gym, laundry room, roof top patio, and free wifi also included. The staff made us feel welcome and at home considering we stayed for a week. Good location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Only eleven months old with newly appointed rooms. Room was spacious for NYC. Many nice amenities such as in room kitchenette and complementary breakfast and during the week dinner. Will definitely stay again and would recommend it for families.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: NYC is usually a day trip for us, but my wife had a convention in midtown, so we (DW, DD and I) spent a night in town. We've liked other Homewood locations -- we usually get a one bedroom suite. In this case, we opted for a studio, which was fine. By NYC standards, this room was pretty spacious and included a king size bed (a bit soft for my taste, but perfectly fine), a small (twin size) sofa bed, and a small kitchen (equipped with 2-burner stove, microwave, sink, dishwasher, refrigerator/freezer, coffee maker, toaster, etc.). The bathroom was a comfortable size; it had a large shower -- no tub (no problem for us, but bath lovers beware!).This location looks pretty new -- everything seems to be in good shape. The room rate included a full breakfast, which lived up to the standard of other Homewood locations that we've experienced.The street was rather quiet -- not sure if this is true all the time. We were there on Saturday night, so that might be a factor. The room was quiet except for some noise (just people talking loudly) that seemed to carry through the ductwork with remarkable clarity. It wasn't a big deal -- I couldn't see dropping the hotel's rating over it -- but was a bit disconcerting at first.We didn't explore the immediate neighborhood much. The block seemed rather dull -- office buildings, another hotel across the street. It's an easy walk to/from Penn Station.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just few minutes walk from Amtrak station, close to quite everything in central Manhattan, BUT small suites ( of course , we are downtown in Nyc ) and definitely noise due to palace restoration just opposite the main door. Very useful for theatre district.Weak resistance to the noise given by window glasses.To use only if works ended and , anyway, to avoid low floors.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a great hotel,The room size is generous with 2 queen beds, and a small sofa and table and desk, and bathroom and kitchen and entry areaThis room was big enough for the 3 of us to share comfortablyThe beds were very comfortable, and the windows have two blinds which help control light and noise coming from the streetThe bathroom whilst small is serviceable with the closet for clothes in it, with ironing facilities also and the room safeTowels were plentiful and changed daily There is aso breakfast everynday, which whilst basic is very nice and plentifulFrom eggs to yoghurt and porridge and fruit, bread for toast and bagels and a selection of muffins and pastrys every day.And tea coffee, hot ,chocolate plentiful all day in the lobbyThey also have early dinner 4 nights a week, which we had twice in our stay and were very happy with itWe als used the gym most days, good basic gym with lots of cardio machines, fit balls, mats, free weights, but only one multi ourpose machine which could use a few more attachments to make it more usedul.Good wifi although you had to log in each 24 hours, quite reliable although it did drop out on occasionThe proximity to times square is awesome, we pretty much walked everywhere from times square to central park, and to all the main attractions, empire state building etcThe staff were wonderful, very helpful on all occasions from maps to directions nothing was to much trouble for any of them and Thankyou leslie for all your helpWould highly recommend

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Their motto is for your stay to feel as if you're at home and thats exactly what was delivered. This hotel is fantastic! The location is awesome just a short walk into times square and an easy walk down to central park if you dont mind walking a little further. The staff were all so lovely from check in to check out or just coming back into the hotel after being out for the day they always welcomed you home. We checked in early but our room was ready! We were in room 509. Fantastic room. 2 queen beds, plus a little sofa and kitchenette. Double curtains that blocked out the sun if you wanted to sleep in. In room safe provided. The wate pressure in the shower wasnt great but thats about as bad as it got! . The real drawcards here are the free wifi, free breakfas every morning ( although it does get very busy), free dinner with beer & wine monday to thursday and a coffee,tea,hot chocolate station available 24 hours. Awesome! The gym was great and there is also a business centre. The only other small nitpick i have is the lifts are tiny and half the time you waited so long as the lift kept going past your floor!i would definitey stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I've stayed in several of the moderately priced chain hotels in this area and while still expensive, the Homewood has nice rooms (equipped with kitchenette, ceiling fan, desk, couch) and two meals a day. Service staff are very friendly and responsive. 10 minute walk to Javits Center and 20 minute walk to Times Square/Theatre District.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Maybe because it's a public holiday, it is too crowded and hotel breakfast is nightmare. Added we take red-eye flight from west coast without option for early check-in is a pain. Location is not too bad or not very good as well. Hotel and the furniture is new and lift very fast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7 nights from 18th of May until the 25th. Upon arrival we were immediately struck by how welcoming and stunning the hotel was, we were attended to quickly and check in was almost smooth. We were on the 15th floor with not the best view but what do you expect in midtown Manhattan, the room was lovely, bed extremely comfortable and all amenities we could have needed, breakfast in the hotel was ok but not to our taste. The staff were always keen to help and would always welcome you back from a long day with a smile and a welcome home greeting which I thought was very nice, we used the business centre once and that was fine.All in all this place was a fantastic place to stay during our vacation, thank you for making our stay memorable

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We visited the Memorial Day weekend and stayed Saturday to Monday. Good: daily breakfast had hot items. The first morning, there was scrambled eggs, bacon, and hash browns. My son liked the eggs and asked for more. The second morning, there was a cheese filled premade omelettes w pieces of bell peppers, pork sausage patties. We got the last items in the tray so they were cold. The sausage patties were flavorful but too spicy for my kid. French toast sticks available one morning, too.There was the usual cereal, oatmeal, toppings for oatmeal, yogurt (and toppings), bagels, pastry, etc. each morning. The room was clean and the kitchen items were adequate. As compared to other Homewood Suites, this was a very, very small suite. The two-seater love seat was in the back of the room so it was hard to get to. Kitchen appliances worked just fine.Staff was friendly and cordial. I had a few minor issues w booking the room online but they resolved it just fine. The coffee and drinks were always available and stocked. My son spilled a full cup of hot chocolate and the front desk called for a cleaner w a gracious attitude, not an annoyed attitude like some hotels would display. Five stars for attitude!Needs improvement: the dining area was tight as was the breakfast buffet area. On the second morning, I just couldn't fight the crowd and sent my friend in. The love seat pulled out into a twin size bed. The foam mattress was one of the cheapest I've seen, not representative of a Hilton chain. An adult would have a problem sleeping on this. Recommend that management figure out a way to handle breakfast traffic. Maybe add a few round tables to the lobby which can be used for guests who want to sit in the lobby after dinner. We came back w dessert from the famous Carlo's bakery and had to sit at a counter to eat. Overall, a great location and a great visit!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at the Homewood Suites for business. The hotel is nicer than some "nice" hotels in NYC. Very modern, clean, staff is extremely friendly. It's a relatively new property, so the trick will be to see if they maintain it to such high standards. The room itself is very spacious for NYC standards and even comes with a full kitchen. It was great to have a full size refridgerator to use. My only real complaint (and what kept it from being a perfect stay) is that the rooms have this very loud air filter that can't be turned off or quieted. Nonetheless, didn't ruin my stay, just was annoying.All that said, I would definitely return to the hotel in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter in late February. She is an aspiring actress and our plan was to attend several Broadway plays.First, the price for this location was pretty good considering location to Times Square and Broadway play houses. We could have been slightly farther north, but the rate would have been considerably higher.Second, the lobby had a nice feel and the staff was very warm, friendly and helpful. As we arrived on our upper floor, the hallways and room felt somewhat cramped for a suites hotel. My guess is that this was a remodel of a former hotel. Second generation space had the dimensions and feel of a much older hotel. Third - the room was well appointed and the bathroom was OK for two occupants, but not what I would call generous. My bed was a queen, but my daughters bed was a fold out love seat. The size was fine for her, but it was separated from my bed by about 6 inches. If you are looking for a suite with room separation (like an Embassy Suite), this room would be disappointing.Fourth - the ACE subway, which runs north /south under 7th Street, was our access to Broadway. Unfortunately, the closest 2 stations were three blocks south (34th St) at Penn Station and 5 blocks north (42 St) a block west of Times Square. This made it fairly useless from a choice perspective and we ended up walking the five blocks north instead of using the train. However, the 34th St station is a useful station if traveling elsewhere in Manhattan. Penn station is also convenient if traveling in from another city.Overall, It was a fairly good stay, better than average location and a pretty good overall value.
user_name:
Randy578
Charleston, South Carolina, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Pros: New hotel, nice modern rooms with fridge etc, free breakfast, wifi, and even late afternoon snack (with free wine). Great location.Cons: in the room with sofabed room that I had, the shower was oddly in the bedroom instead of the bathroom - so if sharing the room its awkward for the sofabed occupant to take a shower. Sofabed is as uncomfortable as you would expect (has ANYBODY figured out how to make those comfortable yet? How about an electric inflatable mattress ?)Second, the interconnecting room door is in the bedroom instead of the living room. The neighbors were talking in normal voices and i could still hear every word they were saying.The free buffet was average/good but crowded. Only 3 very busy elevators, lots of waiting morning and evening. Recommendations: don't stay there if you are planning on using the sofabed, and ask for a non-interconnecting room. Also, if you can ask for a room the 2nd floor, you can take the stairs and avoid the elevator. Otherwise would stay there again.
user_name:
Jeff B
George Town, Grand Cayman

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First time in New York so sightseeing was made easy by the location of this hotel plus with Hell's Kitchen on your doorstep there are plenty of great places to eat. I would echo all the positive points posted by other guests. Lovely clean modern rooms, tea and coffee 24 hours, excellent staff, nice breakfast despite the numbers of people jostling for food at the same time - the waiting staff work their socks off replenishing dishes, clearing tables and keeping everything clean and tidy - Lenny Terrero you were brilliant. The roof terrace is a lovely place to have a drink and eat goodies from Chelsea Market while watching the sun go down.A few problems - our first room on the fourth floor but had an interconnecting door and the family in the next room were very loud till very late. It sounded like they were in the room with us. We asked to move but they didn't have another twin bed room that night so suggested we ask again in the morning. The next day the front desk staff confirmed they would move us so we packed everything apart from the clothes on hangers, as we were promised that they could be moved as they were. We came home late that evening to find the move had not taken place and it appeared we'd been forgotten, however the tip we'd left for the porter had been taken. The Duty Manager Melissa was extremely apologetic but again couldn't get us a twin room so we opted to move to a King with a guarantee of a move to a twin the following day. Melissa also arranged for a complimentary car to take us to the airport when we left. Our third move went as planned and the room was perfect apart from the toilet blocking on two occasions however this was dealt with fairly swiftly.Noise levels from the street, air con, refrigerator and other guests is intrusive so if you are sensitive like me, I suggest ear plugs. They have them on reception ready so I presume they are used to complaints.We felt a bit unlucky having the issues we experienced but Melissa was a star and we felt she did all she could to resolve things for us. We'd stay again and would recommend the hotel to our friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is perfect for extensive shopping in NYC. It is short walk to broadway theaters and times square. Good food. Our room was very noisy due to problem in ventilation system that they failed to fix it after multiple trials. My advise to you, DO NOT let the concierge to get your broadway tickets, get it by yourself.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed with my family for two nights. The location is in heart of Midtown west, New York. Many places of attraction like Times Square, Madison avenue etc. are just in hopping distance. Metro station is close bye. Enjoyed our stay here.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for a week and were very happy with our stay. The location was great, the staff were helpful and friendly, and the room was nice. This was a hotel with a lower price than most available, and we were pleasantly surprised. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were on vacation for a week in New York. We chose the Homewood Suites because of the location and the fact that they served a complimentary hot breakfast every day. We also took advantage of the complimentary dinners 2 of our nights there. There were 3 adults in our party and the suite was very spacious. The 2 queen sized beds were extremely comfortable as were the down pillows. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, from the desk clerks giving us subway directions to the housecleaning staff. We also enjoyed having coffee and tea available in the lobby at all times if we wanted it. The 3 elevators were a bit slow each AM but that is to be expected with everyone coming and going from the dining area. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends if they need a place to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'll be honest - of all the chains, I prefer Homewood Suites the most and this is a great centrally located NYC option. The biggest problem is that it gets booked out so quickly due to its location near Times Square, NYPA terminal, Penn Station and Madison Sq Garden. This place is new, fresh and everything you hope for from a Homewood, although the rooms tend to be smaller in size (as are most in NYC).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was awesome. The staff was excellent! Location is perfect for Manhattan. Close to several Subway stations, Times Square, Central Park. Took the F train from 34th and 8th to Ground Zero took less than 10 minutes. Also close to Chelsea Piers if you happen to be going on a dinner cruise (we did and I fully recommend). Open bar with wine and beer Mon- Thurs 5:00 - 7:00pm. Workout facility on lower level, nice rooftop lounge area with decent views. Room was very clean with stovetop, microwave, fridge, dishwasher, plates, silverware, glasses, somewhat small compared to other Homewood's but unless your spending over a grand a night that's what you get in NY. Would stay here again definitely! Opened November of 2014.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is one of the few places we found with a king size bed and a pull-out sofa. The place also had a tiny kitchen (we didn't use it, but it could be helpful), and a wonderful staff. The 22nd floor is a comfy terrace with views of Manhattan. Breakfast was great too!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel located near Madison Square Garden! Very clean and very busy. Staff was excellent and wanted to help with reservations or sight seeing. Big hotel room by New York City standards. No view at all....

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Room a touch small, but very clean, very well appointed, everything you would expect at a Homewood. Staff exceedingly helpful and pleasant. Breakfast, nice selection and adequate amounts, but as you would expect with a hotel of this size a little out of control relative to the volume that was requesting service. Will definitely come back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Ten minute walk to times square, 5 mins to macy's, 15 minutes to empire state buiding. Ideal location for subway travel. this hotel offers free breakfast of a great variety each day. from Monday to Thursday evening between 5 and 7pm they offer free light meals which are good quality and free wine and beer! coffee and tea is always available. Recommended to all types.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I frequently travel to New York and have stayed in numerous hotels and can say that this Homewood is the most comfortable accommodation you will find in Midtown Manhattan. Although some reviewers here state that the rooms are small, for midtown Manhattan these rooms are *well* above standard size...even the Studio Suites. Even the most basic of rooms have almost all the luxuries of an upscale condominium. The rooms are modern and trendy, and the design is incredibly thoughtful. Kitchens are fully equipped and you can do everything just short of baking cookies. The appliances are new and spotless, and include a large fridge. I can't tell you how lovely it is to have a freezer full of ice, real glasses, and the ability to have evening drinks in the comfort of your room.The beds are plush with crisp white sheets and multiple pillows. There is a desk with a comfortable chair. The wifi is free, strong and reliable, with an option to purchase premium internet access if you desire. In my studio there was an abundance of storage with a built in closet (which had shelves), 3 large drawers, a luggage rack as well as a digital safe.The room has easily accessible power outlets for charging multiple devices, and they are thoughtfully located. You have so many lighting options in the room that you can set the mood you'd like...something unavailable in most properties! There are bedside lamps, an under-cabinet kitchen light, a ceiling light, a desk light, living room lamp as well as hallway lighting....even the bathroom has the vanity light as well a recessed and nicely diffused shower light. The bathroom itself is spacious with upgraded fixtures, toilets with single and double-flush options as well as the absolute best water pressure I've ever experienced in a Manhattan hotel. I felt like I was at the spa everyday.There are also small touches to the room that truly make the space feel like your own. A series of wall shelves invite you to customize them.... and as my trips usually involve seeing many Broadway shows I add a Playbill to my shelf every night of my stay.The business center is well equipped with 2 lighting-fast computers, a printer, office supplies in a comfortable setting. The adjacent laundry room is convenient and a wonderful thing to have on site. The fitness facility is large and clean, with premium equipment, televisions and everything you need to keep active.Breakfast is free and has a nice selection of items. Dinner is also free (Monday through Thursday evenings) with varied offerings each night. For my stay I was treated to dishes such as chicken and shrimp stir-fry, pasta with meatballs and grated cheese, and artichoke dip with flat-breads. Your alcoholic beverage is also complimentary with your dinner (beer or wine).I will say that this property has spent a great deal of money on their common areas and accommodation, and it shows. Even details like the well-appointed hallways on the guest floors and the public areas on the lower lever remind you of this.Finally, I have to say that the staff are wonderful and accommodating. Nafeesa at the front desk was always there to make my stay right and is a tremendous front desk employee.Thank you Nafeesa, for everything! The rest of the front desk team was warm and welcoming, the restaurant staff were pleasant and my housekeeping attendant was fantastic. This hotel has become my favorite property in New York CIty, and come to think of it I've actually never had a hotel surpass my satisfaction and expectations as much as this one did (and continues to do).Skip the "full-service" hotels and book the Homewood for your next stay in Manhattan. There is no greater bang for your buck....anywhere.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had the pleasure of staying this Homewood Suites for two nights (Sunday and Monday). The staff was excellent, the rooms were very nice, the breakfast and dinner were above average.From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I appreciated that they were well staffed at the front desk. They were eager to assist at check-in or at any time when I had a question or needed something. My room was very modern and included everything I needed. There were a significant number of conveniently placed outlets for my electronics, the wifi in the room was very good, the bed was comfortable, the room itself was very clean and housekeeping did a nice job of cleaning the room.The breakfast was good...the food was fresh and plentiful. There were not a lot of choices in terms of hot items, but sometimes keeping it simple is how you maintain quality. The same could be said for the evening meal. I did not eat the evening meal...though I did want an appetizer before going out to dinner. A true appetizer was not available so I improvised from the dinner offering which is OK, but a true appetizer offering might be a place they could improve.I needed to do a bit of laundry while I was there. It is great that they have coin operated machines (and I believe that there are at least 4 sets of washers and dryers. That said, I found them to be very expensive. $5.00 to wash and dry...and an additional $3.99 for detergent for one load. I guess they want you to use their laundry service so they make this quite expensive. $9.00 a load seems pretty darn high to me. They have to be making a profit here, but making this a service and reducing the price, it is possible that they would get greater benefit in terms of customer satisfaction scores. I don;t often have to wash clothes when on the road, but when I do...I don;t want to feel like I am being gouged.I must mention that the young lady that served the beer and wine during the Manager's Reception on Monday, May 11 was very, very nice. She always had a smile on her face! :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Family holiday to New York, location excellent. Nice rooms and well laid out. Building works going on across the street but no major concerns. Staff on the desk were superb nothing was a problem. Free wi-fi in rooms and reception is a nice touch.Breakfast is included but very busy on a morning and a limited selection, if on a budget that's great. We used once but preferred to sample the local diners. All day coffees and teas in lobby also dinner and wine is included on Mon-Thursday, again basic but a nice touch with a nice beer or wine included.We stayed for a week over Easter and loved it, The room has everything you need and more.Will stay again in the future, cant fault it. The staff are superb and we will be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites Midtown is a comfortable, conveniently located hotel. As many have stated, this hotel is fairly new (1 yr old) and so everything is in good shape. I stayed for two nights and only experienced a few minor issues. The rooms are small, and after checking in I realized the room I was given was actually slightly smaller than what I had booked (1 Bedroom Studio vs. 1 Bedroom with Sofa Bed). It seems there are actually at least 4 levels and sizes of rooms, but when booking it's not clear what you will get. For the price I paid, I did feel the room was a bit small and claustrophobic. The other issue was that my room was on the 9th floor and the floor below had outdoor decks which meant they could see right into my room at night! I quickly learned the need to keep the shades drawn at all times. Overall I felt the stay was good, but didn't jump out as exceptional. I think I would stay again if the price was a bit less, but otherwise might look for other options.
user_name:
Chris20874
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is situated within easy walking distance of main tourist areas. We had a large 2 bed room with sofa bed, kitchen area and bathroom on the 3rd floor. Towels changed daily if required. The daily breakfast was adequate with basic choices of cereals, fruit, toast, juice, porridge, bagels and a selection of hot cooked items that varied daily. Never had any issues with seating over the 4 days there. The complimentary evening selection Monday to Thursday with free wine between 5pm & 7 pm was acceptable. The only thing missing was a bar in the hotel especially on the roof top seating area with views over to the river. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel, located right in the center within 6-7 minutes from Times Square, spacious rooms, very clean, it is recommended to ask for high floor front. The room has a basic breakfast but adequate, the dining room is very crowded, but since this bonus in New York so there is nothing to complain about

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I just recently returned from a 5 day stay at this property. I must say I am glad I mad this choice. First of all I would like to commend the staff, especially Thomas for making this stay wonderful. The hotel is located a short walking distance to Penn Station, and Times Square. Very easy to get around town. Many food options around including Hells Kitchen which is just around the corner, with its blocks and blocks of ethnic restaurants. The evening managers reception/dinner is a nice touch. The breakfast was typical, nothing fancy but still somewhere to grab a quick bite if needed. If anyone is worried about outside noise, I will say that I had no complaints whatsoever. I stayed in room 1106, right next to the elevator. Never heard a sound. As for all the negative reviews, yes the elevators can get busy during peak time, yes the breakfast area can get crowded during peak time. But if you manage your time correctly you will never notice. I had no issues with any of the above mentioned. I will surely book this hotel again when I return to NYC. Thanks again staff!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fantastic place to stay at, not only are the rooms neat but have modern finishes. The staff complement the environment. located closed to a few attraction.They deserve a 8/10I would encourage the venue to relook it's shuttle service, very expensive and feels like a rip off $90 to jfk airport......

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent four nights here and were very pleased with our room. It was a one room king studio with a kitchenette wall with full size refrigerator, stove top and microwave. Since we like to prepare at least one meal per day it was perfect for us. The hotel is new and beautiful. We loved the layout. Great bathroom and working desk. The free breakfasts were surprisingly good. We ate one every morning instead of our usual in-room breakfast.Lots of great restaurants a short walk away, especially on 8th Avenue. Metro two blocks away so you can get anywhere easily.Loved it and play to return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We flew to Manhattan to visit a friend in the hospital and there were no hotels available near Columbia Medical so we stayed here and took the subway back and forth. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful with suggestions of places to eat near hotel. It is only a couple of blocks from Times Square and we did manage to visit Times Square for dinner one evening. We had a high floor and it was quiet. Breakfast is included in rate. Not a big selection but they had steel cut oatmeal and yogurt with fruit, so it was perfect for me. Rate was reasonable compared to similar chains in the area. Room was small but clean. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Quick overnight for business, comfortable rooms, nicely equipped. Happy hour in lobby is a nice touch, also breakfast following morning works if you are in a hurry and want something quick to grab. Service was very good. TV was not hooked up properly, maintenance quickly fixed problem. I would stay here again if I need to be near Midtown.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at this hotel last week & we were really impressed with the decor and cleanliness of the hotel. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is located in midtown which is a great spot to be in New York. Our room was cleaned daily. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had just done a lot of research to find a place in NY , I was looking for value, good location , quiet rooms and big rooms. A lot to ask for especially in NYC.Well , if that's what you are looking for, look no further! Its an absolute gem find.We arrived to find out that not only is breakfast included, all day coffees and teas in lobby, but dinner and wine is included on Mon-Thursday!!!!! Location is corner of 37th and 8th, the subway is 2 blocks away (PEnn), and all the Broadway plays are walking distance. We stayed for a week there and could not be happier with our choice.Our room has a kitchenette, small sitting area with couch and king bed.Very spacious in NY standards....and our room so quiet!!!!!!!!!!!! we heard no traffic noise!!!If you go to NY, do yourself a favour stay here, room rates were so reasonable and our stay was just fantastic. Thankyou to the staff also for helping and answering all our questions

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had a very pleasant stay at the Homewood hotel. Apartment was really nice and very we'll located. The thing j enjoyed the most were the bed sheets! A-Mazing! I slept like a baby. Best ever. Breakfast is terrible btw. The kitchen can't handle the amount of people having breakfast at the same time. A very poor selection, makes it feel like a cheap holiday inn.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After hearing lots of horror stories about New York hotels, we spent a long time searching for a hotel at a good price, in a good location & a good standard. We had everything crossed this hotel would fit the bill & it did! A little walk from Penn Station but the best of NYC is all an enjoyable walk away. Room was small but we were there only to rest & sleep as there was too much to enjoy outside. Free breakfast was great way to start the day. Free dinner Mon-Thurs was an extra offer (complimentary beer & wine too) but we only went once & were put off going again by the other guests who were fighting to get to the buffet. It was replenished regularly so no need for the desperation. It was no loss as there are so many places to eat on the streets of NYC that you will never go hungry. If you love sneakers , there was a fantastic shop right on the corner of the street which had a great range (we have some!) & friendly service. Definitely a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Located in the Garment District, his hotel is extremely well located, within walking distance to Times Square, Theater District, Penn Station/Madison Square Garden, great restaurants and shopping. Subway is less than four minute walk. Room is nice size for the city with full size refrigerator, stove. Vanity area is small. Would have liked stronger water pressure.Breakfast was good each morning. Food could have been hotter. Devon Lloyd was very helpful finding honey for my wife's tea.Front desk staff was excellent every time I approached them.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 4/29, due to flight time that we checked in very late, so I called homewood that I will be late check in. When I arrived hotel is already 11 pm, and the employee told me that our room had some problem that water in all the carpet, we can't check in at that day. We were feeling so bad but homewood employees must helped us find a hotel in manhattan beach and pay for everything about our trespotation go and back from that hotel and homewood. I was so tired but had a nice service by the front desk.  4/30,finally, we did checked in homewood, and they upgrade us to room#2015, it's face to 37th st. but I couldn't hear anything from my room. It's in the corner so you can see some view form the room. The room is small but it's New York, you must know that most hotel even smaller then this hotel. I have a nice full kitchen with every dishes, cups, folk and etc. that you need in the room. The breakfast was nice, not the best but good. Just as other people talk about the elevator is wait forever but you could wake up early or late to avoid people. Their hot coffee and water is 24 hours which is really important in New York, I real like this.  Most incredible things which is I saw a employees when she saw there is trash on the ground and she must pick up it, when I saw that my feeling is that she see the trash at home that natural reaction. So I like the front desk said that, Welcome home!  If I have a chance come to New York again, Homewood suites will be my first choice.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Was in NY for a "Me Weekend", nice clean hotel, and especially nice front desk staff. Nafeesa was a real jewel, very professional and pleasant. Also Daniel Done was great!! This hotel is a short walk to Times Square, and all the attractions. I would use Homewood Suites again.Thanks again Nafeesa and Daniel!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed with my wife and son for six nights last April using the Hilton Honors rewards. Our room was upgraded to two queen bed and our stay was comfortable and exceeded our expectations. We would like to express special thanks to Allyson Lehman, Guest Services Ambassador for providing excellent customer service.
user_name:
Ella S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a very nice hotel, and is in the perfect location for tourists visiting New York (close to Times Square, close to several subway lines). The rooms are large and clean, the breakfast is pretty good, and the staff are very pleasant...However, we had a big issue with their credit card hold policies, which meant that we were overcharged around $650 for the duration of the stay. On check-in (rooms weren't available for over two hours after the 3 pm opening time-slot, but that is another matter), we switched the credit card that held the two rooms for the booking, to other cards (one for each room) that would be used to pay for it. Despite this switch happening straight away at check-in, the hotel put a hold on the original card for the first night of both rooms (about $230 each), then put a hold on the new cards for the total amount, plus an additional $200.I understand that hotels need to cover themselves in case people book and don't show, but we did show, and were double charged for the experience. On speaking to the duty manager, we were told that it would be five days before it could be reversed, meaning that we are out of pocket $650 in the meantime.I'd recommend the hotel, but after this experience, I don't think we will be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites in Midtown Manhattan is a modern, clean centrally located hotel that is an amazing value for your money. Our room was huge, very clean, equipped with a small kitchen and very comfortable and quiet. We booked on hotel tonight and only paid $115 for the room. The staff were very nice and even let us check out late for no extra charge. It's not my favorite neighborhood in Manhattan but it is certainly centrally located. Definitely check it out.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed only one night to catch a show but was very impressed. Very polite and helpful front desk (Tiffany) who checked me in and explained all the offerings of the hotel.Room on 10th floor was great. Comfortable bed with full kitchen area and nicely sized bathroom. One of the only hotels in New York I've stayed in with virtually no street noise (except the odd siren). The rooms have large windows which is good for keeping an eye on the outside and makes the rooms very light but there is a privacy blind.Breakfast was better than expected and at 8am on a Saturday there was room to sit and enjoy. Food seemed to be being replenished regularly.I love that there is a hot drinks bar so you can grab tea/coffee whenever you want (though it was out of hot water when I returned from the theatre in the evening).There is an outside terrace on the 22nd floor which I didn't make use of but would be nice to sit out early evening to relax.Location wise, it's just a few blocks walk from Penn station and easy to find. For Times Square it's perfect though walking back past Port Authority I felt a bit unsafe at night as a solo female traveller. Tip would be to take 7th and then cut across. All in all I would definitely return to this property. The only negative is that the fridge in the room can get quite noisy but had a great stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is a short walk down 37th Steet. to the Javits Center. It is clean, it is modern, and it is in a good location off 8th Ave near Times Sq. The a/c in my room worked well...I like to keep my room below 70 degrees F. Also my room on the 8th floor had a patio which was awesome.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed here with my wife, we arrived early as we knew that we could make use of the baggage storage facility - our welcome in the hotel was the coldest I have received in a Hilton so far, I normally use Hilton as they usually provide a great service. Our bags were tagged and our tags were literally thrown across the desk at us by the check in clerk - who unfortunately was the same agent who checked us out so i did not have an opportunity to complain. The front desk is always busy, I had to wait 15 minutes to purchase something from the pantry as they seemed short staffed constantly during our trip, the front desk staff are not very friendly at any point.Apart from the front desk issue, the rest of the hotel is fine - beds are extremely comfortable, bathroom is very clean and anything you might need is provided in the kitchen so that you can cook etc.The location is excellent.I would not stay at this hotel again unfortunately but only due to the front desk staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Yvette from housekeeping was fantastic!!! Allen carried all our groceries up and brought them all in the room seemingly surprised to receive a tip ;) and super gracious and genuine. The entire staff was this way and all so helpful!! The food wasn't the best we've ever had from homewood, but it was a great time and money saver for breakfast and dinner!!! Wow!!! Quiet enough to sleep through the night and central to many attractions yet away from the business. The room was good size for our family. Around the corner at the 7/11 fantastic deal on pizza ;) Hoping to get to bring the family another time to the city and would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was Awesome!!! The room was the size of a studio but with complete kitchen. It was nice having a refrigerator and microwave. My husband is a Hilton Honors Diamond member and so we received breakfast which was ok but at least nice to have available!! Convenient location to be able to walk to everything!!! Would defiantly stay there again!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The suites were very clean and in a great location. Would definitely stay again. Staff were very helpful and friendly. We found the laundry facility awesome and would have used the fitness centre too if we weren't so tired from walking around all day. We didn't try the complimentary food as we are both vegan and gluten free so having the kitchenette was great addition to our stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was mine and my girlfriend's first trip to New York and this hotel is in a perfect location! The hotel is beautiful and convenient to everywhere we wanted to go. I proposed to my girlfriend while on this trip and Allyson went above and beyond to assure that everything went perfect! I will always stay at this hotel while in New York and we both can't wait to come back. Thank you Homewood Suites and Allyson for all that you did!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What an excellent hotel! DH and I spent 1 night just in town to see the Plains Indian exhibit. Room was clean, compact but well laid out. Good size for the 2 of us. A complete kitchen which we didn't use but would be nice to have for a snack or lunch. Free wi-fi, an excellent breakfast. Convenient location easy walk to subway, Times Square. The neighborhood felt safe. As I said there was a very noisy fan which functioned as white noise while sleeping but was annoying while watching TV. The only issue I had. I would go back in a minute.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I typically stay at the Homewood Suites and I have never had a bad experience. The friendly staff is just the icing on the cake, they truly go out of their way to make you feel at home. The location is ideal for business or leisure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had read other reviews before selecting this hotel and can confirm the following.Good location for access to Penn St station, restaurants, Time Square, Broadway shows, shops, etc. Breakfast and dinner is a good addition, although not gourmet is adequate to get the day started or finish a day of sight seeing with a drink and light meal. Can be organise chaos at times during peak times but they to a good job to cater to the numbers. We stayed on the 10th floor behind the lift and were initially concerned about noise after reading previous reviews. We found our room to be generally quiet except for other guest outside our door, clean and spacious. We found the free 24 hour coffee, free WiFi a great addition and staff friendly and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a convenient location and comfortable stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Planned a 50th Birthday with myself and 3 other women. Had a 4th flying in to the city as a "surprise". Homewood Suites upgraded us to accommodate 5. "Allison" went above and beyond, from my initial call she told me to ask for her when we arrived. She set us up for the perfect time. She had wine and extras waiting for the birthday girl. Even more, she was suppose to go home but decorated the room for me before she left as a surprise. She truly made the trip. The place is beautiful too. I will now only stay there and ask for "Allison".

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I just spent the weekend celebrating my 50th birthday with 5 friends. Homewood Suites was the place to stay. Not only was our room amazing, clean, hypoallergenic AND comfortable, but it was in the heart of all that we wanted to do. Walking distance to broadway (saw a show) and several amazing restaurants. The best part was Allison--she brought a birthday card and bottle of wine. PLUS she decorated our room with balloons,confetti, streamers and a banner all brought by my friend, Karen. Allison was SO accomodating, and made our stay EXTRA SPECIAL! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a classy hotel in the heart of NYC. Thanks for an amazing weekend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I spent months looking for a hotel in NYC for affordable accommodation with basic kitchen facilities and a balcony. The balcony was a real preference as we love to sit outside first thing in the morning with a coffee and breakfast so when we found the Homewood suites we thought we had found everything we wanted from a hotel. Sadly for some bizarre reason the balcony has water sprinklers placed either side of the patio door which are on a timer...from 6.00am until 7.30am every morning. There are no plants or grass to water so all that is watered are the windows the fencing and most annoyingly the terrace furniture which is then rendered useless to use for breakfast time. The first morning we were totally unaware of the sprinklers but we were soon in for a rude awakening as we got soaked whilst on the balcony. Have asked at reception if there was anything they could do to turn them off and was assured the company who deals with them would have it sorted by this morning...guess what.. 6am woken to the sound of water hammering on the windows again...not impressed we paid extra for a balcony we can't use at a time that suits. Maybe tomorrow ...but have just bought an umbrella...Just in case!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First, I am a HHonors member and use Hilton ofter. I tried this Homewood Suites because of ots location in Midtown and close walk to B'way shows. 37 Street & 8th Avenue - in the garment district which os a kick with the speciality stores and galleries featuring fashions and sewing crafts. Interesting neigborhood. The hotel is Hilton's idea of a new millenium minimalist hotel room. Small - I had to go into the hallway to change my mind! The room fits a full kitchen [fridge, freezer, dish wash, microwave, stove top and prep sink - all in a 6' space, directly adjacent to the bed, which is adjacent to the 2-person divan. Tat's not too bad - abot the size of a cruise ship cabin. BUT...the closet is 12" wide! and half of that was taken up by the ironing board and iron mount [we had Housekeeping take ours out]. We travel for casual and dressy in NYC...the closet is important - this one sucks! we have clothes all over the room because there is no closet room - BAD feature. Also, I like privacy on the potty - do yo? well, the bathroom is less than tiny, the shower very narrow, and so is sink. the worse art however, is a slider door to close the bathroom off from the rooom - doesn't work because the dooor does not 'seat' closed; the door hangs outside the bathroom wall, so if you pass gas inside it is easily heard outside. Imagine the embarrassment or the lack of privacy in the potty! This is terrible choice as is the fact the small bathroom is not user friendly - no hooks, no place to put your toiletries, no place for anything! This is not the way I travel. We like the convenience of a full and private bath, and a room large enough to relax withoout falling over eachother. It may be fine for the saleman or single traveller, or the young couple on a spree - but at nearly $400 per night it leaves omething to be desired in a full room. We got lucky and reserved a room on the 8th floor with a patio - really, with grass and a table and chairs overlooking 37th street - at least we could escape the confines of the room [even with the construction on the highrise bldg across the street so I got to know some of the construction workers when I went out to smoke a cigar!] - One other GOOD thing they serve a fairly good breakfast everymorning for free [egg somethings, meat and potatoes, some fruit and lots of pastries - none gluten-free however] and on Monday-to-Thurday they serve a 'dinner' from 5-7 also free with dishes such as hamburger night, pastas and salad...a real nice touch + coffee/tea/hot chocolate 24/7, and sell booze from a cart. In all a very mixed bag - good locale, nice property & staff, and free food [well you pay for it in the room rate] - but hate the room, bathroom and the fact the room lacks convenience and storage. It obviously appeals to foreigner & their families who were over 60% of the guest the week we stayed [everything is smaller in Europe]..You make the call based on this - I will pass next time!
user_name:
Neal S
South Lake Tahoe, California

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: W stayed here in a suite for 3 nights and found th room to be very nice, the free all day coffeetea in the lobby is most welcom as is the included breakfast and light one course evening meal. The one down side we found was the noise from the street we over looked, there was building work noise most of the night and the bin emptying at mid-night was very noisy, but this hotel is well placed for both north and south Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is perfect. The hotel is lovely; the rooms are large and comfortable. The front desk is helpful; the housekeeping staff is cheerful. Allyson Lehman clearly went out of her way as guest service ambassador to make my visit with a grandson special. There's not one thing we'd change; thank you!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I chose this hotel for price and location and photos online. But lucky me I got sooo much more! This was a great find. In a city like NY that offers hostels and shared rooms (eww, not my thing), I make sure I do my research and when I do find a gem like this one, I put it on my list for future visits and would be ok if the price fluctuates north a little do to business levels because I know what to expect.ROOMS: super clean, big, comfy bed, generous size windows, reliable A/C, very functional clean kitchen area (even has two stove burners). Fast free wifi, ceiling fansDINING: during weekdays dinner is offered, hot breakfast is offered, if the hotel is busy they do warn you that breakfast can get crazy crowded. And indeed it was, but being told so helps you be prepared or just skip it or get a to go.COMMUNITY AREAS: there was a first floor outdoor area and a rooftop area...both outdoors and spacious with tables and chairs. Very inviting lobby even if to just watch tvSTAFF: helpful, nice, sorry I didn't get any names (no name tags).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a delight! Clean, modern, great location, decent breakfast and evening meal, and a huge balcony! This is current favorite of the Hilton brand in NYC. I am in town for the Pharma show at the Javits and it took me all of 15 minutes to walk back to the hotel this afternoon. The staff is amazing and very kind. Price is well within reason for what you get. I do not know what the compaints are about. Sure the elevator might take a minute, but that happens when a place is sold out. Noise? This is Manhatthan folks. I am going to advise my company to use this hotel for the several events different divisions attend each year at the Javits. It is a keeper. I like it so much I did not even wait until I left, I still have one more night.Good job Homewood Suites:)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has a beautiful interior both downstairs and in the rooms. The room is large enough, comfortable and homey. The location is really great to Times Square. I happened to need to be working at the Javits Center one day and it is only about a 10 minute walk from there. The parking garage is almost directly across the street from the hotel, on the right side of the street. I was on the 17th floor and it was basically silent in my room which I loved. The main issues are 1) spotty TV service. Really bad and freezes often, making it possible to even watch one TV show. 2) The elevators get so packed and you may develop claustrophobia (for the first time) upon being in them3) Breakfast gets extremely busy with people and people are pretty rude. I happened to be here among primarily international people and there aren't really manners in terms of grabbing food. Not much patience. The food selection is decent though.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is in amazing location, few blocks from Empire State, Macy's, Time Square, subway right around the corner. Suites are huge for Manhattan standard, modern, clean, housekeeping did excellent job, the whole property was super clean. I was amazed with breakfast staff, breakfast area was always packed with guests, but they did great job keeping it clean and fresh. I am not sure if some guests know this, but this is not a restaurant, there is no servers, so it would really help if all guests take their own dirty plates, I was upset how rude some of us can be and just leave the table dirty. Great Job to the whole team.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location is great because the hotel is located between Penn Station and Times Square and within walking distance to both. Check-in and out was efficient and quick. The room was very nice and well planned. Elevators were slow during peak times. I had opted for the terrrace room, a mistake because there was ZERO view from the terrace and being located directly opposite the elevator was a no-no. I was subjected to noise all night and morning long. There was much street noise from Eighth Avenue. The windows were not soundproofed. Because of the noise issue, I would not return and I cannot recommend this hotel. Like other NYC hotel rooms, rates are primarily driven by supply and demand.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Many New York City hotel rooms are barely liveable. I can affirm that by my many stays in that city. This Homewood Suites was surprisingly liveable and clean -- a rare find in a city with some of the most awful hotels in the country.. I was upgraded, so I hope my room was typical of the others. I did indeed have a modern two room suite, with a large living room/dining room/kitchen area and a separate bedroom -- all nicely appointed. The kitchen, in fact, had a full size refrigerator -- a true rarity! Both rooms had large-screen HD televisions. Unfortunately the TV reception was spotty and needs to be investigated and repaired. The reception desk was very friendly and helpful. All staff were friendly and helpful. Another positive surprise was the late afternoon cocktail hour/dinner service with real food, complimentary! A full and fine buffet breakfast was also included. Coffee and beverages seem available all day. The main "but" is that my upgraded suite was on the second floor -- above the noisy atrium lobby. The noise in my room was often deafening and tailed off somewhat late night. Being New York, there was lots and lots of street noise as well. In short, be sure to book a high floor to avoid the noise. The atrium rises only to the second floor. The neighborhood, off shabby 8th Avenue, is also a bit dark late at night, but should be ok. On the plus side, it's not far from Times Square and Madison Square Garden. All in all, this hotel could be a real find if you avoid the second floor. I would stay there again, but only on a high floor.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: So i am a huge traveler. I travel locally as well as aboard. I have traveled to NY several times, but this was my first time staying at Homewood Suites. It was so many nice things to say about it, but i am going to try to keep it brief. The staff is very VERY friendly and helpful. The inside was very clean . the bedrooms was just as clean as the lobby. They also not only provided free breakfast, but they also provide free dinner as well. But only Mon-Thursday for the dinner. The food was good. and they also provided free glasses of wine or beer with the dinner.
