They also did grocery shopping for you if you needed it. every room has a stove, dishwasher, sink, cabinet, and they are fully equipped with dishware and silverware. There was also a microwave. My only down side was that the room was a little small. But thats because i made my reservation late and only a single room was available. So i had to share a room with my friend. We managed it was okay. but i would have liked a bigger room. hey things happen. i will be staying here from now on when i need to stay over night in New York. oh yeah free coffe and hot tea ALLLL DAYYY! :D

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We enjoyed 14nights here, and we were very pleased with our choice. Booked through Expedia, city view, room on the 15th floor. Checkin was smooth, fast and friendly. Our room meet all our needs, we thought roomy, kitchen facilities including full sized fridge included. Housekeeping great, room always cleaned well. Breakfast was well stocked, a variety of hot, cereals, fresh fruit and pastries, something for everyone. The breakfast staff deserve special mention for the friendly service, they were brilliant. The coffee stand was well used, especially coming in from the cold.Managers reception Monday to Thursday was a life saver, several times we had grand plans of eating out, as you intend to do in New York, but we were so tired from all day sightseeing, we just couldn't go out. The food really surprised us, a good variety and very tasty, the wine and beer went down well too. Location was the clinch for us, so close to the subway, Madison square gardens, and Times Square an easy walk. We could access every thing we needed too with ease and without difficulty.Would we stay here again, absolutely.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed over the March Break period for four days at this hotel. The location is great, close to everything. Only misgiving was the buffet ~ too crowded and not too keen on the food laid out with everyone going around breathing on it. Changing how it's presented, laid out, would up the stars on this one.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: iT IS RARE TO FIND A HOTEL WITH SUCH EXCELLENT SERVICE. FRom The moment we arrived at 10 pm,the service and staff was exceptional.Great location too .Internet was very fast,great full breakfast and loved the coffee station in the lobbgy

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Rooms r nice, Lobby/Reception niceClean room, reception staff very efficient, Housekeeping staff very professionals Worst breakfast ever had in my 26 years in hospitality business: Dirty equipments, bad food variety, food not tasty at all, not enough space for the number of rooms, room used for breakfast is like a war zone, no supervision, not enough staff for breakfast It would be better to charge guest for breakfast & give them a decent breakfast then to give them a bad breakfast for freeWe only had breakfast the first 2 days of our stay, after that we had breakfast in different coffee shops for 9 daysIt is a shame to serve a cheap food because the hotel has an excellent location : 5 blocks from times swuare, 3 blocks from penn station, ...All the best

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights last week with my husband, son (19) and daughter (16). Fantastic hotel, staff were friendly, professional and very helpful. (Loved how the reception desk staff always welcomed us back into the hotel on our return from a days sightseeing). Hotel was very busy but check in was quick and room as was ready before 2pm. Room itself (613) exceeded my expectations (NY hotel rooms are notoriously small); this was large, modern and very clean. 2 queen size beds, floor to ceiling windows, work area with large chair and pull out desk, separate sofa and seating area, mini kitchen with fridge, hob, dishwasher, microwave, crockery/cutlery etc. Large modern bathroom with shower over bath, great lighting, good storage space, plenty of towels and toiletries. HD tv and free, fast & efficient wifi. Breakfast was included (as was evening meal & wine/beer on the 4 nights we were there - an added bonus as this saved us a fortune on eating out at night) Breakfast, fruit juices, choice of cereals, fresh fruit, toast, bagels, pastries, muffins, scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes. Free tea and coffee in reception area 24 hours a day. I agree with some of the comments about the breakfast area being busy but we never had to wait for a table, any queues for food were no longer than 4 or 5 people, the main problem at meal times is some people's inability to queue or to take ages as they were piling their plates so high you'd think they hadn't eaten for a week. Not the staff's fault at all, they were superb, constantly bringing out fresh food and clearing away tables after the people who obviously thought this was beneath them (this did wind me up as it was set up so that it was easy to clear away after yourself and meant new diners were coming into clear tables rather than having to wait for someone else to clear it away) Not much of a view from the room but this didn't bother us, the building is only 22 floors high and in a highly built up area you're not going to get much of a view. But the roof terrace is lovely and there are some great views from up there. Made use of the gym area, this was well equipped - treadmills, bikes, cross trainers, weights etc, water machine and plenty of towels. There's a free guest laundry too which is open 24 hrs. We also made use of the business centre facility, great for checking in online and printing boarding cards before our return journey. Great location, 5 minute walk from Macys, 10-15 min walk from Times Square. I don't understand the bad reviews, we really couldn't fault this hotel, would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others without hesitation.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall, our whole hotel experience was very pleasant; mainly due to the staff. Mr. Hugo was particularly helpful and approachable if we ever needed anything. He was a very hardworking individual and always went out of his way to make sure we felt at home. The rest of the staff were also very friendly and welcoming. The hotel itself was clean and modern and was in a good location, literally a 5 minute walk to 42nd street (one of the main streets in Times Square, including Madame Tussauds etc). It was also close to the 42nd street and 32nd street subways which was very useful as they gave direct links to the main areas in NY. The room was practical and had all the facilities we needed, apart from a kettle because the hot water was located in the Lobby. However, if you are located on one of the top floors, be prepared to wait a while for the lifts as they would often take their time. We had a balcony room, the balcony was lovely however there wasn't much to view as there was scaffolding on the building opposite. The free breakfast every morning and free evening meals from Mon-Thu were also very convenient as NY can be quite an expensive place, especially when it comes to food due to service charges etc. We would definitely book this hotel again and recommend it to anyone :)
user_name:
Hxneenx
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: this is an excellent hotel, rooms are clean and tidy, kitchenette is perfectly acceptable. breakfast was plentiful though could get busy and you could take out to your room to eat with the plentiful disposable freely available, hot drinks available all day and night.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: ok, last minute trip to nyc to give my wife a break as she's been work and we've both been travelling a lot, so my son, wife and I took off for a long weekend. My intentions were to get this done several weeks early but I'm glad I didn't. FIrst I used Booking.com for my hotels with Trip advisor as my backup check. I'll tell you that you have to keep checking because room rates change within hours. I was able to snag this property for under 175/night. And that is for a king efficiency, complete with a fridge, freezer, 2 burner stove, sink, great shower and a totally updated room....the room had knotted pine floors for gods sake....yes the room is small, and we didn't have a view, but it's mid town in one of the most incredible cities in the world. There were three of us (wife, son (8) and me..and oh, did I mention that we had a pull out sofa bed as well?? Being from NY, i was leary of a room so close to Penn Sta or the bus terminal...But not a problem at all. Was quiet, the front desk people were absolutely great and service was super friendly. Every morning, there was a full on breakfast....hot scrambled eggs, sausage, some sort of potatoes and the reg, breads, oatmeals, ceraels, yogurts.....All inclusive of the room rate....and if you're there mon-thurs, there's a complimentary cocktail reception and food as well......totally impressed. Room was done up in modern decor. Really nice and looked recently refurbished...Fresh complimentary coffee throughout the day and close by places to eat.....Even more importantly, and i did feel guilty about not taking advantage of the bkfst, but when i'm in nyc i HAVE to have a Bacon, egg and cheese sandwich to start my am off! and there was a place right around the corner on 8th called the international kitchen that delivered...all 3 of us ate each morning for under 9 dlrs!! 2 eggs, cheese and bacon on a fresh hard roll.....People may point you to an italian place, amalfis or something like that but it was a bit more expensive than the international kitchen, plus they had a build your own salad bar as well....Clientele were really diverse, lots of europeans and south americans which is always great, makes for meeting lots of interesting people, families as well but not so many that it was jamming with kids running all over the place...So in conclusion, great place, use tripadvisor or booking.com for your room rate, stay here, eat breakfast here or go to the place i mentioned.....There's also a 7 11 around the corner so you can pick up some libations and other perfect with a beer processed food snacks! Enjoy!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There a lots of people in the lobby area waiting for check in, 30+. Because room were not available. It was 5pm. The lady at the front desk was very businesslike, no controlled queue, people were cutting line, but employees in the front desk didn't stop them. There are three elevators, but only two are in service most of the time, we stayed lower level and when we checked out with big baggage, we had to wait for 20+ min, because they were alway full with guests from upstairs, I called front desk to resolve that situation, nothing happened. Packed with people in the breakfast area, you will need to wait for 10-15 min by yourselves to get seats, or you will have to stand/wait next to the people who are actually having breakfast to secure your seats.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hotel was in great location. Free Breakfast was great but it does get crowded and many guests are somewhat pushy but the staff always stayed calm and professional and not sure I could have done the same with the way some of the guests acted. Drinks is great after a long day out on the town but only get back once for that. Overall good hotel and good value for family of 4

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great crash pad for NYC! Really liked the convenience of being close to Times Square but just far enough from noise. Close to Penn station. The breakfast was very adequate, please, people quit complaining, it's free! Geesh! You can't go wrong here.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: With chain hotels, I find it's the little things that make the difference...and this location of Hilton's Homewood Suites has those touches.Room itself is fairly spacious for NYC standards, and surprise, surprise, not carpeted, but hardwood flooring. Bed is comfy and room has all the usual offerings so...Onto those little things...LED light on the front door light panel so even if it's pitch black, you know exactly where the switch is (no more miming along the wall to find it).Fan...when was the last time you had a room with a ceiling fan in it?! Righteous.Foot rest in the shower...FTW! Sounds like nothing but so useful in a smallish shower stall...ladies are gonna love this, trust me.Pull out desk...I've started to see this featured in more & more rooms and it's great for business travelers who want to work and watch TV at the same time, but not face into the wall.HDTV: yes 99.78% of hotels have flat panel TV's now but I still find soooo many don't bother to actually give you HD channels! They do here, killer picture & channels including HBO.Wifi: zippy and free.Elevator numbers: floor numbers are listed for each bank so you know exactly how fast (or slow) an elevator is coming. Only a couple negatives to report, but one's a biggie...I would have given this property 4 stars but had to take one away as I left a portable speaker behind in my room and after several calls & attempts to retrieve it, I didn't even get the courtesy of a response from staff!! #EpicFail One other thing to know, the compact elevators are very, very crowded during the morning rush...it typically took me 3 or 4 different attempts (or about 10 mins) just to get one with room! So I'd strongly recommend either staying on a higher floor to be the first on OR smarter yet, a lower floor and just take stairs down....believe me you'll be glad you did.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This Hotel was steps from Penn Station, Times Square and Midtown, where we wanted to be. Our room was very quiet, the bed was comfortable, and the kitchenette came in handy to store our bottle of wine!We were on the 17th floor (sadly, no view), but never had to wait for an elevator. The only complaint was...the free breakfast was barely adequate...no butter for toast or bagels one day, no cream (other than flavored) for coffee the next day...But the staff was very friendly, and let us check in early.All in All, kudos!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: So my friend and I booked our room through the app Hotels Tonight, and after a five-hour drive we arrived at the hotel at 1:30am. When we tried to check-in the front desk person then informed us in completely apathetic tones that our reservation had been for the previous night, and that when we didn't show up they charged my friend's card and cancelled the reservation. no phone call, nothing. We showed him the information that the app sent us with the correct dates, and pointed out that the hotel had made a mistake, and the guy merely shrugged and said there was nothing he could do for us because they were all full. It was indeed the hotel's mistake, and yet this guy was rude and did absolutely NOTHING to help us. He didn't bother to call any affiliated hotels in the area, showed zero concern, and seemed utterly apathetic that we were now without any hotel at 1:30am and utterly exhausted from a 5 hour drive. I have never seen a hotel treat guests so terribly EVER. It was truly shocking.
user_name:
hm759
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my first time staying at a Homewood Suites. This hotel is conveniently located near everything in Upper Manhattan...Times Square, Macy's and Madison Garden. Although I was in the heart of everything, I heard no noise at all in my room. Beautiful and efficient amenities in the room. All the comforts while on the road. The staff was very friendly and offered excellent service upon arrival, throughout the stay, and upon departure. I will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location was close to Times Square. Welcomed when we arrived. Helpful staff, and clean hotel. Dinner was ready when we arrived late in the evening. A very nice top roof patio, and clean fitness center.
user_name:
Annette G
Lake Stevens, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very good hotel : the personel is pleasent and welcoming. The Bedroom is spacious, silent and very clean, the bed comfortable. A alone problem : the refrigeratore was noisy when it was triggered? The breaksfast was ok and good. Perhaps, it was lacking a little croissants and similar types of bread

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent Hotel, very recommended for family and vacation. clean, big room, with kitchen Rich breakfast and dinner are served very nice. nice and helpful staff. great location, near to everything. We where 2 families and took 4 rooms and enjoyed our stay in the hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Comfortable and very clean. Although the immediate neighbourhood is undergoing some renovations, there was minimal noise to be heard in the room. The room was efficient and had more than what we expected in the kitchen area. Beds were comfortable and the pull out option on the setee was great to have. Great location, much of what we wanted to see was in easy walking distance.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The front desk staff were friendly when we checked in. Complimentary coffee and tea is available all day. Breakfast was included, with a big variety. The hotel is very modern, our suite was very big with two queen beds and a pullout. We were worried about the location, but it was great, less than 10 minutes from the heart of Times Square! We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stay in NYC a lot and this is my favorite hotel to stay in. Why? The rooms are much bigger than the normal NY hotel. There is a small kitchen in each suite. The beds are comfy and the wi-fi works great. Probably the best thing is that the staff are incredible and helpful. What else can you ask for? Love it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had really looked forward to staying here for a night, coming to NYC alone and had meticulously chosen this hotel after reading great reviews and because of the ideal location for my stay. It's never an easy decision to find the right hotel. I booked and paid for the room in advance and when I arrived to check in, I was informed that the hotel was overbooked. I was instead put in a room at the Hampton Inn, 7 blocks away and far away from where I was meeting friends. I had to ask them for cab fare to the Hampton Inn, which they did give me. But they should have offered without me having to ask. I would never have chosen the Hampton Inn (dirty carpet on floors) on my own and really feel that Homewood Suites treated me poorly as a customer. I'm not usually someone who complains, but if you mess up, you fix it properly, and Homewood Suites in Midtown did not fix this properly.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hey we just stayed at Homewood yesterday and left this am! We live in upstate ny and come to the city several times a year and we found our new home!! The front desk was stellar! Warm, friendly and super accommodating! What took it to another level was Carlton and Devon! They made our all included dinner and breakfast just perfect. Dinner is served during the week from 5-7 beer and wine included.The kitchen staff worked their butts off but made time to ask how we were doing and really meant it! Sincere, professional, and warm. First thing this morning we were asked how our day was, Carlton had given us some tips and hoped we had had a nice time. Then we met Levon who wanted to make sure we were all set and taken care of! Dinner and breakfast were great!!! We will always stay with Homewood Midtown. They must be proud of their staff, kudos! The rooms looked brand new and so clean ,beyond comfortable. The roof top patio is a great place to go and unwind after a busy day!! Make your reservation quick you won't be disappointed! Hope this helps you!Sent from my iPhone

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at this hotel between 24th - 31st March & it was GREAT. RESTAURANT -They offer tea,coffee & Hot chocolate all day everyday, which was great when the temperature is in the minus!!! The Breakfast is good if your not expecting 5* Quality, it is what is is FREE breakfast!! For us it was great fresh bagels, cakes, breads,cereals,fresh fruit, yogurts & small range of hot food. LOCATION - was great 10 mins walk from Times Square, 5 mins to Madison Square Gardens, 10 Mins to Empire state, 5 mins for Bus & train stations & 5 mins to Macy's. Local shops & on your doorstep.BEDROOM - We had a Suite which was 2 queen beds & a Fold away sofa bed which was great with 2 teenagers, My 14 yr old Boy slept on the foldaway & said it was really comfortable! We were on the 6th floor & didn't have any problems with noiseWIFI - FREE Which was great with 2 teenagers.Only negative was the fridge making a noise in the middle of the night.I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends & family.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Rooms are very nice and large; lobby is really nice; elevators work; breakfast experience is a nightmare - 10,000 people in a space designed for 20 people and there is no flow. I have started skipping breakfast just to avoid the hassle. Reception staff is disorganized and is extremely slow to notice guests arriving or check you in.
user_name:
Daniel E
Greenville, SC, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 8 nigths in this hotel. We ask for a higher floor and they give us the 21st floor (it's a 22 story building). The room had a lot of light, no noises from the Street or the corridors. The breakfast is really great, every morning something dfferent, baked potatotes, omelettes, eggs, .... some days bagels or muffins. Breakfast is from 06AM but I suggest you to arrive early every day in order to avoid the crowds.The bonus was the weekdays lunch (they call that appetizer) but it's a buffet with hot ítems and salad and it's running from Monday to Thursday from 5 PM to 7 PM. Drink Beer or wine as much as you want.USA Today provided at the room door weekdays (they forgot every single day but we take a copy from the front desk).Wifi is not bad (1MB) and is also complimentary. 5 minutes walking to Penn Station. 10 to Madison Square Garden.Also has a rooftop but the views are limited (you can see the very top levels of the Empire).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were in NYC for a Billy Joel show. Decided to stay close to the Garden. The price was high but this is NYC with a great location to everything. Room was nice with a kitchen. I think our balcony may have been about the same size as the room. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is at a prominent location in NYC. The staff is awesome !. This property is relatively new as compared to other properties.Breakfast is complementary. Dinner is definitely a plus on weekdays. Rooms are spacious. Overall the guest is treated well.Going back soon .Free wifi too.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here 4 nights for a family trip in NYC. Our suite room was spacious enough, although it had 2 queens but no extra sofa bed as advertised. The hotel decor and facilities are very nice and offer a good range of services. Wifi is fast, and the included aperitif/breakfast/dinner enjoyable and plentiful, if also of pretty average culinary quality, and served in a crowded space.The front desk personnel was generally helpful and responsive.If this hotel served better quality food and beverages, and paid more attention to little details like ecological choices in toiletry, bedding, ... it would be excellent. As it is, it is still a very good choice fo families.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I personally deleted this hotel because the price was ok when compared with the others and it offers the breakfast. When I arrived the hotel I was surprised because they offered also dinner from Monday to Thursday.I had a little disappointment when arrived my room. In the pictures that I saw in Internet, the studio has a bedroom separated from the kitchen and also a sofa. My room had everything together. In summary, the hotel is good enough to spend some days in Nyc with good location, quiet, and offers the breakfast and dinner with free drinks.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel's quality is heads and shoulders above anything else in this price range. Updated, comfortable and clean rooms; friendly staff; great location; incredible fitness center. I can't recommend it highly enough.
user_name:
Raymond L L E
Dallas, TX, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were very impressed with this hotel. We stayed from the 13th March - 21st March and we have had an amazing stay. The room was clean, modern and size wise appropriate. The bed was huge! - and comfortable. The only thing that we would recommend for the hotel to improve is the food. We found the choice of food to be very limited and almost everyday we have had the same breakfast. Although this was a little disappointing we still found the free breakfast and a free monday - thursday dinner to be very convenient as we have saved a lot of money to do some shopping. Also, the lobby provides a free tea and coffee anytime, so you can just grab your coffee and go sightseeing. VERY CONVENIENT.Overall, we will be back at this hotel as we loved the location (short walk away from Times Square and subway), and we loved the room and the service we have received. However, ff you're a picky eater you might need to go find a nearby restaurant instead.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: For a business trip that included time spent with family, this hotel was perfect for us. The hotel offered all the amenities I wanted as a business traveler (breakfast, Wifi, efficient front-desk staff) and plenty of space to bring my family for this trip. Room: Very, very clean. The bathroom was spotless, the kitchen area was immaculate. Our bedding was comfortable, fresh, and clean. Our room was quiet even though it was on a lower floor and it faced the street. We did not hear street noise at night. Food: The breakfast offered decent options to get us started - eggs, sausage/bacon, potatoes; cold cereals and oatmeal; fresh fruit; yogurt; beverages. The area does get busy but we never waited long and we never waited for food to be replenished. Service: The front desk staff were very professional, prompt and helpful. Location: A couple of blocks from subways and Penn Station. Access to taxis is plentiful. Not the prettiest neighborhood in NYC, but busy and safe. All in all, this is a solid go-to hotel if you want a comfortable, clean, and convenient hotel in midtown.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room, though very small, is clean and modern. The hotel appliances work good. Hotel is in a great location. The hotel serves breakfast everyday with a good selection. They also serve dinner most days. It could get crowded at meal times and securing a table to dine can be difficult. The place was reasonable for the price compared to other hotels in NYC at the time of year (week after Christmas) we were there.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughter and I spent a week in New York for her 21st birthday, and Homewood Suites was such a haven to return to each day after exploring the main attractions of Manhattan, on foot and by subway. HS is was so well situated, just ten minutes walk from Times Square/Theatre District, no more than fifteen minutes to the Empire State Building/Fifth Ave, and the subway was even closer. Our room was nicely decorated, the beds were comfortable, the kitchenette was well equipped and the bathroom was very clean. We had everything we needed and there was no noise problem. OK the room wasn't huge and our view was of another building, but we certainly weren't cramped and as we were out everyday, the lack of view didn't bother us. There's a good view from the roof on 22nd floor though. The complimentary hot drinks in the lobby are a nice touch, breakfasts were good, and the complementary supper (Mon-Thurs) including wine/beer was a welcome bonus when we were too exhausted to go out after a hard days' shopping and sightseeing. The staff were always pleasant and helpful and although we didn't use them, I believe there was a laundry and gym in the basement, available to guests. All in all, top marks, for the price and situation, I would highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is located in a very convenient location, accessible by several metro lines, and a walking distance to Time Square. The room was extremely small, but modern, clean and decorated with taste. The bathroom was a good size, nicely done and very clean, equipped with everything we needed, though the quality of the shower was not that great. Hot tea and coffee was served in the lobby all day long, in addition to having it available in our suite. The frig was big and other appliances worked just fine. Plates, cups, glasses, pots and silverware are provided in the room. The breakfast is good and with a great variety for all kinds of needs, from bagels, and toasts, to oatmeal and yogurt and fresh fruit and egg and potato and sausage, etc. But the quality of the hot items were not as good as the cold items. I loved having plenty of yogurt and berries. They graciously serve dinner on M-TH, and the quality of food was quite descent. It gets very crowded over dinner so you cannot sit there and enjoy it quietly for a long time. Have to hurry! Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and will be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We booked this hotel for oust last night at Manhattan, before our flight back home and were very staisfied of all in the property: staff, food, location. All. Can recommend to all who need good location, reasonable price and nice property and service-

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just returned from a five night stay. We were welcomed by Daniel who was very efficient and very helpful particularly when we advised him of our missing luggage on coach trip from JFK. Having requested a high level, street facing room we were very happy with room 1405. Room was spacious, decorated and furnished in a contemporary style with a large, very comfortable bed with super cotton sheets. Kitchenette was well equipped for those wishing to dine in after a long day walking around NY City.Breakfast was fine though there can be some room for improvement particularly in choice of egg available and type of bacon. Tried early evening dinner once but it was poor for us though well used by other guests. Complimentary hot drinks in reception area were very welcome and appreciated.Hotel was busy but there was no issues whatsoever re noise in corridor nor from street.As a regular visitor to Homewood Suites in Florida the decor and style of this establishment surpasses all others. Hope a refurbishment is to be rolled out in Fl.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My room was so gorgeous I was sad to leave. I often feel hotels in NYC are way overpriced with few amenities but this hotels is worth it. The staff was pleasant and the breakfast/open reception ranks this hotel well above others in the area especially considering how close it is to the touristy crap. Can't wait to stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We recently stayed in one of the bigger suites as a family and found the hotel to be clean, located in a wonderful area and suitable for a longer stay. The food was average - but with free breakfast every morning and dinner Mon, Tues and Wed - along with beverages - you just can't go wrong. It is conveniently located close to Times Square, subway stops, the garment district and more

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Where to start ..what a lovely friendly hotel, we were welcomed by Leslie ( I think that was her name) very helpful , our room wasn't ready when we arrived , she was very apologetic ,we sat and waited in the lobby, room didn't take long, there is free tea, coffee, hot chocolate all day and night which was fantastic, the free breakfast everyday was a bonus, the food was very fresh and lovely, plenty and you just helped yourselves, you could take up to your room if you wanted, there was cooked food, like eggs etc, toast, cereal, porridge, fresh fruit, fruit juices, great staff there if needed any help with anything, we arrived at 6am when they opened for breakfast as we found by 8/9 am they we're really busy and was hard to get a table. We stayed in room 2011 it was clean and large, nice shower, cooker hob, dish washer and a fridge ,the beds were very comfy and got a good nights sleep, we had fresh towels left daily and the bed was always freshly made when we returned each evening... Great location right near penn station, few blocks away from Times Square, plenty of places nearby to grab food or snacks on the go. We needed to find out one morning how to get to the world trade centre site, and Leslie was most helpful and more than happy to give us directions . All staff were happy to help and nothing was too much effort, the guy that takes your bags to store when you check out was lovely to, he arranged a cab for us on our last day to take us to the airport, sure enough it was there waiting, ( and early :) this was our fourth trip to NYC and I would hesitate staying here in the future ! If you want a friendly hotel with all amenities then look no further! They also have a gym and a launderette on site, the roof top terrace was beautiful to, with a seating area , lovely on a summers day, there was also free wifi in the lobby and the rooms which was really good as we wanted to face time our children back in UK ! Thank you homewood suites for a magical stay, we will be back :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The rooms in this hotel are excellent value for New York - very well maintained and furnished, with kitchenette, comfortable beds and bathroom. It's best to get a high floor to avoid street noise from the construction site opposite, anything on floors 2-8 facing the street is difficult (at the moment), but up high the room was quiet and great. Fitness facilities are basic but satisfactory and easy to access. The only real negative point: Breakfast is horrible, in a room too small for the size of the hotel and with an unimaginative selection. There was almost no fruit, just fried eggs and potato with bread, some other things on offer as well but overall it was awful. It's the only point we didn't like, and for such reasonable room price we were happy to breakfast outside every day. Overall, it's a great location, good staff and very high quality rooms - this hotel is recommended in a city that is normally very expensive.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spent 4 nights in this centrally located hotel--walkable to all kinds of attractions (Macy's/34th St Shopping, Bryant Park, Times Square, and the Garment District with the "Mood" store, made famous by Project Runway) and transportation centers (Penn Station, Grand Central Station and Bus Depot). My suite was roomy, and with a clean, sleek and modern continental feel. Well equipped, and quiet even in the room next to the elevator. The window opened to get an exchange of air (always a plus for me!!) and when closed, it totally shut out the sounds of the street below for a quiet night's sleep. Daily breakfast and dinner included Monday through Thursday. Amenities include Business center and a large exercise room. One "unadvertised" but very helpful bonus was the laundry room with washers and dryers--which, at $2.50 per load per machine is a tremendous savings over sending it out and having it charged "by the piece."Free wi-fi was provided, but was a little spotty at times.I'd go back in a heartbeat!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed 3 nights with my Mom and Son. We all loved this hotel. It was clean and modern. Our room was on the 17th floor, facing the front of the building, which was great for my son, who wanted to see the 'action' down below. The midtown location was perfect and within comfortable walking distance to many sights. Always felt safe to walk at night.Breakfast was just 'ok' and finding a seat was a challenge, if you arrived at peak time (~8:00a). The all day coffee/tea in the lobby was great! Front desk staff were super friendly and very helpful.Great value for your money here!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have stayed in other Homewood Suites but finding one in NYC was great. The rooms are very nice and clean, with a kitchen, big bathroom, walk in shower, nice basic breakfast, 24 hour coffee/tea and it was very close to everything, walked to Radio City, Times Square. Perhaps what sets it apart is the staff, they were truly interested in each person they served and the kitchen staff did a great job keeping up with the weekend volumn. We will be back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a great place to stay in NYC! Sincere and helpful staff. Huge room with everything you could need. Yummy breakfast AND dinner. Perfect location- 3 blocks to Penn Station, 2 to Subway. The only problem I could see was that the bed was so comfy, I did NOT want to get up and hit the streets :-) Thank you for a wonderful stay!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed here one night with my daughter and my mother before going to see a Broadway Play. The hotel was very clean and the staff was VERY friendly. The only problem we had was that we were on the 2nd floor and our window faced 37th Street. We heard every car that drove by during the night and there was a recycling truck outside the window at 11:00pm that woke my daughter up. Obviously this is not the hotels fault but if you stay here and are a light sleeper try to ask for a high floor and a room not facing 37th street. The location was perfect. We were going to see Phantom of the Opera and it was only a few blocks away. And it was only a few block from Penn Station as well. The breakfast in the morning was great they had French toast, sausage, bagles, oatmeal, cereal etc. Overall this was a great hotel and I would stay here again if I need to spend the night in the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was a real 'find'. Wonderful friendly, knowledgeable staff, clean, tidy and modern rooms with a kitchenette. Coffee, tea and popcorn in room but always a ready supply of drinks in the lobby so only used the fridge for chilling champagne! ( it was my 60th). Included breakfast was good and plentiful, didn't have a problem finding a table although tended to be up fairly early. Monday to Thursday complementary evening meal was a bonus ( only one nights wasn't quite so good) and the beer and wines supplied were excellent. Very reasonable price considering its central location. No distance at all really to Time Square, Macy's and the Empire State. Penn street station was very close by for the subway to the 9/11 Memorial site and museum and there were some excellent restaurants only a short walk away. Can't fault the hotel and should we ever return we will definitely stay here. It has already been recommended to friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: For NY you cant beat the value offered at this Hotel. I will definitely stay there again. I found the finishes and cleanliness exceptional. The hotel was quiet as well. The location was off the beaten path for NY bit not too far where it was inconvenient.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just arrived home yesterday after a 4 night 5 day stay at the Homewood suites. This is a really great central location. Well kept, and very clean. The kitchen is an added bonus with complimentary coffee, tea and popcorn. Our room was 403, with 2 queen beds, away from the elevators with a street view and close to the stairs, which we always used since the elevators were quite busy. The room was quiet at night, a nice assortment of items for breakfast, the complementary supper with free wine and beer was a nice added bonus. Staff were always patient and informative. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again. Easy walking distance to a number of sites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Efficient, clean, QUIET & friendly staff- what more could you ask for? I was attending a show at the Javits Center and this hotel was within easy walking distance and priced very competively. I was very pleased with my stay. The only down side was that the fruit at the breakfast buffet was frozen, as in still frozen when placed on the serving line. My room was also very warm. I tried to cool it down but too no avail.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel with friendly and helpful staff in Mid-Town NYC - what a great find! Homewood Suites offers that extra kitchenette which is so helpful when staying multiple days. It is just a short walk to Broadway shows and Restaurant row.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We arrived super early and the front staff was very accommodating and got us to our room. They were extremely friendly and personable even though the lobby was packed and they were very busy. Breakfast was delicious and once again the service was spectacular. I would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had the best stay at this hotel. Helpful & friendly staff, beautiful decor, comfortable beds. I loved the climate controls. There's also a ceiling fan! Probably the only thing I noticed that they didn't have was a robe. They had everything else for your convenience -- even a toaster! The kitchenette was superb. The hot daily breakfast was really good. (Just no waffles nor pancakes. Great fresh fruit, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, English muffins, bagels & toast. They serve dinner M-Th also. I didn't get to experience that since I stayed on a Sunday though. The fire place was awesome in the lobby as was the water feature. The only helpful tip I can think of is to be wary of the traffic on 37th as it's a major vein to the Lincoln tunnel. It's really hard to get in and out of the garage across the street that the hotel recommends. It's only a $5 savings if they validate your ticket so I'd prolly use a different one next time if I were to drive in again. I'll prolly use the train though as its only four blocks from Penn Station. Excellent, excellent hotel though. I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Been to New York multiple times and stayed various places. I have found this hotel to be right in the middle of and near everything I wanted. I took my childhood best friend to the city for Christmas (He had never been) and we loved the hotel. Truth be told we weren't at the hotel much because we wanted to be in the city. A couple blocks and you were in Times Square, Rockefeller Center, multiple subway stations...great place to be. Hotel was clean and appropriate and the staff helpful and patient (rare for New Yorkers). Thank you for a great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My other half and I went here for New Year. We had both always wanted to go to New York and obviously wanted to make sure the whole holiday was perfect, so we had spent a lot of time hunting for the best hotel and this hotel couldn't have been more perfect! We arrived and were greeted by a very friendly bunch of reception staff. My partner had emailed to ask for a room with a view, unfortunately this was not put through, but that was our fault more than theirs really. After checking in we went straight up to our room and we were so impressed! The room was fantastic - Modern, clean, bright room, massive bed, lovely bathroom, full size fridge freezer, tea, coffee, hot chocolate and microwave popcorn. We were over the moon! We arrived around 4pm so by the time we had settled in, it was time for Dinner. Reading some of the reviews before we went we weren't expecting much - it was complimentary after all - however the food was lovely. The only downside if that you have to eat off of polystyrene plates and with plastic cutlery... but that isn't the end of the world. We were also able to keep some stuff in the fridge in our room so this kept the cost of food down. There is also tea, coffee and hot chocolate available by the reception area (I believe this is 24 hours). Give one of the hot chocolates a go - I preferred it over the Starbucks hot choc! The breakfast was also lovely, just your typical american sausage, scrambled egg, potato hash, toast that kind of thing; as well as cereal, porridge, fruit etc.The rooms were cleaned daily, linen changed and restock of supplies. Reading some of the reviews before we went, we were a bit worried about the lift waiting times as this had been mentioned by quite a few people. This was not a problem for us at all. Over the 6 nights we were there, we did not wait anymore than 1 minute, so this was not a problem. The hotel also has free WiFi, a gym, computer room, laundry room and small shop.It is in a perfect location, not far from the heart of time square but was far enough away for us to not be kept awake by the New Year Celebrations. They have their own taxi service, which was much nicer than to travel in rather one of the crazy yellow cabs! The drivers in the yellow cabs drive like they want to kill themselves, so I would definitely recommend using the hotel taxi service. Its also only about $5 more to go in one of their lovely, comfy taxis. I would definitely go here again and would recommend it to anybody thinking of going!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We booked a one week stay here based on our positive experiences at other Homewood Suites properties and the positive TripAdvisor reviews for this property in particular. After staying here for a week, we can add our name to the list of satisfied customers. Management is to be commended for running a first rate operation.The staff at this hotel does an exceptional job of working hard to make your stay a pleasant one.The hotel is in a convenient location to all kinds of NYC activities and restaurants. The lobby, common areas, and rooms are very clean and well kept. The breakfast and dinner offerings were also quite good.We will absolutely stay here again when we return to NYC in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fair price , good location, delicious complimentary breakfast plus dinner on M-Th , includes wine and beer. Great friendly staff. Nice rooms. With gym. Fireplace at lobby for cold winter. Friendly staff with a smile.
user_name:
Isabelo C
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Traveled with my teenage daughter and stayed at Homewood Feb. 28 - March 3, 2015 and was pleased with the hotel and location for the price we paid. The lobby, room and bathroom were all very well presented with current, modern furnishings. The room we had included a King bed and a twin size pullout sofa with a small kitchenette with stainless steel appliances. Though we did not use the kitchen other than to make tea, it was nice to have the extra sink while we were getting ready. Coffee, tea and microwave popcorn were provided in the room. Coffee and tea are always available in the Lobby and breakfast is served each morning and consisted of eggs, breakfast meat, potatoes, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, some fruit and several bread items and juices. Being situated between 8th and 9th Avenue, the street noise was not unbearable. It is New York after all and you will hear sirens and horns no matter where you are. We did not interact with the staff much; however, when passing them in hall or on elevator, they always spoke. There is not a doorman and taxis are not waiting outside the hotel so you have to walk to one of the Avenues to catch a taxi. Times Square is a few blocks away as is Macy's. Walk to Rockefeller Plaza and Theatre District is 20 minutes. Walk to Chelsea is 25 - 30 minutes. This is my fourth stay in NYC and each time has been at a different hotel. If you are watching your budget, I highly suggest you stay at Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood suites were excellent in location for shopping and travel. It was just two blocks from the subway A train which I use to commute to and from JFK airport. Time square and popular shopping is just a few blocks away. Hotel staff were warm and professional, I was impress that they secure my bags while I explore the city before checkin. The room was modern and comfortable and the kitchenette was just perfect for a chef. I pertictulaly enjoyed looking at the clouds of snow through my large window since it was my first time in New York for winter. Lots of towels.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I usually stay at hilton hotels but this is the best for a long time. It started two days before we even arrived when we received an email from Allyson Leyman at the hotel saying the they were looking forward to us visiting. She was there on our arrival and gave us a great welcome. The rooms are really spacious and it's really handy having a kitchenette. It's a new hotel so everything is lovely and clean, and the decor is great. The rooms have everything you need. Having breakfast included is a real plus together with 24 hour coffees and teas. Monday to Thursday they also have dinner and beer/wine all included. This can save a ton of money. It's also a great location just a few blocks from Times Square and there's lots of restaurants and bars close by. We opted for a higher floor as NYC is noisy with lots if traffic wherever you are. Thanks Allyson and all the other staff for looking after us so well!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If you are looking for an affordable, perfectly located NYC hotel with plenty of room to spread out, you'd found your spot. This place is a real gem. The rooms were, well, roomy - with very modern and comfortable furnishings. The evening happy hour served as dinner - pizza, salad and wine, and the breakfast had a pretty good selection, although it was quite crowded. However, my highest praise goes to the staff. The front desk folks, Tiffany especially, really went out of their way to make me feel welcome and answer all my questions. Well done, Homewood Suites!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My son and I stayed at the Homewood Suites his Birthday trip to Manhattan. We usually stay downtown, but we had tickets to an event at Madison Square Garden, and this hotel was walking distance. Everything about the hotel was great from the moment we arrived. The staff said our room was not ready yet (we arrived about an hour after the check-in time) but this is not unusual for busy NYC hotels. What WAS unusual, was the great attitude of the front desk personnel. It was about 10 minutes (with free coffee and hot chocolate) later that we were given our room keys. Pretty quick, in my experience. The room itself was specious, not just by NYC standards, and not only had a full kitchenette (burners and everything) but also service for 4, pots and pans, and even storage containers. Small details, but I have stayed in other places with a "kitchenette" that had no way to cook anything. Nothing in this hotel is an afterthought. The room was clean, the bed comfy, the bathroom up to date and comfortable. There was a sofabed near the window that could have been used by a 3rd person.Also offered, M-TH, was a "reception" that included not only beer, wine, and soft drinks, but basically a full dinner. We had hamburgers and salad, and it was quite good (in addition to saving us at least $30-50 that evening, as we had planned to just keep it simple anyway). Breakfast was very good, too. The eggs did not seem artificial (like in many hotel breakfast buffets) and there was fruit, yogurt, cereal, and an assortment of breads. Also, the juice was fresh. ***A big Thank You here, to Carmen, who was working at the breakfast and got me "To Go" containers so that I could bring food up for my still-sleeping son. I stupidly spilled orange juice because I was trying to balance it, and Carmen got me a tray, and suggested that I use the coffee cups that had lids. She did this all with a smile. AWESOME employee among awesome employees*** There was free, fast Wi-Fi, too. And all of this was included in the very good price we paid. I highly recommend this hotel, especially for people who need to be around Midtown. It was far enough away from Times Square to be calm, but close enough that if you want to go there, it takes about 5 minutes walking. It is about 15 minutes walk to Penn Station, less, depending on which part you need. I will stay here again. My only wish is that it were farther downtown, as that is where we usually like to stay-do things. Still, it is worth the short cab or Subway ride by a long-shot to stay in this Hotel. Everyone was great, the facility was great, and the value was excellent. Just once more: Thanks to the whole staff, and especially Carmen!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was excellent for the price. My friends and I went to New York for International Fashion Week. Other hotels that we priced for that same week were triple the price. The room was small but the hotel was new and the rooms and lobby were very clean with every amenity that you would want. The breakfast and dinner buffet was complimentary and very good. This will be my hotel of choice when visiting Manhattan in the future.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at this hotel when I went to visit my cousin who lives in Brooklyn. I had a room on the 21st Floor, a King Bed Studio. The room was small, but that's what to expect in New York. Even though it was small, the room was loaded with amenities. There was a full kitchenette with a two-burner stove, a medium-sized refrigerator/freezer, a small (but nice) dishwasher, sink, and microwave. They also provided pots, pans, plates, bowls, and utensils so that was a great thing. If you want to save money and/or cook healthy, these rooms can be a bargain. There are a few grocery stores and drug stores in the area, so it is easy to get food should you wish to cook in your room. The complimentary full breakfast was also nice; they had a variety of hot and cold foods. I, however, suggest going to breakfast first thing in the morning because it can get very crowded if you go later. The lobby is beautiful with a surround fireplace, a large wall fountain, and an overall welcoming atmosphere. The staff is always eager to help in anyway they can. One thing to note: The 22nd Floor has a rooftop patio with views of the surrounding skyline. The location is excellent; just 3 blocks from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Times Square is also just a few blocks away as well. The great rooms and service at this hotel are sure to please. I want to stay here again!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a new property on 37th Street between 8th and 9th Avenues, just a few blocks from Penn Station. The lobby is bright and open, but not expansive. Coffee, tea, and hot chocolate are available all day long (no charge). Adjacent to the lobby is the breakfast area where a buffet is set up in the morning (included with the room rate). Our check in was a little strange; we were given key cards to a room we found to be already occupied. When we returned to the front desk, the clerks were unsure what had happened. We were assigned a different room, but the experience was odd and there seemed to be something left unresolved. Our room was very comfortable, large by New York standards, and as quiet as can be. We heard no street noise; none. King size bed plus a sofa (pulls out for another bed), desk, kitchenette, nicely appointed bathroom. Nothing in the room not to like. Breakfast in the morning was cramped and rushed. The breakfast area is just not large enough and it is understaffed. There were insufficient utensils and buffet items were not replenished. The warm items seemed processed and there was little else that looked appealing. Juice, yogurt, granola and an orange did the trick. I would definitely stay here again, particularly if I snagged the $84 rate I found on the hilton.com website.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our 8 days stay. Ideally located close to Time square and subway Penn Station. All the staff is very nice. The room witth the street view are very nice. We had a beautiful firework for the chinese new year ! I will for sure come back to this hotel. Very good price for such a quality

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great rooms, VERY quiet, friendly and helpful staff, and a great bargain for the location.The room was very comfortable, although I still laugh at the difference in size of the room between NYC and Dallas. Everything you could possibly need has been carefully thought of and provided for with an overall high level of quality.All of this, combined with what had to have been the absolute best price I could find for miles made this a winner of a choice.I highly recommend this property.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It was a clean hotel and with all new furniture and I liked the hardwood floors too. Would definitely stay here again if I'm ever back in the area. I'm in NYC quite often so I will be back pretty soon.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: here for 2 nights to babysit our grandson while our daughter interviewed for jobs here. He was teething, still on LA time, had a cold, miserable, he also threw up in the bed in the middle of the first night. The housekeeping staff, front desk, servers in the dining area, everyone I encountered was pleasant, helpful, just lovely. The manager is to be commended for training.We also enjoyed the breakfasts, which changed each day, as well as the coffee and tea available all day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I scoured high and low and could not believe how much less expensive this was than any other room in the area for a King bed and with this much space especially. It was even a better bargain because our daughter was staying with us and for her to have her own bed would have been $30-$50 more anywhere else. I love the Homewood Suites model but I have to say the breakfast was only meh when we stayed. It's never fantasmic but it was only ok at best. But... it kept us full and kept our budget down so we had more $ for a nice lunch. But this hotel was cute! Very modern. Super duper clean. Comfy bed. Well appointed. It felt nicer than just a moderate hotel, to me with the waterfall wall and such. I would easily stay again and I LOVED being so close to Penn Station. Easy walk to Times Square... I could go on and on, but you should just book it. (Ps- my three year old loved it too!)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My friends and I stayed here for a long weekend on a trip to New York, and it was more than what we could have hoped for. Especially for the price! All the staff were super friendly and helpful, including Daniel the concierge who was there throughout our stay. The location was great, near to subways and in midtown Manhattan so everything was in easy reach. Our rooms were perfect and were cleaned daily. And the complimentary breakfast and weekday suppers were a bonus. Definitely coming back here again, would recommend to anyone. Thank you again- look forward to staying again soon.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel with two friends and the room was actually comfortable for three people.. The price we paid was similar to what other hotels of the same category offered and its location was perfect! Breakfast was nice and it was different everyday.. The only negative thing is that their elevators were slow because the hotel was full! what i really liked was that you could grab a cup of coffee or tea from the hotel as you went outside to the city!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: With free 24hr coffee & tea on a freezing winters trip, wifi, free breakfast & surprisingly free dinner on week nights with Beer & wine on the house as well, this place was very convenient and top notch for the budget conscious traveler. Mind you we didn't partake in this often or daily but its nice to know its there for those that need that.
user_name:
John Henry C
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It was the end of January/beginning of February when we stayed here and needless to say it was certainly cold. Therefore I was looking for something near Lincoln Center, my office, and Penn Station. The gap between the three is a hidden market of the city named after the New York Times (a small newspaper publication). This was the best deal I could find and certainly would suffice for most people. It is small, but more spacious than most rooms in this price range for this area. It's also helpful to have kitchen appliances in a room as well. Hard wood floors are always appreciated. There was absolutely no view whatsoever, and the elevators are slow and never inspired much confidence. But the best part were the real sunflowers that were used to decorate the room. Flowers always help brighten a room. I would return, if only because all other options in this neighborhood are obscenely overpriced.
user_name:
Kwan N
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location of this six month old hotel is ideal. However there are a few bugs to work out. I found the front desk staff unapproachable and at times non existent. The "free" WI-FI had to be reset everyday as it only was good for 24 hours. The maid nightly parked her cleaning cart our side our door. Rooms are small, not quite a "suite" and with way too much furniture in them. The breakfast was quite good, with quality food and plenty of choices. One of the few chains to get this right.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We went for a week end in NYC and were looking for a low cost and great location. ..that's what we got. It's always nice to get free breakfast and free wifii. The gym is very nice and the hotel is very clean. We will be back for sure

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: From the room I could see the whole skyline. The hotel is centrally located. You could literally walk across the street to a Broadway show or next door to Dave and Busters. I was in NYC for work, and went to the Javits Center everyday. It wasn't more than a $10 taxi ride away.I've stayed in NYC before, and space is a valuable commodity. the Hilton Times Square was a great value in terms of space and money.
user_name:
Joan K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our son had a ballet audition so we needed a spot just for one night. We chose the Homewood Suites since it had the most room for the $$ (we have triplets). The room was smallish but very new and modern - it had two beds and a sofa which was helpful with 3 children. We ended up using Hilton points which was a bonus! There are delis nearby and Times Square is right around the corner - our son even got a great haircut around the corner! What I liked about the hotel is that it's modern (vs. some drafty, older NYC hotels) and it had a nice coffee area at elevator. For the price, you can't beat it in a central location of NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here because my daughter was attending classes nearby. I have to say that this was one of the best hotels we have stayed in NYC. Loved the pergo floors. Usually hotel carpets feel icky and you don't want to take off your shoes or socks. The flooring made the room feel cleaner and more like home. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffets were what you would expect. Nothing fancy, but it was complimentary. They had a decent selection for food and beverages. A nice touch was the all day coffee, tea, hot chocolate in the lobby. It was FREEZING outside, so that was a nice thing to have after walking around the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a family trip...me & my 2 kids 19&16. The hotel was in a very good location although it was a lil bit further from the subway than I thought. The staff was soooo helpful & cordial! They drew is routes on the maps they provided. Helped arrange car service to the airport. This was my first stay at a Homewood Suite but it won't be my last!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A very comfortable place, appartment/room with excellent kitchen facilities en other facilities. For New York very spacious. Recently build and very well maintained. Daily room services excellent. Very freindly and helpfull staff. Nice lobby, very realxed in the heart of the metropolis; good fitness facilities, free and fast internet. We have enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and dinner! Great location Midtown West Manhattan, only three blocks away from Madison Square Garden/Penn Station. Supper access to the subway stations and on walking distance from Empire State, MOMA, Time Square and even Central Park. Very much recommended in NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Friendly, helpful staff. Great showers and towels. Lavish breakfast available every morning. Truly within walking distance of popular NY sights. I will tell all my friends and would love to go back to this Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had a theater weekend over Valentine's Day and Presidents' weekend, so New York was busy and full of tourists. After searching online, we found this hotel to be extremely conveniently located and considerably cheaper than the alternatives. We were able to easily walk to and from the theaters and to dinners. For further excursions, the subway is also nearby and an easy walk. It was a surprising value and we will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We just spent a fantastic week at Homewood. We had booked a studio for 3 adults - one king size bed and a sofa.Check-in was efficient and fast.The studio wasn´t large, but the size was adequate. A nice bathroom with shower, small kitchenette with dishwasher and all necessary kitchen utensils.We didn´t cook in the flat, but it could easily be done. There are two small tables and including the sofa the necessary seatings for three.There is daily cleaning.Coffee, tea etc is available in the studio, but we used the free coffee station in the lobby - 24/7 fresh coffee incl. decaf and Robusta plus tea and coco.There is a nice free gym in the basement.Breakfast was fine - cereals, oatmeal, different hot dishes, orange and apple juice, toast, bagels, jam, Philadelphia etc. No cut meat or sliced cheese - but it was no problem.Monday to Thursday we had free dinner between 5 and 7. It could be soup and a hot dish - plain and simple, but nice to have before theatre etc. Free beer and wine included !The hotel was sold out, but we didn´t have problems finding a free table for breakfast or dinner, but some of the guests took the meals into the studio.After check out the reception took care of our luggage until departure.The hotel is situated near Penn Station and only 5 minutes from 42nd Street - perfect.We definitely recommend this hotel - good quality, reasonable prices, breakfast included, dinner incl. drinks Mo-Th. It couldn´t be better.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: room was great and all the services were great.internet was strong and gym was cleanfood served mon to thurs was ok but had to get in early. careful if you have an allergy as they didn't state if it was gluten free or notdefinitely coming back

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great property close to nearly everything my family of 5 wanted to experience. Time Square, Museum of Modern Art, Korean Town, Empire State building, and Central Park just a little further up. Subway stations are three-four blocks away (along 8th ave.) at Port Authority and taxi can easily be hailed from the corner of 8th Ave. and 37th St.About the property, prompt and friendly service. Got keys to our room in less than 5 minutes! The room was clean and comfortable. The kitchenettes (refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher, electric burner and a sink) were ideal for our family. Fitness center with high glass ceiling was a plus. The best value is free breakfast (6am-10am) and dinner (5-7 Monday-Thursday). From all the hustle and bustle of city life, its refreshing to return to the hotel for free beer and wine on weeknights. I love it. Will definitely plan on returning.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I researched almost all New York hotels before deciding on this one WHAT A GEM, the hotel, staff, food,location,rooms could not be better. It was a friendly and altogether brilliant place.The breakfast was amazing almost everything hot and cold you would want. Didn't need to get down early for seating either. From Monday to Thursday there were free evening meals with wine & beer between 5-7, could not fault it.Very central a few mins from Macys, Times square and Empire state. Arrived as it was my 50th birthday Daniel on reception delivered a nice bottle of wine to our room minutes after we arrived. Thank you to all at the Homewood Suites it really made our stay in New York.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fantastic hotel to stay, very helpful and courteous staff, nothing was a problem. Room was very neat ans clean and larger than I thought it would be. Great location and the complimentary breakfast and dinner was good. definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable and relaxing place to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have never been so pleased with the friendly and helpful service we experienced when staying at this hotel. Everyone we encountered was excellent, but I need to mention that Nafeesa went above and beyond expectations. I will only stay at this hotel for any further visits to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Trip advisor let me give half star ratings! This is a two and half not three! I booked this hotel as I wanted a bit of space as I had so much luggage with me. The king size room is small. Not exactly a suite. I phoned reception and asked if all the rooms were the same. I was told yes. Then I looked online and it showed the two double bed queens were bigger. So I phones again and was told they were a little bit bigger. So I asked to see them and found they were almost twice the size. Really the hotel reception should know there rooms better than thisStaff were friendly. Room was fine once I changed. Internet was painfully slow, a common problem sadly. I can't imagine staying here again. It is what it is. No character. No charm. Simply a place to sleep.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Really nice and helpful staff, modern building and charming place specially the days they offer drinks and dinner, good location, king Studio perfect size, bedroom, bathroom and living- kitchenet. I traveled with my 19 years old daughter, she loved the place.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I recently stayed here over the weekend for business, and I don't think I can say enough great things about this hotel! First off, the hotel is gorgeous! Very new and modern. I arrived about an hour before check in and of course my room was available. I mention to the gentleman who checked me in that there was a particular King Studio room I saw online that I really liked, but I want sure if that was the room I had booked. It wasn't, but he went out of his way to accommodate me and complimentary upgraded me to the room I liked! Awesome! The customer service is amazing, Daniel was so cool and helpful. The rooms are pretty spacious for NYC! They have a full kitchen and a small couch in each room. I literally had real walking room in my room, and anyone who has stayed in NYC hotels knows that rooms are literally the size of a closet! Lol! There was complimentary breakfast every morning that was really good. Also a 24 rooftop terrace that over looks the Hudson. The location was perfect! Located about 5 blocks from Times Square, about 2 blocks from Madison square garden! If you take Megabus or bolt bus for your travels, it's maybe a 10 minute walk from the pick up stops. Pretty much in an ideal location. Overall this hotel is perfect! This is officially my go to hotel when in NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the location and price of the hotel are great for this hotel compared to most other Hilton brand hotels. my room was small I asked for a nicer room but was denied, great diamond benefit of the hotel. as a diamond I don't think I received any benefits. all said and done, the hotel is very nice. great lobby, nice clean rooms. good breakfast, lacks variety, and great evening reception.the hotel did check me in early as well.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall, this is a really nice suite hotel and probably slightly better than the nearby Candlewood or Staybridge (both of which are a bit older but otherwise excellent). It's about five blocks from Penn Station and in a fast-gentrifying bit of midtownReception is friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. I was given 2pm checkout (with my Diamond card) without any quibbling, which is not always the case at HiltonsMy suite (2011) was big and very well decorated. I had an excellent view looking north over the skyscapers. The two design flaws are, first, that the door goes directly from the studio room (albeit the opposite end from the bed) onto the hall. This means there is some hallway noise -- I only noticed it on Superbowl night but I can imagine that you could be unlucky if you had noisy neighbours. The corner rooms might be a bit better; those opposite and behind the elevators would probably be worse. Second, the laminate floors look very nice but -- predictably -- you can sometimes hear people walking on the floor above you.The mini-kitchen was really well equipped with dishes, knives, saucepans and glasses.
