The full-size refrigerator was great and the microwave was -- if anything -- a bit too sophisticated (it took some working out). My only complaint is that there is no waste bin for food so, if you cook, you'll end up with food waste in the main room waste basketThe bathroom was big, spacious and well lit with a nice large shower enclosure and no lethal, slippery bath. Very impressiveThere is a nice gym downstairs with about 15 pieces of equipment. I didn't use it as I wanted more weights but it looked great (I went to the Mid City Gym on 42nd Street which cost $60 for 5 sessions and had as much equipment as I wanted)I went to the supermarket so I didn't eat the breakfast or at the evening reception. Both, though, looked very busyBe careful about waiting times in the morning rush hour: it can take ten minutes for an elevator to come to the upper floors

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Brilliant Location, walking distance from major attractions, time square, mace's, Port Authority, everything is within walking distance, I enjoyed my stay, Staff is very helpful & friendly. Defintely I am staying again if i visited NYC

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Arrived tired, cold and hungry after a 14 hour international flight. Warm welcome at reception by the entire team, looked after immediately by the wonderful Nafeesa. Room offered immediately even though it was 9:30am. Most unusual for NYC. Room and facilities excellent for the rate. Free breakfast was excellent and much much better than expected. I will now make this my hotel of choice whenever coming through NYC. Great value complemented by amazing staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice hotel, loved the balcony. The locations is very convenient to Penn station as well as time square. The rooms are nicely done, with convenient kitchenette, and nice breakfast as well as warm dinner reception and wine. The location itself is ok the street is a little dark with construction, but close enough to walk to anything.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was incredible. After a long trip to NYC our room was available early and my family and I could check in and relax. The staff were very attentive and made the stay feel like home. The location of the hotel was great and we were able to walk pretty much everywhere. The rooms were well thought out and the kitchenettes had pots and pans, cutlery, glass wear and everything we needed to eat in which helped to save some $$$. The breakfast every morning was great and had a good selection. All in all, I would highly recommend staying here if you are traveling to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at this Hotel in Sept 2014 with a large group there was 10 of us. We all got wonderful service and the rooms where super clean. They where roomy and lots of space the kitchen space was good to have to with a full size fridge. It was so close to Time square it was like a 5 min walk and super close the Subway station. The hotel staff was super amazing epically Aaron the kitchen manager, he made sure we where well taken care of. He saved us a table for breakfast and dinner for our large group which was wicked so we could all sit together. The food was awesome they served breakfast and dinner Monday to Thursday we where able to save a lot of money by eating at the hotel and like I mentioned the food was delicious. We did a lot of research and this was the best priced best location and amazing.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: By New York standards the room was quite large and the bathroom spacious - both very clean. In room amenities great - the kitchen with microwave and fridge came in handy (especially to store/reheat food from breakfast and 'dinner'). The staff were amazing (slight issue with acknowledgement at check-in but was not a reflection of rest of employees). The breakfast and evening reception were typical affairs, as long as you're not expecting gourmet food then you'll be satisfied and certainly well fed! They'll even provide 'to go' containers if you want to take food to your room. At night, the free beer and wine was certainly an added bonus (and money saver!) Every single staff member (and there were plenty of them) went out of their way to talk to guests and make sure their needs were being met. They actually seemed to enjoy their job (which certainly isn't easy when they are probably not earning much)! Sometimes the 'free meal' situations can be a bad experience due to food items not being replenished fast enough and tables not being cleared quickly but this was not the case here - there was always an employee in sight to take care of it! I had a great experience during my stay - would definitely recommend!
user_name:
Emyleen B
New Jersey, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at the Homewood for New Years in December and left January 5th. It was such a lovely hotel, and we had plenty of room, especially being in NYC! Going to Times Square to see the ball drop is on most people's bucket list, and it was freezing but we hung in there. Although we probably won't do that again, we would DEFINITELY stay here. The staff were lovely and always willing to help. When we got in our room wasn't ready but the staff profusely apologised and it was all good. Thank you for a great week!Tyne

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Close to Port Authority, Times Sq and Macys and shopping. Good in room amenities. Comp breakfast is good. Helpful staff. Very new hotel so everything is spick and span. Book this hotel you will love it. Breafast was a wide choice of hot and cold items. Slight variation everyday which is good. Coffe and tea making provided in the lobby and a nice open gas fireplace which I liked. Good location to explore NYC in Midtown. Close to Port Authority where bus service is available to travel to Jersey Garden Outlet malls. Helpful front desk staff. I got a good deal on this from Priceline. Booked only an hour before I checked in.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is an extraordinary hotel with the friendliest staff in town. Especially Mai at the reception desk and the staff in the breakfast room are extraordinarily courteous and make you feel at home while in New York. The whole place is relatively quiet, spacious and welcoming.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great NYC overnight experience. We decided to stay at the Homewood Suites in New York City to be in the audience of the Rachel Ray Show and because my husband works in the city and it made sense so he didn't have to commute the next day. Always a little skeptical staying in the city, due to cleanliness and size, but much to our surprise, both my husband and I were pleasantly surprised. The staff was more than friendly and accommodating on many levels. Went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant and our stay exceeded our expectations. The suite had a little kitchen with a very large refrigerator, microwave, stove top, sink, and all the dishes and utensils you would need to make a meal and have real plates to eat your meal. I highly recommend this for a night in the city and for business travelers that need to be in the city for several days. The suite was clean and with a nice modern decor and a very comfortable bed. And we are picky about our bed, we have a really great bed at home. We didn't even realize we were in NYC while sleeping, we heard no noise from the streets. (honking, sirens, etc.) The staff was so friendly and accommodated our every need as we need to check in early since we needed to be at the Rachel Ray Show early and they allowed us to do that. It's is easy access to either Penn Station or Port Authority. We took the bus which goes to Port Authority and it was an easy walk.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great Stay Great Staff very helpful , I would recommend this hotel everyone I am amazed to see the ranking at 90 I will suggest everyone to Stop going by ranking as i have now decided not to go by the ranking as this hotel is Amazing Helpful Staff ,Great Location Good Rooms with good Amenities Very Clean But washrooms Shower area is Little tight but its NY very Close to times Square 5 MIn Walk, Empire State Building 8min Walk Macys 5 MIn Walk Mc Donalds 2 Min Walk Big Bus Stop 5 Min Walk Dunkin Donuts at the Corner of the Street , 7 Eleven Very Very Close so what else you need But We need More Free BreakFast Free Beer and Wine and Snacks 5-7 pm why to stay somewhere else its a great hotel with great staff at great location

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: One word.......Great. Great room. Great staff. Great free dinners on certain nights. Great locationGreat wine. Great bed.Ideal location. The only problem was parking in midtown Manhattan. The staff is terrific. Check in for a great hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We took my son to NYC for his b'day weekend and wanted to be close to Times Square. This hotel was great. Room was like a studio apartment and very modern. Comfortable and very clean! The breakfast included was ok a typical free breakfast style meal. It helped us to save $ and filled us up to well past lunch time. The location was walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Empire State Building, amongst other great locations. My son really enjoyed NYC for his b'day weekend and can't wait to return! We would definitely stay @ Homewood Suites again. Love Hilton properties and they have never let us down!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Ideal location, room was comfortable with good facilities, coffee was replenished irregularly (I stayed for 8 nights) but not too much of an issue as there was always coffee & hot water on tap in the reception area. The breakfast & dinner was a nice touch, particularly when it was too cold to venture out.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice, well designed hotel. Leslie at the desk and the rest of the staff are very helpful. Room was modern and had mini kitchen with fridge and stove. Exercise room looked adequate but didn't have a chance to use.
user_name:
Michael K
Navesink, New Jersey, Usa

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great value. Free full breakfast. Modern rooms. Full kitchenettes. 5 Minute walk to Times Square. Comfortable beds. Cozy lobby with fireplace and TV's. The only negative was we arrived an hour before check in on a pouring rainy day and were told we would have to wait until 3PM to check in. The plus is we sat in front of the fireplace ,drank some complimentary coffee and watched TV while we waited.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked a suite late august 2014 for a night. we had to book a this hotel last minute because we missed our flight and needed to stay the night in New York instead of Miami.The lobby was ok the Suites need modernising. The rooms just had a dated look, it was ok.The staff were helpful. Breakfast buffet was really good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very convenient hotel for families especially with the well equipped kitchenette inside the roomPersonnel very helpful and very kindLocation is perfect close to Times Square, Empire State Building, Macy's...Breakfast and dinner are average and can be betterRecommended hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Lot's of other glitzy and sleek hotels in NYC, but this was cheaper and to be honest, cleaner and more spacious than most others I have stayed in before in the city. Convenient location to times square and Penn station. I didn't avail myself, but the evening beer/wine seemed popular, as did the breakfast, both complimentary. Will stay again for sure. Front desk staff was very helpful and free wi-fi.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great hotel in a very convenient location. The rooms are large for NYC and very clean. Beds are comfortable. The reception is a nice idea with wine and beer and soft drinks. Coffee and tea are available 24/7. Breakfast is adequate but needed to be warmer. The staff was very receptive to all suggestions. Early check in did not seem possible but the lobby (large lobby) was empty by check in time so no problem. Great hotel find.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed 2 nights at the Homewood suites, found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, the hotel is attractive from the lobby up. The rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable. We had the efficiency and it had fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher and utensils. Breakfast is provided and is good, the also put a menu in the room Mon. thru Thurs and the evening food from 5 to 7 is complimentary that includes beer and wine. We didn't take advantage of this but its a nice twist. Housekeeping is provided daily four blocks either way will get you to the subway and Times Square is a short walk. I would definitely recommend the hotel and stay there again.
user_name:
Ed M
Glens Falls, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had an excellent stay during Christmas 2014. Nice, modern and new hotel. Pleasant staff. We liked the wooden floor in the room and the bathroom was nice. Very soft and comfortable towels and even a face cloth.The fridge in the room was a little bit noisy and we did not like the plastic plates and plastic cutlery for breakfast. We tried the evening meal once, but we were not very impressed. Nice with free wine and beer, and the children loved the free hot chocolate.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Came to New York for a relatives play location was great, hotel clean. Jennifer at the front desk was welcoming. The weather was cold and rainy but the hot chocolate and hot coffee all day was such a great treat. The room was a great size for new york the design utilized the space well and efficiently--- well done! And the price was great for the location. Having been a member of Marriott for years this experience convinced me to take a closer look at hilton's chain of hotels.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have just enjoyed 7 days in this hotel in New York City and had a great time.I was travelling with my 2 teenage daughters. The room was spacious and had plenty of room for the 3 of us.The room had a desk which enabled me to work each night.In the room there was a good kitchen with full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher, plates, utensils etc - if you wanted to, it was possible to cook a full meal in the room.The free wifi was adequate.Each morning there is a good, filling, free breakfast available on the ground floor (particularly good on cold winter mornings rather than going out for breakfast).There is a free evening meal (including wine) 4 nights a week although we only tried once.The gym is very good with new equipment.The location is very convenient, an easy walk down to Macy's in 34th Street and an easy walk to Times Square. We even walked down to Central Park, 5th Avenue shops and Chelsea Market.This was a good value hotel and a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great place and location for business and sight seeing. Many good reastaurants and shopping in the area. In walking distance to many attractions and to business locations. I was here for business yet I would stay here for personal reason too. Great freindly staff.
user_name:
Jeanne D
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Overall a nice hotel,friendly staff, very comfortable beds, clean & quite room. Close to Pen Station but a pretty good walk to Times Square. Subway just around the corner. Not a bad hotel but for just a little more, you can stay on Times Square if that where you want to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: fantastic location, great staff, 3 adults in 1 room, lovely beds, breakfast, complimentary tea coffee hot chocolate in reception, and in room, complimentary evening food and beer and wine Monday to Thursday. would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I cannot praise this hotel enough. My partner and I spent 9 days in NYC over Christmas and New Year, and this hotel really boosted our experience from a good one to an exceptional one. From the moment we arrived (late in the evening), the desk staff were polite, kind, friendly. They explained all of the facilities available in the hotel - Free WIFI, free breakfast every morning, free evening meal from Mon thru Thursdays with alcoholic drinks (they even served on Christmas Day), free coffee in the foyer 24/7. The guy on the desk also asked if we had a preference of floors - we asked for a high floor (because we hoped for a view). We were delighted to be placed on the top floor, (there are only around 5 rooms on this floor) for no extra cost. The top floor also boasts a large, yet tidy and landscaped roof terrace with a view of the Empire State building's spire. We felt like we'd got the penthouse! It was such a shame that the majority of the guests seemed to only use this space as a smoking area - we made it our business to tell other guests about it when we shared the elevator - definitely worth checking out!During our stay it was also my partner's 30th birthday and I contacted the front desk asking if they could secretly put a cake in the room for me while we were out. This was absolutely no trouble for Allyson, who very efficiently sorted it all out, asking what type of cake and what budget to remain within. On my partner's birthday we came back to the room and there it was in the fridge - and it was delicious!In terms of the hotel environment, as you can see from the pictures, the hotel is very modern and new. It has been recently (June 2014 I believe) acquired by Hilton and fully refurbished throughout. I can confirm that the reality matches the photos shown here, it is very new, clean and comfortable, with tasteful fresh and modern decor. As far as we were concerned, it felt like a brand new hotel.Other things that positively surprised us:- The fitness suite, which was a very nice environment to have a work-out in. The equipment was new, clean, and there was cold water available from a cooler and clean towels. There are treadmills, cardiovascular cross trainers, free weights, and a cable machine which can be used to tone the whole body in the absence of your usual fitness suite while you're on vacation.- Free ice dispensers in the hallways on chosen floors (one right outside our door actually), for guest use.If I had to give one negative it would simply be that on the 22nd floor you do sometimes have yo wait a while for the elevator. The hotel has a bank of 3x elevators but at busy times (breakfast and evening meal) you can wait up to 5 minutes for an elevator to reach the 22nd floor and it often takes a while to descend due to having to make 6 or 7 stops. However I appreciate there is not a lot Hilton can do about this. Also we did visit at a busy festive time and the hotel was clearly very full, so we found it acceptable.Just a quick final word on location - I have to admit I was very pleasantly surprised with the location of the hotel, which i wasn't expecting having read some reviews before our trip. It was a 10-minute walk from the craziness of Times Square, but it was just far enough away to get away from the crowds when you wanted. 34th St Penn station is the closest subway, just out of the street and to the left for a couple of streets. The station is on the red line meaning its really easy to get downtown or Central Park in just a few stops. Madison Square Garden is visible from the end of the street that the hotel is situated on, and trendy areas like Hell's Kitchen are within 20-30 mins' walking distance if you're a walker.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed 3 night. The hotel is in a very good location, a few blocks from Times Square. You have a pharmacy store and Donuts/coffee shop in the corner.Front desk was very helpful. This is a new hotel. The room was nice and clean. Had it's own kitchenette with goodies and a couch to relax. Good A/C and heater. It had free wifi but I'm an HHonors Gold member so I'm not sure if it is free for all guest, but it is available.The bed was large and comfy but wobbly. Not sure if it was because of the wood floor but the bed would move around. The best part is the hotel has free breakfast and free dinner with free wine and beer. Yes you read that right, and it wasn't anything cheap it was the good stuff. So if you're traveling on a budget this would be great because you can have two light meals for free. I took advantage of this two out of my three days by coming back for dinner, rested up a little then headed out again.Another thing I would like to mention is the rooms have new locks that instead of using magnet strip cards they use RFID cards. The benefit is you won't be locked out of your room because your card was demagnetized. I hate it when that happens. All you want to do is get in your room and now you have to go to the front desk and hope their is no long line.The cons - The only thing I can think of is the bed, although it was not uncomfortable. The closet was smaller then usual but I don't unpack much so that didn't really bother me.I would highly recommend this hotel! Just because of the location, its new and it doesn't just have free breakfast but also free diner with free wine and beer.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed four nights in a 2 queen bed with sofa bed studio. Lots to love about this place. Huge room for New York. Beds comfy, sofa bed not. Very clean, laminate floors which are clean, fairly quiet, large in room safe and good kitchenette. Breakfast was ok. Lobby contemporary and inviting. Great location walking distance to lots of places. Go on 9th for better restaurants. what wasn't great was the housekeeping. Only 2 sets of towels, missing toiletries and the blanket for the sofa bed was wet in the plastic bag. We had to call every day for something to be replaced. Food area was very tight and on the busy weekend was extremely crowded. Elevators slow. No closet space laughable. Overall though I would recommend

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at Homewood Suites for 5 nights of a business trip. What a treat! I can't decide what to rave about first! My room was spacious (for NYC). My room was quiet, even though it was close enough to the street to hear the traffic. (14th floor). The bed and the pillows were very comfy. The staff- from the maids to the folks at breakfast and the front desk- were lovely. They give great advice on where to dine and they greet you with a smile at the end of the day. There is a Manager's Reception in the evening with a dinner and beer/wine that is complimentary. Oh YEAH- I will be back at the end of the month, and in February, and in April and anytime I am in the City!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 3 nights there. Location is very nice and handyRooms are spacious and cleanDownsides: always the queue at the elevators that you could exit for 5-10 minutes...Breakfasts and dinner are free, but not good. We tried once the breakfast and it was once too many

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was the perfect choice for our 8 night stay (20-28 December 2014 - room #2106). Homewood Suites is located between 37 Street and 8th Avenue and from JFK you can take the LIRR and get off at Penn Station on 34th Street. It is only few blocks away and from the airport is it about a 20-25 minutes journey (4$ per ticket). The hotel is only few minutes from Time Square and all the main attraction. If you like to walk you can reach easily Chelsea and all the trendy villages. The rate offers free breakfast and free meals (Mon-Thu) including free drinks (soft, wine and beer) and absolute bargain! The check-in was very swift and the hotel staff has been always polite, professional and helpful when there was a question to be asked. The room itself was clan, very large and furnished with a kitchenette and microwave always very handy. Hot drinks are always available in the main foyer at any time. Some guests have experienced a certain amount of problems with the lifts (elevators). In our experience we only had to wait for about 10 minutes one day, for the rest the waiting was average compared with the full hotel booked during Christmas. The breakfast room can get very busy at time but you can always find a place to sit. The quality of the food is not very high but consider that it is free and offers a very decent meal. Good TV and free Wi-Fi. What else can I add? Homewood Suites is now definitely my first choice for my future staying in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family really enjoyed staying in this hotel. 4 person stayed in 1 room (2 adults and 2 children). My son slept in the sofa bed. The room has kitchen and its equipments. You could even make a cake in the oven. The room has also a dishwasher, coffee maker etc. This hotel provided breakfast and dinner (free) and free beer and wine every night. The house keeping did well her job in cleaning the room (her name is Matilde). Victor also did well in the restaurant during breakfast. He provided me with beef sausages because my family don't eat pork. Free good WIFI throughout the hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Myself and my wife have just returned from a New York holiday over Christmas and New Year staying at Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan.This hotel is just superb, the room was massive for NY standards and spotless. We had our own very clean kitchen including fridge freezer, toaster, microwave and all utensils, plates and cutlery. As upper king sized bed with one of the comfiest mattresses and pillows we have ever slept on (never slept as well at any hotel before). Bathroom had a large excellent shower, plenty of towels topped up daily and all shower amenities you could want.There is plenty of drawer space, loads of wardrobe space, massive full length wall mirror, hair dryer and iron and board. The large flat screen tv has tons of free channels with a perfect picture.Now the best bit, the breakfast. You may read negative reviews due to breakfast being really busy but continue reading. Breakfast s served from 6-10.30 and is you go any time after about 8.00am it is chaos, so me and my wife would get up at 7.30 and just chuck some clothes on, then head down to breakfast. At this time we always got a table and it wasn't too busy. We would have toast, cereal, tea, muffins and bagels and it was lovely. Once finished and it starts getting busy we would go back to our room and slow,y get ready, perfect. Your not in NY to stay in bed anyway! Also I would carry a full cup of milk up to my room and a few small boxes of cereal and that would do me of an evening also. Evening meals are served Mon - Thurs including drinks but we mainly went out for food. The lifts do get busy at certain times. It you just have to wait a little.Staff were friendly and hotel is just brilliant and half the price of any others. It's only a 3 star but is sooo much better than any 4 star NY hotel we have stayed at before.Take the chance and you won't be disappointed!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for one night with my 7 year old, a holiday gift of "a show and Mommy time". I was very impressed with the hotel and our entire experience. The absolute best thing about our stay was the bed. It was the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in! The decor is new and modern, all in great condition from the lobby on up to the 17th floor where we stayed. Few things to make note of: our room would not have fit more than 2 people comfortably (though it was quite comfortable and even roomy for the two of us); the breakfast Monday morning was extremely crowded (we went around 10am; breakfast is served from 6-10:30am), to the point where we shared a table with two strangers; lastly, there was no ice machine on our floor, only every few floors, so we had to walk down one flight to get ice. On the plus side, the front desk was very helpful, both when we dropped our bags off early (our room wasn't ready early), when we came back to check in, when we bought ice cream and snacks later, and the next morning when we checked out. Overall a perfect stay, and I would stay here again. (Though I'd first confirm they have rooms big enough for our family of 4 next time.)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at this hotel from Jan 2-4, 2015. Arrived early afternoon, the room was not ready but they were able to store our luggage for the afternoon. Checked in around 3 pm, the hotel was very busy and it did take a little time for them to bring our luggage out of storage. You can have your luggage delivered to your room if you wish, we elected not to do so. Room was very clean, and typical for NY standards, that meaning small, but how long are you in your room in NY. Breakfast was very good, but it was busy, and the staff did have a tough time keeping up with demand, but they did do a great job. There are only three elevators in this hotel, so you will have to wait sometime for one, if the hotel is busy. Overall, I would stay here again, I have never been let down with a Hilton product.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here on New Years day. Room was not ready at check in time and communication with front desk was not very good. They told me they would call when room was ready which never happened. Finally got our room at 8:30pm. The lady I dealt with (I believe her name was Tiffany was very good and took my complaint seriously. Room was nice, lots of room for NYC. Had an issue with the TV and after the second call it was finally fixed. Housekeeping was right on the ball, cleaning in a timely manager. Hotel is close to subways and Times Square. Recommend and would love to visit again soon.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights with 3 other women. Hotel was very nice with many perks, such as the coffee/tea set up in the reception area and free breakfast. The room was a nice size and accommodated the 4 of us very well, loved the hard wood flooring and mini kitchen area, however for 4 women there weren't enough mirrors and the lighting wasn't ideal for applying makeup, etc. With that being said, my real frustration was with housekeeping... as stated before the room was very nice, however, certain locations hadn't been dusted in a VERY long time, (ex). ceiling fan and underneath tables, but the most frustrating thing was the lack of an English speaking housekeeping staff (or the ones they kept sending to our room), it was a bit frustrating after a few attempts to get our room cleaned and fresh towels and wash clothes for 4; they didn't understand us and we didn't understand them.We also had a situation in our bathroom closet. Looked like something (maybe a rolled up dirty sock) had been left on a bottom shelf way in the back, and it started to smell really bad after showers, so we called downstairs, no one came up (said they did and we didn't answer the door which was not true); called again and no one ever came and WE were not touching whatever it was.Anywho, we enjoyed our trip and the hotel in spite of the few housekeeping issues.Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I will start from the positive aspects of our stay. Check in was quick, staff behaviour really nice and the room was as expected (quite big and comfortable). We were informed about complimentart breakfast and free dinner. During our stay we had no problem with staff or room. Negative aspects: 1) when you have breakfast or light dinner at a Hilton and pay more than $300 per night (incl. taxes) the least you expect is not to eat with plastic cutlery and paper plates. It might be one of the busiest periods of the year but service has to be all-year round similar (friends have stayed and suggested this hotel in September and their experience was totally different). 2) We checked-out at 11am, the staff arranged a car to get us at the airport for 5:30pm and left our luggage to be stored. When we got back to the hotel at 5pm, we asked for our luggage. At 5:20pm we asked again the reception what's going on and they told us that we have to wait for another 5min since they were other clients waiting for their luggage. At 5:30pm we asked again and still were asked to wait because it is a very busy time of the day for the staff and the elevators were busy (first time we hear this excuse!). We told them that we are willing to go and get the luggage from the storage room by ourselves but we were told that this is not allowed. The two ladies at the reception (Alyson and a red-hair with no badge) had completely different approach and behaviour. Alyson was really kind trying to sort everything out. The other one was completely arrogant with no intention to be of any help. Finally our luggage arrived at 5:45pm and after being told by a hotel staff that he is willing to show us where the stairs are! It is the second time we leave a Hilton hotel dissatisfied and more probably will not choose to stay again at a Hilton, especially when there is a wide range of hotels offering similar or even superior service for the same rate.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at Homewood during the New Year's holiday period for a week. The room was a little smaller than expected but new, clean and comfortable and included a full size fridge, microwave and mini stove top. The facilities were great and included a laundry, unfortunately there aren't many machines and we did have to wait a while. There was a also a business centre where we printed off tickets and confirmations free of charge. The small convenience store in the lobby was helpful for a drink and snack and there was complimentary coffee, hot chocolate and tea available 24hrs a day. We were offered complimentary breakfast 7 days a week and dinner Mon - Fri. The breakfast selection was ok and included hot and cold items as well as pastries and cereal. Dinner was quite early (5-7pm) and there weren't too many items to choose from but it was great to have the options of dining in. I read in another review that the restaurant serves food on plastic plates but we didn't mind, they even have the option of take out containers which you can take back to your room if you don't want to eat in the restaurant.  We like the location as we were only a short walk to the subway and Times Square. The staff were friendly and helpful but housekeeping did come knocking quite early so ensure to put up the do not disturb sign the night before.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I chose this hotel for our trip to NYC during Christmas week 2014 based on location and meals offered, and I could not be more please with my choice. We arrived at Penn station via Amtrak, and walked just a few short blocks to the hotel. After check-in, which was fast and efficient, we headed back out for an easy walk to Times Square. Many other sites were also within reasonable walking distance. And for longer trips, there's always a nearby subway station. The staff provided a hot breakfast every day, AND dinner - DINNER! This is something they offer M-TH, which happened to be when we were there. It wasn't anything elaborate - just simple food, but it was good and it was included. They even gave us dinner on Christmas day. The staff did an amazing job feeding so many people during the very busy holiday season, and kept the tea-coffee area clean and well-stocked. Our room was different the standard layout, and of course included an apartment sized refrigerator, and dishes. We lacked for nothing. The only thing that needs improvement is the elevator algorithm. I don't think it was working as intended since it often missed the 21st floor, yet would stop at every other floor to which it was called, even when stuffed completely full of people. Even so, I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Friendly staff, excellent central position. Nice modern furnishings.Not so good ZERO Christmas spirit some music, Carol singers or SOMETHING would help. Didn't feel like Christmas staying there at all. I stayed with a three year old child. Meal times were a joke, served on polystyrene plates with plastic knives and forks. No Christmas dinner and no Vegetarian options except watery soup, mostly the same one daily. Christmas dinner was stir fry beef and rice. The dining room does not accommodate the amount of people the hotel holds so had to retreat to bedroom with meals, not easy with a toddler, plates and drinks, no trays provided. Same at breakfast times even by getting there first thing, nowhere to sit, so by the time you've waited for an elevator your food is cold. Tea and coffee in Foyer often empty. The room seemed clean but wouldn't recommend rooms at the back although quieter from street noise they were very claustrophobic and look onto office blocks with very noisy aircon units. On leaving and retrieving lost toys (under the bed) were pretty horrified at the inches of dust under it. Also the hotel takes dogs, One had a bad accident outside our room which made the corridor stink and I think the carpet must have fleas as returned with some ankle bites. It was ok but having worked for Hilton I expected more from the Brand. The reception staff were great, couldn't do more to help and allowed us a late check out, the food staff very sultry. Managed to leave some items in drawer so yet to see how honest the cleaning staff are. Will update!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We felt the need to express our thanks and gratitude for a really exemplary stay over the Christmas period at this excellently run and super conveniently located spot.This was a last minute decision to come to NYC for Christmas but after discovering this place and the fantastically efficient and friendly Natalia, all our pre visit requests were sorted out effortlessly, prior to us arriving. The facilities on tap at the hotel such as free breakfast, dinner between 17:00-19:00 and also free wine, and draft beer between the same times, Monday-Thursday are an added benefit to a fabulous place and we will have absolutely no hesitation in staying here from now on, next time we’re in our favourite city in the world. In summary, a great place, in a great location, with great staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I choose the Homewood Suites as part of a BA holiday based on the fact that it was the cheapest hotel that included breakfast - that turned out to be a great decision!The location is really good. We walked to Times Square, Empire State Building, Central Park, and the Rockefeller Center without too much trouble, and being situated between Penn Station and the Port Authority Bus Terminal meant that jumping on the subway to get home, or somewhere further away was dead easy.Our room was a little small, particularly as we needed the sofa bed down, but it was clean and well maintained. It came with a fridge / freezer, sink and microwave.Breakfast is included, as well as a light dinner served Mon-Thurs 5 to 7. Don't expect culinary excellence, but if you're on a budget it helps keep costs down, and is OK. The things that weren't so good? Our room wasn't ready when we turned up at 1 (which was fine, we were early) and we were asked to come back at 3. Returned at 4.30 and still had to wait for Housekeeping to confirm the room was ready.  Trying to get a seat for Breakfast or Dinner is tricky, and many people end up taking their plates back up to their rooms. And finally, our room was noisy. Despite unplugging the fridge and turning the heating off, there was still a constant buzzing in the room, which I assume is the ventilation system. It was loud enough to be disturbing when trying to sleep.Overall these were minor issues though, and I'd be happy to return here if I ever came back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our family of 4. The decor, amenities, room and location were perfect and i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City and wanting to stay in this general location.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed just one night but were greeted by helpful staff each time we spoke to an employee. The room we had consisted of two beds and a pull out sofa so the whole family could fit in one room. There was a little kitchen and it felt like we had a small city apartment for a night. The hotel offers free hot breakfast in the morning and also for weeknights a light dinner consisting of soup, salad bar, and bread with juices for the kids and wine or beer for adults which was a nice treat after walking the city for hours. We still ended up getting a slice of pizza each later at a nearby place but its hard to argue about anything when its free. I highly recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay, a few blocks away from Time Square. Its in the Garment district and the bus/subway station is only 1.5 blocks away so travel is easy once you figure your way around the city. I highly recommend this place.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the check in process is very friendly, the breakfast/reception staff is very helpful---Devon, Maileen are very attentive to your needs and go beyond the call of duty. Devona has always over exceeded my expectations as Director of Guest Services---I have stayed there many months now and every time I check in they have treated me like it was the first (unlike most hotels).....thanks team for helping me feel at home, part of a family and not just a number that is staying at your hotel.
user_name:
paula m
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First time that we used Homewood and we were extremely pleased we did. Very clean and large room, very quiet considering the central location of the property. Liked that we could cook and warm food up especially over Christmas as we did not want to be confined to a hotel room. Liked everything about Homewood so will be back again on our next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is an excellent choice for your New York vacation. It is brand new (opened in 2014) and is centrally located to Times Square, Central Park and other attractions, such as Macy's. The Service is excellent. This hotel also offers a free hot breakfast daily and a meal fro supper through the week. I would highly recommend this hotel for vacations and business travel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I have stayed at many Hilton properties in Manhattan. I generally like fuller service Hilton Hotels, but the cheaper properties can be of excellent value. When I booked this 3-day 2-night stay in October, the best rates were at this Homeward Suites. Reviews were good so I took a chance. I was not disappointed. The hotel is 'new'. The 'studio' rooms (with one comfortable king-side bed) are small but cozy, and they do feature a small compact kitchen set-up with utentils, plates, cups, glasses, coffee maker, refrig, dishwater (!) and even tupperware. Kitchen was shiny and new. Shower had great pressure and lots of hot water. I could see this would be an excellent option for an extended stay, but it was also fine for a 2-night stay.The hotel is located on West 37th street between 8th and 9th avenues, blocks from Penn Station/Amtrak, close to Times Square, and there are lots of small restaurants and shops on 9th avenue, which retains its 'neighborhood' feeling.They offer free breakfast (which is very similar to Hampton Inn with styrofoam plates and cups). This is where I much prefer regular Hilton properties (or the Doubletree/Garden Inns) because as a Hilton Honors member I get the free breakfast, which is just better quality. But for families and those who are on budgets, the free breakfasts here can save lots of money. They also offer drinks and evening food Monday–Thursday. Since our stay was Friday–Sunday, we did not experience this.There is coffee and tea in the lobby that you can access 24-hours (I suppose), although it frequently ran out as the hotel was completely filled over the weekend. A minor annoyance.Desk staff and other staff were very polite and accommodating. I would definitely recommend this property.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at Homewood Suites in September 2014. Great Location, really central place to be. Our room was clean and beautifully set out and the kitchen was efficient and compact. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was superb! Really good deal with the dinner package. Will stay here again and again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Second trip to NYC in 3 years. Have visited NYC many times and this is one of the best places so far. It is a new location so the rooms are very nice. Was a little worried this trip since it was a quick get-a-way for a week at the last minute so we ended up on a lower floor. The very thick windows made it quiet. Also, could walk down stairs to the breakfast when the 3 elevators were busy. As other reviewers have mentioned, the studios included a kitchen area that was well stocked with items to make your own B, L, or D. Yes they had very nice dinner (more than just snacks) food choices M-TH that included salad and others items are listed on your frig for the week. Breakfast included cereals, some fruit (would like to have seen more fruit), usually a sausage or other meat choice, potato choice, bread, bagels, eggs, yogurt with fruit and nuts, and of course juices and milk. We visited in Dec. so the all time mini bar with hot teas, coffee, and hot chocolate was a nice touch in the lobby. The staff were all very nice and took the time to say hello. You will find a nice laundry, workout area, and computers with printers in the basement area. Go up to the 23rd (think that is right) for a patio area (sure it is nice in the warmer months) to see some limited views--including the Empire State Building. The location on 37th street between 8th Ave and 9th Ave is easy walking to Times Square, Macy's, ESB, Madison Square Gardens, Bryant Park, etc. You will find a 7/11 right around the corner on 8th, several Dunkin Donuts, and several nice restaurants in the area. We were comfortable walking around the area at all times. This hotel will definitely be a go to for future visits to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We spent Christmas week here and it was a great home away from home. The rooms are studios and furnished with everything you need from kitchenette to living and sleeping quarters. They even serve dinner and beer and wine from 5 to 7 Monday through Thursday as well as breakfast every day from 6:00 am to 10:30 am. This is included with your room charge. We didn't do this as it was very crowded and we wanted to experience New York restaurants. There is a beverage station with coffee, tea, hot chocolate and hot water and all the fixings open 24 hours. The location is great- just an easy walk from Times Square and Broadway and Rockefeller Center. The day we checked in a water main had broken and there was a trickle in our room. The front desk personnel were very courteous and apologetic and assured us it would be fixed as soon as possible. They opened their little store for free snacks and bottled water. It was fixed by dinner time. This was a very busy hotel and the elevators were small meaning you had to wait sometimes but the wait was never too bad. We would definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Over the years I have travelled to NY City many times, trying different places to stay, always being let down and disappointed.Homewood was such a nice surprise after a long, long flight in. The rooms are perfect with everything you need, it very clean and we maintained. Location is excellent.We got free supper, drinks and breakfast. Services was great, it was really great value to.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I took my teenage daughters to experience NYC at Christmas and stayed here. This was a fabulous, clean hotel with lots of amenities. Hotel is new, staff very friendly. The location cannot be beat. Walking distance to Times Square, Macy's, Bryant Park, and Penn Station to catch the subway and trains. We never used a taxi while there. Took a train in from NJ and rolled our luggage easily to the hotel three blocks away. We stayed on 21st floor, no noise from street, slept very well.We had a king room with sleeper sofa, plenty of space for the three of us! Dunkin Donuts, 7 Eleven nearby. The hotel has a shop stocked with ice cream, mini pizzas, sodas etc. The breakfast is excellent, oatmeal, french toast, bacon, eggs, yogurts, cereal. Coffee, hot chocolate, tea 24/7. The lobby is pleasantly furnished with fireplaces and a waterfall. Everything we needed was provided, perfect home away from home. All of us agreed, we had found the perfect spot to stay for our next visit to NYC.Tips: Book a city view room, the hotel has a luggage room if you get there early or you leave late, just be sure to tip porter for your bags.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location of this hotel is really perfect, 10 walking minutes from TS , not in the centre of it but quite close for being able to go over there for food, drinks or whatever. it's got metro nearby and it's quite close to the chelsea highline, i have tos ay that thanks to the area where it's located we did walk quite a lot. The rooms are nice not too super big but big enough for a couple to share and have enough space. beds are huge as well. the kitchen was close to the bed and even if the fridge was making noise it didnt disturb us during the night.if i had to choose something bad it'd be the lack of variety during the weekend in the breakfast time, but i've to admit that it was probably one of their busiest time of the year (weekend before xmas) and 930am . but they were quick enough to bring new things as soon as they run out. it's really nice of them as well to offer free dinner and drinks between 5 and 7 during the week. would def. recommend it specially if you find an offer like the one we did.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is excellent. In the pictures you think that some rooms are bigger but they're still good. Service is really good, that also includes breakfast and dinner. The gym is really good, pretty big. Whoever likes to workout you can be really creative over there. The location is ideal because it is close to the subway and Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed as a family of 3 for 7 nights in December. The hotel location was great. Not directly in the middle of Times Square but just a short walk away. Next to Penn station and subway lines which easily transported us to wherever we wanted to go.The rooms are comfortable and having been to New York 9 times now this hotel offered the best soundproofing we have experienced. In New York the noise is expected but I can honestly say that even being in the room next to the elevators I did not hear a thing. How ironic that it was my daughters snoring that kept us awake in the city that never sleeps and has no noise control!Breakfast was included which was basic but good. We never frequented the dining room and brought our food to the room each time so I cannot comment on the space issues. Never had to wait for an elevator very long, even at peak times.There is a handy 7 eleven round the corner (snacks and drinks) and plenty of eateries to satisfy any palate in Manhattan so we never ate in the hotel or took advantage of the managers reception but if you are on a budget it would really help keep costs down.The hotel staff were great. All very welcoming and polite and very efficient when we had parcels delivered to the hotel. My only disappointment was that I contacted the hotel prior to arrival to ask them to do something for my daughter (which I was going to pay for) as it was a celebration holiday for our family and they didn't do anything or acknowledge my request at all. Maybe a dedicated concierge service would be better? Nevertheless, there are very few negatives about this hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our family spent a long weekend in NYC to experience Christmas in the city and absolutely LOVED our stay at the Homewood Suites in Times Square! The suite we had was plenty big, which was a nice surprise in the middle of Manhattan! Everything about the hotel was wonderful and I don't think we'd choose another hotel now that we've experienced this one. I whole-heartedly recommend it because it truly feels like you're "coming home" each time you walk in the door!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The most important thing in a hotel for me is a clean room and bed. During my stay, the whole hotel was spotless and staff were constantly on hand to clean and tidy.All the staff were polite, friendly and helpful.Check in was quick and easy, our room was ready and clean....The refrigerator was a little on the noisy side but when we turned the temperature down, we didn't notice it. It is not like we needed to stock it full of food as complimentary dinner was provided (during the week) and although this was not full menu with waiter service, for those in a rush or on a budget, it appeared adequate. We didn't take advantage of the food as we had made other arrangements but we did talk to other guests who had no complaints. Included with the complementary dinner was complementary drink, wine or beer.Also complimentary was the breakfast. We had breakfast every morning and although the dining room did get busy later on in the morning, it wasn't such that we had to go without.The location of the hotel is very close to all that Manhattan has to offer, Times Square, Broadway, Central Park. We used a taxi just twice in the week we were there. To take us from the airport and to take us to the airport.For any trips further afield I recommend the Hop On Hop Off buses. Check on here for the better companies.All in all a great hotel in a great location. We will be staying there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I will give a quick review initially for those that do not wish to read the entire review and just want a feel for the hotel. For those that wish a slightly more in depth then please read review in its entirety.We travelled as a family of three between 14 - 19 Dec 2014 for a leisure break just before Christmas. The hotel was booked as part of a package with British Airways so I cannot comment on the hotels booking process. Check in was very efficient with friendly welcoming staff. The rooms are very spacious, we had a twin queen bed room equipped with small self cooking area. There is a complimentary breakfast every morning, and a complementary dinner Mon - Thu. Housekeeping a little hit and miss. The rooms are well soundproofed, and it is needed. Short walk to Times Square and close to shops if you wish to cook for yourself. Check out was again efficient with no problems. Overall I would recommend the hotel for those wishing a break in New York and wanting to be central to Manhattan. If you are looking for top class luxury then this hotel is not for you, but it delivers well on what it says it is, which is a three star comfortable and friendly hotel.More detail...The hotel is situated on 37 St West off 8th Avenue. The street, as with a lot of streets in New York, is quite dark due to the height of surrounding buildings, do not let this put you off as the hotel is modern warn and welcoming, we looked on Google Earth first. The surrounding area felt safe and you are only a minute away from 8th Avenue and a further 5 - 10 mins from Times Square. As the hotel website advises, there is no hotel parking if you are hiring a car. The hotel is modern and feels welcoming. Check in was smooth with very helpful staff. The rooms are well appointed and very spacious, although there is insufficient hanging space for clothes. The only place being in the bathroom. The beds are comfortable and all the usual facilities are available. The air conditioning is very controllable and works well. There is minimal noise from other rooms and this was despite being directly opposite the lifts. The building across the street is currently undergoing large renovation works, but you would not know unless you open the window or look outside, the sound proofing is very effective. The complementary breakfast, although I am sure you pay for it in the price of the room, is basic and for UK travellers equate it to a Holiday Inn Express breakfast. A couple of hot choices, with toast, porridge, fruits, cereals etc., it suited us fine. It can get busy from 0800 onwards and there is not a lot of seating, but you can take it back to your room if you wish. For those with younger children the access for push chairs etc. is fine although a little tight if the dinning area is busy. There is also free tea, coffee hot chocolate 24 hours in reception. That said a number of occasions there was no hot water, and on one occasion they ran out milk and had no more, odd as there were a number of shops close by. A minor thing but not difficult to get right. We did not take dinner at the hotel so cannot comment on that aspect. House keeping was initially good but the toiletries were not consistently replenished and the cleaning was only what could be seen, lift up the bed valance and the lack of attention was visible. Again not a major problem, but something that should be right. Checking out was smooth and you can leave your bags with the reception staff until ready to depart. The hotels strengths lie in the very friendly staff and the welcoming feel to the hotel. Where they could do better is in the minor details as mentioned above. If I was going back to New York, Manhattan, I would have no hesitation in staying at the Homewood Suites again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a very nice (new) hotel located in the Fashion District - location is very good, walking distance to many attractions; Times Square is just a few blocks away. Bed and pillows were super comfortable and make for a great nights sleep after a long day in the city! Breakfast was ok, food was pretty good but the set up is terrible. No "system" whatsoever and they are in need of re-thinking how this is set up. All in all a very nice stay for our family! There is some noise but you are in NYC! The city that never sleeps - so we just turned on our fan over the microwave each night which drowned out any noise - we slept great. Front desk staff were also very nice and accommodating to our needs when we needed something.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was fabulous. Location was fantastic. Close to garment district, big Macy's, Times Square. Staff were amazing, especially front desk who made transportation and dinner reservations for us. Breakfast and happy hour were great. Staff at dining area were outstanding and kept the food coming. Only downer was lack of cell phone reception in our room and WiFi slow. But otherwise great place.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The location in midtown is fantastic if you are arriving or departing from Penn Station (a couple blocks away). It is also within walking distance to Times Square if you are going to a show and has immediate access to the A/C/E lines to get elsewhere. I stayed for two nights and, at the price point (under $200/night with a AAA discount, including taxes and fees), received great value. The booking includes free breakfast (buffet style) and although I didn't try it, free dinner as well (Monday through Thursday only).The room was clean and comfortable for what you might expect for a mid-tier hotel. It was also spacious (I've stayed in rooms half the size for the same price in Manhattan) and includes a kitchenette and decent sized refrigerator (not just a super mini one) if you are interested in having a meal in to save some cash.One notable downside was the noise from the central air system at night. We were on the 18th floor (I was hoping to stay high to avoid noise) and on the front side of the building. On the checkin info, there is a comment about turning down the refrigerator setting to avoid extra noise, which I tried, to no avail. I was also hoping for a view from this room, but it was blocked by a wall.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed with my family in December, location excellent, 3 blocks from Penn station and subway, close to Times Square. Room very comfortable and with breakfast included is very competitive on cost/benefit.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We arrived at Penn Station from Washington DC...finding & walking to the Hotel was a breeze!The greeting at reception was exceptional as we were treated more like friends than guests.Our room was what you expect from an organisation like the Hilton. We were particularly impressed with the meal provided at night (with drinks!)...whilst not extensive it was more than adequate . Breakfast was also adequate even although there was not a huge choice but then we have stayed at establishments which do tend to go overboard .Room was very clean with lovely clean , fresh linen.We could not fault the Homewood Suites at all!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is in a very good location just a little south of Times Square. We got to the hotel early and were not able to get into our rooms but the front desk staff checked our bags for us. They were very helpful with subway and restaurant directions. I stayed on the third floor facing 37th Street. The room was beautiful, appears to have recently been renovated. Very large rooms with full kitchens. The room temperature was fine for probably most people but I like my room very cold. The window opens about 2-3 inches which was great except for the fact that the room faced 37th Street and literally horns are honking all night long. I guess that's the price of staying in midtown! This was the first time I stayed there and for my next stay I would request a room that faces the courtyard in the back off of the street. The free breakfast buffet was typical of what you would find in most business hotels. I only had toast but the coworkers I was with ate eggs and sausage and enjoyed it. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate are in the lobby all day long with is wonderful. We did go to the evening manager's reception. Two different type of beer were offered as well as wine. I had salad both nights but the co-workers I was with ate the dinner and enjoyed it. I would definitely stay here again. I found the front desk staff to be very helpful with directions and pleasant. It's in a very central location, only a short walk from Penn Station and not too far from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. We had to go to Penn Station to grab a subway. The hotel is in a weird spot to try and get a cab, you would need to walk to one of the cross streets. My room would have been fine for a family. I had two double beds (beds are super comfortable) and a pull out couch.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: night 4 of 7 and happy so far. Booked 2adjacent rooms for the 4 of us (tick), reviewers were very right about breakfast buffet -limited choice and crowded but who cares really? Bonus on arrival was being told Mon-Thurs a dinner buffet with wine or beer is included and again very basic but given its "free"? Room is very comfortable but aircon kept us awake and when we complained fixed within minutes. Good location and central to lots of things. Gripes? Teeny ones like frozen baby carrots in the salad bar, washing machine only takes quarters, elevator is slow -very third world problems in reality. Would definitely return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The breakfast was good and the free dinner throughout the week was nice too. Great location and convenient to everything. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Highly recommend. Only thing I wish they had was a hot tub. After walking so much, it would have been nice to soak our feet!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Okay so the hotel itself is in a Great location it's pretty much in the middle of everything. It's clean and warm. The staff not so much. We went out at 9am one morning and come back at 11:30 pm and one of our rooms had been left open since it had been cleaned at 09:30am, thankfully nothing was stolen! The food is free for breakfast but I'd recommend paying elsewhere!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just left from a 4 night stay at this hotel. So convienent to everything that we wanted to see and more (either by foot or subway). We walked to the hotel from Penn Station towing 3 suitcases and having just got off 2 long haul flights from Australia and it wasn't that far and easy to find. Breakfast included was a great option - we all found food to eat and there was plenty of it to fuel us for the day. We were at breakfast by 7, so can't comment on if there was a wait as we didn't experience any. Only had one night of the included dinner (as we stayed over a weekend) and that was good too. Being environmentally conscious I was concerned by the use of throw away plates, cups etc at breakfast, although non disposable items were being used at dinner. Each day I hung up our towels for reuse but they were replaced each day so not sure if there was an option to reuse towels at all. We were on 16th floor and didn't have any sound issues from the street as reported by other reviewers.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Housekeeping horrible, Extremely noisy, No Valets or luggage carts, Parking unacceptable. Was there on business and you couldn't check in before 3. You had to take your car to a garage where it is kept until the end of your stay. You cannot access it for any reason. I had a meeting all day, came back to shower for dinner and the room hadn't been cleaned yet! So I had to call, complain, leave while they cleaned and was late for dinner. You could hear people talking on the street, sirens all night long. We couldn't sleep. The elevators were slow coming. Not any dessert type items on the breakfast buffet. No danish or sweets of any kind which would've been a nice touch. No luggage carts. What a pain to unload and carry all baggage. Plus one of us had to stay with the luggage while the other had to carry it all in, relock the car each time. No Valets!! We will never stay there again. Costs us over a 1,000 dollars for 2 nights. Never again!!
user_name:
Debra A
New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I loved staying at this hotel. It was like having my own little apartment in the city! The kitchenette, full hot breakfast and manager's reception made my stay very comfortable and convenient. Plus, the location is excellent, within easy walking distance to Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Macy's, etc. But the best part was the friendly staff who made me feel so at home. I especially want to single out Omar and Thomas Venitta. You guys are the best! Thank you all for such a wonderful stay in NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were very impressed by this hotel friendly staff and nice room. Added bonus is free breakfast plus from Monday through Thursday from 5pm-7pm you have complimentary beer, wine and light dinner. Loved our room however after our first night we heard our neighbor's alarm clock going off and hearing their conservation. It felt like we had no privacy. Windows and walls are not sound proof which is unfortunate! The honking and construction would wake us up. I have stayed in other hotels in NYC before and have never had a noise issue before. We stayed on the 4th floor and wish we were higher up since other reviews mentioned they had no noise issue when on the 15th floor & up.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This technically not a Homewood Suites, because the rooms in the hotel aren't suites. However, that's understandable as you'll be hard pressed to find an actual suite in New York for this price. To be fair, even though it is just one room, it was bigger than most other hotel rooms I've stayed at in the city. You can tell that the hotel is brand new, as everything in the room was still shiny and clean. The property itself was nice and the staff were friendly. Breakfast in the morning was ridiculous and it took 10 minutes of standing in line to get cereal, but that's New York for you. Pretty good area of the city to stay in, walking distance to most tourist spots in the city. Compared to a similar property in a different city, this place isn't all that great. but since it's in NYC, the value for the money is unbeatable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I loved the design of the hotel. The lobby is very business friendly. During my stay, I stayed on the 15th floor and had a phenomenal view. The elevators however were very slow. The elevators literally stopped At every floor between 15-1. The location of this hotel is very convenient. In addition, to being a good walking distance to Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Attended a convention at Jacob Javitts, found the Homewood Suites to be an excellent hotel for the stay. Will always choose this Hotel for a stay in NYC for this business travel. Breakfast and Dinner provided! What a bonus. I only stayed two days but the room could have made a week stay very comfortable.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a lovely new property. Rooms have small kitchenettes, allows you to make simple meals in your room if you want. Rooms are new, modern and stylish. Lobby is attractive and a bit small (NYC style) but pleasant enough to sit in while waiting for someone. Breakfast is included, and is pretty good - eggs, cereals, fruit, etc. WIFI is included, which helps make the hotel a good deal. There is a public parking garage across the street, so cars can be parked.In spite of the hotel's name, it is several blocks from Times Square. But it is also not far from High Line Park, an elevated walkway built on an old railroad bed. Great way to get out and get a feel for the West Side of NYC.If the location suites you, this is a great place to stay while visiting NYC. Clean, modern, helpful staff and reasonable rates.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The sound proofing in our room was non-existent, nil. We would just as well have moved our bed into Times Square I complained , to no availIt does have the ideal location , but my advice is pick another hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is nice and our room were clean and very modern.Not even a little scratch on the walls.It's far better than Holiday Inn for example.Staff is generally friendly and helpful. The only negative points when we were there:- although our room was perfectly clean, some pillows smelled the past guests saliva. I assume for the quality level of this hotel they should wash their pillows each time.- the staff was totally messed with 2 reservations we made, and we have had problems for this.- 2 of the 3 elevators made very strange and concerning noises each time...but nothing bad happened.- the stuff they sell (cola, soap etc) is very expensive...I know a lot of hotels do the same, but I don't feel respected when I have to pay almost 4$ for a little box of tide soap to wash my clothes (that I am used to pay 1$ in other hotels).- it was impossible for us to use our cellphones into our room, so no signal at all and we had to get down to the lobby each time.But don't get me wrong: it's still one of the best hotels I have ever been, and I strongly recommend it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here the first three nights in NYC. It is modern and clean. The location is slightly off the beaten path but is in walking distance to Times Square and the Empire State Building. The hotel is at 37th and 8th. The main part of Times Square is 46th and 7th. Then the Empire State building is on 34th and 5th. So this hotel is in walking distance of some NYC sights. We also took the subway down to Broadway to catch some shows. We even walked back from the hotel after the Broadway show. The hotel offered free breakfast and free dinner. The breakfast was so.so. But it is nice to get a free meal in NYC and save a little $$$. We never did make it back in time to try the dinner. The free dinner is served only Monday thru Thursday. Monday we did peak in to the dining area and the food looked good but we had eaten a late lunch and we were still full. I would stay here again for it is fairly reasonable price, clean and safe. However, we later moved down to the Central Park area and loved that part of NYC. But Central Park hotels are $$$.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I couldn't get into the hotels I wanted to but was very pleasantly surprised by this one. It is a little 'off the beaten path' in that it's located between 8th and 9th Avenues, but it's still easy walking distance to Times Square, so a good alternative to hotels on 7th or Broadway. Rooms are clean and modern with all necessary amenities.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was our first trip to New York and our first stay at a Homewood Suites Hotel. The location, staff and the hotel itself, could not have been any better. My wife put it best one evening walking back to our hotel when she noticed spotted the corner we turn on to get to the hotel and said " When I see that sign, I know I am almost home."

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: the breakfast and dinner at night was an added bonus after being in the city all day! I would stay at this hotel again. It was clean and friendly. The location was excellent and we didn't get a taxi all week!
user_name:
Courtney R
grand rapids, mi, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had only 3 days to spend in NY city especially at the busiest time of thanksgiving and we were lucky to find a place like Homewood suites. The staff we're so welcoming and great with all the questions we had as this was our first time in states. The location is great for everything especially shopping and all the city tours , food. We will go back there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Couldn't have asked for- a better location, great food breakfast and dinner. Clean room- nice kitchenette, roomy shower, comfy bed!
