The staff would accommodate requests and ways served with a smile! Tiffany , Karl, Victor, and Mey were absolutely customer service oriented, friendly, helpful, and happy! Omar with car service was great as well- always greeted customers with a smile! Our daughter came to visit over Thanksgiving so we needed a pull out couch our request was granted ! She too was very appreciative of a pleasant , happy, and helpful staff. Keep up the good work!
user_name:
Martha M
Las Cruces, New Mexico

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great value and quality in the heart of midtown NY. Room amenities are great, hotel service is very good. Rooms are clean and functional, fully equipped. Location allows you to move quickly to the key points in Midtown Manhattan

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nice location close to Times Square and with added benefits of excellent happy hour and complimentary food (dinner) from 5-7PM M-F and breakfast included. Nice clean rooms with full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher and stove top.The service from the staff is what really differentiates this hotel...they were phenomenal fromReception to Restaurant workers! Far exceeded service expectations especially in NYC :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I just checked out this morning and couldn't wait to review this hotel. I travel to New York about every three or four months, and have stayed in some wonderful hotels (and some not so wonderful ones.) I've stayed in small rooms and in suites. Honestly, I didn't have high expectations for this stay, so it wouldn't have been hard to meet my expectations, but I just was blown away by how accommodating and warm everyone at this property was. Every amenity you find at much trendier or expensive hotels is available here, and then some. It rained during my stay and I'd neglected to bring an umbrella. The front desk staff could have sold me one as they did have them for sale in their little store in the lobby but instead gave me the use of one of the hotel's umbrellas. Free coffee and tea all day and night, continental breakfast and dinner with wine were included in the cost of my room, making this a real steal in NYC! I completely recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good location within a few blocks of several subway stops/Penn Station/Port Authority/Times Square/Herald Square. Rooms are large and bright, nice furnishings, but need a mirror/outlet outside the small bathroom. Lots included compared to other hotels for the price (free wifi, breakfast, dinner). We happened to stop back at the hotel a couple of nights while dinner was going on-- the food was ok, good for a small bite before theater, and wine and beer were available too, great touch. The room was very quiet. I never heard noise from the hallway, other rooms, or even much street noise (we were on a lower floor). Elevator wait was not as bad as I was expecting from other reviews. Overall great hotel without spending a fortune.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The rooms not suites are very nice. They are a little larger then the standard New York City rooms, but also have full mini kitchens. My issue though is more about the service then the hotel. At check in I was not recognized as a Hilton Honors Gold Member nor did I feel welcomed. That evening we attended the complimentary dinner and it was terrible. The food was very cold and not edible. The area around the food was quite dirty as well. We threw out our food and went a couple of blocks to the Tik Tock Diner which is very good. On the second evening the lobby was quite busy and a large group was waiting for the elevators, but on the last elevator there was a bellman holding it and preventing anyone from getting on. So it was quite a long wait about 15 minutes for the next elevator. Then the internet went out for most of the day and when I called down to see if they had an estimated time of when it would be back up and running I was told in a rude way that they have no idea. I would definitely recommend this hotel for its location and room cleanliness, but have to say the staff is not very friendly and welcoming.
user_name:
Dale G
Albany, New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was a perfect place for our family to spend the night when we came to take in the Macy's parade. Close to so much - and very, very accommodating. Our room was ready early - we got a late check out - rooms were clean, quiet, and just perfect for our basecamp for our NYC adventures!
user_name:
Jane J
Arlington, VA, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful - wonderful - wonderful stay! Great location! Great size of room! Will stay here on return trips to the Big Apple! No disappointment from the staff, the food, the front office staff - all excellent!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New Homewood Suites within walking distance of Time Square, Fifth Avenue, and Lincoln Center. Nice breakfast choices which were varied each day. The manager's reception (dinner) was lovely each of the three nights we stayed at Homewood Suites. You can easily get to this hotel from JFK by taking the train to Penn Station. Subways are close by. Great staff!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I needed a hotel for two nights near Penn Station as I'd be getting on an early train when leaving New York. Based on TripAdvisor reviews, I selected this Homewood Suites. This is a brand new, well designed, clean hotel. I had a corner room, which was well laid out and had everything I needed (including free WiFI). Only negatives were the lack of counter space in the bathroom, floor of the shower was somewhat slippery and the breakfast a disappointment. Re the last, have to give the hotel credit for offering free breakfast, which is almost impossible to find at a New York City hotel. While definitely not in the most attractive neighborhood, the hotel is within walking distance of Penn Station, Time Square, subway lines, etc. Hotel staff is efficient and pleasant, and I got an excellent rate (for NYC) for my room. Would definitely stay here again if I had to be in this area.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This property is a great central location for seeing all of the city. Just west of 8th avenue, you are within blocks of the theaters. The staff is very polite and take great care of you. Cocktails and food M-Th is an awesome perk. Rooms are large by NYC standards and well appointed. The kitchenette is a plus. Very quiet, we were surprised. Don't have anything bad to say about this property. This is our new go to place to stay when we come to the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was our first visit to New York and what a beautiful hotel we chose! Hotel is situated a few minutes walk from Times Square.It is around the corner from Maceys and Madison Square Garden.Staff are very friendly and helpful.There is a twenty four hour free tea and coffee dock in the lobby and they even have herbal teas ! Bedroom was spacious with a mini kitchen. Breakfast was provided every morning and there was free dinner with drinks served every evening from Monday to Thursday. Hotel is within walking distance of all major sights.there is free wi fi everywhere in the hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Professional and extremely friendly staff, comfortable and spacious room (very quiet!), convenient location, free breakfast and Wi Fi and all at a reasonable rate -- this is my new go-to place when I come to NYC. Instead of the usual compromises I've encountered "because you're staying in Manhattan", this is a no-compromises necessary place. My only, very small, negative would be the lack of readily-available cabs on 37th, but 8th or 9th streets are a quick walk away and Penn Station is within blocks.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was first trip to NYC. Six of us total so got 3 rooms. The room size was bigger than I thought given what I've heard about size of NYC hotel rooms. We got there early so had to wait for our room. Once we got to room it was a good size room. It was very clean and had small kitchen. So great if you were staying long and wanted to save some $$ and cook a little. We had enough room to put our clothes away. Nice tv and great channel selection. Bathroom was decent size and everything worked fine. The breakfast in the morning is okay. A few more options would help but it's free so you can only expect so much. The bed was really comfortable and had a great night sleep each night. They have free coffee in the lobby. It's close to lots of attractions. I would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: On arrival we realised that this hotel is nowhere near Time Square, yet it constantly mentions being located on Times Square in its advertisements. The 'suites' were no bigger than any standard room, they just missed out a cupboard and put a small sink and fridge in there. When we arrived they asked for a credit card. I only have one and it was near it's limit, but that didn't matter because I had plenty of money on my debit card. As we obtained any expenses throughout the week instead of waiting until we check out and then settling our bill they just constantly attempted to charge my credit card without telling me so many times the card provider assumed fraud and closed my card. when I asked the desk manager, Castillo, if it was usual practise to hammer someones card without discussion before check out time and he didn't have an answer. Of course I paid all bills before I left, in fact earlier than that to stop them from trying to bill my card.They also accused my friend who I was staying with of smoking in the room. I don't smoke and hate the smell, and I didn't see him smoking in the room - I wouldn't have let him of course. And I can tell you 100% the room didn't smell of smoke, but he still may have done. Instead of so much as discussing it with me, the person who booked the room and gave the card details, they called up the room number and told us if someone didn't come down and pay 250 dollars as some kind of shake down money then they'd call the police and have us escorted out of the hotel. We had one night left and to be honest it would have been cheaper to just leave and stay elsewhere. But I'm not the type of person to be humiliated like that, so I paid it. I asked what the money would be used for and they said cleaning the drapes. There must be some expensive drape cleaners in NYC. Horrendous handling of what could have been a straightforward situation. The cleaners routinely rifled through all of our possessions to the point where I set a couple of obvious traps which they fell for. I realised they had gone through my bag after the first day so put privacy on the room so they wouldn't come in again. But they came in everyday regardless. They also took some dollars off the side table they must have assumed was a tip, but certainly wasn't. I've stayed a lot of places, even in US alone and this has to have been the worst experience I have ever had. Avoid at all costs.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Close to Time Square, but quiet. Walkable to Penn Station and the Theater District. I still can't belive the rooms had hardwood floors. Every morning should start with FREE breakfast. A great find for a quick night in the city.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites was a wonderful place to stay on my last trip to New York! The staff was so friendly and accommodating (especially Daniel!); the hotel was quite clean and the location incredibly convenient. All-around great experience! Would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Holly-Anne P
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The room was amazing and considered very spacious for NYC standard. Not a full service hotel so please don't expect sandals, bathrobe etc. The location is great for people who like to stay at mid town. The check in is slow (I've tried two Hilton brand hotels in Manhattan both were slow in check-in) and I wish the breakfast could have been better.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at Homewood Suites By Hilton in New York Midtown at Manhattan Time Square NY and it was great - what a location , every thing is right hier , walking distnce to all my meetings , the center of the world!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel, they are really service oriented. Conveniently located and reasonably priced. Excellent value for my money. Food is great in the morning and staff are very friendly, I loved the fact that you can check out from your TV set.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I go to New York often (monthly) but have never stayed at a Homewood Suites. First of location is pretty good as it is only about one two blocks from Penn Station (so easy commute from JFK) and is about 5 blocks south of Times Square. Stayed on the top floor in a regular studio. Rooms are small but this is typical in NYC. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, modern and spacious. A few things to keep in mind: if you are on the top floors the wait for the elevator is long, especially in the morning rush for breakfast. So unless you are particular to a top floor, I would stay on the lower floors so that you can take the stairs. Breakfast was nothing really special. I was expecting something similar to what you find at Hampton Inns but the selection was limited and not that good. Plus it gets very crowded in the dinning area so chances are, you wont be able to sit to eat. Didnt really interact with the staff so I comment on that. So if you get a good rate, I would say this is a pretty decent place to stay if in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The rooms are nice and large for NYC. Really liked having the pull-out couch for our child that was traveling with us. Full sized fridge, wood floors (no carpet)...overall, very comfortable room. Elevators are busy and you can wait awhile. It's great to have free breakfast! I agree with others though that the area is too small for the number of guests. Also, they kept running out of food and coffee. No cream for the coffee- my one complaint. They had flavored stuff, but no regular cream?The area is "ok". It's not as close to Rockefeller or Times Square as we would have liked, but a quick cab ride to most places worked just fine.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New hotel close to many things in the city. Rooms are smartly laid out. Lobby is very pretty. Dinner, breakfast and drinks are included. How can you go wrong? There is also a rooftop area that would be nice in the summer. You could take your drink up there and hang out. NOT NOW in the winter!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Everything was excellent service great room were nice Location the best Pull out queen couch Always clean towels Sm bar downstairs Serve am bowls of snacks Will stay there again Ckeck in easy Hot cookies every night

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great place friendly clean, quiet rooms and good breakfast Close to where we want to to travel too Time Square , etc subway not far away from places we wished to go. Safe , fun area will go back soon. Hotel meet all our needs.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a great property. My fiance and I stayed here with friends back in the summer. The location is perfect and close to everything. You will not find bigger hotel rooms in Manhattan. The staff was extremely helpful with directions etc. The best part is the roof top. Grab a few drinks, some friends, and check out that sunset on a warm NYC night.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is perfect, away from the hundreds of people, 3 blocks away from Times Square easy access. The rooms were clean, beautiful inside and the staff was great. Stay here, you will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Heating/cooling so loud you won't sleep at night. Breakfast so paltry you're better off staying somewhere that doesn't include breakfast in the room charge and finding a good, reasonably priced diner -- or coffee and a bagel on any corner. Inconveniently located amenities. Mattresses like rocks. If you're used to memory foam, forget about it! Beware the "we can recommend a car service" scam! Google for a Manhattan car service, comparison shop, and choose and schedule cars on your own.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Be prepared to pay, but you'll be thrilled with the quality of this home away from home. Many of the rooms have a sofa bed, so, you can sleep more people there than in most NYC rooms. Great also if you have kids or grandma and you want everyone together. Safes in the room, lots of channels, radio, iron hairdryer. They've thought of everything. Lots of electric/phone plugs everywhere.The kitchenette is wonderful, the bathroom is beautiful. Your view may leave something to be desired, but it's in the heart of the garment district, so, that' s to be expected. My NYC local friend says they've left alot of the old garment district as is, and so while it's a little dowdy, it's also a glimpse into old NY before Disney and trump wallpapered over it. Incredible restaurants just 15 minute walk up from here to west 46th. So you can end your day here without a huge hassle to get home. Close to theater and times square. The breakfast was good, not great, but respectable. Solid hot foods but no pastry. The service was fabulous. Beds divine. Great towels, lots of pillows. Very sumptuous and modern and sleek all at the same time. They do stainless steel and glass and make it sexy instead of austere.Lots of handy restaurants/cafes/convenience stores just around the corner. Everything is closeby. Nice, safe neighborhood. Always awake, always people around. You get the "city that never sleeps" experience without the trampling of times square. It's an easy walk to times square or Madison square garden.Parking is a bear. Welcome to NYC. The hotel doesn't have a garage. Expect to pay $47/24h at any of the private garages within a block of the hotel. No getting around it. Dinner is included during the week, but, honestly, why settle for their buffet when yo u're in NYC???? Go out and eat!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean, spacious, well equipped and great location. Breakfast was good, but when we went down around 7 am the breakfast area was already full so we had to eat in the lounge area and we ran out of bacon but they replaced it with sausage. Valet parking is across the hotel but quite expensive. Nearest subway is about a 10 minute walk. I pre-paid our hotel which was non refundable and paid about $350/night. When I checked the day before our stay the price went down to $250. I should have waited! Check in and check out were fast and problem free. Lobby was quite busy at all times.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A clean, well appointed place with great service. A perfect location and exceptional price ($160/night) 4 blocks from Times Square and 2 blocks from the subway. The bed was comfortable, the pillows perfect - a great shower. Comes with free breakfast that was plentiful and free wifi even in room. Could not ask for more in the city

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very clean apartment which felt quite large, centrally located. Easy to get to from Penn station bus stop from the airport. Breakfast was excellent and of a good standard. Located in a quite street a short walk from Times Square. Would recommend this hotel for a short or long staybridge holiday

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: my daughter found me a place to stay close to her and pre-surgery - She picked this location for that reason, and also because of the Hilton name - and the price! I must add in that it was an extremely attractive venue, both inside and outside the room, with attentive and helpful staff. I regret that I didn't have a chance to try the restaurant, but hope to stay at this hotel again where the pillows are wonderful and the bathroom freebies are of excellent quality. The room had obviously been carefully planned. Not totally silent, but not impossible.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 8 nights and was amazed ....everything advertised and claimed is absolutely correct! Clean, well appointed room with a small but very practical kitchenette, sumptuous breakfast, complimentary Wi Fi, tea and coffee all day long, wine and beer and good wholesome food in the evenings, daily cleaning of room....the list could go on and on. Very friendly and helpful staff, great location and a highly competitive rate that makes this arguably the best value for money in mid town Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A great hotel! I cannot say enough. Courteous & efficient check in. Beautiful room. Huge high ceilings. Ceiling fan. Spotless - including the bathroom. EXCELLENT dinner buffet. Even the free happy hour beer was top shelf (not some no name watered down stuff). The attendees at all the food and beverage stations were, again, attentive and positive and smiling and happy to have me as a guest. All public areas were neat and clean. Very safe feeling both in the hotel and on the block. Great location as well for midtown NY. Located just right to avoid paying Times Square rates but still a quick walk to everything. Again, I cannot think of one thing I could complain about. A great stay. Will be back for sure.
user_name:
MrBrownShoes
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I planned a solo trip to NYC for a couple days and this place couldn't have been more perfect. It was within walking distance from Penn Station, I felt safe walking in the day & nighttime in the location, and the hotel itself was extremely neat and clean. Breakfast is offered each day (as well as dinner which I was not able to take advantage of) and my room had a tiny kitchenette in it that allowed me to save leftovers and re-heat in the microwave. I will definitely stay again if I travel again to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for one night while on business in NYC. It was my first time.NYC hotels are crazy expensive and frequently come up short with price per value. Not this one. It offers a lot for a business traveler.Lets begin with the positives: the staff was engaging, friendly, and professional from the doorman, to the front desk personnnel, to the housekeeping staff and the follow up check in call to ensure I was pleased with my room. That customer focus is not always the case in NYC.my room while not huge was quite sufficient for one person. It was well equipped with quick WIFI, a kitchenette, a small but up to date bathroom, and a very comfortable bed. The lobby isn't large but it is well designed for attractive spaces to hang, do work or watch the multiple TVs for games or news. The breakfast room and offering is extensive and they even offer a complimentary dinner M-TH along with a nightly reception from 5-7pm. The fitness center is well lighted, has a high ceiling and glass construction. It seems stocked with aerobic machines. There is a first floor terrace that is a nice place for a outside drink and conversation -- in midtown Manhattan -- not easy to find.If you are looking for a facility near Penn Station and Hell's Kitchen then this is a good one.Everyone can improve so here are some suggestions: the bathroom amenities seem skimpy when compared to how well equipped the room is, can't tell for sure how many anaerobic weight machines there are so if that is important to you check it out.Overall, this is a good choice if you are looking for a clean, mid-tier hotel. give it a try.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My wife and I, along with our 6 year old daughter came to NYC for the Christmas spectacular @ Radio City Music Hall. We were impressed with the level of attentiveness and professionalism of the staff. They went to great lengths to greet us and shower attention on our daughter. We were in a bind for dinner and the concierge/front desk was able to recommend Ruby Foo's and get us a table! We got stuck in traffic on our departure day and were past the check out time, but they were very accommodating and offered to help any way they can, including extending us more time to check out. We stayed on the 22nd floor, with a beautiful view of the skyline. We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We just stayed at this hotel this past weekend, the experience overall was great! The hotel was very clean, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful with any questions we had, also went above and beyond when we forgot something after we checked out. They welcomed us home every night. The breakfast was delicious and buffet style-like. They offer free coffee/hot chocolate/tea bar 24/7. Location was ideal, we were 2 blocks from Times square. I would without a doubt stay at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Myself a two other friends were extremely delighted with everything your hotel provided for us during our 8days. From the moment we walked in the lobby & greeted by your staff. Such hospitality with everything. From the. day when we arrived, till the moment when we checked out. The staff so professional to provide anything or answer any questions or directions, not in a mechanical tone of voice, like a recording but so friendly . Makes you feel at home. Willing to make you comfortable in all areas..from the staff at the front desk, the personnel in the dining area (very good food, great breakfast! , and the utmost cleanliness in ALL areas, & housekeeping. We also felt quite safe being there. We were very happy to have picked this hotel and we are already passing on the word " this is a great place to stay if your visiting NYC". Close to all main transportation & attractions. Thank you to all the staff which made our stay at your hotel a very pleasant one. We will definitely be going back.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We visited this hotel this year end Oct for 9 nights. I made reservation for this hotel at the beginning of the year, so before the hotel was fully build up. I had some request in advance and contacted them by e-mail. The answers took some time and were really short (like 2 sentences without politeness) and unsufficient. The staff really needs some more training regarding service.I was traveling with a diabetic kid and let them know about it. A german hotel with this standard would ask me about any special nees. Well, Homewood Suites didn't seem to care.So I had some mixed feeling beforehand. Then we finally arrived after an 16 hrs travel. The woman at the desk told me, that there is a problem with my credit card and they CANCELED our reservation. I was shocked. We were told to return tomorrow with a valid credit card and sort of kicked out of the hotel.Fortunately there is the Marriot Courtyard hotel right across the street and we went there. I was quite exhausted and my daughter didn't feel very good, too. So the guy at the desk there was very nice and helped me to sort out the problem with our credit card and gave us a nice room. I am still so thankful for that.So the next morning I went back to the Homewood and they let me finally check in.The rooms are really nice and clean, except of the floor. So don't forget your slippers. The breakfast and complimentary dinner (mo-fr) are really low standard. So we went in the morning to Dunkin Donuts. There is a nice kitchen with big fridge and microwave. A big Samsung television with a lot of channels to choose. You can clean your clothes in the laundry downstairs. And don't forget to go upstairs and have a nice view from the rooftop.Will I stay there again? Absolutely no. Feeling at home? No way.If you don't care for any service - please choose this hotel. If you like to be treated courteous - go across the street or somewhere else.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New hotel. We were pleased with the location. The room was a little small for my wife and I meaning we had to get somewhat creative, exercise patience and went in with the understanding the rooms are expected to be smaller in NY. The AC vent was blowing directly on us in bed. The hotel technition who was very courteous did his best to divert the air away from us with cardboard and tape. We were able to manage and had a comfortable stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After much deliberation Homewood Suites Manhattan was chosen for our recent 4 night stay. Glad we did!Pros:-Excellent mid town location within easy walking distance of Times Square, Macy's and subway.Spotlessly clean and brand new everything, everywhereComfortable bed and pillowsLoads of towels and toiletries replenished dailyTea, coffee and hot chocolate available in the lobby at all timesGood breakfast choiceFree and well chosen wine and beer Mon - Thurs with free evening food (food just OK)Gentleman running the food area was brilliant, really wanted to make sure everyone was looked after, and he succeeded in our case. Thanks for that and filling up wine glasses without question!Lifts were not the problem for us that other guests have highlightedRelaxed atmosphereGreat hand held hairdryer in bedroomLittle interaction with staff due to everything being so well done, Omar on reception sorted taxis out for us on day of departureFree band aid (plasters!) from reception when feet blistered from sightseeing!Discreet housekeeping that were not present on hotel floors all the time which is often the case.Complimentary and excellent wifiCons:-Not all rooms ready on arrival at 4.30pm. Small issue soon sorted.Problems getting luggage brought up from storage on day of departure caused delay with taxisWe travelled at an expensive time but not really a con as such - we feel we got great value for the room rate paid. If you get to stay at a cheap rate you're onto a major winner here.Area around 8th Avenue had a few shady looking characters in the late evening but we were only passing through on way back to hotel, never felt threatened.Not hotel related - would not recommend the nearby Houndstooth pub for food. Expensive and very poor quality.If you're considering this hotel - book it!Thanks to all the staff in Homewood Manhattan, you contributed greatly to our fantastic family break to the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The General Manager Karl Baugher and his staff were so great to deal with. Very attentive and acommodating. Our room was so quiet never heard any street noise which was a concern. The breakfast and dinner are what anyone should expect that has ever stayed at a Hilton Garden Inn or a Hampton Inn. If you want better hit the street and have at it. Don't know if all guest realize that there is a roof top area that you can gather some friends and family and enjoy a little view of New York sky line. Thank for a great stay.Bill

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The road out side does not do justice to this hotel. Lovely hotel but small rooms. may be expected from New York hotel though,.As we were at back of hotel no view other than next building with offices facing the window. So we always had to keep shut the drapes.Breakfast good but crowded as not much room there. The free dinner had limited choice. To go to times square it a bit walk but Macy's just couple of blocks away....The hotel scores on the service though. Everyone we met was helpful and smiling....

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I write this review, literally, while in the lobby of the Homewood Suites as I await my transport to the airport. It's a bit rainy and chilly outside, so I sit by a fire at one of their many comfortable lounge/work-spaces, sipping hot tea as I write. (In addition to free breakfast daily and dinner (Mon-Thurs), complimentary hot beverages are also provided, 24/7, to their customers.) From the moment I arrived, until the hours before my departure, the staff at Homewood Suites made my stay absolutely enjoyable. I was greeted by a warm and caring staff and all who I encountered were excellent. Nafeesa, especially, went out of her way to ensure my every need was met. She even sent me on my way with cookies in case I got hungry on my flight! The hotel is quaint and cozy. Even though it's located on a busy street in the heart of the garment district, noise was never an issue. I was informed that because the hotel is new, the rooms were all equipped with thicker, sound-proof glass. The facility is pristine and my room was a haven after attending several meetings in Wall Street area. The hotel is an easy walk to Times Square and the Blue and Red subway lines, making travel throughout Manhattan affordable and quite easy to navigate. I will not hesitate to return to this property whenever visiting NYC. Thanks again to all at Homewood Suites for a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights in a suite which is a small apartment with a separate bedroom. All such suites are on the second floor of the building which is not that bad in terms of noise as the windows seem to be well insulated for noise protection. Inevitably though as this is a big city you cannot block it all out no matter which floor you are on. Our 2 year old slept in the bedroom whilst we were able to do our own thing in the lounge area. This is the perfect situation for a family and gives you some freedom at night. We even hired a babysitter one evening so we could go out. The receptionist provided babysitter details.The hotel is modern, clean and well equipped. There is a definite commuter feel to it. Staff are friendly and helpful.Breakfast and supper are included - supper is only served on certain specified nights. The food is unspectacular but fine. It's a self service buffet with plastic knives and forks which is a bit unusual but personally I didn't mind. Wine or beer is available with supper which is a bonus. Free tea and coffee is also served all day in the lobby area. The location is great. Ten minutes walk from 5th Av and Times Square. Macy's is around the corner. We landed at Newark airport and got a yellow cab to the hotel for $80.My only real grumble is that we were here to get married in NYC and although we told the staff and I emailed the hotel manager in advance nothing was done to congratulate us. A bottle of bubbly would have been a nice touch.
user_name:
David L
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has a great location and a modern feel. Our room was quite spacious and contemporary with a comfy bed. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast which is quite good, but could do with a bit more variety. The only downside was the noisy fridge in our room. We unplugged the fridge during the night and had a good night's rest.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I booked this hotel on the basis that it was the cheapest of the Hilton group of hotels in Manhattan for the dates I required for my stay. At $359 (before tax) this was a total disgrace - why not sell out the hotel at the 'normal' rate rather than fleece a loyal customer and profit from high demand/low availability? Disposable polystyrene plates for breakfast at this rate? Disgraceful. I normally don't mind the Homewood Suites brand but not this time. At $200 a night I would have rated this a 3/5 but on the value for money I'm afraid it's a 1.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My family had a very good experience staying in the hotel. The brekfast and evening meal really added to the value we feel we recieved there. The location was ver good as it was within two blocks of Times Square and Macey's.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed in room 403. It has 2 queen beds, a small sofa & a full size desk. It also has a fridge, stove top, microwave. Plates, cutlery, glasses also provided. The room is very large for a hotel in New York. The decor has clean lines and is minimalist. Very contemporary. Free hot breakfast daily. Free dinner Mon to Thur with beer & wine served. Staff are friendly and helpful. The only compliant I have for he room is that it doesn't have enough closet and storage space for our clothes. Also, there are not enough mirrors in the room (we are 3 girls sharing the room)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was more than expected. The rooms are big considering this is NYC. The room was quiet and clean. The bed was comfortable. Only drawback is the bathroom. The vanity is small, very little space for a lady's makeup bag and toiletries. The faucet was at a weird angle too, making it difficult to wash your face. Breakfast was limited but included real scrambled eggs and potatoes. A bonus was the dinner and wine they provide for free during the week. Will definitely return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Chances are you don't know this new place, so let me tell you what was good, and less good, for usThe good1) The location is great if you will use the public transport system. You are 100/300 yards from all the 34th street subway stations, and you can be at Macys in 5 minutes Because the hotel is in a quiet cross street there is little noise at night2) The free food and drink (5pm to 7pm) can be tasty and convenient when you are just off the plane. The free breakfast good when it's bacon and scrambled egg3) Everything is new and the bed is great. The elevators well programmed, so you don't wait much. The bathroom sparkles and, although small, you can shower (no bath) without soaking the place4) There are few hotel bargains in New York and we paid $340 in high season, which is possibly below average The staff are good, but that's the norm in New YorkThe less good1) The location is in the heart of the old garment district. There's not much garment stuff left, but the area has not changed much and you won't find many bars or eateries indeed anything at all of interest if you want to walk around2) The free breakfast can be dreadful when it is fried egg with the consistency of leather and sausage of doubtful flavour. The eating area has the charm of a works canteen, and you will eat with plastic cutlery and paper plates at breakfast 3) The bedroom is equipped with a new kitchen battery (fridge-freezer/microwave/dishwasher etc) As the room is not huge this takes up a lot of space and if you want to cook you will be less than 3 feet from the bed whilst doing so. And you can't eat a meal face to face, but would have to squash in side by side at a tiny table. Does anyone actually want to do this? And how would you keep the room smelling fresh if you did cook?4) Price/value ratios are a personal judgement. We came here after 3 stays at the Novotel and a bad experience the last time there. I think next time we shall opt for somewhere that costs more but gives us a larger room

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This new property is just perfect. Lobby beautiful and full of plug in spots. Breakfast was above average. Rooms are surprisingly spacious, sleek with comfy beds. Nice wooden floors, frig and adequate kitchen, nicely appointed. Really enjoyed our stay in all respects . 5 minute walk to Times Square so close but away from the madness. Lots of nice restaurants within walking distance. Just perfect.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location is great, 5-10 minute walk from Times Square. Area looks safe, although some strange figures hang around after mindnight, but it is Midtown New York, what else to expect in Midtown New York.Reception staff is extremely friendly and polite. They handled every request quickly and effectively. They even let us check out late free of charge.Room is OK in size and fancy. It was called a suite but it was rather a room with a kitchnette and a small sofa bed squized in a standard room. The kitchen was well equipped but the refrigirator was extremely loud. They sent a repairman to fix it but the final solution was to unplug it for the duration of our stay.AC is loud too and hard to set it right, it blows too strong even in lowest mode. Our window looked to the inner yard and could not be opened without getting deaf from the external AC. Bed was comfortable, but we did not like the simple sheets on the blanket, they should be covered entirely, it is not hygienic this way.WIFI was free and fast enough.Our cell phones did not work in the room as signal was zero due to location, we had to go to the hall to talk or send sms.They have a business center where you can use computer or print your stuff, it is very useful.We did not use the gym but it looked good.They offer complimentary dinner but it is very simple, only one course and one option and served between 5 and 7 PM only but it can be OK for some people, better than nothing.The hotel has a laundry room in the basement which can be convenient too when needed.Elevators are crowded and slow, they have three only and staff members use it too. The lifts stop at floors even when being full.The worst thing baout the hotel is its breakfast room and the breakfast itself. Lots of people in a little room pushing each other for the simple repetative food served on disposable plasctic plates.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I actually picked this hotel because of the nice reviews about the staff and their friendliness.However, I didn't find that during my one week stay. Especially the front desk they weren't friendly and they didn't treat Arab well.When I checked in "Daniel" took care of me and I wished if he didn't. At first he told me there isn't any reservation under my name (which was two rooms) and when I gave him the printed confirmation he acted usually and he didn't apologies. After that, he put us in a lower floor "without asking me" or even without looking at my request that I have made earlier during the booking time.Also, in my request I have specifically asked to be in two rooms beside each other or in front of each other but again why to bother and look at my request.After I checked the rooms I didn't like what I was provided with; since I had small children, So, I get back to him and asked to be relocated based on my preference and he did but wasn't so happy about it.The most unpleasant experience was the bed bugs, me and my sister had a lot of skin bumps all over our body. the supervisor came and checked on me when I told the housekeeping about that. They unfortunately didn't act well about it as they checked on us only once and didn't offer any deduction from my rate even after I asked the manager during my check-out.I'm really disappointed and will never ever come again to a place that DOESN'T"T Respect you or give you a skin issues.They were over priced too for their location.PS. I'm NOT allergic and I've slept in many hotels. This was my first incidence.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There are not many hotels in Midtown that offer a private back yard with patio furniture, full kitchen, free full hot breakfast, free dinner and wine/beer reception in such a superb location for under $300 per night. I would pay this yet I only paid $150 through Priceline. Service was outstanding, very clean, good breakfast, parking was easy (right across st. Emerald Parking, great service there as well. Only $74 for 36 hours for my SUV). I gave this hotel 5 stars.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: You never know what to expect when visiting New York and booking a hotel. But Homewood Suites surpassed all expectations. Clean well appointed rooms. Hot showers with lots of water pressure. The in suite kitchens have everything you would need if you wanted to prepare your own meals. The bed was awesome and the hotel was so quiet and was the best night of sleep I ever had in New York City. Staff was also very personable, pleasant and attentive to your every need. And by New York rates this hotel is a steal, I used booking.com.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Any frequent traveler to NY knows that "new" hotels in old buildings can often be a combination of a beautiful, modern lobby and small, dark, functionally obsolete rooms. That seems to be the key to success for many boutique hotels in the city. I was pleasantly surprised to find this Homewood Suites to be a very well designed, conveniently located, affordable option in Manhattan. The lobby is new and very inviting. The front desk staff is friendly and extremely helpful. The guest rooms are modern, comfortable and well equipped. Our room had a mini kitchen, nicely designed sitting area and a comfortable bed. Breakfast is included in an affordable room rate. I'm a Hilton Diamond member and rate this hotel high on my list on New York properties.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our company held an event at this hotel, so a bunch of us booked rooms rather than travel back home. The people could not have been nicer to all of us. Our bell hop, Omar, was friendly and always smiling. At breakfast the next morning, Michael, was very nice and accommodating even though he was extremely busy with all of the people there. We had a great time. Thank you all so much. I 100% recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton with my sister and two nieces for three nights in October. We arrived early approx 10 am and the hotel kept our cases until check in time. The only glitch in our stay was when we returned at 3pm to check into our room. The receptionist told us it wasn't ready and she couldn't tell us when it would be. I explained that we were going out that night and that four of us had to get showered and dressed. It was 4.30 before the room was ready. Only a little thing but we had been travelling for 12 hours and instead of relaxing to go out we all had to rush. Moving on I can think of no other negative comments to make about the hotel. The rooms were fabulous, very large and although four of us were sharing we never felt on top of one another. The bathroom was huge and the kitchen was fully equipped with microwave, fridge and freezer. It was absolutely spotless as were all other areas of the hotel. The reception/lounge area was comfortable with free coffee/tea/hot chocolate available at all times. Breakfast is included in the price and this again was excellent, with plenty of choice for everyone. The location was brilliant and we walked most places. The staff at this hotel are all extremely helpful and I cannot fault any of them. All in all a great hotel, great location and we would all definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel could be one of the best options in the area however it is starting to fall/have into the regular hotel issues. We chose this hotel after major research online and based on reviews, photos , and location it seemed perfect. It also provides an extra bed which was crucial for us as our son who studies in NYC came to stay one night. Yes, the hotel is brand new, location is perfect, and rooms are much bigger than average. We asked for a higher floor , got it, and paid extra for a view(the hotel does not have the Empire view like other hotels in the area) that came in a form of huge floor to ceiling windows; lobby is beautiful and cozy and the upper roof deck is a plus (bring your own drinks), so far so good ,yet here comes the BUT.. We had major cleaning issues , our room was not thoroughly clean when we arrived and was cleaned less as days went by. Like many other modern trendy hotels now , the use of shiny materials and kitchens requires more work, and dust, food leftovers, hand prints and so forth are impossible to hide. A complaint to the staff did not help. We were lucky to have our bed changed, all we got was more and more towels, which we didn't use. We noticed same trend in the public areas. 5 days and elevators were not cleaned even once. I believe the fact that everything is brand new covers for the lack of maintenance. I also know that some people have different standards for those matters , yet since the price per night was not cheap, on the contrary , you expect more. Breakfast was crowded with people literally pushing to get food. It was sufficient but some items were out for the whole time we stayed; half and half for the (lobby )coffee (that was so bad), sausages.... after 3 days we decided to eat outside. NY has many great breakfast places . Our check in stuff was pleasant and accommodating , even though our room was not ready she made sure we got the room we want. On the other hand the check out guy very early in the morning was laughing in our face when asked a simple question, rude on any level. The week we stayed the hotel was packed with European groups and that meant more smoking! Yes, the hotel is smoke free but they would smoke outside and then go inside, elevators were stinky at times. During breakfast they would yell to each other, sit in large groups for longer period of time,( I get that , they are groups) but it wasn't the atmosphere my husband and I were looking forward to.All in all the experience was good taking into consideration it is a beautiful new hotel in a very good location with larger than usual rooms. We frequently visit NYC and if those issues will be taking care we might return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Ten days in New York City from Italy.This hotel were extraordinary for our holidays; new, cool, very well built, modern furniture, large bedrooms with big bathroom, shower and window, soft and relaxing bed, polite staff.We were very excited about the international breakfast (large hot and cold buffet) and the evening meal that was all included.Hotel surroundings are pretty good: lot of restaurants, shops, markets, metro station and Penn station, not far by feet from Empire State Building.Enjoyable roof top at 22th floor with a great view, especially by night.Simply nice and lovely hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: It was my first vacation in almost (20) years. I had always wanted to visit New York City and was thrilled when my Mom suggested we go there for my 50th Birthday!! I spent at least a month researching all our options for Hotels, and chose the Homewood Suites by Hilton New York Midtown Manhattan Times Square. I have to say that it was THE best decision that I've ever made and this beautiful property was THE best hotel stay that I've ever had! We booked (3) nights from October 14th - 17th - which was just last week. We returned home late Friday night and miss it SO much! We're already talking about our return trip! I don't even know where to begin!!! The rooms were SO homey with our Full Kitchen...which not only included a Fridge, Microwave, Stove Top elements and Sink, but we were also provided with cutlery, plates, cooking utensils, cups, glasses and storage containers. This hotel even provided dish detergent packets for our built-in Dishwasher!!! It was wonderful being able to bring "Doggy-bags" home from a restaurant, storing them in the fridge, and heating them up the next day for Lunch!!! The hotel room was very quaint and we were fortunate enough to receive a room on the 16th floor facing the rear of the hotel. Some people may not have been happy looking into some else's apartment across the way...but it didn't bother us in the least! The room was SO private (once you lowered the blind) and quiet for sleeping. My Mom and Sister slept on the King bed and I slept on the Pull-out Bed. It was surprisingly comfortable and, with the fleece blanket, I felt like I was sleeping on my own bed! A great night's rest every night!!! The bathroom was lovely and everything was SO new and fresh! The hotel itself was exquisite...from the Waterfall wall and Fireplace in the Lobby, to the Rooftop Terrace with it's terrific views, décor and easy listening music pumping in! It was THE perfect retreat after a busy day of sightseeing! The complimentary FULL breakfast every morning was SO appreciated! You didn't have to search the area to find a great place to eat...it's was just a short elevator ride away! The selection was endless...from Scrambled Eggs and Ham, to cold Cereal, Juices, and Yogurt, to any kind of bread or bagel you desired! SO much to chose from! Monday to Thursday, they offered a complimentary dinner with Wine and Beer, if you desired. We took advantage of it our first night, and thoroughly enjoyed the Meat Lasagna, Garlic Toast and Green Beans...Delish!!!! On top of all of this, they also offered FREE Coffee, Tea and Hot Chocolate 24-7! This property has a central location perfect for whatever you chose to do be it shopping, sightseeing, taking in a show, travelling Uptown or Downtown, or just heading out for a great meal. What more could you ask for?! I've saved THE best for last...THE greatest staff ever! From our check-in and check-out with Allison, to chatting at breakfast with Devon or making car arrangements with Daniel, they epitomize what "Exceptional Customer Service" is all about! I too, work in Customer Service, and was SO impressed with how helpful, friendly, outgoing and warm each and every one of their staff members was! For that reason alone, they now have "Customers for Life". My love to each and every one of them, and I can't wait to come back again next year!!!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: After much research online, I decided on the Homewood Suites Hilton, due to several factors...location, cost, and client reviews. Learning that this was a new property was an absolute plus. Everything is new, so many typical hotel issues are non-existent! Value...NYC is an expensive locale to begin with, so deciding amongst a huge assortment of standard hotel rooms, this appeals due to the massive size of the rooms! A full kitchen, including fridge, stove, microwave and dishwasher, ample space to accommodate lots of luggage, and all of the fabulous NYC shopping, a seating area, in addition to spacious & welcoming beds...I would never consider staying at another hotel in the city again...Homewood Suites By Hilton carries the standard that the Hilton name represents, as well as the superior customer service one expects from the Hilton name. The additional perks are also not typical of other hotels in the city...Monday through Thursday there is a complimentary dinner offered in their main floor facility, and complimentary wine is included. How fantastic and unexpected from a NYC hotel! The location is on a quieter corner of the excitement and 24 hour madness of Times Square...but in your room, it is just peace and quiet...all the right ingredients for a perfect night's sleep. Easy to walk to all the main tourist attractions including Macy's, Madison Square Gardens and the Empire State Building, to name a few. All staff members were amenable, professional, courteous, and available to help with anything...they understand that the human touch they offer is a key part of excellence in customer service. All in all, I have absolutely no issues or concerns with this hotel, and I recommend it highly! I'll be back, myself! And will look forward to another great experience at the Homewood Suites by Hilton! Bravo! Job well done!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our room on the 10th floor was quiet, spacious. With the mini kitchen it was everything we could wish for on a short stay. The happy hour was very well done and the meal they provided was fine. But the breakfast was terrific with eggs sausage rolls cereal etc. Great way to start a day touring NYC. Also the front desk staff was helpful in their recommendations regarding restaurants and sights. I would like to especially recognize Daniel on the front desk. We departed for a cruise during a huge rain storm and he was able to get us a limo to the terminal when no cabs were possible.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This section of 37th ST does not look impressive and there is construction across the street from the hotel that adds to the congestion. That's it. Everything else was positive! From the Front desk to the personnel attending the dining area and the housekeeping crew, ALL were personable and attentive. The hotel is either brand new or recently overhauled and it is kept clean. Our room should be in some architectural or design magazine. How they got a king size be bed, pull out couch, closet, sink, stove, microwave, tiny table that unfolds to a small dining table, desk, etc into a very small room without seeming crowded, I don't know - but they did it and made it look good!The street may not look great, but the location is fantastic. We walked to everything we did in Time Square/Theatre district and were 2 blocks away from Penn Station. All this, with better rates (notice I didn't say cheap, nothing is cheap in Manhattan) than others around it.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has a great location. Not quite in the crazy Times Square but within walking distance of everything you want to see. The hotel is very updated and clean. The breakfast and cocktail hour are a nice addition. The rooms are NYC small but has the space you need. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at this hotel mainly for the price and accommodations for five people. My only hesitation was the area because of some reviews here on TripAdvisor. Fortunately, we found the location to be fine. We were there over the weekend and there were large crowds throughout the night. We never felt unsafe walking back from the broadway musicals. In addition to the great price and location, the room was large and well appointed, the breakfast was good (scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, potatoes, cereals, oatmeal and pastries) and the service was great. Omar the bellman helped us secure a private car to JFK. I read earlier about complaints about the private car price. However, Omar went over the price $85 which included tolls. We would just have to tip. This was cheaper than two taxis. This is our hotel of choice in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: A fairly new hotel in NYC so it is very clean with all new rooms, beds, etc. Smallest Homewood suite room I have ever seen but normal for NYC. Room comes with free breakfast and dinner which is a big plus in NYC. Staff was friendly, elevators a bit slow and overcrowded, especially in the AM.
user_name:
FrequentTraveler501
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is not in the middle of Times Square but only a short walk. The rooms were so clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. And the location is handy for eating in the Hells Kitchen area. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Impressively service oriented staff, well laid-out/apportioned room (although a bit smaller than what I'm used to - still had everything I needed!), delicious breakfast (yes, that was a real NY bagel!). Walking distance to everything I needed. Overall - great place to stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel during the first week of October and I must say I was more than satisfied with my stay!! The rooms were immaculate, the staff was awesome, and the location was just blocks from everything. Thank you to Daniel for allowing me to check-in early and for his wonderful and friendly disposition during my entire trip. Kudos to your team!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: As seasoned travelers with high expectations, it's not easy to impress us, but the Homewood Suites on 37th Street in Manhattan did exactly that! First, the hotel itself is only about six months old, so not only is everything pristine, the accommodations and furnishings are current and trendy. The king size bed was comfortable with high thread-count sheets. The small sofa actually does pull out into a twin bed that isn't bad. A full walk-in shower with glass doors, stylish tile and glass tile inlay was so much better than the usual tub/shower combo. Having a full kitchen with refrigerator and dishwasher was great for bringing home leftovers and keeping treats from nearby delis. Although, food was certainly never an issue as they fed us well. The hot breakfast every day was available from 6 am until 10:30 am, which is so convenient regardless of what time you need to be up for the day. Breakfast was so-so, about average for hotels, and always included eggs, varying types of potatoes and breakfast meat. There were also plenty of breads, cereals and juices. The manager's reception Monday - Thursday was from 5 pm - 7 pm and not only included unlimited beer and wine, but also a full dinner. I was skeptical when I read other reviews, but our first night we arrived to parmesan-encrusted tilapia, red potatoes and fresh, french green beans. It wasn't exquisite, but it was tasty and better than some restaurants. The dining area is adequate and there is a large, nicely enclosed atrium off the dining area and lobby if the weather is pleasant.There is no swimming pool, but there is a nice fitness facility and laundry room in the basement. There is also a safe in the room. They made the most of the small room with enough drawer, storage and closet space. A small rolling table that unfolds to a larger table along with the rolling table that pulls out from under the desk were genius use of space. A full-sized iron and ironing board as well as a hair dryer are in the rooms. There are three elevators and sometimes there was a wait, especially towards the end of breakfast. The staff members were always pleasant and helpful. The only hiccup was when we found the housekeeper had unplugged my phone from my charger and plugged in her own. She accidentally left it plugged in when she finished cleaning the room, so we found it upon our return. We tracked her down to return the phone and she was terribly embarrassed. The convenient location was superb! Although technically in the Garment District, we were five short blocks to Penn Station, a couple of blocks from Times Square, and just a few minutes walk to the Theatre district. Central Park is a bit of a hike, but we walked it when the weather was nice. We walked to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, Carnegie Hall, Madison Avenue and MoMA. 37th street is a main thoroughfare from Brooklyn all the way across Manhattan to the Holland Tunnel, so we were able to catch cabs easily when needed - either on 37th itself or the half block away on 8th. Our taxi from LaGuardia to the hotel was $40 but we ordered an uber to return to LaGuardia, which was $55, so it would be there when we were ready and we wouldn't have to catch a cab with luggage.We're so glad we found the perfect place for our family of three to spend a week in Manhattan!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We arrived at the hotel and it was very easy to get our room. Rooms are traditionally smaller in New York but I was impressed with what they did. Very modern and had a kitchenette. It felt like home. Breakfast was the least favorite thing though. Eggs and food were sub-par at best and very crowded. It was hard to even get a bagel. Room service was good. One thing was that the sheets they replaced had a fishy odor but it dissipated after a day or two.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed 7 nights and had originally booked 5 nights in a Studio Suite followed by 2 nights in a Studio room (due to the Suite only being available for the 5 nights only). The first night we stayed neither of us could get any sleep at all due to the demolition work happening across the street throughout the entire night. Our Suite (along with all suites in the hotel) was located on the 2nd Floor and was facing the street. Even with the double-glazing and earplugs, we could not sleep as the demolition involved jack-hammering and the contractors throwing huge chunks of concrete from upper floors to the enormous metal skip bin on the street.Next morning when we requested to be moved to a quitter room in the hotel, the reception staff advised that we should have been aware that all building work should stop by 11pm. Being from Australia, we are not familiar with NYC building regulations.We were moved to the 21st floor and although a smaller Studio Room, it was much quieter and we enjoyed the rest of our stay. The beds were very comfortable, as were the pillows.The breakfast buffet was included and we did eat there a few mornings. It was best to go early, as it was chaotic and crowded after 8.30am -10am. Unfortunately, not much in the way of fresh fruit on offer. Mainly bagels, toast, scrambled egg, bacon and yogurt. There were bananas and apples most mornings. The fruit juice was really good. Coffee was available all day - filter variety in two strengths "robust" and "regular", or else decaf. Limited teas on offer.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughter and I had a Saturday overnight trip, and were so glad to find a NEW property (3 months old) right around the corner from where we needed to be. Great modern rooms (laminate floors instead of carpet, which was cool), personable staff, perfect location, and a large lobby area (great if you have a lot of time to kill like I did). We arrived early on Saturday and they were able to get us into our room well before typical check-in (I know that is an exception that you can't count on, of course, but they REALLY helped us out). From the time I met Omar as soon as I walked in, to Nafeesa getting us into our room, to Diogenes helping with a few things, to a nice conversation with Leslie as I was wasting several hours in the lobby (my daughter was busy around the corner all day), the entire staff was friendly and helpful. I can't stress enough how pleased we were to find this property. We will definitely stay there again, and we've already recommended it to others that ever have a need to be at Pearl Studios on 8th Avenue! By the way, if you're coming from LGA through the Queens Midtown tunnel, it's a straight shot across 37th to the hotel!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood Suites was a great find close to the centre of Manhattan. Walking distance to Broadway and very well located. The staff are amazing - the Manager Mia, went out of her way to manage our stay including storing luggage while away for a few days. The provision of Breakfast and a light meal at dinner time was great. The rooms are pleasant and new. We would stay again. Very affordable

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very nice hotel! The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Very clean and the beds are quite comfortable. Nice breakfast served daily and free Wi-Fi is a bonus. Would highly recommend. Great location only minutes walk to Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: we had a very good time in this good hotelwe had a good room ....the hotel has a nice brakefast and it's free(!!!smiling and helping staff (thank you nafeesa ...and a good location close to times square

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good to have all the facilities in the room. I would try to improve in those two areas: - breakfast quantity is aplenty but quality is just average. - fridge in room is noisy considered is just next to your bed.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel itself is nice and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Check in and check out were a breeze. However, your first impression is that this is not in the best area. Lots of demolition, vacant shops, shady characters, and a constant traffic jam on 37th street. The parking lot is across the street. They won't let you in unless it is check in time. You have to valet your car and they block you in, so don't forget anything in your car or expect to get out of there quickly. It was raining when we arrived and we, along with our belongings, got pretty wet.The room was nice. It has a refrigerator, freezer, microwave, dishwasher and cook top. Bathroom was nice and decor was modern. If you use the pull out bed, there ends up being a little too much furniture in the room. The pull out wasn't clean. It had some crumbs, a pen, and some other random goobers in there. Overall, the location wasn't ideal. It's not really convenient to anywhere. Its a 20+ minute walk to anything other than souvenir shops and convenience stores. I got familiar with the car services in the city. If you stay here, I recommend you do the same

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at the Homewood Suites in September 2014 for 3 nights, and I must say from the moment we arrived to our time of departure we experienced a first class service, especially Nafreasa at the front desk. . Check-in was fast and room was excellently set to high standard. The facilities were perfect for a New York trip, small kitchenette if you wanted to cook. Breakfast consisted of hot food, fresh fruit / juices, etc.... and there was plenty, and queues were quite small too. On the 22nd floor there is a roof top terrace from which the views are very good, especially at sunset. We have been to New York many times and have stayed at different hotels but this hotel is by far the best we have stayed in. I can honestly say that this hotel is worth a visit, The location is perfect, close to the Port Authority Bus station and Times Square. Two blocks away on 39th Street is the bar Tir Na Nog, which serve really good food. Finally I would like to say that it really is the hotel staff (from Management to Housekeeping) that make you feel at home, every member of staff that we met were incredibly friendly and helpful..... we will certainly be returning to Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We're currently staying at this hotel and have been since last Wednesday (October 8th). We got a great price brought British Airways by booking before the hotel opened, so I wasn't sure what my expectations were.We arrived two hours before check in and our room was thankfully ready.First a couple of negatives, although these are far outweighed by positives -- breakfast. It's a free breakfast, so don't expect much. I guess it's ok for a free breakfast, but the eggs were blatantly made of powder and the food seems to sit out for a while. Bagels were good as were cereals.- the lifts. Small gripe, but they are a little frustrating. The hotel is over twenty floors. We were on the eighth floor and often had to wait a little for an elevator as they were busy. Just a small gripe.- the balcony. Lovely to sit on, but mostly dirt and weeds. Expected maybe some grass or something? Maybe this will come with time.The positivesLocation - because this is what NYC is all about! The location of the hotel is aaaaawesome. Couple of blocks from Times Square, couple of blocks in the other direction to Macys and Penn Station. Great location. We walked most places. 24/7 Dunkin Donuts on the corner and a 7/11 just around the block.Staff - very friendly and helpful. Always welcomed us into the hotel every time we came back. Recommended great pizza delivery.Rooms - comfortable, clean,meagre and bright. Lovely rooms. We were three adults and there was loads of room for us and all of our things. Housekeeping always thorough and supplies replaced consistently.Free coffee - FREE COFFEE! Who doesn't love free coffee?Free wifi - fast and reliable throughout the hotelSoundproofing - New York City is LOUD. But you would never know from your room with the windows closed. The soundproofing is fantastic. As is the air con...All in all a great stay. Would stay again and Willis recommend to friends.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Located on W37th street between 8th and 9th Avenues, this new hotel is very good.We stayed for 5 nts on the 19th floor, no view but who cares, and it was very quiet. Nice sized room with a big bed, small kitchenette with a full sized frig which would be perfect for a long stay.Breakfast was simple, a few hot items, cereals, pastries, toast etc. served in a smallish area that was cramped on the weekend but fine during the week.The location is the big winner being only 10 mins walk to Times Square.Staff were very friendly and helpful. For a good Italian restaurant head towards 9th and go right at lights. It's called Tavola.For thai, go left at those lights and look for Thai Select.If I needed a hotel in this part of NYC again, this would be my choice.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My experience at this hotel was great. The staff (specifically Daniel at the front desk) were great. The parking is down the street about 200 ft on the other side of the street. Its called the Green Emerald and could be marked a little better. Time Square is out the door of the hotel take a right then a left at the corner (8th Ave) not far at all. No problem during the day but a little different at night. The room was very clean and considering the volume of guests the elevators were fast. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Room and experience was good but a little pricing but not as bad as others in this area. Morning breakfast was good. Price was high but low for this area of NYC. Location was good but would have liked closer to theater district. We had a cousin who lives in the city as a guide so trip was enjoyable with her showing us the ins and outs of the area!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 5 of us stayed in this hotel for 5 days in August. Our room was comfortable, bright and specious enough for us all. It was also directly in front of the lift which I thought would be noisy but we heard no noise. The staff at this hotel are fantastic, warm and welcoming especially Daniel. Complimentary breakfast was lovely with a choice of hot and cold foods with something different each morning. We only had evening meal once during our stay which was nice enough but wasn't much choice for my fussy 5 year old. Complimentary beverages were also available in the lobby. Lifts were on the slow side often but we were aware of this before staying but it wasn't too bad: I was in a wonderful hotel in NYC so not complaining! The roof top terrace was also a delight on a warm evening. The complimentary business centre was perfect for checking in online for our flights home the following day.
