The hotel is situated in a great location with plenty of shops and places to eat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with all it has to offer at a reasonable price. I hope to returnto this hotel one day. Thank you Homewood Suites for an amazing stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved every moment! The beds are so comfortable, like sleeping on a cloud. The staff is super nice, homey and incredibly welcoming. You can get free coffee 24 hours, and the food is really nice (both breakfast and dinner). We will come back for sure!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We had an amazing stay! The staff was more than accommodating, allowed us to check in early and gave us helpful tips for our trip. It's centrally located to the convention center, time square and has easy access to the Lincoln tunnel. They provide breakfast, dinner and cocktails and have a convenient garage for parking which is also affordable. The rooms are huge and they also have two beautiful outside areas. We cannot thank Aaron, one of the managers, enough for all his hospitality, attention to detail and great personality!! We highly recommend this hotel to all and will be back again and again! Thanks so much for the wonderful experience!! Jenny & Christina

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband, our dog, and myself stayed here while our building had some emergency plumbing going on. We booked this hotel at 9pm on a Friday night and checked in at 1030pm. They also gave us a late check out wich was helpfull. We were exhausted from the week and from dealing with our buildings issues so this place was such a silver lining in our week! They accept dogs wich was a must for us. They had free breakfast wich was really good and had plenty of variety. The room was large, comfortable, quite and clean. Defiantly big enough for a small family to have space in. We also had a little stovetop, dishwasher, big fridge, and microwave, plus all pots pans utensils plates glasses etc . We were only staying one night so we didn't get to enjoy our mini kitchen but it would definitely come in handy when staying anywhere for more then one or two days. If you are visiting from out of town this hotel is really centrally located to everything. Our highlights: free GOOD breakfast, a ceiling fan in our room, dog friendly, and enough room for all 3 of us. We will definitely stay at a Homewood when traveling elsewhere (or when our apartment is under construction). I would also recommend it to my family and friends to stay here when visiting. I just wish I knew about this place last year when my family was in town for our wedding!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have stayed in many Homewood Suites across the US. Most were quite good, but this one was disappointing. I stayed here for 9 nights in September, but cannot say that I enjoyed it. It was barely functional, not worth the high cost ($550 a night). First the good points: It is located within a few blocks from Times Square, Madison Square Gardens, the Garment District and Macy's. But it is not convenient if you have business meeting in midtown on the East Side. It is newly constructed, although I cannot vouch for the construction quality.And then there are quite a few negatives: 1. It is located on a busy side street with a lot of construction, making the street noisy and dangerous at times. The noise in the backyard of the hotel, where they have placed a couple of nice tables, was deafening.2. The hotel is a new construction, but does not seem to be of the best quality. The walls, doors and windows are not soundproof: You could hear babies crying and couples arguing in neighboring rooms.3. Rooms are quite small, judging by the 1-Bedroom suite I stayed in.4. The only restaurant is claustrophobic -- way too small for a 22-story building.5. Breakfast was OK - what you would expect from a budget hotel.6. There is no view of any kind. The hotel is in the middle of Manhattan with nothing to look at from any direction.However, the worst part is the service. Housekeeping is kept to a minimum and front desk service is certainly sub-standard. Take this example: As a regular Hilton customer, I always ask for a high floor to avoid noise, especially in big cities like New York. To be sure, I asked for a high floor when I booked the room directly on Hilton's website, weeks before the start of my stay, then followed up with an email a few days later. When I checked in, I was surprised to find out that they my room was on the 2nd floor, with no possibility of moving to a higher a floor any time during my 9-night stay. Forget about upgrades that Hilton Honors customers are entitled to. Simple decency would have required the hotel to contact me in advance to tell me that they could not provide a room on a high floor, so I could find accommodation elsewhere. This was the first time, perhaps, were Hilton has failed me on this simple request.I could go on, but this is probably enough. I hope that you have a better experience if you stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Got a great last minute rate and was expecting budget basics for the $$ but arrived to newly built hotel (is this the right place?!?) with friendly check in staff advising we had free cooked breakfast and afternoon snacks with beer and wine! Room was great size with kitchette and everything was brand new. Bed was King & super comfortable and no outside noise at all. Free breakfast and afternoon snacks (beer and wine inc) were just ok but dont expect much and you'll be happy enough, or just walk outside and there's all the food and drink you need.Easy walk to times square plus hells kitchen restaurants and bars, and also quick walk to 34th or 42nd street subway stations.Coin laundry onsite too.Would highly recommend this hotel!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is excellent and I highly recommend it for any occasions business or family. The rooms are extremely clean, food is great ,staff is very accommodating, Ms. Vasquez who manages guess services is an exceptional hostess. The location is only a few blocks from all the action and fun in time square. The cost is very reasonable compared to other hotels.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We arrived at our hotel for a weeks visit and our entire experience was excellent. The rooms were clean, modern and equipped with a kitchenette. Every staff member we had contact with during our stay was very welcoming and helpful. Many attractions, broadway plays and shopping were just a short walk away. Overall an excellent hotel choice!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Greeted every time by a super friendly staff. Daniel was very helpful with recommendations and reservations. Room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Hotel is within close proximity to Times Square but just far enough away to avoid the noise. Quick walk from Penn station.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is centrally located to almost everything.. It has been very well maintained and is super clean. We loved that there is absolutely no carpet, at all!!! The beds were comfortable and the linens were nice!! Best of all, was the staff. They were wonderfully helpful....Specifically, Leslie absolutely saved the day!!! After a very long day of walking, and two tired girls, she volunteered to pick up our pizza and bring it to our room!!!!!! Really????!!!!!!! That was the most amazing treat ever!!!! Our only disappointment was the breakfast...It was very very crowded....Pancakes were a little cold and the selection was very picked over midway through breakfast time....We felt forced to eat out....I would highly recommend the hotel to families or business travelers...

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The price was right, but the location was very shady. The associate at the check-in desk came off as unfriendly and a little bit annoyed. He also would not apply my stay to my Hilton rewards card. The room, bathroom, TV, and general accomodations were great with the exception of the air-conditioning. The room was constantly too warm despite turning down the thermostat. Complimentary breakfast was good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is within walking distance to times square, the theater district and Madison square garden, near the subway and many restaurants. Overall very clean rooms, very comfortable beds, very quiet with the exception of the fridge in our room.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Upon our arrival we were welcomed by the smiling faces of Daniel and Allen, who immediately made us feel at home. They gave us all the information we needed being our first time in New York. Staff and service were excellent. Rooms were great . Location so close to time square and everything we needed. We were on holiday for my sister 50th birthday and Daniel went out of his way to make her feel special. Thank you so much for making our a wonderful experience. We would highly recommend the Homewood suites Manhatten to anyone travelling to New York.
user_name:
Michelle K
Mandurah, Western Australia, Australia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were very pleased with our choice of hotel. It is well located to shopping, theatre, Times Square and center of city. The staff was very helpful and friendly and eager to please. The breakfast was very good serving hot and cold items with variety of choice. The evening meal on Mon. through Thurs. was good and the wine and beer option was a very pleasant feature. The only change I would make is to upgrade the pull out or an option to split the king bed into two bed, cruise ship style. This would make it easier for friends to share a get away.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: What a great hotel. Hotel is new, very modern and sleek. My train arrived early, I called the Front Desk to see if I could get early check in. They said they would try! Lo and Behold, when i walked in the Hotel, my room was ready. I would defintely stay at this hotel again. The Hotel is close in to Times Square.... I would say it took me like ~5 min to get to 42nd street. The rooms were a great size considering this is NYC. One thing I realllly liked in the room is that there are no rugs! Less allergens in the room. The Hotel was defintely quiet. I did pay over $300 (with taxes) for the eff room. With that said, there was the UN General Assmebly Meeting and a Peace/ Planet March going in Central Park. I did get free wi fi in the Hotel. Reception was great and fast.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I travel to NYC almost monthly for work and I like to stay close to my office when I can. I am a HH member so I like staying within the hilton family of hotels for consistency and points. I have stayed at other Hilton properties in Manhatten some great some sucky. This is my new favorite. It's brand new so that's always nice but what really drew me to this hotel is the kitchenette in each room. I like to make food and not be forced to eat at restaurants daily. There is a grocery store on 42nd and 9th that I load up with groceries and have food and drink for the time I am in town. Kitchenette has stove,fridge, microwave and all the utensils you need. In addition they serve free breakfast every morning, most is pretty good. They also offer free dinner mon-thurs. It's not gourmet but something mom would make for you. Lastly, they offer free beer and wine during dinner 5-7. It's just nice to come back from the day and enjoy a drink on the roof deck or in back patio. Bed is very comfortable and room well laid out. If there is anything that may seem annoying is the front desk staff like to welcome you home everytime you walk through the doors. After a day or two it starts to feel like I am walking into a sushi restaurant......lol. "rasshai"

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Such a nice, quiet hotel, right in the heart of NYC. Sound-proof windows made sleeping so comfortable and easy. Love the built-in kitchen in the room, so convenient to have a fridge, stove, dishwasher...felt extremely homely and it was super-clean and modern. Lovely hotel, definitely give it a 5-star rating!! :)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, the HW NYC is in the heart of the happenings. My family enjoyed the friendly, helpful staff. The suite was spacious, everything we needed was right where we expected it to be. No surprises. The service exceeded our expectations. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is located near Times Square and very close to two major stations, Port Authority bus terminal and Penn Station.Very modern and clean, nice waiting areas. The staff was very helpful and always smiling, such kind people made us feel so welcome! The room was large with a king bed, sofa, very ergonomic furniture, clean, nice and modern design. Bed was comfortable for the three of us to sleep (our 5 year old son shared bed with us) the kitchen has everything you might need (we only used the refrigerator). Their free breakfast is selection of fruit, yogurt, eggs, bagels muffins, cereal etc. they offer complimentary coffee and tea or hot chocolate all day, their coffee is so good especially if you add the hazelnut flavored milk. Four days a week (Monday to Friday) they also provide complimentary lunch with wine and beer from 5-7.The area outside the hotel feels safe, there is an other hotel across the street and there is a 7-11 around the corner on 8th avenue.Over all, I must say it was higher than my expectations and I would like to thank the stuff for doing such a great job assisting us on everything. If I visit New York again and I want to stay in midtown Manhattan I will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wonderful experience! My daughter and I were plesntly surprised when we arrived on Thursday evening to find a free dinner prepared and waiting for us to enjoy. I have stayed in New York on several occasions at 4 star hotels but Homewood Suites proved to be just as good ifnot better. The location is excellent, we never had to take a taxi as everything is in walking distance. The full breakfast is an extra bonus, plenty of vaiety, enough food and good coffee; althogh the area for serving is very tight and congested, when you consider the full complimentary breakfst, the congestion is a non-issue. The staff was very, very accommodating, friendly and aimed to please. The hotel room was large for New York and the amenities and full kitchen were a pleasant surprise. The only drawback was the noise factor; the walls are very thin and unfortunately we could clearly hear the sounds of other guests, to include the popping of popcorn in one of the suites; and a screaming baby. The hotel is new, we hope the standard does not degrade as it age. We have already recommended it to friends.Other than that, our stay was fabulous and we plan a second visit.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Clean, comfortable, polite staff; immaculate upkeep of new BIG rooms, furniture, rugs, and equipment, etc. And, it's completely affordable, with a very advantageous location near Penn Station. The included hot breakfast - very well done. The clean-up crew is almost too efficient, if you turn your back for a minute on your food or coffee. There are no complaints to be had at this welcoming property new to its area. Will stay again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Walking distance to many city attractions. Easy access to transportation hubs. Next to Time Square and the Theater District, Central Park. For all the Seinfeld fans, Sup Nazi just blocks away. Convenient location.
user_name:
Martin M
Westford, MA, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The one full day we had for sightseeing was wet and dreary, luckily we had bought ponchos, because the rain wasn't going to stop our first NYC trip as a family. This hotel was an excellent choice for us, not even the price of our suite was an issue since other hotels were more pricey. The staff was very friendly, the bed was so comfortable. The convenience of location was a plus since we were in the middle of everything, Port authority, Penn Sta., Times Square, Subway, all the major attractions easily accessible. At the corner was a convenience store, eateries and bars and souvenir shops. The free meals (Mon-Thurs) was an added bonus because we must have saved a fortune not having to eat all our meals in the city. Even more so of a bonus was the free wine and beer during dinner!! This was my first time staying with Homewood Suites and it will not be the last because I enjoyed every minute of my stay RAIN OR SHINE!! It was the best decision I made when choosing this hotel out of so many to choose from.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent hotel with very helpful friendly staff. Very clean room and exceptionally larger than normal for a NYC hotel. Breakfast was a bonus and again the staff was super polite. The desk clerk was very prompt to great us and made a last minute change to my reservation. The hotel was very clean and really liked the amenities offered. Very nice size room for NYC. Loved the location for close proximity to Penn Station and look forward to future stays.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I had a very welcoming stay at the Homewood Suites for a recent business trip. The rate was reasonable for the quality of the hotel. My room was surprisingly nice, both the bedroom and bathroom. It was nice to have a mini kitchen (even if I didn't use it) and free wifi. I felt that the bed was very comfortable and room was a nice size for NYC. The decor was better than I would have envisioned for a Homewood property.I enjoyed having free breakfast, dinner and happy hour drinks. The fitness room had modern well-kept cardio equipment, but I don't recall seeing free weights. Clearly, the location is central, being close to the subway and Penn Station. There is an abundance of restaurants, bars and shops nearby. I will definitely look into staying here again when in town.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Traveled to NYC for business by train. Hotel is 5 minute walk from Penn station. The Theatre district is maybe a 10 minute walk. Subway is right there too, may 5 minutes. The rooms are somewhat small, but that is expected in NYC. They have breakfast every morning and also offer dinner Monday - Thursday. Staff were welcoming.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is excellent. Very clean, quiet, and service outstanding. The whole staff are friendly and courteous. The manager is always present and walks around the hotel checking. The food quality and food service are fantastic and the atmosphere is great. The 24 hour complimentary coffee is also very convenient. Thank you for the great stay!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my first experience at the Homewood NYC. What a fantastic hotel, the staff was outstanding and very engaging. The hotel was new with all the bells and whistles. The fitness center was huge and the roof top view was amazing. The rooms were large with a kitchen and very comfortable.This will be my new headquarters, whenever I stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: All other "decent" hotels were sold out, but the Midtwon Homewood Suites had availability. Website looked decent, so I took a chance. I was quite impressed - very new, clean, modern, nice amenities, great fitness center, and friendly staff. Super fast internet connection increased my productivity. Exceeded my expectations (except for bed linens - a little scratchy in my opinion)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at Homewood Suites on 21-28 Aug 2014. We had the room with 2 queen beds and it suited us perfectly. We were thrilled that the room was spacious, clean and had amenities! Housekeeping cleaned daily. People at the front desk were friendly and efficient, esp Daniel who checked us in. Hotel was walking distance to Times Sq and other famous and useful areas like Macy's. Breakfast was kinda crowded so we just brought up the food to our rooms which suited us fine anyway. They sort of extended the breakfast area to the lobby -- just during breakfast hours to help divest the area of people. Food was regular. We were not able to avail of the free dinners as we always had somewhere to go at night. Wifi was not speedy but was good. Elevators behaved the entire time we were there.The only negative thing i have to say is that we could hear voices in the corridors ergo their walls must be thin! Other than that i would rate our experience as excellent.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: 3rd time to New York stopped in one of the best hotels on Manhatton on my last two visits but the Homewood smashed the other out the park .Amazing staff , Amazing accommodation Amazing location . Breakfast , dinner and drinks in with the price hard to find this in any city hotel anywhere in the world let alone Manhatton . Well done to all the team .only down side was having to leave. Defo see you all again. One peace of advice if you are thinking of booking do it fast as I can see this hotel being full nonths in advance soon (Ha Ha ).

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel hits the nail on the head! It is extremely comfortable and convenient. Location: Roughly 5-10 minutes walk from Time's Square in Midtown Manhattan. Loads of eating places around and hundreds of taxis passing through every minute. Room: A very clean, comfortable space with many conveniences. Though the room is somewhat petite, they managed to provide many useful features. The kitchenette offers two stovetop burners, a large microwave, full sized fridge, plates, bowls, drinking glasses, cutlery, toaster etc. I honestly can never understand how extended stay hotels with these features are cheaper than the more "high end" places which won't even provide a simple cutlery set. The only thing that was petite was the bathroom. It was however still comfortable; just no wasted space. Hotel Staff: The front desk staff members were very polite and helpful. As it was our first trip to New York, we were overwhelmed by the scale of things but the front desk patiently answered our questions thoroughly. They also offered useful advise with respect to tours and transport. Breakfast: The hotel provides a complimentary continental breakfast buffet. No complaints what-so-ever. It's a decent spread with a fair number of options. Summary: This hotel has no fancy chandeliers or antique furniture or a breathtaking lobby. It does however have free high speed wifi, complimentary breakfast, and a room with an awesomely comfortable king sized bed and features you would find quite useful when travelling. Places in midtown Manhattan are bound to be expensive, so in relation to everything else I's say this is a steal. Highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel was absolutely AMAZING! It is not your typical Homewood Suites. The hotel featured state of the art amenities, great fitness equipment, and the roof top had a great view of the city. The staff was warm and welcoming. The hotel is also located a few blocks from Madison Square Garden and Time Square. I will definitely return!
user_name:
Leticia P
Washington, DC, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: With 5 hotels in 5 days, this was the bestest. So well designed and employees are superb, especially Daniel R. He's my Mr. Magic, after helping me with an early check-in (when I was beat.)Good vibes all around: Studio rooms with everything, including lots of plugs in the right spots ... and breakfast with good fresh fruit and energy. This is what a hotel should be! And, a best value on top of all. Neighborhood also worked for me.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I found myself staying here last minute when my flight was cancelled, but I'm glad I selected it as I'll definitely be back when I'm next in NYC.The rooms by NYC standards are huge and decorated to a good standard.If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in central manhatten then you could do worse than stay here. It's close to Times sq, but more importantly right near the subway and the meat packing district is just a short walk away. So all of NYC is within easy reach.I'll be back and would recommend to others

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just completed a trip around USA. This hotel was the best. So friendly. Great amenities such as free wifi, free all day coffee downstairs, free breakfast and dinner mon - Thursday! Great location! And everyday we returned from discovering the wonderful city of New York, we were greeted with a "welcome home!" The premises only opened 2 months ago, so very fresh and outstandingly comfortable. I can't recommend this place enough! Don't pay big $ to stay closer to Times Square, this is the best and close to heaps - location 37th and 8th. We will return!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband I stayed for three days, Sept. 2nd-5th. I really wanted to stay in Manhattan, but most of the private rooms were so expensive; I found a room down in the financial district under $200, and that's about it. This room was listed for $289 online, but I bid through Priceline and got it for $140/night. It was a great deal at that price, because it was a decent-sized room with a very comfortable king-sized bed. We had a fridge and oven, too. We didn't use the oven, but the fridge was very convenient for water & other drinks so that we could take them with us daily. The free breakfast was also convenient, although the food was just "ok". Yes, the breakfast area was crowded, but not that bad. We didn't have any problems with elevators, as other reviewers mentioned. Free wifi and a business office.I was very impressed with how NICE the staff was. Very helpful with dinner suggestions, directions, and setting up a ride back to the airport. Everyone always greeted us warmly, and we were given a small bag of snacks at check-in. We were celebrating our anniversary, and they also left a bottle on wine in our room. Do yourself a favor, and use a private car to/from hotel. We used a taxi on the way there; $50 to hotel, it was hot, and he drove like a maniac! On the way back, we paid $55 for the private car, but it was cool, comfortable, and the driver very friendly & safe. (There IS no cheap way to get to hotel, unless you plan to ride the subway and walk several blocks with luggage!)The hotel is a couple of blocks to Times Square, and a couple of blocks in another direction to Penn Station. Keep in mind, though, that NYC blocks can be LONG. At the end of long days, I definitely wished it was right in Times Square. Also, many midtown areas that are NOT tourist areas are dirty & a bit seedy, and the area around the hotel is no exception. Overall, though, I was pleased with the hotel, especially for the price we paid.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Rooms were very nice, new, clean and most efficient - but be sure to ask for a room with a view if you want to check out the NYC skyline you have to ask for what you desire. But it was a most wonderful stay - staff was well informed and friendly. The Complimentary Breakfast was very, very good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Exceptional staff and hotel location. Will be back! In NYC for business and enjoyed the Staff and service provided was exceptional. Amenities and social evening event was unexpected pleasure. Close to Penn Station and activities.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel and location was great!!! Only 7 blocks away from times square, it's plenty to do in the area as far as the food I can't say enough it was a lot of places to eat at whether you want to eat from the street vendors or a restaurant. Devona the director of guest service and the rest of staff was so friendly and helpful. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Homewood is great ! Very well located with everything you need around, lots of restaurants. Rooms are very big, clean bigger than the studio I used to live in back at home. Fully equipped kitchen, very comfortable, not noisy at all. Great lobby and reception. Very good breakfast, dinner is so so but it's free. It worths going for the free drinks. This hotel is also very expensive, comfort comes with a price . BUT , the phone reception doesn't exist in the rooms. It was a pain for me 'cause I was waiting for a call twice a day so I had to spend half of my days in the lobby downstairs. It had everything except the only thing I needed. Is not their fault I guess. Enjoy! Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Three of us stayed here for a recent concert at Madison Square Garden and was pleasantly surprised at what a wonderful hotel Homewood Suites was. It was conveniently close to MSG and comes fully equipped with a refrigerator,cook top, microwave and dishes. Though I did not use any of those if my stay was longer I certainly would have. I will remember for my next trip to the city.It had a nice pull out love seat that was perfect for my 17 year old. Oh yeah, free breakfast! I would have liked to see some bacon but there was something for everyone. A simple free breakfast is what it is and it hit the spot.It also had the three things I ask for in a hotel. Clean room, comfortable bed and a nice hot shower.I had no need to call on the hotel staff so I can comment on them but check in and check out was painless. Oh I would like to say the doorman, if that is even his title, went all the way to the end of the block to hail us a cab Sunday morning so he ranks high on my list.So do a little shopping and prepare a simple meal in your room and save a couple bucks if your staying for any length of time. NYC isn't cheap.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This trip to NYC we chose to stay here. The hotel is newer and stills holds its newer quality throughout. We chose to stay in the largest suite, at 485 sq. ft. There are only 5 in the whole building and all of them are on the 2nd floor. The whole 1st floor are public areas. We were disappointed to find out that though you pay more for a larger suite, it is right above street level - very noisy. We are aware of noise in NYC, this is not are first trip to the area. We were not aware of the location of the suite. In my opinion, all the higher priced suites should have been put higher up. Because at almost all hotels in Manhattan, except those around Central Park,your room will face another building and that's to be expected.The suite itself was roomy, for New York standards. There is a shade that is used in front of the window and is raised or lowered using a chain. It did not work correctly all of the time, thus making you raise and lower it a few times to get it up. The water pressure was dismal in the shower. Being on the 2nd floor, you would expect better water pressure.Breakfast is always offered at Homewood Suites. This place offered a normal breakfast fare, without any waffles. If you arrive after 8:30 am, expect a large crowd and minimal seating availability.The staff were very helpful - that is probably the best part of the stay. Eager to be of assistance in all areas. The location offers an opportunity to walk in any direction to eat, drink or take in a sight. If you choose not to walk, taxi's are everywhere - it is NYC!This site has a work out room with modern equipment, an outside patio, a lounge area and a small seating area in the lobby by a fireplace. Overall we were happy with the location and staff but hold reserve for the upgraded suite location and usability. We give it this rating because the suite was lacking, which was not so good because its a newer establishment. We will try another hotel next time we come to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We're native NYers unfortunately no longer living in the city- we travel back home frequently and generally stay downtown where it's quieter. Chose Homewood Suites this time because of its proximity to Penn Station. It is very nice & new. However, even though the word 'suite' is in the title of the property- these are single rooms with all of the amenities of a suite literally squeezed into a relatively small space. There is no separation between the main bed and the kichenette area and the sofa bed is right next to the main bed on the other side- so really, no privacy for anyone. Some creative rearranging of furniture is necessary to pull out the sofa bed and if someone opens the fridge in the middle of the night- well, the entire room lights up. The bathroom is tight as well- and I agree with some of the previous posts that a few more shelves for storing personal items would be useful- especially considering these rooms are meant to accommodate 3 people. I found the breakfast to be unremarkable- typical mass produced runny eggs etc. I imagine this would be a fine option for couples or small families (one child). The full size fridge and cooktop, along with cabinets fully stocked w/plates, pots, utensils & glassware would definitely allow for saving $$ on meals during an extended stay. The front desk staff was very friendly and I imagine they are very helpful to tourists who need guidance. The property served it's purpose for us for one night, but we probably would not choose it again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We are frequent travelers into NYC and stay at a variety of hotels, usually high end to boutique. On a last minute trip, we booked a room at the Homewood Suites and were blown away. Before arriving, I was expecting a mid-level hotel, but we were so pleasantly surprised that this will become a top choice in the future.First, a huge thank you to Leslie at the front desk. She was amazing. At check in, she was so professional and warm. She genuinely wanted to make it a best stay possible and she succeeded. She found a wonderful room for us and when she heard that we were celebrating our anniversary, she sent up some yummy goodies - thank you. Then, when we asked for a late check-out, she went out of her way to make it happen. Her level of excellent service was 5 star and better than some of the way more expensive hotels that we visit.As for the hotel - it is very nice and new. The layout is modern and sleek. The bedding is very nice and the kitchenette is a wonderful feature (having a full refrigerator, microwave, extra sink and range makes a big difference for both business and family travel). The bathroom is also very good. Couple of suggestions here is that there could be extra shelf space for toiletries and the shower needs some type of slip proofing - when wet it is very slippery. But the decor and amenities are very nicely done and supplied. Added bonuses include free wi-fi, coffee/tea in lobby 24 hours and a very nice breakfast each morning. Not just the usual continental, but eggs, sausage, potatoes, oatmeal, fruit, etc. For NYC, it is not usual to have this type of buffet included in the price. And, we saw that every Mon-Thur, they offer free dinner and drinks. Again, incredible value for price paid.The location is very good for those who may be traveling in/out of Penn Station or visiting Madison Square Garden/shopping at Herald Square. It is also not a far walk for Times Square - another top tourist destination. In summary, this hotel is new and well done. Although not as expensive as a much higher rated property, it offers the service and amenities above and beyond its competitors. Definitely add it to your list of great NYC finds.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Brand new amazing hotel with fabulous staff and all of the amenities of home!! I won't stay anywhere else when I come to NYC. Times Square is right around the corner but the location is away from the crowded chaos. There is also a very nice grocery store 2 blocks away to stock up on food. You have everything you need in the room to cook. I've saved a ton of money by not eating out every night.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: AWESOME hotel. Having researched a lot of hotels we were overwhelmed and delighted with the value for money we had from staying here, the daily breakfast and evening meals Mon-Thurs a great bonus. The bed the most comfortable ever. All the staff absolutely fantastic, friendly and helpful. Location fantastic, short walk to most of the main sights. Great view of the Empire State from the rear of upstairs terrace. Kitchen an added bonus however we only really used it for hot drinks and keeping drinks cool in the fridge (by the way if you are noise sensitive/have tinnitus as I do I would recommend using ear plugs as it can be a little noisy when trying to sleep). Nice added touch of a free bottle of wine when Nameesa (hope I've spelt it correctly) discovered it was our wedding anniversary during our stay. Can't recommend this enough, cannot understand how anyone could complain about anything here. Congratulations to Hilton and their staff for such a brilliant hotel. Will come again one day for sure.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This new comer to NYC gets an immediate 10 rating. The room is spotless and everything as promised. The location is great if you more focused on work and convenience than "brand" Most important is the staff. Outstanding. They seem to have been hand picked to put the best foot forward Manhattan. And they exceed all expectations and go above and beyond.Particular shout out to Nafeesa, she helped me in too many ways to list. But it starts with the smile and knowledge. This is now my go to place when coming to NYC.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Steve S
New York, New York, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Can't say enough about this hotel. I researched every choice for what I wanted: kitchen, large, breakfast, close to times square, nice. This had it all. Staff was excellent. Not one bad attitude. Accommodated every request. Also, they have town car service that was great and inexpensive. Lincoln town car to LaGuardia for $47. light dinner snack was offered on Thursday. Website says Monday through Wednesday. Good free WiFi connection.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location between Penn Station and Port Authority Terminal, very well-equipped room with small kitchenette, small sofa and desk. After some of the tiny New York hotel rooms I have experienced, this was bliss! Hot breakfast and nice evening reception. Friendly staff. Good price for what was offered.  The location was good for getting about New York and for arriving/leaving. This time I used the Long Island Rail Road from Jamaica/JFK; it was a much cheaper option for a solo traveller than a cab and only a 20 min journey to/from Jamaica. Only a 3 block walk from Penn station to the hotel. The air-conditioned lobby was a lovely refuge on New York's hottest day of the year.Recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed over Labor Day weekend. From check-in to check-out we had a great stay. Monday through Thursday they offer complimentary dinner, beer, and wine. Breakfast is included 7 days a week. We stayed in a king room on the 11th floor. This room is extremely spacious for New York standards. The bathroom could use a little more shelving space for my liking and the shower design we battled water leaking out onto the floor but overall very nice. Being a Homewood, the room also had a kitchenette with a large refrigerator. There is also an in-room safe. My favorite May have been the wood laminate floors and ceiling fan. The location is prime Manhattan being able to walk or take a nearby subway to anywhere. We only experienced crowded and slow elevators during peak times. Otherwise is was no issue. Same with breakfast. Definitely worth the price we paid.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our visit it NYC was fantastic, from the minute we walked in the front door the kindness of your staff was impeccable ...sorry if I misspell their names, Jennifer, anneshia and zeena ..made sure that my husband would be comfortable at all times... Even late check out!! Close to Houndstooth Pub, High line, Times Square...Becco's... And always a cab nearby... The rooms are beautiful and spacious. Don't forget to check out the roof terrace... Great view!!! A must stay!!! One off my husbands bucket list;)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First of all, it was Labor Day weekend so it was pretty busy and the hotel was completely sold out. So you have to view everything through that lens.It took a little longer than expected to get through the check in line. When we did (at about 2:00 pm), the room wasn't ready. As a Hilton Honors member, they had allowed me to check in and pick a particular room. I said it wasn't necessary to get that particular room, but they didn't have any unoccupied rooms ready yet.So we went out for a walk. At 3:30 pm, the room still wasn't ready. So the girlfriend camped out at the front desk and the room was ready in 20 minutes.While the room appeared small, it was immaculate and more than big enough for the task. The bad was comfortable. The kitchenette seemed to have everything (although I only used the refrigerator to hold a doggie bag). If you were going to feed a full family, it would be a little cramped (although I don't have a full family, so what do I know). Anyway, I liked the room and it was quiet.The breakfast room was really crowded when we came down at 9:30 the next morning. There was not a seat to be had (once again, a function of the hotel running COMPLETELY full). So we opted to have breakfast elsewhere.The staff was very nice. The lobby was a little small (but once again, the hotel was completely full, so perhaps it only felt like it). I liked the trickle down fountain on the rock wall in the lobbyI would guess this is more of a family place because most other people had kids.It was very close to Herald Square near Macy's.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, spacious rooms, amazing gym, business center. Staff were friendly and always willing to help. Always said welcome home when you came back in and it felt like home! Slept so well, not noisy at all. Will be back because this place was real value for money. The kitchenette was always well maintained and the bathrooms are immaculate!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We loved our stay at the Homewood Suites near Times Square. The hotel was clean, quiet, and excellent value for money. All the staff that we encountered were very friendly and happy to help. We booked a 'King Efficiency with City View', I had assumed that 'efficiency' would mean small, but our room was spacious and very comfortable. We had all the amenities you'd expect plus a small kitchenette area that came in very handy and included a microwave, fridge freezer, toaster and dishwasher. Perfect for making those midnight snack bagels after a night out. The room price also included breakfast, which was the usual buffet style mixture of cooked breakfast, pastries, cereals, fruit and yogurt that you find in most hotels. Surprisingly the hotel also offers guests a free dinner Monday to Thursday (the menu is posted in the room) and free tea/coffee in the lobby whenever you want. Compared to other hotels we researched this one certainly gives you excellent value without compromising on quality.The location is excellent - right on the edge of the garment district, it's just a 5 min walk from Penn Station which is a main hub station for travel to NYC's airports. It's about a 10min walk from both Times Square, Macy's, and the Empire State Building (there are also subway stops at all of these points, so it's easy to hop onto the MTA to go further afield too). A personal highlight for me was that the hotel was only a 2min walk from Mood Fabrics, the fabric superstore that is featured in the TV show Project Runway. If you're a sewist then a trip to Mood is a must! We were on the 21st floor (of 22), so street noise was minimal. Really all we heard were the omnipresent sirens of emergency vehicles. We never heard our neighbours, so either the walls are pretty thick or we had quiet floor-mates. The only noise we experienced was from the fridge, and the air-con, both of which were pretty noisy and couldn't be switched off. That said, the noise didn't bother us enough to keep us awake (which might have had something to do with the endurance sightseeing we were doing every day).All in all I'd be happy to recommend the Homewood Suites to family and friends, and I'd certainly book there again if I'm every lucky enough to get to return to NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very close to times square, big, confortable, clean. Its expensive but its very good and the room and the bed is very good. Thats one of the top Hilton hotel. Very good to explore new york walking and relax after.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel is brand new and nothing short of excellent. The staff was wonderful! The hotel is clean, well appointed and tastefully decorated. You will rarely find a larger room in NY city. The lobby was spacious, the breakfast area had ample room with an overflow courtyard. The hotel also had a rooftop sitting area which was really cool. The business center was quite and well equipped. The exercise room was excellent and private. The rooms themselves were great - tile floors (I don't love carpet) large shower with excellent showerhead and water pressure(rare in NY), cooktops with microwave and full size fridge. They got it right on this one! Cudos to the staff and management for NOT making me feel like I was in a high stressed hotel atmosphere which is all too typical in NY!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This new hotel is in a great location very close to Times Square, Broadway, Macy's etc. Rooms are very clean and well appointed. Free breakfast, free wifi and free dinner and drinks Monday to Thursday are all added bonuses compared to other options in the area. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Have stayed at Homewood suites near Dallas and love the concept. When we first arrived 9 am, staff were very helpful storing our bags at no charge for the day, and when we checked in they offered to have the bags brought up to our room. This is a brand new hotel. There is always complimentary coffee in lobby with nice fireplace, TV, computer station. Loved the shower head with several settings. Bed was super comfortable. Enjoyed microwave popcorn in our room. Location was perfect, just blocks from Penn station for subway or Times Square, short walk to many theatres and shopping in fashion area including Macy's. Customer service was wonderful. We didn't stay for free dinner but did enjoy the hot breakfast both mornings. Would be my first choice for stay in New York mid town.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed here for 10 nights in mid August and it was wonderful.Our room was just perfect on the 21st floor - it was quite, clean, new and modern. It had everything you need - Fridge/Freezer, Microwave, plates, dishwasher, coffeemaker and all small details you need in a kitchen. ** Location is superb - just off the 8th Ave corner and 37th St. - so easy to get anywhere. Subway is about 4 mins away, Macy's within 8-10 walk, Times Square is about 10 mins too. ** Breakfast is served daily and just think of it as a bonus as I read so many comments about it - just think how much money you save each morning. it is true that it's crowded but it's worth the wait if you need to (we never had to wait to find a table and we had breakfast at 8am-9am.** Dinner is also served (Mon-Thu) which is another bonus. Menu can be found on the room fridge and we found it very helping to check what's on the menu everyday in case there is an option we don't like. ** There is a nice and modern Gym/Fitness center on the lower floor. on the same floor there is a business room equipped with 2 computers and a printer - so handy and used it a couple of times during the stay.Wi-fi is free and works really fast - which was a big plus to us.** Front desk reception - We received a nice and welcoming service by Nafeesa who helped us several times during our stay. ** Elevators - we had the same experience of long waiting as other guests had but have to say that this won't put us off staying here again in the future. Waiting is mostly in the mornings during breakfast time, later on in the day it's not as bad.I must say that I can't think of anything that was bad - as we enjoyed 100% of our stay.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for six nights in August and had a great time.This hotel is located midtown just five blocks from times square. Everything about the staff says professionalism, Nafeesa and Jennifer U at front desk are very knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel is very clean kudos to housekeeping rooms well maintained. Breakfast is complementary and satisfactory as is Dinner wine and beer on evenings only thing is seating is limited get there early or opt to take your meals to your room. Minor cons, slow elevator. Would definitely stay at this hotel when visiting New York again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just spend 9 nights at the hotel, and it was a very nice stay; very friendly and welcoming staff, clean and large rooms and of course a good location for Manhattan tourists planning to visit Broadway, Times Square, Empire State, touristbuses.... 4 blocks away from Penn Station as well.Good breakfast as well with bagels and some hot courses and a bit of fruit, yoghurt and cereals. However it was a bit crowded in the serving area during the morning hours.. We didn't try the dinnermeals during the afternoon, but that is a nice complimentary service.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed at this Hotel for 7 nights, staff friendly, great location as round the corner from the empire state building in the 'Garment district' of Manhattan. Great to have breakfast and evening meals during the week provided, meals were ok, complimentary beer and wine also was great. Room really clean and comfortable, fully equipped kitchenette the most comfortable hotel bed ever. Teenage kids also happy. Thanks

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My mom and I stayed here for the first time August 28-30. We usually stay at a comparable hotel a few blocks away and have been very happy there so we were wary of trying someplace new. The reason we chose this hotel over the other one was because the rates were better and it was brand new.The location of this hotel was perfect for us as we were going to be using Penn Station to get to and from JFK and the US Open and it was a short walk away. We also found a great little eatery that offered 2 slices of pizza and a soda for $2.75, and while there are many of those places in the city we liked this one because the pizza was perfect for me and my mom was able to get rice and beans so dinner came out to less than $8.00!We arrived at the hotel around 8:30am so it was too early to check into our rooms, but the nice lady at the desk offered to store our bags which we took advantage of. We returned to the hotel around 3:45pm and Thomas assisted us with getting our room. There was a slight mix up with our assigned room but Thomas took care of it quickly which we appreciated.We had a room with 2 queen beds and the size was great for us, especially compared to other rooms we've stayed at in NYC. We went to the complimentary dinner downstairs and I decided not to have anything; my mom did have some but she didn't really care for it. Breakfast the first morning wasn't great as my pancakes were a little cold and hard, but breakfast the second day was much better when I had the scrambled eggs and French toast. We went to breakfast early the first day since we were heading to a day session at the US Open so the seating area wasn't too crowded and we were able to get elevators relatively quickly. However, on the second morning (the day we checked out) we went to breakfast later and it was very hectic and we ended up taking the stairs to and from breakfast since the elevator still hadn't come after 10 minutes. The seating/elevator issues are a problem at the other hotel at which we stay so this problem definitely isn't exclusive to the Homewood Suites, but it's worth mentioning so people can be aware of it and perhaps time their breakfasts appropriately.Checkout was a breeze and again it was a short walk to Penn Station, and the walk is definitely manageable with luggage as we each had a carry-on suitcase.Instead of automatically booking our other hotel when we go to NYC, we are now going to check availability at the Homewood too. Be sure to check out the rooftop terrace on the 22nd floor. Thank you for a great stay!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have just returned home to the UK after a week long stay in NYC. I stayed with my two daughters (15 and 20), my eldest daughter slept on the futon bed and found it comfortable, and although the room wasn't huge (typically for NY) it was large enough to keep the sofa bed made up in the day, so we didn't have to put it away each morning.When I booked the hotel there were no reviews and I didn't realise that it hadn't opened at that point. Not sure I would have taken that gamble had I know that in advance, however all aspects of the room were perfect and a lot of the equipment had not been used (pots and pans etc)The bathroom was lovely and the shower was great. My daughters loved all the daily complimentary toiletries (Neutrogena) and I loved the big white fluffy towels.We had a king/queen sized bed (not sure which) it was so comfy!The girls loved the fact that it was free wifi so they could log on to all the usual social media sites as soon as we were back in the hotel!We were on the 12th floor and had a street view, in the mornings it was lovely and sunny. The room was very quiet with no noise from other rooms. In fact we were directly outside one of the lifts, but didn't experience any noise from it. I read other reviews whereby guests were unhappy about the wait time for the lift, but there were 3 lifts so we never had to wait very long at all.We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and found that if we went down to breakfast a bit before 9am it was generally less busy, however even we it was busy we still managed to select any of the plentiful options (hot choices/toast/bagels/cereal/fruit etc) There was one member of staff who couldn't do enough for us at breakfast (i'm sorry I cant remember his name) but he made us feel so welcome and made us smile every time he was working.There is a complimentary self service coffee bar open 24/7 and we liked having a hot chocolate to take up to our room when we got in late in the evening.We didn't eat dinner at the hotel (although this is included in the price of the stay), this was due to a busy schedule and we weren't usually at the hotel at that time.The front of house staff always greeted us with "welcome home" when we came back through the door which was a nice touch.On our checkout day we left our luggage for a few hours as we had an evening flight, again the front desk staff facilitated this for us. On our last visit to NYC we stayed in a more expensive, well known, traditional hotel which was nice enough but overpriced and a bit dated. When we return we will definitely stay at Homewood Suites again!Thank you to all the staff and we hope to see you all again very soon.room 1205 (20.08.14 - 27.08.14)

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for 9 nights in august ,birthday treat for our son.We booked this hotel last year through Expedia before it was open so got good price(£1000)also got cheap flights with Norwegian (£1000 all in return ).We found the hotel in a good area for us ,walking distance to everything we needed.Checking in very easy,but found it unusual not to been offered to have our luggage taken to room for us .Room was ok,we just had a view of the office building next door(room 1412) good fridge,just wonder how much of the kitchen is used ? free wifi throughout hotel .good complimentary breakfast ,also complimentary evening food offered Monday - Thursday .We had our breakfast early so no problems finding a table ,it is a small area with no proper flow ,people just take their plates and find a seat anywhere in reception area.Checking out needs to be improved for holiday guests,our flight was not until 11 pm so had most of the day to waste having to check out by midday,the problem we found was no room offered to get changed/showered. You can use their toilet in reception but only a sink ,also several other people leaving the hotel same time so we couldn't use it.Would we stay again? Yes,for us good location,quiet and with the added bonus of free wifi,breakfast and evening food.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: For the midtown location, this is an excellent hotel that is clean and has decent sized rooms, particularly compared to most other New York City hotel rooms that are usually the size of over-sized closets. The complimentary manager's reception with beer and wine is a nice features, but the quality of food varies each night. Complimentary breakfast is nothing special, but hey it's complimentary, and it's NYC, so nothing to complain about there. Nice sized fitness center for a homewood suites, courteous staff. Clean rooms, and nice hotel appearance. Minor cons: slow elevators, blahhhh coffee. Good stay for a business trip.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Nicely done up public areas and rooms. Satisfactory breakfast . Dinner, wine and beer on the house on weekdays. Helpful and friendly staff. Super location. Only the sofa bed was not comfortable at all in an otherwise perfect stay- it should be replaced!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for four nights at this hotel with a 15 year old granddaughter. She slept in the sofa bed and found it comfortable. Our room was nicely furnished with a full sized refrigerator, stove, microwave and utensils. The décor is contemporary and very stylish.We enjoyed the rooftop "garden" area. The location is great. We walked to Times Square several times. We arrived on Amtrak, and the hotel is only 3 blocks from Penn Station.Some reviewers complained about the elevators. We only had to wait around 9:00 a.m. when people were heading to the included breakfast or checking out. Otherwise, they handled the crowds efficiently. You should be aware that the "suite" is just one room. There is no separation between the kitchen area and the bedroom. Anyone expecting two rooms is going to be disappointed in that.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Booked 2 rooms for 7 nights each for our family of 4. Hotel has been open since 30 June 2014, so obviously in excellent condition. However the cleanliness is not up to the mark. When we checked in one of the rooms was not clean and had dead ants and other insects. Bought this to the attention of front desk and they changed the room immediately. However we now had the rooms on separate floors, although we had specifically requested adjoining rooms because of our teenage children. Another round of discussion with the front desk and they finally managed to get us 2 rooms on the same floor. They also deducted one nights charge for one room. Again after 2 days there was lint and dust all over the floor, which was from housekeeping not doing their job correctly. When highlighted to the GM, he was very apologetic and had it corrected by the time we came back in the evening alongwith complimentary cookies and bathroom accessories. The elevators are messed up and we ended up taking the stairs down most mornings. Apparently its some sort of new technology in which the elevator decides when to skip floors when its full.Breakfast was included in our rate however most days when we came down, it was a madhouse and we ended up getting breakfast outside.They had a group of 50+ teenagers on a school trip and on one evening the lobby was more like a school playground.The walls of the rooms were so thin that you can hear pretty much everything your neighbour says and you can hear him/her opening the curtains.On the positive side, excellent location. Walking distance to Times Square, Penn Station etc. Excellent kitchenette, with dishwasher in the room. Fridge was a bit noisy though.Good quality (Neutrogena) toiletries.On checkout as we had 5 bags we asked for a suv yellow cab to go to JFK as we knew it has fixed price of USD 52 + tolls of USD 12 = 64. However reception got us a private limo and said it would cost us the same. When we reached JFK the driver said the price was USD 85 because its a private limo. The front office staff need to get their act together on this and explain the higher charge in advance.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The 'Greens' had a fantastic time & this Hotel & will be recommending it to all our friends ... From the doorman to the front desk staff house keeping I can't thank the staff enough for making our New York experience wonderful ........it was so nice to come 'home ' from a days sight seeing to be welcomed with a glass of wine .......dinner ......it was just delightful well done everyone at Homewood Suites -by Hilton Midtown ....... you all get 10 out of 10 ..... Also a any Aussie's thinking of staying here don't forget to Tip I know we don't do it back home but when you get great service as we did it's worth it .Once again THANK-YOU

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for 9 days and found the hotel very suitable for our needs. It was well located and big enough for my wife and I. The rooms are very comfortable and come with a kitchen. The complimentary breakfast and dinner is a real plus. The staff are really helpful and arranged a limo for us to the airport. When we ready to check out our bags were placed in the limo while we enjoyed breakfast. The hotel surpassed our expectations for the price we paid. This is definitely a hotel I will highly recommend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is a bran new hotel, and I have to say it is excellent.The rooms are small, but still a very good size. It was my teenager kids and my self and it was enough. The bed was very confortable and had plenty of space to put all your things away, the bathroom is also very confortable.The breakfast was not very big, but for us was more than enough. There was not a day that we didm't find something to eat.The location was so good, 10 minutes walking to the subway, and to tell you the true we did everything walking, and we enjoy it so much. And to end this the staff is Amazing!!!!! They are so kind, and always willing to help with smile.Thanks very much is special to Omar, Nafeesa and Devora. Definitely if we go back to NYC, we will go back to Homewood Suites.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: If your party has more than 3 people, this isn't the place to stay as the suite is too small for everyone to have a place to sleep. The idea behind Homewood Suites is more space, and this hotel fails miserably. Aside from that, the hotel is new and the (tiny) suite was extremely nice. The midtown location is good, close to Times Square attractions but far enough away to avoid the huge crowds. The front desk staff was very professional and helpful too. I'd stay here again if I didn't have my family with me.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed on 21st floor, very quiet. Easy access to Penn Station and Times Square. Very good supermarket close by. Breakfast area is small for hotel size and mobbed with vacationers, so we used the room cutlery, plates etc. There is a dishwasher to help with clean up!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel has honestly been one of the best Ive been to, considering the complimentary breakfast and complimentary dinner that is served. All the staff greet you with a smile and that really brightens up the day. If I return to NY I will definitely be staying here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This was my 3rd trip to NYC and I must say, this hotel was everything. It has only been open about 4 weeks. When my group arrived we wre greeted at the door with our room keys. The stay was wonderful, I must give a shout out to Omar G, he set up a private car for my very early morning flight. he was so helpful and always wore a smile. They served a hot breakfast and dinner. My only suggestion is the breakfast food could have been a little warmer. Great fr a family of 4, has a stove & full size fridge. The hotel was spotless. I am so glad I stayed here & this hotel wll always be my first choice when staying in NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is outstanding...my family and I enjoyed our stay, and will stay here again on any future trips. The staff was professional and the rooms were nice and quite, we barely heard any of noise from street level, which rates high on my lisy alone.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was intown on bussiness and stayed 12 days. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Jennifer U. Thomas and Omar never hesitated to assist as they could. Leslie truly went over and beyond telling me what areas I should go see as well as arranged for transportation. She truly took the time to get to know me and made my stay as fun an comfortable as possible. My only dislike was the setup of the dining area. It would become crowded and because there was no real line.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My daughters and I enjoyed our stay at Homewood Suites - Times Square. Perfect location, perfect patio, perfect employees, and perfect room. The breakfast options were delicious, as well as the manager's reception during the weeknights. We were within walking distance of Macy's and Times Square, as well as the Port Authority. We will definitely reserve this hotel again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: With this being a brand new property, it is a very clean hotel. The breakfast line went much faster than previous reviews I read, so we really had no issues here. The elevator fiasco I have read about was not nearly as bad as I had heard of. However, the housekeeping department needs a revamp...pronto. I did get my bed made each day, but rarely got coffee, shampoo, ice bags, etc. I have a feeling they were in and out of the room within 30 mins based on some of my departure and arrival times. I had to make a call each day to get product delivered to my room. Some days I even left an obvious note asking for specific supplies, but those were ignored as well.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Central location, wonderful staff, excellent value,; the perfect base for exploring new york city; easy access to local transportation, mid-town, times square and the theatre district; New; clean and very quiet with a bountiful complementary breakfast

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I'll share the good and the bad, but will say that the bad outweighs the good by so much, that we will no longer be loyal to the Hilton brand (and we have been HHonors & loyal members for YEARS). We had a lot of bad experiences here, but I will not list all of them, since I could pretty much write a book on it.Location: location is great! Not far from most of the main midtown attractions and subway. If you are on any kind of meal budget and looking for something cheap, there are several pizza places within 3 blocks that offer a special of 2 slices of pizza & a can soda for just $2.25. Pizza was good and it's a terrific deal!Check-in: this is what started everything off really badly!! We booked a city view room, months and months ago and that is what we expected to get when we arrived. We were informed that the city view room was not available & also advised by the clerk that their lovely corporate office allows overbooking on their website for this room and they could not help it (his words, not mine). We ended up getting a regular room, but were still charged for a city view room. Last time I checked, city view rooms were more, which means we should have been charged less, but we weren't. We just loved paying that price for a 6th floor room with a fabulous view of the old building in front of us that looked like it would fall down if you blew on it! Completely ticked off already. I will say that the 2 clerks checking us in were very friendly, but it didn't help my mood any after this.Room: the room was very clean and modern. However, if you need to use the pullout bed in the sofa, you have to wait before bedtime, because there is NO ROOM to walk once this is pulled out. Even my teen daughter couldn't walk through there and she is small!! The bathroom was also very clean and modern, but we had absolutely no sink or counter room to place any of our things. We had to keep everything in our bags, which was a pain in the whazoo! You have a full-size fridge, microwave and a small sink in the kitchen area, which is nice to have. The regular bed was very comfortable.Breakfast: one word----CRAZY!!! They had a good selection, but I sure do wish hotels would have healthier options for breakfast. Not everyone eats pork bacon/sausage, so turkey bacon/sausage would be a nice option. The crazy part was trying to find a place to sit. For a hotel this size, the sitting area for breakfast is tiny and a complete madhouse in the mornings. There is no line for breakfast, so everyone is just stepping in wherever they can to grab the food. Terrible way to start the day.Checkout: this was more painful than checking in. On their website, it states $40 a day to park in the deck across the street. First, it is only $40 a day if you have a car. If you have an SUV or truck, it's $45 a day. That adds up when you are there several days. Nowhere on their website does it say anything about $45 for SUV's and trucks!! I am livid over that and they should have all prices posted!! We wanted to pack our SUV, check out of the hotel, but leave our SUV in the deck so we could go to the 9/11 Museum. After that, we were leaving NYC. I asked the hotel clerk if we can do this and she advised yes and that we have 1 in/out privilege, so that should be no problem. (We did not use this yet, nor did we know we had 1 in/out privilege until now.) Hubby went to get our SUV so we could pull it up to the front of the hotel to load, but then take right back into the deck and park for a few more hours. The attendant in the deck said he could do this, but he needed my husband to pay him $90 cash to take it out of the deck to make sure we were taking it back and then he would give us the cash back when we return to leave and then pay with the credit card. WTH???? My husband said he was not handing over $90 cash, with no proof he did so and no guarantee we would get it back. My husband also offered to pay the full amount with our credit card right then, but the attendant would not allow him to pay. Something is completely off about that! So, after 45 minutes of this hassle and me asking the hotel clerks why their website says $40 a day to park, but we are being charged $45 a day, the attendant said the only thing we could do is bring all of our stuff over to the deck and load it, then he would park the vehicle back in a parking space. Oh, did I mention it was pouring down rain????!!!!!!! So, I'm trying to push the luggage cart outside, hubby comes running over to help me, then a hotel bellhop comes over and takes the cart from my husband and rams it down off the curb onto the street and guess what?? A ton of bags and our pillows fell off the cart into a huge water puddle on the street. Well, at this point, I just lost it and cried for the next 30 minutes. The hotel clerks inside did not care one bit about any of this. We've stayed in NYC many times, but have never encountered a hotel experience like this one. The other hotels we've stayed in always added the parking to our room--we've never had to pay this separately, so that was a complete nightmare for us.So, due to all the stress we encountered at this Homewood, we will no longer be loyal to the Hilton brand. My hubby's company also has a corporate contract with the Hilton hotels, but we are filing a formal complaint with them, so hopefully, they will get new contracts with other brands to give us different options. Just not worth starting out a road trip with this kind of stress.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We arrived to a freshly opened hotel. With a lovely spacious room and keen excited staff doing all they could to ensure our comfort and make us feel welcome. The dinner provided was a definite bonus. The food was simple but heary and mostly uniiversally appealing.. Very "home wood". It was nice to eat "at home" before venturing out again sometimes. The business centre was useful for us and we organised show tickets and confirmed onwards flights, bus tickets to Woodbury common and printed all we needed with no problems. 4 girls and luggage in a room for a week and we didn't feel crowded or trip over each other although we did use an outlet near the microwave for 1 hair appliance and the microwave as an extra mirror!! FOUR girls remember! Great room great people, thank you , we loved it!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Fresh, new and modern hotel with friendly staff. Our room had windows that stretched from floor to roof. Nice location two streets away from Penn station. From Penn station we took the subway all over the town for shopping, culture and restaurants. Breakfast included (served on disposable plates) but overall ok. There was always a hot breakfast alternative. Dinner was included (mon-thu) but we only tried it twice. Not the best of meals, but cannot complain since it is included. If you appreciate a fine dinner, then eat out instead.Cleaning was overall good. We did however need to ask for more shampoo (etc.) and one night found a cleaning cloth between our sheets. The cleaning is the main issue that we feel need a bit of improvement.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel just opened in June 2014 and was great. We arrived at 10:30 am and were greeted by Nafeesa who was able to get us into our room early. When we thought one miracle was enough, we peeked into the breakfast area which closed at 10:30, five minutes earlier.
