Victor and his co-workers made us feel welcome right away by letting us grab some breakfast to take to our room, and even offered to go back to the kitchen to get us more variety!! Only a few blocks from Madison Sq Garden and Penn Station, everything was an easy walk, as was Times Square, Empire State Bldg, and subway. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby also. The rooms were clean and comfortable. While, like all NYC hotels, they were a little small, the designers used every inch of space wisely. Having a kitchenette was a plus, with a larger refrigerator for our use. Elevators were a little small and got busy at peak times, and the breakfast area was a bit crowded too, but it was all worth it. We would almost certainly stay again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is only 3 blocks from Penn station and a few blocks to Times Square. Friendly staff and nice accommodations make this ideal for families with little ones. Breakfast was something to be desired (runny eggs and corn beef hash every utter day) and didn't stack up to other Homewood Suites we've stated at but we still return.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New, clean, excellent location. Good breakfasts each day and evening meals (4 per week). Staff friendly and helpful. Noise from adjoining rooms can be a nuisance. Excellent Internet and fitness facilities - no swimming pool.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed 3 nights recently at this wonderful hotel. Service was fantastic. Desk clerk Daniel went above and beyond making sure we had a wonderful experience. He even stopped traffic on street so we could move our car! Free breakfast and happy hour was a nice perk. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: For the price is a very good hotel.The breakfast is included in the price and have a promotional dinner from Monday to Tuesday in August For the price is a very good hotel.The breakfast is included in the price and have a promotional dinner from Monday to Tuesday in August

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New hotel in heart of Times Square, from check-in to check-out the staff were outstanding.Complementary breakfast and dinner (Monday - Thursday) are outstanding and though can be crowded it is a minor inconvenience. The elevators can be crowded at times but hey it is Manhattan.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: New hotel between 8th & 9th Ave on 37th Street. Convenient to Penn Station but a little off the beaten track. Stayed in room 1915 - a King Studio - with a convertible couch at the foot of the bed. Traveling with my adult daughter so we used both the bed and the convertible. When the couch is open, there is almost no floor space in the room. If you are sharing the bed this room is fine. If you need a second bed, you should get one of the rooms/suites with 2 beds. There is only a shower in the bathroom, and by most standards would be considered small. The breakfast is nice, but the layout of the buffet area creates traffic jams. Breakfast selection is very nice. A full house taxes the capacity of the seating area, and one morning we were told we could not sit in the back half of the breakfast room because it was reserved for a group (despite it remaining empty the entire time we were there). Staff was very pleasant, and hotel was clean and well appointed. Still, when we considered proximity to the Theater District, less desirable neighborhood, small room, and long elevator waits, for the price we will choose a different hotel the next time we come in for a theater weekend.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed as part of a group for a week at this property. Overall the service was good with only a few minor issues. We arrive at 5 PM on a Saturday and were told our room was not ready yet. Another member of our group arrived at the same time and were told the same thing. We went to grab some food and an hour later our rooms were ready. The first thing we noticed was that for the size (and height..20+ floors) there are only 3 elevators and each could only hold 3 people with a wheeled suitcase. We were on the 4th floor, and by day 2 used the stairs exculsively. Every time we tried to catch an elevator they took forever and half the time were full when they did stop on our floor.The rooms look nice, but for an extended stay type room are not very well appointed. For a room that should sleep up to 5 there were 9 hangers and 3 drawers for clothing. Thats it, no more. My other complaint is that the room has 2 beds and a cold out bed, but all are in the same room. There is no privacy. Most extended stay hotels have a bed room and a separate living area with a fold out so there is some level of privacy. My wife also did not like that the bathroom door was a slide type door not an actual closing door. Same issue with no privacy.My next dissapointment was with breakfast. The food was OK, what you would expect for a hotel breakfast, but the seating is horribly lacking and the actual layout of the service area is not well thought out. The area is cramped with the hot food in the middle and the bread, juice, fruit etc on a separate bar wrapping around the center island. This layout doee not work well when half the people staying there are trying to get eggs and toast in the morning. Finding a seat after you get your breakfast is a crap shoot. The last morning we were there the whole seating issue was even worse as the staff had half the seating area blocked off for a "group". Honestly this area needs to be twice the size to accomodate the traffic. Maid service was good for the most part, my only complaint there is they did not refill our coffee half the time. But the room was cleaned, beds made and towles replaced. What dealings we did have with the staff they were plesent and helpful. Some of the people staying with our group has issues of some sort, but we were happy with the staff and really felt they were the only saving grace.The hotel is nice, the location is good, the people are the best part. The hotel itself needs work and was poorly thought out. If it were just my wife and I, then I might consider staying here again because we won't usually eat at the hotel and the storage would have been OK for 2 people, but as part of a group or with the kids, not a chance.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I booked my stay with Hilton points and hoped that the meal availability here - they include both breakfast and dinner - would not let my NYC trip break the bank. The rooms are fresh and new - the only niggle was a leaky shower door that resulted in a sizeable bathroom puddle.->Dinner: you're better off microwaving a TV dinner in your room than partake of the buffet, which in our case ran out of the main course, meatloaf, 65 minutes into the service. It was substituted by a tuna-casseroley thingy.->Breakfast: only slightly more decent than dinner, but such an overwhelming madhouse in the buffet area that your blood pressure will shoot through the roof as you try to snake your way through 20 people to get to the toaster->Seating/atmosphere: unless you're a fan of screaming children and people dumping bagels into their backpacks, you won't appreciate this feeding trough->Coffee: watery and burnt-tasting - congratulations on achieving that winning combo!->Elevators: too few and with a mind of their own->Gym: the website listed free weights, but there are none. If you're not into aerobics, there is one multi-use cable machine. On the plus side, it wasn't crowded.Overall I was extremely disappointed that Hilton would put their name on a hotel like this. I think that with a few design changes to the food area and the food itself, however, the place could become a winner I had expected it to be. You might consider staying 3 blocks away at the Staybridge - rooms are slightly less new but the food and dining area is a bit better.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We travel to Manhattan frequently and we have stayed at many properties. We saw this new one and decided to give it a try. The desk staff and doorman here were terrific and very helpful. We checked in and were pleased with our room. For the next few days of our stay, however, the housekeeping was woefully inadequate. There was no evidence of vacuuming during our three night stay, toiletries were not replenished unless we got them for ourselves. For the pull out single bed we were expected to make up and/or change the sheets ourselves each day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed here for July 4th holiday1st time at a HomewoodGreat location - short walk to subwayNicely appointed roomsVery nice breakfast and evening receptionsTerrific and helpful staff around from front desk, dining room to housekeepingWill definitely look to stay here again on my next visit!Keep up the great work guys/gals - Thanks!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed for 8 days shortly after opening. Everything brand new and modern, great facilities. On a higher floor with a city view, remarkably quiet for NYC. Noticed the rates jump up in the fall. Close to everything. Breakfast fantastic. Dinners convenient, but not great. However NY expensive, helps the budget, but don't rush back if you're out having fun, not missing much for dinner.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My friends and I stayed at the Homewood Suites the first week it opened. (July 2-6, 2014). Our stay was wonderful! The hotel is centrally located and we were able to access many of the cities sites on foot. The staff was wonderful and accomodating. The rooms were clean (I think we were the first ones to stay in them) The complimentary breakfast was perfect, nothing fancy, but a great start to the day. Take advantage of the rooftop patio, it was a great place to relax and regroup.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This hotel is wonderful, especially the staff. Front Desk staff Nafeesa is a true blessing! She knew I was not feeling well during the check in process and went out of her way to get me into a wonderful room very quickly, even escorting me to the elevator. I cannot thank her enough for her caring manner. The rooms are clean and modern. Lovely experience thus far. The only negative is the surrounding neighborhood - not the best area. BUt I feel safe to walk around during the day.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton in Midtown Manhattan for seven days. Our suite was amazing. We were on the 21st floor. Our suite had a bay window from ceiling to floor. With an incredible view. The staff was professional and very attentive to our needs. They were extremely friendly and amiable. I want to take this time to thank the following personnel for making our stay extra memorable. Daniel, Allan, Leslie, Aaron, Devon, Josefina, Jose, Hector, Michael, and Michael. It was pleasure meeting all of you. We most definitely will return to your hotel because of your efforts to make our stay as comfortable and memorable as possible.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We have had a great 10 day stay. Booked via expedia. Reasonably priced. Clean modern room with good facilities. Breakfast and some evening meals - consistently fine as complimentary.Great friendly service, Absolutely no complaints

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We tried the Homewood Suites at 37th St. while we were celebrating our 29th anniversary over the weekend. The management and staff were welcoming and even gave us a bottle of wine and chocolates for our celebration. The room and bath were very clean, king size bed very comfortable, and the kitchenette was complete with plates, utensils and appliances. Very convenient for those that have a long stay. There is a 7-Eleven just off the corner for stocking up with food/supplies, or the hotel can do the shopping for you if you choose. The location was very convenient to the sites and the subway. It is a reasonable walk to Grand Central Terminal too. The breakfast in the morning was very good, and there was plenty of seating area to accommodate groups of all sizes. The lobby area was very nice with the gas fireplace, and there is an outdoor patio on the top floor where you can relax as well. I was pleasantly surprised at how well maintained the rooms and facilities are. I will definitely look to stay there again when we are back in the city, and I recommend it highly to business travelers that are on an extended stay. The hospitality was fantastic!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Just spent 5 nights. The staff is great, but they are overwhelmed in the kitchen by the number of people. The rooms are nicely decorated but don't work well for more than two persons. There are very few double queen rooms. Some rooms have a pullout, but space is the biggest problem. There is no noticeable street noise on either the 5th or the 20th floors. The air conditions are loud. Street is not pretty but was safe and lots of small places to grab food on 8th street. Best deal in town on 8th and 38, $2.75 for a soda and two slices of cheese pizza. I would stay here again. Don't forget to check out the view from the roof.
user_name:
Alec B
Houston, Texas, United States

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I am a Hilton Honors member and thus stay at many Hilton properties. Yes, this property is fairly new( about two months), and it has room for improvement-like everything else. However, this property exceeded my expectations. The service, the location, the amenities it was all to the point. Yes, the breakfast area could be a bit bigger, the elevator could be faster, but which property is perfect- NONE. My mother has limited mobility and this location allowed my mother freedom. The bathroom accessibility was great and having a kitchen in the room, was beyond awesome.This property gets two thumbs up from our family.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We are a family of 4, are kids are young adults, we are always looking for hotel rooms with 2 full/queen beds and a sleeper sofa. This hotel met our requirements. We were surprised by how 'cool' the room was and the space. The staff was friendly and I would recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Spacious clean rooms for NYC, conveniently located, complimentary breakfast, the hotel elevators do get a little crowded so you may have to wait 10 minutes for one. Large fitness center. Helpful staff

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: First of all I am a diamond HHonors member so I stay at a lot of hilton properties of all kind. This homewood Suites may have blown the curve for my expectations for that brand. Yes it is a smallish, busy lobby. I read some of the reviews about the small elevators. We didn't have a problem but I did notice there was continued construction going on in the property's lower floors so the elevators may be in use by contractors. That should take care of itself eventually when all construction gets done. Our room was small but highly efficient and had everything you could need. I think we may have been the first people to stay in that room.The staff (especially Daniel) were all helpful and engaged with you despite a lot going on.The location is convenient to Times Square and Penn Station but tucked far enough between 8th and 9th to be very quiet. I give it five stars relative to my expectations of Homewood Suites. It isn't the Waldorf or Plaza. It is a new, clean, convenient and reasonably priced hotel near Times Square.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Wow, I don't know what sort of people staying at this hotel decided to rate it as "Terrible" or "Poor" but I can tell you that 99% of the things that they've complained about were certainly not encountered by myself or my friends. We stayed at this hotel for 14 nights in July, FANTASTIC experience! The only staff member who seemed a bit cold was the lady who checked us in; other than her, the bell men, wait staff at the dining area and the girl who checked us out at the end were all extremely helpful and friendly. Each night we walked back into the hotel, we were greeted with a "Welcome home!" which was really nice to hear. Housekeeping was done every day and we had new towels, bins cleaned, new supply of soaps etc. Fridge was full size and definitely not noisy as one reviewer claimed. No noise heard from the outside during the weekends either. Was great to be able to go upstairs to the rooftop and lounge about, or have breakfast up there as well as in the courtyard. Breakfast served daily and there was some decent food too (eggs, bacon, sausages, bagels, toast, pastries, cornflakes, fruit, yoghurt, decaf/ regular/ strong coffees, teas, juices).. Dinner Monday to Thursday with a different me u each night PLUS wines and beer. I mean, what more do you want?! I loved it! And for the price we paid ($200 a night), to get free breakfast and dinner at a brand new hotel is pretty good! Complainers: next time, go to a 2.5 star joint for the same price. This is New York City you are talking about.Drawbacks:- Perhaps the room could've been just a touch larger so there's more space between the kitchenette and bed, and the elevators could've been a bit bigger. Other than that, I found the hotel to be excellent. Location great too. Only a few blocks south of Times Square, three blocks north of Madison Sq Garden, Penn Station and Macy's. I'd most definitely recommend it to others and I'd absolutely stay there again!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed for 7 nights from July 11-18 and spent a small fortune for it to celebrate a special birthday.Pros: centrally located, hot breakfast, convenient for families. Cons: Elevator was a nightmare!!! Stayed in plenty of good hotels but never had such a slow elevator service. We quickly realized we need to give extra time to get up or down, took the stairs down from the 14th floor several times. Also the dining area was tiny, and there was almost a stampede to get your breakfast or dinner. Allow plenty of time for that and go early cos once they run out they are not really keen to replenish items and we were frequently told that we were out of luck! This was very disappointing because you should be able to get what you want if you are within the time frame that it's being offered as it's a part of what you've paid for. Dinner was burgers n hotdogs so we ate out after the first day. Finally, my husband had informed them that we were there to celebrate a Special birthday but that fact was totally ignored during our stay. Did not expect a whole lot but got not even an acknowledgement.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We arrived in NYC this past Wednesday and stayed until today, Saturday. The hotel is absolutely beautful and the staff is wonderful!! I have to agree with another reviewer that the rooms are a bit small, but I've learned that's what to expect in NYC. We enjoyed the free breakfast every morning and the evening dinner the first night only. There was always plenty of options (hot food, fresh fruit, etc.) so everyone went away satisfied. The fitness room was awesome and I was THRILLED to see the wipes in the room to wipe down the machine when I was done! We're sad to have to leave, but we're on to Philly!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I was traveling on business and brought my two teenagers. The hotel was spotless and the staff very attentive. The room was small but do-able. Heard NO noise from other rooms or street even though our room was next to the elevator. The sleeper sofa was a twin but that was how it was advertised when I booked it. The price was a little more expensive than the other hotels I looked at but it included a hot breakfast and internet which others did not. So... this was a better value. When we checked in, we were told that dinner was from 5 - 7. Yes, they even included a basic dinner with the room. One night it was tortellini, breadsticks and tossed salad. Oh yeah, and beer on tap for adults. Saved us a fortune as we ate at the hotel and then would just have appetizers out later. The kids loved the hotel which even had a smart TV in the room. Room had fridge, stove, microwave and dishwasher which we didn't use much as I didn't feel like cooking. Easy walk from Port Authority where we arrived by bus.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at the newly opened hotel from July 1st to 10th. We left quickly and I realized on the plane I had left two items of clothing in the closet. I am 100% certain that I left them and am sorry I didn't check each space before leaving. We called the hotel right away and many times since and they were not able to help us retrieve the two pieces of clothing. Everything else about the hotel experience was positive but the loss left a bad taste. The clothing had sentimental value.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband travels a lot and is a diamond member with Hilton. We booked this hotel for a family vacation with 2 kids (9 and 7). When we booked, the hotel wasn't open yet. We booked a room with a king size bed and FULL sofa sleeper. However, we were given a king bed and TWIN sofa sleeper. This made for a VERY uncomfortable sleeping arrangement. The desk told us that the room descriptions probably changed from the time we booked it and they didn't have any rooms that would be larger for us. I will say that Venitta was helpful in trying to find a solution, but it was a little disappointing and we would've chosen another hotel if we would've known this ahead of time. Otherwise, the rooms are clean, the staff friendly, and the location is good.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My wife and I were just was treated like a VIP at a new Hilton property on 37th street in NYC. The hotel just opened at the beginning of July and they already have their act together. The employees are friendly, the breakfast is hot and appetizing and the top floor outdoor patio at night is great. Our room had a full kitchen, which unfortunately we really didn't use, except for the refrigerator; but some really great features; a ceiling fan, wood floors, lots of channels on the TV, a small sofa to relax on, and some interesting artwork, especially, the wall behind the headboard. This is a find
user_name:
Mark L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We were a group of 4 women and spent 5 nights at this beautiful new hotel located only a few blocks from Times Square. The staff, rooms, food, and hotel were all excellent and would highly recommend. We even enjoyed their lovely rooftop patio. Our only small complaint was the wait time for elevators so used the stairs often, which did us good. Can't wait to return some day!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My twin eighteen year old daughters and I spent a week here earlier this month and loved it. It's a brand new property and overall, we found it excellent. The other hotels we stayed in during our time away from home fell far short of the Homewood Suites in Manhattan.The compact room was very comfortable for us, the full kitchen was a plus, and we enjoyed the daily breakfast plus the dinner Monday through Thursday evenings. Elevators were crowded but the hotel was very full and it is NYC.Overall staff was helpful and tended to our needs.The guest laundry facility is a great plus as is the business center and fitness center. I liked the lobby level courtyard but it was a bit noisy. The roof, however, more than made up for it with fantastic views in all directions.I enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: There was a stove in my room!!! I'd never use it, but it was indicative of the efficient design of the room, which managed to have a fully stocked kitchen (and a table tucked under the desk to eat on). It was New York small, but everything I could think to want was available. One of the elevators was down the first night, but it was fixed the next morning. Housekeeping never made it to our room until we were taking a break around 5pm between our matinee show and our dinner, but we if we'd had an urgent need we would have called. Those are minor quibbles. The room was comfortable and really well designed, the breakfast was filling and delicious (and yes crowded but I've worked out a strategy for all hotels that offer breakfast involving getting breakfast for myself and my husband, on a tray and then getting out of there), we found a great dive bar next door, and a wonderful bodega over on 8th Avenue. I lived in New York for 16 years and I consider it my second home, and I think this location is great because it is away from the crowds but close to everything convenient. My husband and I are avid Hilton Honors members (though we never achieve anything above Silver) and so since we visit New York several times a year, we are very familiar with New York hotels in the Hilton family, and we are definitely adding this to the hotels we check first.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I agree with the other reviewers that the rooms are small and the elevators are bad. The biggest elevator issue I saw was that the staff does not have their own elevator and guests with luggage competing with staff with carts and cleaning baskets was not fun to watch. The free weights in the gym were on backorder. The breakfast and dinner service were hit and miss. The best part of the hotel and the reason I will be back is the kitchenette in each room and the availability of coin laundry machines in the hotel. For long term guests these are important. The staff was also hit and miss, but Guest Services Manager Jatin was definitely a hit and they need more like him.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The hotel was in a good, central location. Close, easy walk to time square, subway terminal entrances, Hell's Kitchen, and other shopping stores. The rooms were clean and services were nice. What was not so nice, was the elevators, too slow and too small. The refrigerator was also noisy and it was difficult to maintain temperature. Rooms were good size for two or three people but too small for four. Price was reasonable. We would consider staying here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Arrived 6 hours later than expected due to a storm in the city. The bellman greeted us immediately and the young man at the front desk was extremely accommodating. He offered us much needed water and checked us in quickly. This was a terrific start to the stay; we thought. We still have two more nights here as part of our 7 night vacation. I asked the bellman about city tours and he immediately pulled a brochure out if his jacket pocket. I told him tripadvisor gave it bad reviews and he looked irritated. I asked about a different tour and he stopped answering my questions. It felt like he had a hidden agenda. We booked two suites; one for my husband and I and one for our daughters and their friend. This hotel had some pros and some cons, but the overall experience did not feel like a Hilton! My husband travels here on business, but will choose a different place to stay. Pros: 1. Breakfast is included (not great choices, but nice to be able to grab and go)2. Dinner is included, although it is a limited selection, still nice to have available (Monday-Thursday)3. Good location (close to everything)4. Housekeeping (a lot of reviews harshly critiqued them, but we had great service)5. Coffee 24 hours6. Rooftop seating & view7. Kitchen appliances8. New & clean facility9. Modern amenities10. Wi-fi11. The man at the breakfast was helpful and pleasant 12. Front desk staff (specifically the daytime staff) was helpful 13. Lots of charging stations for phones, laptops, etc., in the lobby14. Comfortable and plentiful seating in lobbyCons: 1. Slow elevators (small & crowded) long wait times 2. Safe didn't work (fixed on second day)3. Air conditioning broken (too cold or too hot)4. Refrigerator was REALLY loud (had to sleep with headphones each night)5. Doors slammed all Friday & Saturday nights (did not sleep either night)6. The "quiet" sign is designed poorly and falls to the ground every time you open the door 7. Only one bathroom on the main floor, which by the way was filthy (I waited to use it and the bellman from the first night came out, when I entered, I realized he peed ALL over the seat and floor. (He should have been embarrassed!)8. Showers are small and if you turn around too quickly you can hit elbow on handicap bar 9. Our kids' room view was good, but our room looked directly into offices10. Grave shift staff were less than helpful (We took our kids to "Escape the Room" and arrived back about 1am on Monday morning. I walked my daughter and her friend to the hotel and watched them walk through the first door and turned around to go help my husband carry food from a vendor 1/2 block down. The girls intended to sit in the lobby if our hotel and wait. A few minutes later they came rushing into the restaurant and said the man turned them away, so they ran to where we were. Not realizing they needed a key to get through the second door, I was livid to learn, the hotel sent two girls,13 years old, back into the streets of NYC at 1am. When we entered the hotel, the same man who sent them away, held up a room key in a smug way and said you need a room key to enter. His rude demeanor enraged me and his flip attitude, blemished my entire experience at this hotel. My husband and I got the girls to their room and I returned and asked Charlie and John at the front desk for the man's name who sent these kids into the night. They claimed they did not know because he worked for an outside fire safety company. I would say they lied because the three me were involved in a friendly conversation before we entered the building. When I asked the man directly for his name, he cowardly covered it up and said he didn't have to give his name. Why would he hide his name if he had not done something wrong? I worked as a GM for a hotel, so I get people not letting non-guests into the facility after a certain time for safety, but no effort was made nor were the girls told they could wait inside the first doorway. Our kids are fairly naive and very innocent, they never would have questioned authority, so they left, SCARED! Perhaps, customer service training and common sense training are in order. Had your staff simply bothered to ask a simple question, these young girls would not have been sent into the streets! Even more appalling is the fact that your staff tried to justify their response by saying many times young kids try to come into the hotel and do bad things; how would they know, you've only been open a few weeks.)Until the incident with our kids, I was willing to overlook all the cons we had experienced because this is a new hotel.Now . . . I am just a disappointed, ex-Hilton patron! When you travel as much as we do, you expect minor bumps along the way, but this is the first time we felt like our children's safety has ever been jeopardized on a trip. As much money as we spent on our rooms, we expected more!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Terrible check in and check out service! The room I reserved was not available. The rate charged was incorrect. The towel rack fell off the wall. The elevators were slow and crowded. the neighborhood was noisy and dirty. This hotel has some work to do.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Location is very easy walk to Times Square, staff is helpful! we loved Alen. beds are comfortable. Areas to fix are the dreadful elevators and caliber of breakfast. Breakfast is boring. The rooms are really small,and do not reflect my idea of a suite. Really tight quarters especially with a teenager. I am sorry to say that I would not choose this sight again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We live close enough to NYC that we occasionally visit for a weekend. We stayed in this hotel for a weekend recently (Friday and Saturday night). The location is really great, within walking distance of loads of things which was perfect for us. Our bedroom was very nicely furnished and very clean. Spacious too for a New York hotel. The staff were mostly very friendly and helpful. The main reason I wouldn't stay here again is because it felt overcrowded. Only two of the three elevators were working for most of our stay, so we had to wait a long time for one to show up. It probably doesn't help that there are displays telling you that an elevator on the way down is passing your floor by. Even when the third elevator started working again, there were still long waits for them at peak times. By far the worst experience was the breakfast buffet. The layout of this space is horrible. It would work well if there were 5-6 people trying to get breakfast, but with tens of people thronging around a tiny space to get food it was unbearable. People shoving and pushing, no order to how to navigate the tiny space, people spilling food/drinks because people were pushing into them. It is a disaster. And the staff do their best to keep up, but it's impossible. Another terrible design decision was to have the door of the pantry open out directly into the space where people are trying to queue for cereal. Whoever designed this space did not think ahead to when people would actually be using it. There were plenty of table to sit and eat breakfast once you got through the crowds. Personally I would have preferred to see some of that space used for the buffet.So if you don't plan to be in this hotel during peak times, or don't plan to have the breakfast and don't mind taking the stairs/waiting for elevators, then this hotel is probably great for you.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great location, just off Times Square and with easy access to subway & all major attractions in NYC. IKEA-like rooms, very compact but liveable. Hotel at full occupancy so sometimes food items at breakfast & dinner quickly run out if you arrive late. Staff friendly, but need to be a bit more trained. When I asked about best events to see, they turned to google & printed out vague/general ideas. If traveling with a family or group, not a bad choice.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Good: The location is great, as central as you can get for that price. Fresh and clean. Polite staff. Best hotel wifi I've encountered. Bad: Elevators from hell, there are three of them and theyre fast and all, but they are horribly programmed. Not unusual to wait for it to arrive for five minutes. The air conditioning has two settings; "freeze to death" and "drown in sweat". You have to manually keep it between those extremes which takes a lot of work. Breakfast crowded and decent at best. The room's refridgerator is big and nice, but awfully noisy. Hard to sleep.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Great hotel! It was very clean and quiet! Omar (downstairs/bellman) was your shining star. He took great care of us! The elevators were the only frustration, otherwise I will make this my first choice when returning to NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: This is the worst Hilton property I have ever stayed at!! The staff and management was horrible! This hotel is new and modern! The walls are paper thin! There were two temps to the shower boiling or cold.. Chose cold!! Sucked!!! Diamond Hilton member!!!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Stayed there july 3-7 and had an outstanding experience. Hotel is brand new and lobby and rooms are fantastic. Stayed in 1011 which had decent city views. Room is very spacious and the kitchenette was so handy. Service was impeccable from the time we got out of the cab to check out. Bellmen and front desk were professional, helpful and not tip hungry. Place has an amazing dinner and alcoholic drinks during the week, and great hot breakfast everyday. There is a rooftop deck which we didn't find out about until 2 nights in(guess it's sort of a secret). Hotel is very close to subway(3blocks) and there is plenty to do closeby. Overall a great experience.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed for two nights at this hotel on a quick trip to Manhattan. Being a newly-opened facility, it was very clean, sleek and up-to-date. The location is convenient, if not picturesque, but that's okay. With the windows closed, the rooms are SILENT. The staff was quite friendly and helpful - those that I met, that is. I was always greeted and sent off with a smile, and they seemed to be working very hard.The only glitch was that at the end of my first full day I returned to my room around 4 pm....and no housekeeping had been done. I checked to make sure I hadn't accidentally put out the "leave me alone" card - nope. When I was ready to go out again for the evening, I stopped by the desk and mentioned this, wondering if they just didn't do housekeeping for guests staying two nights?? My concern was immediately addressed and someone was sent up to take care of it. Judging from the other reviews so far, thoroughness of houskeeping is definitely a kink that needs to be worked out. But when they do, this will be a great choice, especially for families with a lot of mouths to feed if you stay during the days they have evening hospitality.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Excellent staff and neat rooms with large fridge and dishes. Location was great and being new the hotel was in pristine condition. The lobby was spacious and well decorated with water streaming down a wall and modern furniture. It was light and airy and the free breakfast and dinner was a added treat buffet style. We enjoyed the room immensely and will keep booking this hotel in the future when we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Our room (#1716), though not huge but was big enough to sleep all of us comfortably. The room was ready and clean for us when we checked in at noon.Pros:- 1) Centrally located2) Modern and contemporary interiors3) Clean4) Comfortable sized rooms compared to NYC standards5) kitchenette6) good customer service7) complimentary cocktails on weekdays 5-7 Cons:-1) Basic room services tasks were not performed upto Hilton brand satisfaction- for e.g. cleaning trash, vacuuming the room, unmade beds and replenishing coffee cups2) Average breakfast and complimentary weekday dinner- not very vegetarian friendly and the kitchen staff did not accommodate when we requested a vegetarian option not on the menu.3) Morning and evening dinner kitchen staff seemed overwhelmed with so many people during the rush hours.4) We requested if we could leave our luggage overnight after we had checked out of the room and were willing to take the liability and sign the waiver form, but the hotel was unwilling to accommodate such a request. Overall, the stay has been comfortable and any of our issues that arised, Jatin Kumar and other front desk staff smoothed them out. I will definitely recommend this hotel, but be forewarned that they are fairly new and still working out all the kinks with their staff.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Hi. We recently completed a WONDERFUL stay at the Homewood Suites, 312 W 37th St in New York. We cannot brag enough about this hotel!! The hotel was spotless and clean and the staff was AMAZING!!! From the time we first registered until we left, we were treated like royalty! The staff was SUPER-- We were given excellent directions to the famous landmarks in NY, subway advice and information, superb service at the evening receptions and breakfasts, excellent customer service, and they even arranged for a car to take us back to the airport. Some of the staff members who went ABOVE and BEYOND was: RAJ who replaced the in-room safe that was defective, ALLAN at the front desk who greatly assisted us with directions and transportation, WILMA and ALLIZAD (sp?) also at the front desk, who were very helpful and friendly, DEVON (evening reception), AARON, and VICTOR (breakfast) who assisted us with our dining needs, JATIN (sp?) and OMAR at the front desk who answered any questions we had with patience and kindness. There were other staff members who helped us, but the above-mentioned 9 employees were PHENOMENAL!!!! We expressed our thanks to these fine workers through tips and verbal thanks and appreciation, but we would also like to let Trip Advisor know about the excellent, hard-working, pleasant, helpful, and devoted employees that are working at the Homewood Suites, 312 W 37th St, in NYC. Our family only stays at Hilton brand hotels when we travel and this was our best stay EVER at a Hilton hotel! We truly appreciate the fine customer service practices that the Hilton brand hotels are known for! Thank you,

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I booked this hotel for a 4th of July weekend trip to NYC with the Mrs. We arrived early on the 4th, and we were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. It was a new hotel and had everything you need. Yeah the rooms aren't huge, it is NEW YORK!! If you are in the room a lot, you are doing something wrong...Omar was the concierge and was wonderful. He answered any and every question we had regarding the city. I wish I would have seen him on Sunday so I could have rewarded him properly.I cannot say enough about how wonderful he was. The staff was good, yeah I am a HIlton Gold member and they didn't have my water bottles ready, but so what.I had a great rate, and would love to stay there again when I head back in December, but the rate is extremely high that date.I sincerely loved the room, new wood floors, the bathroom was great, large shower, clean etc.Even the elevators were fast!!!If you stay during the week, there is a meal, and free cocktails from 5-7. The breakfast was average, but it was FREE... I don't get people who complain about free stuff.The ONE negative was that the concierge at night told me wrong directions on how to get on the 7 train... Oh and another minor negative was it seemed the hotel front desk staff did not know how to get ANYWHERE. It was all up to Omar...I hope he never gets sick:)Overall, great stay, and I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: The Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South provided one of the most negative experience of my hotel stay. Being a HHonor diamond member there is some expectation and trust in the Hilton brand. Based on this experience and trust, I booked my much awaited family vacation at this hotel. The customer experience we received is way inferior than other hotel stays of Hilton brand - Hilton, Double Tree, Embassy Suite, HGI, other Homewood suite, etc. The basic room services task did not get done like - cleaning the trash, making the bed, removing the used totel, filling up soaps/shampoo/lotions, filling up coffee/tea/creamer/sugar. Had to call the front desk and room service several times to perform some of these basic stuff during the duration of my 5 days stay, which on top of that was not done as per basic expectation of satisfaction guarentee. This was a total waste of hotel stay time, $$ amount, and all the massive points I have used to stay at this hotel during my family vacation.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: Very nice and NEW hotel just South of the hub-bub of NYC's Times Square. Excellent location, placing you very close to the action as well as offering amenities that are useful away from home. The staff are beyond excellent; everyone smiles and wants to help make your stay enjoyable. Rooms are small but the bed is nice and big, along with Studio sized fridge, stove and microwave. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: I stayed at the new Homewood Suites during the week of July 4th and this hotel has everything - great location, great people, large comfortable suites (which is hard to come by in the Metro area). I would recommend this hotel to anyone making a trip to Manhattan, the hotel was a short walk from Times Square and many great restaurants. Thanks to all of the staff for making my stay GREAT... Hope to see you on a return visit.

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at it for one night and loved it. It was close to time square. We are used to NY and stayed in to see the Fireworks. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was great. The mini mart in the hotel was convenient when we got ice cream. We didn't have to go far. On the 22 floor there was a great view of the city. The rooms were nice and modern

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: My husband and I celebrated our 20th anniversary In NYC. We chose the Homewood Suites in Times Square because it's part of the Hilton family of hotels.We were a little concerned at first since the hotel only opened the day before we arrived. Stayed 4 days and enjoyed all the hotel had to offer. Rooms were quite spaciou by New York standards. Fast elevators and modern amenities in the rooms and throughout the hotel made our stay very pleasant. Staff from the front desk to the dining room were terrific and very helpful during our stay! This hotel will be our go-to hotel for our future visits to NYC!

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review_body: We stayed at HGI last night. We were at the Hilton fashion district over the weekend and this hotel is much much nicer.  First of all the staff was more than helpful and went out of their way to constantly ask if there was anything they could assist us with.  The rooms were very modern and felt like an updated NYC studio apartment. The free wine and beer in the lobby was a nice touch, along with snacks. They didnt have any rooms available that slept all 4 of us but they certainly tried to find one for us. We knew this going in and it's typical for NYC. The room was very spacious by NY standards and we made it work. Actually it was HUGE in comparison to the Hilton fashion district. It had a couch, kitchen and walking room.  I would definitely stay here again. It was a 5 minute walk to the heart of Times Square and lots of places nearby the hotel.
